Reviews.Title: “Terriffic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Crystal L
Reviews.Content: I visited here to stay with some friends who have it as a timeshare. The rooms were exceptionally clean, the suite was stocked with everything you could need to stay for a week vacation, except the food you like (you will need to get this yourself). Everything worked perfectly fine and there were LOTS of activities for both children and adults on the grounds. While Orlando area is chock full of activities, I imagine you would not even need to leave the resort during your whole stay except to pick up groceries. Great staff and great location. I would highly recommend this place for anyone wanting a true getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake West Village”
Reviews.Author: Brian20188
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Orange Lake West Village in January and had a wonderful time. We had a recently refurbished unit on South Magnolia Lane Our 2 bedroom 2 bath unit had everything we needed. Nice kitchen with granite countertops and each room had flat panel tv's. There was a screened in balcony with a nice view of the golf course. We went on an RCI exchange and the only draw back was the timeshare talk that we were brow beaten into going on. Stay away from this at all costs! Otherwise Orange Lake is a great resort with lots of pools restaurants and golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “First visit was much better!”
Reviews.Author: ambmeglydcam
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Orange Lake Resort. We were in the West Village on South Magnolia Ct. The area is very dark at night. The landscaping was certainly lacking in this area in comparison to the rest of the resort. We found 6 cockroaches in our room. We finally called to complain and pest control came out to take care of the problem. When we returned that evening, we found three dead cockroaches in the livingroom area. This problem should have been addressed before we occupied the room! The hairdryer in the master bathroom didn't work and smelled like burnt hair. I did notice that the floor in the bathroom had some random hairs that were dark in color (we all have blonde hair). I was worried about using the jacuzzi tub because I didn't know how well it had been cleaned. I bought bleach at Target and cleaned it myself. On a positive note, the pools were very clean and great for the kids. The rest of the grounds seemed very well landscaped. I would probably stay here again, but in a different area. Our first stay was at River Island and it was PERFECT! We had friends staying in a different area that had none of our issues. Orange Lake needs to pesticide the rooms on a regular basis and improve the lighting on S. Magnolia Ct.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Coondogg
Reviews.Content: The staff was great and friendly. Lots of activities for families as well as plenty of pools to choose from. Could use a coat of paint in some areas(common areas) Rooms were pretty nice. Overall worth the money

Reviews.Title: “If not staying at a Disney Resort, this is probably a very good option.”
Reviews.Author: ColoTravelingMan
Reviews.Content: The location of this large resort made it very convenient to drive to the Disney Parks every day (we had a rental car). For us, since we were not staying at a Disney property, the location of this Resort was a huge plus. We stayed in the North Village and it was a very quiet area. By contrast, the West Village area seemed quite busy when we were checking in. The two bedroom condo was comfortable and clean. The screened-in porch with screen door access outside was nice, though there was a pile of cigarette butts just outside the door, which should be cleaned-up in my opinion. The "backyard" of the condo we were in was part of one of the golf courses. The golf course was lighted for night play, which I thought might be annoying if you were trying to go to bed, but it really did not cause any trouble. I'm not even sure when the lights go off - we were all so tired after spending every day in the parks we didn't really care. It also made the stay unique. I mean, how often do you see a lighted golf course? The course was not busy and my youngest son and I had some space to throw the football around. We did not use any of the pools while we were there, but did have some food and drinks in a couple of the pool areas. The pool areas seemed nice and the food and drinks were tasty. Check-in was easy, though once we checked in they did hit you up for the timeshare sales, which we declined and were never bothered again. The resort was clean and well maintained. There was no maid service for the week (although I believe you can request room cleaning for a fee), but it did have a washer and drier, which allowed us to pack far less for the week. The condo kitchen was very minimally stocked (nothing at all in the pantry or fridge so they probablty clean out anything that is left by prior vacationers). Fortunately, Target and Walmart are close (Target was right across from the resort) and there is a Publix (grocery store) that is right at the entrance to the resort, so there is no problem getting what you need to stock your condo. We did not take advantage of many of the resort's amenities and used the place as a convenient and cost effective place to stay off Disney property. It was perfect for that purpose. From what I could tell, I imagine that you could have a wonderful stay here if you wanted to use it as a "destination resort" with golf, swimming pools, food, activities, etc. It certainly appeared to have everything you would need for that purpose too.

Reviews.Title: “Time to renovate”
Reviews.Author: Claudio F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this highly recommended resort for the first time - in a time share unit. The resort is very well run, the check in and check out procedures are very slick and the service levels generally very high. I have a problem with the decor and fittings in the rooms however. Everything is very 1980's. The drapes, bedding and color schemes are in serious need of an update. Even the TV - an old archaic box type TV, was last sold about 30 years ago. Time for a revamp

Reviews.Title: “we love it here”
Reviews.Author: carl c
Reviews.Content: my wife and i first came for the holiday of a ,lifetime to florida from the uk and strangely we have been back pretty much every year for the last 22 years .i can remember when orange lake were just starting out and way back then we had been advised stay away from the timeshare folks.we did but then visited some years later as rci exchange and loved it.had a family by then so still said no.but two years ago we turned up at orange lake again and it was now much much bigger.we now own here because at this time it is simpler for us to rather than buy some property but property will come in the not to distant future.we have now visited 3 times in the last 18 months first in the west village then last august in river island (which we wont do again-to busy) and then the west village again from where we have just returned(14th april 2012).the rooms have always been top class and clean.we had some issues this time but issues that we consider not serious and the staff sorted immediately.we have never suffered the bugs thing but have just encountered spiders.but spiders are everywhere no matter where you live.facilities are good .check in and express check out are spot on.pools are very clean and the minature golfing is very good even though this time i lost a bet to my son(13 years)and it has cost me some cash.we are lucky that we dont do the theme park stuff-well usually maybe one.if you dont know the short cuts to get to disney from the 192 it can take a while especially if you choose to go down to the i4 because there are roadworks at the minute and it would take ages.we have only just realised if we are going down to st petes beach that if we turn right out of the complex and go the us29 it it so much quicker to get down to the i4.not really in to the river island thing but my son is so me and the missus just enjoy a starbucks and a bit of people watching.for us this place is 100% top dollar.if you are looking for some where to stay you should give this place a go.yes they will try and get you to do the tour.just say no and be strong.we went on it because we were interested and our £ to $ was good.one thing i would say to anyone staying is.dont ever answer the phone.let them leave a message.my wife is already looking to see if she can get back out again before the year is out.our only obstacle is airfare. for any downsides that people have brought up there are far more upsides.big thumbs up to orange lake and their friendly staff and i include all their maintenance guys.

Reviews.Title: “Just added to our amazing Florida stay”
Reviews.Author: smeehan
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the reviews prior to our trip I was a little nervous upon arrival. Would our apartment be clean? Would we see many bugs? Could we smell Animal Kingdom? Would we receive the hard Timeshare sell? Well, none of those fears came to fruition. We arrived late in the night and we were not pressured at any point to attend a timeshare presentation. We were located in the East Village and the apartment on the 4th floor was larger than expected, clean and provided all the amenities required for our 2 week stay. Both children had their own bathroom and huge beds each. We had a large bedroom, bathroom and a jacuzzi bath. Whilst we did not have chance during our stay to sample any of the on site activities or make use of the pools due to a rather jam packed itinerary, this resort is perfectly placed for anyone visiting the Disney parks, a 10/15 minute drive away. (Tip to avoid 192 traffic use 429 $1 toll but cuts out any delays) The resort is groomed to perfection with constant manicuring of lawns, golf courses etc........ The East village was perhaps a little quieter than some of the other areas but that suited our needs. We had a beautiful view over the golfing tees and decorative fountains. I can only assume the other reviewers have experienced bad luck with the allocation of their accommodation because Orange Lakes did not disappoint and we have high expectations at the best of times. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “North village review”
Reviews.Author: stewheart
Reviews.Content: Tis is our third stay at Orange Lake and we were put in the North Village this time. Our 2 bedroom villa was spacious as always and definitely newer than the west village. The jacuzzi tub and screened patio were very nice and being so close to the pool was a big plus. The 2nd bedroom in the west village is larger but my two little ones didn't notice the difference. Also, the 2 nd bathroom had almost no counter space. Fine for kids but could be a bit tight for adults. Staff was friendly and helpful as usual and they now offer delivery from many of the restaurants. We still stopped by super Target on our way in and stocked up for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Has so much more potential.”
Reviews.Author: Hanoli2
Reviews.Content: After having a great trip to this resort 5 years ago, the opportunity came to stay again this year and we jumped on it. Still a beautiful place with excellent check-in staff who want to please. We checked in a half hour before assigned time, got our key, went to our room only to find the room a nasty disaster from previous occupants. After driving 16 hours, we were grossed out and stunned thinking once this room was cleaned, it would be ours for the week. The front desk gave us a new room only to say many visitors check out late and according to her computer, that room had been cleaned (?). She graciously found us a new room in West Village near tennis courts. The room was welcoming with most lights turned on and a/c at a comfortable temperature. The room had an odor i was able to bear being as exhausted as i was but the 2bedroom was very spacious for the four of us. First stop, the bathroom. On the floor were hairs and not just long black ones but the other type too. I cleaned it but the floor looked like it hadn't been mopped. Neither did the kitchen floor. Im not even sure the carpeting throughout was vacuumed. Walking around the building while the cleaning staff were in the rooms, not once did i hear a vacuum running. The sales tour/meeting lasted 3 hours for us and we kept saying no thanks. To check in, you need to present your license. I have been to so many timeshare presentations and this was the first. We only went to the presentation for the 2 passes they give for unlimited use of the bungy jump/slide/floats for lazy river/mini golf. I felt I needed to get them. My girls are 13 and 14 and went down slide once and the bungy jumping seat hurt. Floats are abundant, you can find them on side of pool once in awhile if you really want one. They played mini golf once. Not worth the three hours for us. Finding a lounge chair was a nightmare at the lazy river. Signs say "no reserving with towels" but ppl do it. We would get there right at opening and towels were on every chair. Not the resorts fault.. not sure how else they can handle that. There are other pools on the resort but most families with kids want to be here especially with the free unlimited passes being given out for attending a presentation. Daily activities are listed throughout the resort but the staff should do more to get kids involved in doing them. Several times, my girls would show up to do an activity and nothing came of it (teen beach volleyball game/teen night/soccer kick to name a few). It only makes for a greater experience if kids have a blast and families with kids are who you see at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “You cant go wrong”
Reviews.Author: im_always_wright
Reviews.Content: My inlaws have been owners at Orange Lake since the late 80's early 90's. For me this is my 7th stay at Orange lake and you cant go wrong. My husband and I always request a 2BR Villa in West Village. Each time it has been exactly what we asked for and fully updated. Our son travels with us, he is 6 now but we have been bringing him since he was 1. For the most part we stay on the resort for our entire stay as there is plenty to do here. Usually do just 1 park a year. Expect the pools to be busy and although the rules state you cannot reserve chairs it happens ALWAYS. Be prepared to get up to the pools by early-mid morning if you are looking for a particular spot. It is stated that coolers are not permitted but we always carry in a soft cooler with drinks and snacks and never have a problem. i have read reviews and would have to say that the negatives are few and far between. We travel with other couples who agree this is the place for a family vacation. Traffic on 192 can get busy but it only took us 10 minutes to get to Animal Kingdom this past week. Its like anywhere else the traffic can change due to holiday and such. If you are not interested in buying a timeshare do not go on the tour. you will be there up to 2 hours and they do not give up. Most of the in room calls are to try to sell you something so unplug the phone. I will continue to vacation at Orange Lake as my husband and I are taking over his parents timeshare. I love it here and look forward to years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic pool & crazy golf amenities”
Reviews.Author: VIK_STER77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bed villa in West village. Very roomy by European standards with everything you need to make your stay comfortable. Only negative is that the Bathrooms are small. We didn't use all the amenities as we were busy with the theme parks. So much so that we avoided the sales calls - be warned that they try to get you on a sales tour of the complex at check in & throughout your stay. Decline & be firm :) would love to come back here one day. We did an RCI exchange so was perfect for our beds & kind on our pocket. Recommend Dine at Joes dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach heaven”
Reviews.Author: NCSFrankfurt_Germany
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Gemany on recommendation of our trusted travel agent. Little did we know that we were firstly to endure a time share sales presentation, which we politely declined (though it was pushed on us again and again). The resort itself is lovely and has great potential. Unfortunately I found it quite dirty (washcloth with black hairs upon out arrival at a "villa"= apartment in the East Village, not to mention the state of the elevator)...the third day, we had a visitor, which was most unwelcome: a giant cockroach in the kids bedroom. And in the evening his little friends were in the living room, in the folder with all the hotel information. Upon calling guest services they assured me the pest control would take care of it. Until we checked out this morning, they might have, but we had the critters there again this morning to wave good bye. Believe me when I say, they were big enough to wave. The safe was not working. Apparently the hotel couldn't fix it without us being present? It said "service" on the display, so it was nothing to do with us being in the house. Especially as we found somebody had been in the apartment without our knowledge, to re-organize the trash. Apparently because the resort is going green. May I suggest not using plastic cups for everything rather than going through the guests' rubbish? The restaurants are okay, but again, if your looking for cleanliness, this is not a place for you. Upon asking for the name of the manager when checking out, the receptionist told me there were too many, she didn't know who was in charge of complaints. Oh well. That sums it up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pools for the kids, but a 40 minute drive from Seaworld and Universal”
Reviews.Author: Diddy1818
Reviews.Content: It's easy to be decieved by the proximity of this resort to all of the hot spots in Orlando. But when I was down there in March it was taking us 45 minutes to get North on I-4 to Seaworld and Universal Studios. You'd still be about 30 minutes from some of the Disney attractions. The resort is HUGE!! They offer shuttle service (golf carts) so you can get around, but most everyone hops in the rental car and drives to the different pools. The pools were top notch for a hotel/resort, one of the pools was more like a water park with several pool areas, slides, and a large lazy river. A great place for the kids, but only if you're planning on actually staying at the resort. If you're just bedding down between park runs I'd stay some where closer in Orlando that had shuttle service to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by poor reviews.”
Reviews.Author: emjay2us
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the West Village during our spring break this past year. We were impressed from the start, with the friendliness of the staff and their eagerness to meet our needs. We stayed in the West Village Tennis Villas. This was a great location for our family...close to pools, tennis courts and golf. I was not afraid to allow our 13 and 11 year old walk to the pool, mini golf, arcade, tennis courts on their own. I felt like the majority of walking areas were well lit at night. I felt like the amount of staff and security present kept "hubbub" to a minimum. I did witness on several occaisions staff checking coolers to make sure there wasn't any glass present at the pool. Pluses were the amenities. Enjoyed the alligator show with our 6 year old. For the most part, the timeshare presentation wasn't to painful. I don't think the wristbands were worth the amount they charge. I felt our cabin was very clean. There were unpleasant odors (manure smell) when we spent time at River Island. Our unit fit our family of 5 perfectly. View from the lanai was relaxing. Was surprised how peaceful sitting on the lanai was (thought it might be more noisy). Enjoyed watching the golfers from our room. The floor in our kitchen area could of used a better cleaning, but nothing we couldn't live with. Our jacuzzi didn't work, but we didn't come to Florida to relax in the tub...we wanted to be in the sun. Overall, beautiful landscaping, well groomed golf courses, friendly staff and great entertainment. Will definitely be back in the future!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely RUINED my vacation”
Reviews.Author: Maria C
Reviews.Content: I have been an owner at Orange Lake for several years and my family stays at the Orlando resort almost every year. This past Christmas holiday, I had saved up points so that I was able to reserve 3 units (Two 2-bedroom units and a studio) so our family could spend the holidays together. I have never been more embarrassed or disappointed in my life. The smell at the resort is disgusting! They say it is from Animal Kingdom. It was so bad my daughter actually vomitted on the sidewalk while we literally ran from the car to get inside the condo. The beds were horrible - the springs were shot and my husband and I actually rolled into each other in the middle of the bed. I have slept on air mattresses that were more comfortable. There were missing pans, dirty coffee cups, the sheets smelled like mildew. My sister, who is an owner at Bonnett Creek (a beautiful resort on Disney property) was with us and could not believe I actually bought in this place. When I went to my owners update and tried to tell them how disappointed I was and explained all the problems we were having, he only tried to sell us more points. NOTHING was done for us...NOTHING!!!!! I called once we returned home to again tell them how disappointed I was in my stay and they apologized but could do nothing about it. But of course, they needed my annual dues paid in full. I AM SO SORRY I BOUGHT HERE AND I WILL NEVER STAY IN ORANGE LAKE AGAIN! If you are considering buying, DON'T DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “UK review....”
Reviews.Author: Julian R
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here, had been made aware of the "time share" experience at the check-in, but arriving late at night and after a 18hr plus total trip time I guess the advisor knew that we were not in the mood for anything other than finding our unit. The unit - excellent, very clean, plenty of room (we had the 2 bedroom type), Kitchen, dining and living area very good. Two big bedrooms, both with en-suite, showers and one even had a jacuzzi bath!! Stayed in East village, quiet, views over the golf-courses and not too far from the main "River Island" pool area (be aware, European and UK approach required to the sun-beds!!! - none available after 10:00hrs...) Location: as said before you are on the Bronson highway and can get held up in the traffic, but that is all that can be expected as it is on the route to Mickey land. We did experience one problem, reported it to house services and within 30 minutes some-one was there to fix it! Nothing major, minor or otherwise to complain about and we can understand why so many of the regular residents of the site are very happy and proud of it. If we come back again (to Florida) this will be on the list to choose from. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joerod01
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this place! You have everything you need here! The River Island lazy river was so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Traveller123321zx
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort 6 years ago and what a change for the worse. Service We sometimes waited for more than 24 hours to get maintenance service for broken appliances and other badly maintained parts in the unit. Financial Although we had toll free telephone cards we were still charged even if we dialed an engaged number. Charges that were not for our unit was added to our credit card. It was later reversed. Because of the exchange rate fluctuation between USA and South Africa we lost +- R350 (US$ 70) that was shrugged off as not the resorts problem 6 Years ago the resort bent backwards to please. Now you have to pay for and wait for everything. What a letdown.

Reviews.Title: “Far better to be had for the money”
Reviews.Author: swisstony123
Reviews.Content: I think it’s rare that I’ve ever been so disappointed with a hotel. I selected this property in light of recommendations of others, the facilities on site and also on the basis I have Platinum status with IHG, of which this resort is a member. We arrived at 7pm on a Thursday and checked in quickly. I was welcomed emphatically as a new guest and also as a Platinum member of the Priority Club loyalty scheme. I was given a $20 welcome voucher for my loyalty (which I’m sure they said I could use to buy wine etc) and quickly presented with my room keys and info pack. Upon leaving reception I was jumped upon by another eager agent who could see the $20 voucher stapled on the outside of the folder and said they would ‘validate’ the voucher – whatever. I was taken to another desk and the voucher then became a green sheet of paper worth $20 off ‘various on and off site attractions’. So we drove over to the room and there it was, the newly built River Island complex in all its splendor. No signs on the outside of the buildings mind you so you have to guess which one your room will be in. We unloaded the car and - by now – tired kids (there were 7 of us in total) and went in to find our room. Now as a platinum member I have come to understand that you’re not always going to get the best room, but never have I experienced this – the worst room on the property as a thank you for my loyalty. We were on the parking lot side, ground floor, in an accessible room. As a result, instead of pleasant vistas and a luxurious bathroom, we were eyeball to headlight with cars in the lot and had a master bathroom that wouldn’t look out of place in a school gymnasium (see the photos). We also found that some of the bedding was missing, so I called up front desk, flagging both my disappointment with the room and also asking for replacement bedding. I was given short shrift - there were no other rooms available – yes, Holiday Inn Vacations at Orange Lake had allocated a Platinum guest paying the top rate the worst room on the property. They did however manage to deliver the replacement sheets in about 10 minutes, but even so this should never have had to be raised as a problem. The following call saw a volley of calls between myself and resort services, with the excuses as to why I had that room allocation getting more comical by the minute. “You should have requested a pool view/high floor when you booked”. “You should have asked at check in whether it was an accessible room”. “You checked in on a Thursday – Friday, Saturday or Sunday gives you more choice.” To make the parking lot view better, they don’t have curtains/drapes at the windows (they have some non-functioning ones in the lounge). So at night as guests come back from a long day at the theme parks, you get a steady stream of headlights sweeping through your bedroom. And one kind soul decided to park up outside the unit and leave the headlights on for a good 90 minutes just after midnight too. Getting nowhere (all they would offer me was a round of minigolf, which finally got moved up to $40 credit to spend in resort) I elected to refer the matter to Priority Club as this is the crux of the issue – they allocate the most loyal guests the worst room. This in turn elicited a call from the Resort Manager himself but despite promises that someone would get back to me, I’ve heard nothing. I also tried to spend the $20 voucher I’d been given on arrival as a thank you for my loyalty – my young son wanted to play golf so this seemed a sensible solution. Driving the not inconsiderable distance to the West side of the property, I was aghast (although perhaps shouldn’t have been) to find out that my voucher was only valid as part credit for either a 1 week pass for various activities on the resort or a discount off some theme park tickets – none of which we intended to visit on our stay. The property is awash with nuances that may be perfectly well known to frequent guests and owners, but left me repeatedly puzzled. They have happy hour at the bar but the first I knew about it was when I went to buy a drink (no signage). 5 years and under don’t pay for the activities like golf and the river tubes – didn’t see this anywhere. There’s also a great habit of not enforcing rules that the resort make up, especially regarding the use of the pool (bringing own alcohol onto the deck, inflatables and reserving lounge chairs). Oh, and despite my request in advance to not get timeshare sales pitches (we already ‘won’ in the area, I received three. This place could be truly great – the grounds are lovely, the rooms are by and large well set up and perhaps if you’re an owner the experience is altogether different but if you’re a paying guest, I’d suggest giving this place a wide berth. There’s far better to be had for the same money around here.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and living areas”
Reviews.Author: jagsstatman
Reviews.Content: Family stayed at Orange Lake Resort in the River Island section. The rooms were quite large with ample bathroom space as well as kitchen area. There is also a good sized living room area with adjoining screened balcony. The price was reasonable for the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Perfect Vacation, We Love Orange Lake!!”
Reviews.Author: Lenny M
Reviews.Content: Me and my family (wife, 12year old son, 2 year old infant son) recieved a reservation at Orange lake from my mother (owner). We stayed in the East Village 88680, and Loved the room. In fact this has been the best place we have EVER stayed at! There was only 1 hair ball we found on the bathroom floor, (No big deal) The room made up for it. I have been reading on trip advisor and knew that there was going to be a sales presentation. Upon checking in they will give you a $20 voucher. When you have your room key in hand you will be asked about the voucher, Immediately I said I have a infant with a dirty diaper (Travelling from NM) and quickly walked away. The woman seemed desperate, and she said "I'll give you a free bottle of wine"! I still walked away... Once we got to our room after being absorbed by the beauty of this resort, we unhooked both phones. We got a 2 bedroom villa on the 6th floor. We were never bothered after that. We loved the pools, the atmosphere, and overall Loved this place. There was a pungent stench twice during our stay which would gag a maggot. But these little instances did not affect the way we feel about Orange Lake. It was quiet, and Very beautiful. Good view for the fireworks, great location, and overall I will give this place an A+. Look forward to going back!!

Reviews.Title: “River Island rocks”
Reviews.Author: TacoMel
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in late March, 2012 in a 2-bedroom unit at River Island. (We previously stayed a half-week in March 2011.) The traveling party was my wife and I and our 6 year old son, who loves to swim. River Island was the ideal place for us, with two pools connected by the Lazy River. Being spring break week, the pool area was crowded and it was difficult to find a chair at times. However the experience is great and we could see that it was being enjoyed by folks of all ages. My son's favorites are the two "squirt gun houses" along the Lazy River that shoot approximately every 20 seconds. On the last day we tried out the pool at the North Village, which had an in-pool basketball hoop, volleyball net, and a small water slide. That was also a hit, especially the water slide. (We picked up a waterproof case for our digital camera prior to this trip, and that was a great investment!) Amenities include the wi-fi internet which is included, a flatscreen HDTV in the living area, and an extensive selection of cable/satellite channels. The kitchens had the necessities, and the appliances, dishes, and cookware were in good condition. The units were also cleaned well and the common areas were also clean and well maintained. Being a timeshare/resort, there are the typical annoyances that folks have come to expect and tolerate. We did get "the call" - the dreaded invitation to the sales pitch - and unfortunately it woke us all up at 9:00 AM after having arrived late the night before on a delayed flight. Once we said no, they did stop calling though. There are some nickel-and-dime charges, such as tubes for the lazy river -- although I think it was taking it too far when an overzealous staff member decided to proactively take away previously-abandoned from children (of all ages) who had found them and naturally started playing with them. Perhaps they're within their rights to do this, but bringing my son and others to tears by practically yelling at them not to touch abandoned tubes just was not cool at all. (Fortunately this only happened one day, and the other workers we encountered were pleasant and helpful.) As for the location it's right on US-192 so you're going to be instantly sitting in traffic no matter where you're trying to go. We do not visit The Mouse but Orange Lake seems very close and convenient if you're going there... however, if you spend time in his Kingdom you're missing out on the pools and the many other things to do at Orange Lake!! Note: we are owners of another time share in the Holiday Inn Club family (Lake Geneva, WI) so I do not have any experiences with RCI exchanges, or being "required" to attend the sales pitch after staying at a reduced rate.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems that interrupt your vacation”
Reviews.Author: Karenspade27
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we own at this resort but transferred in through RCI. First the positives...lots to do onsite for kids. Pools seemed clean and common areas were also well tended to. The units in the East Village were big enough for four adults and gave us plenty of space to spread out. The pool in the East Village was nice and quiet for the adults and was well taken care of. The check in process was a lot easier once you ask them not to call your room for any reason and avoid the timeshare pitch by just telling them you are not interested and be stern about it. We had no problems but we were on the offensive about it after reading all of the other reviews and having stayed there before. Now the negatives. On check in the safe was locked and we had to wait to get it opened before we could leave the room. We also had a room that smelled badly of smoke. AND Yes they have BUGS and they don't seem too concerned about it. I called and informed the front desk that we had roaches in our bedroom and they offered to send someone in the next day to spray. They were so big I took pictures. We have someone with asthma who had already had to go through having our room sprayed because of the smell of smoke so we asked to be moved. They said they couldn't do that. It was late at night so we went to bed with the lights on. The next day we realized the dishwasher wasn't working. By the end of our stay the toaster didn't work either. It is an ok place for kids because it is close to the parks and the restaurants very close to the resort. The worst part of the whole resort is the crazy prices they charge. $9.00 for a tube and you can't share it with anyone. They have you put a wristband on and if you give your tube to a friend they will take it from them. Doesn't seem logical that they say they make you use their tubes for safety purposes and then don't let you share it??? They also charge you about $9.00 to play miniature golf...the $25.00 arcade card we had lasted about an hour with two people playing on it. EVERYTHING COSTS EXTRA. If you truly want a great experience try the Wyndham Bonnet Creek resort. It was right on the Disney property, had shuttle service that ran consistently, the units were spotless and well stocked, and they didn't charge for all the extras. I hate rating this place so poorly because we own there but they really have to stop ripping people off. It is much cheaper at Bonnet Creek and they tend to maintain their property much more diligently. I see lots of follow up on other poor reports from the Orange Lake Management team saying that you should report the issues...we did. They didn't care. I understand it is Florida but I stayed at Bonnet Creek and didn't see a bug inside my unit the entire time I was there. Also they have free activities all day for the adults and children and awesome entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but needs TLC outside”
Reviews.Author: xxhermxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a 2 bedroom suite at River Island. The reservations person at the toll free number was exceptional in the way she explained all of the different options -- the pros and cons of each village etc. We arrived at 11 a.m. and checked in -- but weren't permitted to go to our room as it wasn't ready. That was okay -- we left to go to a baseball game then came back at 4 and the room was ready. My only complaint was that when we checked in, they said they would call us and tell us our room number when it was ready. That call never came. I ended up calling them and they told us it was ready and gave us the room number. (Not sure why they didn't do as they said they would and call me). Anyways, as someone else has said, it's quite a drive to get in the resort area to your room. It is really a huge place. We never really left the River Island area, but just looking at the map, I can see how huge the place is. In all other respects, I found check in to be relatively efficient. It wasn't really explained to us that our "villa" was just an apartment. That's what it looks like -- a 4 storey apartment building. It's not a "villa" at all. We were a little disappointed at that. Don't use the word "villa"; it is deceptive. Once we got inside (up the elevator and down the hall) to our room, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious (we were told it was 1280 square feet -- it didn't feel quite that big) and the furniture was decent. The appliances in the kitchen were functional, somewhat dated, but I wouldn't expect stainless steel top of the line appliances in a place like that. The fridge had an automatic ice maker, which was wonderful -- it would have been nice if it had been switched on for our arrival. The kitchen had lots of dishes, pots, pans, utensils etc. Very well stocked. We only ate breakfast and the occasional sandwich in our room. We didn't cook in it. The decor was inviting and pleasant. Nice artwork. There was a breakfast bar area, with stools, in addition to a fairly large kitchen table with a bench and chairs. The living room had a large sectional couch, which had a sofa bed and occasional chair. The living room tv was a flat screen. The lighting was excellent. I hate dark hotel rooms. The deck, off the living room was large, had a light and ceiling fan and furniture. It was covered so you couldn't sit out there and tan. Also it was enclosed by a screen, as all of the decks were. Not sure why. Obviously some resort decision. At the entrance way was a large closet with a washer and dryer, plus a few packets of laundry soap (no fabric softener). They were great. We used them a few times. Very nice to have them in your room. To the right of the entrance was a bath -- which you can get to through the hallway or the second bedroom. Both bathrooms had a great lay out. They were large and had lots of places for storage. Lots of shelves. Also, both baths had a separate room for the toilet, which is also great and makes it more functional. The second bedroom had two queen beds (or maybe doubles - I 'm not sure), a tv (not a flat screen), a closet, a few lamps as well as overhead lighting and a ceiling fan, a dresser and a table between the beds. There were hangers in the closet. I appreciated this. Across the suite,on the opposite side of the living room was the Master Bedroom and bath. This bedroom was slightly smaller than the other. It had a king bed, dresser and TV, closet with hangers, chair and ottoman, desk and chair and two bedside tables and lamps. The Master Bath again was well organized. The only difference between this one and the other one was that in addition to there being a nice glass shower, the Master Bath had a jacuzzi tub (which we never used -- we hardly use the one we have at home). Outstanding parts of the suite: the lighting, the windows, the window coverings, the bathrooms and the air conditioning (it was very hot out but the A/C worked great!) Unimpressive - that there was no housekeeping and I wasn't told this when I booked in. I don't think I was even told this when I checked in. The time share push -- I was literally accosted by one of the employees as I left the check in desk. They ask if you have a few minutes and don't tell you what it's for. I am usually a sucker and am usually pleasant to these people, but we were getting late for a baseball game, and we literally had no time at all. So I walked away. She ripped off some part of my check in package -- something to do with the $20 incentive. Let me tell you this -- if you want me to take time out of my day to go on a time share tour, you are going to have to give me more than a $20 incentive. In fact, I would need probably at least $500 to make it worthwhile, so leave me alone!! I was not told this was a time share place and that we would be bothered like this when I booked in. There should be full disclosure when you are booking in that you may be asked to consider the time share option. They did call our suite later in our stay, which upset me. We had already said NO to the time share tour. My husband told them No and at least they did not call again. I now turn to the grounds and facilities. The grounds, generally speaking were nice. We didn't golf but the golf course looked great. The parking lot was satisfactory. The pool area was dirty. I don't know if there were just a lot of dirty people or what? I did see workers cleaning and picking up trash, but it was more than the trash. There were lots of leaves, berries, and parts of bushes on the terrace. Also, the smell was horrid. it smelled like a flower had bloomed but had now over bloomed, like lilacs sometimes get. Or maybe it was the water in the river/creek or whatever it was. It was horrid. It made sitting out by the pool less pleasant. There are nice shops etc. at River Island -- you can buy souvenirs, clothes, some groceries -- there is actually a great selection there. Plus a fast food place for burgers and fries etc. And a healthier fast food place where you can get overpriced carrots and celery and salads. Drive down the street to the Publix and buy that stuff for a reasonable price. The River Island fitness centre is great. Loved all of the machines. What I really didn't like about the pool and recreational activities was that everything cost more money. When we booked in, the person on the phone told me all about the lazy river and the rock climbing and the hippo water slide -- she did not mention that there is an extra fee for all of that. I think I heard that the tubes to go in the lazy river were $9 per day!! WOW! Cabanas were $169 per day. I would think this would be very expensive with young children. Massages were overpriced as well and I would never get a massage in a public place where the masseuse has had his/her hands on many other strangers. But they often seemed busy. The resort was definitely an industry in itself. We took advantage of the express checkout feature. You phone a number, tell them when you will be leaving and your room number. Then you simply leave your keys with the security. We still haven't received our bill but it's only been a week. I hope I will receive a copy of our bill in the mail. If not, I will have to call them.

Reviews.Title: “What An Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Walt1
Reviews.Content: When Holiday Inn bought this Resort they institued a training program on customer relations and it works requests are fulfilledin in atimely fashion and there is alwaysafollow up phone call.Everyone is very polite and asking if they canhelp.We also found the food especially at TheLegacy to be quite good recommend the Chicken Pot Pie

Reviews.Title: “Could be great”
Reviews.Author: DCFunTravels
Reviews.Content: This is a really good resort as you can see by the many positive reviews. We have stayed her 5 or more times. There are a few reasons that I would prefer to go to another resort. 1 - Size. This is a huge resort and it gets annoying having a 10 minute drive to about anything...pools, market etc. I hate fighting thru traffic after a long day to make it to the resort and then still have another 10 plus minutes to get to our room. 2 - Cold pools. On our most recent trip to River Island, it was 88 degrees and sunny and the water was too cold for any of the adults to get in. We come down to Orlando for the pools but c'mon put some heat in them!! 3 - Grills - there are ZERO grills on the property. Give families a break and install some gas grills that can be used. We love this about Sheraton/Westin properties. It is so nice to cook a couple meals on a grille. Other than that, cool place but for those reasons we have not been using our ownership at OL and have been staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Verace
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I spent a week in the West Village at Orange Lake... We did nothing but relax for the first 3 days... We were approached to do the tour when we checked in and declined, on our fourth day someone called and asked if we would consider doing the tour and we decided to.... Breakfast buffet at the River Island restaurant was excellent, the Trade Winds bar was great as well.... We did not try any other restaurants on the property. Overall it was a good experience....

Reviews.Title: “family fun”
Reviews.Author: northernmimom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake Resort March 24-29, 2012. I was a little skeptical about staying somewhere that was 40 miles from the ocean and also about all of the stuff I had read regarding the high pressure timeshare pitch, but had an overall great experience. Our room: POSITIVE: I booked our room through booking.com and received a significant price discount for paying in advance. We had a studio (2 queens, pullout couch and efficiency kitchen with table). It was a perfect set-up for our family. The beds were comfy, we had plenty of linens to get us thru the 4 days and the room was clean. We were centrally located and could easily access our car or the pool or the front desk from our room. Our room: NEGATIVE: Although I had requested that we be placed at River Island, our room was actually at the West Village - directly behind the check-in area. Thru booking.com, I was not made aware that the room type we requested was not available at River Island. Also, I had been lead to believe each room room a washer & dryer but in our building, they were actually down the hall - we were given enough laundry soap for 4 or 5 loads and we did not need coins to operate the machines. Time Share Experience: Upon check in, I firmly declined the $20 free gift to the woman who approached me. Additionally, we unplugged the phone in the hotel room and were not asked again to attend any timeshare presentations. My advice is to be polite but firm with your "no"...and trash the $20 certificate...FREE is a 4 letter word. Pool & Surroundings: The pool at the West Village was super nice. There were plenty of towels and chairs. At River Island, our friends got up early to break the rules and reserve chairs. There were signs that stated that reserving chairs was not permitted but there was nobody enforcing it. In fact, the only thing that was strictly enforced were the $9 per day lazy river blue tubes! Everyone had their own cooler packed with food & drink & cocktails and after 5 days the only person I saw get in trouble were people without armbands that were riding on tubes in the lazy river...they literally have a hook that they grab them from people with in 2 different stops around the river. We took advantage of the 2 for $4 domestic draft beers for happy hour and our friends took advantage of the $14.95 refillable soft drink container. Our kids liked the virgin daquiris with the $3 refills. Dining: We ate a Breezes one night and Pisan's pizza place. They were both average...the kids meals are all under $5.99 and I found the adult items to be reasonably priced. We went to Publix and got yummy Boars Head sandwiches a couple of times and we also kept breakfast & lunch stuff in our room. Other: None of us were a big fan of people smoking at the pool. It seemed like there were people smoking everywhere. Additionally, at the end of our hotel hall was an exit to outside and people stood outside that door and smoked so we had to walk thru it on our way to the pool. I even saw an employee standing there...we stayed at the Renaissance @ Sea World earlier in the week and they had a no-smoking policy in the pool area...that was super. My only other complaint was that the hotel rooms were super nice, but the hallway still had dingy ceiling tiles and the stairwells (by ashtray) and area by the stairwell entrances at West Village were dirty...they needed to be swept & painted. Overall a 4/5 experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised”
Reviews.Author: Wary-Traveller884
Reviews.Content: After I read alot of bad reviews about this resort we were really surprised and impressed when we arrived. The 2 bedroom condo we booked was beautiful. Ive stayed at classier places, but this was no 3 star either and it was nicely decorated as well. I will not take trip advisor reviews as the gospel any more. while the overall rating by tripadvisor is good, alot of the reviews had us worried until we arrived. Its easy to give a great review when you dont have any problems during your stay, but the true test of any service provider is the ability to solve problems and make the customer happy. Orange Lake did this for us. We had traded a RCI for a week stay here to do disney and cruise to Daytona beach to catch the tail end of Bike Week. When we checked in we asked that they see what kind of rate they could offer us for an additional two nights at the end as we were planning on going somewhere else for cheaper for the last two nights in Orlando. The man we dealt with was not exactly on the ball, but he was nice none the less. We asked him to get back to us with some prices and he never did. We forgot about it and got caught up in the disney marathon and it wasnt untill the last few days we decided we better follow up with him and see what was going on. Turns out he forgot?...He was a bit laid back about it, but sincere enough and after wasting some more time on the phone with him on hold he came up with a really cheap rate for a smaller condo which was fine by us. We left it at that and went back to our vacation. Called back before our week ended and were told there was nothing booked for us so of course we were back on hold for a long time and frustrated we were spending too much time sorting out what we were told by this employee and telling it to someone new, now worrying we have no accomadation. The lady we dealt with eventually called back and got it straightened out. (the reservation had been made, but lost in the "system") so we accepted that and she garunteed our rate. when we got the new room key we were pretty happy and surprised to walk into another 2 bedroom villa after booking a studio. This one was as nice as the original place we had. Thats what I call making it right for the customer after the fact. The only complaint I had was the toaster was kaput and looked like it was not recent and the dishwasher soap dispensor would not close so we could not do the dishes we dirtied. The TV in living room had a channel changer that would not work. I left a note for the house keeping staff and other than that our experiance was great. Also, my daughter lost her I-phone and it was found by the Publix grocery store that is on the Orange lake property and one of the staff members called the "home" number stored in phone and my daughter got her phone back within 24 hrs of loosing it. This Resort is huge and I think it needs more support staff at front check in/customer service counter as you do spend a few minutes on hold for anything other than a wake up call, but overall I thought we were treated great by all. As far as the whole time share sales pitch, I eat those guys for breakfast due to previous encounters at other resorts so was prepared to dispatch the first one that approached us this time. I did not happen. No one bothered us at all, so that was really nice as well. I even went to the timeshare customer care office to ask were we might find a certain seafood and the guys inside were super and the one gentlemen went out of his way to help and give me some good "local" advice. All this and Im someone who usually runs from large resorts as I dont like the amount of people and all the price gouging for amenities such as food and extras. We tried to have a few decent meals in our condo and ate offsite for the rest. Also I read reviews about smells coming from Animal Kingdom and after being at the resort Its seems to me that they are confusing the smell of fertilizer used in the beds around the resort. Animal Kingdom is so huge and the animals so spread out it would seem odd to have that concentration of odor. Not to mention I watched the Disney staff cleaning it up as we toured the Africa section. Orange Lake has obviously raised the bar for service delivery as well as the product they supply so they get my thumbs up!....PS. Nice golf courses. Regards, the wary traveler

Reviews.Title: “East Village good for Handicpped Person”
Reviews.Author: EasternCanadaKoda
Reviews.Content: I came to Orange Lake with my handicapped mother and 2 friends on a timeshare exchange.. I called ahead asking for a handicapped room. It was wonderful- on the ground floor. All 3 baths had walkin showers but the master had a wheel-in model and Jacuzzi. The pool was a walk-in as well, which was very convenient. We were 4 intentionally, so that we could play bridge. We loved playing in the screened room where we could watch golfers and one day watched a family of cranes walking their babies. Every morning Mom and I walked down a golfcart pathway to a small body of water where turkey vultures gathered, and we also saw woodpeckers and a heron. No alligators. There are shuttles that run 7am -12am with knowledgeable and friendly drivers. Necessary to do steps. We didn't have to use the car onsite at all. We attended comedy night and found it hilarious. The meal was excellent as well- a caesar salad bar and a variety of pastas. The drink menu was extensive and creative, but expensive. Maintenance staff came immediately on calling, but no one came to clean or change towels all week, perhaps because it was an exchange. I'm certain they would have come had we asked. We needed help with the safe and a security guy was at the door as I hung up the phone, followed up by a call from that department to ensure we were able to work it. We couldn't hear noise from any attached units.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable holiday here”
Reviews.Author: With2Children
Reviews.Content: We were sent a link to this site a week before our holiday, and we were a little worried after reading some of the comments. Upon arrival from the UK after a long flight (2am uk time) we could have done without the timeshare/offer sales pitch. But we were prepared so quickly declined and the staff accepted this. We had requested a ground floor villa as we did not fancy stairs with children/grandparents and suitcase/shopping etc, so were a little disappointed to find our villa was actually a 4th floor apartment. (this may be due to a UK/US language difference). However there was a lift and the apartment was very spacious and well equiped. The resort was attractive and well maintained, the lazy river pool was fun, but can't believe the resort pay for staff to rent out the rubber rings for the river. THESE SHOULD BE FREE as most people only want 1 go round, so $9 was expensive. We did not use any onsite activities such as mini golf as you could not pay for a single game, only a day pass. One other aspect that slightly spoiled the stay was the golf course lawnmowers cutting the grass at 5am outside the apartment blocks! Overall a very good holiday, and if the orange lake managers listen and change some of the issues reported on this site then it would be an excellent holiday destination.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Cara557
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the beginning of March 2012. There were four adults (my parents, my husband and I) and 1 toddler and we were very pleased with the property. Fortunately my parents did the "sales pitch" tour so my husband and I were able to skip it, although they did take the toddler with them which gave them an out when she got bored. I had read that the resort can be very pushy but after the one tour (in which my parents managed to not spend any money) we didn't hear from them again. I think you just have to be firm in the first meeting. The resort is huge, lots of pool and children's entertainment options. The one thing I didnt realize is that the lazy river/waterslides are not free, although you can still use the pool area around it. There were lots of families there as well which helped to entertain my daughter (she made friends at every pool we went to). There is also a toddler friendly playground in the River Island area, which we didnt find until the end of the week. Wish we had found it sooner! We had a two bedroom condo in the west village and a one room/kitchenette in the hotel area of the west village. The one room was okay (sort of like an older hotel room) but the condo was amazing. The place was huge with a nice kitchen, eating area and balcony (which is screened off to protect you from bugs). The restaurants on the resort are actually very well priced as well and my husband and father tried the two golf courses (both very nice). The service was good throughout - although can be a bit slow in some of the stores. The resort is also very well located - only a few minutes from Disney and there are some groccery store and shopping options very close by. I would highly recommend this resort, especially if you can avoid the timeshare sales pitches.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: sa2121
Reviews.Content: We have been going to orangelake for many years as guests with friends of ours....now we re owners...and hat a wonderful suprise to us when we got their....but updated rooms! We were so happy with the upgrades! My husband played on all the golf courses and loved them all....we ate at a few restaurants and the food was good! We brought 9 other people with us (we had 2 rooms). And they were all impressed with everything orangelake had to offer! Resort services were very helpful when we needed a high chair and a crib....at no charge. The only thing that we didn't care for was the "no cash" policy. You use your room key or a credit card. But that's my only complaint. I cant wait to go back for many years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but not sure I'd go again”
Reviews.Author: pron6miller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a villa in River Village. If you are traveling with kids and don't want to have to take a car to the pool, stay here, as the property is huge. Rooms are spacious and very clean, as is the entire resort. Prices for food were reasonable, prices for poolside drinks were a bit high, but you expect that. Very turned off by their charging $9 for a tube for the lazy river - nickel and dime maneuver that brings down the entire experience. I did not have any problems with timeshare salespeople.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for our family & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NolanFam
Reviews.Content: My family returned from a spring break in Orlando. We started with 3 days at Universal & the Hard Rock Hotel, then moved to Orange Lake for 4 nights. This was our first time at Orange Lake; we were cautiously optimistic after reading the reviews here and became even more hopeful when I met some people that had stayed here before. We arrived early on Monday about 11:30, although our unit wasn't ready we were able to check in and were told housekeeping would call my cell phone when it was ready. After lunch at the Miler Ale House and grocery shopping at Publix (just outside the front gate) my phone rang and we were ready. We were in 2282; an excellent location on the # 8 tee box of the Legends course (there's not any better entertainment than sitting on the patio with a cold beverage watching people hit ball after ball into the pond) and a short walk to the West Village pool. Our unit was recently remodeled with granite counter tops, tile, carpet, new appliances and paint. Unfortunately we had to call maintenance for a broken door knob, a clogged disposal, torn refrigerator gasket, and a bad smoke detector. This was not necessarily Orange Lakes fault, in fact the maintenance staff was excellent and prompt. Apparently we had some partiers in the unit before us but the two maintenance men that visited us had everything fixed within minutes, not hours. Orange Lake handled our issues promptly and efficiently. They get high marks for customers service and professionalism form the maintenance staff. We loved our unit. It was an excellent location. The master with king bed for my wife and I and the bedroom with twin beds were perfect for us. It was tastefully decorated and came with more than I expected; dish washing detergent, clothes detergent, and even some coffee. We took the shuttle (which had a stop just a couple hundred feet away) to River Island on the other side of the resort. River Island is a collection of small pools intertwined by a lazy river. There's a number of bars, restaurants, and shopping. It's a great place to spend the day. Unfortunately it was packed (spring break) and there were no chairs to be found so we didn't stay long. We took the shuttle back after only an hour or so and our driver dropped us off right at our door vs the bus stop. Now that's service! After lunch we walked over to the West Village pool, easily found lounge chairs, and enjoyed the rest of the afternoon. We enjoyed the pool at West Village ( I think it's called Water’s Edge Beach Club) so much that we reserved a cabana for the following day. The cabana was well worth the $99 to have a couple of couches, shade, our own fridge, and we had a great waiter (I think his name was Dominick) that took care of us all day with drinks and lunch. The Waters Edge Beach Club has a couple of pools, a restaurant and bar, a game room, putt putt, and is next to to the lake where boats can be rented by the hour. Finally, a few bullet points: - Don't bother checking your messages if your in room phone is flashing, it's just advertisements - The time share people are a little pushy but that's what they do, I thought I was done after checking in but I ran out to Target for 20min one morning and when I returned they had gotten my wife on the phone and she agreed to an appointment, they must have seen me leave :-) Really it's not that big of a deal but know going in it is a time share place and they are gonna try to get you into one of their sales pitches. Listen in if you want or politely say no. I didn't have any problems but keep in mind they are persistent. We had excellent wifi connection from our unit and at the pool Service was excellent, every phone call we made for reservations, tee times, maintenance, bus drivers, were all warm and friendly, knowledgeable and efficient Prices for drinks and food on the resort are fair. Certainly not restaurant prices from home but nowhere near on-property Disney and Universal prices. My son and I golfed at the 9 hole executive course (Legends) and had a great time. We used rented clubs and once again had excellent service and the price was fair. When you check in they will hold $250 on your credit card for charges at the resort. You can't use cash anywhere, just your room key. Some people may not like this but I'm fine with it. When I'm on vacation I want no worries, ease of use and relaxation. It's nice not having to carry much around. We had a great stay and will plan to come back, probably a full week next time. Orange Lake is a great value for the room and onsite restaurants and amenities are excellent as well. You're just a few miles from Disney and with a Publix, a Target, and several restaurants just outside the front gate, you've got everything you need. Don't be concerned with renting a place in West Village because it's "older," I think that's where you want to be. Cheers, Nolan

Reviews.Title: “Orlando trip”
Reviews.Author: Lisa F
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is very nice but spread out. If you don't want to drive or take the shuttle, you are limited to the closest pool to your villa. The villa we had was a little run down and not what I had expected. The staff seemed to be happy and were very friendly. The phone rang non stop trying to get us to come to their timeshare presentation. We just ignored it and that worked out great for us. We would not have had time to attend a presentation. If you are going to Disney, this resort is close by but if you are going to Universal (which is what we did), this was too far. The Fun Team did a great job with the kids during the nightly Sunset Celebration. They had a great time hanging at the pool and doing the activities. We would probably not go back as the resort was a little too spread out for us. We had to do a lot of walking to get places within the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome resort !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie W
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't know where to start. We stayed in the West Village which should have been from March 11th-18th but had to extend our stay until the 20th due to the Direct Air fiasco. None the less we truly enjoyed every experience that Orange Lakes had to offer. We didn't encounter any pushy sales people...(not sure if it's because we were using my parents timeshare unit), Even after we had to check out and check right back into another unit there was no pressure or sales pitch given. We did receive a daily phone call that left a message only letting us know what was going on that particular day at the resort. The condo we stayed at was a two bedroom bungalow unit that was very clean and spacious. There were 4 adults and 4 children ages 9-12 that stayed and we all had plenty of room. It was very handy to have a full size washer and dryer in the unit. The unit itself seemed to have been recently renovated as far as the kitchen and bathrooms. But the only complaint would be the doors and window's seem to be original but they did their job none the less. We attempted to go to the North Village to spend the day around the lazy river but went way too late in the day (1:00) and it took forever to find one lounge chair. Be sure to get there bright and early to claim your spot. We actually all agreed that we preferred the atmosphere and pool/beach in the West Village. The Breezes restaurant served up delicious food and had friendly wait staff. I would especially like to thank the employee's of the Resort Services who went over and above their call of duty. We truly appreciate all the help you provided especially with printing off our boarding passes. All in all we had a fun filled and fantastic experience staying at The Holiday Inn Club Vacations Orlando - Orange Lake Resort

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Condo/Resort Are Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: joewingless4
Reviews.Content: Prior to arrival -- and any questions that you have once you are on site are handled by "Resort Services" Naisy, Jodie, Carmen and the rest are a joy to deal with. They can help you with anything. What a joy that is to have true professionals who are there to help you.***** I go to Orlando/Kissimmee often and many of the other resorts(Help Staff) where I have stayed in the past just want to sell you something and not help you have a great stay. Orange Lake's "Resort Services' Staff Should be the Model for the Timeshare Condo Industry. Our 2 bedroom slept 8 comfortably-- King in Master-- 2 queens in Second Bedroom. Plus the Pull-out for the kids. 2 full Bathrooms. 3 flat Screens-- Awesome Kitchen-- The place was Modern and perfectly clean. We went to the Parks a couple days- But left a day unused at Disney- Because the kids wanted to stay at Orange Lake as much as possible. They made Great friends- Hanging out at the pools(Especially River Island.) My Girlfriend and I Loved The Breezes Bar.(Close to where you check-in-WEST VILLAGE) My girlfriend said, "Michele makes the best Margaritas ever." Michele ,Katie and the rest of the Breezes' Staff were very nice. One night we went to the "River Island Grille," The all You-Can-Eat Ribs for $21.99 were amazing. Chong was our waitress- she was superb. Orange Lake is a place that I will soon visit again.

Reviews.Title: “all about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: campnavy
Reviews.Content: hated the sales pitch for the timeshare at the reception.... everyone was supernice at first -- then the pitch .... amanda offered us about 350 in gift cards for the resort/disney/universal to attend the 'resort tour' -- we said no thanks and were then treated like dirt. the cordial amanda abruptly turned her back on us. so, poor marks for service. Rooms are brilliant, pools are great -- super access to shopping, restaurants, and all parks. Great place to stay if you can get past the not so nice Amanda.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay & plenty to do for all ages!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay in a 2 br villa in the North Village of Orange Lake Resort. It was a little overwhelming driving into the resort because it is so huge & there are so much housing. Many of the areas have single story housing complexes, which you park directly in front of and it easy for loading & unloading the car. The villa was very nice with big rooms & bathrooms. We traveled with 2 kids, ages 11 and 2.The lagoon pool is good for toddlers because it has a kiddie pool, zero entry pool, and fountain area. That pool area also has a small slide, basketball goal in the pool, volleyball net, and arcade area for the older kids. The river pool has a lazy river, zero entry pool, 2 slides, and also was right next to the mini golf, huge inflattable slide, rock climbing, & bungie trampoline. We will return. If you have a citicard you can use your CitiCash to get discounted rates. Avoid the timeshare sales pitch by telling them that you already heard the pitch when you booked the room over the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo, bad food”
Reviews.Author: lynz001
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in East Villiage ground floor unit 2 bedroom. The condo was very nice and was not an updataed one but was very clean and large with the ability to go outside to see pond and could see golfers. I did manage to plug in my curling iron and the power went out. Also on last day fridge freezer was leaking bad. But overall was very happy with the comfort of the condo and the area it was in. The resort is huge with lots of pools and golf courses. We had realitives staying in River Island so we went there a lot to hang by the pool. The lazy river is very nice but could be a lot better if they shut off those terrilble spray guns that soak you and this becomes and not so lazy relaxing river. or at leas turn off 2 so you can avoid them. My biggest complaint was the food, it sucked. The menus were good but when you got your meal was lacking in taste. We ate at Legend Grill and another place by River Island. Thankfully there are lots of options off the resort. We took the shuttle a few times although we had car but a few drinks we needed to use the shuttle which worked out well. We did get a good deal on the condo which can be priced high at times. Golf courses were great and you can get discounts on golfnow. We arrived at midnight so when we checked in no sales desk people and no one even mentioned at time of check in of one. There was a voucher attached to our package I simply threw it out. We did get some calls each day but either had my daughter say we were out or ingnored answering the phone. You can easily avoid presentation just do not take voucher or go to sales desk ad ingnore your phone. The place is very nice. The pina colodas very good.

Reviews.Title: “This Resort Has It All”
Reviews.Author: cmclauss
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Orange Lake Resort and I knew in advance my husband and I were required to sit through a 120 minute timeshare presentation. We did not purchase because it just wasn't for us. The property is more like a small town with 4 neighborhoods. We were in the West Resort which is surrounded by the golf course. We backed up to one of the golf greens and were on the main path for golf carts. I liked that we could take the golf path to get to the Breezes pool in about 7 minutes. One downer - the 5AM mowing and the maintenance crew using the path at full speed beginning at 6AM. It sounded like a freight train going by. We had a sweet, clean, well maintained 2-bedroom 2-bath villa with a full kitchen that was perfect for our family of 5 adults. However, the pull out sofa bed was incredibly uncomfortable. My son ended up closing it and just sleeping on the sofa. We arrived on Saturday, March 10, right at 4PM check in and from the outside it seemed like it check-in was going to be crazy busy. I was pleasantly surprised that we were out the door in less than 10 minutes. Check-in was very organized for such a huge place. For that first night, we ordered a pizza from the West store. It wasn't the most delicious pizza, but it was reasonably priced and ready in less than 20 minutes. I also purchased all of our Disney and Universal passes at the resort. I was pleasanty surprised that the tickets were actually at a better price than I could have purchase in advance on-line. We spent 4 days in the parks (10-15 minutes from Disney, 30 minutes from Universal) and 2 days using the West resort pool. We purchased cocktails and appetizers from Breezes. Cocktails are $6 after your purchase your first cocktail in a souvenior glass. The only bummer was when my family went over to the lazy river - $9 per person for a tube rental is ridiculous! There is a Publix grocery store, a liquor store and lots of places to eat right outside the property. If you don't bring a computer (and don't have a fancy phone), it will cost .25 / minute for internet access in the business office.

Reviews.Title: “A scam”
Reviews.Author: OIFDoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in January and were duped into the fact this is a time share. So they rope you in by having you book unaware of that fact and then we were told we get discounted Disney tickets if we sat through a 90 minute presentation..... We said ok.....well 90 minutes became 5 hours of hell..... We tried like 20 times to tell them we were getting married and buying a house and we didn't have the money for a timeshare but they just kept pushing it on us.....the term one time offer arose like 50 times.....reminded me of a south park episode that made fun of timeshares.....anyways after rejecting 4 separate salesmen and 1 your guide they laid a package on us " letting us" return in the next two years and then pushed that on us..... Long story short it felt like if we didn't agree to something we would never get to enjoy our vacation so we said ok and signed a paper saying we'd come back..... Mind you, you have to do another 90 minute timeshare....so plan for 5 hours..... Anyways we had ten days to cancel so I called and tried to cancel....but no one even knew who we were....so I thought nothing more of it.....well all the sudden I get emails saying we signed up for this package and so I called back asking what this meant and wouldn't you know it, our file was easily found with our phone number.....problem is, this is past ten days and so they refuse to let us cancel it even after explaining the situation and how before no one knew what I was talking about.....they were complete [--] to us and basically told us too bad so sad..... So now we are stuck paying for a trip they harassed us into......I will never consider holiday inn or ichg hotels ever again over this because they know nothing of customer service and they will do whatever it takes to help their bottom line......when I pay this off and come back I'll make sure they get the same respect they showed us.....mind you we are only going back because we are stuck paying for this crap institution

Reviews.Title: “Will go back.”
Reviews.Author: dlcrush54
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Orange Lake and loved it. Very nice property, lots of activities totally self contained if you don't mind spending a little extra on food and drink. Loved the shuttle bus that you could catch to see all of the property. Only draw back is the high pressure for the presentations. We already have plenty of time share and want no more. You have to jump through hurdles to get your parking permit because they send you from the front desk to the time share presentation station to get it. My mom was interested in finding out about the change over from weeks to points offer and made an appointment. When I told her I didn't want to go she cancelled and they told her they were going to bill her $30.00 cancellation fee!!! She straightened that out we hope. It hasn't shown up on her card yet.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice visit.”
Reviews.Author: 5yearoldtwins
Reviews.Content: This is our third time visiting Orange Lake, so obviously we already like it. We spent 4 days at Disney and honestly, I wish we spent more time at Orange Lake. Pros: River Island and the North Village pool were both wonderful for our kids. River Island was a perfect place for our family to relax and float around, and when the kids got bored they went to the fun zone--which was an amusement park in itself. Rock climbing wall, 3 story inflatable water slide, and a trampoline area. This area is not complimentary, but for $50 a person you can get unlimited trips to the fun zone as well as unlimited mini golf and unlimited tube rentals. We got $20 off for listening to the time share appointment presentation (just 5 minutes of my time). I felt this was a good value even though we only spent two days at the pool. Honestly, I don't know how the rooms are so quiet. I have stayed at many resorts/hotels and none have been a quiet as Orage Lake Pros: Check in was much quicker and the appointment scheduling for the timeshare presentation has been separated from check in, and they give you the $20 coupon I mentioned just for talking to the people that schedule the appointments. The person who checked us in (Pablo) was fantastic and went above and beyond. We had 2 units in the East village that I loved. We had views of the Magic Kingdom fireworks from our screened in porch. The units were clean and in good repair, Master Bath has a large whirlpool tub that was nice after long days at the amusement park. Kitchen had all you need to cook meals, working dishwasher, full sized washer and dryer. Enough paper towels, toilet paper, laundry detergent, dishwasher detergent, and dish detergent to last a week (this was a nice change from our last visit 2 years ago). The golf courses look nice, but I can't comment because I don't play. We did eat lunch one day at the pool, and honestly I was surpised at the prices, they weren't bad and the food was quite good.
