Super target across the highway from the entrance which has affordable groceries and everything else you may need. Many restaurants within and right outside the resort. We ate at Bahama Breeze and Houlihans which were both excellent. The Disney parks were a very short 15 minutes (maybe less) especially if you know the short cut. Cons: TVs were still tube TVs, and quite old. There wasn't even a input for a DVD player. The flatware was a bit cheap, but there was plenty of it. The appliances work, but could stand to be upgraded. Overall it was a nice and economical place to stay. I would be hard pressed to find somewhere as nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly nice place. Unplug your phone right away.”
Reviews.Author: Paul X
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 2012; my wife and 3 teenagers, my parents stayed in another unit. My youngest was traveling with his high school team for baseball, the older two wanted to go to Disney parks. My father and I wanted to go to some spring training games when my sons team wasn't playing. Found this online because we wanted location, condo/kitchen/space and flexibility. Place was great -- clean, modern and much nicer than I expected. I travel for business and stay at higher end hotels, and this compared well. What was great and unanticipated was the amenities on site -- tennis and basketball courts, pool complexes, and multiple restaurants that were great for dinner out with multiple generations. Teenagers loved it. Large property but well contained and no problem with the 13 and 16 year old boys walking at night to arcade etc. Close to Disney, and Braves spring training 5 minutes away, Astros 10 minutes away, and Tigers (lakeland) 30 minutes away -- my personal favorite. Lots of chain restaurants and t shirt shops on 192, but better off with the decent on site restaurants.. Only drawback is the pitch for time share. I read about this prior to coming so was prepared. I declined the offer of a sales pitch despite the escalating offers of free stuff (coupons for food) and the check in girl became increasingly pushy, intimating she might lose her job if she didn't sign me up; she told me she "had" to charge my credit card $30.00 anyway (not true) and politely declining was not successful. I then flatly refused, no matter what (she then asked if I had financial difficulties or was at risk of bankruptcy...) and after 15 minutes got my room key. The next day, robo-calls were made every 20 minutes to the condo offering a sales pitch from 8 am on. After an hour of this we just unplugged all the house phones, and had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Property”
Reviews.Author: Pooh_Bear_2012
Reviews.Content: We visited during the day to go through the sales presentation and did not stay at the resort. The pool and running river were beautiful and people in the complex seemed happy to be there. We were shown a very small part of the property and only what they wanted us to see, but it was well kept and attractive. We agreed to the presentation for a price break at another Holiday Inn. If you are made uneasy by sales pressure or pushy salesmen, this may not be for you. We were seen by no less than four salespeople, but were mostly treated with respect. Salesman one was pleasant, salesman two was very pushy, salesman three was the charmer, and the final person was the last ditch effort to purchase something. It was three hours instead of the advertised two. The terms and conditions of the sale sounded complicated enough to us that we were not comfortable signing. We asked for literature to take with us that we could review and we were told, "no." Unfortunately, that was the deciding factor for us not to sign.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: SunshineOtt
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort, this week was very crowded and hard to find anywhere to sit at the lazy river. We were on the main floor and backed on to the air conditioners so you could not sit on the patio, not ideal, still enjoyed the condo. There is a lot to do here, nice quiet pool at East Village, the beach area doesn't have swimming but does have water sports. target and publix are close by. We stayed in the East Village. Overall, very happy and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on ground floor of East Village”
Reviews.Author: nannacallie
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 2 bedroom unit on ground floor of East Village. We spend a lot of time on the patio or balcony any place we vacation in warm weather. There are a group of 6 air conditioners located about about 2 feet from the end of our patio and another 6 about 6 feet from the other end. When one was running it was annoying; when 3 were running we couldn't even hear each other speak. The noise would echo in the patio. The morning after we checked in I called guest services to voice my complaint. A maintenance person checked out the air conditioners within an hour. However, they were running as was expected (I've never heard such loud air conditioners) and they couldn't change it. I continued to make phone calls and after about 4 hours we were given a different unit on a 3rd floor. It was very nice with a good view of the golf course and a pool. The pool was never too crowded. There were always an ample number of lounge chairs. This is the largest resort I've ever seen. Bigger is not always better. It is a resort geared for golfers. There are a lot of golf cart paths, but no walking paths or sidewalks in East Village. Walkers walked in the road. I would only stay here again if I was guaranteed my unit would not be on ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family vacation in the East Village!”
Reviews.Author: nmm9217
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews we were a bit skeptical as to how the resort would be but were receiving a huge discount from a friend who transferred their timeshare to us. We stayed with a total of 9 people including my parents and inlaws. Check In - We checked in at 11am and they had our room ready hours before the normal check in of 4pm. (I did call a week early and have put a request in. They couldn't make any promises but it seemed like several ppl were doing the same thing). Check in was quick and easy. They did give you a voucher that they wanted you to redeem which of course is the time share pitch. We simply handed it to them and said no thanks. No pressure, just was told I wouldn't get the water park discounts. We weren't having any parts of the timeshare. East Village Rooms - our 3 bedroom villa in the East Village was in a high rise on the 4th floor. We walked in and the room was immaculate. Yes the tvs aren't flat screens but the room was very large with the rooms each separate so everyone in my large family had their own space. I am used to staying in 5 stars, very modern rooms whenever I travel but couldn't afford that for a family of 9 this trip and was still quite happy with the accomodations. There was one bug we saw the entire week by our front door in our room and let me tell you, it is Florida and homeowners see atleast one a day. This isn't uncommon. They do provide dishes, toilet paper, paper towels etc. However we stayed a week and with a large family by mid week we were glad we picked up additional papertowel etc bc we ran out. No maid service. You can choose to pay $30 a day for them to simply come in and change trash and replenish towels or you can wash the towels yourself with the washer and dryer which was easy enough for us. Also, from our balcony we had a view of disney fireworks each night. They were a distance of course but you could see them. Oh and beds were fine with the exception of the pull out couch. I am pregnant so I bought a cheap $30 memory foam to bring and leave when done just to be safe but i really didn't need in our room. Smell - so I was afraid of the reviews on this especially near East village. 2 out of the 7 days of our visit we knew what they were talking about but it is not nearly as bad as what ppl say. It was so mild that you maybe noticed it for a second when you walked out of your room and forgot about a minute later. Almost like a hint of that new mulch smell we hate. We laughed about it since I was most worried about that. Pools - River Island is where you will want to spend most your time and its so big you can locate on a quiter side of the massive pool or lazy river or the busier side. Some tips - don't pay the $9 fee for a bracelet for tubes. They don't let you put them next to the pool when done since you can get another one with your bracelet so there are always some laying around. We pd the first day and regreted it. Plus if you have a child they get one free so we kept taking my daughter to get free ones for the family. They also have a policy you can't use your own tubes which infuriated me bc the childs tube was too large for my toddler. She used her own tube the first day at the pool and then a girl with a power trip prevented her from using the 2nd day. River Island Charges - yes everything is a charge. To go down inflatable water slide is $3 per time. My kids took advantage of the tired worker not collecting tickets and went down a few times. The food is really cheap and good by the pool and the waitresses were great with drink and food orders. (about $5 for a burger, wrap etc) which you will pay every where. We expected to pay for food etc so none of this bothered us. Drive time to River Island - it is less than a mile and walkable but it is a lengthy walk or two minute drive from River Island to East Village. Disney - all of the parks were a very quick distance from the hotel. We brought our gps from home and used in our rental which was perfect and got us everywhere in minutes. Restaurants - staying in the East Village there is a back entrance leading right to Millers Ale House, Target, Publix, Olive Garden, Bahama Breeze etc. Everything around you to access. Even a TD Bank. Timeshare Calls - yes they will call everyday. However, the second or third day they woke up my father in law and he sternly told them no we weren't interested and not to call back and our phone never rung again! Easy enough. Overall Orange Lake is a really nice, clean resort that has something for everyone! Having the resort amenities to enjoy while not visiting the parks made this vacation so much more enjoyable. Recommendation - we did Disney twice last year and once this March. We finally tried Discovery Cove and this place is recommended to all! Yes it is a little more expensive but it includes unlimited access to Sea World while on vacation and includes swimming with dolphins, They also have a huge lagoon where you swim with sting rays that were bigger than my dad. (Sounds soooo scary but it was the coolest thing we have ever done lol. I started out on my husbands back and ended up under water with them in an hour). Plus unlimited food all day and unlimited drinks - yep all you can drink beer! We would have spent the difference in one meal elsewhere. We did this on our last day which worked out perfect because they have the best showers with every single thing you need to get showered and dressed before the airport. (shamp, condi, soap, hair dryer, bags for wet clothes, clean towels - was almost spa like feel)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise at North Village”
Reviews.Author: JupiterEmily
Reviews.Content: Unit was great! Spacious, recently renovated, end unit with Screen porch, well equipped kitchen, and best of all QUIET! I was skeptical about this RCI exchange. Riding through the west entrance pass the villas, I was still skeptical. Our unit North Village, 3655 was a second floor, end unit in the back of the resort on a golf hole. Very quiet, adult oriented, great furnishings, excellent linens. Easy, quick check-in and once we got passed the cleverly worded timeshare marketing and said, "no", we weren't approached again during our stay. We could view the Disney fireworks from our screened porch. Getting to the Disney Parks was an easy 3-4 mile ride. We weren't interested in any but Epcot and were lucky enough to miss the horrible crowds at the other, more child oriented attractions. The resort offers attractions for families, golf, tennis, lazy river, restaurants that deliver, none of which we used but were available, if desired. The West entrance begins with Villas on golf courses that I thought were old fashioned but in North Village near the Legends course, the 2 story 4 plexes are much more updated looking. This resort seems to have something for everyone. The resort has shuttle buses if you wish to get from your unit to activities without using your car. My only advice is, if you are looking for a quiet stay, request this area. Hwy. 192W, outside the west entrance is lined with familiar restaurants if you want to eat out. There is a Publix grocery store outside the East entrance and a Walgreens right across Hwy. 192.

Reviews.Title: “awesome family vacation ready to book again!”
Reviews.Author: jessjax
Reviews.Content: After reading the bad reviews I was a little skeptical about this place but I'm glad I went with my gut instincts and stayed here. I wish I could say our trip went without a hitch but feel I must mention that the first villa they put us in wreaked of smoke (4022 West Village) however all it took was a call to the front desk and we were moved to unit 4285. They sent a van to help us since it was almost ten o'clock at night. We stayed 5 nights six days in a two bedroom villa in the West Village and loved every minute of it! Villa was very spacious for My husband and I plus my sister and our two year old. Two bedrooms and two full huge baths. Kitchen was outfitted nicely with washer and dryer large pantry, dishwasher and everything you need to cook all your meals there. It really was a home away from home. They provided dishwasher detergent (3 loads) clothes detergent 3 loads (so nice not to have to do a weeks worth of washes at home!) Also there was toilet paper and tissues as well as dishtowels stocked in each bathroom and kitchen. Beds were very comfortable as well as furnishings, must say again the furnishings in this unit were a little nicer in quality and age. Bathrooms and closets were more than adequate. Resort was spectacular the River Island area was gorgeous and lots to do for the whole family. Fees were not outrageous and I could see staying on resort the whole time however the Disney parks are no more than 20 minutes away. We did Hollywood studios (15 minutes) and Magic Kingdom (20 minutes with parking and all). We dined at the River Island Grilling Company and had a great meal great service and the food was reasonable. Also did the sunset celebration at the West Village Clubhouse restaurant more casual and also very good. No problems with any smell other than smoke in the first room, no issues with their sales pitch for the vacation club, I declined they still gave me my $20 resort coupon (which we didn't use), no issues with the cleanliness or comfort of the room. My only negative would be that there is only one way in and out which sometimes you have to wait for either at the gate and also you have to drive quite a bit to get to the other places of interest, pools bars restaurants in the resort but there was plenty of parking and we never had a issue.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected! Hidden Gem in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Flashg1992
Reviews.Content: A little farther than I wanted to be from the attractions. Other than that it was a pleasant stay. Especially if you need a suite/multi room place to stay. Ask for one of the newer buildings closer to the lobby. Great amenities for kids (mini golf, pool tennis water slides). Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A Vacation Inside the Vacation”
Reviews.Author: shasher_72
Reviews.Content: We surprised our kids with a trip to DisneyWorld and staying at this resort helped top the vacation where Dreams really do come true. It is a well-cared for resort, the grounds are spectacular and immaculate, the suites are spacious and clean. Everything you need is on this resort, from shopping to swimming and pretty much everything in between. It was like having two vacations in one! Crazy busy and fun Disney by day and restful and fun resort by night.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Off-site Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: TikiGoon
Reviews.Content: I head to the Orlando area almost every year to visit with my relatives and take the kids to Disney. I started staying at Orange Lake about 12 years ago. Besides Orange Lake, I have also had the opportunity to stay at several other resorts in the area and compare the location, features, unit size and overall experience. First thing to say about Orange lake is that it is HUGE and has so much to offer! There are several pools, golf courses and restaurants. Three of the pools have some very unique features. Water’s Edge Beach Club, is next to restaurant/bar which often has live music. The pool right next to that, offers “dive-In” movies. Heck the kids were even getting into playing shuffleboard, which was just a few steps from the restaurant. Splash Lagoon is a very relaxing, well landscaped twisting and turning pool with a waterfall. It feels very “back to nature.” Don’t worry still stuff for the kiddies to do. There is a water slide and fountains to run through. Now we come to the latest pool… River Island! This pool is pretty much a water park. It is huge with a large slide and a lazy river. Tube rental is extra, but not overly expensive. I recommend a car if you stay here. There is a bus system which will get you around the resort and I have used it. It is certainly the safest way to get back to your unit if you have had some of the drink specials at Water’s Edge Beach Club. The resort is not super close to Magic Kingdom, but less than 10 minutes from Animal Kingdom. There is a special “short-cut” to avoid the traffic on 192. Ask the folks are the resort, for the back way to get to AK. The resort is divided into villages: West Village- oldest with mostly two story buildings which you can park right in front of, North Village which was the second phase, still with mostly two story buildings, East Village and River Island which are the newest sections and offer more of the “High Rise” Experience. To each his own, but I like kicking it old school in West Village, though I do request a remodeled unit. The units are huge compared to most other resorts. Our stay this time was in the West Village very close to the 192 Entrance. We could walk across the parking lot to a pool, but it was not one of the featured pools I mentioned above. Pretty much, everything was great. The Unit was roomy, well appointed and clean. We were able to make it to most the featured pools, take advantage of the drink specials at the pool bar and catch a dive-in movie with the kids. My only complaint was the two white plastic trash bags left in front of the unit for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the the timeshare presentation”
Reviews.Author: Ron60713
Reviews.Content: While it looks great on the outside, our week at this resort was filled with false promises and mediocre accommodations. The condo was roomy, but we had to share it with cockroaches that came in and out through a one inch crack below the front door. When we called the front desk about the roaches, we were told - "it's Florida". They told my kids about the swimming pool with a movie theatre upon check in, but when we went there the next day learned that the movie theatre pool was closed for another month. Broken drawers in the condo, broken jets in the tub in the master bath, and the worst part no AC or heat so the condo was always too hot or too cold. We were offered discounted tickets to Disney if we did the timeshare tour. Their discount was $2 off $1,000 in tickets and included restrictions on the last day - thanks but no thanks. And did I mention we didn't get the coupon book or other free gifts they had promised. If you are considering a timeshare at orange lake resort - which is a bad idea - but if you are, they are going for as low as a $1,000 online. So don't succumb to there high-pressure sales tactics and the four sales managers (yes 4!) that they will send in to badger you. And if you already have plans to go, enjoy Disney World!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't need to leave the resort!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew L
Reviews.Content: We come here every year!! Top vacation retreat for family! We and the kids love the lazy river! Always something to do, and extremely close to Disney. In fact, you can throw a rock into Disney's Animal Kingdom property.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Trip-Orange Lake Resort Stay”
Reviews.Author: TripMaster2011
Reviews.Content: We have been to orlando twice and this was our third trip; I would have never consider Orange Lake Resort on my own but this time over my friend asked us to join them. Family oriented resort - jam packed with activities for adults and kids; highlighted activities are golf/mini golf, swimming pools in almost every area (village), game rooms for kids you can imagine the activity and it is out there. Our condo had two bed rooms with fully equipped kitchen with enough room for three kids and four adults; nothing fancy but all the necessary things are in the condo (our condo was on first floor). Restaurant's are good and staff is friendly; general store in market place has pretty much everything but if you want wide select then Publix supermarket is just outside of resort. Of my five days of vacation we spend one whole day in the resort itself and kept ourselves busy with all the activities!! Bottom line we all enjoyed our stay in Orange Lake Resort and had a great time. Hope you find this review helpful and have enjoy your stay here! Oh just one tip - this place is huge and very easy to get lost!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious for large group, but horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: THLe
Reviews.Content: Had a 2-bedroom villa. The place is clean and very spacious. The stove didn't work. 1 of 4 burners turned on and the oven only got to WARM. The dryer sounded like it was a jack hammer. The toilet had very little water pressure so even toilet paper from peeing would clog the toilet. The refrigerator wasn't very cold. All the things that people would choose this resort for doesn't work very well. I am only writing this review in hopes that hotel management would respond to me. I have reported my incident with the resort directly and with corporate and haven't gotten anywhere. The morning after checking in, I get a knock on the door around 10am. I have read reviews that this resort doesn't offer housekeeping, so I went to the door to see who it is. I see a man in uniform standing at the door, so I walked over to the living room to tell the half naked to cover up. On the short walk to the living room, I hear the door open. I quickly turned around and see that the man let himself in the room. He was shocked to see me standing there. I asked him why he was there and his answer was that we made a call last night for a broken window shade. I advised him that we made no such call and instead of leaving, he walks into the villa more. He precedes to the window and plays with the shade for a little and left. I found his behavior very suspicious and called the front desk. The maintenance people told me that there were NO calls for anything broken in the villa where I was staying. I reported the man for entering under false pretenses. The response I got from them was that they will retrain the person. HOW IS RETRAINING GOING TO STOP A MAN FROM WALKING INTO A ROOM WHERE THERE WERE 2 WOMEN AND A TODDLER SLEEPING, FEEL SAFER?!?!? I contacted corporate about this incident and I received a confirmation email stating that the property would also be copied in and someone will contact me. It has been over a month and no one contacted me. I write corporate back and I was told that I needed to contact the property directly. REPORTING WHEN IT HAPPENED DOESN'T COUNT? I believe that this property is allowing their employees to case the place when their guest are away and steal anything of value. If the property denies this, why hasn't anyone contacted me back to tell me that it was an isolated incident and that the employee was dealt with in an appropriate manner? I am asking for an explanation on why this is allowed to happen but no one given me one almost 3 months after my stay.

Reviews.Title: “a review from a guy that doesn't write reviews”
Reviews.Author: msprichsiliconvalley
Reviews.Content: This is from a guy that never writes reviews. Hope you enjoy it! First let me tell you the good points about this resort. We had a 2 bd condo on the golf course. It was huge, clean, plenty of linens and towels for our 4 day trek. Fully stocked Kitchen, Washer and Dryer and very quiet. Each room had a t.v. there was a Jacuzzi tub in the master bath. Next, they have an actual Disney employee onsite to answer all your park and ticket questions. Great Disney service. The front desk Staff was pleasant and accommodating. Good or bad, this is a cash-less resort, so you can use your room key for charging anything to your room. Now let me tell you about a few (bad) things that stand out, in order that they happened. 1. arrived on Thursday once we had our keys we were immediately whisked away to the Vacation desk they tried to get me to sign up for a timeshare presentation and they told me how much I would save on my park admission. After listening to their 10 min pitch they seemed pissed off when I told them I didn’t have time to listen to a presentation. This was the FIRST 10 min of my arrival. It certainly didn’t set the stage for a pleasant relaxing trip. 2. (by the way, I called the resort on Wednesday (the day before our arrival to ask about transportation and had to leave a voicemail and never got a call back) customer service wasn’t very good. 3. After arriving at our room, we immediately got a cab to take our family to the parks. We found a great cab service that charges $45 round trip to any Disney park. IF you are going, (and not renting a car) DO NOT USE the transportation company the Resort recommends. They are TOO EXPENSIVE (16-18 per person) and you need to give them 2 hours notice and they don’t take you directly to the Parks, they make multiple stops and charge per person. Our “taxi” service just asked for 30 min notice and did pick up and drop off at our room. The best service………call [--]. Ask for Carrie. Her and her husband Jeff run the Taxi service. 4. After 3 days of the Disney Parks we were wiped out and tried to get a good nights rest on Saturday night for our departure on Sunday. Note that Check out time was 10 AM. (I asked for a later checkout and was denied since it was a busy weekend). We are from the West coast so we were still sleeping when housekeeping rang our doorbell (twice) at 8:30 AM and when we didn’t answer (since we were still sleeping) they tried to come into our room. Thankfully our door was locked with the chain and they couldn’t get in. when we finally made it to the door we found a large black plastic bag full of clean linens and someone from housekeeping walking away with no explanation or apology. I immediately called housekeeping who apologized and connected to Guest services. After complaining about being woken up and the intrusion they offered me a round of Golf (I was leaving that day so it wouldn’t matter) or inner tube rentals at their onsite waterpark. I then asked for them to take of any incidental room charges and they agreed. $42. Overall I wouldn’t stay there for the negative reasons mentioned above. They are a Holiday Inn Resort (RCI for timeshare). You get what you pay for. This is NOT a Four Seasons or Fairmont (or even Disney) The resort is SO HUGE they have shuttle stops at various points throughout the resort, unfortunately when we needed to get on one, they were not around. The resort itself is about 15-20 min from the WDW Parks. If you can afford it and want a true Disney experience, stay at a property on site, The Polynesian, Grand Floridian or one of the resorts close. You can take the Monorail right from the Hotels and get you right into the Magic Kingdom or Epcot. By the way, if you have been to Disneyland in California, don’t bother going to the Magic Kingdom. It nearly identical except for 3 times the size (no Matterhorn ride). Disneyland is much more intimate (read: Smaller). Spend your time at Epcot or Animal Kingdom. We didn’t get to Experience the Hollywood Studios Park. All the parks have a 1 day entry fee of $85 + tax If you are going to be there multi days, get a 2 or 3 day pass. Its VERY difficult to try and see more than 1 park per day due to the distance and how much there is to see at each park, especially Epcot. Don’t bother getting the Park Hopper Option. Save your money and just get the multi day pass. The park hopper option is only good at the Disney Parks in California since they are right across the promenade from each

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: schmite
Reviews.Content: We have owned at this resort since 2005. We go down in February for Speedweeks in Daytona. This year we stayed for 10 days. We have never had any problems. Every year, yes, they do try to get you to go to the sales pitch. However, we tell them we are very busy and have every day of our week planned and they are not pushy. The first 2 mornings, we did receive a few phone calls. However, we just chose not to answer the phone. We love the pools. They are always clean and fun. The condo we stayed at this year was in the North Village. I find the master bath in the North Village are larger. These also have patios that are screened in and are on the 9 hole walking golf course. We golfed this course during the night under the lights and had a fabulous time The only issue we had this year was the shuttle service. On Saturday night, we had to wait 45 minutes to get picked up at River Island. After 25 minutes of waiting, another group came out of the restaurant to wait with us. After hearing how long we had waited, they went in to have a waiter call it for us. This was at 11pm. The signs say the service goes until 12am. The Sports Bar at Legends was fun. We went there for a few drinks. The atmosphere there is like a sports bar and casual. Overall, we love this resort and look forward to going to it every year.

Reviews.Title: “Family get away”
Reviews.Author: suzanne w
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights last weekend in a 3 bedroom villa. We were suprised at how aforadable they were. Very roomy & nice. We went to Disney while we were there & it was only 10 minutes away. It was a great alternative to the pricey Disney resorts, but still had a lot to offer on site. It was too chilly to swim but the lazy river looked inviting. I will say though, check out is at 10 which we felt was a little early. Then the maids started ringing the door bell & knocking on our door at 8:30am asking us if we were checking ou and what time to come back. We were still sleeping so we were pretty upset to wake up to that. They obviously knew it was our check out day because they didn't come the other days! And yes, we were checking out but not until 10! It was ridiculous. We felt like they were rushing us to leave. Overall though we plan on going back but making sure to let the maid service know not to bother us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: beeweex4
Reviews.Content: We are a larger family, 2 adults and 4 kids so finding an affordable, roomy and clean place to stay is a job on its own. We were beyond shocked when we drove through the gates to check in. This place is amazing! We stayed 5 nights at the River Island complex which is fantastic. The lazy river is great and even with the amount of guest in the resort the pool never seemed over crowded. This is a "cashless" resort so I was worried about all the extra charges we may have but the prices we so reasonable! There is so much for everyone to do that no one should ever be bored here. They have a Publix just down the road which is great for picking up your groceries. The shuttle bus is a bonus. Our room itself was spotless! spacious and had everything we needed for our stay. All the staff work hard and are beyond friendly. My only wish is that this resort was closer to home as it was so enjoyable and would love to be back more often.. Keep up the fantastic job guys!

Reviews.Title: “It's Got It All - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: CinHow
Reviews.Content: We opened the door to our 3 Bedroom/3Bathroom Villa and said "WOW"...It's a luxury apartment, clean and we had everything we needed to enjoy our week stay with our family. The property is beautiful, the restaurants are superb.They have 3 shuttle buses to take you around the property. When we checked in, the time share appointment people greeted us with offers; when we hesitated to take a time share (no obligation) tour.They sweeten the pot to $100 for only a 90 minute tour. We took the tour, what 90 minutes? It was 3 hours of sales pitching and they worked us over with 4 people. Beware - They have a hard time taking NO for an answer. Other than this and some Internet connections problems for our iPad. We enjoyed our stay very much. We highly recommend this Country Club Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Space”
Reviews.Author: aronam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three day stay at this "vacation club resort". We like to stay at condo rentals more than hotels for the space and convenience they offer. Two adults and three young kids in a hotel room is never much fun! For the price we paid ( about 120.00 per night) it was acceptable. We stayed in a two bedroom with a king and two queens, non-smoking, in one of the East Village 5 story buildings. If you're looking for posh accommodations you will not be satisfied here. We had a couple of minor issues like a kitchen drawer face falling off and the master sink drain lever not working, but for a place to crash with enough space to stretch out after a long day at the parks, it's acceptable. I should add that I did not notify the front desk about any problem so I can not comment on service. I noticed that There were plenty of service people around, so I'm sure they would have responded to a request for repair had I cared. There were televisions in every room and, while they were from the last century, they were quite sufficient for our needs. They could use a couple more kids channels in their cable package. Free wi-fi was an appreciated amenity. I will say this, the place was CLEAN! The room doesn't come with daily housekeeping service but my wife mentioned that you could call them if you needed something like towels. As I said, we were looking for convenience. This location IS that; there's a Publix supermarket at the front entrance with most of the major restaurants, and several good locals, within a mile or two. The entrance to the Disney resorts is about four miles down the highway (Rt 192) with Universal and SeaWorld about ten miles. At the price we paid this is a bargain compared to Disney property rates. We live in Tampa and have stayed at all the "luxury" Disney properties". This place is better than any of them and you don't have to spend a small fortune dining out! We were here to do our youngest daughter's 5th birthday at Disney World ( her wish) There are MANY other amenities in the resort and they seem to charge for all of them but we didn't use any. The golf courses looked pretty nice but I don't play golf. I read a couple of reviews here complaining about the timeshare sales pitch. There's an easy solution to that, when they offer you money to sit through "a short presentation", decline the offer. Personally, I appreciated the great effort my "greeter" put into to trying to get me to "add fries to my order". It's his job and I was happy that he was trying to do it well! If saying "no thanks" makes you uncomfortable, practice a few times before checking in and you'll enjoy the experience too! If you're like me, and you're not planning on spending all your time on the property, but are looking for a nice place to get more space than a hotel room, I would recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean big rooms - close to Disney and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Valerie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an RCI exchange week just before Christmas - we LOVED it! We ended up buying and after we returned home we bought some more points/a better week. It's clean, rooms are large and well equiped, it's 10 minutes from the Disney parks and a main road that takes you easily to Orlando and other main Highways. We loved the resort, all the pools, the Starbucks on location, mini golf, the lazy river, shopping - you could go and stay at the resort. We stayed in the West Village in a villa on the ground level, the grounds were very well kept, we could see the fireworks from D.W from our room! Loved it! We did not really do many of the kids activities, only the breakfast which was not Disney characters but the kids still thought was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: DaddyWhalen
Reviews.Content: We rented a suite in the West clubhouse for a two day stay before a cruise. The room was very clean, and everything was new and nice. Free Laundry facilities on site. Beds were comfy, and the room did not have that musty, humid smell many Orlando properties have. The best part of the resort are the pools & grounds. Everything was like new. After spending our first evening at a pool, our 3 boys voted to skip Disney the next day to enjoy the other pools. One of the best decisions we have ever made. We spent a memorable day enjoying the lazy river pool, waterslide, and water volleyball court. We stayed on site for dinner, ordering pizza from the resort that was really good. The only "con" we encountered was the dreaded timeshare salesman. I was approached by a very pushy woman seconds after I checked in, who did not want to take no for an answer. I was firm and direct, and the entire encounter was less than 60 seconds. Don't back down, just say no and you'll be fine. Property is really close to Disney, and plenty of shopping & restaurants are nearby on 192. Enjoy your trip to this great city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place -rough sales presentation”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: We went as a promotional deal, we got an awesome deal, but had to go through the sales presentation -- Great Resort, better if you have a family I think. As a couple, we just didn't need all the pools and activities. The sales presentation was a stressful four hours - by the end, they tried to sell us everything under the sun. We didn't buy, thank goodness, because you can find better deals from owners that want to sell. However after sitting through the presentation and talking to four different people, you start getting brainwashed and think you are crazy if you don't buy something - The price kept just getting lower and lower; they were quite desperate to sell by the end of the four hours and of course they said we had to make a decision right then (I don't know about you, but making a $10,000 dollar commitment on the spot - don't think so). Somehow we got out without buying, although I was close to having a nervous breakdown from exhaustion. We were glad - later that night we talked to someone who owned one that said you can always buy from an owner for cheap and that the maintenance fees can get expensive- don't get fooled into thinking that you can't get a better deal because you can. The resort is beautiful. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants, but the drinks by the pool were reasonably priced. We also don't golf or have kids, so we really didn't need the amenities they offered. Our villa was very spacious and we enjoyed the kitchen, however I prefer a hotel with a small kitchen for just us; but again for a family it would be nice to have all that room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay but....”
Reviews.Author: Ronni T
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for at least 10 years and this is the 1st time I stayed on South Magnolia Drive. Don't stay at on this street!! The back of the condo is right in 192 and the noise from the traffic is so loud at all hours of the day and night. Then about every 15 minutes or so there is this God awful loud shrieking whistle noise. When I asked what it was I was told about a year ago they insulted a pressure release valve right outside that area. I have liked staying here in the past but if I was to come back I would have to make sure I was nowhere near this street.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mijayati
Reviews.Content: We were in a 2-bedroom in East Village, and we had a wonderful stay. Huge rooms, comfy beds, washer and dryer in the unit, and a screened in balcony to boot! We wish we hadn't planned every second of our five day stay at either Disney World or Universal, because there's tons to do right there at the resort - a waterpark, miniature golf, walking trails, tennis courts, a myriad of pools, and a PGA-rated golf course. We will plan a couple of days extra to play at the resort itself next time. We did have dinner sent up from Breezes restaurant, which is on the property, and the food was tasty and the service prompt. Definitely coming back!!!!!!! Warning: The timeshare pushers are fierce here. Avoid the transportation booth - that's where it starts. Fortunately we had a car. We told the lady who walked up to us that we wanted to squeeze in a visit to Magic Kingdom before it closed and ran away from her. They called daily, but we never picked up the phone. They do call and give updates to what's going on at the resort, but they leave messages. Just walk away from the salespeople and NEVER pick up the phone and you'll be fine!

Reviews.Title: “First Class TimeShare”
Reviews.Author: patknj317
Reviews.Content: We have been owners here for 15 years and try to visit every year. It just keeps getting better and better. Grounds, rooms and ammenities are amazing! Can't imagine a better place to be! We were in the upgraded Signature Collection units and were treated like royalty! Four golf courses, numerous restaruants, bars, and three pool complex areas that are way more than just pools. You will not be disappointed if you spend any time at Orange Lake Resort.

Reviews.Title: “We are not owners”
Reviews.Author: Bob0409
Reviews.Content: We stayed with some friends who are time share owners. The accommodations were great. Everything was ready for us when we checked in, even though we were there early. The condo was right on the golf course. We golfed, relaxed and had a great time. We had a problem with family back home and they were more than happy to help us even though we were not the member/owners. They could not have been more helpful. What a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort, especially for families!!”
Reviews.Author: JerBob
Reviews.Content: Since we are Platinum members of the Holiday Inn Priority Club program, we were invited down for a four day/three night weekend for $100.00. We decided to take advantage of it and came down. We found it interesting from the start that they tried to separate the resort from the Holiday Inn Priority Club program when "convenient"; but when advertising or referring to it, always came back to it and the Holiday Inns system of motels. Regardless, the two bedroom suite (they call them villas) was on the 6th floor of a building in the East Village on hole four I believe of the Legends course. It was entertaining just to have hot tea in the mornings and watch the golfers come down the fairway through to the green. Since we are golfers, we had a lot of empathy for them!! Interesting to see though how much etiquette golfers have forgotten over the years, especially regarding golfers being on the course with people behind them waiting to hit. The tour was interesting and although my wife and I already own a timeshare program, we just weren't interested in this one. We did however refer them to a family with two boys that would love this property, but they didn't want to listen to that nor take their names or references and add them to their "visitors list". It was kind of sad. Our guide, Laura, talked quickly and I think knew she needed to get her spiel in quickly within the two hours as we were walking at the end. As do all timeshare tours, we were approached by three people "after" Laura to make sure there wasn't anything they could sell us. The property itself is very well maintained. Beautiful golf courses that I would come back and play and the rooms were very roomy, and well maintained, well equipped, and well adorned with all of the conveniences of home including ample silverware, and supplies, as well as TV's in each room and a DVD player in the family area. We were surprised that they hadn't updated the TV's to flat screens, but I guess they figure that's the last thing folks should be there for. The primary pool and kids playing area with water slides and such (River Place) with a lazy river, etc. was VERY nice and would entertain kids for hours I would think! One can tell that the property is really designed with kids and families in mind!! Even though this was the case, our room was still very quiet and peaceful all weekend. We will go back if we ever have the chance!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Wdrob
Reviews.Content: My wife, 23 month old and I stayed for a week in a 2 bedroom condo in the East Village over looking the golf course on the sixth floor and couldn't be happier overall with the value we received. We booked a JetBlue vacation package that included a 2 bedroom suite for a week at Orange Lake. Our East Village condo was a short walk to the River Island where we spent most days. Our son old really enjoyed floating around the Lazy river. We had lunch twice at River Island Grill on the patio and were happy with the food including the children's pasta and grilled chicken. I had the burger twice and enjoyed it both times. Our unit was well equipped with a whirlpool tub, two baths with walk-in showers, washer, dryer, dishwasher and all the necessary cooking utensils. The resort provides one highchair and one crib at no charge. We ate in most days in the unit and were able to get all the necessary groceries just outside the gate at Publix and Super Target. Unit also had a DVD player and we caught up on some movies that were able to rent at Publix for a dollar or two per night. We choose Orlando and the Orange Lake Resort based on value. We did not attend any of the parks other then spending an evening walking around Celebration and another evening in Downtown Disney. We attended Celebration Community Church on Sunday, a non-denominational church about a 10 min drive away. Service was very good. After reading the reviews we avoided the timeshare sales pitch and ignored the phone calls. Overall, we were real happy with our stay at Orange Lake Resort and may go back. It was a great spot to get away from the cold in Canada and relax with the family for a week for the price.

Reviews.Title: “We really like the Holiday Inn Club Vacation system..!”
Reviews.Author: D S
Reviews.Content: We started to use our Holiday Inn Club points for both RCI and Holiday Inn Club properties. Bottom line, this has been a great value for us. We are able to make last-minute bookings, and Mon-Thurs stays to extend our points, etc. We have turned our fixed one-week timeshare into greater than double the value (based on night stays). There is a significant difference between the Holiday Inn Club vs. other travel clubs. Mainly it is the flexibility in using your points (such as RCI and other partners). We have stayed at the resort in Orange Lake for many years and do not have any regrets. The only thing that can get annoying is the "updates." As with most timeshares, they want to continue "selling" you more points. We just have no need for any more points..! We have taken several mini-vacations and still have last year's points. Skip the update, unless you have time to burn and want to get some discount tickets or cash back. It will cost you at least one hour of sales pressure that you may not want to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “What a great vacation....all except the inital attack”
Reviews.Author: Stang32
Reviews.Content: This was a relaxing and fantastic vacation, after we escaped the sales staff once and for all. I made a mistake the first day in being too kind and that was a big mistake. I approached the check in desk and began the process of getting our keys. After the brief check in was finished, they directed me over to another counter where they showed me all these discounts I could get if I took a tour of the property. Whenever someone tells you they want 45 minutes of your time, RUN. The 45 minutes tour took over 3 hours - all with a 14 month old crying baby. I realize they are there to sell you a vacation rental but to put us through 4 or 5 people who hold you captive after saying NO over and over was really annoying. After that horrid experience was over, we had a wonderful vacation. We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa which was perfect for a family of 5. It was clean and very comfortable. It was safe to go for walks around the resort but we needed to hop in the car for a 4 minute drive to the main waterpark area because we had 3 small kids in tow. The pools were fun and not overly crowded even though we were there at March break. The poolside bars and restaurants were very reasonably priced and we relaxed in the warm sun while sipping on our drinks. We would definitely stay there again and will know to avoid any discount tickets offered. That's the only reason I didn't give it a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful about booking vacation package”
Reviews.Author: PhilippeBougard
Reviews.Content: On January 2012, as I was making some Holiday Inn reservations, I was offered a 6 days 5 nights package valid for 1 year at Holiday Inn Orange Lake for $499 with attendance of a 2 hours sales presentation. I asked if there was any black out dates and was told the price was valid at anytime over the next 12 months. The $499 was charged to my credit card and I received two emails on January 28 sand 30th confirming my reservation and inviting me to call to choose the dates. Today, Sunday February 19, I called Holiday Inn to make reservations starting Nov 18, 2012 and was told that there was an additional $99 fee for that week. When I told the agent that it has never been mentioned in neither the 2 e-mails received or during the original conversation with the agent who charged my credit card in January, he said that he was sorry but could not waive the fee. When I asked to talk to his supervisor, I was told that he was busy on other calls and call back in 15 minutes. I asked instead that his supervisor calls back when he is available and was told that they only take calls...they do not place outbound follow up calls! I am stunned that a chain like Holiday Inn would do such misleading packages and then they to extract more money from you when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the timeshare sell”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: We are more than pleased with our villa and general location to Disney and shops. However the timeshare people need to appreciate that when you have been travelling for 18hours with children, the check in process should be quick and not the time to sell.

Reviews.Title: “Great property close to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Timeshareman
Reviews.Content: This property was amazing. We visited it an were impressed about all the great features and how close it was to Disney. The property has all kinds of thing to do aswell from golfing, swimming, watersports, and even miniature golf. Anyone who gets a chance to see this property will fall in love!

Reviews.Title: “Take the bad with the great”
Reviews.Author: 1yummymommy
Reviews.Content: First, be aware this is a time share resort so you will be asked if you'd like to get "free" tickets (tickets to their onsite lazy river, or possibly other venues). You can always just say no. We've stayed here before but this time, immediately after we received our keys, we were directed behind us where someone was hovering to convince us to listen for 1 hour to presentation and then we'd get tickets to their resort ($200 value) for free. This time, we figured we could do it (we said no at our first visit). OMG the presentation the next morning was 2.5 HOURS long and despite saying no, they kept bringing us different people to offer another deal and each person got more and more pushy, sadly, we learned we shouldn't have been so nice to first guy. That may have stopped it right there. Now our place we stayed was a 2 bedroom condo and was fantastic. It made the whole thing worth it bc we were there for 4 days after our cruise. The other major complaint was that at the Village where the lazy river is, we were floating along and my son was sliding along the edge of the pool and he almost put his hand down on a RAT!!!! Not a mouse but a rat. When we complained we were told that has never happened but it would make sense bc they like to live under bridges. Whatever. Luckily our condo was way over in another village so I didn't get all weirded out but that rat fact didn't seem to phase the time share guys. Still a good place and we'll probably return. I'd just insist on room in main building or get condo. great location too with all amenities nearby or even onsite. Target, grocery, Starbucks and many restaurants nearby (car needed)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cabanaboy3
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say I would stay there again. The cons are the place was not very clean with a huge dead bug on the kitchen floor on arrival. The refrigerator needed serviced because there was ice and water in it when I arrived. I cleaned the refrigerator and the ice and water on bottom of the unit was back in a few days. The toilets in both baths ran. The sales pitch on check in was a joke and the man was dishonest. He wrote figures on a sheet of paper saying how much I would save on Disney World tickets that were very high and when I said I was not interested he would not let me have the paper. We bought are tickets at Disney and saved the sells pitch on the time share. The condo was very nice and located in a safe area.Even with a few negatives I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “BIGGER IS NOT ALWAYS BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: Smile923
Reviews.Content: Vacation dates 2/5/12-2/12/12 - Bigger is not always better. The sales people and the check-in people kept repeating that Orange Lake is the largest planned timeshare resort in the world. This place is so large that you need a car to get from one place to the other! I had to drive to the gym, to the barbeque grills and to the restaurants. We had a three bedroom unit in the East Village. The unit 86716 was nice and clean but the furniture is older and there are no flat screens in the unit. The unit did have plenty of windows and sat on a golf course (beautiful view). The only problem with the interior is that the beds were not comfortable around the edges. If you sat up on the edge of the bed for an extended period of time the back of your legs ached and you get a large indentation. I noticed the same thing on all the beds, but fortunately it was only around the edges. The beds were okay aside from that. The other issue I had which turned into a real sore spot was that there is no convenient shuttle service in the East Village. I had my dad (67 yrs) on vacation with my cousins and my boyfriend. We can usually leave my dad on his owns to explore and get a meal, etc. We did not this time because he would have been stranded. Almost everything is too far to walk too. I have stayed at dozens of resorts over the years and never experienced such inconvenience. We could not take the car and go too far because we needed it to get around the resort. I cannot figure out why the shuttle stops are so far and few in the East Village!! This is something Orange Lake needs to rectify!! I have been an owner at Westgate Resorts (Interval International) and Summerbay Resorts (RCI) 13 years. I would never trade my weeks to go to Orange Lake again. I prefer convenience and free activities when I can get it. You really felt that being a non-owner there was a serious disadvantage. You also have to pay for all of the activities. I called for a bicycle rental and found out they had none. But you can rent a bike from an outside contractor for $70 for three days (owners and non owners). The pontoon boats cost $110 an hour for owners and $120 for non owners. They nickel and dime you to death for everything then slap you in the face with inconvenient shuttle service. If you love golf and are on owner here you will have a magnificent time. They only allow owners or friends of owners to stay in River island the nicest newest section of the resort where everything is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Janius E
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the beginning of February Enjoyed every day. Our 2 bedroom/2 bath villa in the West Village was in excellent condition-very well maintained. The kitchen was well equipped and we got a decent amount of soap for the dish washer and washing machine. There was a washer and dryer in the kitchen. Beds were very comfortable and the second bedroom had two DOUBLE beds (and plenty of space). Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Anthor Great stay at orange lake”
Reviews.Author: Greg D
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. 2 bedroom condo was very nice. Had everything you need to make it your home for a week. Even had a teflon frying pan which is rare in a condo. 4 golf courses. 3 pool complexes 1 with a giant lazy river. Publix right outside the gate. There are multi restaurants on site they specials each night. They also have their own pizza delivery. Disney is a quick 10 to 15 ride just hop on the toll road it's only $1 no traffic that way

Reviews.Title: “Utterly depressing rooms”
Reviews.Author: HistoryLvr
Reviews.Content: We are curently staying in a one-bedroom in the clubhouse. Our stay is Feb 4 - 11, 2012. This is the most depressing room I've ever stayed in. It's completely interior with no window to outside. The only window is to an interior atrium area so you cannot even see outside from the room. The furniture is old and dirty. I counldn't stand the thought of sitting on the sofa so we covered it with a blanket we found in the closet. The carpets are so shabby and dirty that I would not go barefoot in the room. I did go to guest relations and tell them that I am very disappointed with the room and its shabby condition. It is really not better than an extreme budget motel. Guest relations offered to have someone come in and shampoo the sofa but other than that they said there is nothing they can do. Also, the bedroom in the 1-bedroom units is right beside the door to the hallway. You can hear everyone walking, talking and shutting their doors in the hallway. It is also quite easy to hear your neighbors in the rooms nearby. Bring earplugs or you'll never get any sleep! We had been looking forward to this vacation for a long time. Our trip has been good - everything aside from this 'resort'. I recommend that you stay away from this "resort" if you want something better than a budget hotel. It is marketed as a resort but it does not live up to the marketing hype. Also, when you check in there is a lot of pressure to attend a timeshare sales presentation. We did not attend but had to go through 10 mins of high pressure at the check in area before we could actually get on with our vacation. They gave us a coupon for $20 to use at the resort as a 'thank you', but we found out the coupon is useless. It's only good if you buy a full week's worth of activities within the resort, then you can get $20 off of that price. Very misleading!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, secure, comfy but a little over priced.”
Reviews.Author: kaydayAlabama
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Cute tropical decor. Spacious. Lots of amenities. Away from downtown. A bit overpriced but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but was misinformed”
Reviews.Author: Dawn33
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay as an owner, we received a deal if we booked a studio we were upgraded to a one bedroom. We were given a one bedroom clubhouse is the west Villiage. When we booked we were told it was the same as a one bedroom villa just in the main building. That we would have a full kitchen and washer and dryer and a closed in patio. Well that was not so. I was very misinformed when I booked. I had a good stay but I would have liked to be told exactly what kind a villa I was getting instead of getting there and being disappointed. The unit would be better if the bedroom was not when you first walk in, you hear all the noise and doors slamming from the hallway. We did see a studio unit and these room had the beds further in the room and the noise from the all way seemed less bothersome. Other than the issue is being misinformed by the booking person. We did enjoy our stay. But will probably never stay in the one bedroom clubhouse again. I put up pics of the unit for anyone interested. The unit has a kitchenette. A fridge that would be found in a college dorm with really no freezer space. There was a two burner stove no oven but a microwave and toaster oven. One four cup coffee maker. There was dining ware service for four and a dishwasher. The bedroom had a kingsize bed. The bathroom had the shower/tub and sink vanity in one room and toilet in a small other room. We were there from a Saturday til Wednesday so it wasn't that bad. It served our purpose. But if it's for more that two adults this unit is not for you. There was no outside window in our unit our one window was a view of the downstairs indoor area by the recreation center. I love the two bedroom villa in the west village and will be booking that again in October. Any questions please feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape from Cold, Northern Winters”
Reviews.Author: calicogobye
Reviews.Content: We stayed in #2476, a 2 BR, 2 BA villa in West Village. Although we are Holiday Inn Club members, our home base is at a different location. This was our first visit to Orange Lake, and we loved the well-maintained, spacious grounds and the privacy of a roomy villa. Our reservation was for 2 weeks, but I could have stayed longer. West Village is perfect for retirees wanting to escape cold, northern winters. The villas are ground level and parking for the car is just a few steps from the front door. The villa seemed to be older but appeared to be recently refurbished. Maintenance requests were handled promptly. The kitchen is well-equipped with a full-size range, refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, and washer/dryer. There are cabinets for food storage above the laundry area. Paper products are provided, along with coffee for the first morning. Sliding glass doors led to the rear patio from both the living room and the master bedroom. The bathrooms are small, but all other rooms are large. A heated pool was a short walk away. The pool and hot tub enclosure held an ample supply of lounge chairs and tables with umbrellas. The pool towels are small but adequate. There are 2 more pools near the West Village Clubhouse about a 15-minute walk from the villa. If you want an even larger pool complex, you can take the shuttle to the beautiful River Island. North Village and East Village have pools, also. This resort is huge. We wasted the first few days at this wonderful resort trying to find fault with the place. Why? We attended a “member update” on the morning after our arrival. It was not a good experience. We chose not to accept their proposal and left the meeting with bitter feelings. I recommend that the sales presentation be scheduled for later in the visit, after you have an opportunity to enjoy some of what the resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Only go for golf or stay away - very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ljhelm
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week's stay.Very disappointed with the concept. Too large requiring driving to get anywhere. 4 sections divided by a highway. We were in a 2 bedroom unit in the western section. A pool there but everything else cost money. Even the fishing pole. We drove to the river area and they wanted $9 per person per day for a tube rental. These have always been free at other places. We went through the sales pitch to get 10% off our food. The 60 minute presentation took over 2 hrs with 4 sales people. They don't like to hear 'no'. We did not get the coupons as promised either. The ones we got were useless. This place is for golfers only with 4 golf courses - 2 18's and 2 9's. No sidewalks except for the one main road. No walking trails. Claim to have 9 restaurants but in reality there are 2 with 1 sports bar and the rest are where you can get a premade sandwich or order a pizza. Would not stay again. The quality of the kitchen cabinets was poor with the laminate pulling away.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with room”
Reviews.Author: Shari A
Reviews.Content: We reserved a one-bedroom unit in the River Island area, which is the newest area of the resort. The room was very small with a bad odor - suite hotels are much larger and nicer than this unit. The "balcony" was a screened area with two chairs (it's all that would fit on the balcony) overlooking the parking lot. The furniture was uncomfortable with stains and scratches - my sons college furniture was in better condition. We left the unit shortly after we arrived to go to the pool bar and had not complained about the odor at this point. When we returned a half-hour later there was someone from housekeeping in the room who said the people in the unit before us had complained of a bad odor. We went to the reservation desk to inquire and were told there was a note on the room that said bad odor reported.....and they put us in the unit anyway! I have to say the kind gentleman at the reservation desk, Pablo, found us another unit which was a two-bedroom and we were happy with the resolution. The bed pillows are the most uncomfortable pillows I have every slept on. I ended up folding a blanket from one of the beds to use as a pillow. I ranked service as average because of the room issue on check-in and the service at the River Island Grilling Co was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “No Time Share for Us”
Reviews.Author: slovak
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful property, I'll give it that. We had found a rate of $73 per night and my husband is a Platinum member. They greated us and thanked us for our status and gave us a free bottle of wine. Now for the sales pitch, 20,000 points if we went to the one and a half hour presentation. We said no thanks, we were there for only 2 nights. The room was near the River run and a beautiful one bedroom suite complete with washer and dryer. Now it was a bit confusing finding it as it is a very large complex. We unpacked and then got a telephone call that we were only there for one night and had to move the next night. My husband told them we weren't moving and nothing happened the next morning. On our last morning our doorbell was rung by the maid at 8:30 asking to do the room. Now on vacations we like to relax not leave at the crack of dawn. We were up but not ready to be answering doors. We loved the River Run which was just behind us. If we were into golfing it would have been a great place. I don't think we'll be back but that has more to do with not wanting to go back to Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This place is huge!”
Reviews.Author: dbfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We booked a short 2 night stay at the Orange Lake Resort following our cruise in early Feb 2012. At about $120/night for the unit - figured it would be a nice and affordable way to finish our vacation. First impressions - amazed at how big this place is! We pulled into the first entrance (wrong), and drove all the way around the resort to the registration center. Wow! Hundreds of units, spread around golf courses and ponds. Very attractive. Found the registration office, and was helped by an extremely friendly employee. Was able to check in at 10 am (normal check in at 3pm!). Was directed over to the (time-share) desk, and after a very brief discussion, exited without getting roped into a tour. Simply tell them you do not want to do the tour.... Arrived at our unit - a 2 bedroom villa in the West Village. The villa was spacious, with entry into the kitchen area, that connected to the dining room and family room as part of an open floor plan with high/peaked ceiling. Kitchen was nice - full sized fridge/freezer, newer microwave and stove, dishwasher. Kitchen was even stocked with dishwasher powder, dish soap, a couple coffee pouches, several coffee filters, etc. Washer and dryer in closet in kitchen with a couple detergent boxes. Nice dining room table as well as breakfast counter provided plenty space for our group of 7 to spread out and eat. (We grocery shopped at the Publix just off the property.) Family room had a ~40" flatscreen samsung with cable, a couch, loveseat and chair surrounding a large coffee table. Worked well for the kids to spread out and do homework. Master bedroom with very comfortable king bed and pillows, second bedroom with 2 queen beds, each room with a bathroom attached. Each also had a tv. The bathrooms were the only area of the villa where the unit wasn't outstanding. Just not perfectly clean and showed a little more age than was noticeable elsewhere in the unit. Perhaps the newer units are better? The master bedroom and family room each have sliding doors out to a large patio facing the golf course. Patio table and chairs made for nice lunch outdoors. Up close and personal visits from 8 sandhill cranes and a few egrets was cool! And the pool areas....! First, there are several different pool areas, situated in the various "villages". We spent time at both the Water's Edge and River Island pools. Water's Edge has two pools and a large hot tub, many lounge chairs, and is surrounded by other activities (arcade, mini-golf, restaurant/bar, etc) - very nice. The River Island area is huge! Lazy river is very cool - with or without tubes (for rent). Water slides and large pools attach to the lazy river. Restraunt/bar, shopping, minigolf, rockwall, trampoline/bungee jumper.....lots to do. Oh, and the water at all the pools is maintained at 80 degrees - very nice. We have stayed in Orlando many times, typically renting a private house for a week, with our own private pool/hot tub, bedrooms, kitchen, washer/dryer, etc. The Orange Lake Resort rivals renting a house, providing many of these benefits. Obviously not private...but the multitude of other activities on site and affordable price make it a nice alternative to a house. Again, our only suggestion for improvement is cleanliness of the villa's bathrooms. Thanks for a pleasant finish to our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Despite all the negative reviews.... we are so glad to have come here... IT'S A FIVE STAR IN MY BOOK.”
Reviews.Author: ckmdudette
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed every minute at this resort. After reading some of the reviews, i was worried that it was going to be dissapointing, but instead, we have been really, really, really pleased. Check in was very easy. We were quickly greeted by many employees. Will at the front desk checked us in and was able to give us a 2-bedroom in the West Village. The West Village is their older resort, but our appartment was renovated. We found newer appliances: stove/oven, microwave, dishwasher,refridgerator, washer/dryer and all the dishware/cookware needed. Nice beige granite counter top. Our appartment was able to accommodate up to 8 people: one bedroom had a King bed, the other was a 2-queen size beds and the living room had a pull out bed. We especially loved the fact that our rental car was parked right outside the appartment... litterally 20 steps away. This made loading/unloading very easy. It also guaranteed a close parking spot to our appartment. This resort is enormous and it required us to drive if we wanted to go to the pools. Orange Lake has 7 pools (I think) which are all very beautiful. There is free shuttle service that will take you from one location to another. Be aware that the resort itself is 1400 acres of land but only approximately 30% of it is currently being used. You will find the best pool at River Island which is another another section of this HUGE resort. River Island has 2 pools and a lazy river connects the 2 pools. You are welcome to swim in any of ther pools in this resort, but if you want to use a floating tube for the lazy river at River Island, you will have to pay for the floating tubes. The resort will not allow you to bring your own floating devices. The pool is nicely heated to a comfortable 80 degrees and there are lots of places to sit. If you want, you have the option to rent out cabanas for $125. I think in the cabanas you will find comfortable sitting and a refridgerator. The resort has many restaurants for families to dine, a great agenda of activities for adults and kids, and a few little shop. There are tennis courts, racket courts, gyms, basketball courts..and more that we probably did not see. The location of the resort is great, it is surrounded with familiar stores like Target, Walgreens, and Publix (just a few blocks down). There are also many places to dine outside of the resort that are minutes away: Applebees, Olive Garden, Bahama Breeze, Orlando Ale House, and Chick-Fil-A to name a few. ..... Finally, you are probably wondering about the TIMESHARE presentation that was given. Yes, my husband and I attended it. We were told that the presentation could last "60-minutes or more," and I can guarantee you that it will probably take A LOT longer than 60 minutes. You have the option to say no to this presentation at the front desk, but we could not pass the 7-day unlimited hopper pass to Universal Studios and Islands of Advanture for only $109 per tickets. The sellers at the Timeshare presentation are not aggressive but they will go through the loops of bringing multiple sales person to the table. We were passed down to 3 different sales person, each one giving us a better deal. If you are no interested in buying their timeshare and wish to not waste anymore of your time... just be firm and say no. We actually enjoyed it because these presentation provides more information to be better timeshare owners. Well, hopefully you found this review helpful. I would recommend it to anyone including my close friends and family. I know that we will come back to this resort again and again to enjoy all the activities and the theme parks. ENJOY YOURSELVES! =)

Reviews.Title: “complete review”
Reviews.Author: texas463
Reviews.Content: Before we left we had read almost all the other reviews, so I will comment on them as well as our experiences. The resort is huge with three areas West, North and east villages. We stayed in the west village on the top floor of a 2 story 2 bedroom bungalo. The north village appeared to be getting re-vamped when we went through there.The east village is where the photos are of the lazy river and waterfalls. The eastvillage semed more condoish and the other villages more one or two story bungalos. Each village has pools and kids areas with the east village having the newest looking and most kids stuff. Our room was great, slept my wife and I and 4 kids aged 12-15 just fine. There was a back balcony that looked at nothing, but trees and swamp. The room was not perfect and had some wear and tear, but was clean and certainly large enough for us. Our room dryer broke down while we were there and it was replaced the next day when the repair man could not fix it. You do need to rent a car while your there if you are there for Disney and Universal studios. The shuttles to the parks are about $18 per person. They are not worth it. We took a cab twice (my wife had the rental car on bussiness) and it was under $20 (total) from the animal kingdom and $23 to Epcot including a decent tip.There were cabs right there leaving the parks, but we waited about 50 minutes to get picked up from the resort. With a car there is everything nearby. many restaraunts, publix, walgreens ect. all the Disney parks are nearby, and Universal is about 1/2 hour away. Do not bother with the park hopper ticket, you can spend a full day in each Disney park. Do get a 2 day (both parks ticket for universal) you will need two days to see it all. Note get a plastic parka outside the park for the Universal water rides and take them with you, you will be glad you did. On other peoples comments: The beds were just comfy. There is a charge for almost anything extra at the resort, We we did not use or do anything at the resort because we were getting home late every day. The kids did go swimming at both East and West rsorts and actually liked the west one better although the east resort certainly looked much nicer. the water was warm and towels were provided at the pool, no need to bring room towels. we could not smell the animal park,but could hear and see the fireworks. There were messages on our machine everyday for the timeshare presentation among other things, but it was not hard sell. we declined and that was that. The staff was very good and proffesional The pizza on the resort was 2 larges for $20, good-deal good pizza. Never made it on the golf courses as this was a kid/family vacation, but the courses looked great and I sure wanted to. Unsure of the green fees, Bring your clubs if you can. T.V.'s are older tube type, did not care, we were gone all day. Kids watched a bit of t.v. before bed. Never saw any bugs (January though) bad things, Dishwasher was absolutely terrible and the shower water pressure was very poor as well. some wear and tear, baseboard bashed up. Overall it was not perfect, but for the six of us it was all we needed, I would definetly recommend this for a family/Disney vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Rachel T
Reviews.Content: I loved the this hotel, they had kitchens in all the rooms and they had a lake and several golf courses. This hotel is a must when traveling with the family, it is spread out on big acreage. This hotel is not far from all the theme parks. It is very relaxing place to stay. Recommend when in the area to stay at this location!

Reviews.Title: “Always my favourite”
Reviews.Author: jburstonGloucesterUK
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are going to Orange Lake for a week on 18th February and this will be about my eigth and her seventh stay on four years. We just wish we could do more. I have been more than happy to 'buy' extra points/weeks knowing that the service I receive will be hard to be bettered. Yes the 'sales' staff are 'pushy' and can be obnoxious but they are no different to sales staff the world over. They have to live. As for the rest of the staff I cannot speak highly enough of them. I actually suffered a stroke whilst on holiday in March 2005. My family and I were booked in just for 1 week, but the staff immediately arranged for my wife to extend her stay whilst I was in hospital. Indeed, when my hospital stay extended to a third week, even though they had no vacancies the staff spent their time after work trying to find alternative accomodation for her. In the end they had a cancellation and reassured my wife that whilst I was in hospital they would ensure she had somewhere to stay.
