Also whilst I was in hospital they ensured that taxis were always available to run her to and fro, and they even negotiated a substantially reduced rate with Mears on her behalf. When I came out of hospital the taxi dropped me off at reception as apparently the staff there wanted to ensure that my wife and I received such assitance as we required. They were absolutely lovely and there were a few tears shed. To cap it all they never 'charged' me for the extra weeks reassuring us they were more concerned that I got better and my wife's stress levels were kept to a minimum. In October, 2011 my partner and I took several members of her family with us. All they now talk about is 'when are they coming again'. And this is not the first time. we brought out family members in April, 2009 and 2011 as well as friends in September, 2010 and they ALL adored it I have stayed in all 'levels' of accommodation from the 2 bedroomed villas to the 3 bedroom 'Signature' collection apartments. My only complaint is that I leave it too late to book, and due to the popularity of the resort cannot always get the accommodation I want, but have always been happy with the standards of the accommodation. If you want a 'busy/active' holiday there is plenty to do both on and off the resort. if you want peace and quiet it's there as well. I have actually arranged for my daughter and her fiancee to stay there as part of their wedding present and my daughter, who has stayed there many times, cannot wait. There will always be faults if we look for them, but Orange Lake, I have found. will always try and sort out any problems. Indeed, when my partner and I visit in two weeks I intend to sit down with a vacation counsellor to arrange our future stays here and at the other resorts in the 'Orange Lake family'. And before anyone asks No I am not an employee of the resort. I am an accountant from Gloucester England - so feel free to websearch John Burston

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious, and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: missmia
Reviews.Content: We had a 2bedroom 2 bath unit, with a full kitchen, it's own entry, parking spot, and patio area. 3 flat screen tv's, and free wireless. It really took care of all of our needs. I traveled with my husband and 2 young children and my teenage brother met us there half way through. We had a king size bed with our own bathroom. in the master bedroom and and two queen beds in the second room, as well as a pull out sofa bed. It was very clean and comfortable, the full kitchen came in handy for keeping and preparing quick snacks, and storing our food that we bought at the nearby walmart. We bought food from restaurants in the area and brought it back with us and ate it at the full dining room area. We also went for pizza within the resort, the price is very reasonable, although not the best quality of pizza, it did the job. The place is huge, and the pools were always nice and quiet, not over crowded. I did not like that you have to pay for every single activity available, I think this should be included in the price of the stay. The location is great, we rented a car and drove out to the Disney Parks without a problem, overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “In agreement with all past reviews”
Reviews.Author: acey2000
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this resort 6 times for a total of 50 nights in the past 2 years. We do not own a timeshare in the resort, we book through Holiday Inn website. Here are the good things: Large complex with lots of pools and various activities. Gated entrances and security is better than a hotel. Lots of grocery, dining, and big box stores close by. Close to Disney. Here are the bad things: It seems as like overall quality is slipping. Maintenance of the units has been spotty. We have not been in a unit that has not required various fixes. The appliances in the units we have been in are over 12 years old and were very bottom of the line when they were purchased. The formica countertops and plastic coated cupboard doors are delaminating and just falling apart. Our units have been very dirty, the carpets are filthy with many stains. Tops of cabinet doors in kitchen are covered in grease and dust. Blinds, curtains, and furniture are extremely dusty. All of the units that we have been in need a deep cleaning. The full dishwasher cycle runs for more than 2 hours and does not clean the dishes. The smell in the air emanating from the animal waste at Animal Kingdom was overpowering and not tolerable during most of our 10 day stay. We drive our Suburban to the resort and bring a large Rubbermaid tub of cleaning supplies to sanitize the unit before we unpack. Our family also wears socks the whole unit, With regard to the timeshare sales pressure and survey requests, walk straight out of reception after you check in and the minute you arrive to your unit, unplug all of the phones. The staff goes out of their way to be polite, but when it comes to addressing a complaint or fixing a problem....good luck. Receiving department and front desk lost an overnight package that was sent to me and found it 10 hours after it was delivered to the resort. We have been repeat customers of the resort because the units we have been in are better than a 10 X 20 foot hotel room that has not been really taken care of either. The units do have full and usable appliances if you can tolerate the age and condition of them. The weekly price has been fair, not cheap by any means, but not affordable. The resort recently added a “resort fee” for $7.95 per day which is just cash in their pockets because didn’t pay this fee prior to our most recent stay. If you are a Holiday Inn Priority Club guest, regardless of status level, do not expect any special treatment or upgrade. As Platinum level members, we have never been given anything.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Share12345
Reviews.Content: We have owned here at Orange Lake since 2008. There is always someone in our family using and enjoying it. There is so much to see and do. Never enough time. The rooms are large, clean and well stocked. We love the lazy river (my personal favorite). The Grilling Co. has a great assortment and we love the idea of cashless. It's the only way to go. We went to five theme parks and many more places but always made time for our home base Orange Lake. We stayed for 12 days and wished it was longer. Went to a meeting. Yes they are long but it works for us. We converted from the week plan to the points. It's much more flexiable. Now we are going to Hawaii with our points and the great exchange program. I find everyone to be friendly and helpful. It's a large purchase so we did ask alot of questions and got all our question answered. If your not happy people just ask that's what they are there for. I now have something to leave my Grandson. He has been here and loves it. No regreats!!! Great job Orange Lake. Hang in there. I'll be back. M from Lynn

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: baaaba
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Orange Lake and have stayed here numerous times. We just returned last night from our vacation and are disappointed in our stay. At check-in we were given the opportunity to sign up for an owners update meeting, we understood that this was a sales pitch to try and convince us to switch our week into their points system. We were told it was an hour long meeting, but having sat through these before we understood that most likely it would go longer. The salesman who came over to help us was named Randall. He explained that he was not an employee of Orange Lake but instead contracted out to talk to individuals like us, who had a timeshare that was paid for in full but had not yet moved their week to points. He assured us that we would not have anyone else come over to talk to us because we were "veterans" of this process and therefore he would be taking care of everything. It is amazing how kind the sales team are as they are attempting to sell to you, and how quickly it changes once they realize you are not going to purchase anything. After his pitch, my husband and I said that we weren't interested in purchasing anything. Randall then had to take a call from his wife, and sent in someone else to offer us a new deal. It was such a scam! I told the next person that we were not interested in changing anything right now, once again this person became rude to us. I told him that one reason we will not put in anymore money to Orange Lake was because how rude they became during the presentation. Yesterday as we were packing up ready to go, my brother could not find his camera, we lifted the mattress up to look for it and saw this HUGE wad of dark black body hair lying on the box spring. I can't even begin to say how disgusting that was, to know that it had been there the whole week. My husband mentioned it to someone as he checked out and they said "oh ok", no one seemed to care. As current owners I am not sure if we will return to Orange Lake. I do know we won't be purchasing any upgrades to our current plan because of some of the experiences we have had at Orange Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Cautious Stay!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PPWA
Reviews.Content: We were given a timeshare presentation in 2008. However, I will never buy into anywhere, nor anything without experiencing staying first, so we got an extension of the offer. We stayed for 1 week in January 2012. The 2 Bedroom 2 Bathroom villa assigned to us, as this is the type of unit they were trying o sell us, was definitely not what we were shown back in 2008. This villa was old with some very old amenities, in the East Village which felt like the very back of the property. I promise you that if this is what was shown to us in 2008, we would not have wasted our time to extend, as we simply were not impressed by it. We did not even unpack our clothes, and insisted to be moved. They reassigned us to the 81000 building at River Island. This room still was not what we were expecting, however, we decided to stay in it. I believe they treat prospective owners and owners different from regular paying guest. We had absolutely no housekeeping service for the entire time we were there. If we wanted the service, we would have to pay additional for it.....WOW!!! I do not believe the room was properly cleaned and checked before we went in. The curtain rod in the living room was broken off, thus not allowing us to pull the curtain. Neither did the venition curtain rolled up. So we left both curtains closed all the time. I spilled some drink in the kitchen, but could not find a mop in the villa to clean it up. I had to use some paper towels to do the job. Also, the resort in all of the numerous communication I had with them prior to us arriving, did not mentioned to us that the entire property was a "cashless" property. So if you do not walk with enough credit on your credit cards, you will have some real challenges, even if you have more than enough cash. Unbelievable!!!!! They refuse to allow us to pay with cash during our stay. However, I can setting my bill with cash at checkout.....WOW!!!! One thing I thought was funny, was that the television screens in the main lobby, were all nice flat screens, however, the bedrooms we were in had small regular tv sets. The staff is courteous and helpful to some extent. You can see some of them trying, but I believe they can do much, much better. I would encourage anyone going to this resort, to ensure you ask many pertinent questions before you get there, and ensure you get the responses in writing, so you can show them what you booked. This will definitely help. I do not think I will go back to this resort in the future. Obviously, we did not buy the timeshare........

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Iretiredat55
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time staying at Orange Lake and this time there were 9 of us on this vacation. The resort catered to many of our needs incuding the large 4 bedroom unit that accomodated all of us. Even when the main pool at the River Island complex closed for 4 days (winter maintenance) we had no shortage of things to do right here (3 more pools and areas to use.) Some people have said the timeshare presentation was off putting but then you can say no to it so keep that in mind when you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Twice and Enjoyed Both Stays”
Reviews.Author: stevenjlacy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Orange Lake twice. Once in September, and another time in December. We have enjoyed our stays both times. The biggest draw to us is that the units are well furnished, updated, and have all the amenities we want. We travel with children, and space is important to us, which is also a plus here. We have stayed at a number of resorts in Orlando over the years, and this is one of the better ones. Some of the reviews have commented on the aggressive sales tactics here, which I would agree with. But , I have found that to be the case at almost every resort in Orlando, so it is not unusual to Orange Lake. One drawback to us at times was that the resort is so large and spread out that you feel compelled to drive to other amenities, such as the pool, workout room, main recreation center, rather than walk. However, that is a plus for joggers. Overall, a good resort. Good pools for the kids, good workout facilities, decent golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Bentley777
Reviews.Content: Stay away from the timeshare presentation.4 hours of my life I will never get back.Left a sour taste in our mouth fot the rest of the trip. They do not let you out of the room until you have said no to 6 different people all offering a better pricie than the person before. They take you by a golf cart on a tour of the property,but bring you to a different building about a mile away from where your car was. If you do not purchase they make you take a shuttle back to your car. Do not waste the $ 40 per person to purchase a pass for the slides and tubes, not worth it .We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, which was only ok.It was clean but not plush like other timeshares we have stayed.Stayed there January 7-14

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room to spread out”
Reviews.Author: Imonthego
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed four nights here on our trip to Disney. This is a nice resort for families that like a place to spread out and not be on top of each other in a room with just two queen beds. We stayed in a two bedroom two bath villa in the west side. The unit was clean and nicely decorated. There was even a washer and dryer as well as a fully stocked kitchen. The one thing that I was a little unsure of was the fact that they do not have daily maid service....the room is clean upon arrival and not cleaned again until after you leave. You do have the option of having it cleaned daily for an additional charge if you wish. It didn't end up being a big deal other than I wasn't crazy about having to take out the trash :-/ The resort is very large and spread out. This didn't bother us because we were only there to do Disney World....and it is very convenient to the parks. As for the timeshare stuff...when we checked in, the lady at the registration desk gave me the card keys to the room and also gave me what she said was a twenty five dollar gift certificate to use for credit at some of the places there at the resort....she said the lady standing behind me would validate it for me. I asked her if this credit certificate was tied to a timeshare presentation in any way.....she said yes....so I handed it back to her and said that we weren't interested in doing a timeshare presentation. She nicely said she understood and took it back and we never heard anything else about a timeshare. I read some of the past reviews of this property so I also knew that they would try and call our room and leave messages.....so we simply ignored the phone altogether. This was a nice resort....I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend for Epcot's food and wine fest was great!”
Reviews.Author: girli565
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa with 8 adults and 2 children. The villa was spacious, had more than enough room and bathrooms for all 10 of us, and was conveniently located. There was a Target and Publix across from one entrance. We stayed from Oct. 21-23. The weather was cool so we didn't use the pools. Our villa overlooked a section of the golf course and a small pool/play area. The parking at our villa kind of lacked because it seems like there was one space for each villa and we had four cars and pretty much took up the whole parking space available in front of our building. I joined the holiday Inn priority club and was able to use the club line when I checked in, thank goodness because the regular line was PACKED! We walked right up, checked in, and were walking back to our car within 15 minutes. Joining the club is free so i suggest everyone do it! I was not aware that there was no cleaning service daily so I had to call for towels on the second day. The trash bins were difficult to find but we finally did. Also, beware of the animals around. A HUGE bird that walked on two feet was blocking our doorway one night and would not leave. It snapped at us and took half an hour to move on. Finally, on the first night this very drunk man repeatedly knocked on our door and would not leave. We had to call security and they never came. The man finally moved on but not after knocking and yelling at our door for close to 20 minutes. Overall we had a nice time and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible horrible horrible x100”
Reviews.Author: Mdm_Travelalot
Reviews.Content: Do not bother, try another place. This resort WILL try everything in the book to rip you off. We stayed there on a family vacation from Dec 17-27. Why we would rate this a place NOT to go: Had multiple things billed to credit cards 4 days before they had the card. The room when we got there did not have some of the beds made. Every single day we were harrassed by sales calls on our condo phone -- our favorite was at 8:30am on Chrtsmas day. Just a crappy experience all-round.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for older people”
Reviews.Author: AlegreteRSGuga
Reviews.Content: I , my husband and my son stay there for a week from January 8 to January 15.The houses are wonderful they have easy access one story, they have lights all night, they are very clean.I just notice that they have to renew the TV sets from the room they are old not LCD or plasma.And some details like the batteries for the remote controls.They supply detergent for the washing machine and dish washer.The wi-fi works well and they have a business center where you can print and use the computer for some cents for minute.They have a arcade which my son loved.If you want a housekeeper you have to pay 25 dollars.Be careful with the phone even if you use a 1-800 you have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Good condo, substandard service.”
Reviews.Author: laceylala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for five days and nights. The two bedroom two bath condo had a nice layout but was dusty as if housekeeping hadn't come in beforehand. The pullout sleeper only had sheets, no blankets. My daughter got sick at 1am and threw up all over the bed and I was told that we'd get new ones sent over.They didn't arrive until 9 am, a little too late. We agreed to do the 90 minute time share spiel and ended up staying over 3 hours. This was fine until the end when we finally decided we weren't interested in the program. The guy got really aggressive and irritated and essentially tried to bully us into it. When he called me "mommy" and told me to calm down I was DONE. Three other guys and offers later we were able to leave. I would call it predatory lending - no credit check, bullying and 16.9% apr, not even allowed to see the book of places or even allowed to see fine print unless you want to sign up. Even if you ask over and over. There were communication errors all over between the staff -two people called to confirm us giong to the time share presentation, then them telling us and my sister two completely different things in regards to when to show up and with whom. The resort is really really spread out so there is an up and downside to it. They close the pools at 10 which is kindof a bummmer but livable. On the good side the location to Theme parks is absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake Resort is "Beautiful"”
Reviews.Author: bquan_9
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort in September 2011 for my daughter's 4th birthday....could'nt afford Disney :-(( I read almost every review, good and bad about this resort; so I will try to give you my honest opinion: Check-in: We booked our stay through an owner(this is a time-share property) We arrived and were directed to the owner's check-in which offered soda, coffee, water and snacks free of charge as you check-in... Yeah, they try to sell you on the resort, which is absolutely lovely, by the way and they do offer discounted park tickets and credits to use around the resort for going on their "Tour"...and although we declined at check-in, they did call the room quite often...easy fix is just turn your ringer off! The resort is lovely, well maintained and very family-friendly. There were quite a few young people working around the pool area who were not very friendly, but we chaulked it up to "teenagers being teenagers". The lazy river is at your backyard if you stay at the River Island section. We loved River Island! It has everything from shops to dining to bungee to mini golf....Overall the staff was friendly and very attentive. For the lazy river pool, tubes are nice, but they do charge you daily for their use. We purchased the fun pass for 35 dollars that included mini golf, bungee, tubes and other amenities that we were not able to take advantage of. The bartenders at the pool were very friendly and you could put your drinks on your room key or pay cash. The restaruants were exceptional... we dined at the one at River Island and it was "Outstanding" and the price was not ridiculous. Our condo was beautiful and clean and stocked with everything you need. They included some complimentary detergent for laundry, dish soap, coffee etc., I can't speak for the other condos on the property, but we drove around the entire property and it was beautiful! Oh, that's another thing...they have a free shuttle to get you around the property, but we rented a car, so we never took advantage...but if you want to leave the property to go to the grocery store or anywhere off-site, you will definitely need a car. Overall, I highly recommend this resort whether you are visiting Disney/Universal or just visiting Orlando; there is so much to do at the resort, you never have to leave the property! But we did DisneyWorld for my daughter's 4th birthday, and spent very little time at the resort...We have stayed at many resorts claiming to be four star, but I would have to say that this is truly a four star experience...great stay and we will definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Condo, East Village Stinky at Night!”
Reviews.Author: bunnycrawford
Reviews.Content: We checked in today. Our condo is fabulous! Clean, updated, conveniently located. It looks like the pictures on the website. Check in was quick and easy, we just ignored the line to get our $20 gift validated. A girl did follow me to the ticket desk and get the voucher from me. We bought our disney tickets in the lobby to avoid lines at the park tomorrow. The lady that helped us was awesome! We left the property to go to dinner and when we arrived back around 9 pm and the smell was overpowering! I read about the smell on the reviews but I thought people were exaggerating. They aren't! It's bad! But, it's only outside. Overall, this place is great! We won't be here much and aren't planning to really swim or anything, so the smell won't really bother us!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for longer stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Thadd_969
Reviews.Content: The property was beautiful, the suite was huge and very clean, it had a kitchen and there were free laundry rooms. It would be a great place to spend a week. There was lake with a beach, 2 pools, golf, mini-golf, and all that space. Not as fancy as the Grand Cypress, but in my opinion a better value.

Reviews.Title: “West Village Villa”
Reviews.Author: Hockey123mom
Reviews.Content: The villa was spacious and very clean. We did get the timeshare invite upon registration (resort employees stand there and run over to you right after check in) but we declined and also did not answear our phone every morning. There is lots to do on the resort and they have kids menu $5 at all restaurants. The resort is close to all the disney parks and sea world. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “West Village-older units and long and annoying sales presentation”
Reviews.Author: Dee746
Reviews.Content: This is our first time at Orange Lake, and I was looking forward to a great vacation. We booked thru RCI and were told, "you're going to love this resort." We've been here two days, and things are not starting well. We walked into our two bedroom unit and encountered an overwhelming smell of clorox. Since my sister has a lung condition, we called to complain. She was told there was nothing the management could do but send someone over to spray another chemical. The housekeeper who arrived stated it was evident that too much clorox had been used. She said the only thing she could do would be spray another scent that might prove more annoying than the original. She advised my sister to air out the room and sleep on the pullout sleeper in the living room. When we opened the window, there was no screen. This morning we were going to fry a couple of eggs for breakfast, but there was no frying pan. There was also no broiler pan, and the toaster was broken. I called housekeeping and was told they had no idea when someone would respond as they just entered the info in their system. When I asked if we should go out for breakfast, housekeeping responded that we did not have to be in the room for them to come in. The frying pan showed up after our breakfast of soft-boiled eggs. The man who brought it explained broiler pans are scarce and there are none in stock as they are not buying any. He did replace the toaster. We had booked in for the timeshare sales presentation which was listed as only lasting 60 minutes so we left around noon. As we left the unit we noticed weatherstripping hanging off the top of the doorframe. The sales presentation lasted three hours and consisted of visits by four different people, the first three of whom were entertaining and the last, someone named "Mike" who was simply annoying. Although I explained we were not going to purchase and my sister was a 77 year old diabetic who needed to eat something (The "light refreshments" listed for the presentation turned out to be coffee) Mike said, "Will that be MasterCard, Visa, or American Express?" apparently thinking he was quite the card. Finally, he directed us to the exit, pointing out that we needed to stand outside and wait for the shuttle to take us back to our car as the first salesperson had brought us to another building. Apparently, the modus operandi in sales is isolate them and keep them until they buy something. The resort grounds are extensive, and the units are spacious. There appear to be a lot of activities. We are here for awhile. If the experience improves, I'll update this narrative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo for a visit to Disney & Universal!”
Reviews.Author: SuzAnnakin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa from 1/2/2012 till 1/10/2012 for a visit to the Disney & Universal Parks with our 3 kids. The villa was very nice, spacious, and super clean. There is a Super Target and many restuarants 5 minutes away, Disney Parks are 10 minutes away, and Universal is 20 minutes away. Great Location! The resort has tons of amenties including super cool pools, putt putt, and rock climbing wall. Everything you would ever want! This place is a great value for your money and we are recommending it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with condo ammenities”
Reviews.Author: wheresheroams
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay here in the "club house" portion of the hotel. The small kitchenette was sufficient for us - we just bought frozen dinners from the Publix around the corner to heat up in the microwave. The "suite" was nice - in that it had a separate mater bedroom from the main living room and eating area. Price was very good as well. Super close to Disney - about 15 min or less, though being January it wasn't high season. We did not sign up for the time share sales pitch, as we had limited time and did not want to waste 2 hours feeling uncomfortable and pressured. They were a bit pushy, but not completely obnoxious. I didn't listen to any of the messages that came up on the phone - just ignored those. The grounds are very clean, and there is a small market that sells some groceries and supplies at slightly higher prices right on site. The pool is beautiful and heated. We never made it to the lazy river. My one HUGE gripe though about this trip however was filling up gas for the rental car near the airport. The price was nearly DOUBLE the normal cost - nearly $6/gallon. The rental company wants a receipt saying you filled up within a certain radius of the airport - which is total price gouging. DO NOT fill up near the airport. Fill up by the hotel, then top off at the gas stations by the airport. This is completely ridiculous in my mind, that a gas station can charge that much more than the norm purely based on location.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable stench from Animal Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: GISguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake Resort from Januray 1st to 6th, 2012. This resort is great in terms of facilities and things to do for kids. The location is also good, with a Publix grocery store right at the resort entrance. The two bedroom villa we had in the East Village was beautiful, spotless and huge with a screened-in patio. We had previously stayed at this resort a few years ago and I remembered them constantly calling our room to try to get us to do the time-share tour. However this time we only received one call from their guest relations people wanting to do a 15-minute survey. I told them I didn't have time and for them to call again the next day. I then disconnected the phones. Problem solved. We didn't have any other issues, but on the morning we left, when I opened the room door at 7:00 am, the stench from Animal Kingdom (whch is next to the resort) almost knocked me down. I've never, in my life, smelled anything as nasty. So would I recommend this place? Depends on which way the wind is blowing.

Reviews.Title: “Lot's to do with your kids”
Reviews.Author: patsashl
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 children arrived at around 9:45pm to check in. The front desk staff were helpful and pleasant. Our kids were getting hungry so we were anxious to get something to eat at one of the restaurants but were advised that all the restaurants closed at 10pm so we were going to miss out. We should have packed some food or snacks to get us through til morning but poor planning on our part. Thankfully the front desk gave us some pizza places off site to order in from to which we did. We had a large pizza delivered right to our unit door at about 10:45. After checking in we were directed to the "sales" desk where we had the option of signing up for the sales presentation the following day. We did sign up with the intention of not buying anything but wanted the "rewards" for sitting in on the pitch. The rewards included buying 2 days at Disney at a slightly reduced rate which included a 3rd day at one of Disney's water parks. We also received free play passes for the week (hippo waterslide, trampoline and one of the many mini putt golf courses) They add $30 to your account but it is given back to you after you finish the sales presentation. The sales presentation is your typical time share/ vacation ownership lecture that you receive anywhere else. They advise it's 1 hour but it's closer to 2. Your rep drives you around the resort showing you this and that quoting numbers and figures that you don't really understand but you continually nod your head like you're approving what they are saying. I'm sure if you were genuinely interested in purchasing, you would make it a point to gather as much informatin as you could and know what they are talking about but...we did not. We went back to a meeting room where they go in for the final kill. After you akwardly advise them that you're not interested, another team member comes out to sweeten the pot. Again, we advise them we're not biting so sales guy # 3 comes out and does his best. After we shut it down for the last time, they get the point and usher you to the rewards desk. Like I mentioned, I think this is the standard procedure in time share sales anywhere else. We always feel so guilty at these presentations because your sales rep is trying to sell you something that you know your not going to buy and we feel like we're wasting their time. Regardless, we were glad it was over. You will not find anywhere on the resort that takes cash (other than the front desk). They will take credit cards or you can charge things to your room with your room key. We elected to deposit money periodically at the front desk towards our account and used our room key to charge things. That way we were paying up front and just deducting from our account when we buy anything so we wouldn't be hit with a huge bill upon checkout. We stayed in the West village. Bungalow type building with a 2 car driveway. The unit was clean, roomy and comfortable. All condo amenities and appliances worked as they should. Our backyard backed on the 17th fairway of the Reserve golf course. We had a family of crane type birds visit our patio looking for habdouts each morning. You'll be mildly annoyed by having a flashing message on your phone everyday advising you of the resorts specials for the day. We ran out of soap and toilet paper which was quaickly remedied with a phone call to housekeeping. You are close to a Walgreens and a Publix off site for additional supplies and groceries. Some of these items can be bought on site a a slightly elevated price. Houlahan's restaurant across the street was also a great night. Transportation throughout the village is top notch. Designated "bus stops" are everywhere and the frequency of the shuttles are 10 minutes or less. They run from 7am til 11pm if I remember correctly Just advise where you want to go and the driver will let you know when you arrive at your destination. The resort has many pools. The most frequented area in my opinion is River Island. The pool and river are heated which comes in handy sometimes during an Orlando winter. Pool bars are abundant so are tubes but will cost you. Tip: for beer drinkers, purchase and hang on to the cheesy Orange Lake plastic beer glass for $8 and every other beer after that is $4. Remember, no cash. We liked the North village poolas well. It has a small waterslide for the kids. We were satisfied with our stay at Orange Lake. A great place for kids and you're a 15 min drive to Walt Disney World. We found that the customer service was good. Very pleasant, thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort/Nice Units - Too many extra charges n Rip Off Sales”
Reviews.Author: bdshaw7
Reviews.Content: I this ia a premier resort, except everything is an extra charge for just about all activities. The timeshare was terrible - everything they said was a miss statement of fact. We are a family of 7; 5 children and 2 parents. One of their top managers convinced us to purchase a one bedroom, so we could get the benefits of the club. He further stated that my two bedroom in Florida would be allowed to be exchanged for a unit in Orange Lake because we owned there. We asked him and other over and over, he assured us this was the case. We even were going to back out in closing, but again were assured that we did not need a 2 bedroom to get in to the resort. Well upon further review, when I went to try and exchange, it never worked, also the week we bought was not the top points week, eventhough he told us that the week was as good as a holiday or summer. He promised to get us a holiday or summer week, and bait n switch took place. I complained to no avail. The following year, we managed to get some sympathy, and got a two bedroom. We took the presentation to tell them about our terrible experience, they could only upgrade us and give it to us for cost - 2 bedroom week 30. Do not go on the presentation 90 minutes turns into 4 to 5 hours, and one day of your family vacation gone. Summer Bay is a better resort and less fess and not so big! I would buy there again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Scotts13
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Orange lake to visit Disney 2 weeks prior to Christmas. We stayed in the West Village in a 2 bed villa. It was clean, comfortable and suited just fine - there was plenty of space. The kitchen was well equipped and there was pretty much everything you needed. On arrival there was no check in queue which I had been dreading after a 10 hour flight from the UK with a 3 year old, and it was swift and professional. The automatic checkout system is also good - it really can't get much simpler! I can't understand at all why people are getting so "upset" about the timeshare selling - its a timeshare resort and a polite "no thanks" is all you have to do if you aren't interested - come on people!! And as for the telephone messages everyday - so what? Delete them if you don't want to listen instead of making it an issue about pushy sales staff (and lets face it they need to sell timeshare otherwise this type of resort simply wouldn't be able to offer what it offers!). Its really close to Disney but we still found sat nav really helpful for getting about to other places. There are a few of the usual types of restaurants in the vicinity of the resort so you don't actually have to travel very far if you don't want to. The grounds are very well kept too, the staff work hard to do this however, its not perfectly manicured which is great because there is lots of natural greenery and wildlife - very nice indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for Families!”
Reviews.Author: lidar
Reviews.Content: This is a very large resort split into multiple sections (i.e. East, West, etc). We stayed in a newer section in the East Village and it worked out perfectly for us, think River Island might be the newest addition. You can shuttle around the resort or walk (we chose to walk). There are many amenities (too many too list) with plenty of pools (7) and activities for all ages (including golf). Our unit was a 2br/2ba that overlooked the Golf Course. It was very spacious, had a large screened in porch, full kitchen/dining amenities, washer/dryer, full bathrooms, good size bedrooms. You can decline the time share presentation known as the "Welcome Reception" (we exchanged into the resort using RCI). I would highly recommend the resort for families and would return without question. You can see Disney fireworks from some of the rooms (ours in East Village) and the drive is about 15 minutes to Disney depending on traffic. Pros: Full service resort - many things to do (could be a con if you don't like walking), you could spend a lot of your time here vs Disney Kiddie pools / Water play area, playground, outside activities, arcade Nice accommodations (loved the screened in porch, beds were okay) Beautiful well kept grounds Washer/Dryer (dryer was slow to dry clothes) Good surrounding area / easy to get to Disney - (grocery store, target, restaurants) Cons: Limited side walks (if you choose to walk to various sections/areas) You need transportation Staff drives around in golf carts -sometimes too fast While it's close to Disney - high traffic times in the main areas can make your drive to Disney 30 min

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort...decor can be updated.”
Reviews.Author: datninja
Reviews.Content: The resort is in a great location, very close to Disney and plenty of eating and shopping locactions. The rooms were nice but the decor was 80-ish! Don't get me wrong... everything was clean and presentable. It could use an update for the cost. I was taken on a tour of the new high rise units and offered a timeshare....nah! When I first booked I thought I would be in the new high rise unit because that was where they took me to tour the rooms. I was told at check-in that I was mis-informed!?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Poppie123186338
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, it is by far one of the best locations in Orlando, the only negative thing i can say would be that the beds are very uncomfortable. The staff at this resort are very polite and curtious. Will definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space to relax but amenities skimpy”
Reviews.Author: ArlingtonVATraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at the Orange Lake Resort in Orlando. We had a 2 bedroom unit in the west village, which was extremely clean and spacious. Two adults and 3 children (2 teens and a 'tween) comfortably shared the space, though one child chose to sleep on the sofa in the living room. The kitchen was very well-equipped with all the implements you could want for basic cooking, and had granite counters. The washer-dryer was useful and worked well. Bathrooms were spacious and clean, including the jacuzzi-style tub in the master bath. The complex seems to be in good repair. We were in Orlando for a soccer tournament, so we wanted space to relax between games, and got that. If I were there for a vacation, though, I would be disappointed with the amenities. Swimming pools seemed small, and even in December the miniature golf courses were crowded. Restaurants and the Marketplace mini-mart were expensive for what they offered. The River complex pool looked fun but too small for the vast size of the resort overall. Security at the gate was rather over-zealous, but it's easy to get in if you tell them you are checking in. The architecture is extremely monotonous, but not hideous. Friends who were also staying said the golf was pleasant but not memorable. As a place to stay, a larger-than-average hotel, it was fine. If I went there with the idea that it would provide entertainment for several days, I'd be disappointed. One nice touch was the array of starter goodies provided in the unit: dish soap, paper towels, laundry detergent, coffee. It was pricey but I'm sure a better deal could be had if you could be more flexible with your dates. Beware - they will try to get you into a sales session for the timeshare. And when you say no,they will call your unit to invite you yet again (to be fair, they offered $100 to come to the session). We were honest and said the only reason we were there was for a soccer tournament, and wouldn't want to vacation in Orlando otherwise, and they respected that and left us alone. Maybe those are the magic words? (Never a mention of a charge not to attend the sales pitch, btw.) Service was friendly and prompt - we were missing a couple small items from our unit and they delivered them promptly, and phone inquiries to various departments were answered quickly and accurately. The people working here are very friendly and helpful, and the housekeeping is excellent. The 7:05 AM shuttle to Disney cost about $20 each and was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Studio Villa in Orange Lake Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Viajero736
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time in OL Orlando. This time we stayed in a studio villa in the main building (clubhouse). The villa is excellent for a family of four, but since we were five, I slept in the sofa sleeper. I do not recommend anyone with back pain to sleep in the sofa; not as comfortable as others I slept (Marriott Cypress Harbor and Hampton Inn). Other than that, it was great. The kitchenette is small, but enough to prepared a quick lunch.

Reviews.Title: “The kids did not even want to go to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: CGSchaub
Reviews.Content: Great location 10 min from Disney but with lots to do without leaving the resort. Our accommodations very clean, the mattresses were excellent, the kitchen well stocked and the bathroom large with plenty of very plush towels. I had not been there in 18 years and my how the place has grown but the staff is as helpful as it was when the place was smaller. The amenities seem never ending. The kids went to Sea World and loved it, but opted to stay at the resort rather than go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: HHbeachgoer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bdrm unit in the north village early December 2011. The unit was nice; clean and welcoming but the customer service sadly has really tainted my opinion of Orange Lake. We had a member of our group take ill on our incoming flight and as a result , our plane was diverted. Another member landed on a separate flight and checked in alone ahead of myself, and I am the RCI exchange member. Understandably, she was upset and flustered at check in awaiting news from us at the hospital. As she was checking in, she gave her credit card for the security deposit and was quickly booked into a timeshare tour. She would be charged $30 if she did NOT show up for the tour. When we arrived later that evening, I was going through the check in paperowork and came across the timeshare papers. I had rented a car to drive from the Jacksonville airport to our resort and I needed to drop it off at the Hertz desk at OL front desk, so I thought I would cancel this while I did this. I also wanted to put my credit card down for the deposit and take my cousin's card off their records. The salesperson told me that she could not cancel the tour until she had a 'code' from our paperwork that I had left in our room. I went back to the room and called the sales staff, gave them the code and they told me it was cancelled and I would not be charged. The next morning, we got a 'friendly reminder' phone call about our tour that day. I informed them that we had cancelled the night before. The tone of our 'friendly reminder' immediately changed. She told me she had no record of that and I would be charged the fee if I did not show up. I told her again, we had cancelled and we would not be there nor would we want to see a charge for it. Afterall, is it not our vacation? She told me that she would call us back if she needed more information. We did not hear from her. Upon arrival back home, my visa showed a charge of $30USD posted December 13 2011; two days after we arrived home. I immediately called OL and spoke to the accounts department and they assured me that a refund had been issued and it could be just delayed in appearing on my card. I check again December 30 2011 and there is STILL NO REFUND! I called OL again and was told there was 'no manager on duty' and they would call me back. 36 hours later I am still awaiting that phone call. I sent an email to the Holiday Inn website to lodge a complaint and I am still trying to settle this. The issue is not the $30, it is the lack of service in dealing with a situation that was simple to fix. I will not recommend OL to anyone who is looking for a relaxing vacation with exceptional customer service. There are many resorts in the Orlando area and you would think OL would want to keep their customers instead of losing them to their numerous competitors. You lost me, and potentially others who take this review to heart or ask me where they should stay when they visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!!”
Reviews.Author: adnol
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at West Village, Orange Lake, Orlando. We, as a family, have spent many happy days at Orange Lake. We have sometimes stayed for 3 weeks at a time. When we enter through the main gate at the start of each holiday my wife always says "were home". The staff are very friendly and helpful. I would agree that the "pushy" timeshare selling is a bit of a pain. Even as owners we are made to feel we must attend a welcome party. I think that the organisation should adopt a policy of "if they refuse, thats okay". The whole Orange Lake experience is worth doing especially since there is a Applebees at the edge of the complex where you can get 2 drinks for the price of one and then walk home. We hope to have many more good times at Orange Lake over many years, thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: Angela S
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Orange Lake since the year 2000 and recently purchased privately in the West Village, I love this resort because of the amenities theres so much to do there. When we had problems with our unit such as repairs in the unit and the grounds outside they responded quickly. We did have a problem with fire ants on our patio outside when my husband was bitten. We called maintenance they came and sprayed outside quickly. The only negative aspect is that upon check in you need to leave them a credit card because its a no cash resort and they want $250 min. we refused to use credit cards so we gave them cash to put on our room card, but first they gave us a hard time this shouldn't be a problem. We use Travelers Checks not credit cards. As far the sales pitch they do hassle you, but be firm say no.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: Steve V
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the River Island location with family for a week during Christmas 2011. Good sized, clean and well fitted two bedroom apartment. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent poolside complex - plenty of space with lazy river, restaurants, cafe, shop etc. Good location for access to Disney World. No problem with pestering from sales staff (just ignore the automated telephone messages). Great weather for December !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near Orlando”
Reviews.Author: kxguerr
Reviews.Content: The resort was very well cared for with great rooms, facilities, and landscaping. The location is great as it is right next to Disney but it feels like it is away from all of the busy parts of Orlando. My family stayed in a two-bedroom unit in the East Village through an RCI Exchange. The unit itself was very clean with lots of space. The beds could use some updating but were not terrible. The resort area is very large and the pools for the East Village were not by our building. We drove by the East Village pools and they were not very big but there also were not many people there. We went to the River Island pools with the lazy river and there was plenty of room. A couple of complaints would be that they use an extremely slippery tile in the walking area that leads up to the zero-entry pool for kids and my young son fell hitting his head. Also, a lot of the pool edge is taken up by landscaping leaving only a few chairs viewable from the pool. The lazy river was great, my son had a lot of fun with all the different water features (waterfalls, bubbles, fountains) around it. We did not eat at any of the restaurants because at the entrance to the resort were many restaurants available. We also did not purchase the wristband to be able to use any of the attractions at the resort. For $50/person you can use the climbing wall, mini-golf, inflateable waterslide, and get a tube for the lazy river. We chose to just swim through the river instead. The check-in process took a while as there were a lot of people in line. After getting checked-in at the front desk, someone shuffled me over to their sales department immediately even after I said I would just like to take my family to the room after a long day of traveling. They require you to hear the sales pitch for tickets to offsite attractions, attractions at the resort, and to try to get you to take the tour to buy a unit. Overall, the resort was very nice and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: jam05Ontario
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here but this time we weren't very happy. First the pros:great pools, lots to do for families The Cons: Horrible Beds..felt like I was on a boat, whenever my husband moved, I moved. My back killed every morning. We were awoken at 5:45a.m. by their lawnmowers. When we complained we were told "this is primarily a golf resort and we need to get the greens ready by 7a.m." Guess they don't care about the guests sleeping. The automatic sprinklers woke us up the next morning. (we stayed in a villa) You could only use your room key to pay for things. We were told that each person would ask our names and room number to be sure no one else can charge things to the room. After using our key several times, we were never asked for our names except for the mini golf area. Hang on tight to your keys. As I've said before, you can't beat the pools and the activities but I can't recommend this hotel because of their rooms and their attitude.

Reviews.Title: “December 2011 Family stay”
Reviews.Author: LLwL
Reviews.Content: Dislike: The sales pitch... we know you are time share... we know you want us to buy.... we know.... Palmetto bugs and roaches found the first two days (We know it's Florida and buggy - not a huge deal). The buzzards (like 30 of them) on our building roof at all times.... it's creepy! The teenage boy managing the bungee jump trampoline thingy on his phone and tecting the whole time....those support lines HURT when stray legs hit them... watch the kids closely (as parents should also). LOVES: Many more then the dislikes - This is a great location to Disney and all the fun attractions. Our favorite days are pools days at the resort, so much to do. The pool are just fanastic. The pool side food and drinks were YUMMY. The pools were warm also... it was so nice to be able to get right in..... We have stayed there four time (non-owners) and really LOVE it. Highly reccommend....

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Inasmit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lakes North Village for a week with our 2 daughters, son-in-law and granddaughters aged 4 and 1 and we all had a great time. The service was excellent, the staff friendly and the amenities great. You don't really have to go anywhere since there are so many different play areas to keep everybody happy. We will recommend Orange Lakes to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Willory549
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of a 5 night stay in a two bedroom villa... Superb all around. Very convenient location, clean, plenty of room (we had 8 in a villa that sleeps 8 and had plenty of room). Kitchen and washer and dryer make this a no brainer. We did NOT even see pool or restaurants so can't comment on those...here totally for parks. No one bothered us at all about timeshare spiel. My husband spent 5 minutes with a guy at check in who offered us a very modest discount on tickets if we sat in on timeshare thing. We declined and that was it. Teenage boys loved ability to step outside villas and play basketball on one of the 6 nice lighted courts. Very quiet and very comfortable beds. 5 nights at 99 a night was a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: stevenssn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake the week of December 4-11, 2011. I booked the rooms through world resorts international’s Buy with Me deal, and got 7 nights for a great price. After reading the reviews, I didn’t know what to expect when we checked in, however, we were pleasantly surprised! Recommend this place for families looking for vacation rental amenities and not hotel amenities. Check-in/Check-Out No wait and courteous staff. The only criticism is the time-share tactics. The receptionist gave me the room key and $20 voucher. My family was waiting in the car, so I walked out to meet them. On my way out, the timeshare rep pounced! And when I told her that I had to meet my family, she said that I had to give her the $20 voucher back. It was the strangest thing. I knew that the voucher was a timeshare ploy, but if I knew they would demand it back if not used immediately, I would have declined to take it in the first place. But that was not a big deal because overall the staff was very courteous. After getting to our room, my husband called the front desk and asked if we could be moved off of ground level. They gave us several options and were very accommodating so overall I would rate the reception staff as excellent and the timeshare group as rough around the edges (we had to unplug our phones because they literally called us non-stop even after we picked up and said we weren’t interested.). Property We stayed on the 5th floor of the East Village. It looked like this was a recently renovated/built section because the rooms were clean with modern décor. The receptionist said that all rooms in the East Village are similar. The entire property is huge! It took about 5 minutes to drive from the reception to the East Village because of the winding roads, golf carts, pedestrians, etc. Driving through, it looks like the West Village and possibly North Village as well, are the older, one level rooms. They actually look like little houses. I’m not sure how they look on the inside, but I don’t think I would want to stay there. I like the more modern look and feel of the East village. I loved that there was a pool in the East Village and a restaurant as well. There are like 8-10 places to eat on the resort and at least 4-5 deliver until 10pm. We ate at The Legends once and the food was OK. We did not really use the amenities on the resort. We went to the pool once in the East Village. It was very quiet and cold during our stay. There is a lazy river in River Island, but we never checked it out. The property has a great location, with a Publix, Walgreens, Target right next door. Very convenient! Also, this place so close to Disney. We went to Magic Kingdom and after the hustle and bustle of getting into and out of the park, it was nice that our ride home was less than 10-15 minutes. Room We had a 2 bedroom condo. It was clean, spacious and very comfortable. The kitchen was equipped with cooking essentials, although a few pots and pans needed replacing and one burner was broken. The TVs are dated, but the living room has a DVD player which was nice. The bedroom TVs had bad reception. They have extra sheets and blankets for the sofa bed. We found one blanket had food stains on it, but thankfully the place was equipped with a washer/dryer and detergent. Overall the imperfections did not stress me because of the deal I received, but it would bother me more if I would have paid full price. I would stay here again, and would recommend this place to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A value-for-money vacation place---just find a way to dodge the timeshare sales pitch! ;)”
Reviews.Author: Mitziec
Reviews.Content: This is a great home away from home in Orlando, Florida, especially if you're visiting theme parks like Disney and Universal Studios. Orange Lake is a very short distance from these places by car. Aside from the location, the price is also reasonable (especially if you get a good deal online), the place is spacious is clean (perfect for families), and the activities inside the resort are enough to keep you busy and happy. For food, you only need to drive outside a bit and you'll see a slew of restaurants to choose from. The only thing you should remember is to find creative ways of dodging sales pitches by the employees. Do that and you'll be fine. =)

Reviews.Title: “Still Great after All These Years!”
Reviews.Author: Foodaholic5270
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Orange Lake over the last 20 years. We stayed in a villa in the West section which is where we stayed 20 years ago. The Villa did not disappoint. I read some reviews before we booked this time and was a little worried, but I found the Villa to be clean, smell great, spacious, and bug free! We loved the room it provided for us (3 adults). We had guests visit and were able to entertain comfortably in the living room. We had breakfast in the entire 7 days we stayed...we ordered in dinner for delivery one evening. Although the food was only okay, it was very convenient. The West Village is quiet without too many kids around (we didn't see any). The River Side was beautiful but I can imagine it would be crazy w/kids during the high season. Great if you have kids, but not so, if you are adults seeking to be away from them! You just need to be firm w/the sales pitch - they can be persistent. It's a minor inconvenience to put up with when you consider value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: DocAnne1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Orange Lake six times over the last four years. For our last stay, we were in the one-story units in West Village. This is the oldest part of property, but the units have been updated. The only item that needs to be replaced are some of the beds. The one my husband and I were on had a noticeable sage on one side, but the kids bed seemed fine. My parents said their bed was a bit saggy in spots. The plus with this location was easy unloading/loading and an easy walk to many resort amenities. The possible negatives are a smaller master bath with a regular tub-sized jacuzzi and a bit less square footage than the high rise units. Most the time we have been in the East Village. The units are large, nicely decorated, and well-maintained. The only down-sides with East Village are that it is remote from many resort services and there are a number of buzzards that tend to hang out at the edge of Animal Kingdom witch backs this part of the resort. I would stay in West or East Village again. The grounds are very peaty and well-maintained. They had many decorations out for Christmas, and the fountains, golf courses, etc. all combine for a nice resort feel. My kids love going to the River Grill for breakfast with "Swampy," the alligator mascot for the resort. We generally travel in December or March, and at those times the breakfast has never been overly busy. The characters have always been great with my kids and they always spend a lot of time interacting with the kids. The food has been a good quality buffet-style affair with custom omelets. Very tasty and an outstanding value at just under $10 for adults and $4 for kids. The pools are very nice. My kids love the fountains at North Village and the kids pool there is a good quite option (far fewer guests than River Island). River Island is basically an attraction. We were shoe-stringing it this time, so we did not rent floats for the lazy river. We discovered that is was quite relaxing and enjoyable to float along the lazy river even without a float. What fun! We always take the kids mini golfing and the courses are well-lit and attractive. The price went up since our last visit, but the approximately $9 for each person covers two rounds. The staff will give you a rain check if you are unable to play both rounds at the same time, so we get two days of fun. The only recreation disappointment was we rented a paddle boat to take out on the lake. It was a quite windy, and we could not get the four-person unit (just two were able to peddle) out. It kept blowing back into the shore. We were just out for about 3 minutes of our 30 minute rental and asked if we could trade to a 2 person boat for the remainder of our time in the hopes that less wight and a higher ratio of peddlers would allow us to get out in the lake a bit. The staff member told us we would need to go to the front office and get approval from an administrator to change boats. He offered to charge us for another half hour if we wanted to give another boat a try. We were, to the best of my knowledge, the only people renting at the time, so it seems like it would have been easy to let us switch. Our kids were very disappointed that it did not work, and my husband and I felt just a bit disgusted with inflexibility. Other than that, the staff were all very helpful and professional during our stay. We really enjoyed our time yet again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 4 nights.”
Reviews.Author: Memisovski
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom villa in the west village very nice. A lot of room. Did not dine onsite or use the pool. Staff at check in was nice. Made me feel welcome. Did not like the sales pitch to go to the 90 min. pres. Good prices on tickets though if you went. So if you are travling with kids and will go to the parks might be worth it to save some money. Great value and gated resort made my family and myself feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed with owners”
Reviews.Author: Joecaption
Reviews.Content: Very clean well kept grounds. We stayed in an end 3 bedroom 3, bathroom unit, it was huge, bigger then my whole house. Everything in it was new, there was TV's in every bedroom. The beds were very comfortable. And we smelled anything funny like some of the other posters reported. I did hate hearing the weedwackers and leaf blowers starting up at 6:30 in the morning right outside our building. There was a few minor mantance issues that came up but someone came within a few min. to take care of them after calling the office just once.

Reviews.Title: “Would defiantly go back”
Reviews.Author: Kevin L
Reviews.Content: My family (2 kids-9 yrs & 11 yrs) and I just stayed at the Orange Lake Resort. After reading several reviews on Trip Advisor I prepared myself for the time share onslaught. Upon check-in my wife let the representative know that we weren't interested and our vacation was short. The representative was somewhat taken back, but got the message. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and it was all we could ask for. All the necessities were within the villa, including washer & dryer, utensils etc. We did experience one inconvenience and that was inconsistent hot water. A member from the maintenance crew responded and rectified the problem. We received several follow-up calls inquiring if we needed anything further. Kudos to the maintenance crew for their professionalism and understanding. I would highly recommend Orange Lake Resort.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO TAKE THE GRANDCHILDREN”
Reviews.Author: traveler1892
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this place it has everything pools, lazy river, games, bingo, golf tennis, great food on premises. I have been bringing my grandchildren here for years from New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but lacking in the fine details.”
Reviews.Author: amlauber
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for the second week of November. We did not know what portion of the resort we would be staying until we arrived. After reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor we made a point of requesting the River Island, which was near the big pool with the lazy river. The girl at the front desk was very nice and did an excellent job of helping us. The only shock was that it cost us an extra $300+ dollars for the "upgrade" despite the fact that we did not increase the size of our room. We were warned about this charge though and chose to spend the extra money to make the most of our vacation. The room was clean and well planned, however the quality of the appliances was incredibly poor. It was impossible to get the dishes clean in the dishwasher, so plan on handwashing. Honestly though, this is not something I would consider a major problem. The major problem that we found was when we first arrived in our room, we all noticed that you could here every word that anyone outside the building was saying, even in a normal tone of voice. It was so bad that I was convinced that someone had left a window open, but after inspecting all the windows, I found that this was not the case. Again, I thought that this would not be a huge problem because the pool hours ended at 10:00 pm. I failed to consider that this poor sound quality of the walls. On one night in particular we came back to our room at about 4:00pm and noticed noise coming from the room above us. It was a rythmic thumping sound which we assumed was someone playing music, so we decided not to concern ourselves with it, hoping that it would soon end. By 11:00pm the noise was louder than ever, and I decided that it was time to call customer service. They said that this was the third complaint that they had about this and the manager had been called to talk to the people involved. Another hour passed. Still the noise remained and I called again. I talked to a new person that seemed uninformed of the problem so I explained again. They said that security would check into it. By 1:30pm the noise was still there and our telephone in our room rang. It was from security letting me know they were still looking into it. I informed them as politely as I could that I would not like to be called anymore at this hour to avoid waking my young children. Some time later I fell asleep dispite the noise, and woke at around 7:30 and the noise was still there. There was never any attempt to follow up or make things right from anyone on the staff. I now suspect that the noise was something mechanical in the building itself, because it was a consistant thumping sound that persisted for almost a full day. When we returned to our room later that evening the sound was finally gone. The rest of our stay was fairly uneventful. I can not speak for the quality of the restaurants or other facilities. After ordering two tiny mixed drinks at one of the poolside bars and being charged over $18 (the tip was automatically added) I was in no hurry to see what everything else would cost. I try not to be cheap on my vacations, but I don't like being taken advantage of. All in all, I have be far more impressed by other places I have stayed. However, this was not the worst place I have been. I don't think that I would bother going back, but if you are a sound sleeper, and don't drink (or are used to paying top dollar for tiny dixie cups full of mostly ice) then this place is not too bad. As I said, it's clean, pretty, and well located. I just had hoped for more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3 night stay - Dec 1 - 4”
Reviews.Author: ekperigin
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I started to get a little nervous...but we had a PERFECT mini-vacation at Orange Lake. My daughter was participating in a national AAU cross county event at ESPN Wide World of Sports. My husband and I already had our tickets to Disney and our short stay was on a tight timed schedule. We were able to check into our room at 1pm. I was told about my gift, but again we were on a tight schedule and made it clear that we did not have any time to view the property. Offered $75.00 credit to a location resturant or credit could be used within Disney. Again, we could not spare the time. They understood and pretty much left us alone. Our 2 bedroom villa in West Village was PERFECT. Roomy, spacious and best of all three TV's. Wireless that easily connected to our phone and computers. Our screened in balcony overlooked the golf range. We took advantage of the pool and lazy river. Glad to read the reviews so I was prepared to pay for our floats. Water was a little chilly (we did get to the pool late afternoon), but still enjoyable. Did not have the opportunity to eat on premise, but plenty of resturants to choose from on route to Orange Lake. We did do a little grocery shopping at the Publix and cooked breakfast every morning. Plenty of supplies for a longer stay including laundry detergent, dish washing liquid, bath soap and lotion. Plenty of towels. After a long day at Magic Kingdom (the park closed at 1:30AM) , it was a pleasure to spend my last morning relaxing in the jacuzzi in the master bedroom. Got my aching legs and feet feeling back to normal. Security was wonderful. We realized that we LEFT OUR DOOR OPEN, when leaving the room. Came back to the room a few hours later and everything (including my lap top left on the kitchen table) was still in tact and not touched. The price was right for our two bedroom villa (king bed & two doubles). We called for a late check out..they gave us 11AM. We left the room at 11:45AM and no one bothered us. Housekeeping did come by that morning and I told them we would be leaviing shortly. I would definately stay at Orange Lake again.

Reviews.Title: “My go to place to stay when Orlando from now on”
Reviews.Author: leeannderita
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 2 other women. Wanted a 3 bedroom hotel suite. Found this place when searching. Stayed in 3 bedroom, 3 bath villa. Loved it! Very spacious so not on to of each other. Kitchen was great so we could have breakfast and snacks. Was very clean. We arrived around 1:00 am so was dark and we entered through the back entrance mistakenly so we got a bit lost driving around property to find registration. But during the day, got it figured out quickly. We only stayed 3 nights and spent the days at parks and then on to visit parents in Vero Beach. Would have loved to stay all week there an take advantage of the amenities. Met a couple from England who come every year for several weeks. They travel quite a bit and said this is one of the best places. Bed was very comfortable. And the rate couldn't be beat for a 3 bedroom!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Gems26
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks in October. We found Our 2 bedroom apartment in the west village to be really well furnished and comfortable. Ate a few times at breezes, very tasty and reasonably priced. Loved the starbucks at River Island, good to get the morning caffine fix! We were out everyday, ignored the voicemails from timeshare reps, and turned down any requests when checking in so didnt really experience any problems. Really nice pool areas. Will be returing next time we visit florida

Reviews.Title: “Good property worth the price no view”
Reviews.Author: Jessie G
Reviews.Content: I recently went on a trip with my partner to orlando and got a great deal Via Bootit.com on this hotel. I figured we would not be spending to much time in the hotel and this was close to disney and other parks. It also had free parking which was great. I did not like the fact that my room was facing the indoors after requesting a pool view but for my rate thats the best they can give me. I tried to stay out of the room it became depressing. They hound you about this vacation club thing from the beginning to redeem cash. DO NOT FALL FOR IT. yes you save maybe 40 bucks but you will lose a whole day to a annoying sales guy. Ive had this experience before. Pros: great for families with kids ( tons of pools and things to do) Huge if you have a car you can travel to the different pools and such rooms are modern and clean pools are huge and nice Cons: if you do not have an upgraded room they will put you in a room facing the indoor courtyard - they hound you in the beginning for this vacation club ( tip just tell them you want to unpack you are tired and you have all your tickets) -Resort fee ( not much but annoying) - taxes ( I thought were in the bookit price) - No daily cleaning ( but hey if it keeps cost down I'm fine with that)

Reviews.Title: “First time will be back...”
Reviews.Author: stephanie k
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Orlando with my family and did not know anything about this resort when I booked it. We stayed a week back in June and I must admit, we were very impressed. When I booked the "resort" I automatically knew that it must be time shares and to be prepared to be wisked away into a presentation. I was thankful that I was able to choose my day and time because I had driven 8 1/2 hours with 5 kids and wasn't in the mood to sit through a presentation. But, I digress. The check in process was smooth as any check in would be. Once I got to the room, we were throughly impressed. We stayed in a 2 bed room condo close to the Lazy River (not the new ones, but directly next to them) and everything was great. The only problem was that the handle on the toilet broke over night and I called Guest Services and they had it fixed when we made it back in that day. My family and I utilized several of the pools and even watched one of the basketball games while the kids played in the pool. We danced to the dj and listened to the live music the next night. We had a ball the entire week we were there. My only complaint is that we did have to sit in an almost 3 hour timeshare meeting and saw 3 to 4 different people when we kept saying no. One of the salesmen/mgrs even questioned if we loved our children, that we should want the best for them and that would be to buy a timeshare. Of course, that ticked us off, but we ignored him and just sat through the presentation. We will be back and we are bringing more of our family. We have already prepared them for the spill and hope that they truly keep it only for 90 mins or less. Yes, we had to pay for the extras in the kid zone items but you have to spend money somewhere right??

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay again.”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake 7 years ago in North Village. Everything was great. We came back and stayed this year Thanksgiving week in East Village. This place is still the first class resort it was then. We have zero complaints as we did back then. East Village was recently updated. Our unit looked brand new. The staff is very friendly. The grounds are very well kept. The pools are clean. The fitness center was nice. We did not feel harassed or bothered with time share pressures. We simply told them when we checked in we were not interested, and that was it. DIsney entrance is only a couple miles up the road. Plenty of restaurants right outside the property. Shuttles run constantly throughout the resort. This place is the place to stay. We love it. Our teenagers love it. We will not stay in another resort in Orlando area. We have struck out twice at two others, and Orange Lake is where we will stay and recommend to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “UPDATE to my Review Below....”
Reviews.Author: TimeShareShy
Reviews.Content: This is a continuation of the review I provided below and is late due to several factors, one of which is the TripAdvisor limitation of rating each property only 1 time in a 3-month window, so I could not provide the end-result of our July 2011 Family Vacation. As it all turned out, we were provided with a great Customer Service agent who happily refunded a large part of our weekly bill for the problems we had with the water and the lack of service. It did take some arm-twisting to get someone to review the issue, even after 'Rose' departed after seeing the issue. I think in some ways, Rose was just a measure to make us think it was being looked after, but maybe not. Rating the Lagoon area: The huge lazy river was pretty cool, gave us some exercise while relaxing. At any one time, i never saw both slides open and had issues with keeping track of my 5 y/o and 7 y/o boys as the slide where we entered was never open, the slide near the residents of the Poolside Rooms seemed to be opened all the time. Not a big deal, but something to note. The fact that we were not allowed to bring in any floating device for our kids was a bit questionable but can be understood for safety issues, however, nothing was said about our special needs childs life-vest and we were happy about that.
