Would have loved to have had a tube at a reasonable rate so I could have floated but I am not going to pay the prices they were asking. As an Owner, should have a bit of leeway for my investment. We were given the opportunity to eat breakfast one day at the restaurant and found ti to be equitable and bit more personal than Golden Corral, and nice to have someone there know us too. WIth a family of 7, every bit of $$$ and courtesy makes a difference to us. We will be back every year, have already planned for the 2012 season, and are contemplating a 2011 Pre-Christmas visit just to keep the blood flowing. Overall, we will be back, will reference to friends and family, will be aware of other issues we have experienced, will tell others of our experiences and will be sure to try to find the sweet spot for our family in the Orlando area here. Nothing is perfect, but we can sure try to find it on a small budget. Thanks for reading, you can ask me more if you would like, I am open to helping others with our experiences. Regards!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay In Florida”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no complaints in any aspect of the stay. Room was well furnished, spotlessly tidy and very spacious. We have stayed twice in the East Village and not had an issue. We had a ground floor apartment this time which was ideal as we had grandparents in the family group and there was only a very short walk to the car and a swimming pool and gym only a minutes walk from the apartment. The whole party went to the Sports Bar and Grill a few times and enjoyed food and drinks. The prices, considering it was a hotel bar, were very reasonable. Our family enjoyed the entire stay (again) and we will return again in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Very annoying sales persons and lots of mandatory meetings. The resort is not great!”
Reviews.Author: Timur U
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this resort and the Holiday Inn chain as well. We bought our vacation package 2 years ago and decided to go for a vacation on Nov 2011. We were very surprised when we had to go to sales event again (we did it last time we were there) and it was MANDATORY! Why they are doing it? We don't like when somebody puts a sale pressure on us, it's just ruined our day, we spent there almost 2 hours for nothing, our time was wasted!!!! and the sales person said we had to or the will charge us additional $400 for the stay, why? We paid a lot already! Plus at the very end of the sales even, when we made it very clear, that we won't buy any time share there, 3 people saw us!!! And the last manager even asked if we won't buy at least something. WHY DO WE HAVE TO BUY, WHY? The money we paid for this vacation was a mistake, will never use Holiday Inn hotels, just because of this unpleasant stay. Also the resort is very old, it's not worth what they are asking for the stay. The rooms are 20 at least years old. All electronics are very old, furniture is old, everything is old! If you're looking for a place to stay close to Disney, you have a lot of other options! My verdict, will never stay at Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Bad Timeshare Experience”
Reviews.Author: family4florida
Reviews.Content: Property Pros: Large size two bedroom villa, in North Village, older unit but clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Lots of things to do. Wonderful family comedy show on Wed evening in property restaurant. Resort restaurants reasonably priced and food tasty. Fun family atmosphere. Property Cons: Room smelled of mildew on the first day, odor less after that day. Lazy river, putt putt golf, etc, all cost extra. Now for our timeshare experience . . . We were greeted by a pleasant lady who was very obviously "schooled" in what to say. She quickly took us away from the initial meeting place, where our car was, and continued her presentation to us while shuttling us on a golf cart to another area of the resort. After a quick tour of the resort and showing us the models, she took us to a conference room and continued to present pricing to us. After we told her that we would think about what she presented to us, because this was our first experience hearing about a timeshare, she thanked us for listening to her presentation and said that she had to get her manager to "stamp" us out so we could leave. Her manager, after I saw him speaking angrily to someone in the back, I couldn't see who it was, but it was probably our salesperson, came over to our table. He acted like he was having us evaluate our salesperson and was rather patronizing to her, in front of her, but quickly began offering even lower pricing that she had offered, if we bought the timeshare that day. After we made it clear again that we are not the type of people to buy something this large so quickly, he excused himself saying that someone else would be coming to "stamp" us out so we could leave. The next salesperson came to our table and presented even less pricey options available if purchasing that day, but after we once again declined to buy, he asked us if we got our gift. He excused himself saying that someone else would be by to give us a gift. By this point, we were more than ready to pick up our children from the arcade where we left them more than 2 hours ago, so we left the building. Unfortunately, we didn't know how we would return to the first parking lot where our car was because we were quite a distance away. We reentered the building and ran into the last two salespersons who we had seen, one of which shouted to the other, "They don't get a gift. They are not buying. Show them out to the shuttle." This was all said in a rather angry voice. Well, if there was any chance that we would consider buying a timeshare from Holiday Inn Resort, that chance went out the window. Our initial saleswoman acted clueless as far as what was happening with the managers and how they were treating us,and I say "acted," because she certainly knew what was happening. She also had the nerve to tell us several times during the presentation that she was a top salesperson, "high on the food chain" at the resort. Well, none of the salespersons at this resort are doing anything worthwhile by treating people without respect. Sales hit a new low here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: Anorak Ray
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the USA and we were not sure what to expect but the excitement and expectation levels were very high. We arrived at the resort quite late on the Saturday evening after a round-the-houses trip dropping others off at various resorts around the area. Check-in was a breeze and the lady on reception soon had someone organised to take us to our accommodation in the East Village. We were expecting a villa or condo so were a bit taken aback to be dropped off at an apartment block. On entering the apartment, however, we were somewhat stunned at the size of it. This is a very big resort, over 1200 acres I was told, and we had not hired a car, relying instead on external shuttles to get us to the parks (more later). Within the resort, there is an excellent free shuttle bus service and we never waited more than a few minutes for one to arrive. The drivers are friendly and chatty and will usually stop when going in the opposite direction to make sure that you are waiting on the right side of the road. They will also make detours to take you where you are heading for rather than just dropping you at the nearest stop. I am probably getting them into trouble for writing that but it is just another example of the excellent service which they provide. Coming back to the apartment, apart from the standard items provided, e.g. crockery, linen, towels, etc, you will also find packs of coffee, tea, sugar, creamer, salt and pepper, dish washing liquid, dishwasher powder, washing powder and toiletries. We had a 2 bedroom ‘villa’ which had an open plan kitchen, lounge and dining area. The kitchen had a decent sized fridge/freezer as well as a dish washer and electric stove. The balcony was enclosed in netting to keep out the insects which, I imagine, would be very good in the hot season. The main bedroom had a king-sized bed in it and the en-suite bathroom had a spa bath, shower, basin and a private toilet – i.e. its own door to ensure privacy if it was being used while someone was in the bath. The other bedroom had two queen sized beds plus the usual plentiful storage space. The inner hallway had a washing machine and dryer hidden behind folding doors. Needless to say, it was air conditioned. There is a small outlet on the resort where you can pick up bread and milk and a limited quantity of groceries if you are doing your own catering. I would recommend, however, that you rather get the shuttle down to the main gate and then cross the I192 (carefully) and go to Walgreens where there is a much bigger selection at a much, much lower price. Alternatively, get the shuttle to the East Gate and then continue down the access road (about 10 minutes) to Publix (I think that is how it is spelt) where, again, prices are much lower. In the restaurants and bars, I thought prices were high but they seemed to be much the same elsewhere so I guess it is just a very expensive area. (As an aside, at the airport, for a glass of wine and a ‘premium’ beer, we were charged over $23 which is ridiculous. If the menu had shown the prices, we would have had something else!) The facilities in the resort are excellent and plentiful. Three very good golf courses and plenty of swimming pools, slides, etc all around. The tennis courts appeared to be well utilised and I saw plenty of people using the gym so I imagine it is also up to scratch. There are also 2 putt-putt courses. There are facilities in the main reception area to access the internet (25c per minute/75c per printed page), and to purchase tickets to the parks and transport. We used Mears Shuttles to get from the resort to the parks. The price was usually $19 per person plus the ubiquitous tip at the end of each journey. To Epcot, it was slightly cheaper at $16 per person. This does not sound much but it adds up when you are using them every day, especially if you are there for a couple of weeks. It was nice to relax and let someone else do the driving, though. Don’t believe any of the prices on the resort web-site for transport as they are terribly out of date. An unexpected bonus was being able to sit on the large balcony every evening and watch the 8pm firework display from one of the Disney parks. The later ones could be heard but not seen as they were taking place behind other apartment blocks in the village. I guess it all hinges on which block you are in as to which one you will be able to watch. We were a bit apprehensive about being subject to the time share hard sell but it was not raised once during our stay. All in all, it is a fantastic resort and I could write loads more. The people working on site are very friendly and go out of their way to be helpful. I would recommend this resort to anyone. The only reason why I have not given the resort 5 stars is that I felt that prices in the market place and for some of the amenities were near rip-off level. We are certainly keen to go back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: SPK77
Reviews.Content: I have have had nothing but positives experiences with Orange lake.... Love the atmosphere and love the amenities. Grocery Store (Publix) on the property and orange lake is close to anything worth doing in Orlando. Water Park, Golf, Jetski, Game rooms, etc, etc. They have something to fit all taste... Older home like feeling in the west village or a tad more upscale in the east village, or very very nice in the new River Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment - mind the timeshare trap!”
Reviews.Author: B T
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 2 week stay at this resort. Did not use many of the on-site facilities so cannot really comment. Apartment was absolutely fantastic - huge rooms and plenty of living space. Very clean, tidy and welcoming. ONLY disappointment was the pressure sales to sign up to attending a timeshare sales meeting. We were collared as we checked in after a long day of flights and travel. Promises of massive reductions on tube hire for the pools and access to the slides if we attended. $30 fee if you agree to meeting but don't turn up. We were told it would be 90 minutes but on arrival at the meeting were told we could expect at least 2 1/2 hours!! Managed to get out of it and not charged $30 fee because they kept us waiting for over 30 minutes for salesman. We did use the pools but there were plenty of loose tubes anyway and the slides were not worth the fee! Only advice (if you do not want a timeshare) would be do not agree to the sales pitch as the rewards, for us, would not have been worth it anyway and we wasted 1/2 a day of our holiday. Apart from that, the resort really was great, in a lovely setting and relatively easy access to all attractions. Definately the nicest apartment we've stayed in for a long time. Would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Great space, fun place!”
Reviews.Author: lizd3
Reviews.Content: We rent the three bedroom unit every time we come and stay at orange lake. The units are spacious and you can't beat the price. Things to know, everything costs extra. Prepare for that additional cost upon arrival. The lazy river rafts are at an additional fee as well as all the fun zone activities. They do sell passes to save some money. Be aware of the early checkout at 10am. No maid service during your stay. They do provide cleaning supplies in your unit and there is a washer and dryer in the unit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sunith P
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Orange Lake resort for my Disney vacation last week. I had got an upgrade to a 2 BR (1200 sq.ft) villa, which was very spacious, and comfortable. The property was very near to the attractions. Will stay at the same resort again, for sure.. Good value for money..

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: Ileftmyheartinnyc
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 3 nights stay at this resort and I was pleased with my stay. We had reserved the 2 bedrooms villa in West Village. I would definately come back and have a longer stay. The resort is a few miles away from Disney. Close to many restaurants and shopping. We very much enjoyed the different pools and spas. Eventhought there is a shuttle going around the resort, a car is a must. The resort is huge and if you want to see all there is to do, a car is helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Week in the sun”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Spent one week in Florida staying at the Orange Lake Resort. Met up with family who live in Canada and own a time share. The apartment in the West Village was on the ground floor and was fittede with every convenience and was spotless. Nothing seemed to much trouble for the staff and all very friendly. Spent an afternnon round the pool where pool towels are provided and plenty of sun loungers. The whole resort is very well kept and a credit to the staff. The only critiscim was the 2 daily phone calss on the first three days from the resort asking to either attend a 90minute chat on the resort (even though we told them the family owned a time share) or telling us they could save us money on park tickets (we worked out we'd only we saving around 30 dollars. Would certainly recommend anyone to stay at the resort. Within 30 minutes of the main attractions and within 10 minutes of some great restaurant, would recommend the Olive Garden and The Outback in particular. The resort provides a shuttle around the resort and to some of the attractions. Would have no hesitation in returning to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “awful place”
Reviews.Author: lisa a
Reviews.Content: having just returned from orlando our fist hotel was this one. Dont stay here if you dont carry a credit card as nowhere on the complex accepts cash we had a disabled room with the smallest roll in shower i have ever seen could,nt even get my mum into it, yet the complex kept saying it was within the legal reuirements but when we asked to see a copy of the requirments they said we could,nt see them without a lawyer!!!!! And also our appartment was crawling with cockrouches needless to say we got moved to much better place

Reviews.Title: “Holidays”
Reviews.Author: ianally1990
Reviews.Content: Great resort everything you expect from the Holiday Inn.Room had super views of the Disney Fireworks every night.The room itself was clean with ample supplies for our needs.The resort is not too far from the Disney attractions and about 30 mins from Universal.A variety of restaurants on site and just outside.Local supermarkets nearby

Reviews.Title: “True resort amenities for the entire family”
Reviews.Author: MissDixieDelight
Reviews.Content: We have visited Orange Lake Resort several times through an RCI exchange. The villas are lovely, spacious and well equipped. On property are restaurants, spas, golf courses, tennis, and lazy river. If you reserve through an exchange there will be numerous opportunities to tour the property in an attempt to sell you a timeshare. There is a lot to see and various purchase options. Make your own decision but know that these tours last several hours. Now when we go, we say "no thank you" at registration and don't answer the telephone calls to the villa. You'll love the resort; just figure out how to avoid all the sales pitches. The resort is very convenient to Disney, I-4 and Fl 429.

Reviews.Title: “1st Visit. Wonderful family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Lifelister
Reviews.Content: This was an RCI exchange for me, two, 7-ish granddaughters, daughter and son-in-law. Everyone was delighted with all the opportunities for fun, relaxation, and family time. Our 2 BR unit is North Village was newly, attractively decorated and pristine. Kitchen was well equipped for the casual meals we prepared. I did bring, as always, an electric griddle with me and find it so useful. We were on the lighted golf course and enjoyed our screened patio for drinks nightly, plus the little girls could run off steam if no golfers were present. We enjoyed the views of sandhill cranes and got no odors from the Animal Kingdom. The multiple pools were a huge success for our girls, except for the six year old who was not allowed on the tubular slide at the Lazy River pool; she was a half inch shorter than her eight year old sister. We thought this policy was too restrictive since she is an excellent swimmer and has been on far more challenging water slides. But..she enjoyed tubing the Lazy River. The huge slip and slide and trampoline bungee were also a daily must. We bought the weekly package for that and got our money's worth. We suggest the resort add another, larger covered area since the sun was beating down on us and the one covered area only held six people. If the kids had to wait in line, they were standing in hot sun. Re: Beds. My daughter did find the bed very hard. I was not bothered by it. I have no idea how to resolve the personal preferences for mattresses and pillows. I bring my own pillow. We did not do any dining, but had casual pool food and drinks. The resort grounds appear meticulously maintained and landscaped. Deer and interesting birds appear everywhere. The location is very convenient to all the theme parks and shopping. I have only two minor negative remarks: On arrival at the villa, there were ants by the hundreds streaming under the patio door and up the walls inside the villa. We immediately reported it to housekeeping but no one responded. We brushed the ants outside as best we could and stuffed towels under the door. When no one came by dinnertime, we went to the store and bought ant spray. We sprayed every day and that solved the problem. However, over the course of the week, I was bitten three times by a stray ant who was hiding in the carpet. I could have been more demanding with Housekeeping but just let it go. Our smoke alarm went off and maintenance was as our door in a flash to fix that. Re: sales pitch. At check in, we were handed two coupons and told they were a discount for tubing and the slip and slide since we were RCI. We were then guided by a smiling agent over to the "cashier", we thought. But a young man launched into a sales pitch for the tour. Honestly, we didn't see it coming. So we politely said, "no thanks" but we'll just buy the tubing pass at the regular price. He immediately dropped the friendly banter and just turned away rudely. Not necessary. We were not even looking for a freebie. This was a minor unpleasantness in an otherwise pleasant arrival. We did not receive robo calls all week. I would return here quite happily. Your kids will love it. Hopefully you can get a newly decorated unit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Updated, Fun but... (600 lb Gorilla!)”
Reviews.Author: beantownmba
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Orange Lake for well over a decade. Clearly, I must like it - and I do. It is convenient to Disney, Universal, and Sea World parks, among others. There are plentiful activities onsite, including golf, minigolf, pools, lazy river, and many more. The units are regularly updated, large and comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful. At checkin, particularly if you are not an owner, there is a semi-high pressure push to take the tour - aka, to suffer the sales pitch... but that's pretty routine at these places. Just say no - and persist - unless you are, in fact, considering buying. So, what's the gorilla, you ask? The facility absolutely MUST improve room cleaning staff. Cleanliness of units has taken a major step backwards over the last half-dozen years. Hotel staff must check and recheck in out-of-site areas, which is clearly not being done anymore. Rooms are always updated and pleasant to walk into - but under the surface... well, take my word for it, and stop here, or read on for details. In my last 3 visits, two have had unacceptable 'findings.' 3 years ago, the 'finding' involved my nephews finding what I'll term 'adult paraphernilia' under a bed. In a location easy enough for anyone - including cleaning staff - to find by simply lifting a bed skirt. This same year, we had issues with mildew/growth accumulating around jets in the jacuzzi tub. This is a tough issue, granted, but that is not an acceptable excuse. This must be regularly cleaned. Our next visit was much better, without any incidents. Pleasant and comfortable, as had our previous half dozen years (prior to the above-mentioned experience) been. This year, however, we were greeted by an amphibian under our bed. When I grabbed him to free him outside, he literally dissintegrated in my hand. He must have been there for weeks, if not longer... So, the issue persists. I have, and will continue, to encourage Orange Lake to improve cleanliness. It is a wonderful facility, which is above such issues. I would never accept these problems at a hotel - and they should not even be a possibility at a luxury resort. Once this issue is addressed - and I believe it will be - I will once again give Orange Lake the 5 stars that it used to be. One more thing, added by my wife: the interest in staying in touch is thoughtful, but unnecessary. We come back to our room everyday to a message. The attempt, I believe, is to keep us up-to-date on activities available. However, it feels more like a high-pressure sales tactic. No thanks, we're on vacation - and just not interested!

Reviews.Title: “Competing Vultures”
Reviews.Author: PaulaW30242
Reviews.Content: Our Orlando vacation had a strange theme....vultures, both outside the unit and with the phone calls to our condo. The easy ones to spot and dodge were the 3-foot tall black birds stacked up as many as 60 deep on the roof peak on the unit...they were just annoying and like having a "Tower of Terror" experience without going to Disney. But the more distressing were the vultures in the form of "tele-marketers" calling our unit to pressure us into a sales presentation. We are regular timeshare travelers with enough weeks and points to have plenty of experience of being treated in all kinds of different ways in a wide variety of settings. The Holiday Inn Vacation Staff takes the cake in terms of shameless pressure. Having scanned a few reviews from others on Trip Advisor, I can assure you the experiences they mention were shared by us as well (front desk shuffle, the "$20 gift" usable only off-property with a 3 or 4-day pass to a park, and the cold shoulder once you politely explain, "we're here on vacation and aren't interested in a sales presentation"). The "new technique" we faced at this timeshare is having a computerized robo-phone call to the unit about 4 times per hour. Starting on day two, the phone rings four times--no message--and these calls continued from 8:30 am through the afternoon. For a day or two we just ignored the phone ringing, knowing it was more sales calls. Finally, once we answered the phone it turned into an argument about how this was a "welcome call" and "we can make it worth your while" if you come to a sales presentation. Going to the front desk on the way out later that day to discuss this only met with more exotic explanations...."how do you know all those hang-up calls were not housekeeping asking if you wanted more towels?" Oh yeah, and the odors...the shuttle bus driver warned us that the "aroma" was from Animal Kingdom. It was a nightly reminder of nature, but not of the animal variety. Check out Google Maps and you will find a very large human sewage treatment plant just behind the tree line behind the East Village at Orange Lake. I think we understand now what attracts the 100 or so vultures to the back of the property. Overall, the resort is very attractive and the units are above average. The groundskeeping staff deserves four stars. The international students who do some work at the resort were a nice addtion to the staff and the old Putt-Putt course is one of the best we've ever played -- all about precise shots and the angles, not crazy shots through corny displays. But the vultures, both the flying kind and the shameless hawking that starts from the first hello and persists with the phone calls -- well, I doubt we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: Mike A
Reviews.Content: This was or 6th or 7th stay at Orange Lake Resort (I've lost count) and it was one of the best stays we've had yet. This primary purpose of this trip was to attend the wedding of a niece whose family lives in the area. We stayed in a 3-bedroom villa in The North Village. It is the same type of unit we own, and cost less in points than our yearly allotment. We had 6 adults in our party (7 for 2 nights) and everyone had ample space and privacy. We ate most of our meals there, and it was a perfect home base for all activities leading up to the wedding on 11/11/11. The unit was right on the Legends Walk course. I was the only golfer in the group and I’ll detail my golf experiences at Orange Lake Resort and surrounding area later in this review. Before coming this time, I decided to look for some recent reviews, and was pleased to see most still thought the place fantastic but there was 1 resounding negative theme: the hard sell, high pressure tactics to attend a sales meeting or owner update meeting. I have found this to be true in the past as well. So I went in with the mind set that at check-in, the person checking us in would know that for this trip we did NOT want to attend any “owners updates”. We upgraded from a 2-bedroom villa to a 3-bedroom villa on our last visit and saw no need to be bothered with any of that stuff this time. Much to my amazement she said, “I just learned how to do that today, so you won’t receive any sales calls to your villa”. She was very cordial and the check-in was quick and painless. At the end she stapled some kind of a $20 voucher on the check-in folder. I said we’re not interested again and left the counter and walked straight out of the door to my car. People insisting that I needed to “redeem” my voucher as I had read about in a review on this site did not accost me. We did not receive any sales calls per se, but we did receive a phone call from someone who said they were our point of contact if we decided that we would like to attend an owner update or needed anything else while at OLR. My wife took that call and told her thanks but no thanks. That was after the phone had rung twice before and upon my answering a recording said, “please hold for a Orange Lake representative” I waited about 10 seconds and then hung up. Same thing 20 minutes later, this time I hung up right away. If you want to call me, be on the other end of the line. I am not going to talk to you at your convenience. I am on VACATION. I think it is rude and disrespectful to make calls in this manner to your guests. My Customer Service Rating: Excellent Check-in experience Check-in time 5:30pm on Sunday The 3-bedroom villas in The North Village are very nice. They are a bit older and in need of some minor repairs and upgrades. There are TV’s in every room, but they are the ancient CRT type. OLR needs to upgrade to flat screens TVs and HD programming. I believe people are beginning to expect that type of TV unit in accommodations above Motel 6 level. There is high speed Internet wifi in the units. I was able to connect my android phone and my ipod touch to the wifi without issue. I did, however, have trouble navigating past the terms and conditions page with my laptop. A nephew staying with us had no problems with his. I called Resort Services and was transferred to their IT department. The tech I was connected with actually in PA. He was very professional and knowledgeable, but was unable to solve my problem that evening and would have to submit a ticket. He said someone would contact me the next day. I did not hear from IT again. I didn’t pursue the issue because we did have access via various devices and having MY laptop operational wasn’t critical. Still, no one called. I did not have any issues using this same laptop on my previous stay in the west village. Another really nice thing about these units is that the 3rd bedroom is down a long hall away from the living room area and other bedrooms. We call it the “in-law suite”. The bedrooms are large and have great closet and drawer space. The master bedroom has a King size bed and a spacious bathroom with a walk in shower and also a Jacuzzi type tub. The 2nd bedroom has 2 double beds and is right next to another bathroom. The washer and dryer are in that area as well. The in-law suite has 1 double bed and a pull-out sofa bed, along with its own bathroom, which is kind of smallish but adequate. The beds were firm but not uncomfortable. My biggest complaint is with the pillows. Everyone in our group agreed that the pillows were too thick and hard. There were no other choices. I stayed at several Holiday Inn Express hotels this past summer and they have choices of pillows. They even have fancy sashes around them saying Soft or Firm. I think Holiday Inn Vacation Club should adopt the same type of thing at their resorts. The kitchen has just about everything you need to prepare a full home cooked meal. The appliances in our unit were older. The toaster was in need of replacement and was only a 2 slice type. I think the 3-bedroom units should have 4 slice toasters. It just makes more sense. The icemaker worked great and the counter space is good with numerous electrical outlets so you can plug in all of the devices of today’s life. There are stores and restaurants very near by. The nearest useful Starbucks is in the Super Target just south of the east entrance. The Starbucks in The Market on the resort is limited in their drink options. We only used Paisan Pizzeria on the resort for pizza one night. We used a coupon given to us in the check-in folder. 2 xl pizzas for $25. I remember the pizza being better from this place before they moved it out of the main west village building to the Market, but it’s still OK. It was a good value with the coupon. Customer Service Rating: Very Good Pick –up quick, ready in 15 minutes. I didn’t check the pizzas before leaving, discovered mistake on 1 pizza, not a big enough mistake to complain about. The units have a covered patio that is nice. They have a table and chairs so you can enjoy the beautiful weather while dining. The units are non-smoking and this patio is just fine if you do. There are no ashtrays in the units, so you’ll have to make do with what is available or bring your own. Another big concern we have is that there is no apparent recycling effort ongoing at the resort. We generated a lot of bottles and cans of various beverage types during our week stay. We took them to Super-Target, which has some small bins for recycling. OLR could start a recycling program and then tout itself as a “Green” resort. Also very disappointed that activity pass that used to be offered is no longer available. The mini-golf activities on the resort are now very over priced. Checkout is 10am on the final day of your stay that could be made a little more generous. Housekeeping crews didn’t rush us as I saw mentioned in reviews. Checkout was quick and efficient. Customer Service Rating: Excellent No waiting in line. I asked to put the stuff I had charged using the room key on to a different card. That was handled efficiently and quickly. I was on my way in no time. All in all if you are going to Orlando and not staying at Disney, but still want to go there and/or other attractions, Orange Lake Resort is a fantastic place to stay. It is a quiet, restful environment away from the hustle and bustle of the parks and has its own qualities. Just remember it is a time-share Resort and they want to sell people on the benefits of ownership. You will need a car to get around if you have big off resort plans. I think the Orlando area is pretty easy to get around in if you take the trouble to familiarize yourself with a map of the major roads. This rest of this review is about my golf experience at Orange Lake Resort this trip. We have been owners at OLR&CC since April of 2002 and 1 of the main reasons I bought into this was the golf courses here at Orange Lake. I thought since we would probably come and visit relatives here from time to time, why not have a great place to stay and squeeze in some golf around other family activities over the years. I had the pleasure of playing the courses before the Crane’s Bend course was built out of the original Resort course. I think it was 27 holes then. The new configuration of the Resort and Crane’s Bend is very nice. Overall the golf at Orange Lake is great. This trip I played The Legends on Monday afternoon. Legends Walk on Tuesday night and Friday morning, The Resort course early Weds. On Thursday I ventured over to Orange County National and played the Panther Lake course. OCN is a golfer’s die and go to heaven kind of place. Look it up. I wish I had had more time to be able to use the facility more. It is only 15-20 minutes and $2.50 in round-trip toll away using SR417, which is very accessible from OLR. It was well worth the seasonal rate of just under $80 with tax. It is has also been the site of the PGA Q-School finals, most recently in 2010. Back to golf at Orange Lake Resort, The Legends is a very nice course, kind of tight, but playable if you keep it straight. Greens were smooth and not lighting fast but still have to pay attention. I got my tee-time off of golfnow.com for $31 plus tax. I had always just paid the owner’s rate and not checked for deals before. It is well worth that kind of a deal if you can get it. I have never had trouble getting a time to play here as a single. Nice driving range, GPS on the carts. Pro shop had the kind of soft spikes I needed. I played with some very nice folks from Scotland, who weren’t staying at the resort, but liked the course from a previous visit and stay at ORL and found the golfnow deal online as well. Saw an alligator along the lake on 16. Biggest one I’ve seen yet on that course. Customer Service Rating: Just OK Upon arriving, greeted at bag drop, clubs taken and put on a cart. I told them my tee time was in 45 minutes. Pro shop guy was great, let me borrow spike wrench to put in my new spikes. Hit some range balls. Arrived at #1 tee, 5 minutes before scheduled tee time, there was a group hitting off tee. NO STARTER in the area, so I didn’t know if that was my group or not. Turned out it was and when the starter did show up, he didn’t seem very concerned or know what was going on with the people now lining their carts up. He just, at one point, threw his hands up and said I quit, then got on the radio to try to figure out what was going on. Eventually I tee off and catch my group on the first green. It took 4:15 to play the 18. That was one of the faster rounds I’ve played there. That includes ordering a cheeseburger on the 9th tee via the GPS system and stopping to pick that up at the grill. Service there was quick, not very friendly, but quick. Only saw the cart girl once on the 4th hole. She told us it would be are only chance that day. The Legend’s Walk course is a great lighted Par3 course. From “the tips” it plays long enough. It is very easy to walk and is great for kids. I played by myself one night and it is pretty cool. Played though a couple of groups with small kids along, Perfect place for a very leisurely 9 holes. Played in 1:05. First one out on Friday morning at 8:50 finished in 1:15 playing as a twosome with my nephew who arrived for the wedding later that day after his own little golf excursion in the space coast area. Each round cost just over $15 with tax. Customer Service Rating: Excellent This was as no hassle as it gets. Walked in, said I wanted to play 9. They ask “need clubs”, I say no, pay them and tee off within 5 minutes. Staff very pleasant during both visits. The Resort Course is my favorite course at OLR. It is a little more playable than the Legends course for the average golfer, but is a nice test of golf. Greens and fairways are great. They used to have a drainage problem over on the southeast side of the course and I think that is why Crane’s Bend was built and the Resort course modified. The practice facility is great, didn’t utilize it this trip but have in the past. Customer Service Rating: Excellent Greeted upon arrival, no starter problems here. Staff friendly and attentive before and after round. I didn’t play Crane’s Bend this trip but it is also a really nice par 30 9-hole course.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Scottsally
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay at River Island, part of Orange Lake resort. The resort is huge, you definitely need a car, or you can use the regular hotel shuttle service to get around the resort. They also provide transport to Disney parks etc but it's expensive for a family of 4. Heated Lazy river and pool are lovely but tube hire is expensive. Plenty for kids to do during day around pool and within the resort. The fun zone is great for the kids but costs extra, there is a large water slide, bunjee trampoline, climbing wall and crazy golf. Weather was mixed during our stay and sometimes the wind was rather cool. Fleece needed at night. Rooms well equipped with large beds and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “5th stay, a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Pop1013
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I have stayed at Orange Lake Resorts, Orlando. I used my Priority Club points for this stay. We chose this site to take our sons to celebrate their birthdays as well as attend Universal Studios. When we arrived at the resort, we were greeted warmly and well. When we got to our room, we found that there were some toiletries and soap supplies missing. We did contact Resort Services the materials were delivered as promised. We were not prepared for the rest of the evening. We were very uncomfortable with the beds this time. We have never had this trouble before, but the beds in the room, both the master and 2nd bedroom were very uncomfortable. We did not have enough blankets to soften the bed. Our son was so uncomfortable that he spent the night on the couch. When we spoke with first the desk clerk and then the resort services representative, they thanked us for the information that would help them make their place better. I could tell very quickly that they were in neither the position nor authority to help us other than to take down our concerns. They asked us if we had spoken to anyone at the time we discovered issues with the beds. But at 2 in the morning, what can be done? Do we gather all our stuff up and move to another room in the middle of the night? We did the best we could. It would have been nicer to have had the comfort with which we have become accustomed in our previous stays at Orange Lake. We were also told we would get a survey which we could fill out that would help the resort improve their service. At no time did they offer to find a manger to help us with our issue. It was unfortunate that we could help the resort improve its service in the future, but they missed the chance at that moment to improve their service to us. Later in the afternoon after checkout, I called the Resort Services office to find someone with whom I could address my concerns. I did speak with a lady who took down my comments. She was gracious and understanding. She did promise that a manager would contact me, but I have yet to hear from the manager. We have always enjoyed our experiences at Orange Lake, often using my Priority Club points for the stays. I am also a property holder at Orange Lake. Sadly, this did not help me find anyone at the site to help resolve my concern. I have always been proud of my association with Priority Club and the properties of the Intercontinental Hotel Group. However, this was a very sad experience not only for the lack of comfort in the accommodations, but more so in the severe lack of personal customer service at the conclusion of our stay. I honestly feel that I wasted my Priority Club points this past weekend at the Orange Lake Resort, Orlando. I am still looking for someone in authority with whom I can express my concern. I would appreciate speaking to someone as soon as possible. I will send this same letter to the management at Orange Lake, hoping that there will be someone who can get back to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway vacation!”
Reviews.Author: foxjcw
Reviews.Content: Our friends invited us to join them for a week at their timeshare. We stayed in a two bedroom condo on the sixth floor in the River Island section of the resort. The master bedroom had a private bath and the second bedroom had a bathroom with two entrances - one from the bedroom and a pocket door into the laundry nook (that leads to the entrance/kitchen area). The condo had a deck overlooking the pool area with a table and four chairs. The deck had a half wall and was screened in above that so you had to stand up to get a good view. We played regular golf, miniature golf, swam, tubed in the "river", sat in the hot tub and used the exercise room. All were in excellent shape and everything was in working order. The resort was clean and well cared for. The shuttle drivers were friendly and the entire staff went out of their way to be helpful. We made a few breakfast meals using the kitchen, made sandwiches for lunch and had appetizers and cocktails before heading out to dinner each evening. The appliances were inexpensive apartment quality but did the job for the few times we used them. We had a slight service problem with the dishwasher, but when we called to report the issue they had someone at our door within 15 minutes and it was fixed and ready to go in another 15 minutes. Supplies that were running low were quickly and politely replenished. The pool area is large and there are great places for kids and adults to sun and play. The public restrooms were clean and bright and there were plenty of options for shopping, buying a snack or ordering a drink. All charged to your room or a credit card - no cash accepted. We played the Legends golf course and it was beautiful with GPS carts. The Reserve is an older course and more central in the resort (i.e. shots off the mark can end up in people's yards). No GPS carts at Reserve. The miniature golf is basic but well maintained. Each side of the resort has two 18 hole courses so there are 72 different holes of miniature golf you can play. It is well lighted so you can play in the evenings as well as during the day. We had a great time and look forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Sue t
Reviews.Content: We have been here 3 times now each time it just gets better, stayed in villa this time on springer circle enjoyed it more than apartments was nervous of new cashless resort syestem but worked ok resort spotless villa spotless ,just book it you won"t regret it .well done orange lake hope to see u again soon

Reviews.Title: “A very nice way to spend a week away from the cold”
Reviews.Author: PaulT6
Reviews.Content: I am a member of the Holiday Inn Vacation Club and wanted to go someplace warm as winter approaches. The booking process was easy using my points but the website was not very good at explaining the differences from west/east village, or lazy river and so on. Each area of the resort has different items to offer. We simply wanted to be near a pool and took the two bedroom west village villa. Arrival was easy and our villa was ready. There was the usual hassle of booking a "time share tour" for which the resort held a $30 deposit that would be charged if we didn't show up. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. There were some issues on arrival at our villa. The thermostat was broken making it difficult to hold a reasonable temperature and the shower head in the master bath had virtually no pressure. Both issues were reported to maintenance but were never fixed during the 10 day stay. Otherwise, the room was stocked with plenty of towels, extra linen, dishwasher detergent, laundry soap, and everything else you could need while on vacation. Having a patio that looked out onto the large pond was awesome! There was plenty of wildlife to see for a non Florida native including birds, turtles, deer, and even a baby alligator. The time share tour/sales pitch was the usual. When we told our guide that we simply were not interested in buying another unit he was friendly and understanding. The staff provided us with four $10 certificates for use at any store or activity at the resort for our time. The remainder of the week was spent relaxing by the west village pool and hot tub. A bar is located in the gate making exotic drinks easily accessible. The drink prices are in line with a casual style restaurant and there were many "special of the day" opportunities to try exotic mixtures. Average drink prices were $4-8 for mixed cocktails and the service was very good. If there has to be two items that make Orange Lake stand out it would have to be the cleanliness and service. Everyplace on the resort is kept very clean by what looks like a large staff of grounds keepers and cleaning crew. Every staff member was very helpful and polite. I wish that Holiday Inn hotels had staff as friendly and well trained as the people at Orange Lake. Check out was as easy as any hotel. The bill was correct including being credited the $30 tour reservation fee and the desk manager made a special point to ask if there were any issues during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very large resort”
Reviews.Author: steph68
Reviews.Content: We had a unit that was remodeled and we didn't find anything to complain about. The only thing that was wrong is the icemaker did not work. Several pools to choose from and a beach. Large resort, need a car to be completely at ease. There is a shuttle bus to go around the resort. Lazy river was a big winner for my kid I believe it's no worth to pay for the activity package. There

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family relaxation vacation”
Reviews.Author: guyn1
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Holiday Inn; it was comfortable, equipped with all you need for kids and family maintenance. Our first priority was Disney World, It is quite closes to the Disney resort, that’s the reason IV chose this hotel. My first mistake was, I want to get the 50$ reward, so Iv found myself and wife sitting with some salesmen “drillers” Before I chose the hotel, I read about in the internet. It says that free shuttles available as well as shuttles to Disney, well, no free shuttles from the airport neither to the Disney, the only free shuttle is inside the village. I rent a car, it is necessary for any movement (well maybe not if you play golf all day……) Summering, it is great place to relax, it is very good for family with kids and I must say that after all day Disney “brain wash” I’ve found this place, even better than I left it in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bingomike
Reviews.Content: this is most wondrfull place i have ever visited, We stayed for a week using an RCI exchange. We had a large 2 bedroom villa in the West Village section. The rooms were clean, spacious and did not have any strange oders. When checking in we were asked if we would like to go on the tour. We declined and were not bothered again.This was a dream resort...clean, spacious, beautiful. The apartment was comfortable and very well equipped, everything we could wish for, The location is perfect for disney and the the other theme parks. The only black spot was our so called welcome meeting, which was actually 2 hours of hard sell for their timeshare

Reviews.Title: “I don’t like being lied to”
Reviews.Author: DenisZF
Reviews.Content: The resort is fine for the most part. We were in the North Village and there was a very strong smell outside, but we requested to get a different unit and there was no smell there. But the timeshare pitch was just awful. The rep who got us to sign up for it lied to us regarding both the incentives we would get out of it and the actual content. They had a chance to fix the situation by giving us what was promised, but they did not claiming it was miscommunication. I almost never write reviews, but I hate being lied to. We are definitely never coming back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: liberta26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased a timeshare here after we had a horrible experience at another hotel in Old Town several years ago. But we are so glad that we purchased it. The accommodations, restaurant and pools (love that lazy river) are great. We purchased a studio and we always upgrade to the villa and we stay in the West Village. The location is minutes away from Disney and there are alot of activities right in the resort that you can just enjoy if you don't feel like doing the parks one day. Regarding the timeshare they always try to sell the most expensive (villa), but what they don't tell you is that you can buy the cheapest and smallest room (studio) and always upgrade for a minimal amount everytime you call for you reservation and enjoy the same resort accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare sell a major downfall”
Reviews.Author: Lisa P
Reviews.Content: While the amenities were nice (pools warm, clean and fun!), the timeshare folks NEED TO BACK OFF. In order to get away, we had to be rude. That was VERY frustrating. The rooms (2 bedroom suite) were a great size and had all the right items included - washer/dryer, kitchen appliances & utensils, plentiful towels and cleaning supplies. However, the rooms were a bit overused and run down. Living room furniture was stained and dirty-looking (we covered them with sheets before using). Carpet edges were fraying and we kept stepping on sharp tacks where the tile met the carpet. I'm pretty sure we won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice peaceful stay”
Reviews.Author: nsully38
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week using an RCI exchange. We had a large 2 bedroom villa in the West Village section. The rooms were clean, spacious and did not have any strange oders. When checking in we were asked if we would like to go on the tour. We declined and were not bothered again. A nice feature on the phone was internal messages did not ring but the light would flash on the phone, so if you got in late you were not disturbed, This is a large resort and you need a car. There is a free shuttle service in the resort. Now for the negative, if you went on the timeshare you got a break on the 7 day activity card, instead of paying 49.99. You would get it for 10. Just not worth the bother to go on the tour. You could also get a 0ne use for one activity/rental for 9.99. Which is kind of high for tube rental or wall climb, but the choice is yours. Undecided if I would go back, there are many other resorts to try.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place but timeshare team ruined our first day”
Reviews.Author: lmthatch
Reviews.Content: This was a dream resort...clean, spacious, beautiful. The apartment was comfortable and very well equipped, everything we could wish for, The location is perfect for disney and the the other theme parks. The only black spot was our so called welcome meeting, which was actually 2 hours of hard sell for their timeshare scheme. We already own holiday points, but despite this, it took 2 hours and 4 different members of staff to extricate ourselves. We had been taken a long way from our car by this time, so walking out was not really an option. We saw several other victims in the same position throughout our stay. Orange Lake need to remember that holiday time is very precious, and as in other aspects of life...no means no! For this reason, I can only do a low rating, and probably will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!! RUDE Staff, Noisy and smelly...choose another resort”
Reviews.Author: LCWWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights in a 3 bed 3 bath Villa in the East Village. On arrival the receptionist told us that our Vila would not be located near our other family members as "Timeshare guests get sorted first...you get what's left"...nice start. Turned around from check in desk to be greeted most unceramonially by a timeshare rep who ripped off our 20 dollar so called gift because we wanted to check into our room first... Appalling way to treat paying guests on arrival. Make no bones about it unless your timeshare or buying any of their additional packages you are treated like second class citizens and do not get the typical warm Floridian welcome...it really dampens your spirits when everywhere/one else who serves or deals with you in Orlando is so friendly. We had to move because we experienced horrendous noise on the first night. We were in the East Village, ground floor. They moved us to another block but quickly realised after settling in there that it backed onto Animal Kingdom. we were told "thats it youve moved...put up with it, you cant move again". The stench from Animal Kingdom late afternoon/evening is horrendous and we could not sit on the porch to eat or drink as my children were wretching. Positives: Accommodation is clean, spacious and enough room for everyone if travelling with family. Some blocks in East Vilage where away from the stench of Animal Kingdom and located closer to River Island. East Village pool was nice to have a few hours relaxing around and to relax in the Hot tub. River Island was great for families but too far away to walk(15to 20 mins walk) If you can guarantee that you can stay on River Island(where the main pool is) or in a better Villa in the West Village where all the amenities are, then you should be ok. Personally I would NEVER return here. I feel cheated out of my holiday and don't expect to be spoken to by staff in such an un courteous manner on all occasions, regardless of wether I buy Timeshare or not. If you are currently looking through a Virgin Holidays or other UK Tour operator brochure To determine your holiday, I would put a big X through this place and move on, unless you can guarantee where you get to stay, which I doubt you can as the receptionist told me"We get what's left" AKA, the crappiest Villas available There are much better resorts than this in Orlando, I'd find one. Our holiday was spoiled, don't let yours be too...you've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Why pay for a room you're never in?”
Reviews.Author: lynningva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a 2 bedroom willa in the West Village and were very happy with our choice. I pingponged back and forth about staying on a Disney property vs an offsite property and am very glad we chose this alternative! The price quality is fantastic - we had 2 enormous rooms and spacious bathrooms. All appliances worked and having the washer dryer in the villa is so convenient! We had a small problem with running the dishwasher and the staff came round straight away. Managed to easily avoid the sales pitch. The only reason it gets a 4 instead of a 5 - is the pool. To put it simply it was dirty (especially the female toilets!), we packed up and left after an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Nana4
Reviews.Content: We have only been here a few hours and love it already. After reviewing other reviews, I almost cancelled our reservations due to negative comments. The shuttle is great and restaurant prices are moderate. We are staying in West Village-fourth floor condo and love it. They supply you with detergent, dish soap, dish washer soap and even salt and pepper. The condo is recently decorated and CLEAN. Walgreen and Target nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely resort but deeply let down by the time share sales team!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_family39
Reviews.Content: Visited this resort for the first week of my stay. I had read about the timeshare sales team before leaving the uk but having encountered this at other resorts didnt really see it as a problem. We arrived at the resort at 7pm, after a long time travelling from the uk and still on uk time we were very tired. I went in alone to check in..two check in desks and the signs at both didnt apply to me..i had to ask someone where to check in. Quickly checked in I was handed a voucher for $20 and told i had to get it verified at another desk..i knew this was part of the time share sales and said i wasnt interested. Walking away from the desk i was stopped from exiting by a guy who told me my check in was not complete..i had to get my voucher verified..i said i wasnt interested but was told that i was not checked in until this proceedure was completed. He took me to a desk and handed me a leflet about the fun passes available on the resort and offering me a discount price of four passes for $20 instead of $50 each.. I respectfully declined and said i did not have the finances to invest in time share..to which came the reply it was not a time share sales talk but an information meeting to show me around the resort..i again said i was not interested and he again said it was not timeshare sales..so i pointed out that the leaflet he gave me quite clearly stated "time share sales". at this point he handed me a $20 voucher and told me to enjoy my holiday....how ever this was not the end! I was rung everyday 2 or 3 times a day..sometimes as early as 8am! at first i ignored them but answered it once on my last full day at the resort and was again being encouraged to attend..they would give me a room credit for the fun passes that i had already purchased if i attended..after saying no three times I just said goodbye and hung up the phone. Further calls went unanswered. Apart from that we had a good time. We had a villa overlooking the golf course..so close that quite a few times we had golf balls land extremely close to us. We visited all three sets of fun pools and brought the 3day fun passes for $35 each. This enabled us to use the tyres in the lazy river, the hippo slide, rock climbing wall and the golf without additional charge for any three days. It was worth it although i wouldnt have paid for all these things seperately. The kids loved it. We made good use of the pools and the kids loved the slides. Was not keen on the pool by reception but the river island and the other pool was great. Accomodation was very similar to other accomodation we have stayed in in florida, clean and spacious..the curtains were a bit confusing..there is a white net curtain but you have to go behind this to find a white blackout curtain which is what you close at bedtime. Lighting in the bedroom could have been better, you only have bedside lamps which you can turn on by the switch by the door but then if you switch them off from the bed you have to switch them back on from the bed or the light switch will not work. Shuttle service is good and the cashless pay system seemed quite secure..i felt comfortable using it. On the last day...check out was at 10am but as early as 8am housekeeping staff were hovering about. everybody in the blocks around us seemed to be checking out and the staff seemed to be waiting for people to leave..at 8.30 i was phoned by housekeeping asking me what time i would be leaving, 5 minutes later a man came and peered through the windows to see if we were still there and then a black bag or cleaning supplies was left on the doorstep which we had to move out of the way to get out the door. I loved this resort, it was great for relaxing and spending some fun time together but the experience with the time share sales and the house keeping on the last day did spoil the stay and because of this im not sure if i would return again. Im sorry Orange Lake but your heavy handed tactics do not do your lovely hotel any favours!

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful suite”
Reviews.Author: Spursfan1961
Reviews.Content: As we were already in Florida for a friend’s wedding in New Smyrna Beach, we decided to make a holiday out of it and take the kids back to Disney/Universal Studios. The groom recommended that instead of staying at one of the Disney resorts, we should try the Orange Lake Resort in Kissimmee. Straight away I checked on Tripadvisor to see what was the general consensus regarding this facility. For the most part it was pretty positive so we went ahead and booked a 2 bedroom Villa in the water park section of the resort. I did make note that there were a few postings on Tripadvisor mentioning the people around the main lobby trying to sign up guests for time share meetings with the lure of a free gift. We arrived at the hotel late in the afternoon and my wife went into the lobby to register. Armed with the information regarding the free gift, she was ready. When the person at the check-in desk said that she had attached a coupon for a free gift and to go to the counters on the other side of the lobby to collect it, she knew she wasn’t interested. However, on her way to the doors, someone stopped her and told her she needed to get her free gift. When she said she wasn’t interested, they said her check-in was not complete until she got her gift. She just told them that she had checked-in, had her keys and was on her way to her room, and was not staying for a gift she did not want. The resort is absolutely huge, so be sure to get a map or detailed instructions of where everything is especially your accommodations. We arrived at our part of the resort and were disappointed that we did not have a view of the pool; apparently you have to very specific when you book. As it was, our suite was on the ground floor on the parking lot side of the complex, but it did mean we could unload our copious amounts of luggage and take it straight into the room through our own screened porch area. We can only describe the 2 bedroom villa as stunning. It was more than we could imagine. The suite has a fully equipped kitchen with a built-in breakfast bar, a full size washer and dryer, a bedroom with 2 double beds with an ensuite bathroom with shower, a master bedroom with a king-size bed complete with an ensuite bathroom with a shower and whirlpool bathtub. There was a dining area and comfortable living room with a couch, some armchairs and a large flat screen T.V. There were also flat screens in both the bedrooms. Both of our daughters told us they want our next house to be as well thought out as this suite. The water park area was superb to put it mildly. The lazy river that meandered its way around to different pool areas was great. There was lots of seating room around the pools, and there are several restaurants/cafes when you have a thirst for a much needed drink. The only part of the pool area that seemed strange to us was the towel pick up area. It was a long way away depending at which pool you were seated. There may have been more than one pick up point, but if so, we never found it nor was it signposted. We had lunch at one of the poolside restaurants and found the food to be pretty good. It wasn’t the cheapest meal we had in Florida but it wasn’t too bad, especially when compared to eating anywhere at Disney. One thing you may want to careful about is answering the phone in your room. Chances are it’s the time share team trying to arrange your tour of the facility. I made this mistake once; I never answered the room phone again. If it’s something important, they can leave a message. Down the hallway from our room, there was a desk set up that I was sure had something to do with the time shares. Every time we walked past them I was just waiting for them to start. As it was, they always gave us a cheery good morning etc., and that was it. No need to worry after all. The location of the complex is minutes away from grocery stores, restaurants and more gift shops than you can shake a stick at. It is a 10-15 minute drive to most of the Disney parks, but the drive back can be considerably longer depending on the park closing times. On Friday evening it took us over 40 minutes to get back to the complex. Negatives? Only 2 -the “free gift” issue at check-in and on our last day, with check out at 10:00am, we got a knock on our door at 8:15 – it was housekeeping wanting to clean the room. When I told them we weren’t ready yet, she demanded to know when we would be ready. I said by 10:00... I did read a report stating that the reviewer’s room had a bug infestation. We checked the room thoroughly and it was absolutely spotless. The only time we did see a bug was when we initially got to the room and I spotted a 1 ½” cockroach walking in from the screened porch area. This was because we had the outside door left open to bring in the cases. Unfortunately, he didn’t make it through to see the next day. Would I stay at this resort again? You’d better believe it! It was great for our girls and great for us and we would not hesitate to stay here again....and hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best birthday in years”
Reviews.Author: Bethany960
Reviews.Content: When I arrived was concerned about switching villas as I have 2 reservations 2 cover my stay. Resort services helped. by letting me know that bellhop could store my perishable items til my 2nd Villa ready while we talked my birthday was discussed as reason for stay later wheni got back to Villa. lovely gift basket. No one here to celebrate with me. so this gift was so sweet I was brought to tears. Joyce in resort services should be employee of the year no resort has ever been so great that's why I'm an owner

Reviews.Title: “This time it shined!”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: We have been owners for quite a few years and have seen many changes happen and now feel that the resort is operating near perfectly. The grounds, the water park area, the restaurants and golf courses are beautifully maintained and clean. The drinks around the pool were very reasonable (5 Margarita compared to $13 at Epcot!) Even the swim shop had incredible close out sales on everything ! Finding an expensive pair of Reebok golf shorts for $6 MADE MY DAY! There are loads of planned activities for families and as mentioned, a Publix store on the property to help you save some money on breakfasts and snacks. We were happy that we chose the points system, as it gives us much more flexibility. We sure had a lovely trip with our family, and definitely had the best stay yet at Orange Lake.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE LOVE LOVE Orange Lake!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy L
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Orange Lake and have been for years. We keep coming back year after year. We absolutely love it there. We were there the week of October 15th, 2011 and brought our son and his family. Our grandchildren never wanted to leave! They loved River Island with the Lazy River and Fun Zone. My four-year old granddaughter even got brave enough to go down the Hippo Slide! Our original villa was in the West Village on the golf course and was great especially after the renovation. It was like coming to a new place. The we traded our week for the points in what was first Global Access and now Holiday Inn Club and have upgraded twice. It's wonderful because now we have enough points (if we choose time and place right) to take several vacations. We ALWAYS come to Orange Lake though each year. The villas are nicely equipped and beautiful, the people who work at Orange Lake are fantastic, and the grounds are superb! So anyone can see from this review that we DO LOVE Orange Lake! We have NO COMPLAINTS whatsoever and we highly recommend Orange Lake to everybody! We are very excited for the openings of Marco Island and Las Vegas. We most definitely will be trying those two out also.

Reviews.Title: “Will keep coming back again and again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn33
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at orange lake. We stayed in the west village. It was the oldest part but just remodeled and was very nice and quiet. The pool is heated and always empty. This property felt like a resort and had everything to offer. You didn't have to leave for anything if you didn't want to. Can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: jennifer r
Reviews.Content: Yes the price and location where great but that was about it. The tv didnt work , it was full of static. Also has poor channels. They are definetly on the lowest brighthouse package. The room was fine but the curtains are clear white and there is nothing to cover it with to make the room dark. So if you want to sleep in you cant because the sun comes right in. The carpet of the room and of the hotel is generally old and noticeable. The shower runs on light water , so if your used to alot of water you wont get it here. The towles have stains although folded nicely , once you unfold you notice the clear brown or yellow stains. I would not recommend this nor would i ever stay here again! Also almost forgot to mention , the woman who is always outside for valet parking , basically barks at you like a dog. She dosent smile and you cant understand anything she says because it sounds like dog barks coming out of her mouth. Dont let this terrible hotel ruion your orlando plans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: Rick L
Reviews.Content: sweet and simple, i went to OL for the first time back in 2005, River island just opened and i bought a timeshare with my Wife at the time thinking we would have a family one day and this would be great for kids since its so close to Disney, We got Divorced , and now im never having kids however the two bedroom river island timeshare i bought payed off ! i converted it to points just before they roled out that program, i payed $900 to convert it and they now want over $5000 and now they want 35k for the same unit i payed 1/4 for, geeez, the Holiday Inn merger is great i use my points to spend a night here and there all over the country, especially Cancun Mexico, damm i payed $149 and 12000 points to stay at the Melia for a week and i still have 109k points left ......any way back to OL ,the river pool is awesome and the grounds and nice and clean, the west village is a family area and the east village is a golfing area. i only go here for Bike week and or Biketoberfest , march or Oct, i mainly exchange my timeshare for other trips and such and or a quick long weekend here or there to get away from the chaos of NYC, airfare is cheap on jetblue which makes it a major plus. cool facts- Publix on grounds close to Disney great timeshare exchange value cheap to get to from NY nice brand new unit on river island facing the pool 8th floor great to have several people stay with you - sleeps 8 at least

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake Resort is Toxic”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: We were supremely disappointed in Orange Lake, and we are owners! In October 2011, they stuck us for four nights into a so-called one bedroom suite in their Clubhouse building. To say the least, this "suite" was like staying in a cheesy 1960's beach hotel. The long hallway to our room reminded us of cell block number 9. The other room doors along the hallway were drab brown with peeling paint and all scuffed up. The hallway carpet was stained and frayed. The stairs leading down to the pool area was rusty, scuffed up, and full of dead insects and insect poop. Our room was a long wind tunnel. One postage-stamped sized window postioned such that you could not view out of it no matter where you sat. The air conditioner sounded exactly like a jet plane when it cycled on. The entire "suite" was drab and dreary. When we complained, we were told, "That building is our first building built over 25 years ago. But aren't the granite countertops nice?". We will never return to Orange Lake Resort and are totally disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: T7776
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time I had stayed at Orange Lake Resort. The 1st time was 2008 when Holiday Inn did not own OLRCC. There is a notable difference, some good, some bad. Over all I was again impressed with the resort and what it has to offer it's guests. The grounds are always clean and well cared for, I would say the outside stair wells in the main Clubhouse on the West Side do need to be painted and cleaned. That being said it was very picturesque overall. We had a king-bed room in the clubhouse facing the the interior of the bldg, I believe the same room as 2008. My only complaint with this is that you kinda get cabin fever without being able to see the sun or sky, but it's Florida so most likely you're gonna be outside. The room itself was great, clean spacious and comes with all the amenities that you need. Large mini-fridge, dish washer, toaster oven, kitchen utensils. My complaint would be that the resort has gone cash-less which is to say that you can only pay for things with a Visa or Master card or what ever credit card you use, or you can just put it on the room key and pay at the end of the stay. They do give you the option to pay in cash at the end as well. I just think it's easy to charge stuff and lose track of what you've spent or tallied up. My other complaint would be the lack of house-keeping services in the west club house. We had to request towels everyday due to the fact that they only clean once a week for the rooms in the club house. I'm not sure about the rest of the resort. Breezes bar was good by the pool, they always have something on the go everynight. The drinks are reasonably priced as is the food. The River Island Exchange however I found a little over-priced, my meal was excellent but my girl friend's meal was something to be desired. Kinda dry and cold, I thought pasta was supposed to be served hot or at least warm. The security is great as well, 24hrs a day some one can be found at all the entrances and exits. Some have complained in the past about the time share pitch, I only received one phone call from a lady wondering if I was interested, I politely declined, she persisted going on about all the benefits of being an owner. I told her she would have a better chance of me staying at Orange Lake again and again in the future if she would just understand that I was not interested in becoming an owner and less of a chance of me continuing to stay in the future and as well as possibly checking out early on this trip if she did not respect my privacy and request to not be contacted anymore about a time share, she got the message clearly and I never heard from them again. My other concern is the amount of desk staff they have working at times upon check-in and check-out. Some times there seemed to be plenty of staff but other times only 2 people behind the desk with a lobby full of families waiting for their rooms. Overall the stay was great, the weather could have been better during our time there but we take our chances when we travel. Orange Lake has something to offer for all ages and and sizes of families. I would say that it is a little out of the way for those of you who plan on doing the attractions and shopping close to Universal Studios and the North end of International Drive. Disney is very close, 10 mins away via car. If we head to Orlando next year ( most likely, who am I kidding? I LOVE IT THERE!!!) we will definitely be keeping Orange Lake close to the top of our list of hotels to stay at again!!!

Reviews.Title: “good vacation stay”
Reviews.Author: travel_addict51
Reviews.Content: I'm an Orange Lake owner and have stayed at this resort, West Village, twice. Both times, my stays have been just fine and what I expected. In Oct 2009, I stayed in a two-bedroom villa in the tennis court area. We had a first floor unit with parking directly outside our front door. Decor was dated, but clean. Unit was clean and properly furnished with all the kitchen stuff we needed. We spent a lot of time at the resort, using the pools, arcade, dining, etc. and everything was great. I just returned from a week-long stay in a one-bedroom unit in the West Village Clubhouse. Unit was clean and updated with flat-screen TV's. My only complaint about the one-bedroom unit is that we did not have any private outdoor space and the kitchen was more of a kitchenette, with small fridge and toaster oven in lieu of a full sized oven. But for my boyfriend and I, the kitchenette was sufficient for us to make breakfasts and dinners "at home". I did get aggravated upon check-in when I was hounded to attend an owners update meeting. Even though the guy told me that they changed their tactics of making you speak and say "no" to multiple people, HE wouldn't take No for an answer. I told him repeatedly that I would not attend this meeting and he still kept badgering me. I'm way too polite to just walk away, which in retrospect, I should have done, so instead I just kept giving a firm no. Nearly ten minutes later, I finally was able to walk away. Luckily, for the remainder of the stay, I was not asked once (phone call or otherwise) to attend one of these meetings. Overall, good stay and would definitely come back due to its convenience and close proximity to the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, apartment was outstanding. Avoid the timeshare salesmen !”
Reviews.Author: TaipeiFox
Reviews.Content: We used a 2 bedroom ground floor apartment which was really outstanding. Rooms were very big and comfortable, every single piece of equipment and appliance you could possibly need. Decor was good. Location to all the attractions is ideal.
