The only pain is the horrible check in process when you are ambushed by high pressure timeshare salesman - try to avoid that and you'll have no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “No Compassion”
Reviews.Author: JudithM428
Reviews.Content: Here I am writing this review after I have spent 16 hours today at my dying sisters side. She has been fighting cancer for two years. We stayed at this resort two years ago and had a wonderful time. My husband and I are avid golfers. There are four great courses at this resort. Two months ago we decided that we needed a much deserved brake and prepaid a weeks stay. We were informed yesterday that she only had three to five days to live. We understand that this was last minute notice. We did not try to refund our money in full but did request to try to put some of the the prepaid funds toward a future stay at the resort. After being put on hold for over 45 minutes and speaking with several employees of the resort we were told that we had to produce a death certificate to get a portion of the funds applied to a future trip. We booked our flight through Southwest airline on a non-refundable ticket. When we called the airline, they were very sympathetic and did would ever they could do to help us out. Well Orange Lake Resort, you will get your death certificate. It just may take a few days. Sorry to inconvenience you. Do you really think someone that prepaid in full is trying to scam you out of money? Oh and by the way, my husband and I were so happy with our last stay that were considering buying a time share at your resort. I guess in the long run this is your loss. Judith MacNeil

Reviews.Title: “Great family experience!”
Reviews.Author: corkyp_pokerplayer
Reviews.Content: This place is was great. I took my daughter, son in law and 4 yr. old granddaughter to Florida for our first time Disney experience. We had a 2 bed, 2 bath unit with kitchen which was well equiped and spotless. It looked like new. I can't say enough about how clean it was. The safe in our room wouldn't lock so I called resort services, a security man was there within 15 minutes. The problem was dead batteries and he assured me it would be fixed by the time we returned from our Disney excursion. It wasn't, so I called the next morning. The same security man showed up and I could tell that he was NOT happy that the batteries hadn't been replaced. He made a call and within a few minutes 2 men showed up and had the batteries replaced in no time. That is as close as I can come to a complaint, and it's really not. Other than that, the complex is huge and extremely well kept. We only had one day to enjoy the pools, of which I think there are 7. I guess one complaint I might have is that they charged to use inner tubes to float on the Lazy River. That seemed a little cheezy for a nice place like this, but didn't cause any real problems as we just enjoyed the pool. There are two entrances to the complex. Right outside the entrance we used was a supermarket and about any type of eating place you could want, as well as shopping of all types and a Super Target. At check in we were offered a $20 voucher for discount tourist places to listen to a sales pitch to get us to take a tour. We were also tempted with discount Disney tickets. I already had a place to buy discount tickets and the prices were close enough that I decided I didn't want to spend my vacation time taking a tour and had a bit of a hard time getting away from the guy. However, we didn't receive any calls as I have read some people complaining about. The $20 voucher wasn't worth the time we spent talking to the salesman. It's only about a 10 minute drive to the Disney parks, which is convenient. I would have no problem recommending this place to friends and family, which, in fact, I have already done. We went the first week in October, 2011, which is a perfect time if you are going to Disneyworld. I strongly suggest renting a car as I was told that the shuttle costs $14 per person as opposed to $14 to park you car for the day, and you can go to other parks and use the ticket to get in without another charge for that day. Did I mention how clean our unit was?

Reviews.Title: “My family & I love this resort can't wait to go again. Everything you need is right there!”
Reviews.Author: richmondhillmom
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days in this place after escaping hurricane Irene in New York City the last week in August 2011. The property is beautiful. They have waterparks and pools near each cottage or bungalow. There are three restaurants and a couple cafes. The food is good and pretty reasonable. Our boys enjoyed swimming in the pools during the day and playing at the arcade in the evening. We had a two bedroom suite. The kids had their own queen size beds with a bath. My husband and I had a King size bed with a jacuzzi in our bathroom! We had a nice size kitchedn and living area. The tv came with a dvd player and we rented dvds at the kiosk on the property. The location is great. We were able to go shopping at the local supermarket and target. There is also a nearby walgreens where we rented $1 dvds from redbox! The only downside is the pitch they give you for the timeshare. When you get your first phone call (and they will call) let them know politely but seriously that you're not interetsed in their $25 "gift" to spend three hours touring the entire property to buy into a timeshare.They won't call again. We went to Kenndey space center and universal studios. If we didn't have so much to do right on the property, we would have spent a lot more money at disney. This is a great place for families because you feel like it's a vacation home, not a hotel. I'm a jaded New Yorker who's not easily impressed but I can't wait to go with my guys again. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ajay04_10
Reviews.Content: We thought the resort may just have been using the Holiday Inn label under licence but apparently its a flagship property of Holiday Inn. And they see to it that maintenance etc live up to expectations. The resort sits on a massive 1440 acres so you can imagine the size. Accomodation quality is excellent for the price they charge. Publix etc are close by, as are some of the parks. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations and ammenities.”
Reviews.Author: jgreview
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the beginning of October 2011. We enjoyed our stay and the nice accomodations. The villa we stayed in was spacious, well decorated and clean. The property was well manicured and with plenty of signs and conveniently located near a grocery store (Publix), a large "box store" (Target) and many restaurants. We did most of our activities off site, but it was nice to know that we had several choices of things to do (i.e.: tennis, different pools for swimming, golfing and planned family friendly activities). There are also choices of eating establishments on property, who now offer delivery to your villa - we opted to eat at chain restaurants nearby. We have stayed here in the past and plan on going again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: mamcjreynolds
Reviews.Content: We exchanged for a week at Orange Lake in November 2008. This was a family trip,including the in-laws. All I can say about this place is WOW. We were in the older part of the resort, but it did not matter. They have a great water park complete with a lazy river. The kids would rather spend time there then the two days we spent at Sea World. There is a grocery store on one of the access roads on teh resort. We made most of our meals in teh room. There is every kind of restaurant in the area. It is Orlando. We did venture off to Cape Canaviral to watch the Space Shuttle launch. This was supposed to be the last night launch (not sure if it was or not. Check in was a breeze. There was no time share presentations or pressure to buy. There were activities for the kids to do. Over all, a great place to take the family

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: OceansideCA
Reviews.Content: We have been owners at Orange Lake for approx. 8 years and then 2 years ago we purchased a 3 bedroom unit at River Island. Our most recent trip was September 24-October 1. We could literally spend all of our time at River Island and never leave the resort. The rooms are beautiful and well maintained. We enjoyed the 3 bedroom lock-out unit so there was room for all of us. This time, we only left the resort for 1 day to visit Universal. Our family always comes and stays with us and we leave in the morning for the pool and the lazy river and stay all day. It's the most relaxing environment. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We declined to attend the owner's presentation, and they called us once, but we declined and that was the extent of trying to get us to attend any more presentations. We enjoy all the restaurants, activities, shops. My only comment would be that I wish the gym hours were earlier than 7:00 AM opening. We like to get an early start and would love to get in there by 6:00 AM. But then again, we were on vacation, so it wasn't a huge deal. I would recommend to everyone. I can't see how you can not have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: rabrown420
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I traveled from Seattle to Orlando for a "theme park extravaganza", we did 3 theme parks in 5 days. I was able to book to this resort through my work for a really good deal and was expecting to stay in one of the larger towers surrounded by a pool with lots of ppl and noise, instead we got a villa that was right inside the gate. It was a great unit, large for the 4 of us and had an awesome deck that was at one of the golf sand traps. Golfers never bothered us and don’t think there were any guests staying on either side of us so it was a very nice location for all of us after we were dead beat from a day at a theme park in 90 degree weather. I have no complaints and would love to go back to this location, or try out another Holiday Inn Vacation Club destination. I have read some of the other reviews and the unit, and property, was very clean! There was the occasional bug in out unit but it’s to be expected in that climate but we were able to get whatever bugs out of the unit without killing them. The unit we had was recently renovated and the kitchen was stocked, except we could never find a pair of scissors, which I hope they do supply! The property is huge and there are a number of things to do right on site, the grounds were very well kept and we never say garbage in any lawn or the road. If you do stay in one of the towers I noticed they were busy busy busy at the pools and lots of kids, but i do not know if they were load since we didnt have any experience with the pool situation. Highly recommend this location to anyone looking on staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Got Bugs?”
Reviews.Author: Tampa1029
Reviews.Content: We’ve stayed in East Village and West Village and they are pretty much two totally different resorts. East Village is a lot like some of the other condo style resorts in the Orlando area. It’s new and seems to be pretty well maintained. West Village, on the other hand, just needs to be torn down. We stayed at the resort a few weeks ago and asked for a room in East Village when we arrived. To our disappointment, nothing was available so we were given a room in West Village. During our previous visit, we drove past West Village a few times and their appearance reminded me of an old 1980’s style apartment villa. Not my ideal vacation retreat. Unfortunately the inside of the villa was no better than the outside. While I can’t put my finger on what it was, the room had an odd odor in it…almost an old musky odor. Beyond that, it is clear that the units are very poorly maintained. The balcony had old cigarettes on the ground and the floor had not been vacuumed or swept since the last guests departed. Even worse was that there were dead AND live bugs in the villa. I’m not a bug expert so I can’t tell you all the different species of bugs we saw, but we saw roaches, spiders, ants, and what appeared to be termites (or some other type of winged insect). If I was a bug collector, I would have been in heaven. I reported the bug issue when I checked out and was told, “Sorry about that, this is Florida so the bugs come inside when it rains.” I have lived in Florida my whole life and that has to be one of the lamest excuses I have heard! It rains all the time at my house and there are no bugs in it! Why? Because I properly clean it and have the proper pest control safeguards in place. Anyways, long story short, if you stay here, don’t get near West Village.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME VACATION !!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenlovestravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake from 10/1/11 to 10/8/11..... We checker in at 12:00pm and no one was there. We were given a coupon at the end, as I walked away a man said come over to counter for your coupon, I very nicely said were not interested....he was a little miffed but then we just walked out. We had not one phone call in condo. But the grounds are beautiful,well kept. Pools are AWESOME...Kids were in heaven. Condo was clean, and had all the amenties of home...we had a 2 bedroon and was plenty of room for 6 adults and 2 kids... We had a great time. They do charge for extras like lazy river,but we never did it there is plenty to do without all that. Publix on site to shop for food and beer/wine ect.We did have a car which made it easier to get around. There was a shuttle but don't know how this worked..... Overall we had a great time and no problems....Would come back........

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, huge property, must have car! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: mjdquincy
Reviews.Content: The pools are awesome, something for every age! We stayed in the East in a 3 bed/ 3 bath unit. It was perfect for us! After 3 days though, we did experience the awful " animal poo" smell other reviewers mention...not good! 15 min or so to the MK, 20 min to Seaworld. Restaurants on site were so so, nothing fantastic but fine in a pinch. I didn't like that you had to pay extra for a one time house cleaning, and wash your own towels but that's just part of a timeshare, I guess. We got one call about doing a tour after we fended them off at check-in and that was all. We were very happy and hope to be back in a few years!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Only place I will ever stay in Florida.”
Reviews.Author: Kann626
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor comments had me so paranoid about hotels that I changed my hotel 5 times over the course of 6 months. We only go on vacation about every 5 years so I wanted it to be perfect. I almost canceled Orange Lake but then found a fabulous price on Orbit and just had to go with it. We were there for two weeks and it was just the best vacation I can ever remember. We bought the Orlando flex pass which gave us tickets to Universal, Islands of Adventure, Wet n Wild, Sea World and Aquatica. There was sooooo much to do at the hotel that we only spent about half the time at the parks and the rest at the hotel. I love all the pools and different entertainment they offer. Prices are about what you expect for a "resort" so kind of expensive but no worse than eating at alot of the tourist traps. We got the 7 day pass for the hippo slide, etc... not worth it for my family. We only used 3 days and ended up giving the passes to another family on our last day. The kids liked the slide but could care less about mini golf so we spent most of our time at the West Village pool (Waters edge). We had a two bedroom which was absolutely perfect. I couldn't believe how big and clean it was. The patio out back was great...wish ours was screened in but other than that it was a great place to hang out at night when it was cooler. No complaints from me what-so-ever and I will definitely go back the next time we get to go to Florida. They could use more shuttles to the parks. We ended up driving every time so we could leave when we wanted rather than get stuck there all day. Which was perfect so we could get back in time for Bingo and Happy Hour ;) We did the timeshare "speech" to get 4 free 7-day passes which I think was worth it. So I wasted about 60-90 minutes talking to this wonderful saleswoman who was great to talk to and didn't try to strong arm us into anything. She gave us a great tour of the property which to me was worth my time since we hadn't even been to River Island until then.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!! ROACH MOTEL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FL_Travel_review
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. The first time was ok not perfect but ok enough for a good deal to stay again. The first time we stayed in the newer (MUCH NICER) building s and this time were not so lucky… When we arrived to check in, there were hardly any people working to check anyone in BUT there were TONS of employees waiting to do the time share scam. So after 25 minutes of waiting in line (only 2 people ahead of me when I arrived), I was helped by a very friendly girl. She was so nice. I politely told her I was not going to stop at the scam desk because now my child was crying in the car. When I turned around, I got jumped by one of the time share people. I nicely explained my situation. She wouldn’t stop and was blocking my exit path. After the 4th plead, I told her no and moved around the other side of her. She ripped off the $20 certificate thing, rolled her eyes, and shoved my room packet at me. We let that go since we knew about it from before. The room was ok but then we walked near the dining room table only to step on dirt and crumbs. So we let that go and cleaned it up. We left and went out. When we came back, I noticed a large roach on the curtain in the master bedroom. Neither of us like roaches and we never had any in our home so we looked for bug spray. Since there wasn’t much to kill it with and it looked like it may fly on a failed attempt, we called “Resort Services”. I spoke to the RUDEST customer service person ever. She never one time apologized and simply said they could send pest control in the morning or we could move rooms. Since it was 10:30 at night and the kids were asleep, that didn’t seem like much of an option. So we finally had a plan and killed it. Stupidly, we figured that was the end of it. Next day, we went to the park and then came back to relax. We noticed the pest control company came (what a joke that ended up being). We were watching tv in the master bedroom when my child screamed, “There’s a huge bug on the bottom of the bed”. I looked and sure enough a different kind of bug. So I got it and thought to myself, “OK, it’s Florida, give it the benefit of the doubt.” We went to the Lazy River only to find out that the stream ends at 6:00 PM. That is insane since most people like to come back from the park and enjoy the lazy river. The last resort we stayed in kept the stream on until the pool closed at 11:00 PM. Warning – there was a hotel worker taking away all of the tubes that had been paid for and rented at 6:00 PM also. We heard and talked to several guests who were mad about this policy. Much later that night (between 12:00 PM - 2:00 AM), the kids were asleep in the smaller room. We had already decided everyone would sleep in there. To our disgust, we saw a total of 6 more cockroaches! We were able to kill 2 but 4 ran and hid. At that point, we knew it wasn’t safe to be on the road at that time so we sat on the bed watching our kids to make sure no roaches climbed on them. Neither of us slept. We all felt disgusting! I should also add that my brother was staying 2 rooms over and had a spider infestation in his room. I saw that the resort reply indicates all of the roach reviews are “isolated”. Wow – so is everyone in the same room over and over again??? As soon as the kids woke up, we dressed them and made sure their shoes were on before they got off bed. We had already loaded the car and we all left. We went to the front desk where we were sent to “Resort Services”. A friendly lady at the desk was sympathetic but said that she could only give us $50. We told her that was unacceptable. She left to go talk to a man in a red shirt sitting across the way from us. He could hear us and see us. He kept staring at his computer screen acting like he couldn’t possibly hear us. She whispered with him, but we could hear the conversation. She came back and forth 3 times. Not once during this exchange did this man who had to have been a higher level employee come over to apologize. He just kept staring at his screen. I should have recorded him so he can see how fake it looked. She finally said all they could do was refund one night and at first she wouldn’t refund the resort fees for that night. We don’t feel that covers it especially throwing in how horribly unconcerned the Supervisor was. I told her I was going to contact Holiday Inn corporate when she then informed me that Holiday Inn doesn’t have anything to do with the resort that they merely partner with them. She said they won’t be able to help at all. That explains a lot. We still plan next week to contact corporate at Holiday Inn and also pursue the media. No one else should suffer! We have pictures of all of it as well as a video. I attached just a couple below. We want to keep the video for our media and Holiday Inn conversations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with plenty to do.”
Reviews.Author: debbiegam59
Reviews.Content: Orange Lake is a beautiful resort. I've been a owner for over 10 yrs. and have never had a bad experience. Some people just want to complain. Don't believe it! I would recommend that you take a chance and enjoyed a wonderful stay that will keep you coming back over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort I've ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: GiselleScott
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I wanted a romantic get away from Michigan. So I looked up hotels and this caught my eye. Very beautiful and well designed. The only downfall is that it's soooooo huge that u have to take shuttles to certain places. And because of that, my bf and I missed out on ALOT of cool things there. But where goin back next year and I can't wait yo chose this resort again. staff is PERFECT! And so was my stay :)

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't beat the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Papa-Ratzi
Reviews.Content: Our journey to HI-Orange Lake Resort started with a flier in our mailbox. The offer was to come visit the resort and stay 4-days in a 2-Bedroom Unit for $349. Included in the price were 2 tickets to any Disney park (about $85 value each). We had been wanting to take the kids back to Disney World and decided to use this opportunity as a perfect excuse. We were placed in the River Island Village, and from what I understand, these are the NEWEST buildings on the property. We had a first floor unit and that allows you a screened patio with direct access to the parking lot (great bonus)!!! This also puts the lazy river and best pools directly behind your building, so you don't have to walk very far or drive. This is a HUGE property, but River Island is probably the best location of all and close to the rear entrance that conveniently leads out to a Publix grocery store and restaurants. Check-in was quick, the unit was large & clean with flat screen TV's in every bedroom, and the lazy river and pool were fantastic!!! They even have a man made beach area with sand and hammocks tied to palm trees. My only complaint is a few fees that I think should be included. There is a blow-up slide area for children that will cost you extra and you have to rent the lazy river tubes. Access to computers in their "Business Center" can be costly and print charges per sheet are ridiculous!!! Part of our deal was sitting in on a 90 minute time share presentation, but it was actually quite entertaining. We enjoyed touring the property and seriously considered purchasing (but we are already owners elsewhere). They are pretty frantic about ending on time and not going over, which was refreshing and they actually do take NO for an answer... lol!!! We used our free tickets to go to Hollywood Studios and had a great time, especially on the Tower of Terror. We drove around Orlando on another day and used a Groupon to eat at my favorite Chicago Pizzeria - Giordano's. Great pool, spacious & clean room, convenient to Hwy/groceries/restaurants and a Groupon to my favorite pizza = Happy Camper.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIABLE HORRIABLE PLACE TO STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cerificates
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orange Lake Resorts and I had an awful experience. The rooms where very nasty and dirty. They smelled horriable and the staff is just as awful as the rooms. The timeshare pitch felt like they were begging instead of really wanting help you to have a great vacation. Everyone lied, from the person on the phone who set me up with the vacation, to the timeshare person who gave us that awful lie. I love the Orlando Florida area, but Orange Lake Resorts, gives Orlando Florida a bad name. And let me tell you, the horriable part is not just visiting and staying at Orange Lake Resorts, you should try working there. I felt so sorry for the employee that tried to help us, because they were very mean and rude to him and he told us that they discriminate against some of their employees and don't care who knows about it. I also notice this for myself as I saw it first hand. I was just so happy to leave and go home and I will not be going back there. Orange Lake Resorts is a sure scam and they should be ashamed for scamming people and treating their employees like they do. I'm just saying.

Reviews.Title: “Resort is lovely, but be warned it is a Time Share resort”
Reviews.Author: sleighLondon
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at this resort Sept 2011 paying 380 GBP for the week. On the whole I would say its a great place, although we did have a couple of problems. The resort itself is huge and has two main parts, one with a large pool complex with a lazy river and the other with a couple of pools and the lake beach. There is a shuttle service between the two but driving is probably the easiest way. The rooms were large (4 of us stayed in a studio with 2 queens and a sofabed) and had a small kitchen. The resort is ideally located for Disney, and there are plenty of restaurants, gift shops, minigolf etc places on the 192 Highway that the resort is on. Equally, it is about a 30 min drive to Universal, Seaworld (a bit longer to the airport). The staff were extremely friendly and gave recommendations and directions to a list of places. My only grumble is that we were told we would get our room cleaned in the middle of our stay, however, this did not happen and we had to go and ask for towles, toilet paper etc to keep the room going. As for the time share part of the deal: On check in we were charged an additional 7USD per day for the resort fee, this was not mentioned in my booking (through last minute) but I didnt complain as it was late and I wanted to get to bed. We were then given a 20USD "voucher" for the resort (this is only valid if you dont sign up for the tour). However, we were barely given our keys before we were pounced on by the Tour Representatives. These guys sort out the Time Share part of the deal. We were given so much information and prices on theme park tickets, discounted rates on local attractions that I felt extremely overwhelmed, especially after a 9 hour flight. For the tickets we had to attend a 1.5hr presentation. As the rates we were given for the tickets were pretty good we agreed. The presentation was in fact 3 hours long, and whilst the first person who gave us a tour was lovely, we were passed on to a further 3 people (all, we were told, would give us our tickets- this wasn't the case) before eventually getting our tickets- which were not tickets but vouchers for tickets we had to change up at the resort desk- we were explicitly promised actual tickets. The only thing I can recommend here is to be prepared. Just an FYI on this but the Disney tickets we were promised were Hopper tickets and those were not the ones given to us. We only discovered this when trying to get into another Disney park after already using the ticket once that day. We had to come back to the resort and explain our case to 3 different people before it was eventually sorted out. However, all were very helpful and apologetic. Make sure you get what you agreed on.

Reviews.Title: “this timeshare is a scam!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angie M
Reviews.Content: Dont fall for this timeshare scam. They'll say ANYTHING so u sign a lease of thousands of dollards to buy AIR!!! They are extremely nice the first month after that NOBODY ANSWERS, NOBODY RETURN UR CALLS except to receive ur payments. Believe me Im a member and they are rude if they answer and its never the deparment that can help u. Ask anybody, read people's reviews trying to get rid of it. Its worth NOTHING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: CandyChong1982
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a so far so good my friend see servic is ok

Reviews.Title: “Great, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: onesmallrat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2 story unit near the back of the resort and on the second floor. It had a master bedroom with shower, living area with kitchen and a guest room with 2 queen beds. It was fairly clean and had everything we needed. There were a lot of bugs around, but I felt like the humid climate was to blame and not necessarily the hotel. The full size kitchen was nice and included basics like dishes, pans, cups, etc. The washer/dryer units were a bonus we did not expect. We didn't engage in conversation with the staff and did not have much time to use any of the amenities. We stayed here during off season, so really didn't see much traffic to the parks and on the road. The hotel is about 10-15 minutes drive from Disney World so it is was very convenient during off season. There are plenty of eating options within 5 minutes and 2 grocery stores very close by (Publix and Target). It is about 20-30 minutes from Universal and some of the other parks. About 30 minutes from the airport. The condo was a little far from the entrance of the resort, but we heard that usually the newer units are usually not close to the front. There's a guard at the gates who checks for your parking sign in the car so it was nice to have that added security. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and would stay again if we had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “My worst vacation experience...”
Reviews.Author: 14Lisa14
Reviews.Content: Nothing beats customer service. You can have an out dated facility but treat people with respect, and they will come back. That's not how it was when we stayed at this resort. Once they get your money, they don't care how they treat you. We were treated terribly at this resort by the ones who were trying to make time share commission...and yes, it does smell awful early in the morning. No eating on the patio, it smells like the sewer.

Reviews.Title: “Kids love it!”
Reviews.Author: Lun100
Reviews.Content: Was there during X'mas and quite happy about it. My husband goes golf right there everyday, Price is good, place is clean and roomy, with full size kitchen and laundry, a lot of actives for kids that doesn't exist in most of the hotels such as rock climbing, world largest inflatable water slide like as 4 floors high, lazy rivers, mini-golf, kids style jumpie,craft, and free movies, golf lessons etc...........

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: djohnsto
Reviews.Content: If the roaches don't bother you room is nice. Everything on site is extra and outdoors smell bad! Staff rude.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday inn-Waste of TIME SHARE!”
Reviews.Author: chirag16
Reviews.Content: The resort itself was nice. It had a lot of activities and things to do - never have to leave the area. We stayed in a great spot, but unfortunately got a lousy parking lot view. When we fist check into our room it smelled like smoke. We than got a different room and it was a little better. As we were unpacking, someone knocked on our door(once), than just opened the door. It happened to be a hotel staff. A couple of hours went by, and same thing happened again! Yet another hotel staff member! We had everything from flying insects and bugs in our room. The rooms really need to be updated as well. The lazy river is nice, but the entire pool needed a lot of cleaning. Don't even get me started on the timeshare. They tell you an hour and half, but ended up 4 hours! They do not listen to you at all - Just wanna a make a sale. I could go on and on. would not recommend. Pay the extra $50 and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A good resort”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in August 2010 in the 87500 block of East village. We had booked a hire car anyway, but noticed the brochure warned us that one would be required just to get around the resort. This is definite requirement! Check in was relatively painless, but we were approached by someone 'offering' priority check-in if we completed a form. Being highly suspicious, we politely declined! It appears that this then links to other offers.... presentations etc. Our accommodation was of a high standard despite initially thinking we had booked a villa and found ours was a 3 bedroom apartment in a block! It was very clean and spacious and having 2 teenage children, gave everyone more than ample room, and bathrooms! We had limited use of the pools due our own holiday plans, and the frequent rain/storms which required everyone to vacate them. The large publix superstore on the East Orange lake Blvd entrance was well utilized to reduce costs of eating on site. Also the local steak restaurants nearby provided good value. We got used to coming in to find messages left on the phone asking if we'd like to attend presentations, play golf etc. As this was my first time driving in Florida, i found it very easy, and also having a sat nav helped immensely. The parking for the parks (Disney/Universal/Busch gardens etc) was well organised, and although i was apprehensive about distances / timings found them easy to use. (I have used hotel/Disney transportation on previous visits)

Reviews.Title: “Issues with cleanliness - otherwise happy with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: C45255
Reviews.Content: I was a guest in the Riverwalk complex, arrival Sunday, September 11th. We arrived late, (found a pile of 12 sheets folded and left on our kitchen counter) made a quick trip to Publix after check in for necessities, enjoyed a beverage and called it a night. Upon waking, we found the unit was extremely dirty. Mold, mildew and rust on the vent above the master bath jacuzzi tub, air return vents were filthy. One of the beds in the guest room appeared to have been overlooked when sheets were changed and sported a large foot print on the sheet...there were more issues but I'm certain you get the point. Customer service responded quickly in an effort to relocate us, unfortunately the second unit was worse! A cleaning crew descended on a third unit and by about 11am we had been relocated to the 82000 building (which I recommend over 81000). My hostess received a points credit for the 1st night's stay and $100 in gift cards for our trouble. We were pleased with the resolution. Bars at the pool were pleasant, great service. We had lunch at Breezes - fish tacos were excellent, service was fine.

Reviews.Title: “river island great for families”
Reviews.Author: TrinidadW_i_Gillian
Reviews.Content: got this through an rci exchange for one week. had to pay for two nights since i was supposed to arrive on sat and the rental was from mon. i had a delay in flight through ft lauderdale and arrived on sat then drove up on sun morning. i called a week before to inform that i was not going to make it for sat night and was transfered to every possible department only to be told that a refund or room credit was not going to happen. only the manager on duty at the time of check in could help with a room credit. we arrived at about 2.30 check in was smooth however again i was told that i could not get a credit i was not even allowed to speak to the manager. i tried for the whole week and still no manager (its like trying to speak to the queen). check in is a breeze however they shuttle you over to the timeshare people who try to force you to do breakfast. after a four hour flight, 5 hours sleep and a four hour drive without stopping to use the washroom i really had no patience, i just wanted to go to my room. my husband tried to get out of it by saying we will attend but the catch is they put a hold on your card so if you don't show like he was going to do they charge you. i just said no,no, no over and over again until the guy got fed up. he then gave us a green paper with his name on it, only to find out a day later it was a $20. voucher. he did not even say. anyway i was out by $250-$300. for that night. top management is really sucks, however the employees at the lower levels are GREAT, WONDERFUL, very welcoming. the rooms at river island in the newer building 82000 are huge. i have stayed at hilton international drive and seaworld and disney wilderness lodge all in 2 bdrms and i must say that these rooms are larger and really more comfortable. the kitchen is big for a time share.(don't cook much but like a big kitchen to prepare breakfast). the washer and dryer are separate and full not the tiny top and bottom ones. the location of this building 82000 is perfect. right outside is the kids play area and pool. the pool was never crowded and we always got perfect seats any time of the day. wifi was strong in the rooms and the business center and arcade were just a hop away. as you can tell i do not like to walk far from my room. the business center had computers that were fast compared to other hotels which i used print park tickets. remember you are charged by the time you take. i just bought a $7 card and that was way enough. i bought 2 seven day play passes for my children (a room credit would have worked well here), and they had a blast. the lazy river, miniature golf , hippo slide, rock wall and trampoline jump were worth it. the passes were $49. EACH, a bit pricey however we were given a $20. in voucher at check in which we applied to these. the location of river island is wonderful, by the exit, just drive out and there is publix, miller alehouse (excellent), super target and applebees. i will be back to stay at river island. perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: badskindollheart
Reviews.Content: Visited first week Sept 11. Stayed in River Island, in a two-part condo (with lock-off). This was great for our group of grandparents, parents and kids as it meant we could have some time apart when needed. The apartments are beautiful, spotlessly clean and well equipped. Bath & Body Works toiletries go down a treat. Yes, you do get many answer phone messages to attend sales meetings, but you can easily ignore these by not answering the phone. The only issue I had with the apartments was the pillows - incredibly uncomfortable, although the beds were fine. I would recommend taking your own pillow if you can (hence the low rating for sleep quality). Our 5 & 6 year olds loved the pool and lazy river at River Island. They would've been happy to spend the whole holiday there. It is a little noisy at night if you are staying in River Island, but the pool closes at 10pm and it quietens down then. We have always shopped in Publix when here before, but we ventured across the main road to Super Target this time and found the food much cheaper and better quality. Would recommend this for any Brits. The Bahama Breeze across the road is also excellent (best meal we had). All the staff in our building were fabulously friendly and welcoming. Wasn't so keen on the staff in the lobby as obviously they are the sales staff. All in all a relaxing haven. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Orange lake”
Reviews.Author: DCoipel
Reviews.Content: I came to orlando on 7th sept and I stayed in a villa in glenbrook estate The second day I arrived I went to orange lake for a presentation. There was no hard sale. All we experienced was politeness and hospitality. The gentleman made my kiddies comfortable and it was for this reason I invested. prob best thing I've ever done The resort is huge has many pools and in a great spot not too far from many shops Although I'm nit actually staying here at the moment I have been here three times already. It's a lovely family place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place... Smug management”
Reviews.Author: KODUVAL
Reviews.Content: Amazing lazy river! Beautiful units. Too bad ours smelled like fried food. Got it through rci exchange so we were shipped off to the corner like unwanted foster children in a worn out unit. Amazing game room though. Resort also on a river with speed boats and a full golf course. Management and employees were smug... Although I am positive my salary and lifestyle was superior to theirs . They lacked tact and humility. Resort is very far from 192 highlights and Orlando. Resort food was average.

Reviews.Title: “Signature Series...the only way to go!”
Reviews.Author: gm3fan4u
Reviews.Content: Do yourselves a favor...spend the extra points and stay in the Signature Series condos at River Island. You will not have a more fun time and you get express elevator service to floors 6 - 8. Furnishing are upgraded and top notch decor makes it feel like home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “family of 4”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: Wow...loved our villa in the west village. Our kids were happy to each of their own Queen size bed and bathroom. The villa was very spacious & clean. I loved having the laundry facility. We ate at Legacy bar and it was very good. We got souvenier glasses (kinda get a good deal on refills). Checking in they were super accomodation as we came with a family who were time share owners. They were able to get us side by side. It took the front desk awhile to organize with so many rooms. I was nervous of the time share sales people..so tried to get out of the lobby quickly. Unfortunately a lady saw something in my hand and so sent me to a desk to get our FREE GIFT. If we listened to a 1 hr presentation we could get our fun passes reimbursed. This was a $200 value. Well what the heck it is only 1 hr of our time right? We booked 8 am for the presentation so that we would have the whole morning & afternoon to enjoy the resort(it is absolutely huge with so many things to do for the kids). We didn't leave the presentation until 11:30 am...I keep telling the salesperson that I was not interested but he had someone observing him to he kept going thru the process anyway. They keep sending more people to you to sell you something to the point that we said NO NO NO until we were walking out the door to get our $200 cash gift and the guy points to a picture on the wall of a sick child with cancer and says they match all donations to this charity....Nobody could say no to that..... Once we were away from the sale pitch I couldn't say anything wrong about this resort. It was very easy and quick to drive to the parks. We stayed at The Holiday Inn on Disney property for 4 days prior to this hotel. I would have to say I enjoyed this resort more. I liked driving to the parks rather than taking the disney shuttles and the flexibility to make some meals at the villa. I will definately go back to this hotel if I was going to Disney again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation- Even for Adults!”
Reviews.Author: Chamey
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Holiday Inn Club Vacations! We stayed in a nicely appointed, IMMACULATE villa that was roomy and had everything we needed, including a full size stove/oven, a washer & dryer, as well as dishes and even bakeware!! Our villa had granite countertops, modern decor, a flat screen TV in the living room. I read other reviews and saw posted pics on tripadvisor of outdated rooms that I would have been very disappointed to have been checked into!! I was so pleased with the overall look and comfort of our villa. We spent mornings sipping coffee on the rear patio, which backed up to the golf course and was so private and serene. Make no mistake...this place is quite family oriented, but our group of 4 adults had a blast! There's a nice golf course, but we spent most of our time on the property at the lazy river. This is such a nice feature, though it did tend to get pretty crowded at times, and snapping up enough lounge chairs (and/or table w/ umbrella if you're lucky enough!) was a challenge on most days. At the pool area, there was a very attentive wait staff each day that would make the rounds and take drink & snack orders. They were all incredibly polite and courteous and the drinks were always ice cold & delicious! There are 2 walk-up bars as well. Tradewinds had some great entertainment one evening- a sort of comedic musician that really got the crowd involved in the fun. We came to Orlando mainly to stay at the resort and visited just one theme park on 2 separate days during the whole week. The 5 days that we spent exclusively at the resort were fantastic. Having a rental car was absolutely essential. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, but nothing outside the resort is within walking distance, with the exception of a Walgreens that we seemed to visit regularly to stock up on necessities like bottled water and sunscreen. However, it is situated across a very busy highway from the resort, so extra precaution should be exercised if you decide to trek it over there instead of driving. We did not go to any Disney Parks, which were a bit far from the resort. Even further away was Universal Studios, where we spent 2 days. Traffic can be a bear in the area, particularly I-4! You have to time your trips accordingly. We did receive a couple calls about timeshare opportunities, which we declined to entertain, and that seemed to work. We did not attend any of the sales pitches and were not bothered at all to do so. Overall, we have nothing but good things to say about this resort. We would return in a heartbeat and will probably book something for next year! I think we may have an annual tradition in the works! Thanks for a wonderful vacation, Holiday Inn Club Vacations!! We'll definitely be back! :)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resort i went in Orlando area”
Reviews.Author: eduardomiyake
Reviews.Content: Huge resort with some villas , all of them with their own pools , restaurants and a lot of enterteinement , good place for families and a plesent place for runnings ...veru close to the thme parks in Orlando ...

Reviews.Title: “So much so close!”
Reviews.Author: Americangirl624
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other condos in this area on prior Disney Trips and this was by far our favorite. Other condos we have stayed are set up in the form of a hi-rise apartment building. These condos are more like a duplex villa....with only 4 units per building - 2 on the main floor and 2 above. The unit was so spacious and overlooked the beautiful landscaped golf course. There are plenty of pools and different dining choices to chose from. There is a Target and a Publix market less than 5 minutes away. Be forewarned though - this is a "cashless" resort. SO, much like a cruise line, be careful how many fruity umbrellas drinks you order while relaxing poolside. They'll hit you with the tab upon checkout!

Reviews.Title: “LAST TIME I STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: rmsht12
Reviews.Content: Had to move out of 2 units due to they werne't cleaned. Black grim in toilets that had to be cleaned with a wire brush by The Head of Housekeeping. Washer had clothes in washer. When I called to Guest Relations get corrected it took hours. The best thing is I'm an owner here. I'll be trading my week for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Most favorite place in the WORLD!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Florida_girl88_11
Reviews.Content: I actually have not just returned from Orange Lake but would normally be on my way soon, unfortunately we can not go this year and I am devistated! I wish I was going as it is my favorite place in the whole world, I have been every year for the last 18 years and it feels like a home from home! So please ignore any bad reviews, just go!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt Right at Home”
Reviews.Author: MsAmerika
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom villa in east village felt just like our 2 bedroom apartment at home. The resort was clean the room and grounds. We spent most of our time at Disney World so we really didnt get much time to enjoy the amenties at the resort but the pools were very nice and clean, plenty of chairs and tables. I would recommend to anyone looking for an family friendy resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay except for timeshare pitch”
Reviews.Author: nickylove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at couple of nights at the resort in the River Island section which was really nice. Spacious clean room. Right next to large pool and lazy river. Convenient location, close to everything. Landscaping was lovely, and though not a high end resort, totally adequate. Great for families. Didn't care for the sales pitch at check in to attend timeshare tour. Maybe if I was staying longer than 2 nights, but certainly didn't want to waste time doing that. Otherwise, enjoyed the stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: PDIDY68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights after 3 in a Disney Resort and was pleasantly surprised with this resort. We travelled with 2 other couples and kids, ages 7-14. Check-in was a little rough as there was only 3 reps. Handling the check-in but its vacation and it beats standing in line for the bus. I researched OL before hand so I knew what to expect in terms of fees and pushy sales people. I declined the 20 dollar coupon and ignored the numerous phone calls through the week trying to get you to buy a week at the resort. We stayed in the River Village area which is the fairly newer area and it was spectacular. The room even though it seems you are renting a house, is a room in a 4 story building. The room was spacious , two bedrooms, 1 king bed, 2 double beds, and in living room a pull out queen sofa. It easily sleeps 6. The room was well decorated and it came with 3 TVs and a screened in porch and Jacuzzi in master bath, which there were two bathrooms. The Pool area in River Village was well done. A lazy river that winds throughout the whole complex does not get any higher than 4 feet, so you can feel safe with little ones in it. The tube rentals are 9 dollars a day or you can buy a 3-5-7 day pass which includes mini golf, rock wall climbing, water slides, and trampoline jumping as well as the tubes for prices starting at 35.00 per person for a 3 day pass. The pool complex has 2 bars which serve any drink and it is cashless. You must have your room key to charge, and the drinks are a little steep, but coming from NY, it is the norm.($10 for a 32 oz drink with 3 oz of alcohol and the rest fruit juices, and $8.00 refills) Music is piped in giving that tropical feeling and live music is sometimes at the complex. The eats on River Island is the norm. Seafood, steak, nothing out of the ordinary. A Starbucks and Eddy’s Ice Cream can be found on site as well. A Publix supermarket is right outside the resort for all your shopping needs. The Golf at night is great for little ones as they golf for free and fo them club rentals are free. It is also a lighted course. The Lake at the West Village provides water sports such as jet ski and tubing, which we tied and loved and there is another pool there and restaurant to eat at. The resort is about 5 miles from all Disney Parks and minutes from the chain restaurants if you don’t want to eat on site. All in all, the price for the 6 nights was a great deal and I would recommend this resort as a place to stay if you are not that much into the parks EVERY day. We only did 3 days of the parks in 9 days…

Reviews.Title: “RCI owner and is suppose to be a gold star resort”
Reviews.Author: jennifer H
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband with another couple stayed here for the weekend...however it was not horrible but it was not as good as what I expected. There are hidden costs as there is always with a timeshare but I thought It wasn't right. It cost 9.00 for tube rentals and to play putt putt and etc. if this stuff is on site I think there should be no need for charging for it. Also we were a little irritated that the shuttle runs every 20 mins aprox. we waited 45 mins and yes i know it was late at night but still. Also the morning of our departure we were wanting to sleep in until just before check out at 10..the maid/houskeeping were ringing door bell and trying to come in at 8:30 a.m. and woke us up..NOT HAPPY ABOUT THAT...there is no tag to put on door that says do not disturb. I just think this place needs some improvement for it to be considered a gold crown resort. Also could have used more pots and pans to cook with in kitchen for breakfast we had only one frying pan to use.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good but be warned ....”
Reviews.Author: rainbowSurrey_uk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely 2wk stay, mixed ages 75-12!!! Be warned, whilst you check you have a member of staff behind you waiting for you to finish who will kindly offer you a $20 money off voucher to get validated at a further desk !!! Having done research before travelling, this is to entice you into a meeting re, timeshare. Just refuse the voucher and ignore the messages you have left on your phone in accommodation. Most people do not want to be harrassed on holiday !!! The resort is HUGE... You cannot walk anywhere !!! Not to a pool, restuarant, bar, supermarket. This proved inconvenient for us. Chose complex as seemed to offer so many facilities but all eateries served virtually same menu which is such a shame, you have to pay a daily fee of $9 for a ring to use the lazy river, you are asked to leave the pool if you are seen with one other than the one you pay for !!! so cannot use your own which is a total swindle !!! The whole resort is completly cashless and credit cardless ! ~Everything, even in shops is charged to your room card, this is ok if you keep tabs on it, we chose to settle every couple of days. On more positive notes, accommodation is large, modern and has everything you can ask for. Most rooms are in large buildings so stairs or lifts will be needed, they do have single storey bungalows, but we where unable to get 2 next to each other. We stayed at East Village being the quieter, West Village had a slight Butlins feel to it and i was led to beleive most brits are put in this area. Some fab restuarants just outside complex, LongHorn, Outback, Millers Ale House, Applebees, Olive Garden. Shame food on complex did not come up to scratch as would have been more inclined to stay in resort than venture out for a decent meal. Lots of wildlife, saw snakes, cockroaches, deer!, huge birds and lizards everywhere!!! Did enjoy stay but would not return.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the price for all you get”
Reviews.Author: richie34
Reviews.Content: just returned from orange lake on 8/28 .i have to tell you ,you cant beat this place for all the amenities that are at your door step for 100 dollars a night for a 2 bedroom villa..3 large water park like pools ,2 mini golf courses ,bungee jumping, giant waterslide and 4 real nice golf courses. there a 3 nice resturants and a few snack bars that ara very competitive on their pricing compared to chain resturants. the only draw back is that they shuffle you right over to the time share tour or as they call it now a welcome visit right after you check in. but if you have a good attitude about it you waste 2 hours and get 75 bucks for your time. all in all i would highly recommend this resort and if you check the internet you can get some really good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Villages and Pools”
Reviews.Author: Jean V
Reviews.Content: After reading through numerous reviews we decided to book our summer vacation at Orange Lake Resort. What a pleasant surprise it turned out to be! My husband and I along with our two daughters, ages 18 and 21, arrived at the resort around 7:00 p.m. and registered for our room without any delays. There was an additional user fee of I believe $58 when we checked in that I was aware of because of previous reviews. They did offer a $20 coupon to be cashed in and used however we wished at the resort, which when greeted by a representative to cash in we declined per previous user reviews on the site. The coupon is used as a way for them to set up a timeshare appointment. They were very polite about our declining it and told us to enjoy our stay. It was a bit of a drive (very large resort - although there are shuttles a car is definitely recommended) to the East Village from the registration area. While at the resort we received one phone call asking us to sign up for a timeshare tour and I declined. That was the only call we received about timeshares. Everyday a message was left about the daily resort activities. We had a villa in the East Village on 4th floor. It contained a foyer, two nice size bedrooms, bathrooms, living room with a pullout couch, kitchen, dining area, washer, dryer and a screened outdoor patio. Everything was very clean, the beds were made and the rooms were stocked with plenty of kitchen and bath towels, all eating and cooking utensils/ dinnerware, blender, toaster, coffee maker, coffee filters, paper toweling, dish, laundry and dishwasher detergents. The bathrooms each contained a small lotion, shampoo and conditioner. Everyone was very happy with the villa. Restaurants: We ate at both Breezes and The Legacy. Both were good with prices similar with what you would find at Applebee's and supper clubs. Our girls thought the menu items were similar at both places but they had a nice variety of entree's so I didn't see that as a problem. Pools and Villages: We were on a relaxing vacation so the pools was where we spent a lot of our time. Waters Edge at the West Village turned out to be our family favorite and go to pool. There were two separate pool areas, Putt Putt golf, and a beach with sand volleyball. Breezes restaurant and bar was on site so we could grab lunch and drinks at our leisure. The Market Place was also in walking distance of the pool and contained pizza (which you could have delivered poolside) drinks, icecream, sandwiches and small grocery items. If we were to stay here again with teenagers or even just my husband and I this is the village we would stay in. The North Village contained Splash Lagoon which was a beautiful area with small water slides, kiddie pool, water basketball and poolside cafe. This would be a perfect place to stay if you have toddlers through 8 year old's. The East Village was more secluded and contained The Legacy restaurant, two small pools and a very small work out area. A nice place to stay if you want to be away from the action. River Island is beautiful! It contains two pools connected by a lazy river, a couple of water slides, a fun area with volleyball, bungee jumpling and putt putt golf. It also contains a poolside restaurant and bar with live music in the evenings. This area would be perfect for all ages, especially the 7 - preteen years. We are not golfers so we can not comment on that but the golf area's were beautiful. There was a Publix grocery at the entrance of the resort and a Walgreens right across the street. Disney was about 10 minutes away and Universal was about a 20 - 25 minute drive. All in all a great place to stay and we will definitely be returning in the future. Hopefully this review helps! Have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking until...”
Reviews.Author: MICHELEC22301
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days at this property; however 1st day leaking air condition-soaked the carpet. After 4 calls to houskeeping and repairs - staff sent to look at the problem left towels after many requests of the staffer. He said I needed to call to request towels that were in the service truck. Eventually, got moved to another villa and had to kill over a dozen roaches ( didn't report), because moving was not going over well with me. Stayed in the West Villas which were the older section. Not very happy for vacation week, the amenties that are offered are great, but stay at River Island or another section - West side awful. Oh, and if you are a priority club member,you will not receive priority club points for your stay if you book thru a 3rd party. Just make sure it's not clear as it was not made clear to me. Ask questions. signed So sad

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect, would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: DSchooling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for an anniversary trip, and we had an amazing time. The grounds were amazingly kept, beautiful, along with the many activities they had to offer. We did not spend too much time at the resort, we used our days up at Disney, but the time we did spend was relaxing. As for those who are skeptic about the timeshare pitching, don't be. We opted for a presentation because of the discounted tickets they offer. (Disney Park Admission and 7 Day Fun Pass) Once they realized that we were only going to say no, we had the rest of the stay free from a sales talk. All in all, had an amazing stay at this resort. The unit was contemporary, clean, spacious, and comfortable. We stayed at a Studio in the main registration building. The proximity to Disney is about 20 minutes (the longest part is traveling within the Disney grounds). There are plenty of grocery shops in area, did not use the grocery options available from the resort itself. Believe me, you will love your stay at Orange Lake Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Cashless & Smokeless”
Reviews.Author: TravelinT62
Reviews.Content: We had a three bedroom villa, for our troop of twelve. Be prepared to pay $49.95 for a Play & Stay pass per person, if you want to enjoy the extra Fun Zone admenities. Including unlimited use of the Hippo waterslide, Bungee Trampoline, mini golf, tubes for the Lazy River. What a blast!! Be prepared for the "no cash excepted" at any inside the resort purchases, even the restaurants. I would suggest bringing prepaid Visa gift cards for spending, or it could get out of hand real quick! Absolutely no smoking in or around the villas, which I appreciated very much. Great place for a family vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, great place for families with teens!”
Reviews.Author: disneyyisgreat
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a seven night stay at the West Village with my best friend and our families. My best friend and I are 17, and let me tell you that there is SO much to do at this resort, day and night! After returning from the parks, we would go get dinner (either at one of the great on property restaurants or just a few minutes outside the resort) and then go swimming at the west village pool! The reason that this resort is so great for teens is because of the activities and recreation. When we checked in last Saturday, the front desk gave us a copy of the activities. The teen beach bash was that night, and we had a blast. We met kids our age who we ended up hanging out with almost every night. The "FUN" activity counselors did a great job in making sure that everybody had fun, and swampy's club was cool too. The area from the lobby to the arcade and pool area is very well decorated. The arcade is so much fun if there is ever a rainy day on your trip! The rooms were amazing...Very clean and spacious. Our room made it very easy for us to get back and forth to the pool and restaurants. Breezes pool bar was great, they had great virgin frozen drinks for kids and live music almost every night. The musician even got us teens to dance! Although we did not have a chance to eat poolside at Breezes Bar and Grille, the food looked pretty good, we'll be sure to try it next time! The resort shuttle was very convenient, since I m not yet old enough to drive the rental car, it made it easier for my friend and I to travel between pools and restaurants (North village, East village, & river island.) After a week of enjoying the parks (which are easy to get to from orange lake,) we decided to spend our last day at river island and then head to downtown disney in the evening. Swampy's character breakfast was good, although it was clearly aimed at children under 12, little kids seemed to enjoy the characters and balloon animals. The hippo slide was awesome, the lazy river was relaxing and great for getting a tan! Also, the massage therapist by the pool was fantastic, and well worth the $15. My only small complaint is the pushy timeshare people. Upon checking in, we were escorted over to the disney ticket area which also had the "7-day play passes" stand. We ended up purchasing the 7 day pass which included unlimited mini golf, tubes for the lazy river, the hippo slide, rock climbing, and bungee jumping. Originally upon purchasing these passes, it was only $100 or all 6 of us... which is a great deal for 7 days! The only thing we had to do to receive that deal is attend the RCI meeting... which we did not want to go to. The salesman was very pushy, and when he finally backed off the passes went up to over $300 because we wouldn't attend the meeting. We paid the $300. I do think we got our money's worth, although our parents didn't use anything at river island except the lazy river. So I'd say only buy the 3 day play pass, or only buy the passes for your kids, unless you plan on using everything at river island. Because realistically, you wont use the play pass everyday of your trip. -- But this is my ONLY complaint of the whole vacation. I had a great time, this is a great pick for a resort near the parks. It's super close to disney and seaworld, and not too far from universal either. I cannot wait to return!!!! I can't say enough good things about orange lake. Overall a fantastic stay, and the free wifi is awesome!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New Jersey in the shadow of GWB
Reviews.Title: “Good time, but expect "cookie cutter" experience”
Reviews.Author: ren1hoek
Reviews.Content: I'm not an Orlando person. I enjoy the beaches in Florida, but I found myself at a two bedroom villa in the West Village of this Orlando resort due to some extended family plans. Good rate, and each villa is exactly the same. I am a Platinum Holiday Inn member, but I didn't get any extras that I usually would get like upgrades or waiving resort fees . Usually I try to check-in and leave the staff alone, but I had to contact the front desk (located a half mile away) a few times: First villa smelled like smoke, second had a broken latch on the back door, and I wanted a late checkout. They gave me until 12, but they told me all keys automatically stop working at 10, so I'd have to go back to the registration desk again. The lazy river pool was a first for me and very cool, but there are no rules posted, and there were a few babies in diapers. I love babies, but since they don't have control of their fecal excretions, they normally aren't allowed in full size pools. Also, you cannot just pick up a tube and use it: The workers will ask to check your wristband. Everyone was nice and pleasant, but I guess with the extremely high volume at this resort and Orlando in general, you're just another body and will be replaced shortly by the next tourist. All in all: very clean, nice people, jet tub in the room was nice, but a "cookie cutter" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: TravlingTS
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days with a large family group and I have nothing but great things to say about this resort. I always like to break down my reviews so here goes. ROOMS - Excellent! We stayed in River Island and the rooms were very nice, clean and spacious. Loved the enclosed patio and the master suite bathroom with Jacuzzi tub. Great dinning area, updated appliances and electronic. Family Room has flat screen and DVD. THINGS TO DO - You actual do not need to leave the Resort. There is so much to do. Lazy River, GameRoom, Fountains, Pool, Slides, Watersports. We actual only left to visit one park which saved a ton of money. Many people complaine about the arms bands and paying $30 for 3-4 days. However think if you had to go offsite to pay for a different theme park every day while there. If you don't want the band you still have the pools (9 of them) and many others. FOOD - Very good and reasonable for a resort. My son actul thought this was disney. We did not run into timeshare people. We declined the offer at the front desk and never heard from them again.

Reviews.Title: “Kids had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: jdcrose
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed at this resort for 3 days in early August. The condo was nicely equiped. Bedrooms were large and comfortable with a television in each room. Master bath was very large with whirlpool tub. Full sized washer/dryer along with detergent were provided within the condo. Screened in porch was nice and overlooked the golf course in the day and we could see fireworks in the distance at night. There was a small waterpark with slides and lazy river available within the resort. Three day passes for the waterpark were available for a reasonable fee. This included the use of rafts for use in the lazy river and a "fun zone" which indluded a small bungee jump and miniature golf. There were many additional pools available free of charge. All pools had towels and lounge chairs available for use. The resort has a variety of restaurants available. They were average in quality and price. There is also a shuttle available for transportation within the resort. We took our bikes and used them to get around. The speed limit is 23 mph which was nice for bike riding although there weren't any bike racks to store them when they weren't being ridden. Suggestions for Improvements: *Staff are rude when trying to trap you into meeting with them to get you to invest in a time-share immediately after check in. The next morning, they began calling the condo to again schedule a meeting regarding interest in the property. Once I was firm with them, they stopped the pressure and we enjoy the rest of the time without further hassle.. *Signage could be improved. The condo was difficult to find within the property. *The day of checkout, we recieved several visits from the cleaning staff reminding us when checkout was. This was annoying the 2nd and 3rd times.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great pools!”
Reviews.Author: Simplicity5
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by the accommodations. We stayed in one of the newer 3 bedrooms. Very nicely decorated, all the amenities we needed, a full bathroom for each bedroom and a screened in porch! The pools were fantastic... we tried out 3 of them, although 2 were definitely more kid-friendly than the one that stayed open the latest. Also, tho on-site pizza was fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Steve T
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this resort for families. This was our 5th visit to Orlando and our 3rd with our 2 children. As our sons are now teenagers we needed accomodation with ample space and ideally multiple rooms. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in the West Village in the main block, booked through Virgin Holidays. The suites are huge, with a large en-suite bathroom to the main double bedroom and a separate small bathroom next to the 2nd bedroom. The lounge/diner is enormous with ample room for a family of four. The kitchen area was large and well equipped. The suites are decorated pretty much as per the website and to a very high standard. The pools, bars and restaurant were all good and this is a great place to unwind after a busy day at the theme parks. The resort is just 5 minutes away from Animal Kingdom, the rest of Walt Disney World 15 minutes away and Universal is approximately 20 minutes along I4. Downside, this is a timeshare resort and they will try to get you to attend a timeshare presentation. Polite refusal worked for me. This is a massive resort and orientation was an issue for the first few days once settled in it was a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A NIGHTMARE!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderer2626
Reviews.Content: It looked great and started out just fine..after checking in and getting talked into a timeshare tour..we entered our private bungalow. This is where it all began..the place was very hot as the a/c was not working very well, then we proceeded to inspect our place thinking we had got a great deal and looking forward to some pool time with the kids so we could enjoy the resort and rise early for the parks the next day. Upon inspection we started to see how absolutely dirty this place was...ugh!! So kept calling the front desk and they kept transfering us to housekeeping which never called us back. After two hours of getting no help what so ever we were irritated enough to venture all the way back to the reception area...after 45 minutes or so someone found us a new room which he said was much nicer...no it wasn't it was dated and someone was still staying there I think...beds weren't made, food in fridge, mens shaving kit and files in bedroom...wow!! So call up to front desk again and ask for man who transferred us there....he sends two guys over to check the place out as if we are lying to him...unbelieveable. So then we wait for him to find some place else to put us and after a half hour or so they take us to a new condo.."oh so nice on the backside of disney's animal kingdom" ...smelled like the backside of a Rhino's behind!!! So these two henchmen let us in the condo and leave...they say they will bring us some new keys for this unit...and be right back. We waited and hour for them to come back with the keys...at this poing after checking in at 4pm it is now 9:30pm and we have been hostages in the new place for an hour. Now no time to go to grocery store, kids starving and I am diabetic....not good and pool closing shortly. So what we thought was going to be a nice relaxing evening before hitting the parks in the heat the next day turned out to be a nightmare....than we finally got to the pool and sat at a table to get some food...the server hands us dinner menus and before I could get mine open she snatches them up and says they are switching to a bar menu....I do not want deep fried bar food at this point...I want a meal after all this agravation. There was another server who came to see what the problem was and we told her our troubles....can't remember her name but she was such a sweet woman. She said she would get us whatever we would like off the dinner menu and we were so greatful. The cook made us a wonderful meal and we sent our compliments and thanks...I know how it is when you want to breakdown your kitchen in a restraunt.....very nice of both of them to try and make our first night turn around. The server even gave us passes to use for one recreation activity there as she said she is aloud to pic one family a day to give them to in order to be good will ambassodor of sorts and brighten someones vacation there. KUDDO'S to her...she was awesome!! As for the rest of the trip...it was a nightmare....the next morning my gf was supposed to go on the timeshare and if cancelling we were supposed to call a certain number to cancel or be charged...I got up at 7 am with not much sleep and couldn't reach anyone till after 8:30 to cancel....no thanks I said!! Also had an inccident with a female security guard after we finally got a clean room, while trying to find our way to food and the pool we ended up going thru the exit and made a u-turn to come back in...after all the confusion earlier we did not put our parking pass in the car...she was not going to let us back in even tho I had the paperwork for the place in my hand...very very rude woman...I am quite certain I am not the first person to ever forget my parking pass......I am a priority club member and stay at holiday in property's all over the country....I love them and have always had a good experience.....this was my first bad one so not bashing HI just this specific property.....the maid even said the places aren't cleaned regularly when no one stays in them....well it would be a nice place if they got it together.....they have some golden employee's and a few that need to be re-trained.....so even if it sounds like a good deal you might be taking your chances with this place....GOOD LUCK!!!! At 11:00 at night they did call to say come to the desk and they would give us a hundred dollar cash reimbursment for our troubles...this hardly made up for all our troubles and lack of sleep and my gf being ill for the weekend from all the stress we were put thru......

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake - Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: theburg727
Reviews.Content: In May, my entire family ( total of 8 people including 2 children) went to Orange Lake resort for a quick weekend get away. The check in process took about 30 minutes at least. There were lots of people checking in and out so I understood why it took so long, but just be prepared to wait in line for a while. After we got checked in and had to drive out to the east village. Now I had been reading about this place a few months to learn about all it had to offer and East Village is probably the worst place to be when you have kids. There were lots of golf courses and a small pool, but we wanted to go to the lazy river. We had to drive all the way down to that area. It was really easy to get lost if you didn't pay attention to the signs. River Island is the place where all of the fun is happening for kids. It's not ideal for people who are not going to Disney because it is a good drive away from Orlando. However if you are there to see Disney it is really close to the parks. The resort was a 2 bedroom. It was nice and clean. The master suite was BEAUTIFUL! We decided to go to the sales meeting. The sales guys were really respectful. I expected some nasty over aggressive pushy people, but that is not what we got. We toured the property and it was just beautiful especially the VIP suites. If we were in the market for a time share we maybe would've bought one. Anyway the sales guys tried to close us on a deal but we weren't interested. They were however very courteous and respectful. Our stay was really nice and I would visit again but next time I want to stay in River Island!!!! River Island is the only place to stay if you have kids at Orange Lake Resort. Overall it was a good experience. Nice, clean suite, comfy beds. We had a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “How much we love our kids? Seriously??”
Reviews.Author: SouthwestPATravelMom
Reviews.Content: Just returned this afternoon from a three-night stay at Orange Lake. My husband is a HI Priority Club member and a few months ago when he was booking a business trip, the HI rep asked him if he'd like to take a three-night trip for $200 to one of the HI Vacation Club properties. The deal was we'd get back the $200 (making the stay free) if we sat through the "two-hour sales presentation." We've been intrigued by different vacation options over the years and wondered what the different pitches would be, so we said yes.
