We decided to leave our 7 and our 3 year old boys at home with the grandparents, skip the parks, and basically go to relax, swim, and explore. I read a lot of reviews on this site and others before we left. As a point of reference for those of you who are trying to learn something about Orange Lake, we've been traveling to different destinations on a variety of types of vacations for many years. We've done a five-night stay at Disney to take the kids to the parks (stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge), we've been to Atlantis twice (stayed at the Cove), we've been to Antigua three times (Curtain Bluff, St. James Bay, and Galley Bay), we've stayed in a condo in downtown San Francisco with day trips to wine country, we've done B and Bs in the British Isles, and we've done countless Jersey shore beach trips at small and large hotels and condos. We've been very lucky to get away as much as we have, and it's made me love travel and become very observant in lots of areas. We decided not to rent a car since we'd planned to leave the property only once or twice. We took a taxi from Orlando Int'l airport to Orange Lake ($60) and got dropped off at West Village registration. I had tried to call in advance to ask what section we'd be assigned and if we'd be able to walk to a pool, since I'd read up on the size of the place and the shuttle service. I never did get through on the phone regarding the room request -- waited through 15-20 min. hold music both times -- but luckily the nice gentleman who checked us in was able to show me on the map that we'd been assigned to East Village to a villa about a five minute walk from River Island. We waited for about 15 min to check in, but our villa was already ready at 11:00 a.m., so again, we were lucky that we could go straight to the room and get in. A driver took us in a mini van to the villa and I mistakenly figured that this was the resort shuttle. The driver was very nice and even gave us his number in case we needed another ride. The 2-room villa was huge and very clean, well-kept and on the ground floor. It butted up against one of the golf courses. The inside looked just like you see in the pictures on the website. It would indeed have been big enough for two families of three or four, or us, the kids, and our parents, or whomever. We had a screened in patio and a view of a small lake. The master bath had a whirlpool tub. No stains or smells or mold, a few teeny spiders that didn't even bother me, the spider-phobe. Keys worked great. Walked to River Island right away, an easy stroll even in the humidity of August, but I was thankful we'd gotten building 86000 -- others in East Village would have been too far, ditto other resort villages. River Island was clean, nice, good service, good lunch brought over to the Leeward bar for us by a pool server from Tradewinds, yummy drinks... fruity rum punches and such were 6.99. Lunch salads and sandwiches were five or six to eight bucks. Not bad, we thought. River Island was super crowded, hard to find a private spot let alone an umbrella, but it was very clean and inviting and the people (guests and workers) were all extremely, genuinely friendly. I found it hard to relax and read from the crowds and the noise (though it might have also been the heat, obviously nothing to do with Orange Lake!) but I had a nice afternoon and after hanging out till five I stopped at the shop, got wine, beer, milk, some toiletries to take back to the room. I walked back. We tried the River Island Grille for dinner ($70.00) and it was okay. Super nice server. Seafood chowder was awesome. Walked back and enjoyed listening to the bullfrogs on the swamp. Went walking the next morning. Found another pool in East Village and the Splash Lagoon complex of North Village but we were surprised to see how small they were. Decided to go back to River Island. Got an umbrella and and walked/swam the Lazy River. Splurged on a cabana ($90.00) and really enjoyed that -- lunch served, sodas in fridge, fruit on table, TV, seating for four. Everyone got kicked out of the pool/cabanas when a storm blew through but it was a great, relaxing day till then. We left the property for an evening at Downtown Disney, and that was tricky. We waited at the shuttle stop for at least 20 minutes. A shuttle went right by on the other side of the road, and didn't even stop to say Hey, be right back, or Another one will be right by... We kept waiting. Finally we called the switchboard number and asked for a shuttle pickup. Eventually one came. It sat maybe 25 to 30 people and was smelly, stinking of chlorine and sweaty swimmers. My seat was damp. The shuttle took a long route to the ticketing and transportation desk where we asked for a taxi. They called for one and it got there in another ten minutes. By this time, the hour and twenty minutes we'd allotted for shopping at Downtown Disney was disappearing fast. The taxi ride ($30.00) took another twenty minutes and we were lucky to walk in right on time for our reservation at Raglan Road (fabulous meal and entertainment there!) When we taxied back to Orange Lake at the end of the night, we asked the driver to take us the whole way to the villa, which we were allowed to do by the guard at the main gate. The three of us had a little trouble finding it in the dark, but we managed. Okay, so the next morning we get up and head to the sales presentation. It was supposed to be two hours -- it was four and a half. Like several reviewers stated here, no less than four gentlemen came out to hard-sell a condo at Orange Lake to us. I stated flat out that we would never use an Orange Lake condo, and they quickly said what we would really be buying would be points that replenish annually that we could use for any HI property anywhere and/or RCI properties all over. I admit I was highly interested when the presenter said we could use the points to stay at "any" of the Disney resorts, and that we could even use them to stay at Atlantis in the Bahamas! We started asking questions after allowing ourselves to be whisked from building to building, golf cart ride to golf cart ride, shown a movie about the HI founder and his inspirational family vacations, and taken to a large cafeteria-style room filled with tables, chairs, and other presenters and potential buyers. I'm talking dozens and dozens of other potential buyers. We didn't expect the cattle call feel to the whole thing. Even when the presenter assured us that only a teensy-tiny percentage of owners could use points to use the fantabulous penthouse suite at the top of River Island, we got up there and the penthouse was crammed with other potential buyers. Here was the total turning point for us: in the elevator on the way down, the presenter said "It's a test, really. Some days you're offered a test." We looked puzzled. He went on, "Buying property here is a test of how much you love your family. What are willing to do for your kids, and the time you spend with them?" Seriously? Once he said that we were so offended we quit considering even a maybe. Turned out that you can use RCI points to stay at Disney -- but only at the villas some resorts have, which was NOT what the guy said. And we eventually got them to admit that you can only "use" points at Atlantis and privately owned hotels (like my favorite places in South Jersey) by converting the bought points to an American Express gift card. We asked for details on that over and over, and finally they said it would take tens of thousands of points to "buy" a gift card of $250.00. In other words, a waste. When finally, four hours in, prices were presented, they and the interest rate were laughably high, of course. But we were surprised how rapidly cheaper options were suddenly "found," and how shockingly fast the interest rate disappeared altogether. We said no, they brought someone to change our mind, we said no again, etc. etc. I felt snubbed one other time too -- when I said I would need about a month with a calculator and the RCI catalog to sit and research whether or not this would be a good way for us to vacation, the presenter scoffed, made a nasty face, and said, "A month? You've got to be kidding. If you can't see how good a deal this is right now..." Eventually, they let us go, gave us our $200 back. They even offered to call the shuttle to come pick us up. Needless to say, we walked.... spent another great afternoon at River Island, ordered Papa John's that night when the on-resort pizza delivery said they'd need an hour and 45 minutes to get a pizza to us, and got a good night's sleep on the decision we'd made not to make a decision. I guess the nutshell version is -- lovely, clean, fun, if a bit crowded; average food; keep your head about you in the sales presentation, if you go, and take a calculator. And ask to sit and read the RCI catalog if you know you won't be returning to Orange Lake very often.

Reviews.Title: “Reunion with college roommates”
Reviews.Author: RetVtLib
Reviews.Content: I am an owner since a few years ago when my granddaughter and I were staying in an inexpensive hotel with a microwave and mini-refrigerator. We were offered free tickets to a Disney park to watch a presentation and fell in love with Orange Lake. We love having a full kitchen to prepare meals in. I have upgraded my timeshare points twice since then. Last February two college roommates and I stayed at a 2 bedroom 2 bath high rise unit. We went to Epcot and the Space Center and visited a college in Lakeland designed by Frank Lloyd Wright. Evenings we played cards, went to dinner, and one day we spent some time at the pool. When I visit with my family, we spend a lot of time at the Lazy River pool. I enjoy the exercise facilities too. In October I am looking forward to a visit with a few friends to play golf.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare of Orlando !!”
Reviews.Author: bluealaskan
Reviews.Content: I am so glad that this was only for one night !! I booked this hotel for the last night of our vacation after a beautiful ten days in Florida. This was the dirtiest and rowdiest hotel I have ever stayed at. The outside stairway to the pool and the windows looking out of our room overlooking the dumpster was covered with dead smashed bugs. Staff was rude about requesting a late chek out, and was still awaken early by cleaning staff and asked when we were leaving. Property was way to large and way too many people,

Reviews.Title: “Great resort just didn't have time to appreciate it”
Reviews.Author: vic1870
Reviews.Content: 4 adults & 5 kids booked a 3 bedroom villa through virgin and it was wonderful. The size was fantastic it was clean and located next door to a small pool which we used once.The pool was clean as were the facilities there and it was great being open til 10.We used Publix onsite for shopping which was well priced and the staff were lovely.We had problems getting in one night (dead batteries in door lock) but they were prompt letting us in and came next morning to replace. On the downside we did get fed up every night having to delete informative messages, wouldn't have been bad first couple of days but 14 just a bit ott.Tried twice for room service but was so busy we picked it up, even doing this the food wasn't piping hot but it was tasty and certainly not as expensive as we expected.Lastly though the villa was clean i do feel the outside needs watching rubbish such as glass and plastic cups do seem to get brushed into the bark/bushes which with little fingers isn't ideal and does let down a beautiful view. Despite these little flaws i would recommend to anyone (no-one can be perfect no matter how they try) and would visit again maybe for longer to enjoy all the numerous attractions on site.

Reviews.Title: “We love Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: world taster
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Orange Lake and return as often as we can for a summer getaway. Our home unit is in the West Village and we enjoy the idea of driving to the front door of our two bedroom two bath cottage. The units are spacious, well decorated and user friendly. Whether you visit Orlando for the Parks, the shopping, or just to rest and relax - Orange Lake is a great place to kick back and enjoy all Orlando has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: joanna_c_c
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at Orange Lake and I would definately return. Spacious apts (we were in a 2 bed) which were fully equipped, homely and clean. Comfy beds great bathrooms, basically a home from home. Excellent to have washing machine and dryer. I loved the pools and the lake - where we had a go at water skiing. Needed to check on bits of work whilst away so used the internet cafe, but it was pretty expensive, something like $5 per half and hour, apparently there are multi day packages which work out better value. Arcade was good, little shuttle bus which goes around the resort was handy. One gripe; I would have really loved to cycle around the resort and it seemed really strange that they dont have any bike rentals - just seemed obvious to me!! Golf course is picturesque and we had a perfect view from our patio of early morning golfers riding up in the buggies to take their shot. Tons of wildlife which potters around freely about the resort. Would love to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Should be ashamed to call this a resort”
Reviews.Author: Country1-10
Reviews.Content: This resort was a prepaid trip to hell. We checked in late so was not told about the timeshare presentation we would have to hear. It ended up being three hours instead of an hour and a half. The was no housekeeping even after we complained that we didn't get the one day we were suppose to. We were told to wash our own towels and then there was only one dryer working on the floor. We would get four wake ups instead of one. The bedrooms are near the hall door so you can hear guests all night long. The room and common areas are dirty from the tile floors, the return airvents and sticking to the carpets in the hallways. The elevtors are worse. The bed had to have a piece of plywood under the mattress. The resort is dated, dirty and has a poor excuse for customer service. The only good experience we had was actually going to customer care and complaining. Stay far away from here

Reviews.Title: “fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 62MrsB
Reviews.Content: Just had 2 weeks at these luxurious apartments. We were in one of the 4 storey blocks and it was gorgeous; beautifully furnished,spacious and well equipped. The kitchen facilities were excellent, we tended to have breakfast here, take a picnic lunch to parks and then eat out in evening.The beds were really comfy and it was great having a bathroom for us and one for the kids.The swimming pools were brilliant-the kids loved the lazy river. We went to the smaller pool near us on several occasions as had more shade and was a bit less hectic!Disney world is about a 10 minute drive away, on several days we went early in the mornig and then came back in the afternoon to relax ready to go back for the evening parades (this worked well in the extreme heat.).There was a publix supermarket , a post office and Target opposite the entrance.Would definately go back.Only negative was balcony was enclosed by netting so did not sit out but most days were too tired anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids but.....”
Reviews.Author: Suez612
Reviews.Content: Pros: a ton of activites for family decent price Cons: didn't like the being bothered by sales people for timeshare (we said no thanks and walked away) Constant activity voicemails Hidden resort fee Paid $9 for tube rentals Met a family who said there room was covered in bed bugs and switched rooms. The lady had bites all over her.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: CTmacan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in River Island three bedroom villa. Villa was great in terms of space and conveniences, although, I wish the pots were a little larger. The pool area was nice but the lazy river pool isn't deep in any spots and there aren't enough straight sections for swimming. The $9 per tube per person per day rental fee is way to high for tubes you can buy for $1. If you want to use a tube you must rent theirs. I even noticed them tell families with infants that they couldn't use those cute covered floating tubes for babies. Other than that, there wasn't much to do. Ate a few times at Anchors, food was ok, price was ok. You have to drive to everything on the resort so we didn't get to the other villages. The Publix is on the resort property and the prices are hiked up, way up. I would go back but would choose a different village because there's not much to do in River Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Pack7671
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake for a week and loved it. The room was great for my family with three kids and my parents as well. The pools were alot of fun. River Island was by far the best. Don't pay the $9 for a tube on the lazy river. Just wait for people to leave them and then snag one. The other pools are great as well. The food was so-so. The breakfast character buffet was fun but the dinner at River Island Grilling Company was terrible. The ribs were awful and the tried to pawn off another piece of steak as a filet and the manager even admitted to it. Trivia at Legacy was fun. The golf was fantastic and I would recommend visiting the McCord Golf Academy. Friendly staff, very knowledgable, good clinics.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected......and MORE”
Reviews.Author: Amelia C
Reviews.Content: I visited the Orange Lake Resort while staying in Orlando for a Timshare presentation. I had NO intention of buying anyting - just wanted the Promo Buckks. I will tell you that the salesman was great - he was able to work with my budget and I left a happy owner. I 'm so glad I did - it has been one of the best investments I have ever made. WE have been back several times and the Orangel Lake Resort NEVER dissapoints. I have a 13 year old son and he is NEVER bored. I like that it is a gated community and I feel safe allowing him to "roam" without me. He likes that there is so much to do and the added sense of "liberty" LOL Basketball, tennis, miniature golf and oh yes the lovely LAZY RIVER! I have invited friends to stay thre many times and all have been very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Lazy River”
Reviews.Author: KevinFrog
Reviews.Content: This is a big resort with many sections. The newest section of the resort is called River Island. Tip- if you want to be by the lazy river , bars and resturant stay at this part. each section does offer something different . Overall I recomend this resort for price ,convenience, and room size.

Reviews.Title: “I don't really care to go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: G B
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned travellor and have been to different timeshares all around. I was told this place was top of the line and it was one of the best resorts. Well I arrived on July 29 and was immediately pleased with my surrondings, when I got to the front desk I was also impressed. I got checked in by Tony and was pleased with how fast check in was. A little too fast I thougt at first but at that time I was bothered. I was informed about the coupon deal they try to sell you so you could go on the one day presentation. That came off as a bit pressuring. The gentleman who was informing my family and I about the presentation facial expression quickly changed when I stated I was unable to go to the presentation. The smile became to a face of disappointment. Persons come to this resort for a vacation not to be pressured into having coupons. I was given my room number we were given a building that was closet to the exit as soon as I arrived to my villa building and walked to the elevators and i was immediately disappointed in the presentation. The elevators looks old and beat down they can be comparable to motel elevators. WHEN I GO ON MY FLOOR I WAS TAKEN BACK NY THE NAST FILLED GARBAGE BIN THAT WAS RIGHT NEXT TO THE ELEVATOR DOORS. ANDAS I APPROACHED MY ROOM THERE WAS A BIG SACK OF FILTHY LINENS SITTING UP OUTSIDE THE DOOR TO THE VILLA I WAS ASSIGNED TO. I went back to the front desk and explained to that I was not pleased by the surrondings of my room and I needed a new villa asap. Luckily I spoke to Olivia and she showed she was truly concerned and she changed our villa. We later ended up in the Tennis Villas which Olivia stated were newly renovated. The rooms are really beautiful the decor can be modernised but the room was nice. The surrondings were also ALOT better however, the elevators were still very dated and abused. Another thing I didn't like was that I stayed at the resort for 7 days and not once did a housekeeper come in to bring fresh linens and towels. I have stayed at other timeshare resorts and atleast one day out of a week someone comes and brings new linens. Besides the fact that they never brought any linens housekeeping had the nerve to call me an hour before check out time to rush my family and I out of the room. I don't care to come to stay at this resort again, I had too may bad experiences and tasteless events during this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: VacationNeededASAP
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this resort! There's always tons to do for families-golf, putt-putt, fishing, waterpark, lazy river, kid's fun area...and more! We've stayed in the 1 bedroom studio & the 2 bedroom villa and both times, the accommodations were very comfortable, spacious, clean and nice. The studio is more modern & fashionable while the villa had more of a "beachy" feel. The restaurants onsite are very affordable & tasty. Prices are similar to Applebee's but taste alot better! Some people complain about the "pressure" of the time share aspect but we just said no thanks at check-in and were not bothered again. This resort is one of my all time favorite vacation spots & I recommend it to everyone. We always have a great time. If you are planning on going to Disney or Universal, I would especially recommend it as it's only about a 15-20 minute drive away but alot less expensive than the typical "Disney" resorts. Well worth the money! I can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with my investment!!”
Reviews.Author: kbt34
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit since becoming owners in Jan 2011! I took my son and my best friends and their son! We stayed in the West Village and spent 2 of the 4 days at Universal! Our villa was beautiful & clean, beds were uber comfy, I was impressed! I thought the highlight of the trip for the kids would be Universal but all we heard the entire time was "when can we get back to the pool!!!" Next time we will for sure save our hard earned money and just stay at the pool! LOL! Can't wait to visit again! Probably for Spring break and we WILL fly this time! No more 7hr drives with 9yo boys!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location....Loved It, Loved, Loved It”
Reviews.Author: TrvlerVirginia
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Orange Lake Resort and Country Club last year and we're planning on returning for this year's summer vacation. The title of the property says it all. There are 10 to 12 outdoor swimming pools, a lazy river, a golf course that is beautiful and challeging for the avid golfer (my brother), plus a man-made beah with water sports, activities, amenities, spa, restaurants, shopping, AND all of the above is on the resort! This resort is located in the heart of Kissimmee, 5 minutes from Magic Kingdom, Epcot Center, Animal Kingdom and 15 minutes from SeaWorld. Plenty to see and due in the area surrounding the resort with Medieval Times, Arabian Knigts and other dinner shows nearby. In addition, there are malls and a great flea market within a 10 minute drive. The resort could not have a better location! We loved the resort accomodations--we had 2 units, both 2 bedrooms for 8 (which included a sleep sofa). The living/dining/kitchen area was very spacious and the bedrooms are very comfortable. I highly recommend the resort for anyone visiting the Kissimmee area.

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: VickieG246
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel but HATED being pestered daily to go to a Timeshare presentation. Decided to stay here based on all the great reviews and my sister was vacationing there. I rented a small 1 bedroom and thought it was very nice! But the constant harassment and daily calling that we received would make me think twice about ever staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would recommend to ALL our friends!”
Reviews.Author: AmyRMB
Reviews.Content: Gated community. Spacious condo units, Full kitchens. We had a 2 bdrm/2 bath unit with W/D and A/C and a screened in porch. Convienient shuttle service for all amenities on-site. FANTASTIC Pools! Lazy river, water slides, sandy beach entry, tubing, lots of cabanas and chairs. On site restaurants, deli's, bar's, and arcade game area. Grocery store also on site for guests only. Starbucks on site! Disney World just 2 exits away. EASY commute to each park.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and going back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ginaluv
Reviews.Content: We stayed the second week of July and had a wonderful time. My husband and 2 children (ages 7 and 2 1/2) were pleasantly surprised with the 2 bedroom villa. We stayed in the West Village, which we heard was old, but ours turned out to be one of the renovated villas and we loved it. It was spacious, the kids had more than enough room to run around, we had our own space. From check-in to check-out, everything went smooth. My only regret is, we didn't get a chance to enjoy the resort to the fullest, because we were at the disney parks for most of our stay. The pools were great, restaurants, activities...all good. The location was perfect, it's very close to the parks and everything you need is nearby (Walgreens, Target, supermarket, etc..) We went to the presentation and didn't get pressured at all and the outcome was becoming owners. That's how much we loved it here. This place is excellent for families and the next time we come, we will try and stay 2 weeks, one week for the parks and the other to stay and enjoy this amazing resort. Don't take my word for it, come and experience it yourself!

Reviews.Title: “need improvement about the customer service and the cleaning !”
Reviews.Author: dansurfer
Reviews.Content: I was there for 2 nights (July 28 and 29th 2011) ! When I made my rsvp I made it for 2 nights. When I came back from Disney on the 29th, I didn't had access to my villa because the reception peoples said that I had 2 separates reservations ! Who made the mistake ?? the call center where I made my reservation (sounds like it's was a call center in India !!!!!). Anyway, when you are coming back from disney World at midnight, you want to go to take a nice shower and be in your bed ! I had to drive back from the villa to the reception dest (a 4 min. drive) to explain the situation !!!!. I also notice some cleaning problem at the 'vent' near the dinner room and also at the master bathroom (the bath tub) ! when you are paying $$$ to a villa, it's must requiered high standard in cleaning and customer services !. The lady at the customer service was kind enough to listen carefully at my opinion about the resort on the july 30th am when I call !. I also tell er about the green garbage bin located at few fett from our villa !!! I'm very dissapointment about the whole thing ! otherwise I will be happy: the villa is nice but located at a dead end...you had no viex about the golf course. The river island is very nice !.

Reviews.Title: “Sales assicaites rude and pressure you,appliances furniture old”
Reviews.Author: arya29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7/26 to 8/02. Check in went smoooth, We have stayed at other villas before in orlando so we were a bit surprised that the furniture was very old as well as the appliances. TV was the classic big style, no flat screens here. Dryer took 2 hours to dry a SMALL load! And the water pressure was very low , it was obvious they were trying to conserve water. As far as the pools my kids loved them. Two fun slides at splash lagoon, this is the best pool becuase river island has a lazyb river but u have to pay for the tubes! The Timeshare was terrible. We have done others before but this was downright rude. Whe we said no we were thrown nasty insulting comments. They then sent 4 more people over each trying to sell us different packages!!! Every time u said no they would insult you. Would i recommed...only if u do not do the timeshare presentation and get this place for $100 or less a night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go for Timeshare Presentation”
Reviews.Author: GenBlock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake on one of their Timeshare promotions and it was the biggest mistake we made. We were in Orlando for a week and most of our trip we stayed at The Regal Palms Resort and Spa which we absolutely loved. It was nice and clean and very affordable for a four bedroom townhouse. We decided to spend the last three nights of our vacation at the Orange Lake Resort on the Timeshare presentation to save some money and because we heard how nice the resort was. It was a nightmare from the time we entered our quarters. They put us in one of their older rooms which had a funny stinch to it and old furniture. It was a HUGE downgrade from The Regal Palms Resort as far as cleanliness and comfort. The carpet appeared old and nasty, so much so that we refused to walk on it with our bare feet. I could not get comfortable anywhere but in the room. My three year old complained the entire time we were in the room that she wanted to go back to the other vacation house. On top of the room feeling like a motel, our timeshare associate was very pleasant in the beginning. That was until we decided that we would not purchase the timeshare. He became rude and insulting and tried to belittle us with nasty comments. Although the resort itself is really nice especially the rooms where the presentation takes place, I would not suggest anyone book using the timeshare promotion. If so you will be placed in a nasty old room and treated like trash if you decide not to purchase. I'd rather pay full price the next time to stay at Rivers Island, Orange Lakes premiere selling room, or better yet stay at the Regal Palms Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait until next year!!!”
Reviews.Author: QUEENBEE1225
Reviews.Content: My family and I(husband, two adult children, three grandkids, three cousins) went to Orange Lake after I received a discount coupon from an owner, and I am so glad we did! I knew we would have to sit thru a 2hr sales pitch, but we did it before so no big deal. We were in a 3bedroom villa in the East Village and it was beautiful and very comfortable. I too was somewhat hesitant after reading some reviews, but we have nothing but good things to say. There is so much for adults and children to do that it all can't be done in a few days. The convenience of the Publix on the property was great, and there is a Super Target right across the street. We had breakfast at the River Island Grille(buffet) and it was wonderful. For those who worry about the other reviews, please don't let that stop you from traveling to this wonderful place! We loved it so much, that my husband and I actually became owners! We were treated to breakfast for our entire family on our last day as a thank you for our purchase. Please visit, I don't believe you will regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Still in progress, but better deals are out there....”
Reviews.Author: TimeShareShy
Reviews.Content: This will be an on-going review of a family vacation that we are currently in the midst of; I like to provide details as soon as possible, for both good and bad situations. Current rating subject to change as our vacation wears on. A few months ago we were sent an invite by Holiday Inn Vacations to take advantage of a 3 or 4 'day/night' stay at the Orange Lake Resort in a single room or a 2 room villa for what appeared to be a pretty good price, if we attended a 2-hour 'Time-Share' "TOUR". I did my due diligence, being a skeptic and a Marriott Platinum status traveler, I had heard my share of bad information about these types of 'offers', but this one appeared to be worthwhile to really see how the property worked. I did price out the stay cost and it was $800 for a week stay in a 2BR villa, that had a full kitchen and a W/D as well. So i made reservations and informed the appointment taker several time during the reservation process, that we would be traveling with a special needs child in wheel-chair, my 70 year old Mother and 75 year old Father-in-Law, and would be needing an appropriate dwelling for them to not have to use stairs. Upon arrival I found the registration clerk to be very helpful and she had to go to great lengths to find us an appropriate dwelling as described when i made the reservation, but we were provided with a ground floor dwelling that was appropriate for the needs of our family. The drive to the unit was pleasant and reminded me of the base housing when I was in the military; the interior was very similar to that as well! Upon arrival at 630pm, we found dirty linens and trash in bags laying on the walkway and other areas. We tested every knob, switch, device that we could think of as many previous reviewers reported non-operational dishwashers, dryers, sinks etc, but it all appeared to work as it should. It was my understanding that we would receive the same house-keeping treatment that I am used to with Marriott properties, which is daily service for trash and towels if needed. This is not the case, as I was informed that if towels were needed, there would be an extra charge per service request. In the main bath, there is a wheel chair accessible shower, which works well for our family needs, however, the shower curtain was installed about 6-inches too high and when the shower would run, water would go all over the floor. We tried several field-expedient solutions, but none worked effectively. Upon contact with the property management staff, i was informed that we should have been provided with 8 sets of towels and if we needed more, there would be a charge to our room. I informed the staff of the shower issue and was told that they would send someone to address the shower curtain height, but they were 2-hours behind schedule and they would also be bringing us 16 sets of towels to help us out, but any further requests would be met with a chage to our bill. When Rose (shortened name of a most friendly male Staffer) arrived about 3 hours later at 1am, he came bearing an arm-load of towels and a new shower curtain that was the same height as the current one. He confirmed that there is a charge placed for towel requests, but he saw out issue and cheerfully provided us with many sets of towels as he stated, "This is a mess and needs to be addressed as soon as possible". So we had enough towels to last us for the next day or two. But the problem still remained for the remainder of the vacation (5-days more). I was please with Roses' comments and appreciate the backlog of open projects, but this issue will be one folks should address to stop any damage from happening to this dwelling. MORE TO COME.....

Reviews.Title: “What a really nice place.....”
Reviews.Author: Pip1128
Reviews.Content: In Orlando for the AAU Boys Basketball Showcase which takes place in July every year. Stayed with 2 other families in a 3 bedroom unit in the East Village. First, I want to say this place is huge. Check in was not until 4:00, we were there early and the place was a madhouse. You don't know where to go at first. There are signs, but they don't make any sence. I read reviews on Trip Advisor prior to arrival, so I knew about timeshare pitches. We told them upon check in we were on a very tight basketball schedule and were not interested. There were some surprises at check-in, so be careful. They placed a $250 "hold" on our credit card, for incidentals I guess, so pay attention to what the clerk tells you because if you used a debit card you may be screwed if that's all the money you have. This is a cash free resort, so I STRONGLY suggest you use your credit card or debit card and pay as you go instead of using your room key. Be careful because as soon as you are done at the desk because they have clerks (in blue jackets) that "escort" you over to the other counter that tries to hook you by telling you that you get $250 just for attending their meeting. We told them, no thanks. They only called once and that was it. Our unit was very very nice. We all decided that we would have no problem living in it because it was like a large apartment. We were in the East Village and on the 6th floor end unit and right on two golf courses. We don't golf, but it was really pretty to see. It comes fully stocked. Pots, pans, glass baking dishes, plates, bowls, mugs, glasses, silverware, steak knives, cooking utensils. Toaster, blender, tea kettle, coffee maker. Hint # 1... turn on the ice maker right away!!! There is a super Target and a Publix right outside the entrance. The Super Walmart is in B.F.N., so don't bother going there, stick with the Target & Publix. Just one thing, we didn't know what we were supposed to do with our trash. While waiting for the rest of our party, we hung out at Breezes by the pool. We were there at Happy Hour, so the beer, rack drinks and nachos were all half price. The table had 4 beers, 2 rack drinks, 2 sprites, nachos and fries and it was $28.00 including tip. They had a DJ setting up in the pool area playing great music and everyone there at the pool seemed to be having a good time. This was the pool at Water's Edge in the West Village. The water sports are crazy expensive. $100.00 an hour for jetskis. $25.00 for paddleboats...yikes. No thanks! Because of our schedule, we were only able to take advantage of some of the amenities. Once we were done, we went to River Island and floated in the lazy river. This was a Tuesday. It was nice at first, but as the day went on more and more little kids showed up. The river was nice an clean until all the little kids started climbing in from where ever and tracked pine needles and all kinds of junk in on their feet. We did not use the tubes because the deepest part is only 4 ft. There is a hot tub and lots to do at River Island. We stayed until the storm came along. . All in all... we had a pleasant stay. Would I go there on purpose for vacation?? Probably not because I like doing things on vacation. I have a pool at home, so I don't need to sit around a pool. We don't golf and I have family that lives on the water and has boats & jetskis. I grew-up on the Chesapeake, so the water stuff is no big deal to me and my family. This resort is really close to Disney, but why stay here if you are going to Disney? There is so much to do here and if you have little kids, they will wear you out. Save your money and stay at a less expensive hotel if you are going to Disney. It really is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Some changes need to be made”
Reviews.Author: kresha
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that we were given a really good rate directly through Holiday Inn Reservations. I did my homework from different sites to find out what the cheapest room rate was for the accommodations in which we were seeking. It was very important for me to try and find a nice place to stay with a full kitchen. When I called Holiday Inn they were about $30.00 higher per night until I told them that I had found the same accommodations through another website. The young lady that I spoke to immediately honored that rate and even asked me if I was a Priority Club Member. I told her no and she directed to me join. She also told me to go on two other websites and join because IHG had a promotion where if you stay 2 consecutive weekend nights they will rebate you $75.00. We arrived July 9th around 4:00pm which is check-in time to find the lobby area very full. We all cringed because we were in for a long wait especially after driving for 12+ hours, but to our surprise my daughter noticed my name on a board and a totally separate line - which was called the Priority Club Members. Our check in was so smooth. They do have a policy where they hold $300.00 on your card as a security deposit but after check-out that is released. That was no problem for us however, I can see where that would be a problem for some on a very limited budget. It would be nice if that was told to you during the reservation process. We checked in to our condo to find a very nice looking condo. A would say housekeeping could be better. Very nice accommodations. Condo was large especially for 4 people. Immaculate property. Very impressive. We signed up for what they said would be a 90 minute timeshare presentation which turned into 4 hours! What a wasted day. Added advantage for your wasted time is taking advantage of getting discounted tickets at the end. They will save you money. PROS: No bedbugs like I had read on the reviews. Very nice accommodations. Lots of activities for children onsite. Beautiful Property. CONS: Parking - We got home from Magic Kingdom around 1:30 am to find that we had no parking near our condo. You would think that if you pay $179.00 night you would have one allocated parking place. I went to the front desk where the representative told me I would have to speak with security in which I did via phone to find out from him that he was useless. He informed me that I would have to park over by the lobby and walk to my condo. I explained to him that it was just me being a female and my two girls. That was ridiculous as well as being very unsafe that time of the night. King Bed could use a new mattress. Needs to be a little plusher. Very hard. No ceiling fan in master bedroom. Could not sleep at night with door shut in the master because it would get so stuffy and hot.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good home base”
Reviews.Author: Momwith5kids
Reviews.Content: First of all, I need to explain that I am a 'neat freak' and I do not stay in hotels that have less than 3 stars, although I usually don't splurge for 5 stars. However, I do like to keep away from the type of people who: scold their misbehaved children loudly, cut into lines, wear "wife beater" tank tops, and who show gluttony by overeating in buffet lines...ok now that you know I'm picky, it will give context to my opinion of the Holiday Inn Resort at Orange Lake: just like others have posted, yes, when you check in they try to direct you to the side counter where they attempt to sign you up for a 3-hour tour of the place so that you will hopefully purchase a time-share, and it is easy enough to avoid no problem. Our apartment was pretty nice, and clean and passes the smell test for me, which is a high rating. However, there is good and bad about this place: First the good: very secure place with a gated entrance; lots of things to do; still new enough to be very clean and not look 'used up'; quiet part of town; great price for a clean condo with a full kitchen. Now the not so good: Hard to get out of the property (high traffic); not very close to Disney; shows some signs of rough treatment (for example, our bathroom sink had some stains on the counter that were ground in, and the plug in the sink was missing, and the clothes dryer was linty from the last people, and there were a few crickets in the bathroom, and the window near our front door was dented, and the front door had some deep gashes in it where someone hit it with something hard and didn't touch it up again), but mainly, there are MANY people walking around as described in the first paragraph that act less than appropriate in my opinion. I think the reason we saw so many of that type of people is because the rate for the room is SO LOW for a full-sized clean apartment on a nice property....there are lots of condo type resorts in the area, but most of them are much more expensive so we didn't see many people 'like us' in this place. Still, we were not bothered by it too much because we kept to ourselves. We did rent jet skis on the little muddy lake, and kayaked too which was pretty good but it was extra. Every little thing at this place is extra $$...they have an inflatable slide that costs extra just to go down, the lazy river looked fine but closes up at 6pm! You can't go in the lazy river without a tube. The tube costs $9 to use. silly! So in summary, we would maybe stay here again if we just wanted a home base and couldn't find anything else a little more suited to our type of people that we'd like to be around. Sorry I sound like a snob, I'm really not, but I don't like to be around yelling, angry people hollering at their kids while I'm on vacation who cut in lines and sag their britches. It was very inexpensive which was nice, but the other parts were just not worth the trouble. Just depends on what you are used to.

Reviews.Title: “Another great OL vacation”
Reviews.Author: SKKF
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Orange Lake and it was fantastic. The resort is beautiful, there are lots of great activities. We loved the change to the arm bands for the lazy river and other activities. We were able to get arm bands for $20 and have unlimited access all week. A great resort for kids and adults, super-close to Disney. We love the convenience of having the kitchen and laundry in our unit. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a family base - watch out for the snakes!”
Reviews.Author: OldWoodster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights as part of our annual summer vacation, 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We were allocated a 2 bed apartment in the East Complex, our apartment was on the top (6th) floor and overlooked one of the golf courses. Check in was quick and efficient, the apartemnt was clean, spacious and well furnished. The Vacations club is a stunning place with absolutely loads to do for adults and kids, the crazy golf, pools, slides, basketball, watersports etc. are more than enough to keep teenagers amused and allowed the adults to have some chill time! I have no negatives - really fantastic place. However when we were on the sunbeds by one of the pools I noticed a 2ft long black snake under the sunbed my wife was sunbathing on - I tried to wake her and get her off the sunbed without alarming her as she has a phobia of snakes - I didnt really succeed and she was in a bit of a state. I think it was an Eastern Racer which is not dangerous to humans - but it did give her an awful fright (and me if I'm honest)

Reviews.Title: “Best resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: ecamps
Reviews.Content: I booked Orange Lake through RCI and it ranks number one on my list of timeshare rentals. The resort is quite simply wonderful, particularly for a family vacation. It is located conveniently close ( by American standards - a car is essential) to all of the tourist attractions in central Florida, and enough has been said about those. But I can't praise this resort enough for the comfort it provided in every respect - to the extent that it was tempting to just stay there. If I did not have children with me, I may never have left the resort! If you want to play golf, go walking or jogging, laze by the pool, enjoy a family barbecue, eat at a restaurant, its all there. Service was prompt and very pleasant. Everyone genuinely seems happy to serve you , from check in to check out. The apartments have everything you could want, and are clean, spacious and well thought out. Security is also top notch - yet unobtrusive. This is definitely a repeat vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Overall The Trip was worth it”
Reviews.Author: bamagirl2976
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Orange Lake on July 20,2011, we stayed there for 5 days/4 Nights. My husband is a Priority Club Member with Holiday Inn. We got a great offer in the mail that we could not turn down. We Checked into a Beautiful 2 Bedroom villa at the East Village(our view was the Golf Course, Which was beautiful, However we are not golfers) Our Villa could sleep up to 8 people, There were a few things that I can point out that I did not like, First of all the kitchen lacked some items that I needed while I was there. I was going to make Kool-Aid for the children but there was not a Pitcher for me to do so, I had to find something to use, also, there was several items in the kitchen that was broken and not working. Our Bed was not the best, but nothing is like your own. The pool at the East village was very nice and quiet. We liked it because it was not overcrowded like the pools at River Island and West Village. The stay was nice, but the only thing we hated about our stay was having to sit through the timeshare presentation. It was suppose to be a 120 minute presentation but we finally got out of there after telling them 100 NO's and 3 hours later. We were greeted by a salesman on a Golf Cart but when we left after saying No, they sent us back to our car by a shuttle bus. Those 3 hours we were at the Presentation, We could have been making memories with our family. The Club Vacations Program/Timeshare which they would not call it a timeshare, was highly priced and not fit for our budget. It was brought down in $$ after we said No, but still not able to fit that into our budget. Hopefully you will have a Good Experience when you visit Orange Lake. Overall This Trip was good, all except for the Club Vacations Presentation(time share).

Reviews.Title: “So near to everything yet so far from the maddening crowds!”
Reviews.Author: CoupleOfBrits
Reviews.Content: Great accomodation on a lovely site, even if you don't play golf! This was a timeshare swap for us, timeshare staff were reasonably persistent but not in a salesman way so we were fine just being firm that we were not interested in the free tour site and breakfast. We had a Two bedroom condo (most accommodation is bungalows, we had one of the few 2 storey blocks, upstairs). Balcony looked out over the lake with a golf course going around it, the air seemed to have a lovely golden hue to it that just made sitting outside lovely, even if it was very hot. There were people next door and below us but we did not hear them at all. House keeping and security staff were very good. Set out in four areas, north, south, east and west, each has it's own style including pool and restaurants. There are frequent minibuses that go around the site, excellent if you cannot be bothered to drive to the pools or for the children to use on their own. Non cash or credit card site, use your room key to charge everything. The Publix supermarket is just outside the East entrance, very handy and I believe the minibus goes there as well. There is a shop at the West Entrance Reception but it did not seem to do basic foodstuff (milk, bread) or I just missed it. This was booked as my 2nd week in Orlando, the quiet week instead of going to the coast, it was amazing that you could be on the doorstep of Disney but feel so away from everyone. The Sportsbar Grill was excellent, relaxed, great food and really nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday yet.”
Reviews.Author: reet60
Reviews.Content: Just back from Orange lake and we are organising next years but will stay 3 weeks as 2 not enough to pack in all that is available in resort. I read other reviews on this resort and have to say we had no complaints. The staff are very helpful, yes we did get a call about time-share but declined and heard no more. We had a problem with patio door and after ringing house-keeping, it was fixed within half an hour. The grounds and amenities are very well maintained , the golf course is fab and the pools fantastic. You almost have too much choice and not enough time, I could quite happily never go to the parks and spend my days here, although may make time for some shopping, Only draw back, it is a cashless resort, so need to use your cardkey if wanting to hire Tennis rackets, tubes for pool or just buying a coffee at cafe. We spent in 2 weeks $250 but that did include a couple of lunches. If you are careful it could be a lot less and I intend next year to be more aware. I would highly recommend this resort, our bungalow was in the older part and I seen some negative reviews about these but we had stayed here before and although a bit more worn I like the fact that you can open your patio door and step out onto the golf course. Our bungalow was very well presented and had an excellent welcome pack containing coffee, salt, pepper, kitchen and toilet rolls,refuse bags, washing up liquid and dish washer tabs. Towels and sheets were replaced twice when we were there and we had a complementary clean. All staff on resort are both helpful and informative and as it is such a large resort says a lot about the importance placed on customer care. I would defy anyone not to have a good time here. Will be back next year but for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great for access to Disney and beyond.”
Reviews.Author: martmcgrgr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our recent family vacation to Florida. We were allocated a 2 bedroom Villa in West village. The Villa was really nice. It was clean and well aid out than some other resorts that we have stayed in over the years that we have visited Florida. Our villa over looked a part of one of the resorts Golf courses, but this was no problem as we were far enough away from the fairway for it not to be any bother. Also, we were just around the corner from a nice quiet pool, which was great for the kids to have a splash, after a hot day at the parks. We wil definately be returning here in the future as we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “See for yourself”
Reviews.Author: Rckyr
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before I went down to the resort and when I arrived I found myself really getting pissed that none of the problems I read about did not come up. We booked 5 months early so I knew we could not get our deposit back, so I was ready. We had the 2 bedroom villa. We actually arrived 1 day early so I can have extra time to fight with them I swear. We parked in front and went in and not only did they have our villa ready but we checked in early. No extra charge the people that work at the front desk were so sweet and quick I looked at my wife and said I feel so stupid. We got our key drove to our villa it was so beautiful from the time we checked in to the time we checked out from the restaurants,' POOLS', and ARCADE" we went to everything they offered this was the best VACATION EVER I swear on my life 5 days of heaven the best staff u can meet go go go go keep your doors closed and there will be no bugs. The villa was clean and there was enough towels and sheets, so please go see for yourself I even left tips. My name is ricky we went in July 2011 they did not bother us with timeshare, so go for yourself and see what I did. I think some people just want to much they are not at home there on VACATION its more people on vacation then you ,so just be patient. I am going back and i'll see u guys there. I loved it. Ricky R

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but make sure to read the fine print.”
Reviews.Author: nicole1221
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends and family. We had 3 small ones, ages 10 months, 1, and 5. So much to do for kids. The Splash Lagoon pool was our favorite as it had a FREE slide for the kiddies to go down as much as they wanted without having to pay like you do at the other school. Room was beautiful. Fit all 8 of us easily with room to spare. Jacuzzi style tub was amazing! Be prepared to drive wherever you need to go on grounds. Place is too huge to walk anywhere. Publix and Super Target on grounds, which was awesome. Awesome location to attractions and restaurants! Outback, Olive Garden, Longhorn, all within 3 miles. Cons: Pushy sales pitch. Just take your phone off the hook for your entire stay and you will not be bothered. Read the fine print of anything you sign upon check-in. They will "automatically" sign you up for the time share presentation and charge you $30, but not tell you that you are signing up for it or that they are charging you. Also, they say they are putting a $300 HOLD on your credit/debit card for any possible damages, but in fact they TAKE the money from your account instead of putting a hold on the money. Told it would take 7 to 14 days to have it returned once room was "cleared." I took pictures of every inch of the 3 bedroom villa we stayed in upon checking out to show how immaculate we left the place in. Just make sure you read EVERY piece of paper they have you sign upon check in. Check-in/reception staff are rude. All other staff fairly nice, but not overly. When called about the "hold" charge put on the debit card, was met with a rude woman who refused to help, then when asked to speak to a manager was told she was the ONLY manager in the ENTIRE resort on duty. I told her if she didn't find me a manager above her I than wanted to be connected to the corporate office and speak to the CEO. Miraculously, the customer relations manager was found within 10 minutes. "Hold" refunded immediately. The stay itself was great, except for the money issues. You do have to pay for the tubes, but most people leave them in the water or will just hand them to you and when you go through the lazy river and get to the end when the people ask for them just keep on going by. They won't try to stop you or chase you. We did it several times. They are not aggressive about making you return the tubes. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants because they are just too over priced and will all the restaurants surrounding the area, we went with what we already liked and knew was a good value. Pros: Rooms, pools, location. Cons: rude staff, nickel and dime, pushy sales. I would stay again, but now I know what I'd be dealing with and would handle it much better. In fact, we are returning for a week in October. Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...just a few bugs!”
Reviews.Author: GroovyTeach9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very nice 2 bedroom condo for one week. Pros: awesome condo...large and fun, great pools, great location for Disney World Cons: Killed about 10 cockroaches over our stay, our room was missing pillows upon arrival so we called to ask for some around 1 pm abd then headed out to WDW and when we returned at midnight still no pillows, so we called again and then still no pillows at 1 am so called again and then they were delivered. The last night our keys wouldn't work so we had to drive to registration to get new ones. Overall a nice place but I will never stay off property when going to WDW....nothing tops their service and commitment to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience but not all the amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_AshleyWills
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just left Orange Lake Resort two days ago and we did love it. We went there as our honeymoon because our first vacation together was in Orlando and we wanted to "recreate" some of the magic that happened there. We stayed in river Island, which is the newest part of the resort. The room was wonderful. It was spacious, had a full kitchen, flat screen TV in the living area, and a nice bathroom. My husband loved the Jacuzzi tub to just lay there.As far as excursions the best experiences were lazying about on the Lazy River, karaoke, and going to Universal Studios. The resort itself is very beautiful and inviting. The people that work there seem genuine and ready to help you out. The poolside massage is a very nice treat and the Leeward bar staff, the poolside bar, are so very friendly and will easily start a full blown conversation with you. The resort shuttle staff are also very friendly. Rosa and Emmanuel were my favorite resort shuttle drivers. My only complaints are that we are Orange Lake owners and we still had to pay so much for certain amenities. The lazy river tubes are $9 per day which is ridiculous. I understand that any company has to make money but according to the sales rep who tried to upgrade our timeshare, the "vacation business is booming." I just think that if you are basically paying a mortgage very month, then for the week that you are there with your loved ones, you should at least be able to get a free tube to float in the lazy river. I am sure that there are plenty of guests to pay $9 for a $4 tube. I am sure that a member of the team would retort with we could have purchased the Fun pass or whatever it was called for $49.95 but if I don't want to buy a $9 tube, why would I buy a $49.95 package? Also we opted out of renting a car, big mistake. You spend about the same or more on taxi and shuttle service to the parks.We ate at the Riverside Grilling company for breakfast, which was great. It was an all you can eat buffet for $8.99 and for children it's only $3.99. But I would not recommend going there for dinner. It's overpriced and there are small portions. We ended up going to the Legacy Bar and Grill which had entrees that were half the price of the Riverside Grilling Company. Overall the experience was good, and despite my complaints I would still recommend anyone to stay here, just be sure to bring some extra cash ; )

Reviews.Title: “Great Remodeled Villa on Golf Course easy access to Theme Parks...Nice Place to stay in Orlando, FL”
Reviews.Author: kimmiser
Reviews.Content: Went to see the final STS-135 Space Shuttle launch at Kennedy Space Center on July 8, 2011 and stayed for a week at the Orange Lake Resort. Overall, this was a great trip for our family. The resort was really nice with abundant amenities for both kids and adults. We stayed in a 2/2 villa in the West Village and it was spacious and newly remodeled. I would say the villa was at least 1000+ sq. feet and was nicely decorated with flat panel TVs in the living room and both bedrooms. I have to say the beds were VERY comfortable, the master had a king bed and the kids had 2 queen sized beds. We all slept very well and the sheets were nice and soft. The kitchen was granite countertops and had a dishwasher, microwave, oven/stove combo, blender, well-equipped kitchen with pots, pans, baking dishes, plates, etc. Also, in unit washer-dryers which were very clean and almost new. It was nice to be able to do laundry in the comfort of your villa and not haul clothing to a Laundromat. The Orange Lake staff was nice and accommodating, no problems with asking for things for the unit like paper towels or toilet paper. The lazy river is huge and very popular. Sometimes it was too crowded with so many people and kids it reeked of chlorine and was understandable but it did not make me want to go in and swim. Fortunately there are several other pools, I think they have 13 total pools on the property, so you just have to find one that is less crowded and it’s fine. The pools were all pretty clean and well maintained and the snack bars were okay food if you get hungry. There is a great steakhouse right outside the property called Longhorn's and we had dinner there...check it out! Great steaks, full bar, good prices! If you like barbeque, take a 30 minute drive to Winter Garden, Fl or Winter Park, FL and check out 4 Rivers Barbeque...true Texas bbq! Too die for and everything is delicious. We drove out there 2-3 times during our visit it was that GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeepers or thieves”
Reviews.Author: Cooljazzjunkie
Reviews.Content: Accommodations were great. Pools great. Cleanliness of room great. Smell of rotten mulch by lazy river horrible. A housekeeper entered our room uninvited and I can only imagine her intentions. We were not scheduled for housekeeping yet she used her pass key to just come into our room. I had read prior reviews about things missing from rooms and after I "greeted" the housekeeper I made sure to leave no valuables in the room and took them with me whenever I left the room. An accident is waiting to happen at the west village entrance. Bad placement of a stop sign combined with security waving people past him causes potential accidents and is an incredible safety hazard. Other than the above things the family had a great time and I would revisit making sure to not leave anything in the room for staff to steal

Reviews.Title: “Feels like going home!”
Reviews.Author: mbrat55
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and both times the lodging was outstanding. The units were very clean, spacious and homey. Our stay both times was in a 2 bedroom unit, but we have seen the one bedroom and it is also very nice. We didn't like the location of the unit first assigned to us upon arrival, but when we asked to switch, they went out of their way to find us one that we liked. Customer service is outstanding! In addition, the location in Kissimmee is great. It's close to great restaurants and shopping and just a short drive to Disney. We definately will be vacationing there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Enablers of theft and no consquences towards thieving employees”
Reviews.Author: MamaHughes
Reviews.Content: Had 3 beautiful 2bd/2bth villas while we stayed there. Everything costs money while you are there, but it's vacation and you have to expect that a little. We didn't cut costs on anything. 10 7-day passes for access to mini golf, rock wall, bungee, slide, tubes.. etc.., total cost $500. Rung up over $450 to our room in food and drinks. I say these details to stress to Orange Lake Resort management how much money they will be missing when we don't come back. We left very early in the morning to fly back home and amongst the commotion of completing packing and grabbing something to eat I realized as we were headed down the road to the airport that I forgot my cell phone. A Verizon Droid 2 that is valued at $400. I would have turned around and got it in a heartbeat but I would not have just made myself miss my flight but the rest of our party as well. I figured with all the great customer service and friendly faces we encountered there I would have to problem getting them to mail my phone back to me. I called went my plane landed, still early in the am, so I am sure our room had not been cleaned yet. I told them EXACTLY where I am POSITIVE my phone was left and when I called back to check on the status (because no one there figured to call me), they said it was not found. They sent a security officer to check again and still nothing. When I told the woman, who originally took my initial claim, that I would like to ensure that whoever cleaned or entered my room be questioned I was told they don't treat their employees that way. EXCUSE ME?? I've worked enough management, customer service jobs, and jobs where employees can steal, that you need to let them know that you are watching them. Some way of tracking which employees are handling what rooms and if items continuously keep missing under their supervision so then you can let them go. Otherwise, you are enabling them to continue. If that is the case, you can better damn well believe that no matter how much I liked that resort our family will take our business elsewhere. I am not an owner there, so I have no commitment to them. Oh, I was told there will be a 21 day investigation into finding my lost property and after that 21 days are up I get a lovely letter saying "sorry about your luck". Yet, I call a week after my initial claim and they have nothing on record about what they have done in this "investigation". I will continue to smear their name in the mud until my phone is recovered or there is a true investigation into all of the employees that entered my room and someone is fired.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT RESORT - WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: Lisamorris
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when reading the reviews about this resort even although I stayed here 8 years ago. However when we arrived my worries were laid to rest. We had 2 apartments in the West Village overlooking the golf course and tennis courts etc, with teenagers in our party this was the perfect location as we utilised the tennis courts. Pool was 2 minute walk away which my 2 year old son adored. Was a little worried about being a cashless resort however taking a cash passport meant I didn't need to worry as you could make purchases with this card. Dined at Breezes one night and a few lunch times and again food was great and staff were excellent. Accommodation was lovely spacious and couldn't have asked for more. We moved onto a villa the 3rd week however could have easily stayed here for 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok -- for us the pools were the highlight”
Reviews.Author: Picturesmakememories
Reviews.Content: This was an ok resort. I agree that the time share pitch was way too long and the salemen were bordering rude and insulting. How can you go from $40,000 down to $7,500 in less then 30 minutes. The room we stayed in was large enough, and I liked having the kitchenette - but the room was dirty - I don't think they vaccuumed the room before we arrived. Everyday around the same time in the afternoon a fishey smell came out of the air conditioner. It was also very loud in the room at night for sleeping. As far as the resort - we had fun, the pools were nice, the restaurants were alright, we did mini golf and the kids went to the arcade. We also took part in the alligator show - that was cool to hold one of them. As far as the staff - the only one that was not helpful or nice was when I went to get my statement the night before - it was with a young lady at the front desk - she seemed to dislike her job and that showed with her bad attitude. Overall, don't set your expectation to high and you will have a good time here - remember that there are so many other things to do in the area. It is what you make it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it we will be back”
Reviews.Author: lhm1305
Reviews.Content: After reading earlier reviews was a little bit concerned about what to expect. On arrival check in was smooth and we made it quite clear we were not interested in time share sales pitch so no one pushed it an we heard nothing more about it the whole holiday. Stayed in a 2 bedroom villa (2282) in the west village and it was lovely. Spectacular view of the lake and island green on cranes bend golf course. The villa could have been cleaner if you looked closely but it was fine for us.Also bedding It was bit tired and had holes in sheets, cleaned after 8 days but we had to call to ask for it. Apart from that villa was excellent for our stay. Facilities were great and all pools and pool areas were very clean. Golf was also great and very reasonably priced. Found all staff very friendly and helpful during our stay. It is a cashless resort which worked for us. Worth buying the 7 day passes for putt putt golf and tubes for river island. Food was very good in resort and value for money though we ate out a lot. Market place shop was very pricey though. All in all we loved our trip and would definately go back, already thinking of booking for next year. I would not listen to the negative feedback regarding timeshare selling as it was not a problem at all. Stayed July 2011, travelled with family

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: dpsmermaid45
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the West Village, two bedroom villa for three nights. The room was upgraded with flat screen TV's. We really enjoyed our stay at the Resort. We declined the Timeshare presentation due to other activities that we already had planned. The 3 day play pass is perfect for kids for $25 (although we didnt purchase, it would have been worth it even for 1 day ). Windward Pool Bar at River Island has good food and reasonable prices. Loved that the Resort was cashless and everything was charged to the room with your Room Key, makes it easier and you dont have to worry about carrying any money around with you. Kids loved the Lazy River, Slides and the Infatable Water Slide. Excellent choice from my perspective!! Entire family was happy!!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD RESORT!!”
Reviews.Author: jstroede
Reviews.Content: So the price that we happened to find it at definatly helped with the all caps review...but it really was a great resort. The location I thought was very good, the condo that we were in was clean. We were right in front of the large pool with the the lazy river. All the staff we met were courteous. Some potential negatives: One review said they nickel and dime you once your there. Well, I had to think back on this one. Condisering we found a week stay for $199, it didn't bother me that much. But yes, in hind sight, having to pay for a bracelet to use the tubes for the lazy river seemed a little over the top, and the arcade room is over priced. But they do have some free activities for the kids in the rec room scheduled throughout the week. My wife and I have been keeping our eyes open for the right price to book again this year. They also have pretty decent golf specials and the course is pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Fall for the Timeshare "prison" meeting!!!!! HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: amethyst2950
Reviews.Content: We thought this would be a fun resort with a waterpark for our kids. After we checked in we were steered to a desk with an overly friendly man who said that in exchange for $250 and our attendance at a 90 min. presentation about "opportunities" we could get 5 free 7-day passes to the waterpark attractions. We should have yelled "NO!" and kept walking! But we fell for the pitch, and the next morning we left our 3 small children in the resort's daycare room (mostly TV's and coloring for the kids, that's it) and were whisked away across the resort in a golfcart, where we sat down with an aggressive salesman who asked us dumb questions like "why do you think vacations are good for your family" over and over. Then we were forced to watch a stupid video about how great Holiday Inn is, and by this time 2 hours was up and I asked to be taken back to our children and was told "NO, we HAD to tour the condo!" that he was trying to sell us. So groaning, we toured the condo, with no intentions of buying because "Joshua" wouldn't tell us terms or a price! He wanted us to buy a timeshare with NO other information besides "Vacations are Great for your Family and Marriage!" 2 1/2 hours later, our obligation time was way up, and I asked for our $250 refund AND to be taken to our small children immediately, otherwise we would have to walk a mile in the heat to collect them. I was told "NO, I had to wait for another salesman to talk to us". ENRAGED, I DEMANDED to be taken to our children IMMEDIATELY, and finally, we were given an official paper saying we completed the damn meeting buy some other "important" guy, stood in line at a cashier, got our cash, and then were able to catch the shuttle back to get our kids, 3 hours later!!!!! They were fine, but bored. What a waste of our vacation time! They sat in a room watching TV while we were irritated by an idiotic salespitch, when we could have been enjoying the pool and making the valuable vacation memories that those idiot salesmen wouldn't shut up about!! We didn't even use the passes, as we left for home the next day. At least we know to never put ourselves in that position again!!!! The pools were CROWDED and the area around them smelled like rotten mulch, and the whole visit made me sick. I hated it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: har35
Reviews.Content: I pre-booked our vacation with a discount that required the "90" minute timeshare sales presentation. The actual time was about 2 hours. I have done these a few times and knew pretty much what to expect. The sales staff were very professional and polite. I see many complaints here about their tactics, but realize, they are trying to sell packages to make their money. With that said, let me get to the resort. We stayed in the West Village, which is the oldest part of the resort. Our Villa was clean and comfortable. 2 Bedrooms, full kitchen, living room, TV in each room. Private parking right outside our front door. It was so relaxing to have a private villa instead of just another hotel room. The resort was in immaculate condition. We arrived around 5:30PM, check-in took only 5 minutes. The staff everywhere were friendly, helpful, and yes, unlike what some here say, almost all spoke english. I see many complain about the spanish language. I guess being from Miami, I am accustomed to hearing spanish being spoken. Yes, I did hear some of the resort workers conversing in Spanish, but not to excess. The pools were awesome. My kids would not get out of them. In fact, I have the 4 day Disney park hopper passes and only used 2 days. (Will definitely stay at Orange lake to use the other 2 days) My kids enjoyed the resort so much, you never really have to leave. I see where many complain about the extra costs at the resort. When we went to the Lazy River complex, they are supposed to charge $10 for the flotation device, but there were so many tubes in the water that you could use them without paying. The pools were so clean, I could not get the family out of them. They even have a "Dive-inn" movie. Yes, you can swim/lounge around pool while they play a movie-totally awesome. The kidzones/gamerooms are great. Right outside the main entrance, you have a Publix and a Super Target, so it is very convenient to grocery shop. You are only about 5 minutes from the main entrance to Disney. I guess I could ramble on and on about this resort. I can enthusiastically recommend this resort to anyone venturing out to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast and would return”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily30889
Reviews.Content: Our family really enjoyed the resort. The villas were very clean/well stocked and the staff was very friendly. When request were made, they were handled in a timely manner. After reading some of the reviews prior to our trip, I was very skeptical about our choosing this resort, but over all we had a wonderful time. The most important thing is that the children had a great time. Be aware of the timeshare sales!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Timeshare meat market”
Reviews.Author: AndyC100
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort on a recommendation from our hotel in Orlando. Being regular visitors to Orlando we thought it couldn't hurt to see what it had to offered, and not being completely naive we figured there would be some kind of sales pitch involved during the course of our visit, but we went with the simple intention of seeing what else was available at these resorts. What we found was a horrific experience, amounting to a us feeling like prisoners for 4 hours. We arrived only to be allocated our own "rep", who pretended to be interested in us and our holiday experience so far. This being our first day there was little to discuss. He marched us into what reminded me of a high school dining room full of smarmy salesmen with too much hair gel, all talking AT people like us, families, couples, the noise was deafening. To cut a long story short the tour was supposed to last 90 minutes max, and our "rep" dragged it out to 3 hours. We listened patiently to the figures and the offers they had and politely refused. What followed was a line of 4 different salesmen. Each one leaving the room, only for the next to come in, repeating the same "the sales force has been called off now, so you can relax" before then proceeding to try and sell us another lesser value package.
