After another hour it became laughable that each person through the door was yet another salesman hoping they could "break us". By this time we found ourselves in an office with a closed door feeling decidedly uncomfortable and having to ask them to let us leave. Once they realised we were not going to buy anything they "set us free" leaving us in the middle of the resort, miles away from the carpark where we needed to be. They had chauffeured us out here with posh golf buggies, but now we were left to our own devices and had to catch a lift back from an unsuspecting member of the resort staff. I feel angry that we were made to feel like this, and I can only think that we were not stern enough with our refusals, but as it's my nature to be polite, perhaps I was caught out and should have been rude to this kind of people. In summary, the resort did not look anything special, the pools looked overcrowded, and the resort was miles away from where I would want to stay. However having not stayed in a real room, and only having seen the show room, the quality of the "real rooms" I cannot comment on. If you are offered a "tour" of this resort I strongly recommend you think twice because it's extremely likely you will subjected to a grilling by the Timeshare team!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Tryingtobenice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and will never come back due too bed bugs! I dont need to say any more, ruined our vacation the children are afraid to go to bed at night even after we switched rooms. So depressing came along way for this!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time not quite as good as in 06?"”
Reviews.Author: lDLCNMEE
Reviews.Content: this was our 2nd trip to orange lake resort we stayed in a 2bed 2 bath villa in the north village. it seems like they have not done much for simple maintance or updating. our picture window was so dirty you almost couldn't see through it there were stains on the seat cushions. my kids found a oreo cookie on the carpet and there was a pile of hair near the bathroom door. the walkway to the second floor have lilac trees growing over them and it hadn't been swept up. we called the front desk about the walkway and a beeping smoke detector and they did whatever we asked of them. but i think if you don't call they never take care of theese things. the absolute worst part of the place is something they don't tell you and i didn't read anything about them charging 49.00 per person per day for a pass to use the tubes in the wave pool and slides. they do offer a discount if you take their timeshare preview so be prepared the 1 hr preview was about 2hrs and 4 sales people until they gave up on us. we paid 20.00 compared to 200.00 the water park should be a perk for staying with them not a fishing hook for timeshare sales

Reviews.Title: “Yuck, day one”
Reviews.Author: MMR1514
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our one bedroom ( north village). The common hall was humid an musty. Once in our "villa" we found each of the bath towels folded neatly and damp. Further, housekeeping left a child's crib in the master room and a high chair in the dining area. Thank goodness we brought laundry detergent (although a vacation). I had to was all the bath towels, hand towel and wash clothes; it creeped us out the were still wet. If you choose to play at River Island, do it early, the "River" allows many, many guests the opportunity to avoid bathroom breaks, yuck! If you'd like a cabana do it in person; 55 minutes on hold ( no kidding, nearly 1 hour!) The "tour", be prepared... 4 "closers" each with a better deal :( this was day 2 and nearly 3 hours of our life wasted (we were told it would be a hour only). Am I a notorious complainer? NO... Never as we have traveled frequently this is my first review of any of our stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time - Love the place”
Reviews.Author: Wickieboy101
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this place, spent 20 days here and had a great time. Lovely large apartment which overlooked the lake and the golf course. Only tried two pools but they were superb, especially the Lazy River. Had everything you needed, really helpful staff (apart from Housekeeping who left my son's clean sheets on his bed without making it and then didn't return to collect the dirty sheets despite several calls - we just took them to reception!), only one polite phone call about Timeshare. My ten year old had many firsts, he went into a cabana, played his first 9 hole golf course, did karaoke. And we still had time to go to Disney, Universal, SeaWorld and the shops as they were only a short drive away!! When we return to Florida we'll probably be back despite the comical issue with the bedsheets!.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place, Definately would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Texgig19
Reviews.Content: I heard lots of people complain about pushy timeshare sales people, I never had to deal with them once. Stay away and dont answer the phone. If you want the discount stuff then you have to understand they are going to try and sell you something. The place was very very clean and my kids loved the lazy river at River Island, people complain about $9 tube rental prices, In my opinion you really dont need one, we had fun just going around to river and sliding on the slides. yes they charge for some things but you can have a great time with or without that stuff. We stayed in East Village and could see fireworks from Magic Kingdom every night at 10pm from the front balcony. This was a great place and having Target right across the entrance was convenient. The best place to eat for the money if you have kids nearby is Millers Ale house, we ate there back to back. 25 min drive to Universal, 15 from Magic Kingdom, 20 to Wet N Wild. Rent a car unless you want to wait for property transport van. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: levittownfamily
Reviews.Content: This resort has everything you need for a vacation. We stayed at river island and everything at the resort is a reasonable price. Pools,slides,lazy river, golf, resturants,gamerooms,clubs, and many many more perks. The villa we stayed in was 2 bedroom and in immaculate condition. We were so upset we had to leave. We were approached a couple of times for a timeshare meeting, but I already own a different timeshare program and was not hassled at all. You get more bees with honey than vinagar so if at the resort they call more than once just politely say no thanks if not interested and your stay will be amazing. But once you stay there you will never want to leave and my family and I wish we could buy here . Never the less we will definatley be returning for a vacation here. in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “nice pools”
Reviews.Author: BloomingtonFamily
Reviews.Content: The resort is well maintained & clean. Kids loved the water slide at the North Village pool. Unfortunately this resort was quite far from all the attractions of the area. Probably a better option for golfers, rather than theme park goers.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, but awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: Stevenhume1221
Reviews.Content: Our experience was decent. However during your check in, expect to wait in line for well over 45 minutes on an average day. Also, DON'T answer the phone in your room. You will be harassed by marketers throughout your stay (that is unless you decide to pick up the phone and express your feelings like I did. Needless to say, it worked). The shuttle drivers are rude. Don't bother flagging them down because they won't stop. Even if it is raining so hard that you can't see your hand in front of your face and you are standing outside being soaked. I wouldn't recommend this resort. The website makes it look great, but it's not all that awesome. Oh and also the pricing on stuff is high. We stayed in a villa (a more expensive option) and even little things like going to the lazy river cost you ten dollars just for a tube. I would not recommend this location to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for young children!”
Reviews.Author: SuzannieWannie
Reviews.Content: We just returned after staying 9 nights at this property in West Village. This family vaca was me, my husband and two sons (ages 1 and 2). It was fantastic! The 2 bed/2 bath condo is huge and has absolutely everything you need! The front desk was very helpful in getting us an extra pack n' play and they called after a couple of days to see how our stay was going. The pools are great! The best one for toddlers is at North Village. All the pools were very busy, but we had no issues getting towels and lounge chairs. We only ate at the West Village pool restaurant (I think it was called Surf Side??). Good food and reasonably priced. They have live nightly music. There is a Super Target, Publix grocery store and Walgreens very close. Disney World is only a few miles away....its a very easy drive. In the nine nights we were there we did see 5 roaches (all were dead except one). This is the reason I gave it a 4 star instead of 5. They sprayed the second day we were there. The issue is not the cleanliness of the condo/property, but all the lush greenery, ponds and lake right outside your doors. This seems to create a perfect environment for water bugs. We received a few phone messages from a timeshare person the first two days, but once we actually talked to her, we politely declined her invitation to have us attend the meeting. She didn't call again. Overall, this is a great place to stay and we would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: blissful34688
Reviews.Content: I have to say that we were a little skeptical after reading all of the (bad) reviews but it was the complete opposite! Check in was quick. No one pressured us to do the tour. The staff was so friendly. The service was great! The food was incredible! The room was Beautiful! Most of all this Resort was like a Paradise! We had such a great time and our daughter had so much fun that we can't wait to return!!!! I would suggest everyone go whether you have kids or not!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: italksalot
Reviews.Content: orange lake resort is a wonderful place. Friends of ours have been begging us to come here for a couple of years and we kept declining the invite. Finally they convinced us into sharing a condo with them. We "rented" the condo from my friends sister and therefore split the price. We where a little worried as there was 8 of us in a 2 bed room condo but had no problems at all we could have fit at least another family of 4 and had enough room. I did get a great tip for a large family, ask the resort to bring cots. There is a screened in porch and the kids can sleep in the cots on the porch. They will love it like camping and you will free up a bed. The condo we stayed in had a nice tropical feel it was clean and quiet. The best part laundry and kitchen. We did not get pressured to do any tour and you do not have to do any tour. Orange Lakes policy is that you can only be asked once. If you say no they will not or should not ask you again. If you beat around the bush with your answer of course their going to push it, that is what their there for. My friends did do the tour just for the free kids stuff they offer. They said it was annoying of course but hey free is free. The resort is cash free (resort card attached to your credit) and of course each little thing cost a little bit extra to do, its no different then anywhere else. The pools and lazy river are awesome. My friends rented an all day gazebo which was pretty awesome, but I am far to cheap to pay 200.00 for something like that. There is a restaurant on site that everyone except my husband and I seemed to love. There is a "tavern/pub" right around the corner from the grocery store (publix) that I wish we would have found much much sooner. Food was great and prices where even better! We loved the relaxing feel of this resort we bought into it. (you can buy anything on ebay)

Reviews.Title: “It was beautiful... I would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne1971
Reviews.Content: I walked into the beautiful front lobby and was greeted by a very friendly, professional staff. This resort is for families with little ones, couples old and young, or singles. They have pools and restaraunts and shops geared for any crowd or any budget. Bring your golf clubs because your in the middle of 2 wide open yet challenging courses...one is on the resort and the other is public with easy access. All of the units are layed out like condos. I stayed in a 2 bedroom which had a master bedroom suite with a jacuzzi tub and separate shower stall... The second bathroom off the common area was great for the kids and guests. Each unit has a full working kitchen, living/dining room combo, washer and dryer and a screened in porch with seating for 4 or more. It was indeed a home away from home with convenient shopping that surrounded the resort. Acres and acres of property that backs up to a reserve made it feel like a giant housing development. We were told the place was booked but the only time you knew that was when you were down at one their 3 pools. We stayed here in lieu of one of the theme park resorts to save money...well, I can honestly say we will NEVER stay at an over-priced theme park again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney, great for famlies.”
Reviews.Author: Viajero736
Reviews.Content: Pros: I am an owner since 2009 and this is our first trip to this place. We stayed for 10 days in a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit in East Village. If you stay for 10 days or more, you will get a free housekeeping. My family enjoyed it so much that we are planning to return in Christmas. If you have a car, I recommend East Village. Every night at 10 pm, we saw the Disney fireworks from our villa and during the day, we were amused to see a crocodile in the lake in front of our villa. Cons: Originally, I used my points to reserve a 1 bedroom/1bath pool view unit, but when arrived to our unit, it was facing the street and the roof of a building. I complain several time but the most they did, was placing us in the 2bd/2b unit in East Village (they charge me extra points even when was not my fault that the unit was not facing the pool). River Island is great, but sometime very crowded. If you decide for River Island, stay away from the 1 bedroom pool view, not all 1bd villa pool view is actually pool view.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Amyfamilyof5
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 12:00 noon... Tried to sell us a timeshare. Said we couldn't check in until 4:00 @ their "guaranteed" checkin time. Tried to get in our villa at 4:00 after a long day of travel and occupying 3 kids... Room still wasn't ready! 2 housekeeping staff were there- 1 was cleaning and the other was eating fruit on the balcony and we couldn't get in our room. I called from my cell for a manager as my family of 5 waited in corridor with our luggage for housekeeping to finish eating and cleaning. I was told they would send a manager---never happened. Room still wasn't totally clean when we finally got in and toilet didn't work. Nice potential facilities... Too bad it wasn't managed well!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: marymary83
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day stay at Orange Lake Resort. My in-laws graciously let us use their owner slot this year, and we were so excited to go. My husband hasn't been in a few years, and has done nothing but talk this place up. He was sad to learn that so much had changed since the last time he was there. Pretty much nothing was the same as it used to be. We had a room inside the main building in the west village. Nice, well decorated, but to be honest, too much furniture for the room. We had to cram things up against a wall to be able to walk and use the pull out couch bed, which resulted in banging our heads into the light fixture in the middle of the night when having to go to the bathroom. We planned on buying food for our stay and cooking most of our meals in the room to save a little cash for our Disney trip. Seemed like a good plan, until we were met with a fridge too small even for a college student. The "freezer" section didn't keep anything frozen, and it took 3 hours to cool drinks off in the fridge part. There wasn't a lot of storage space for our food items as most of the cabinets were taken up with the resort owned stuff. We had 4 people in our room, and only two full sized towels, and after asking for more for three days, finally received them. The same with extra trash bags. The pools were nice, we stuck mostly to the one at our part of the resort, as you have to either drive or take a shuttle to the rest. River Island, which I assume is the newest part of the resort boasted water slides and a lazy river and the best pools. What we got was a lazy river you had to pay 9 bucks to rent a tube for that had more plant life floating in it than water that barely moved you along, we had to swim most of it, and water slides that my son couldn't even go down, even though I KNOW he meets the height requirements. River Island was crowded and not worth the 5 minute drive over there. You can only go 23 mph in the place, so traveling takes a few minutes. We ate lunch two times while staying there at the resort restaurants. FYI - save your money and go to McDonald's. Food was overpriced and horrible. The perks of the place were the fan we had in our room, best fan I've ever seen, the comfortable beds, the amount of pools to utilize, and the proximity to the parks. Took us about 15 minutes to get to Disney World. We unplugged our phone the first day there, and when finally plugging it back in yesterday, we were greeted with a gazillion messages from resort staff for this or that. We had to buy milk at the Marketplace and pad almost $5 for a half gallon of milk. Everything is expensive, so come prepared! Luckily, there are a bevy of restaurants to choose from OUTSIDE of the resort on Irlo Bronson and a few grocery stores! We probably won't go back, even though the room was paid for. Just wasn't really our cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE resort - East Village”
Reviews.Author: RMLmom
Reviews.Content: Date of visit: 6/11/11-6/17/11 Pros: -Huge 3 bedroom/3 bath condo, whirlpool in master bath, lots of space. 3rd bdrm huge for in-laws. -Free WiFi: super fast-faster than we get at home. -Proximity to Super Target and Publix Grocery -Proximity to Irlo Bronson Hwy: restaurants, shops, mini golf -Proximity to Disney World -River Island Lazy River & Pools -large fitness center -View of golf course from patio -armadillos, deer and other wildlife roaming around -full kitchen with stove, oven, dishwasher, double sink, microwave, coffee maker. Cons: -Showers only in 2 other baths (but we bathed the kids in our tub) -Have to drive or take a shuttle anywhere within the resort (from our bldg anyway in 95F+ heat and humidity) -Daily automated messages left on room phone for activities. A flyer at check-in would have sufficed. No line at check-in (but we came at 10pm on a Saturday). If you don't want to do a timeshare presentation, simply walk out the front door after receiving your room assignment and keys! The "welcome center" is a separate desk and you aren't 'required' to cash in that $20 voucher. If you're missing anything from the room, just call housekeeping. They will drop off anything you're missing (even if you're not there). You can wave down a shuttle outside on the sidewalk...it'll stop for you. If we stay here again, we'll be sure to ask for a unit at River Island. Much more convenient (shops/pool, etc) and closer to the resort entrance/exit. Ate at one restaurant in the West Village during our stay. Waited a little longer than usual for the kids food. Hoped to save some $$ from eating outside the resort, but it was the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation, really loved the Holiday Inn Club and will go back”
Reviews.Author: SusieJ42
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go somewhere special with our Son and family, this was a great place to stay. The Holiday Inn Club Resort is an excellent choice, if you want open spaces and to be close to Disney. The grounds are based on Villages and each Village does have it;s own pool, Restaurants and golf course. For those who love coffee, they have a Starbucks on site. You can also have Pizza delivered to your condo, if you just want to stay in and relax. We stayed in the East Village on the 3rd floor,the floor space of the condo is great lots of space. We could see the fireworks at Disney from our room. The complex does have a fun zone area for kids and adults,there is a charge for this, a daily pass or a 7 day pass. The complex is a time share vacation resort, you will be invited to join them for a tour but you can always decline. We did accept and it was interesting , we also got some free fun zone passes for doing so. We declined any option to join the time share vacation club and they accepted our decision. So please don't be put off by the time share aspect, it's a great place to stay and we all loved it and will certainly go back. One last thing, they don't accept cash at the bars, shops and Restaurants. You pay by credit card or you need to purchase a pre-paid site card in which you load money onto it. You can also use your room key. We rate this complex highly.

Reviews.Title: “Large Resort with lots of variety”
Reviews.Author: 2niagara
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here over Easter break and I was pleasantly surprised. The 2-bedroom condo was extremely nice for a vacation stay. There are many areas of the resort and we stayed in one the farthest away from the main building. There was a small swinning pool next door which was nice to walk to. And our balcony overlooked the golf course which was a nice view in the morning while having our coffee. The condo was very spacious. Nice big kitchen with passover counter into the living and dining room so it's easy to converse with family members. The master bedroom was large with a huge master bath which included jacuzzi top and separate shower. There was a 2nd smaller bathroom with a shower which was next to the 2nd bedroom which was perfect for the kids. We didn't stay at the condo much since the purpose of the trip was to visit the amusement parks, but it was nice to come back to the condo at night and stretch out and relax. Plus having the kitchen was great for having breakfast in the morning without having to go to a restaurant. Since the property is large, you will need to drive to get to the attaractions (lazy river, mini golf, etc.). I also think they have planned activities during the day for those who stay on property. Now - the drawback. This is a timeshare property and you may be asked/required to attend a "presentation." We were told it would be a 90-minute presentation, but 90 minutes turned in to almost 3 hours. They will try to get you to buy at least something. If you don't mind sitting through these sales pitches, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay but timeshare hussle”
Reviews.Author: Aidox1973
Reviews.Content: This resort is oustanding for a family with young to teenage kids. This is our second visit. last time was June 2010 for Disney. This time was Universal/SeaWorld. We stayed in the 2 bdrm 2 bath villa both times. The rooms were very nice and clean. The beds were comfortable but the sofa will hurt your backside ! The bathrooms were large and spacious with seperate whirlpool tubs and shower and double vanity sinks. The kitchen was complete with all great condition appliances including coffe pot and mixer for those of ya that enjoy margaritas. The resort also has free Wi-Fi. The water park was excellent with several pools, slides and a hooch type pool. The cleanliness was above average considering all the kids swimming in it all day. The hotel staff was a little snooty but the restaurant staff personel were great. However, beware of the typical lame hidden resort fees, deposits, and costs that go with timeshare properties. I paid full price (wasnt there on some promotion) and the check-in staff "desperatly and overwhelmingly" tried to suck me into the timeshare hussle. The trick is to say no, no, no to everything ( about 15 times overall for me) including the free this and free that's or suffer a 2 hour check-in ! We also got hit with a couple calls during the stay telling my wife that I scheduled them to call when I was at check-in for the "tour of the property" with free dining and blah blah blah. Just say no, no no ! Overall the stay was well above average but the timeshare game was silly and will have you mad especially after a 6+ hour drive !

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS EXPENSIVE GARBAGE DUMP AT ALL COSTS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KingofChatalot
Reviews.Content: This place is GARBAGE.........just like teh GARBAGE we found inside our villa and outside our door. Looks like the cleaning crew came around and left the job half finished. The air around the villa smelled like someti8ng large had died and decayed...and it was like that for the entire 3 days we miserably spent there. Almost ALL the staff were from India and we couldn't get decent understanding information from anyone where anything is. OH! and get your wallet out if you're STUPID enough to stay here, EVERYTHING costs money and a LOT of it...you cant even fish for free and it doesn't matter because they stock the 2 teeny weeny ponds with minnows, the same thing they sell you to use as bait........there are NO vending machines anywhere and their overpriced restaraunt was selling burgers at a whopping 8 dollars a piece that tasted like an old tire........their bar's drinks had hardly any liquor in them and for what it costs for one marguerita you could have bought a fifth of tequila......and gotten change back... OH!! and they left use 4 SPAM messages a day on our phone...about buying timeshares from them.........I wouldn't live in that [---] if they gave it to me.......... AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “"Our favorite resort"”
Reviews.Author: Ohiomacy
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Orange Lake every year for the last 15 years and have seen it grow from one village to four. The unit we stayed in this year was our 3 bedroom in the West Village. It recently has been renovated and looks beautiful. The beds are very comfortable. The staff is always friendly and very helpful. They have a Sunset Celebration every evening at Breezes Restaurant with things the kids enjoy such as face painting and balloon animals . We went up almost every evening to listen to the music and dance. My husband loves it so much he never wants to leave the resort the whole time we're there. They have some good restaurants at the resort. If you go off the property to eat try Giordani's for the stuffed pizza. One large will feed 4 adults with leftovers. Can't wait until next year!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations. Beautiful place. We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: SunshineNC20
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect after reading many mixed reviews, but I have to say that everything was fantastic. Check in was painless and not too much of a hard sell from time share guy. Did not receive calls that we know of. We had a West Village golf villa near the entrance and while it didn't look like much from the outside, the unit was newly remodeled with granite countertops, and was very spacious and clean. We enjoyed the lazy river, though the pool could have been cleaner. Loved he fact that the villa was 1 story. No noise from any neighbors. Best Orlando condo we've stayed in by far.

Reviews.Title: “Second time there just as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: DEE0819
Reviews.Content: I think this resort is great. We were there last year and thought maybe we just got lucky. So we booked again for a three night family getaway and found it just as enjoyable. Well-appointed, modern, very clean, two bedroom apartment in a 6 story high-rise was perfect for us as a couple with three young children. 10 minutes to Disney, great pool options, full kitchen...just can't wait until the kids are old enough to golf on what look like beautiful on-site courses. Understand that it is like "condo" living - no daily cleaning service, no "breakfast in the lobby". The tv's are also not flat screen and there is no HDTV though there are a lot of basic cable channels. Full kitchen, washer-drier, a Publix down the street and a Super Target right across the main road. It is a huge resort...a car is a must, thought there is also an internal shuttle which we did not utilize. If all that works for you, as it did for us, it is a great place and we will plan to be back. Yes they do try to sell a sales tour but it is easy to turn down if you aren't interested - no pushiness, in fact a very easy and pleasant check-in experience (we got there at about 3:40 for a 4 pm check-in and they were able to accomodate us).

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: CCC57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from June 8-12 in three seperate units, 2 (1) bedrooms and 1(3) bedroom. I am usually uncomfortable with any place less than a 4-star, however, each of our units were spotless, I could not complain about cleanliness at all. We had originally requested renovated units but it could not be arranged for all three units to be in the same village so we opted to remain together. We ended up in the North Village which even though they were older units with dated furniture and appliances, still not bad at all. It really worked out better because we travelled with small kids and the pool was perfect and less crowded and just an elevator ride down. We did engage in a timeshare presentation which took 2 hours of of time one morning in exchange for discounted Disney tickets plus free waterpark ticktes, I guess it was not a bad trade off, since we needed to purchase 11 Disney Tickets and 15 waterpark. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “had fantastic time would stay again”
Reviews.Author: gmntlw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in feb 11 and had a 2 bed villa. We did the timeshare pitch and yes it was all everyone says but we used it to our advantage. The simple answer is unless there's something you want dont go, we just said no and walked away with our passes so the kids could do lazy river and other activites for free for our whole stay. We didnt eat in the resort as I stocked up at the supermarket for breakfast and lunch and we ate out in the evenings. Millers Ales House next to the resort was great but is always busy. Overall the resort was a great base for us, spent half a day at theme parks and afternoon at river island. Free wi fi in villa was great too. We had a great time and also got to watch Discovery space shuttle take off from Coco Beach. If I went again I would be happy to stay here again. Ive also stayed at the Bahama Bay which was nice but there's more for kids at this resort. Happy Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Nice !!”
Reviews.Author: annieosanto
Reviews.Content: As a gift for our daughters graduation from college, we stayed at the Orange Lake Resort because she wanted to go to Disney - it was myself....my two daughters...a friend....her mother and her daughter - we stayed in a 2 BR, 2 bath unit and it was perfect for us - they had everything we needed in the kitchen - and plenty of room all around !! Everything was very clean and comfortable - no problems whatsoever.....would not hesitate to come here again......LOTS of things to do in the resort itself, only being there a few days I'm sure we did not see it all - we'll be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Stealing from your room”
Reviews.Author: ReneeinHebron
Reviews.Content: We stayed june 3-10, 2011 and we think the maid service stole 2-ipods with ear plugs and charger from each bed room. We contacted both police and resort security, but in the end the resort did nothing but threaten to arrest me for telling other guests what happened to us. This resort might look nice to stay at, but I found out later from others (including resort employees,) that this resort has problems like this A LOT!. Beware going, it might be a nice place to visit, but keep ALL your valuables locked in the safe or keep it with you. THIS COMPANY DOESN'T CARE ABOUT YOU, YOU ARE OUT OF STATE!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Fun for PreTeens”
Reviews.Author: mahurligan
Reviews.Content: Our family of five enjoyed a three-night stay in the East Village with a gorgeous fifth-floor view of Epcot's fireworks. The screened-in balcony was a big plus on a typical humid Florida night. Lots of positives about this resort: "dive-in" movies for kids of all ages, a variety of pools, each with unique features, watersports, playgrounds with bungee-jumping and inflatable slides, indoor activities such as bingo and movies, multiple arcades, and beautifully manicured grounds. It's proximity to Orlando theme parks is nice, too. There's more positives....the 2BR/2BA villa is more than enough room for 5-8 travelers. We comfortably accommodated two grandparents, parents, and three kids. All dinnerware, cookware, and incidentals (laundry, dish, and dishwasher soap, for instance) are included. Sorry, folks...this is not a standard hotel. It's a timeshare property, so the occupant is responsible for daily housekeeping in their home away from home. Customer service was top-notch, delivering extra laundry and dish detergent as requested. Negatives: a ceiling fan in bedrooms would be nice and we were not provided a spatula. I struggled to find anything negative. After reading previous review, it's apparent that seasoned, informed travelers appreciate this property for its amenities, activities, and customer service. Complaints about timeshare presentations are unwarranted. Incentives are offered for participation in a 90-minute presentation. Folks...if you don't like what you're hearing after 90 minutes, demand a ride back to your vehicle, get your free voucher, and don't do it again. Or...pay the reservation charge and enjoy your stay- skip the presentation and remember that you don't get something for nothing. Or stay somewhere else. Problem solved. There is so much to do here. If you're looking for the most bang for your buck, Orange Lake Resort is for you.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and we are coming back”
Reviews.Author: fiszk
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, near to Disney if you want the parks, near to itself if you just want to relax and have a good time.. Fine restaurants, a bunch of pools and other ammenities to relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family resort but expensive timeshare to buy!”
Reviews.Author: HIPChelmsford_MA
Reviews.Content: My inlaws bought a week at Orange Lake several years ago so we go with them every year. It is a beautiful location. From our 5th floor suite in the East Village you can see Disney's fireworks, and there is a pool and hot tub right outside our building. The resort is huge, so just a short drive away are three different "villages" each with a pool complex. One has spray park, pools and a water slide, one has a lazy river, pools, slide and hot tubs (as well as mini golf and tiki bars), and one has several pools and hot tubs and is on a small lake with watercraft rentals. They have plenty of expensive golf, a full range of restaurants including pizza delivery in the resort, a movie theatre, a kids "clubhouse" where they can get their videogame fix, and a full range of programs for kids and adults. The rooms are large, clean and well equipped with dishes, pots and pans, towels, washer and dryer, etc. and there is a grocery store at the entrance to the resort. There is a master suite with king bed and full bath/jet tub as well as a 2nd bedroom with 2 queen beds and bath with shower. The couch in the living room also opens so the space sleeps 8. There is a shuttle service around the resort but you have to pay for shuttle to the airport or attractions ($21 pp to the airport). Rental cars are definitely cheaper if you get one at the airport. The kids love it at Orange Lake, but we often see units available there to rent for about the same as the annual owner's maintenance fees, and there are many units available for a few dollars on the secondary timeshare market. However, if you rent there without buying in to the whole timeshare deal, it is a great base for exploring the Orlando attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Close to Disney and other area attractions”
Reviews.Author: vacationfromchgo
Reviews.Content: Very last minute, a friend decided to use her time share and invited me to join. Though neither of us is a fan of Florida, or the Orlando area, Orange Lake Resort was the only thing available so that's where we went. Very nice resort. Closest (within 10 minutes) to Disney, reasonable distance from other Orlando attraction. Easy access to I-4. They insisted that the "upgrade meeting" was ONLY "Member Updates" and would only take 60 minutes. It was NOT worth the $40 on-site voucher!! We were there for over 2 hours... and it was NOT a member update - of course, it was a sales pitch to purchase Holiday Inn Club Vacations, even though my friend already owns a time share through another group. We cycled through 4 sales people, each one progressively nastier and meaner. They took us on a nice golf cart ride through the property, concluding at a facility that was NOT near where we parked the car. We literally felt like we'd been kicked to the curb at the conclusion of the 2 hours presentation where we had to wait 20 minutes for the next shuttle to get back to our car. Yuk! We were there to relax, which we did. Many pools and atmospheres to choose from. River Island being the most crowded with kids and families. I love a Lazy River, but this one is not regulated very well - we purchased $9 wristbands to get the tubes... but didn't really see any other wristbands on the Lazy River. Everyone was apparently free to grab a tube, and swim or walk in the River. At most times, reaching my arms back to "paddle" I would touch another person - that's how close they were. Loved Bingo during the day at the pool near Breezes, and Loved NTN trivia in the evenings at Legacy Sports Grille. Several restaurant outlets. I'm a foodie, so I didn't find the the food overly pleasing. But very reasonably priced - I expected outrageous prices at the resort and was pleasantly surprised that everything was very economical. Service varied from excellent to mediocre. If i come back to the area with my family to attend Disney, I will definitely compare the rates available at Orange Lake vs. staying on property at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “A good dream turns into a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: sameerah_anderson
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the orange lake resort from June 2-June 5. Our trip was suppose to last until the 6th. While staying at this resort, there isn't any housekeeping during your stay there and if so,it's extra. I had been making the beds during our stay and on the third day I went to make my sons bed and I find a huge bed bug. I freaked out!! We started to gather our belongings and throw them in the washer and dryer and put our suitcases outside. I'm usually pretty good about inspecting our rooms but this time the room was very nice looking and I just wanted to relax. It took two phonecalls to get the housekeeping manager up to our room and when he finally came, he inspects the bug and says it was "an old bed bug" -what's worse -new bed bugs or old ones? So that means that the sheets weren't clean OMG- also still no presence from the actual manage during this episode-next they send up pest control who strips and inspects the mattresses. He concludes that there a no bed bugs but there were flying ant parts under the mattress? Then he asked if we wanted house keeping to make up our beds again-we said no-cut our trip short and left-they tried to give us a new room and we said no because obviously there is a housekeeping issue. While checking out there was still no sign of management-

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nikkinoo_R
Reviews.Content: This resort is approx 40 mins from Orlando Intl Airport and is pretty easy to find, it's a good location from both Universal, Sea World, Discovery Cove, Aquatica and all the Disney's. Check in was pretty quick which was good after a long flight, the resort runs on a cashless system so you charge drinks, food from the restaurants etc on either your room bill that you pay on check out or on your credit/debit card, I would suggest keeping all receipts if you charge everything to your room so you can keep an eye on how much you are spending, it's easy to lose track if you're not physically handing over money! The food we tried from the restaurants and snack bars on the resort was nice and not too expensive, the drinks also were the same price in any bar outside the resort. The grounds were well kept and clean, I had read in some previous reviews there had problems with bugs, we had no problem at all. The apartment had all the amenities you need for self-catering, if you are staying for 2 weeks housekeeping will come and change your bed sheets and refresh towels without charge. If I had any negative to say at all it would be, because we were in an apartment block, if you have noisy people above or either side of you there isn't a lot you can do, we had an apartment that liked to have there television quite loud very late into the night but we didn't know which room it was coming from so couldn't complain. Also because the resort has golf courses the grass is cut very early (around 5 am) every morning, if you are a light sleepers like we are I would suggest taking some ear plugs which we did so you're not woken up.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds,lovely but filthy rooms,terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: disneyfreak27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 2nd through 11th with husband and five children. Although we didn't get in the river island section as we requested they did accomodate us in the north village within walking distance to a toddler friendly pool which was great for our family. Our room in the North Village was roomy , a little outdated and a little dirty .Our large family loved the roominess of the villas. Halfway through our trip in the morning when we woke up to get ready for breakfast at Chef MIckeys and a day at the Magic Kingdom we had no water at all. Husband called front desk to see what the problem was. Took half hour before someone called back to tell us there was a water main break in our building. We asked to be moved to another room so we could get ready and be on time for our reservation. Their only option for us was to let us shower in another unit. They also said the water might be working again shortly so we opted to wait it out. Well it wasn't working shortly. Husband tried to find out what was going on from the maintenance men that were working on the leak at our building and got a rude "were working on it " for the answer. We also saw men which looked like management walking around out side our unit but no on bothered to tell us what was going on and when the water was going to be on. Several hours later it came on. Needless to say we missed our reservation for Chef Mickeys and our kids were very upset as were we. The next day guess what? No water again. By this time we were furious. Husband called front desk, told them we had no water again and that we missed a reservation the day before because of it and demanded to be moved to another building so it would not happen again. This time however , the girl said they could move us to another building. A man came to our room , threw us the room keys and left, not offering to help us move or even bothering to tell us what section or where we were moving to. Had to drive around trying to find our new unit. We were placed in the tennis village condos this time. Beautiful accomodations here. New furniture, very tastefully decorated, till you looked closely. The bathroom floor had so much hair and dirt on it that it was disgusting. Shower in master bath had so much mildew in the grout and mold along the shower door that we didnt feel clean even after showering. Carpets were not swept and kitchen floor had food stuck all over it . I cleaned the floors with a wash cloth and it turned it black. What is the point of renovating a room if the cleaning staff are not doing their job and the rooms are filthy? Carpets were new but in terrible need of scrubbing. Its a shame because the rooms have potential if someone would overlook the cleaning crew and make sure they are doing their job. Other than that , the resort is very family friendly , lovely grounds, beautiful pools ,nice location to disney. Upon checkout husband demanded the resort fee be waived for all of our inconvieniences and they agreed. Would not stay here again or recommend however , since our experience left a bad taste in our mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort!”
Reviews.Author: a_sixteen
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful! So many great facilities, though be prepared to pay for them! We stayed in a beautiful part of the resort, great size, nice and quiet, right by a pool. Great protection from bugs, too, which was a bonus! Restaurants were nice, but we ate outside the resort more often.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Cancellation Service”
Reviews.Author: nicandalec
Reviews.Content: i just spent almost one hour on the phone with this resort trying to get my refund from a stay i booked last month. i choose the flexible rate to make sure that i would get a refund in case i had to cancel. the staff was completely unhelpful and unkind. long story short i am not getting my $128.00 refund which i am completely entitled to. this is a vacation home property and once the owners have your money you will not get it back. anyone who chooses to stay here beware that if you arent absoulutely sure that you wont have to cancel then do not stay here because you will not receive a refund. there are so many good hotels in Orlando with great customer service and this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Omahatraveler17
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a nice stay here. I had been forewarned about the sales pitch when checking in & about the $20 voucher so we did not try to redeem it. (This was a helpful hint from another Tripadvisor member). We just wanted to stay for a couple of days, not buy anything. We had no phone calls for a presentation as others stated. We stayed in the high rise (2 bedroom) on River Island. The rooms were very clean, very nice & spacious. For the price you couldn't beat it. Since they have full kitchens, a washer & dryer etc. you really have all the comforts of home. After traveling for 4 days when we got there it was nice to do a couple of loads of laundry. Some of the negatives I found was just trying to call this place. I wanted to make sure I was on River Island, however it took at least 4 transfers to finally get the reservation desk & every time I'd ask for a direct line phone number, no one could give it to me. I had also asked for a view of the pool. We got a view of the street. I did call to complain & was told there were no guarantees when you book as to which area (River Island, etc) you get or which view. We had a great screened in porch but looking out at the parking lot didn't excite me. i felt a bit closed in since we kept the curtains pulled for privacy. In order to get the feel of the resort we had to walk down our hall & down 3 flights of steps to even see the pool area. We noticed the restaurant info given to us at check in must have been the lunch prices, since we stopped by one restaurant for dinner & prices were double. We tried to call for Pizza Delivery from the resort pizza restaurant, but delivery time was 1 1/2 hrs.. Only 1/2 hr. if you could pick up yourself. Stores located on the property were pricey. We found going to the Publix close by was a better deal. Something I hadn't heard from other Tripadvisor member reviews was this resort uses your room key card for on-site purchases. No cash is used here. Since this really wasn't a hotel, daily cleaning wasn't the normal & you did have to pay for those services. We were only there for a couple of days so that didn't really matter. It would have been nice to get have extra shampoo & coffee, but we were forced to buy the extra's we needed since we never saw any maid service while we were there (not sure we would have gotten it anyway).. As always with the phone service it was hard to find someone to answer a question. I tried the morning we left to find out where the trash containers were but could never get anyone to answer the phone at 6:00 am. Yes, they ask you to take out your own trash & put it in the proper place - but they never said where it is. I looked at the end of the hallways but never found it until we were walking out the door. It was located next to the elevators. We did not use the lazy river so we didn't need to rent a tube for $9, however by mid to late afternoon, I noticed a number of tubes laying around that people had left. Others were just picking them up & using them to save on rental fee. Overall this resort had some small negatives to it but again our villa was very nice, clean and reasonably priced. If you want someone to wait on you then this resort probably isn't for you since there is no front desk attendant in your building (check in is in another area of the resort) & no maid service unless you pay extra. A car is definitely needed here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility Poorly Trained Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gndmwing
Reviews.Content: The good: The resort is beautiful, has decent golf facilities and the family very much enjoyed the various pools. We were able to use a different pool each day we were there and had fun at all of them. But that is where the good ends. The bad: The staff is terrible. As soon as you arrive you are hammered into taking the tour of the facility as they attempt to sell you the experience. I was here for a vacation not a god for saken sales pitch. Once we got to the room it got even better... You had to walk thru a wall of spider webs just to get to the door as no one wiped them from around the door. The room was dirty. When we turned on the lights they were covered with cob webs. Extremely easy to see considering someone had supposedly just cleaned the room. The shower liner in one bathroom was completly covered with mold and mildew. It was white at one time but not with that much coverage. The second bathroom was missing a liner. Some of the towels had stains and I wondered if they had even been washed. I attempted to contact the front desk only to be booted around over and over again. Once I finally got tired of this I drove down to the lobby to discuss with a supervisor in person only to be told they were all out or on lunch. I was ok with that as the person at the desk said they would address the issues and have a manager contact me as soon as possible. Lets just say no one ever came to the room with the new liners or towels. I ended up doing the towels myself and cleaning all the fixtures and using some of the cleaning supplies they left on my first night as they didn't believe I was important enough to come down and address these issues. I find this funny as they believe I have to be right on time for the sales tour or they keep my deposit. Are they held accountable for anything? Nope... So I would say the facility is ok and was fun for my family but the Management is some of the worst I have ever dealt with, the staff is incompitent and could really care less about you as the customer. Example (while waiting for our kids to use the bungie the guys running it were discussing the girls they were dating and what they were doing with them. Lets just say the rating should have been G but jumped to R rather quickly. Also while they were talking they paid no attention to the time each child was on the unit. Some would actually jump for 15 minutes or more and some 3 minutes or less. At one point 2 parents nearly got into a fist fight as they had waited for 45 minutes to go on the bungie ride only to get about 4 bounces and then watch another go for 15 as they talked about who they were dating this weekend. This is a fine example of the type of staff working here. Overall it would have been a great experience had the staff actually cared about what they did but in the end the pools were the only reason we stayed for the full 3 days. Hope the final day as we leave on the 10th helps make up for the poor stay and maybe that Manager will actually realize I am still here waiting for someone to contact me. Should be fun tomorrow as we have the sales pitch first thing in the morning. Looking forward to tell them I would never buy into something this poorly run. Hope the breakfast makes it worth the time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort!! Ignore the $20 voucher!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ets127
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying in this resort. We enjoyed the lazy river a lot, though they charging for tubes and they closed the slides at 8pm. We stayed in a two bedroom unit. We had a fairway view of the golf course, which my husband like the most, he was just disappointed when he went to driving range and they did'nt let him play because he was not wearing a collared shirt. We also liked that its closer to a grocery store and restaurants. I did'nt claim the $20 voucher cos i know that they will ask us to buy a time share. We will deffinitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER GOING BACK!!!!”
Reviews.Author: halzyea13
Reviews.Content: Let me start out with the positives. The room itself was big nice bed nice kitchen tv everything up to par. The pools and the landscape looked nice and was well maintained (didnt play golf).... So what you might ask is the reasons I'm never going back. There are several. FIRST is the timeshare presentation as soon as you check in you are presented a "voucher" for 20 dollars. Then a worker who will be overly enthusiastic will bring you over to a second desk where you are ask several questions and enticed with coupons and possibly even money for a "90 mintue" presentation. This presentation is where they try to sell you a time share and it takes close to 3 hours!!! and thats if you say no!! (which we did). But it is not just saying no ... it is saying no to 4 different people for 5 times each. For example I was told since I am a physician that "Thats a stressful line of work if you don't take some vacations you'll probably wind up with a heart attack" SECOND PROBLEM we were told that there "were no discount tickets to the amusment parks (disney/ universal) until after we already purchased the full price tickets at the check in desk... apparently you have to go to a side desk to get them and the check in desk apparently doesnt have this knowledge so there goes 50 dollars. THIRD lazy river sounds great but unfortunately you have to pay $9 per tube for the day. FOURTH We were politely informed we get to wash our own towels since this is "not a hotel" awesome and also you get to clean your room but they will be happy to do it for a fee. Also in this category only room service is delivery from "paisan pizzeria"

Reviews.Title: “Great for multi-family Stays”
Reviews.Author: Jeff60468
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 3-bedroom, 3-bath unit on the East side. Worked out great for me and my wife, my brother and his wife, along with our 15-yr old daughter and my brother's 15-yr old daughter. Everyone had their own bedroom and bath to escape to. This is the only way to go for two couples with kids or extended famlies. Stay on the EAST SIDE closest to the waterpark area if possible. There are some older smaller, one story units on the West side as you enter the resort that do not look very nice

Reviews.Title: “This is not your average run of the mill Resort.”
Reviews.Author: wolfpak117
Reviews.Content: I have read thru alot of the reviews on this property so I decided I would try and compose something for the first-timers who have never been. I am an owner here now for the past 7 years. My first trip was a rental off eBay and after visiting many other so called "resorts" in the area which were barely more than apartments with a jacuzzi we decided this was where we wanted to be. This place has too many ammenities to list, go to their web site to see them. If you can, arrive before 3pm to check in or you will be waiting a while. They are going to tell you ways to get extra discounts on Golf and attractions by attending their sales promotion. First they do work hard at trying to sell you one of these units for $35K which you can buy on the resale market for pennies on the dollar like I did so unless you understand "The Game" just say no to their offers or you will find yourself wasting 2-3 hours (most likely 3 hours) listening to them ramble on and on and on about the value of timeshare ownership. (The Suites on top of River Island are something to see though but you will probably never get to stay there unless you plan on bringing 23 of your closest friends with you.) So if you want to toss away half a day of your vacation then have at it. You can't say I didn't warn you! They have 1 and 2 story villa's in the west village which are very nice and I think bigger than the hi-rise units. Most Villa's overlook the golf courses. There are a few with jungle views so you may want to avoid those. There are 4 courses on the property. 2 x 9 and 2 x 18 hole. Most Hi-rise units have screened porches and 1 elevator per building 5 stories or less. So if it is out of service there is no backup. I kind of felt Isolated up in the upper floors but the view is nice. Some Hi-rise units that face Disney in the north village can see the fireworks at night. The resort is kid friendly, there is only 1 adult only pool near the front entrance in the west village. They have 11 pools and a lazy river. They do not have bike paths and most riding on the resort is on a busy main road so you may want to leave them home. They have nice exercise equipment though so go explore them if you feel the need. The putt-putt offers a week pass for everyone in your room for a set price, play as much as you want all week. It's a good deal if you like putt-putt. I have had some minor maintenance issues and they have always come to deal with them quickly or bring me something I needed. Usually within 10 to 20 minutes. I have never been disapointed with the accomodations. Most all units in the older west and east villages have been updated within the past 5 years. If you stay at river island request a pool view or you could be overlooking the parking lot and the badly maintained orange groves. Those tall buildings have rooms on both sides. There are alot of things close by but you will need a car if you want to leave the property. There is a drug store and McDonalds near the front gate. The Target and Supermarket is quite a long walk and the shuttles that go around the property every 20 minutes do not leave the property. Ask the driver if any of the runs go to Publix. There are several restaurants on the property serving a wide variety of different foods. All rooms I have been in have free wi-fi internet access if you have a laptop. They also have several business cafe's where they rent time on their machines. They do have bugs, everyone in Florida has bugs so be prepared for an occasional roach about an inch and a half long, they like to call them "Palmetto Bugs" but they are still really BIG roaches. Do not leave any food out at night and keep everything sealed in containers. This is Florida people, it dosent freeze here long enough to kill them. They have ants too so it would be good to have some bug spray handy. Bug Spray and Sun Screen, don't leave home without them!!! As far as resorts go, if your looking for posh upscale and you need extra pampering then this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a clean comfortable spacious place to relax and sit by the pool, order a drink at the pool bar, watch the wild birds, play some tennis or putt-putt, rent a jet-ski or play a few rounds of relaxing golf, then this is heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, but has its flaws”
Reviews.Author: Angie1044
Reviews.Content: Our check in process was somewhat quick and easy. After we got our keys, we were escorted to the sales pitch counter to sign up for a tour. Told us it would only take an hour of our time and would require a $30 deposit. My husband and I choose to do it, because we were traveling with 4 men who planned to golf all week and the golf rates after taking the tour were excellent. We were also given a $20 voucher at check in which was taken away by the sales people. They told us they would give it back to us once we completed the tour and that we could use it towards anything in Orange Lake. We were never given back our voucher and when I asked about it at the end of our week, I was told that they use it towards the golf rates that we were given. That made absolutely no sense, because the rates never changed and it applied to every golfer in our party. We stayed in a 3BR villa in North Village. It was very nice. You could tell it had not been updated in a while, but still clean and comfortable. It backed up to a hole on the night golf course and was pretty to look at all lit up from the screen porch. Also, the north village pool was very nice and accomodates young children well. It was nice to occaisionally take a quick swim there instead of dealing with the croud at River Island. My mom called for a hand mixer which they said they would bring down right away and never did. Customer service once you checked in wasnt the greatest. Overall, our stay was nice.

Reviews.Title: “DONT DO IT”
Reviews.Author: freefam6
Reviews.Content: The customer service here is horrific!!!! They make false promises, like our room leaked for several days and by the time they came he shut the water off and left us in the room. We waited another three hours for someone to come move us (their words not mine). The guy came to the door 3 hours later @ 11pm with 4 keys after I told them I only needed 2 and told us we had to move ourselves. Next room had broken toilets,bugs, and less updates then the one we were in. I immediately canceled my contract because we were told that the building we were in was the last to be updated MORE LIES!! Thus its very kid friendly there are lots of hidden cost. In the few days i was an owner I learned there wasnt any differnce than being a guestbesides 10% off some things. go figure... I jus thought based on the lovely golf course and waterpark it would be someplace I could spend alot of time.....NOT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Resort ticket savings!!!”
Reviews.Author: Haole999
Reviews.Content: My family and I came for a 7 day trip to enjoy disney world. Found out about this wanderful resort!! The service was fine and there was tons of things to do for my family. I approached the vacation station upon check in with a 20 dollar voucher. These wanderful people greeted me fine. And I ended up taking the welcome preview which was very informative btw, and got 4 play passes for 5.00 bucks and saved over 300 dollars on my disney tickets. So I was impressed overall with everything . Total savings was roughly 584 dollars for the 90 minute preview thing. Hah I ended up buying a rental package.

Reviews.Title: “It was great and we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: esgwat
Reviews.Content: We check out of Orange Lake tomorrow, and have been very pleased with our stay! We are RCI week owners and exchanged here for the first time. I thought I had originally booked into the West Village, but they put us in the East Village and we are so glad. The West Village looked very congested. It all depends on your family's needs. We wanted peace and quiet, and my husband is very picky about accommodations. Our two bedroom was updated and beautiful. We could see Epcot's fireworks from our screened-in balcony. Our daughters are older teens and had no trouble taking the shuttle wherever they wanted to go on the property. The only little complaint we had is that ceiling fans in the bedrooms would have been nice. The best thing about Orange Lake is the location, it's perfect for avoiding the crowds. We took the little-used West entrance into Disney property and had no trouble at all. We also saved money by buying breakfast and some lunch food at Publix at the resort entrance. Make sure you pick up a roll of quarters for the occasional toll roads. One day we went to Fort DeSoto State Park for the beach, and really enjoyed the family-friendly atmosphere. Ate at Bubba Gump's at Madeira Beach while in Tampa Bay. Overall, a very nice family vacation. Oh, we checked in very late Friday night and no mention at all of the timeshare presentation, and we just occasionally check our phone messages for the day's activities. What a relief!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more from Holiday Inn, and was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: m5_t_c
Reviews.Content: On first arrival, check in process was terribly slow especially for a Priority Club member. There were two people handling check in while 10-12 guests waited, yet the counter had space for at least 8-10 associates. Meanwhile, over at the concierge and sales desks , 6 employees twiddled their thumbs, trying to look busy and avoid eye contact with paying customers waiting in the other line. High pressure sales pitch for a coupon book or discount on amenities like tube rental for lazy river. They refused to give me a written copy of what the offer was, but as a new guest I was given a $25 voucher and told it was for use to get food on the premises, but not for tube rental etc. It should not have taken 50 minutes to check in, but it did, and I needed to get to the room to unpack to get medication. I explained that I wanted to review their offer packages, and could I look at them after I had dinner and my medication, and then discuss in the morning. They said sorry. Since I refuse to agree to high pressure sales, I left. I still don't know about the new customer offers that allegedly included area restaurant discounts that could have saved us $$ on dinners, and perhaps would have made my impression of the resort more favorable. We used the card to get ice creams by the pool, then at checkout I was told that the voucher was for restaurants or area attraction tickets, not the food I was told earlier. So they charged my visa with the room. The room was nice, a little dated, but nice. Things like the washer/dryer making a lot of noise, and doors sticking because there were too many layers of paint on them. I wishe I had been warned about thousands of ants in the kitchen all over the trash can the morning after we had cooked our dinner in, but have since been told this is common anywhere in FL. If I had taken the trash out immediately after dinner, instead of first thing in the morning, it probably wouldn't have been bad, but it would have helped if they warned us. There were no sheets/blankets for the pullout sofabed. We called and it took 2 hours for them to bring them to us. That's a long wait when you're ready to go to bed. The pool was nice - I thought it was not family friendly to blast music that loudly near the hammocks as I tried to nap, and I am surprised they allow smoking through the entire pool and hammock area. Yes, it is outdoors, but the smoke still stinks. I wished they had lifeguards, not just to stop the smokers in the pool, but for safety of the kids running around wild. They had plenty of people selling tubes, but nobody to keep an eye on safety. I hope nobody ever gets hurt there, as crowded as it gets, but we got the impression they were far more concerned about squeezing additional $$$ out of their guests. I mean, they charged me to print airline boarding passes - what hotel does that and expects customers to want to return? It is of course their right to do so, I just question that decision. When I checked out, I expressed my minor disappointments and asked them to have a manager call me at home the following day or week to discuss my concerns. I never heard anything back, now 2 weeks later. I don't want to make this sound terrible - it is a very nice place, just they could do a few things a little better. Little things like these can make a big difference on memories of a vacation. The earlier part of our vacation was also at a Holiday Inn, and it was terrific. I've been a priority club member for over 20 years and I guess I just expected a little bit more from this one. I hope this review is helpful to other guests, as well as management. Maybe if they pay a little more attention to detail then others will be able fully enjoy what they have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastJaneDoe08
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! We originally booked a room at the Wyndham Bonnet Creek, but they messed up our reservation so we had to find a place at the last minute! Best thing that happened to us! We had a late late arrival so missed the push for a timeshare presentation although they did call us and we told them we weren't interested and told them our income which quickly cut them off. We checked in and arrived to our villa in the West Village. It was so nice to pull up right to the driveway and walk right in without lugging our stuff up stairs/elevators. I was a little worried to open the door, but much to my surprise and delight we had a newly renovated villa. It was so spacious and beautiful! My family was so happy and pleased with the comfy big beds (king in master and 2 queens) and the bathrooms. We went right to sleep and actually SLEPT...heard not one noise or peep. With the amenities of the kitchen we drove to Super Target and stocked up on food/snacks and saved some $ by cooking. The dining room is so nice and roomy! We also had a washer/dryer so we were able to wash some clothes and not have to worry about that when we got home. The pool in the West Village is the only pool we visited, but we did drive by the other pools. It was a nice heated pool and there was plenty of privacy and not over crowded! My kids LOVED it and wanted to stay longer then we did. We also got updated messages on what was going on in the resort so that was nice. Convenient location to Disney, Seaworld, etc. There are some nice chain restaurants down the road and super target that is really nice! I suppose the only downside was the A/C was off! When we arrived it was set at 68 and was really about 50 degrees. But, it was so nice to set it at 75 and arrive back to a comfy cool villa. I would have also liked an additional pan to cook over the stove, but they do provide a whole bunch of other dishes, so it wasn't too bad. There is plenty of room for a lot of people. We did use the sleeper sofa and called up housekeeping late (10pm) and they promptly arrived with bedding. All in all, we have decided we will NEVER stay in another hotel room again. 2 bedroom suites/villas, etc are the way to travel with our family. I have to admit for the price we paid, it was like highway robbery! Thank you Orange Lake!!!! PS. It has FREE INTERNET!!!!! Traveling with 2 teenagers and a tech savvy hubby this was important and thankfully we did not have to pay extra!! LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from OL”
Reviews.Author: mamasai
Reviews.Content: We checked in Wed 5/25 - 5/28 - 1 bed at River Island. Staff was great and we were offered a $20 voucher to use on the property or $20 off theme park tickets. The catch - you must attend timeshare speel to obtain the $20 off theme park tickets. We declined and decided to use voucher on property. We tried to use it at River Island to obtain our $9pp tubes, but guess what. You have to go back to front desk which is in the West Village (and if anyone knows how large this property is), it really wasnt worth it. Overall River Island area was great for myself, and a 20 & 15 year old. We stayed 2 extra days because our flight didnt leave until 5/30. According to OL there did not have any 1 bed avail, so we opted to stay on property and rent a studio in the west village. Note the studios/rental/standard hotel room accommodations are located in the same building as the front desk. the room was clean and updated . Only drawback was the AC units. It was extremely loud! and sounded as if someone was taking a shower in the next room. Overall, I would stay here again, because I am comfortable with OL. I was also impressed that Mgmt remembered me and was quite hospitable. !!!!! Thank you for the free WI FI!!!!!! CONS- need more activities. the boys were bored after the 1st day and thank god I had a car, so we found outside activities to entertain us.

Reviews.Title: “The salespeople ruined it for us.”
Reviews.Author: ocalamolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bdrm, 3 bath condo in the East Village. We felt rather fortunate that we were able to stay in a building with a pool, since we knew that we wouldn't be in close proximity to the River Island area. The check-in process was tedious and time-consuming. My husband and I learned something the hard way. When they ask you at check-in if you would like to learn about earning incentives, SAY NO! Not knowing any better, we figured, why not? They quickly whisked my husband away to a second counter where they required a $30 deposit. If you show up to their timeshare presentation, you get your money back plus an extra $30-$100 in cash or in vouchers. Checking in was annoying enough. The room was mostly clean. It is nice that they have everything that you need in the kitchen: blender, utensils, oven, pots, pans, coffee maker, etc. I do not recommend using the jacuzzi jets in the master bath, however. I filled it up so my daughter could take a bath. We turned on the jets. She decided she didn't like them so we turned them off. When the water settled, we noticed black mold-type stuff floating on the water. DISGUSTING! On the third day of our trip we had to go to the timeshare presentation to get our $30 back plus our cash incentive. We were told it would be an hour and a half. It turned out to be a three hour nightmare. Never doing anything like this before, we thought it would be a nice tour of the resort, a way to check out all of the cool stuff they have. We expected a sales pitch like that of a used car dealer. No way. First, we parked our car at the sales office. When inside, we were greeted by "Andrea" from "upstate New York". She showed off her family photo album with pictures of her "husband" and "son". Then she loaded us onto a golf cart, and drove us to a building in front of the River Island area. (Note the removal of us from our mode of escape) We sat through this irrelevant movie about the founder of Holiday Inn and the history of the hotel chain. We were lectured on how we are throwing our money away every time we go on vacation - it's makes more sense to buy a timeshare and "invest" that money. HA! Fifteen minutes after our promised hour and a half, I stopped "Andrea" and asked her how much longer it would take. She said 15-20 more minutes. However, she kept going on and on. We told her we had to get back to the rest of our family and that we didn't have much time. She turned the tables on us saying that it was because we were "asking so many questions" and that she wanted to address them all. Umm, we weren't asking her anything. We were far from curious about buying a timeshare. This went on for an extra hour and 20 minutes. Finally, I met my boiling point and told her to stop with the presentation. She left and brought out the manager. Then he started with a new sales pitch. I told him that we wanted to go back to our car. Then he brought out yet ANOTHER salesman. Then that guy brought out a customer service rep. Finally, they allowed us to get our $30 back plus our incentive cash. Instead of taking us back to our car in the aforementioned golf cart, they told us to wait outside for a shuttle bus. Needless to say, three hours of my life have been taken from me. I feel somewhat bullied and traumatized by the salespitch. They are never getting our money again. FYI - The timeshare we were offered was $37,000 PLUS 16.9% interest. Are you kidding?!

Reviews.Title: “1st time visit”
Reviews.Author: nikkidaniel21
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st visit to america and to this resort, my family of 6 included my parents and my husband and 2 children, when we first got there couldnt believe how pretty, clean and just how massive the whole complex was. The apartment was lovely but upon closer inspection there was a broken lamp in my room and some cleaning issues but we were far too tired to say so. after a couple of days my daughter had a accident during the night so we phoned the reception to let them know, they charged us $20 for changing the bed and as a added bonus left the dirty washing and all the bedding outside our room on the floor for 4 days. (LOVELY) also left rubbish that we found ripped open by someone or something, this to me was very poor. we didnt use all of the resort because of visiting Disney, Universal and N.A.S.A but we did goto 2 of the pools the smallish one very near our room which was perfect as not many people used it, my youngest daughter learnt how to swim there armbands went in the bin, the pool area was very clean and you dont have to bring towels as they are provided, we also used the pool with the lazy river and waterslides apart from being very busy i was very disappointed that you had to pay for the use of the floats, luckily we found some so didnt need to pay.! on our last morning we couldnt believe how quickly and how many "cleaners" turned up to get us out, shame they couldnt have come and removed the rubbish from next door that had sat there for 3 days, they rang the bell and asked what time we were leaving i told them 10am, while we were packing the boss just walked into our room using his master key, which was incredibly rude as we were in the process of dressing and packing. The complex is very secure and even has security patroling the site so its very safe, very clean apart from our hiccup very helpful reception staff and the other guests are polite and helpful too, altho they just liked hearing us speak in our english accents haha On the whole the holiday was fantastic and would go again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Beware of time share push”
Reviews.Author: shewill50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the West side in a lovely two bed room. It was spotless and quiet. The room was perfect but the staff is awful. The main purpose seems to be to sell you a time share. The awful push never ever stopped.. Every thing about the place costs extra and I hated every thing but the lovely room and the excellent price. It is a value if all you need is a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great - East Village Room”
Reviews.Author: ladyvader28
Reviews.Content: 4 day staywith 8 adults, an infant and 2 kids. It was a great stay. The 3 bedroom was spacious-washer, dryer, kitchen, all in clean condition. There was a bee problem outside which was taken care of the next morning. Our bathroom backed up-which was again, taken care of right away. Felt like a little home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: lmnop1976
Reviews.Content: The PROS: -Hotel was great for traveling with children (we had our 2 year old son with us), washer/dryer, kitchen, separate bedrooms was very convenient.
