We had all the comforts of home. We stayed in the River Island complex, which I would highly recommend. From what I've heard from family that stayed in other areas of the resort, some rooms can tend to be a bit dated, but River Island is the newest section. We had a great view, clean room and tons of space. -All cooking utensils were provided, along with starter kits for the washer/dryer, shower, coffee maker, etc. -A trip to Publix or Target SuperCenter to fill the kitchen with groceries, and you're good to go. Stores are really nice too. Probably the nicest Target I've ever seen. -River Island Pool complex is great, we had a fantastic time hanging out on our days off from the parks. -Given our schedule for the week, we didn't really have any time to explore the rest of the resort, but all in all, grounds were very nice all around. Seems like you could spend an entire week there and not leave. *One thing to note is that if you're traveling with an infant/toddler, ask for an upper floor room. We were originally given a ground level unit, but my 2 year old very easily unlocked the door, went onto the screened porch, and walked right out onto the public path. There's no easy way to prevent the little ones from opening the doors, so if your have a higher room, it would be much safer. After a few phone calls, we were moved to the 5th floor. The CONS: -Orange Lake is very big on promoting their time shares. I saw this warning on TripAdvisor before we left, so I was prepared. We spent regular price for our room (i.e. no freebie vacation) and we were still bombarded with morning phone calls. We simply didn't pickup after our first encounter. They try to get you from the beginning. At check-in you're offered a $20 voucher for the resort. However, there are several steps to redeem it. I pretty much threw it away, but other family members reported that it leads you to a sales person who tries to get you to sit through a presentation. Our method was to ignore the calls and eventually they stopped. -Another negative is the check-in process. We got there around 2:30 and were told that as soon as the room was ready they'd call. So we had some lunch at the resort, and were relaxing in the restaurant when we got the call at 4pm. We made our way to the room about 15 minutes later, and the cleaning staff had just begun cleaning the room. So instead of relaxing at the restaurant, we were sitting in the hallway. Not the best way to start off after a day of air travel. -There was some work going on, mostly switching out the rugs in near the elevator. We were informed that this prohibit us from elevator use for 30 minutes. 30 minutes turned into 5 hours. Furthermore, this work was going on a few days later and we were hearing constant banging in our room. We had to leave the room because of the noise (on a day we planned to relax inside out of the sun). I called about this, spoke to 3 different people, was asked for my cell phone # and was promised a call back. That call never came. -Room was very clean other than the floor. Floor was pretty filthy, but from what I gather, most hotel rooms are. Overall, Orange Lake was a nice place to stay, and chances are, I wouldn't rule out the option of staying there again. It seems that if you can take care of yourself, and dont require much in the way of customer service, you'll be pleased. For what we paid (Expedia $1000 for the week which included our rental car) I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families”
Reviews.Author: LynnSunshine
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay! We went for my daughters 11th birthday. She brought 5 friends and we stayed in a 3 bedroom unit. The room was a nice condo. Very clean and had everything we needed. The master bathroom was very nice and the kitchen was well equipped. The room itself was a huge value. When you include all of the amenities of the resort its outstanding! We spent the entire time at the pool area. It was a very quick block from the condo or there was a shuttle you could take to get there too (probably about a 15 min. walk). At the pool there was a ton to do for the kids and reasonably priced food options (for a resort). There is a fee for the tubes for the lazy river, but they offered a deal for $35 you got 3 days of the river, the inflatable slide, the bungee jumping thing and the putt-putt, so I did that for each of the kids and they LOVED it. We spent the entire time at the hotel and the kids were entertained. There was no reason for us to leave to do the parks, they were having so much fun. The pool area is a HUGE complex all gated in. I felt that at 11 (and since they were in a group) they were okay to wonder off on their own within the complex. However, I think it may have been a little stressful with a slightly younger age. Although there were plenty of beach chairs and plenty of room, there were a ton of people. It would be very easy for a child to get lost within the complex.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming at first but great resort”
Reviews.Author: Dagger_TO
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (with 6 and 9 year old) was at the resort last week and we were in a villa at West village like jenmcnitt below but on the ground floor. The place was very clean, comfortable and spacious. It was great to have 2 bedrooms and a kitchen with fridge and stove. With groceries near the resort it was nice to have a pleasant breakfast on the porch. No complaints there except for the wanky wireless connection... Upon entry to the resort we did find the place quite spread out and the roads confusing. But after a day we got to know the area and how to get from place to place. We found check in quite long especially when we accepted to go to the 2nd (time share) desk. Knowing it may take a while we scheduled it for 8:30am the next morning. Once at the appropriate building we met a pleasant time share agent. We got a pleasant golf cart ride to River Island building, got a good overview and tour of the place, blah blah. It was fine of course until the hard sell guys came over which took some time. Overall it took 3 hours and no ride back to the car... The shuttle bus was fine (we used it a couple more times). We did get 7-day fun passes for cheap though which allowed access to the lazy river tubes, mini golf and the hippo slide; all things my kids loved. While in the resort we spent most of out time at the large pool area at River Island. Along with the lazy river there are two water slides and 2 shallow swimming areas. I did find the place quite busy and big. I found it best to be in the water with my kids especially on the lazy river to not lose sight. Also I found there were not many shaded areas there. The location of the resort is a bit isolated. There are stores (Target, Publix) and good restaurants just outside the resort but my wife found it far from the Orlando shopping malls. The restaurants in the resort are fine with reasonable kids' menus. This would be a resort we will return to especially now that we have a good sense of the place. There's still spots we have not checked out yet...

Reviews.Title: “Love the West Village”
Reviews.Author: jenmcnitt
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long vacation staying in the West village at Orange Lake. Most others have already stated what I feel about this resort-it is one of the best ones out there to stay at if you want to visit the Orlando area. I really liked the layout of the unit we stayed in and the pools areas were very nice and large vs some of the other resorts I've stayed at. Staff was friendly and I really enjoyed the variety of amenities that were available at the resort even though our schedule was so packed with things to do away from the resort. We stayed in a two bedroom / two bathroom unit close to the tennis courts. We stayed on the 3rd floor and the back of our unit and screened in patio faced a pond and golf course. We often eat our breakfast on the patio enjoying the view before we headed out to visit the various theme parks. When we came back, it was only a short walk to sit on either the lake beach or by the pool for an our or two. On Friday we spent most of the day at the resort though. In the morning we rented a paddle boat to explore around the lake. It was a lot of fun other than when we got hit by the waves a couple of times from a few of the powered vehicles. They were staying away from where we were for the most part though. Later on we visited the area with the lazy river. Since we were only going to be there for a few hours we decided not to rent tubes for the lazy river but we did swim/walk around it a few times. $9 is really too much per person even for an entire day. I pay $10 a day for my local community water park, but when the service is a part of a resort I could see maybe $5 instead. Never once did I receive a call to go to a timeshare presentation (at least there were no messages on our phone). When we checked in we received a $20 voucher for resort activities that we were to return to another desk to redeem. When we received the voucher it was presented as being a perk since we traded to the resort via RCI. When you look at the voucher itself though, it does say at the bottom of the voucher that it relates to a timeshare solicitation. We just bypassed the second desk on our way out. When we checked in in addition to the voucher we received our parking pass, a resort schedule, and menus to all of the onsite restaurants Prices looked decent though we didn't have time to actually eat at any of the onsite places. We did eat at Applebee's though which is located very close to the resort gate area. My only negative comment is that a few of the drains in the bathrooms should eventually be replaced. Most notable were the rust stain marks around the drain in the small bathroom. It was clean, but just looked a bit dirty due to this. Also, it would have been nice to have had a pizza pan and cutter as part of the kitchen items, but we made due with a cookie sheet and large knife. Overall I would definitely stay here again if I would be able to stay in the West village again. The other areas didn't have the amenities I would want for a couple's vacation but would be great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Npotts
Reviews.Content: We just came back today from orange lake- I wanted to write a review because my parents have owned at olcc for many years and we have been trading it to see other areas and before we went back I read reviews- I do not agree with the negative ones and knew that is not how I remembered my past stays at olcc- to start we had a blast the only day we left the resort was for discovery cove and I still feel like I missed so many activities we wanted to do on the resort( spent too long drinking those delicious piña coladas by the pool! The landscape is gorgeous very well kept! Check in was fast and they accommodated us with a room switch so we could check in at 10am because ours was not ready! Resort is cashless but they still accept debit and credit saw many people trying to pay with cash that forgot but you can always use the room key also. We loved the north village pool but went to west for bingo every. There were even still a few pools that we never went to I see the manager reads these reviews and didn't see a comment card in the room so decided to put them here: On thrusday for 19.95 per person they held a comedy show which was AWESOME Erik Olson Was definitely a hit! He had everyone laughing and knew how to entertain adults with kids present! What a great time we had at that and the food was also great!! Highly recommend price sounds steep but it comes with an all you can eat buffet ribs,chicken,,salad ect The staff was all knowledgable and pleasant! The shuttle bus drivers Ada, Ed, Ollie answered every question we had about the resort and shared the days activities with us ( found out about comedy show and happy hour from them! Donna at breezes from Massachusetts was a great waitress! I would like to say the tube rental at river island is outrageous and as owners you should not have to pay $9 - one day they closed the gym at west village and didn't tell anyone they would be so that was a pain for ppl without a car had to go down to ri very nice equiptment tho! Make sure to tell them if your an owner when buying things for the 10% discount! I agree with the bike rentals! My boyfriend said it the whole trip they should have them Shuttles were very quick but it was not a busy week!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had more time there!”
Reviews.Author: sp0t
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort, the 2nd one we visited during our 2 week stay in Orlando. We were in the West Village tennis area in a 2bdrm aprt on the 4th floor with a balcony overlooking the lake and golf course - ideal location as it was walking distance to the pool, reception area and marketplace. We asked to be moved from the pre-assigned stand alone villa to this area as my youngest son had a strained leg muscle and we wanted him to be able to easily walk to the pools etc - this request was met straight away during our efficient and v easy check in. We travelled with our 17, 14 and 11 yr old children who did not want to leave at all! Spent one of the days at the River Island complex with the lazy river and spoilt ourselves with a cabana - absolutely heavenly day and possibly the highlight of our whole trip! In hindsight we wish we had planned better to include more resort time as in between visiting all the theme parks we were left with needing more R and R (!) Would love to return and will be HIGHLY recommending this resort to anybody and everybody back home herein New Zealand!

Reviews.Title: “nothing spectacular but good !”
Reviews.Author: carol072
Reviews.Content: I stayed orange lakes for week end april after a confusing map of directions realised the resort is in maingate not kissimme, on arrival at reception was warmly welcomed by reception staff who then gave me keys to a 2 bedroom condo in the west village which i was told had been upgraded. Due to the size of the complex got lost at first but then found unit it had been upgraded but although it was ok not what expected sheraton vistanna far superior as parkway vacation village and wyndham bonnet creek.The unit was ok size with ok furniture there are plenty facilities on resort with shuttle bus to take you round resort as if you dont have car and have young kids or elderly parents with you either need to take bus or i would strongly recomend a car. Outside complex there is a applebees or alehouse walgreens within 5 minute drive and 10 mins will get you target or longhorn steak house the complex is geared for you to stay in at night as road you would have to walk along to get to thease places is dimly lit. For me the complex was too far away from bars and resturaunts which iam used to for that reason only would not return. Sorry orange lakes but there is better resorts out there in better locations. I felt the set up made it hard to go outside at night the bars inside are there so you dont have to go out but realy nothing outside anyway.Strong point the river resort is far superior to the other parts of resort but wasnt offered there .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBeachboy1
Reviews.Content: Used and RCI exchange week. After reading all the comments on the timeshare pitch and having more RCI weeks than I know what to do with, I made sure I dodged the sales pitch at check-in, by foregoing the "$20 gift certificate validation" LOL and running out citing a wife and child in the hot car outside which was true, but pre-planned:). They only called a couple of times (while we were home), but I didn't answer and they left no message, so I knew it was them. So in short, easy peasy to avoid the whole pitch, but read my comment at end. The west village 2 bdrm, 2 bath villa was absolutely fantastic. Very well furnished, decorated, and appointed with everything we would need for a 1 week vacation. The units are huge and perfectly laid out even with European style bathrooms where the sink is accessible separate from the toilet/shower, so you all can get ready in the morning quickly. Our unit was spotless and completely bug free and it was some kind of mating season for some flying ants or something so that says a lot about the quality of the cleaning. We are a family of 4 with 2 girls ages 5 and 3. The "starter" kit of stuff was way more than we needed for the week and we ate in 2-3 meals a day and only went off the resort to Disney on 3 days out of 7. We packed clothes for 3-4 days and didn't even use all the laundry detergent supplied. It sounds like different folks may have different needs, so I suggest checking out what is in the unit before shopping to decide for yourself. We had time to kill before getting our room and ended up buying toilet paper and detergent that we didn't use at all. Even soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion are all supplied for a weeks stay, so don't bother bringing any. If we went back, I'm convinced we could travel with 3 full-size carry-ons given what they supply in the villa and the laundry facilities. Beds and pillows were all excellent quality. As mentioned in other reviews, you can wait for the shuttle or you would need a car to get around all the facilities. The person who suggested the bike rentals is dead on. Based on the age of my kids, we didn't spend any money on extra activities, but I definitely would have considered renting bikes for the week. Maybe rent bikes AND kid trailers? That would be great to boot around the resort. I would have paid $100 for 2 decent bikes and a bike trailer for 2 kids for one week. We mostly hung out at the north village splash lagoon. The pool behind our unit worked well for quick cool-offs before dinner after a day at Disney or shopping. The 2 or 3 pools we visited were all very nice and clean. Keep an eye on little ones because I didn't see a lot of lifeguards, but the pools are about as toddler friendly as you can make them. We ate at Breezes twice. Decent food and prices were not bad for a resort. The service was fine. The millers ale house and olive garden just outside the resort were still way better value for money and tastier food (especially the ale house), but Breezes had entertainment for the kids (magicians, face painting, hula hoop competitions, balloon animal guy on stilts, so it's a toss up on whether I'd eat there or off the resort. Besides...you wouldn't have to drink and drive if you eat on the resort...which is definitely worth the extra price. Booze seemed very expensive compared to places outside the resort, but if you're just hanging by the pools, I noticed a lot of people discreetly using their own booze and no one seemed to care, despite the "official" signs. Super Target across the street was handy and cheap for everything from groceries to cheap pool toys that you wouldn't feel bad leaving behind. I am guessing that this place would be pretty good to stay at as a destination of it's own, even though we mainly used it as a base to visit Disney and various malls. If you are interested in the RCI exchange program, this would probably be a pretty nice place to be your "home resort"...but as I said, I'm saying that with no idea about the price and terms. Highly recommended to anyone wanting to visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: kparris472
Reviews.Content: When my family and I arrived the staff was very helpful. The rooms were immaculate. It was like paradise. This place features a lazy pool, its like a water park. I loved it. The Good thing about it, its minutes away from Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: moniquegillis
Reviews.Content: We are staying in the newly remodeled west village of the holiday inn orange lake resort. We travel quite a bit and find the accomodations to be excellent. Very friendly staff. Fun for adults or families

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lakes River Island”
Reviews.Author: theresamk
Reviews.Content: So much fun,You don't have to go to any theme parks if you don't want to. Love the landscaping. Rooms at River Island are very nice. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mjbChatham
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week stay at Orange lake. We stayed on week in the West Village Clubhouse and another week in a two bed room unit at River Island. We had a wonderful stay. Our units were immaculate. We ate once at each of the resort restaurants and all meals were very good. Over the years we've found the service at River Island Grilling company to be the weakest. We've always had excellent service at Legacy Grill at the Legends and Breezes. There are several new restaurants nearby on 192 which we really enjoyed also. The resort has dropped some of their prices but in order to be competive with the new restaurants nearby, they need to take another look at the pricing. When we contacted resort services on a couple of occasions, our requests were dealt with promptly and followed with a call to make sure our needs had been met Our move from one unit to the next was handled for us. We had a wonderful time and intend to return for a month next year. This has been our families vacation destination since 1992 and children, now grown up, enjoy bringing their friends to join us. We also used the fitness centres every day and were pleased with the quality of the machines (except a few mnor repairs are needed at Mussels).

Reviews.Title: “Wow, incredible property.”
Reviews.Author: housewench
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a weeks stay here. We had a two bedroom villa in West Village. It was beautifully decorated, clean and spacious..it exceeded our expectations. The location was great for us as it was close to the pool and the shuttle. I spent most of my time at the pool while the fella's hit a couple of bucket of balls, golfed, kayaked, and visited the sports bar to watch the hockey playoffs. This resort offers so much onsite which was one of the reasons we chose it. It offers something for everyone in your family. Yes, you have to pay extra for most activities, but we felt they were reasonably priced. We didn't stay at River Island as it was very busy..it was Easter and many families were there. We were there with our 20 year old son and there were other pools to visit. We liked the fact that the villa offered all the comforts of home including a washer and drier (three boxes of soap too). We also liked the fact that there wasn't daily housekeeping so we could sleep in, or do whatever we pleased without interupting their schedule. We did laundry every other day, towels mostly, which wasn't a big deal. We ate breakfast and lunch usually at the villa and dinners out most nights. They do have barbeques set up in various areas and we did bbq one night which was nice. I brought extra paper products, laundry soap, dish soap and paper plates/napkins. They have a dishwasher, but it was just a easy to do dishes by hand. As others have mentioned, there are many stores in the near vicinity..Walgreen's, super Target, Publix and many great restaurants to choose from. We originally booked in for three nights, but loved it so much after one day, that we booked in for the rest of the week and cancelled our reservations at another property. Why would you stay in a hotel when you can stay here in a two bedroom, two bath villa with all the comforts of home. We loved everything about this place and would have liked to have spent more time here. We will definitely return. A note about timeshare. They didn't pressure us at check-in and we ignored the phone messages.

Reviews.Title: “Been going here for 10 years! Love it!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTraveler64
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Orange Lake for about 10 years. We are not owners or RCI members as that is just not for us. We love this place and always stay here on our annual trip to the area. It has great rooms, a TON of stuff to do, intimate bars where you are welcomed like "Norm" at cheers and wide open spaces/swimming pools where you can remain anonymous. My husband loves it for the golf. I love it because it makes him happy and it has SO much to do. We love Orange Lake and accept it's limitations. It's limitations include - 1. No houskeeping if you stay 10 days or less. Not an issue for us. 2. It costs extra for activities - mini golf, rent a tube, hit a bucket of balls. Accept it and move on with your life. They offer the option to buy things in "bulk" (aka 3 days of golf) to get a better rate. 3. Customer service at locations that sell food IS SLOW. This drives me insane but I accept it in trade for the good stuff. Some of the best things we like to do in no particular order. 1. Go see Tommy Treadway at the bar. He really is a good singer and makes everyone feel welcomed. 2. Enjoy a drink or two at bar. 3. Go for a walk on grounds and look for alligators (they are there!). 4. Hit a bucket or two on the range. 5. Golf (just my husband - I don't golf). 6. Watch the golfers from our room's balcony/patio. 7. Get pizza from Paisan's pizza. 8. Get smoothies from Island connections. 9 People watch at pool. 10. Watch the lizards and hummingbirds around the pool. 11. Go to the Gatorland show. Things they could fix: 1. Customer service at food sale locations and at the location where the golf course/snack bar is together is HORRIBLE. I have seen some of the lsales ladies at the snack bar for YEARS. They never get any better. They don't smile. They aren't friendly. They aren't organized. They forget to tell you when your pizza is ready. But yet I see them year after year, after year. Seriously. Listen Orange Lake folks - go and be a secret shopper at your food locations. You will see what I mean. I think this should be the main focus of your energies because I would think each resort guest stops at these locations at least once during their stay. One thing in particular that drives me nuts is ordering an ice cream. You tell them your order. They don't write it down. And then they ask you 5 more times while they are making it for you to repeat your order. DRIVES ME NUTS. 2. Add more benches at the driving range by the golf academy. Currently there are 2. There are lots of spouses who like to come and sit on the benches and watch their spouses. We bring books and sit and enjoy the sun. 3. Trim the bushes on the left where the road from River island's Hippo Slide ends at the road that runs past the legends. Drivers cannot see cars coming from the left and I have seen some near misses. 4. Rent bicycles. For gosh sakes, I can't see why someone hasn't done this yet. The resort is huge. Rent bikes. 5. Understand that guests like to walk/bike/jog. During the day time, it might be okay to walk on the road that is a main drag. However, it is taking your life into your hands to walk at night on the main drag. PLEASE, PLEASE add sidewalks from one end of the resort to the next. 6. One more thing. On the last night of our stay (april 9) the air conditioning unit in one of the units in our building must have gone out. I was only getting 4 hours of sleep that night because of when we were leaving in themorning. That got cut to 3 because the maintenance guys decided to have an argument in spanish for about 2 hours outside while they determined how to fix the unit. I was on the 3rd floor and had to finally holler out. the patio windows..silencio, por favor....this resulted in 5 minutes of silence and then the argument continued. Maintenance folks should NEVER ever keep a guest up at night. Ever. We love Orange Lake. We really do. It is not perfect but it is great. Understand that and you'll have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and wanted in a resort stay, but BEWARE of timeshare sales rep!!!”
Reviews.Author: xiongyeng83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two kids has just returned this week from this resort. The resort is huge and everything met our expectations. We stayed in a two bedroom villa over on the west village side which was very quiet. The pools were very nice and clean. We went to the resort on a package we received that includes tickets to seven different theme parks and dinner tickets that were valid for 14 days. This was a package we had received a couple of years ago through a timeshare orientation at another beach. We love everything about the resort, our package and our time there. The resort is located very close to everything. They have a Super Target right across the street and tons of familiar local restaurants and shops around. They are also a cashless resort which is great! We just use our room cards to make whatever purchase we needed to on the resort and was bill for it after we left. The only complaint I have for this resort which I did not include in my rating is that if you are going to this resort base on attending a 90 minute timeshare presentation beware!! The sales rep here are intense and rude. They are heartless and will say anything and do anything to get you to purchase timeshare. They will forget that you are human just to satisfy their sales. My husband and I had went on this trip with the intention that we got a good package to a great hotel and we would kindly attend the presentation as part of our agreement. The sales rep was furious to hear that this was our intention. He basically told us that we do not understand what the agreement was about; that we were supposed to use the money we paid for this trip as the downpayment for the timeshare. He even go as far to telling my husband that my husband had the worst attitude ever and that he is not a good father to our kids or a good husband to me. He told me he felt sorry for me that I was married to such a heartless man who didn't feel that buying a vacation for life for his family was important. He even told my husband that my husband's parents raised him wrong and so forth. Then he brings in his manager and another guy after that to try to convince us to buy. The manager was just as rude. She told us that she really didn't want to us to buy the timeshare at that price anyways so even better. I totally thought my husband was going to snap at the sales rep. We were there for a good 3 hours so when they say 90 minute be prepare for a long session!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS RESORT!!”
Reviews.Author: diamondsr8
Reviews.Content: I just finished speaking with a manager at this resort and am appalled. I had called to request information on the resort and to reserve a room. I was told that I would need to give my credit card information within 24 hours or the reservation would be cancelled. I was not able to get this OK's by husband till after the 24 hours, so when I called to reserve the room with my credit card information I was told they were making a new reservation. No problem... or so I thought. I called about a week later to cancel the reservation due to illness, and was told by the agent that since they had never run the credit card information I could not receive a cancellation number or email. Guess what?! Today I receive an email welcoming me to the resort this weekend when our original reservation was made for. I called to let them know that this was cancelled weeks ago and was told that they would be charging one day's deposit! I asked to speak to a manager and spoke to a Michael [--]. He stated that because I booked at a discounted rate that I would lose a nights deposit regardless of when I called to cancel and that this was explained to me when I booked. This was most definitely NOT told to me when I booked. I would never book with a hotel that has that type of policy. I fully understand charging a penalty if a customer does not cancel withing an allotted time, but this was cancelled weeks in advance of our reservation. This resort seems so desperate for funds that they will resort to taking customers monies whether they stay there or not, or cancel in time or not. Just be advised... unless you are absolutely sure that there is no way on earth you could possibly have to cancel this, (regardless of illness, death or whatever!), do not book this hotel. There are hundreds of wonderful resorts in Orlando that do not implement this policy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort...PUSHY & DECEIVING timeshare tour”
Reviews.Author: nhtraveler7590
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this resort. It was a very large resort with nice rooms and nice pools. I have stayed at more luxurious hotels...I would rate this at average, but the pools were slightly above average. We stayed in a two bedroom villa that had just been remodeled. Nice decor and furniture, but cabinetry, appliances, and fixtures still seemed older. The beds were not the most comfortable. As others have said maid service does not come in unless an extra fee is paid for. Also, new towels are not brought, so you have to wash them yourself. I personally feel like maid service and fresh towels should not be an extra charge for owners considering the maintenance fees that owners pay. Food at the restaurants was average at best. Prices were reasonable. Drinks not included in all you can eat breakfast buffet. My husband and I went on a tour. We were interested in purchasing, but were upfront saying we weren't looking to buy that day...we wanted to find out the details and think about it. We were told the tour would be one hour long...three hours later ours finally ended. Judging from other reviews I have read the facility must be well aware that this tour takes WAY longer than the hour that they tell you it is to get you to go. It is NOT worth the ticket discount promised. I came to Florida to enjoy some sun not sit through a PUSHY tour that exceeded the time we were told it would be. After saying not interested to the original offer from the original guide...we had to endure four other pushy salespeople doing their pitches. We tried to end the conversation several times. Finally we were told that we were going to be given a survey about our opinions about the tour from another person...that turned out to be another sales pitch. Also one of their ploys as another reviewer had the same experience. Finally we said we were looking to end this, and were finally let go three hours later. We asked for a manager to complain, who basically brushed us off and didn't care about our complaints. He told us it was our responsibility to end the tour at one hour if we wanted to leave. I explained that we tried that short of leaving mid sentence of the people talking. We also were told to leave our car at one building and were given a golf cart ride to another. We were told to get back to our car we could wait for the tram. If they drive you somewhere...you shouldn't be made to wait 20+ minutes for transport back to your vehicle. This seriously made me think twice about purchasing from this place. We are now looking into other timeshare opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space and privacy! Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: DaveV075
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the 4 days I recently spent at the Holiday Inn Orange Lake. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo in the North Village which is near reception. Although I have read that people like staying near the lazy river, I preferred the nice quiet area where you don't have any noise from neighboring condos or from the pool area. (something I did not get late at night at Disney's Coronado Resort). Although they offerred for me to attend a sales meeting (i.e. reception), they did not push when I declined and they did not try to hassle me with sales pitches the rest of the stay. So, not sure about the negative comments in that regard. Rooms were clean and well appointed (to the extent that I required). I almost preferred not having maids come in and out each day. About the only thing I would suggest is creating a little "guide" or something to that effect letting guests regarding how you would like the condo left (towels laundered, etc...). Also, wanted to give a thumbs up to Breezes (the only restaurant we ate at due to its convenient location to us)! Excellent food at a reasonable price. I expect to get gouged eating in at any resort and was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not worth the high pressure sales pitch!”
Reviews.Author: TMounkes
Reviews.Content: First the positive things: Grounds were lovely, green and lush. Our 2 bedroom villa at River Island was clean and nicely-furnished. Food was yummy, waitstaff/bartender was personable, and live music was entertaining. Now the not-so-positives: The water pressure in the showers is horrible. The pools and hot tubs close at 10pm, which is insane. After enjoying the parks and stopping for dinner, our 8 year old barely had an opportunity to get wet before all of the water activities shut down. And the lazy river is lovely, but the $9.00 per person per day charge to use an inner-tube to enjoy it is ridiculous. And then the most miserable of all.........the "time share sales presentation." When I first called to make my reservation, the very sweet young lady informed me we'd need to attend a NINETY minute, no pressure presentation to receive a discounted rate. I agreed to this requirement. When my reservation packet arrived in the mail, it listed a TWO HOUR presentation requirement, but I didn't balk, because "what's an extra thirty minutes, anyway?" But the mere fact that the sales team - and I mean team literally - simply wouldn't listen to our firm but polite refusal, made this quite unbearable. Our original sales guy, Sam, was very frank and straight-forward, and kept promising us that Orange Lake wasn't like other companies that try to pressure folks into buying something when they clearly are not interested. That Orange Lake is so admired and revered that they don't need to push and push and push. So when he pitched his "deal" to us, and we refused, he assured us that a sales manager was merely coming over to offer us some limited inventory properties, and then he'd "sign off" on our tour, and we'd be free to leave. Peter, the sales manager, dropped by, and he, too, was professional and business-like and left us alone after our firm "no". We were told someone was coming then to conduct a quick survey. The next TWO (yes I said TWO) guys I don't even remember their names, they kept offering us smaller and smaller "deals", and one of them even hinted at suggesting that "surely our family could afford just 102.00/month" despite our STRONG insistence that we weren't interested. The final guy tried to get us to buy a 999.00 week long vacation package that he was willing to finance for me right then and there - and I could take up to TWO years to schedule it. I felt like I was at a used-car sales convention. At this point I became a bit rude, I guess, and assured this poor last salesperson that I was not buying ANYthing, and I would very much like to leave. At this point we were escorted to the "close out" counter, stripped of our VIP passes and loaded on a trolley bus with the other "losers" and driven back to our vehicles. This miserable process wasted THREE AND A HALF hours of our vacation. Trust me, the lush grounds and nice accommodations aren't worth the "cost."

Reviews.Title: “Quick Mother/Daughter Weekend Getaway - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: vtxriders
Reviews.Content: Booked a room through the Holiday Inn website and got an excellent price on a 2 bdrm condo in the River Island complex. We didn't have a beautiful review but was in the best location in the resort. We did, however, only pay $20 more per night than the local Holiday Inn Express. Okay, the good and the bad... Good - everything! River Island is an excellent way to spend the day. The condo was in great shape and very clean. We were fortunate enough to not get any sales calls but we were only there 3 days. There was plenty of soap and stuff for our short stay. Bad - If you are overly picky, you might find some scuffs on the walls or baseboards but if you are that picky, you should probably stay home. Even though the guy who checked us in told us that we had to use our room card to pay for everything, he never set it up to work. We went down to get tubes, they told us our card was not set up. However, that turned into a food thing since we got our tubes free. I did hear some complain that the lazy river water had too many leaves in it. However, that is a result of people walking through the mulch to enter the pool. If people would stay on the concrete and keep therenkids in line, that would greatly reduce that problem. It was clean each morning after the filters had a chance to clean the water. It is a great spot in a good locarion If you have read the reviews you should know what to expect. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation! 10 mins to Disney World! Affordable Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: seamard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake in the East Village from April 14th - April 18, in one of their 2 bedroom villas. We had a party of 8 which included couples, singles, toddlers, and bigger children. Our stay was absolutely wonderful and everyone enjoyed it. We were in Orlando for to go to Disney World but we still utilized some of the resort amenities. I am going to be as honest as possible so everyone can get a picture of the resort. THE GOOD: The resort is huge and has a lot of great things to do for couples, singles, and families. We played tennis, golfed, went to the arcade, and River Island. River Island (which is the water park complex on the grounds) was amazing!! The kids and grownups in our party loved it. The zero entry pool was perfect, it allowed our 2 and 3 year old party members to play in the pool without us having to worry. The lazy river was awesome! We really enjoyed it. And the water slides were extremely fun. Also they have places to get food and drinks right at the pool and if you do not feel like getting out of your lounge chair, there are servers who circle the complex and will take your order. Surprisingly the place was not too crowded despite our vacation coinciding with Spring Break for the Northeast. For the adults: the alcoholic drinks were inexpensive and they had discounted refills. We got the "bucket" which was literally a bucket that could serve 2-3 people for $8.50 (which you could refill for $7.50). They also have smaller refillable drinks that are only $5.00 to refill. Which is not bad for a frozen alcoholic beverage. The rooms were extremely spacious. 1200 sq ft in a 2 bedroom. It had a jetted tub in the master bedroom with a separate walk in shower. The living room had a nice sectional sofa with a pullout bed. The kitchen was well equipped. And they provided you with dish soap and laundry detergent. For the price it was a steal. We paid about $100 a night for this condo and we had room to hang out and have fun. If we had gone to a traditional style 3 star hotel we would have needed at least 2 separate rooms and we would have paid double the price. Also we were able to cook so we saved money on eating out. Another thing we really enjoyed was the screened in patio! We ate breakfast out there every day. The location was perfect. There was a Publix right at the front gate as well as a Super Target across the street from the entrance. There were restaurants in the resort as well as in the immediate surrounding areas. This resort is also located on 192 which gives you direct access to Disney World. It took us less than 10 minutes to drive from the East Village building to the parking lot at Magic Kingdom. It was perfectly located. The staff was great. Everyone was friendly and helpful. And they have 2 Disney World employees that work at the Attractions desk so you can purchase your tickets on sight. THE BAD: We usually stay in 3 or 4 star hotels and I think the mattresses and bedding in the Hyatt and Hilton hotels are a bit more luxurious. (This didn't really matter to us because the price was amazing, but you should be aware of it just in case it matters to you.) Check out is at 10am (You have to leave the room but you can keep using the resort amenities all day.) If you have small children be sure to bring plastic plates/cups from home or buy some disposable ones from the store because the rooms only have glass cups, plates, and bowls. We had a 2 and 3 year old with us so we went and bought them plastic Mickey Mouse souvenir cups. OVERALL: We had an excellent time, got a great deal, and had space to relax. We started planning our next trip to Orlando the minute we got home and we will be staying at Orange Lake again!

Reviews.Title: “It will be a VERY, VERY long time before I visit this Resort again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beachbuddy1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this resort the 1st week of April 2011. This resort was absolutely beautiful. My family and I stayed in the North Village, a personal villa and it was quite perfect for my family and I. We statyed in a two bedroom, two bath villa on the golf course, it was very clean, spacious and well stocked with amenities such as laundry detergent, dishwasher detergent, soap, towels exc. The pots and pans were very new, the dishes along with silver ware was new. Overall, this villa was perfect. Check-in time was too late in the day, particularly when registration strongly encourage you to arrive for check in at 10:30 a.m. to ensure you get the specific room request that you prefer. After check-in is secure, you cannot officially check into your room until 4:00 p.m. - about 6 hours of riding around, eating & doing nothing. Because this was our first visit to the Resort, checking in felt like an obstacle course - being shuffled from one counter to the next with entirely too much information to absorb. The resort did offer several things to do such as swimming, golf, game rooms, putt putt, and many other things, but the additional amenties were with an additional cost, which I though was INSANE, especially with me being a guest in the Resort for 5 days. Pros: Plenty of space to stretch out Nice Kitchen Very clean-super clean!! Plenty of towels and clean linen Washer and Dryer in villa was nice Dishwasher was nice jacuzzi tub was nice Front desk-really nice Perfect for husband and wife Cons: too much information upon check-in (I felt like we were on an obstacle course and needed a personal tour guide every time we ventured out into the property) Basketball courts were not condusive for 12 year olds (older teenagers were always playing) Movie night consisted of dated movies that my children had already seen Fishing was available, however, I was never able to get info on how to take advantage of this ammenty The additional ammenties that my teenage children probably would have enjoyed came with an additional cost. My children are accustomed to the Beach for Spring Break (very, very last minute trip change from Destin to Orange Lake); super, duper bad mistake. I called the resort and was told there was a beach on the property (man-made, off a lake).........just not the same. So, NO BEACH people! Although our villa was extremely nice and I specifically requested an individual lodging; had I known to to request newest property (the one that's displayed on the web site) with ALL of the extra amentities surrounding this property, I would have requested this location. So in order to take advantage of these extra amenties, we had to drive to get to them and to me, vacation is about total convenience. Overall-the resort was extremely nice. I will strongly reccommend for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gorgeous clean and SUPERB. 10 STARS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jfilthy
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bedroom villa for me, my husband, and our 2 year old toddler. When we entered the main entrance, we knew right away we were going to love it. Security gate, restaurants, pools, waterslides, shoppes, golf, and the most beautiful clean landscape with gorgeous tropical flowers everywhere! We were here 1 week, and were sad to leave. THe north village had the perfect pool for toddlers, with splash fountains, as well as a waterslide, and a huge adult pool.. the "River Island" was great too with a lazy river, and poolside bar.. The unit we rented?? WOW. Marble countertops in kitchens and bathrooms, our own JACUZZI tub in our bedroom, a nice sized living room, AND a private balcony! This place is AMAZING. We checked in at night, and we never ONCE heard anything about a timeshare presentation, nor were bothered. There is also a Publix grocery store at the main entrance which was wonderful.Took us 10 minutes to get to Magic Kingdom.... I HIGHLY advise you rent a car if staying here, as you will want to explore!!!! WILL STAY HERE AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay with a Family!”
Reviews.Author: ambmeglydcam
Reviews.Content: Check-in and check-out was easy. Everyone treated us nicely. The sales presentation was way too long. We had to sit through 4 people trying to convince us to buy something we just weren't interested in at the time. The lazy river was our favorite place to spend the day. We stayed at River Island and loved it. It was right by the pool. The food at Breezes was great and the sunset celebration was nice there as well. We loved it so much, we are going back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation terrible timeshare pressure”
Reviews.Author: grahamnls
Reviews.Content: The accomodation was 1st class, but watch the hidden charging after check out. Try to avoid timeshare selling as it is very very hard sell and they don't like no for an answer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday. Will be back again (ignore the bad reviews)”
Reviews.Author: Charlieandgem
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort via Virgin Holidays and were delighted with the resort. Despite the fact we arrived during a tropical storm and the rooms we requested were not adjacent (Virgin's fault) the check-in team did all they could to resolve this immediately. We were not sold any time share (maybe because we were exhausted Brits just off a 9 hour flight). We were grateful that two of the restaurants delivered take out as we were very hungry on arrival. We stayed in the East Village. The appartment we stayed in was very spacious, very clean and modern, peaceful. The next morning we awoke to gorgeous sunshine and lovely views of the golf course. The resort is stunning and very well maintained. If you keep your eyes peeled you may spot the odd bit of wildlife (baby alligator paid a visit). We also had views of the Magic Kingdom fireworks which were an added bonus. The resort is enormous and you will need a car (big time). The resort shuttle is very handy sometimes a bit sporadic but the drivers are also very friendly and will pick you up if you flag them down. The service overall at the resort is excellent, always with a smile. The resort is cashless. This was not mentioned in the Virgin Holidays Brochure or Virgin website. As typical Brits coming abroad typically we brought half cash, half travellers cheques. Credit card charges make bringing credit card unattractive. You can pay off your room charge with credit card, cash or travellers cheques but do note that to cash in a TC you can only do a max of $50 a day. Although a minor issue, it was a bit of a pain trying to keep track of spend. The local publix at the entrance to the resort allows you to cash $100 a day. Although we spent a fortnight in the resort we barely had time to do any of the many activities so will need to return another year to try them out (except for the Karaoke - give it a miss, the song list is outdated and nothing for the kids to sing!) We didn't cotton on to the cheap re-fills of soft drinks and cocktails until well into week 2, don't miss out, cocktails for $5 dollars are a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Vacation Property”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravels2
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, including our two teenaged daughters, travelled to Kissimmee for March Break and stayed for a week in a two-bedroom suite. The suite was spacious, well-equipped and in excellent condition. The website photos were entirely representative of the room we were assigned. The entire 1400 acre property was impeccably well-maintained. Our suite was located in the East Village but we used the wonderful facilities thoroughout the resort. A very convenient shuttle service, operated by friendly drivers, allows one to travel within the resort without a car. Nevertheless, having your own vehicle would be highly recommended if you want to explore Orlando. Even though the resort was fully occupied during our stay (at approximately 9000 guests!), we never found the resort to be crowded. Our room, backing onto one of the golf courses, was always quiet. The pool facilities were excellent, especially the River Island pool complex with its 1200 ft. lazy river. There are very reasonably-priced restaurants on-site and the service and food quality were very good. An even greater selection of moderately-priced, family restaurants are located just outside of the resort. A grocery store and Super Target are also nearby. We saw no evidence of anything we read in the few negative TripAdvisor reviews. We have already recommended this resort to others since we returned home and would not hesitate to stay at the Orange Lake Resort on our next trip to the Orlando-area.

Reviews.Title: “Third time is a charm!”
Reviews.Author: ioniagal
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time visiting Orange Lake, and it was by far the best! We don't do the Theme Parks during Spring Break, so staying at a resort like this was perfect for our family. The staff was very friendly when we checked in and when we checked out. We sat through the presentation, to which they gave us the 7 day Fun Pass, that was well worth the 1 1/2 hours. The sales staff were very friendly, persistant, yet friendly. My boys are 9 and 12, they played mini golf for hours and used the hippo slide a ton! It's worth it to visit all three major pools to find the right one for your family. The down side would be the people who reserve pool chairs at 8:00am and don't show up until 11:00 and have full lounge chairs for toddlers when adults are sitting on the ground. The staff at River Island did their best to stop this, but it's so big, that's nearly impossible. Overall, we had an amazing week, and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 8 visits Orange Lake Resort with some hesitancy”
Reviews.Author: djcrain
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 8 with our children ranging from 5 to 17. After reading some of the reviews we were hesitant about keeping our reservation. We are so happy we did. Everyone was so friendly and even though we did decide to do the tour- we never felt pressured into taking one. We had other plans in Orlando so we were not able to explore the resort as much as we would have liked. We did visit the pool in the East Village and the lazy river. We did not rent tubes but we did sneak a ride on one and no one said a word. I saw plenty of people without bands and only when the lazy river was busy did the guards ask them to exit the tubes. The beds were comfortable, everything in our room was in working order. The only little problem we had was when I got stuck in the elevator with the kids- the door closed but remained open about 4 inches and none of the buttons, inside or outside, would work.. We did press the CALL button and the gentleman said someone was on the way- fortunately the elevator started working before help ever arrived. (within 5 minutes of getting stuck). We chose not to purchase at this time because we are not into make instant decisions, but we do look forward to returning to Orlando and visiting Orange Lake Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice escape from too much "Magic"!”
Reviews.Author: luv_maui_hi
Reviews.Content: This is a nice relaxing place to stay. I think some of the older units could use some mechanical work (sewer & hot water). The pools are way overcrowded, but the place is clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort EVER!”
Reviews.Author: tnroche
Reviews.Content: I picked this resort for our Spring Break because we wanted a condo so we could have room. I got a sweet deal on travelzoo.com and booked right away! We had a 2bedroom/2 bath villa. This place is humongous! There are so many pools I lost track. Unfortunately it rained the ENTIRE time we were there, thankfully the condo had 3 tvs and a DVD player. I unpacked and both kids had their own tv to entertain themselves while it rained. It had everything you needed for your stay. I would definitely come back. The only negative was that the bed wasn't all that comfy. I wish it was a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy of Gold Crown RCI Rating”
Reviews.Author: WorkHardiePlayHardie
Reviews.Content: My family and I exchanged our points to stay at Orange Lake for spring break. We have friends who own here and now own here because Holiday Inn Club purchased our timeshare property from its previous holding company. After looking at the pictures on the Holiday Inn Club website and seeing the Gold Crown rating that was awarded by RCI, we were sure this was the place we wanted to spend our spring break. After this trip, we will be sure to ask much more detailed questions regarding pictures that are on the website vs. each village/building because what we saw isn’t what we got. Check-in was easy and quick where you received a $20 voucher for resort activities, which had to be activated at another counter in the lobby. This was a push for an “Owner Update Meeting” AKA a presentation to sale the property/points. Just say NO. After checking out and entering our 1 bedroom villa in the North Village, we were quite disappointed!! It was sooo dated! I would rate this room a 2-star at best. I couldn’t believe what I was seeing. The furnishings and accessories were dated. The grounds are obviously better kept and maintained than the inside of the condo, which is concerning for me as an owner. The North Village does appear to be one of the older complexes on property. In addition to this, it has been neglected. We had a myriad of issues: There were no sheets or blankets for the pull-out sofa, the oven did not work, there was a bug in the bed, the bathroom door did not open freely, pocket door to the bedroom did not open freely once closed, the closet door was not on track and our refrigerator leaked brown goo from the door. We did call housekeeping to have the oven repaired. It was completely fixed and functioning the next day. Housekeeping also supplied us with sheets, a blanket and pillows for the pull out sofa. The other issues we dealt with as they arouse on our own. A few days into our stay we received a call from a quality assurance representative to discuss the quality of our stay and we welcomed this because we were completely disappointed with our accommodations compared to what we saw online and the Gold Crown rating and all of the issues we had experienced at this point. We expressed all of our concern and issues with our villa; however, this turned out to be a presentation to sale us more points at the OL resort. During this presentation, we toured the River Island Signature Series condo model, which made us feel as though we really got the short end of the stick on our accommodations. This model was plush and had updated furnishings. I am not sure they are really concerned about quality?? There were good things about our stay… You can stay at any of the 4 villages and can use the amenities throughout the complex located at each village. Our little ones enjoyed the River Island lazy river and pool. By the way, if you choose to stay here as a family, request the River Island village. It is the newest complex and from our tour it was obvious that more care and attention is given to this complex versus the older complexes: North and East. We were just a short 10-15 minute drive to Disney. Also, if you stay at OL you will need a car or should use the shuttle as the complex is massive and to walk to each village to use their amenities might be a bit much. Also, another thing I did like is that you received calls to be sure the issues you called housekeeping regarding were resolved to your satisfaction. Also, you received calls regarding events taking place at the restaurants around the complex. I would not recommend staying at OL unless you can guarantee you are in the River Island complex.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Believe what I'm reading”
Reviews.Author: junebug14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been owners at Orange Lake for many years, we own 2 weeks in May and have recently purchased a 1/2 week in River Island. We have never seen any coachroaches any time that we have stayed and have never had a problem with rude people at the resort. My units have always been clean when arriving and if anything needed to be fixed they were right there. My fridge broke down and I called repair at 1am and they came out and fixed it right then and there. They returned the next day to be sure the applicance was still working well.Presentation can be a little long sometime I will agree with that they could be shortened at little. At no time have I run into any of the issues that I'm reading about in all the years we have been owners and am a little disappoint to think that people feel this way my whole family loves Orange Lake and I have sent several of my friends down on a week that I couldn't use and they also love it and have found no problems as mentioned in these reviews. when we first came to Orange Lake we traded in for another timehare we own anad were so impressed with how the grounds and buildings were kept we bought before we left. We never stay at our other timeshare we only us it to go to other places but Orange Lake is our home every May so keep up the good work Holiday Inn I give you thumbs up J. Hayes - Toronto Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Always exceptional”
Reviews.Author: eyore418
Reviews.Content: Have been owners since 2007, what can I say FANTASTIC..... We have stayed mostly at River Island and have always had an amazing stay. I am very suprised to have read so many negative feedbacks, I do wonder if some people just like to complain and find fault whatever or were they even staying at the same place as us? I do agree however that the sales team are quite tenacious in their efforts to get you to the meetings, but you should be in no doubt that the purpous is for you to buy a unit (so if you are not interested dont go!) We would recommend this resort 100% very clean, friendly and welcoming....... Back again in April2011

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: stewheart
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Orange Lake was fantastic. The 2 bedroom suite was HUGE and nicely furnished. The boys loved having their own room and bathroom. The kitchen came equipped with laundry detergent and dish soap and a few other convenience items that really came in handy. The pools were clean and warm. Our boys loved hanging out in the lazy river and using the beach entry pools. The resort is huge and spread out but we prefer that. The kids could walk out of our hotel and go exploring. The reasons I didn't give it 5 stars: The pillows were like solid bricks. Not too comfortable, Our suite was too far from the shuttle stop to use, I think they should add another stop in the West Village. Didn't encounter any trouble with the sales teams. We politely declined everything and they left us alone. I think the complaints about the time share program are ridiculous. They do offer you nice incentives to take the tour, but nothing is for free. Don't take the tour if you don't want to be hassled.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TonifromOhio
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this resort march 28-April 1, 2011. This resort was absolutely beautiful. My family and I stayed in the East Village, bldg 8600. Our villa was perfect for my family and I. We statyed in a two bedroom, two bath villa with a screened in porch facing the 18th hole! Our villa was very clean, spacious and well stocked with amenities such as laundry detergent, dishwasher detergent, soap, towels exc. The pots and pans were very new, the dishes along with silver ware was new. Overall, this villa was perfect. My husband and I stayed in master bedroom-king size bed adjoined to master bathroom with jacuzzi tub-very nice. My children and mother in law stayed in second bedroom that had two queen size beds and a nice size bathroom as well. Our villa did sleep 8, becasue the sofa did let out into a sofa bed-very comfortable for watching T.V. at night. The resort did offer several things to do such as swimming, golf, game rooms, putt putt, and many other things. Unfortunately for us, we did not get an opportunity to swim becasue it rained most of our stay while we were there. Pros: Plenty of space to stretch out Very large Kitchen-very nice Very clean-super clean!! Plenty of towels and clean linen Washer and Dryer in villa was nice Dishwasher was nice jacuzzi tub was nice Front desk-really nice Cons: Resort only has out door pools-we did not get an opportunity to swim because of the weather-tornados, severe thunderstorms-Resort really needs indoor pools for rainy days. Our villa had not flat screen T.V.s-out T.V.s were a little dated. Our coffee maker was old and needed an upgrade. We were obligated to do a time share presentation because of our vacation package-was more than 2 hours, it was more like 4 hours! and we did not have an opportunity to pick out time for our presentation. I attempted many times ti change out time but was rejected and finally told that the guest never select their times for presentation, and we have to stick with what we have scheduled. That kind of sucked becasue it did take up a large portion of our day. Anyhow, we will return but will never get pulled into a time share presentation again-very exhausting! So, overall-perfect resort and would reccommend for families with children. Caution: RUN AWAY FROM TIME SHARE PRESENTATIONS!! not worth the time you have to give up for your vacation no matter what they are offering!! it's always an catch in the end. We were told we would recieve a gift after the presentation and all we recieved was an attempted lure to by a prepaid vacation at the resort again. We told our sales guy no at least 3 times, afterwards they brought out another gut, we told no again, afterwards they brought out another guy, we said no again, then they brought out a 4th guy with a fake gift for our time which was a lure to purchase a prepaid vacation at the resort. STAY AWAY FROM TIME SHARE PRESENTATION! I t will put a huge dent in your families vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed Orange Lake -- Great choice for Orlando condo stay”
Reviews.Author: kathy884
Reviews.Content: My parents did an RCI exchange for Orange Lake the week of 3/20/11 - 3/27/11, my son's spring break week. We were very happy with the resort. Note, though, that the first unit we were given was on a golf course with no pool or ammenities that we would use close by and we went back to the check in desk and asked if we could get something closer to some sort of ammenity we might use. And they gave us a unit walking distance to the smaller pool and hot tub in the West Village right near where you enter the resort (second road to the right) after coming in at the entrance across from Walgreens. We were happy with this. Do, though, be aware that this is a huge resort and unlike many of the smaller resorts in the area where you would always without question be able to walk to a pool, you could end up with a unit where you might even have to drive to get to a pool/hot tub. If you aren't happy with your unit, though, I bet they would move you like they did us if you ask. Customer service seemed outstanding. The unit we had was an older one story duplex unit that had been remodeled and was in great shape (newer kitchen with granite countertops, nice bathrooms -- beautiful tile, etc., flat screen TVs, paint, beds, furnishings, etc. all in good shape.) The nearby pool area and hot tub met our needs perfectly for a relaxing dip after a busy theme park day. It was kind of fun too, we saw the same people in the hot tub each night, so got to meet some of the other guests. The second bedroom had two queen beds and seemed almost as big as the master, had tons of drawer space, had the second bath connected to it and the common area with locks. We were really happy with the size of this bedroom and the unit in general. In most of the condo resorts we've stayed second bedrooms are smaller than this. The patio wasn't in as great shape as I would have expected, but was fine for sitting out on. I liked the balconies at the Sheraton Vistana Resort and Cypress Pointe, though, much better than this patio. It took us a little longer to get to some of the Disney parks and Sea World from here than timeshares right in Lake Buena Vista, but it was still very convienent for getting to these places. Think 20 minute drive rather than say a 12 minute drive. We weren't by the main West Village pool activity area or River Island, but there are frequent shuttles and you could easily take one of these over or drive over. We did use the tennis courts in the main West Village pool area, a couple of minute drive away. We found staff and other guests to be super friendly adding to our positive impression of everything. We took the shuttle over to River Island to look around, and this is a beautiful recreation area. My teen, though, was totally happy with our close by pool and hot tub and opted to go there rather than drive or take the shulttle over to this other area. (We really only had one resort day with all the other attractions we visited in the area, meaning that we were mostly only at our resort in the evenings.) There were planned activiies, but with our busy itinary we didn't participate in any of these. My parents first signed up to do the timeshare presentation on a Wedneday morning, but later backed out and got their deposit back easily. When the guy asked my mom what was keeping her from attending I got a big charge out of her answer: Shamu, Mickey, the Kennedy Space Center, and Disney Hollywood Studios. There wasn't a whole lot he could say with that answer. All in all, we thought Orange Lake was an excellent place to stay and would be happy staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Alwayslexx
Reviews.Content: We went to Orange Lake and It was amazing. Prior to the trip I had done so much research on this place because I was so worried about how our trip was going to be. I wanted this vacation to be memorable while having a nice stay. Well, I probably called the poor people at this resort 20 times and I talked to one guy and I told him I was worried how this was going to be and he told me not to worry about it because he was going to put me in the West Village (he said that this was the best part of the resort to stay because the other parts if the resort are either bland or crowded like river island) and I asked if we could please have a patio because my daughters and I wanted to tan and that didn't seem possible with the balcony walls blocking the sunlight and I also did this so my husband and son could play football. We stated at a two bedroom villa and there was myself, my two daughters, one of my daughters friends and my husband and it was very nice to have enough space and privacy. I also liked that we didn't have cleaning service because it provided my family and I enough privacy. This place is packed with tons of fun things to do and prior to our vacation I planned what to do on certain days and half of our vacation was hanging around the hotel and we stayed their for 10 days. Real nice resort with beautiful grounds and activities. I recommend this to people of all ages!

Reviews.Title: “Corrupt Business Practices”
Reviews.Author: jackieosborne
Reviews.Content: My family and I visted the resort in June of 2010. Resort was beautiful staff friendly but there business practices were extremely corrupt. I signed and cancelled a contract on the same day. The resort processed by $4560.00 deposit any way. They have refused to return my deposit. I am still in court trying to recover my deposit a year later. Too bad their business practices were horrific because my family and I really enjoyed our stay at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: eec1010
Reviews.Content: Where to start. First didn't get the room we were expecting, second our view was of air conditioning units, when we asked to be moved we were treated rudely, and our new room was next to the resort dumpster. DO NOT do the time share tour. Two hours of interrogation and lies. We went through 5 people before we could leave and each one of them was rude and had a different story. The location is alright. You will need a car to go anywhere outside of the resort. There are much much much better places to stay. Been visiting the area for 20 years and this is the worst place I have visited. Hot tub wasn't working, can't swim in the lake, to many people for the amount of pools they have, the "studio" room is bogus. Will never stay there again. Bad place, horrible staff, unfortunate vacation. So many other places around don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for any type of trip in the area.”
Reviews.Author: Cumberlandmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Orange Lake Resort and were very impressed. Our suite was extremely comfortable and clean (huge, actually), and private. We liked that cleaning service was optional - no need to have it for short stays. The location is convenient, and employees helpful and friendly. We were there to be with our daughter while she was playing lacrosse nearby, but this resort would be a great place for families going to the parks. Had we known of it we definitely would have stayed there when our children were younger. Pools are a walk or short ride from most the suites, which could be a negative for some, but wasn't for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort...but don't get caught up in Timeshare offers...unless you really want to!”
Reviews.Author: JamesDLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location for a Theme Park holiday. The resort actually borders the Animal Kingdom, all other Disney/Universal and Downtown Orlando parks are within 20mins drive or so. The Resort is huge, and from what we saw very well maintained, made up of some 5 storey apartment blocks but predominantly villas. We stayed in one of the apartment blocks next to the Main reception building, I would not describe them as the lap of luxury, more of a functional, holiday home feel. The apartment was huge, by English standards, and was pretty much as illustrated in the brochures and on the website. All the amenities were modern and in good working order. The housekeeping was generally OK, but lacked some detail, i.e. behind sofas, furniture a little dusty when patted down, nothing a quick vacuum could not fix. The swimming pools etc were good, with activities for the kids throughout the day, especially useful when you cannot face yet another them park. Restaurants were fine, quality comfort fayre, good service and reasonable value. My one cautionary tail is with regards to the initial full on attack on your senses regarding attending the timeshare talks. Straight from a long travel day with two young kids, the last thing you want is to be bombarded by offers and deals designed to prompt you into attending a meeting. We were sold some discounted lazy river vouchers as well some others as an incentive to go for what was billed as a 2 hour presentation. The meeting does not take 2hours - yes they are charming and the chap whom greeted us took us around the resort on a golf kart, which the kids enjoyed, but the whole experience was a relentless sales pitch which lasted approx' 4 hours, as soon as you declined one offer, another more senior representative was introduced whom offered us yet another deal, we eventually had to say the same thing to approx/ four differnent people before we were released, however, then to validate our vouchers for Lazy river etc took about another 30 mins as the deal the receptionist sold us was incorrect, had to speak to yet more managers to get it resolved. Ironically we never use the vouchers in the end. However, that aside, we had an amazing holiday, the resort had everything we needed and more. We would definatley go back.

Reviews.Title: “We love Orange Lake!”
Reviews.Author: Brouwer_Fam
Reviews.Content: We took our 5 kids & two of their spouses for a week in a 3 bedroom condo. The condo had enough room for us to have our space in the wonderful master bedroom with jacuzzi ensuite, and both married couples to enjoy their privacy as well. We put the 3 teenage guys in the living area which was fine with them. Only complaint we had was that you had to rent the river island tubes for $9 per day per person and couldn't even share them because you have to have the arm band. So much to do on the resort that you really didn't have to go to disney to keep busy. I love walking so enjoyed taking the hike across the street to the new Target. Having a Starbucks on River Island was bliss. Although my husband always wanted to go to a beach resort, this resort makes up for it with even a small beach on a man made lake.

Reviews.Title: “Dependably wonderful resort! Wish I could rate more than 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Tukaram_das
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some of the reviews here. I bought a timeshare here 10 years ago and never regretted it! (so I may be biased). The condos are spacious, and always clean. When we do find anything wrong (light out etc) they always fix it the same day we call it in. I just spent spring break there with my 2 kids, both in college, and we had a blast. Just be advised you will have to schedule days away from Universal/Disney just to have time to hang out at the beautiful resort. We usually stay in the West Village in single story 4-plex units. This year we stayed in an 8 story tower in the new River Bend area. We love the privacy of the West Village and were needlessly concerned about noise, but the convenience of walking out of our room straight into a lazy river was pretty cool. I honestly can't recommend this place enough! The only negatives I can come with are the sales pitch - even for members, and I personally don't care for the cashless resort - I'd rather pay cash as I go for drinks and food.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay - just wish I had more time to make use of the facilities”
Reviews.Author: mat1234521
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for two weeks. I also read the reviews and was a bit worried, however there is no need. Check in took about 15 minutes with a friendly receptionist. We stayed in a two room apartment which had everything and more than what is required. (TV in every room, tumble dryer, washing machine, diswasher, jacuzzi type bath, two bathrooms). A starter pack was supplied with necessities like dish washing liquid, washing powder, coffee, sugar, paper towel.( i thought this was a nice touch since it is self catering). Coming from Mali in Africa, our intention was to see the Disney theme parks. We did, but I wish we had more time in the resort as well - great place to relax. One could spend two weeks in the resort and not leave the place. Good rooms and splendid grounds to go with them. By the way, I was never pestered about time share. The were messages left on the phone but we just ignored them

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the reviews worry you!”
Reviews.Author: T0niL
