Reviews.Content: I was very worried after reading some of the reviews but we just returned from a week stay in a 2 bedroom villa in the West Village and loved it. The villas are great. Resort is truly like a small town so there is a downfall in not being able to walk to the pool but the pools and villas are fantastic. Beds left some to be desired as there aren't a variety of pillow sizes to choose from and the beds are pretty firm. Villa has all the supplies you need. Only issued I had with service was not getting my in room safe opened but I never made a repeat call. Everyone at front desk and pools very friendly. Very close to the Disney parks--take the tollway to avoid traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort for a fair price but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake in the West Village for three nights over spring break. The room far surpassed our expectations--spacious, clean, and stylish. With a designer kitchen area and 2 flat screen tvs, it appeared the space was was recently renovated. The pool and small beach were great for lounging. Definately check out the pool with the lazy river and water slides. While it is convenient to get drinks at one of the resorts numerous bars, they were pretty overpriced and we questioned whether we were paying 9 dollars for a virgin daquiri (this is to be expected though). Unfortunately, the service was hardly as impressive to say the least. The front desk was unhelpful when we asked for a dinner suggestion, didn't know how to direct us to a pool in a different village, and sold us tickets for a venue that required no tickets (fortunately we were refunded). We ate one meal at one of the resorts restaurants and our waitress practically abandoned us. Also, there is no cleaning staff each day which can be a good thing unless you run out of towels like we did. If you aren't bothered by poor customer service then this resort will be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “good package,stressfull salesmen, interesting end”
Reviews.Author: yellowtiger1
Reviews.Content: my family and i just came back from a wonderful spring break getaway. we booked this hotel through a package advertised for a very good price for 4 days 3 nights, but with a catch--the timeshare presentation.... the rooms and bathrooms are very clean, kitchen wonderful, excellent view, big space. the salesman before the presentation said if you are not interested to purchase i will say goodbye and god bless! we were taken around in a golf cart!! treated like royalty. after saying no, five salesmen later and a migraine they go the picture.sent us on our way, had to take the bus back to the reception area to pick up my son, they ditched us just like that. the last night a 2am drunk people rang the door bell, knocked on the door shouting for 10 minutes, called security, they were not found, so after the kids, my spouse and myself were unable to sleep we left at 4am to go back home. awesome place but pushy salesmen for 2 1/2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and perhaps a better choice than a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelingFamily
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a Springbreak trip in Orlando. We did a RCI exchange to this resort and, since we were traveling with our teenage son, we really wanted the extra space. The resort itself is pretty unexciting, but the basic two-bedroom units were well maintained and spacious -- more than adequate as a place to crash at between theme parks (and save $ by being able to make your own breakfasts since there's a very nice kitchen.) Do not go here for luxury or great views. However the resort is very close to Disney parks and easy to get to Universal and/or SeaWorld. Plus there are lots of restaurants, superstores, and putt-putt golf courses close-by. They are quite insistent about taking the info tour when you check in, so be very strong and just say "no thanks" (and pull out the phone linkages when you get to the room.) We only went to the River Island pool and were not impressed -- it is not relaxing since you are continually sprayed by overhead water which you cannot avoid, and it costs $9 per tube which is alot if you go around once! My husband really loved the Legends golfcourse however. One big MARK OF SHAME; there is NO recycling at this massive resort! This is not acceptable in this day and age... (We were only in FL for 5 days and had 4 full bags of water bottles, cans, etc! We gathered everything and brought it to the Publix just outside the property which has a small recycling bin out back.) So, all told, try this place if you get a good price and need/want a good deal more space than you'd get in any hotel room. But do not expect the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for a family of 5- much better than a Disney property”
Reviews.Author: TaraJaz
Reviews.Content: Our water park suite was perfect for our family of 5 (kids 5, 9 and 12)- two large bedrooms, a large living/dining area and a decent kitchen. We had a view of the lazy river water park and Disney's Expedition Everest at Animal Kingdom from our suite. The food at the resort restaurants was very good; we wished that we had planned more meals at the resort rather than at Disney. Our suite was less than half the price of Disney's Wilderness lodge cabins (Disney's least-expensive option for a family of 5), plus we saved money by cooking several meals in our suite. One note: you need to buy all of your kitchen consumables: dish washer detergent, salt/pepper, coffee filters, paper towels, etc. We recommend the Super Target across from the resort- much less expensive than the Publix. Also, try the fishing at the resort. My son caught a 10 lb bass using rented equipment from the resort. Driving to Disney and parking was easier than taking Disney buses from a Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “No major problems, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JudyF53
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at Orange Lake Resort for a week. Our 2-bedroom villa (West) was immaculate. The only problems with our stay was the long, long wait to check-in. You'd think they would be more efficient since they have a list of who is checking in and know in advance how many will be coming in. We were checked in around 3:00 pm which was an hour early and were told by 2 people that took my cell phone # that they would call when the villa was ready. After killing 90 minutes picking up groceries at the Super Target nearby and driving around with no call, we finally went back to the registration desk to see what the problem was. They were rather "short" and said we could go anytime since the villa had been ready for a while (no call). When we got there the cleaning crew was still there. Part of the problem may have been that we had just driven in from Michigan and were rather tired, but that did annoy. The 2-bedroom villa has a sofa, loveseat, and one chair, TV, computer desk (with wireless Internet). One bedroom has a king size bed, the other bedroom has 2 double beds. Each bedroom has it's own full bathroom, TV and ample closets. I especially appreciate the full size washer and dryer in the unit since it means we can pack less. The villa is also equipped with a full kitchen and a dining room. The sliding glass doors from the living room and master bedroom lead to a cement patio with table & chairs. This year we looked out at a pond that provided entertainment from the wildlife. Other years we have looked over the golf course. We were well back from the road so had no problem with the noise, in fact we couldn't hear it at all. Be sure to ask about the location since road noise could be a problem. Everything was clean, worked and up-to-date. Couldn't improve on the villa at all. Be sure to request a first floor villa if that is important to you. We noticed that some people were staying in the few 2nd floor villas which would never have worked for us. The only other problem was an excessively hard sell presentation. Even after repeatedly telling the gentleman (who we were told wanted to meet to update us on changes recently made at Orange Lake) that we had no interest in purchasing additional timeshare points, we were insulted and pushed hard. It takes a lot to get my husband & I angry, but this guy really pushed our buttons and wouldn't let up. We finally got very rude and said we were done. At that point he said all he could figure is that we were crazy since we wouldn't buy. Lovely. Next year we'll gladly forfeit the $30 they charge (then refund) to attend the "owner's update meeting." Aside from the check-in problem and ridiculous hard-sell, our vacation at Orange Lake was perfect. Teenagers & younger kids will enjoy the mini-golf, pools, arcade, and lazy river with rubes. Minutes from WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Accommodation, Don't be put off by bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: kimchesworth
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous prior to coming after reading some of the bad reviews on here, so we were more than pleased when we got to our unit. Firstly though, after setting out from home at 10.00 am UK time and arriving at Orange Lake at 9.30pm US time, the last thing I want is to be mithered about Time Share tours!! The woman who snatched the 'discount voucher' out of our hand and proceeded to ferry us to the timeshare desk, when we were obviously trying to leave the reception, would have got a piece of my mind had I been more awake. Thankfully, this was the only annoyance of our stay. The resort is huge but the majority of people visiting Orlando hire a car, right? Plenty of parking spaces available outside the apartment blocks. We stayed in East Village Block 86100, 2 bed apartment/condo. On arrival the unit was clean and tidy and looked like it has just been freshly painted. No complaints whatsoever here. We knew prior to arriving that housekeeping isn't included. and to be honest we prefer it that way. It's nothing to keep the place tidy yourself, unless you are an utter slob. Plenty of towels and linen were provided in the storage closet. We used the pools at River Island and North? Village. Plenty of sunloungers and towels provided for everyone. The lazy river can be used without a tube, just a matter of floating yourself. No excessive noise to speak of. We all slept well every night without any of the previously mention noise from gardeners or traffic. We did smell 'the smell' on a couple of occasions, but on these occasions we could also smell 'the smell' at Disney, so I don't think it's an Orange Lake only problem. No hassle with the security either, the staff at the gate always had a smile and a wave, but then so did we, so maybe it's a matter of treat people the way you want to be treated. This resort is cashless, as is mentioned in other reviews and on the literature we got prior to arriving. Anything you buy at the resort will be added to your room bill, this can be paid in cash at the end of your stay. Didn't see one single bug in our unit! As long as you go to this resort knowing that :~ it's a cashless, there is no daily maid service and it's BIG you should have no surprises. We will certainly return to this resort on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place 2 Stay”
Reviews.Author: RynoCorp
Reviews.Content: I came up here with my Dad and Uncle, for a much needed vacation and better weather then we were having at home in Ky. This place is HUMONGOUS, with lots of things to do. Holiday Inn Vacation Club, has over 1400 acres. A put put course, 4 or 5 Golf Courses. 2 Made by Arnold Palmer, so great golf courses. Wanna go for a swim, it is here with 7 Swimming Pools. Only thing, that was bad is if you wanna go on the HUGE Lazy River they have here. You have to pay for it, it's $9.00 a person. I have been all over the world several times, and never been charged to go on the lazy river. So that's a big negative about this place, you have to pay for the Lazy River. The condo, we got was a 3-bedroom, which was huge and very nice and spacious. Over all it was a really nice fun place, they have a free shuttle that will take you all over the huge vacation resort, it's free and great way to get around and figure the place out. Other bad thing, is your pets are not allowed, which is crazy. My 2 boys should be allowed to go with me.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Inn quality stay -- the little things made it annoying”
Reviews.Author: itsallu
Reviews.Content: A Jameson or Roadway Inn would have been the same quality with lower price. The grounds were great to tour with the family. The rooms were large, spacious...we rented a double room (1 king 2 queens). But it was the ever growing little things that made the stay annoying. We stayed at the River (lagoon park). Shortly after settling in, another family came barging into our suite. Front desk double booked the suite. We couldnt call the front office since the villa's phone was dead. We hunted for a phone down the hall and an hour after that ackward moment, an employee came to the room and doubted we were guests. After showing ID and reservations he returned to provide us new keys so they could deactivate all keys assigned to the room. Later that night we had to deal with a parking lot party. Security would drive by for a presense, but the kids spread out like flies on #$@ and came back again. This went on until about 3am. Be sure to reserve a room on the lagoon side. If you're a light sleeper, the cars driving over the sewer grates in the street may nudge you awake often and the constant flow of travelers into the condo-facility area. The following day we started using the lagoon area. Its great and an deal place to entertain the family. You wont be badgered by staff, you just simply approach a bar or shop to grab a drink/meal. You could hit the local supermarket, use a cooler bag and have lunch with the kids at the lagoon without issue. The park keeps the staff presence very light. The staff size was only an issue during the high peak meal hours. When we tried to pay after having lunch and our room key couldnt be used for billing, they dont take cash, and our name didnt appear in their system. So I had to race to the room, grab a credit card and run back to pay the bill....while my spouse tried keeping our young kids seated for the journey. They wanted us to call the front desk to correct the issue, but again, the phone was dead during the entire duration so we had to commute across the resort to get support. Other issues - room missing remotes, house cleaning never stopped by to tiddy the beds or provide new towels/shampoo, phone didnt work, and the parking lot commotion is a bit much. The resort meals were medicore at best. Go offsite for better prepared meals at lower prices. Other than the constant escalating issues this would have been a better stay. There were a few others, but you heard enough. Plan the trip right and you'll still have fun.

Reviews.Title: “River Island was a blast!”
Reviews.Author: Canada365
Reviews.Content: We went at the end of February with 4 adults (my husband and my parents) and our child We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa at River Island, 4th floor, facing the parking lot. The view was not great, of course, but on the positive side it was quiet (very little traffic noise), and the balcony was nice and shady! I know we could have changed rooms, but we liked that we were not in the sun if we wanted to sit on the patio for breakfast or happy hour! We had amazing weather the entire trip. Hot and sunny with very, very low humidity. We were never bothered by a time share sell, not once. But we also had a different kind of package (they called it a "marketing" package?). My Dad is a Holiday Inn Priority Club member and was able to use points for a great discount on the first few nights! Those points add up!! The room - Ideal for the size of our group. It was very clean, spacious and well laid out. The beds were clean and comfy (one king and 2 queens). 2 bathrooms were both a good size as well. Never any noise in the halls, or above us. No slamming doors, no waiting for an elevator. You have to do your own laundry (towels and sheets) if you want this done for the duration of your stay. I am sure you could get clean towels if you asked, but we were supplied with good laundry soap, so we just did our own (we didn't bother with the sheets as we only stayed a week and showered every day). The room was ideally located for running back to make sandwiches for lunch, or grabbing a few drinks (they don't really want you to bring your own booze, but you can get away with it if you are subtle)! The pools and lazy river were excellent. They want you to rent a tube/float from them if you want to use something in the pools/lazy river. It's not cheap. As people often don't return the float they've "rented", we were always able to just grab one and use it (free of course). No issues with that. Beer can be bought more cheaply at the shops near the lazy river (they will even open your bottle for you), but the drinks at the bars are pretty handy. We never ate at any of the onsite restaurants as we often ate in the room. We did try the Alehouse up the street from the resort and it was very good....well priced too! Location - A bit of a hike to Universal, but only because of traffic. We went twice. But you could probably make a good vacation by simply staying at the resort! Close to a grocery store (Publix) and a Super Target. Publix was way overpriced, but Super Target was great. The resort is cashless - you need to use your card for everything (or credit card) so it's easy to loose track of what you've spent! Good to keep tabs on this as some things (like kids candy and even small bags of chips) are very pricey! If you have kids, stay at River Island. There is so much to do, and it's handy being able to make your own breakfasts lunches and save money while being close to the pools - generally kids really don't find eating that entertaining! Make sure you check what is available in the room before you make assumptions (like we did) and buy extra paper towel, coffee filters and toilet paper! The golf courses and grounds looked wonderful as well! The only solid complaint I have, and this is through my Dad's experience, is that the reservation system is in need of some serious help. We wanted to add a night at the end of our stay and it was a massive pain in the butt - although it did work out. We actually had to check out and check in again!! Really! For an extra night - which we asked about 4 days in advance! If you want something, go to the front desk so you can at least struggle in person! It's a shame because Holiday Inn is always so consistent and efficient with their reservation system. Realizing that this property is not entirely owned by Holiday Inn, I still think the solution is simple - communication! The resort staff don't adequately communicate with those in other areas of their resort reservation system, and the computer reservation systems just don't "talk" to each other! Luckily, we didn't really need anything beyond changing a reservation so we didn't need to get to frustrated! But it was one of the most ridiculous things I have ever encountered! PS - the key cards often demagnetize (as they do in many resorts), so always have 2 keys with you at all times! Loved this place though, and would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Our Cup of Tea and Could Be So Much Better”
Reviews.Author: Daru
Reviews.Content: Got a two bed villa from a RCI exchange from our folks. Basically 7 adults in the villa, pretty tight squeeze, but it was okay. They put us in a villa over a 1/4 mile away from the closest resort shuttle stop so we had to drive everywhere. It's so spread out it was ridiculous. This place is completed filled with families and seniors. We hung out at River Island area to hang by the pool since it seemed the nicest. Here are my tips for this resort. 1) Utilize the Super Target to buy groceries. The Publix has a deli, but the food pricing and their produce is weak and EXPENSIVE. The Super Target has a full service produce section and was much better in pricing. 2) Bring a soft sided cooler. It helped with bringing drinks etc to the pool. The pool rules say not to bring in coolers but if you are discrete it is fine. They have little or no staff around and few poolside servers to worry about busting you. 3) Plastic cooler cups to use pool side or discreetly pour your beer or cocktails in from your personal coolers. 4) DVDs - there is a DVD player in the living room, but they do have a RedBox at the Walgreens across from the West Entrance of the resort. 5) Portable speakers for your ipod, if you have any interest in listening to music in the villa. There is no radio and the tv channels don't offer music either. 6) Bicycles. If you are driving and can, it seemed like it would be great to have bicycles to cruise around on. Too bad they don't rent them onsite. I did see a few kids that had apparently brought their own. 7) If you are planning on working out in one of the gyms, bring your patience. They are all very small with limited equipment. I always had to wait for a cardio machine and the Mussels gym at River Island is the only one with weight machines. Overall this place was okay. For a group of 7 adults ranging from 27 to 40 with no kids it wasn't really our cup of tea. Too many kids, too many seniors....not saying that is a bad thing, but just not our thing. One night we went down to Breezes for some "live music" and it consisted of a guy with a portable keyboard singing "Crocodile Rock" with a bunch a kids with grandma & grandpa cutting up the dance floor.....again, just not our cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem amongst all Orlando-Area Resorts”
Reviews.Author: Nut4Disney
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business. Having recently stayed at the Waldorf Astoria-Bonnet Creek, Walt Disney World Hilton, and even the Homewood Suites by Hilton at Lake Buena Vista, I must certainly stay, that this resort is "on my list". I generally prefer to stay "on property" which means a Disney resort or the WDW Hilton, or WDW Doubletree Guest Suites. I usually get upgraded to a suite at the Hilton properties, but this time, I wanted to make sure I had a full kitchen. The Homewood Suites just doesn't compare to this property, and neither does any Residence Inn (by Marriott) that I've stayed at, including the one at Sea World! Simply put, the property itself is amazing. From River Island to Golf and mini-golf, there are so many things to do just on the property. So much so, I probably won't even use my Disneyworld annual pass on the next visit. The resort is the size of my home time... really! It's about 6 square miles, and there are conveniences right outside the entrance, from a Publix Supermarket to a Super Target right at the same traffic light. Little known, is that it's really close to Disney's Animal Kingdom and you ould use Sherbeth Road to get on to Disney property. Traffic can get tight over by mile marker 5-8 on Irlo Bronson Highway, and Sherbeth can save you some time, but going down to World Drive (the "main" entrance to WDW) is not so bad. Just plan your travels accordingly. I stayed in the East Village in 87526 and the unit was spotless and very nice. The furnishings aren't as "nice" as the Waldorf-Astoria, but you're comparing 5-star to 4-star hotels. I did NOT expect to have any traditional hotel services and this is probably where many people start complaining about this "resort". It's a timeshare resort, and just like living in a fancy condo, service is different from a full-service "hotel" like a Waldorf or Four Seasons. While I didn't need any extra services, I found that the staff was pretty friendly. I went there expecting "bad" from some of these reviews, and got the exact opposite! Things do happen and not every situation can be fixed immediately. I've learned to be patient and I have experience in such things as I spent over 180 nights in hotels just in 2010 alone. The timeshare sales part was quick and easy. I told them I live in Florida and that if I were to buy a timeshare, it would be a Disney Vacation Club property. Sale ended! I couldn't care any less about $20 off or even a $75 coupon -- which they upped it to when I said no. Sorry, but it's true. My time is worth more than $75 for a 90-minute presentation. Should they have countered with $375 for the 90 minutes... I could have been tempted. Overall a very great vacation stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort/Pools but Bad Smell some eves and every am”
Reviews.Author: den1335
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the East Village from Feb12-19th in a 3 bedroom 3 bathroom suite on the 5th floor. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews. The layout of our room was fabulous. A little dated but still ok. Big Island and kitchen area, Large living roon and dining area. Huge master bath with a jet tub that (had no black stuff coming from the jets) It was very clean. The unit smelled when we entered though and we thought of pesticide right away but you could tell it had been closed up for a while and was musty. We saw no critters in our condo unit....none! The beds were very comfy. The pull out in the master was a bit old with springs and I called and they brought a new one with out any question right away and they even called back to make sure we received it. We asked for extra blankets and laundry soap twice and it was delivered almost before we got off the phone with a call back each time from the front desk to make sure we receive the things we requested. We even had wake up calls daily. We had no issues at all with our requests. We were all VERY IMPRESSED!!! Great job!!! We had to buy a candle and air freshener spray because the unit definately had an odour. We also purchased some lysol cleaner for general cleaning ie shower that had a small bit of mildew in the caulking around the shower door and to do general cleaning of the sinks toilets etc. It would be nice if that was also supplied on arrival to the unit. Over all the unit was very clean. The carpets could at bare minimum be cleaned if not replaced as I said it was somewhat outdated. The smell was in the carpet I think. The unit was very livable and cozy otherwise. The smell only hit you when you first entered and then it was gone..I guess we got used to it after a while The outdoor smell as other people had mentioned we think was from the bogs. It arrived usually late at night or sometimes just in the mornings and left when the sun came up and the dew left the lawns. It was so bad one morning when I went to the car I almost threw up.It was short lived and worse on the higher floors. We also smelled this on the highway on the way home from the Space Center. I do think its the swamps they are everywhere. We almost wondered if that was the smell in the unit or the pesticide or a bit of both. The unit was great and we all enjoyed it. The staff was fabulous even at the restaurants and bar areas at the pools. The pools were GREAT. River Island was honestly better than our resort in Playa Del Carmen and HUGE. It was beautiful!!! I'm not kidding. Yes $9.00 for the tubes on the lazy river, or the big slide or mini putt but they also have 3 day deals for 34.00 how can you beat that and you spent how much at Disney?? Nothing to complain about!! All day pleasure for the kids and big kids too! The guys golfed the gals shopped. The kids went to the lazy river, arcades and mini golf. The resort has so much to offer. I went to the gator show myself.. everyone else slept in. it was great. He was a bit of a comedy act to boot. Over all we had a fabulous time. The resort is close to everything!! The pools and the grounds were beautiful and WELL kept . The staff were wonderful. The security was superb. We were never hounded about the time share. We said no at check in and that was the end of it. Golf gets cheaper rates throughout the day. Check that out. Ticket counter right there. They even call you daily and leave messages to tell you about the daily specials at the courses restaurants, things happening that day at the resort etc. We did so much off the resort and wish we had more time to enjoy River Island and time at the resort. It really is a nice place! Oh and the alligators in the ponds pretty cool too. Just don't get too close. We would absolutely return ....but would probably stay at River Island Next time! Overall a GREAT place! Do the trip to Kennedy Space Center. It was fabulous. The hubble telescope 3D is incredible and the photos... And Anna Maria Beach you have to go! White sand like flour and shells to collect, crystal clear water, sand bar, soooooooo nice!! I'm not joking. GO!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - would go back & recommend”
Reviews.Author: KMSTOCKS
Reviews.Content: We did an exchange through RCI and were very pleased with our accomodations. We have traveled to many places and if and when we return to Orlando area, I would return to Orange Lake West. We didn't really do much at the resort as far as pool or activities; our time was focused on Disney and Universal, but the villa was in very good condition and very comfortable. We loved having a washing machine & dyer in the unit. I felt comfortable being on the golf course. The only "negative" is that cars drive rather fast on the road and the villa is so close. I was nervous about my 4 year old running in the street. The roads could use a speed bump or two. You will find the location very conveient to shopping (grocery, gift shops, and a new Target) and within 4 miles to Disney (so easy). Plus there are plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Nice Trip”
Reviews.Author: emiwoo
Reviews.Content: Despite a few minor disadvantages, we had a great stay at the Orange Lakes Resort. We arrived at the resort at 10 AM after an early flight and were told that our room would be available right away. This was a pleasant surprise as we thought we wouldn't be able to check in until 3 PM. The desk clerk was very helpful and gave us a map of the resort and directions to our room, as well as as many room keys as we needed (which was great for a large family). We stayed in a 3 bedroom suite on the second floor of an East Village building. When we arrived at the room, we were disappointed by the trash bags that had been left in front of the door as well as the litter that was present in the hallways. The room itself, however, was quite spacious and cool which was a relief. Our suite had 2 bedrooms with king beds and 1 bedroom with 2 double beds, perfect for our party of 6. There were 3 bathrooms with showers and one that also had a large bathtub, which was very nice. The shower adjoining the room with the double beds, however, was incredibly small, and no matter which way the lever was turned, the water never grew hotter than lukewarm. We also had a considerably spacious kitchen with a refrigerator, microwave, stove, dishwasher, and sink, as well as dish sets. There was also a pantry which hid the garbage can. The table in the sitting room was quite large, as was the couch. Some of our party thought that the TVs were a bit dated, but that won't an issue for those who are here to get some sun. The small outdoor patio area provided a nice relaxation space. The cleanliness of the rooms was a bit of a disappointment. The counter surface next to the stove was damaged and ripping up, and it had not been fixed. The windows were also incredibly dirty. Another disadvantage of the suite was the noise. From the bedroom that faced the building hall, absolutely anything anywhere else int he building could be heard. We were kept awake at night by the pounding footsteps above and woken up early in the morning by sound of loud conversations as families made their way down to the parking lot. The amenities of the resort are great, if you feel like paying for absolutely everything. The only things you can get for free here are the towels and the lounge chairs. Everything else from mini-golf to inner tubes comes with a price. The pool and lazy river at River Island, however, are excellent and kept at a nice temperature. The hot tubs often get overfilled, but sometimes you can catch it empty at just the right time. We rented a cabana for the second day, which was nice because it comes with a mini-fridge as well as a TV and is completely covered for those who wish to stay out of the sun. The only complaint we had about the pool was that it was a 15 minute walk, so we chose to drive. If you want to get anywhere on the resort (unless your room is right in front of where you need to be) you need to lather up with sunscreen and be prepared to walk a while to get there. There is also plenty to do around the resort. We visited 2 of the restaurants, both of which were nice. We aren't golf players, but there is an extensive course for guests to use (at a price of course). The several shops around the resort have some really nice things, as well as convenience items. There is also a (free) fitness center which has a nice selection of workout equipment. Beware though, we were told that the scale in the fitness center reads 10 pounds lighter than your true weight. The location of the resort itself is also great. We could get everywhere we needed to go within 45 minutes of driving. We didn't make it to Disney but it was conveniently close by. Our stay at Orange Lakes was relaxing and fun-filled, and the few complaints we had are minor. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the guests are agreeable. The rooms are comfortable and suited to our needs. We had a great vacation and would recommend Orange Lakes to anyone looking for a similar experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeffie413
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for one of those 4 day 3 night stays, and listen to a 2 hour presentations. We went 2 days earlier and they put us in the same unit we were scheduled to stay in for the latter part of the week. This is a great place to stay for family, golfing, etc. The rooms are fantastic, clean, roomy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would go again. It ended too soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: zoeyNewfoundland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in the West Village. We loved being so close to the big pool and Breezes restaurant/bar. We were never bothered with sales pitches, however I am an employee of Holiday Inn so that's probably why. If you are going to Orlando/Kissimmee check out Orange Lake Resort - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: captainjack1950
Reviews.Content: food and pools are great. fitness center is good. only drawback is that they charge for a lot of things that could be free or alot less. such as rafts for lazy river should be free or $1 . I think that the internet is free in the rooms but I'm not sure. mini golf cost too much. But Disney is very close 10 to 15 minute ride straight down 192 grocery store right outsde of property . Target and some good resturants across street and most places within10 to 15 minutes drive; beeches are easy to get by car. basically a straight shot 1 hour and a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay except for the sales presentation”
Reviews.Author: Skier099
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from Jan 8 to 15, 2011. We are Wyndham owners, but had RCI weeks to use and got into Orange Lake. We have stayed there before several times and it has always been nice. We had a two bedroom unit on Springer Circle with our patio area facing West looking directly towards the lake and golf course. Delightful to watch the birds on and around the lake and the sunset in the evening. Even had a bald eagle grab a fish and devour it not far from our patio. The unit was apparently recently updated and the interior was very nice. We were told that if we ran out of supplies like dishwasher detergent, toilet paper, etc. that we would have to purchase the addition ourselves, however we just called housekeeping and more was delivered. The wireless internet in un-secure, no password or sign-in required, but was still certainly very usable. They charge $1.00 plus tax for all toll free calls, which was a real problem for us since we usually use a 2.8 cents / min calling card, which starts with an 800 number. When we got there and registered, we then had to go to another desk to get our parking pass and were pressured into a condo sales presentation and they promised it would not be more than 60 minutes, no hard sell and we would get info on the new RCI changes, which we were interested in. After having to tell four different people adamantly NO many times, we finally got away after three hours and learned little about the RCI changes. If you discard the sales presentation, we had a wonderful stay in a very nice unit.

Reviews.Title: “We have been Owners since 1994..things changed a bit”
Reviews.Author: JaimeBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Orange Lake has since become a Holiday Inn property and since the change, I find that there are more negatives than positives. My Mother purchased the timeshare here in 1994 and we have gone down at least once a year since (she owns 2 weeks at orange lake). This is the most popular property in all of Orlando and there are definitely reasons for this. The West Village is the oldest part, but also the only with 1 level properties. They are not as new and exciting, but they are private and offer a more comfortable setting if you rather not have people over your head or if you do not want to walk up and down stairs. We own in the West Village but have stayed in the North as they too offer beautiful 3 bedroom condos. The layout in the North Village is the nicest in my opinion, even if it is 2 stories high. It's close to a pool and tennis courts of that is your thing. If you are traveling with adults only, I suggest you STAY AWAY FROM the large pools. Your best bet is to visit the older pools at the front and back of the resort. While they do not offer the amenities that the new complexes offer, they will give you peace and quiet. The lazy river is not so lazy. Kids are screaming..parent are yelling at their kids...food is in the pool and there isn't a cabana available. It is a mob scene. You cannot get through to the front desk, unless you go there in person. Orange Lake is aware that they are a premier resort in Orlando so I think this has gotten to their heads. We paid 15K for each week...these same weeks go for over 100K in smaller units in the year 2011. We find it VERY ANNOYING that they continue to call you and ask that you come to a "welcome breakfast" when clearly it is to sell you on the idea of buying something additional or exchanging your weeks for points. No matter how many times we tell their sales people we are not interested, they never listen. they are very aggressive. So much so that I had a strongly worded conversation with he sales manager 2 years ago. And don't forget the highway running through it. Overall Orange Lake is great property but it is CROWDED and you are just a number. It is not like it was 10 or 15 years ago. Overall, you will feel like you are home and you can cook if you prefer to save money but personalized service will not happen. They will surely call you over and over about that breakfast and don't take the word No lightly. We are proud Orange Lake owners, despite the changes we have seen since 1994 but we believe that they have a long way to go when it comes to improvements. Perhaps they should focus less on condos and more on staff training.

Reviews.Title: “Family vaca with small children Jan29-Feb5th 2011”
Reviews.Author: MaineBengalTigers
Reviews.Content: I will spend most of my review on the resort, and not the room, for we were on vacation for the resort, 2 adults and 2 small girls, (5 yrs & 2 ½ yrs old). We spent most of the week at the resort facilities, unlike most reviews that were there for the Parks, so I tried to see as much as I could of all 4 villages. Accommodations {West Village}: Stayed at Orange Lake Circle, Villa# 2119 on an RCI exchange: (this is just inside the park West entrance} 1 story 2 Bed/2 Bath Villa, 32” LCD Living Rm with DVD/VCR, Bedrooms standard 27” TV’s NO DVD/VCR players, bathrooms kind of cramped set-up, Living/Dinning rooms separated by a step down {lighted, nice for night light}, both ample in space, Kitchen well equipped and stocked for 3 Loads Wash/Dishwash. Paper goods 3 rolls of TP and 3 tissue boxes per bathroom, s/b enough for the week for a family of 4. Hard water and low pressure. Property near entrance to Resort which I could hear Rt192 traffic at night, not loud but when quiet it is noticeable, ½ Mile to West Village Clubhouse. Patio view was of a swampy area, Cranes Bend golf hole #4 just on the other side of swamp, Crane birds actually visited one afternoon, very CLOSE, not scared. Free Wi Fi in Villa. Check-in, fast but request for Crib was not met on first night, 2 ½ yr old fell out of double bed first night, follow-up with Resort Services was quick the next morning after I let them know {note it is sometimes difficult to get through to Resort Services on phone, so I went to the desk to make sure this was done asap} Customer service good, but the crib and our Pizza order was messed up. Out of 5 services request I made during the week, they messed up 3 of them, this is a large resort but if I only had 5 calls in need of something, and they messed up 3x, not a very good average, but folks were nice and understanding when I complained. Only one timeshare call when I told the sales agent that we were not interested. Calls on answering machine were for resort activities, which helped on some days. Overall Resort had nice grounds and water features. Shuttle service I used twice, no more than 5-10mins wait {Legends course to River Village & my Villa to West Village Pool complex} Resort Reviews by Village: West Village Pool area: {Note: all pools we visited never were more than 5 ft deep, all have zero entry and depths from zero to 1ft, 2ft, 3ft, 4ft} Zero entry had fountains at edge that our 2 ½ yr old loved at 6 inches deep. Another pool area we did not visit that did not have zero entry and was near hot tub. Breezes Bar Dinner for family, $58, Kids meals $5, Burger decent, Tuna Salad avg. Daily Happy Hour 4-6pm, $2 domestic drafts, kids hula hoop contests, balloon maker, dancing by resort folks during nightly Sunset Celebration at Breezes/West Pool area, real fun for my girls after pool time, we spent 2-3 evenings at the Sunset Celebration. Arcade is loud but plenty of games, $5 cards get you about 3-4 games depending on what you play, most games are 90-100 points, $5 gets you 250 points with some prize tickets on your card for little trinket stuff for the little ones at the counter. Rental boats can be found here, beach front lake with volleyball, really nicely done adjacent to the pool area. Swampy Club: played WI, chalk board, & crafts, cost $2-$4 for colored sand filled plastic star. Smallish room with 3 Video game TV’s, 2 Ping Pong tables, some legos and board games locked up in the cabinets. Marketplace: smallish ALL IN ONE building, some gifts, Pizza (which like many reviews have stated, is great}, Eddy’s Ice Cream and the Golf shop for Cranes/Reserve courses. Not much on essentials, I needed a razor but they did not have one, but Super Target is just outside the resort for all your needs. Played 9 Hole Cranes Bend Golf course, par 30, some nice holes & good conditions, worth the 50% off greens fee offer they left on my messages (see earlier above), $38 with rental clubs included. North Village: Splash lagoon is nice, great toddler pool no deeper than 1ft with mushroom waterfall feature. Water fountains near entrance for small ones to play in. Pool area snakes around, one end with small water slide into 3 ½ ft of water, then moves to water volleyball area, then onto basketball hoop, and towards zero entry pool that snakes around pool complex, depth varies from zero to 4 ft all around, then turns around to another area towards various depths at the other end with a waterfall over rocks. We did not eat at the Terrace or anywhere at North Village, nothing was open, but we were there before noon. Legends Walk golf course is located here, pro shop is SMALL, I did not play the course. East Village: Only saw one pool, did not visit, smallish and looked more for adults. Played Legends Course, nice, they say front is links, on google maps looks back and forth, but the holes are really separated more than I would think for links style, was worth it, paid through Golfnow dot com, $56 at 1pm, so worth that price and I have played many courses, I would pay up to $80 for this Florida course, better than Disney Magnolia, Falcons Fire and Metro West. Had lunch at Legends Bar, burger at bar was a little better than Breezes, average pub fare price. River Island: Lazy River = fun, just difficult for adults to get in and out of tubes, Lazy River depths 2 1/2 to 4 ft throughout, with some overhead waterfalls during trip, about 10-15mins trip for $9 per adult all day fee (kids free with paying adult} Pools on both ends of River Island are zero entry, the pool near the fun zone seemed less busy. Fun Zone is an SAND area with Bungee, Climbing rocks, Hippo inflatable waterslide, volleyball & Mini golf, we did not enter the fun zone {extra cost}. Note: bring your lazy river tube with you to the pool areas after your trip, may have to go around 1 ½ times, you can access the other pool areas from the Lazy river there are forks in the river to the other areas. Playground is located at River Island, average school playground size, maybe smaller. Breakfast with Swampy and friends is at River Island Dining, $3.99 per child & $9.50 per adult, drinks extra at $2.50 per. Met Bandit the Racoon, Ashley the Otter & Swampy the alligator, they come out one at a time in the morning. Buffet breakfast, fruits, breads & typical buffet stuff, no pancakes, but one omelet made to order is included, we spent $50 with tip included. Misc: You can purchase a 3 or 7 day fun card that includes mini-golf, hippo slide and some other activities that cost extra. 3 day fun card cost $35, we spent almost 4-5 full days at the resort and did not purchase one, the kids seemed fine in the free pools & other free stuff available. Summary: Orange Lake Resort is great for families, or anybody for that matter. Golf is nice, Bars are nice, restaurants & all facilities are at least better than average. If you are not expecting a 5 star resort, you will be more than happy staying here. Our visit was great, we were lucky with good weather so we could enjoy everything. Most of the negative reviews are for Villas that are not well taken care of or poor customer service, not necessarily what the resort can offer. You never know what you may get for a room, ours was fine, not high end, but certainly acceptable for a vacation home. Only complaint would be the sofa couch was a bit un-comfortable and worn. Hope this review will help those traveling with little ones, feel free to ask me any questions, I use Trip Advisor as a guide in my planning, and all the reviews posted by travelers, good or bad, are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Golf haven ..and fun for family”
Reviews.Author: bsticky
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Villa #2126 West Village. Our check-in was very quick but then they handed you a $20 "welcome cerficate" which you needed to get activated and thats when they attempeted to rope you in to their condo sales presentation. After 3 firm "NO"s they finally stopped bugging us.We did not use our $20. Our villa was very close to the West exit to highway..which would have been great if we were going to disney or other off property outings but are vacation was to include relaxing & swimming at the resort. We were able to walk to one small pool with hot tub...which was great. Anywhere else we had to drive to...the resort is like a town of it;s own. You MUST have a car!!! We purchased the 7 day fun pass which included the lazy river raft (which is the only raft permitted in the lazy river), unlimited mini-golf, and the fun zone @ River Island which includes the Blow up hippo sllide, rock climbing & bungee trampalining which costs $50 for adults & children 5 & up! I would reccommend to purchase only the 3 day for $35 per adult & children as 2 days were used for travelling and you do not need the raft that they rent for the lazy river, it was nicer just to float on your back ( because the weather was only 65 degrees when we were there). The pools are free..so there is lots to keep them busy. The North village pool was the best for my 3 year old as there was a water slide that she could do by herself, and adults and older kids could go on it as well. The pool was heated...it was great. The only problem was that we could not find out where to get a volley ball or water basketball for the pool. The West village pool seemed busier so we never swam there but we did rent a Pirate ship paddle boat for $14/ 30 minutes which was the prefect amount of time to go around the lake.(lots of different boats available if you have the funds.. sea doos $62/ 30 mins $100/ 1 hour., pontoon boat $72/30 mins $120/hour, gonala $25/30 min, $39/hour, waterski, wakeboard & tubing $72/30 mins, $132/hour) They offer a 30 minute boat ride for $10 pp. We also attended the Gatorland Show for $5 pp...we saw 2 aligator and had the chance to touch them...ok but would not reccommend it as a must see. Our actual Villa was fantastic, clean, well stocked kitchen. The master bathroom was extreamly small but ok. It was great to have our own driveway which was 5 steps to the door. Inroom safe great idea, you reset the combo very easily. The Marketplace...produce was rotten and not a good selection of things. Highly reccommend going to Walmart (off Hwy 27) to purchase food (much cheaper than Publix as well). We attended the character breakfast $3.99 /child $9.99/adult drinks extra ( juice $2, coffe $2.50) good selection of breakfast foods (cereal, fresh fruit, various breads & bagels, eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, pancakes, etc) Only 2 characters were there...raccoon & otter. My 3 year old loved it and especially loved the tropical island music. The on property gift shops were well priced and great selection..very surprised expected higher prices. We went to the Arabian Nights dinner show which is a 15 minute drive from the villa ...after reading many reviews.. very pleasantly surprised by the food quality (steak - great, chicken- awesome, even the kids meals were good, salad delicious and dinner roll ok, Strawberry shortcake fantastic and the brownies were TOO chocolately?? can you imagine. Overall I would reccommend the Holiday Inn Club Vacation as long as you have a car!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: viviana b
Reviews.Content: We belong to RCI and traded in our timeshare to stay at Orange Lake mostly because we needed a big 2 bedroom suite for the Christmas Holiday and Orange Lake was available. We did get pressured into a timeshare presentation for a $50 dinner voucher and 50% discount for mini golf, slides, tubes at the resort. They claimed the presentation was good for us because there were a lot of changes happening in RCI and we needed to attend. We agreed to attend, no big deal. It was a waste of time but we knew the drill. We then moved on to enjoy everything the resort had to offer including the workout centers and arcades. We drove from NC to Orlando so we had a car to move around in the resort. Everything about the room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches in the kitchen!!!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunTimeFirst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last year with relatives and our young son. We loved it so much that this year we came back with the same relatives plus brought the in-laws along. At check in my notes from booking were not on file(in regards to one of our group members being disabled) The lady who checked us in had a slight attitude about this even though I WAS SAYING HOW SORRY I WAS to in convenience HER with our needs! When we got to our room I had to clean the floor, cooktop & cupboard handles in the kitchenette because they were covered in something sticky. During my quick clean I noticed 3 small insects near the fridge but quickly squished them without paying too much attention. The next night my group went out for dinner and when we came back in the late evening, I went to the kitchenette, turned a light on and WOW there were roaches on the counter, wall and floor! I went down to guest services and informed them. The receptionist took my complaint and after I told her I wanted to be in different building she assigned us a beautiful villa. However, she had to go to her manager in the adjoining office, in which the "manager" never once came to apologize for this pest control situation! Very poor customer service if you ask me. I would be making it very clear how sorry I was on behalf of Holiday Inn. I had to wake my 2 yr. old up at 1am to move rooms, be separated from the rest of our group (which was rectified after a large amount of fuss the next day) Toss out several grocery items and be inconvenienced on what is suppose to be a vacation. We were so tired from packing & un-packing and moving all of our group we lost a full day of our vacation. All in all, this time around the service here was lacking from last year. Several people were not so happy to be doing their jobs, 1 of 3 timeshare staff were also rude. A big facility like this should have a regular pest control procedure that would have prevented this and management should have showed us a little more empathy to our situation... including at least ONE apology! The room upgrade is lovely and appreciated but any hotel would have done the same... it's the personal touches that make the situation better. I really thought long and hard before posting this and if I was treated differently this may not have been posted. So, if you book here you WILL have some sort of issue, it WILL be rectified but you will NOT feel like anyone really cares. On the up side the grounds, pools, lazy river and activities are wonderful. You don't need to leave the resort to be entertained and if you do leave, everything you need is close, including all the parks! I should also add, this problem was in the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at a Resort”
Reviews.Author: reneeLI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake as a trade-in through RCI for our 3 bedroom house at Summers Bay. They didn't have a 3 bedroom unit available for the week we wanted so instead we reserved both a studio and 2 bedroom for our family using our RCI points. The studio was located in the West Village which is attached to the main lobby. It was set up like an oversized hotel room (2 beds, couch, small table and kitchen with microwave, sink, range, dishwasher). The room was clean and the beds very comfortable. The hallway to the rooms need an update but the rooms themselves served us just fine. The cost per night listed on travelocity was at the the rate of $69.00 per night which you really can't beat. One thing that makes it different from a regular room is no cleaning service. We paid extra to have the room fully cleaned ($39) and it was a complete waste. The maids made the beds (we were suppose to get new bedding) and gave us new towels. The chips my daughter dropped on the floor were still there so a vacuum was never used. The table was also still dirty so no windex was involved in the cleaning either. I enjoyed staying in the West Village because they had a lot going on. The pool had activities for the kids during the day and karoke at night. The restaurant was also good. Our other 2 bedroom unit was located in the West Village as well but in a different building. The room seemed to be recently renovated and was very clean and roomy. It had a beautiful view overlooking the golf course. It was walking distance to the main lobby and market. I also visited the River Village which looks brand new. It's a large resort with a big pool, slides and lazy river. The air temp was low 70's and the pool was just too cold to use. I found the West Village pool to be more bearable for season. We drove the entire resort which is huge! It's like the size of a small town. Looked like all the sections had there own restaurant, arcade, and pool. Some bigger and some smaller. I would recommend Orange Lake to any family on a budget. I think it's much nicer than a moderate disney hotel. I also liked that I felt like I was staying at resort and not just a hotel. One way to describe Orange Lake's vibe is the affordable blue collar country club.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: fatrev
Reviews.Content: Had a two week break at Orange Lakes in a two bedroom villa and we were very impressed by the whole experience. The villa we had was recently refurbished and was of a high standard. The staff were all friendly even on the timeshare tour whch was not a bad experience.....honest. The facilities are first class and we would recommend this resort to anybody. It is convenient to Disney but also has enough going on at the resort to please most types of holiday On a personal note the golfing experience was first class only spoilt by my own lack of ability

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Disney fun”
Reviews.Author: ladtvtxrider
Reviews.Content: This was a trade for us,we stayed in the north village and found it to be quiet,yet close enough for the pool for our grandson to use. Unit was laid out nicely with outside screened porch for evening enjoyment backing the golf course. unit was clean and well stocked on arrival, had a couple small issues that were resolved right away. people have to realize these are timeshare units used by people with different ideas about how you should treat property that you rent or trade for, so some units take more abuse than others and will show the wear. Check in was easy, and check out was easier. No timeshare pressure from anyone during our visit. I know some complain about the sales tours, but anyone thats been to a timeshare knows if you don't want to be bothered..say NO..nothing is free, dinner,tickets etc..the cost is your time . I would stay again, it's an excellant location, staff is friendly and the unit we had was clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “River Island Does Not Disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: bagspackedCincinnati
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Island Complex of Orange Lake. It was all just wonderful. Our condo was a four-bedroom, four bathroom, on the eighth floor overlooking the entire pool&lazy river area. There were 10 of us staying in this villa, but you would never know it. Tons of space. Every room had a TV. The spacious living room had a large flat-screen and a beautiful gas fireplace(just a flip of the switch turned it on/off). The kitchen was large and very functional. Stocked with all the basics(dishes,pans,etc). The pool area is beautiful and meticulously cared for. I don't know why people don't do their research ahead of time. It's clearly stated that additional toilet paper, dish soap, and other basics need to be brought by the patrons. All bathrooms had toilet paper on the roll-holders, guests need to furnish the rest. Guest services were very quick to attend to our requests. We called for some first aid supplies, and someone came to assist us withing 15 minutes. We also needed a can-opener and that was promptly brought to our room. I had no trouble purchasing discounted tickets to Universal at a rate that saved us almost $50.00. A nice touch would be shuttle service to the area attractions. We did receive a phone call concerning the time-share offer. We declined and ask them to refrain from calling again; they respected our wishes. My advice would be to stay at the River Island part of the resort with a room overlooking the pool area. Just Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families with small children”
Reviews.Author: Dulce_Mar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place for 1 week and it was really child friendly. They have a kids camp, kids pools, and Magic Kingdom was like a 15 min drive...

Reviews.Title: “This resort is unfriendly and unwelcoming. Book elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: kps2play
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton International last year. It was great. Holiday Inn Orange Lake leaves alot to be desired. The first night I used the Jacuazzi tub in the master bedroom. I was sitting in the tub and put the jets on and black mildew and mold shot out of the jets. I called guest services 3 nights in a row. Three attempts and the tub was never cleaned. Everyday someone came in with bleach. We had to use the 2nd bath. Very inconvenient. I agree the shower heads spit out water. The toilet paper was rough and super thin. The bedding on the master beds did not fit. They sheet and blanket fit a single bed and not a King size bed. All amenities cost you at this place, including min. golf. The check in was a joke, juggling the guests after a long trip from one counter to another trying to set up a time share sale. The $20.00 free spending certificate can only be used to buy tickets. Another joke. The phone calls to the room to announce that we have our own personal vacation planner??? What's that about? Just another person to pressure you to buy time share. At check out no one asked how our stay was. They were glad to have us vacate the villa so they can fill it with another potential sucker to buy a time share week. Try Hilton International on your next visit. My husband and I stayed at both and they are great and close to Disney and SeaWorld

Reviews.Title: “Badly managed,too spead out and they charge for a lot”
Reviews.Author: rumnsun
Reviews.Content: If we knew this stuff ahead of time we would have made other choices. Our family of 4 includes mom, dad, a 14 and 18 year old. Room was very spacious and clean. Beds were firm but comfortable, pillows average, towels very soft. The shower had a super water saver shower head so it was like taking a shower under a mist. I called to get toliet paper and they said I could have two more rolls but after that I would be charged.I would only get them free because I wasn't told they charge for toliet paper. Yes, charged for toliet paper! The resort is very large and our two bedroom villa was only driving distance to the pool, gym, arcade, etc. Wet bathing suits in the car was a real drag. Also, this limited the freedom of coming and going as we pleased was no fun. Our kids are old enough that they could come down to the pool and go back to the room on a different schedule that us. I would be sure to get a room within walking distance to the amenities. We used the gym, it was ok, no elliptical machine. The pools complexes were beautiful and spacious. The golf was really crowded and when my husband called from the course to complain, he was told it was over sold and too bad. He could not finish his round because of darkness and he teed off at 2:00. Lastly, whenever we went to the desk for something there was someone complaining about something. Someone came in their room, they were charged for a tour they didn't take. We wanted to buy Universal tickets but their computers were locking them out and there was no manager working who could fix it. Oh yeah, and managers don't work on the weekends. So, get a room close to the pool, ask about charges before doing something or asking for something.

Reviews.Title: “River Island Signature - worth the extra!”
Reviews.Author: SD92886
Reviews.Content: We bought here a couple of years ago and have just stayed for the first time in a 2BR in the new River Island signature villas from 28th Dec to 7th Jan. Check In- signature guests have a private check in area, just ask someone on arrival rather than joining any queues. Check in was quick and drinks were offered,,, Credit cards are swiped and you do have to sign to agree to non smoking policy in rooms and there is 250 dollar charge if you do. I guess you are able to smoke on balconies. When checking out, just need to pop to concierge on 8th floor. Rooms - Stayed on 6th floor and room was excellent, exactly as described on website. Very clean, beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. Flat screen TV's in all rooms with surround sound dvd player in living room. Concierge on 8th floor have plenty of new release films that you can borrow free of charge which came in handy although they don't tell you this anywhere it is useful to know before you go as was perfect when returning back at end of day from parks and trying to get kids to unwind. We even saw films that hadn't been released here yet which kept daughter very happy! Kitchen was very well equipped with modern appliances and granite work surfaces. Master bathroom had jacuzzi bath and full size shower, bedroom 2 just had a shower. Plenty of good quality fluffy towels and toiletries included a razor, shaving gel, toothbrush as well as the usual. Small supply of dishwasher and washing powder etc provided but you can just ask for more if you need it. Balcony with seating for 4 and could just about see fireworks from disney at night. No daily maid service but we did have one clean halfway through the 10 days and we did get a call the day before to let us know what time they would be cleaning which was useful. There is a hoover, dustpan and brush etc there though along with iron/ironing board if you need it. From previous reviews, we were expecting pressure from sales team but we only had 2 courtesy calls during our stay from our concierge leaving messages welcoming us and inviting us to a drinks reception which we didn't go to so can't comment on that but overall very pleased that we weren't bothered at all. Had no complaints at all about the room itself, just one small thing which didn't spoil our stay was that the guests in the room above were very noisy and you could hear children bouncing balls and the sound of dragging chairs across floor but guess that is down to the parents, not orange lake!! Resort - Pools were great, didn't spend much by pool as it wasn't that hot but great private area just for signature guests which needed your room key to get into. It had lovely sunbeds and better towels and there was usually someone there to serve drinks and snacks. You didn't have to walk far though to the nearest bar or restaurant which was reasonably priced and good quality,Starbucks on site too which was good. 6yr old loved the arcade, you loaded up a card and they could swipe to play games which you could also win points which can be saved up and then exchange for small rewards, kids loved it... Resort is very big and do need to drive or get shuttle to other villages. Plenty to do for all ages. Signature guests get a wristband which entitles you to free inflatables for the lazy river, kids bungee jumping, free slides and crazy golf for the whole stay which is a good saving if you have little ones. Only 10 minutes from Disney parks too which is useful. Service was very good throughout. Whole resort is cash free, everything gets charged to your room. Would definitely recommend the River Island signature villas and we will definitely return again soon. If you book signature, you won't be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...far away”
Reviews.Author: lex128
Reviews.Content: Booked thry Hotwire. Was very concerend after reading some of the reviews. Contacted Hotwire and told them my concerns, and questioned there 4 star rating. They assured me the Hotel was a 4 star. DO NOT BELIEVE HOTWIRE'S Star ratings! We arrived at the main buildiing for check in. I was suprised that the room was in the same building. Room: Stains on carpet, hair on bathroom floor, and unit needed vacumed. Called the front desk and they said they would send someone. A guy showed up, handed me the vacum, wiped the floor in the bathroom and left. I had to vacum and then re-cleaned the bathroom floor. We did not have a Villa, just a studio. Which translates to a room with a counter that had a kitchenette. Two double beds. No Balcony, which turned out to be a good thing since our room overlooked the pool where they had Kareoke until 11:00 every night. After a long day in the parks we were tired. The noise kept us awake every night. When we asked to change rooms we were told we could upgrade at an additional cost. There was one elevator, which was the farthest from our room, I had a back injury so I needed a scooter, so I had no choice but to use the filthy, paint peeling, smelly elevator. Speaking of smelly, no maid service, so people were told and did place their garbage outside their doors at night. Nothing like walking down a hallway with trash everywhere that stinks. The comfrter on one bed had holes in it, as did some of the sheets. Then there were the cockroaches. Most likely from te garbage in the hall. Yuck, dirty discusting bugs that I had to share a room with. As said in the title stay away from this place, there are to many nicer hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Well-equipped efficiencies in a huge resort setting”
Reviews.Author: ShiftyNJ
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-bedroom villa here for three nights via the Holiday Inn website. We had none of the problems described with the time-share sales pitches described by other reviewers. During the check-in process (which took a long time for some reason) we were given a $25 voucher for any of the available concierge services which indicated that it was related to time-share sales. We discarded it and nothing further was said about it during our check-in or stay. Our unit was very clean and spacious. Two bedrooms, two baths and a living/dining space with full kitchen, large TV and sectional couch, eating area and screened-in porch. We did not really use any of the resort services as we were there for the parks, but the complex is huge and one could theoretically spend a week there and keep busy with golf, swimming, etc. Look for the "Wizard" package on Holiday Inn's site as the rate included two tickets to Universal Studios (either the main park or Islands of Adventure, where Harry Potter resides). This was again not tied to any timeshare sales obligation, we were given our tickets without any mention of taking a tour or any pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the "Slime-Ball" Time Shares Salespersons”
Reviews.Author: daryls530
Reviews.Content: The 2 bdrm unit was located about as far as one could get from the front gate - no problem. The unit was clean but had well-worn "old" carpeting and the living room furniture was not the most comfortable - no problem. When it came to the time share presentation - after more than 3 hours, I almost was "suckered" into buying a unit and SO GLAD that I didn't. The cost of the unit went from $35,995 (opening price) to last and final offer $7,995 (special secret price just for me!!) This happened through 3 different individuals making a "last and final offer" to me. ($35,995 - $12,995 - $10,995 and finally $7995) The terms of the membership also changed once I got a printed copy of the sales offer. Apparently the sales associate (a.k.a."crook") must have "mis-spoken" (purposefully lied) when he told us about the benefits of belonging to the organization. All I can say is - Buyer Beware -You Have Been Warned Before and Now Again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just started our stay and already dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: SugrCubes
Reviews.Content: Unit is large and has been recently renovated. Cleaning is surface only dust levels behind and under things is very high, tub was totally clogged with hair and would not drain. The biggest dissatisfier was the time share presentation. We were promised no high pressure sales and that there would be a tour of the resort allowing us to "get our bearings". The presentation started late and there was no tour! We walked out getting our deposit refunded but no "gifts" for the waste of our time. This places the resort at the bottom for places we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Holiday.”
Reviews.Author: nedahold
Reviews.Content: Kids enjoyed all the activities etc, close to Disney,Universal, great outlet shopping close by, great golfing on site and close by. Staff were helpful. Did not want the time share pitch, so we did not book the tour they offer and did not get the $$ off of golf and disney passes etc. Not for us but you can attend say no and get the deal.It's usually a hard sale. This resort was clean, beds were comfortable, was modern,had everything you need. Must have a car . First nite we arrived, there was a terrible odor outdoors never smelt it again, apparently was down wind from Animal Kingdom. Grounds kept nice. Great holiday for families. My kids are20,18, 14. We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sim038
Reviews.Content: When we arrived here we didn't know what to expect after reading the varied reviews... We booked through Priority Club which was meant to mean we received a free upgrade so when I checked in I asked about it and was told they were full - I sincerely doubt it given the limited people there! Anyway the check in went ok - we stayed in the main club house and the room wasn't too bad. In fact it looked good. The plumbing however left a lot to be desired... There was no hot water (apparently because we were at the end of the run) and the bath drain (which of course was also the shower drain) was completely clogged - and disgusting. There were sugar ants in the bathroom and kitchen area, and when we went to bed discovered they were there as well! Many bites later throughout the night we reported all of the above and to the Resorts credit they were fixed promptly. We also learnt to take earlier showers to try to get some of the hot water... Given the price and any of the above could of happened anywhere - I would probably stay again (if it's still that cheap). However, it is a little far away from the Theme Parks... Also recommend to take the phone off the hook to stop the time share calls - we did as soon as we got there - but as we were waiting for the handyman to call back unfortunately had to put it back on the hook - and alas there was the high pressure sales call. P.S the bed was way too soft...

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, location, amenities for families!”
Reviews.Author: srivergal
Reviews.Content: While we didn't visit Disney while in Orlando, this is ideally located for those visitors who want to but don't want to stay on property. The beds are really the best - after a few nights on subpar beds on the gulf coast in double beds, these queen gems were a dream come true. Great pool area. Had to drive to the other pool complex, but no big deal. Rooms have kitchenettes, no daily maid service. Close to a Walgreens and a Publix for necessities. Onsite business center. Free in room wifi, divd. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Manager L
Reviews.Content: we went to Orange Lake last december with all family , we found this resort very clean and huge location , im in the industry of turism and in very glad that RCI offer this product like holiday in orange lake , ths 2 bedroom suite were very comfortable and warm , thank you to all staff of Orrange Lake , we hope to see you soon again

Reviews.Title: “Great but Hard Sell Promotions..”
Reviews.Author: tleady
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be clean and loved the extra space for the children. Our only shock was that the amenitites (slides and miniature golf) was not included in the rate...which forced us to attend the Club Vacation Promotional Sells Meeting - which we were not happy about. It was supposed to be 90 minutes but left with a huge headache and spousal arguments 3 hours later. It was stressfull - especially wtih 3 young children. Love the resort - hated the sales pitch. It was hard for them to accept "no" as a "final answer".

Reviews.Title: “Very good....But watchout for the very hard sell”
Reviews.Author: NYCerinVA
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay...check-in was very good. Wife enamored with the possible park discounts so....off we go to the timeshare sales pitch the next day. We are already RCI points people (that's why we where there) but the salesman just would not hear "No"....so just be careful....discounts....not for the parks just food....$10 discounts. Just not worth the time (unless you have time to kill). Otherwise, room was great. Can't speak for Summer months but this was a great getaway place during December...also it was cool. If you are a golfer you can golf without leaving the resort. Customer service was excellent and the people were helpful. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been so much better...”
Reviews.Author: drdjd
Reviews.Content: This resort is priced very reasonably for what you get (we stayed in the 2 room villas for $130 a night). The villas are nice and they do put some helpful things in them, like dishwasher detergent and washing machine detergent. Things seemed a little dirty to me though, especially the bedspreads. I couldn't sleep with them on me. The pillows were 1/2 foot thick and I spent the 2nd day with such a sore neck that I thought I would literally throw up, the pain was so bad. I also woke up with spider bites all over my legs and after 7 days they are finally stopping itching but there are bruises all over my legs. Re: the pillows, I call them and ask if they have any thin ones and they simply tell me no, they only have thick pillows. I reserved the room through Holiday Inn and they don't mention on their site that you will be hounded every second you are there to buy one of their stupid time shares. I was very annoyed about this. I have been a priority partner member for many years and don't feel I should have to deal with this crap when on vacation. We traveled with family and asked for villas next to each other. I have no idea why they couldn't have accommodated us when they have 25,000 rooms on their property! There weren't 2 places next to each other? Really? Customer service stinks at this place. Maybe if I had shown interest in buying a timeshare they would have been helpful. The maid service drives around asking people if they are leaving so they can know to clean the place. I found this to be very bizarre. I probably will not stay here again. It could have been so much better if the customer service was better, it was cleaner and you didn't get sales calls on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but service was poor”
Reviews.Author: rklab
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Christmas 2010. The rooms are not cleaned at all during your stay so towels, bedding etc. has to be washed by you. Some animal did his business on the steps to our room and was not cleaned up for 3 days. There were large cockroaches in the room and bugs in the kitchen cupboards. The rooms were big and the living room was nice, but the quality of the cupboards, counters etc is very cheap. The timeshare presentation that is supposed to be 2 hours took us 4 1/2 hours and was very, very, very heavy pressure sales tactics. This ruined our view on the hotel and made the rest of our stay uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: thirdroom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a renovated golf villa in the West Village. It was nicely decorated, clean and well-equipped. The resort has some nice amenities including a lazy river (although a little more pool heat would have been nice). The resort is, however, huge, and very oriented toward golfers. There are no sidewalks so it's necessary to walk on the road, or take a shuttle bus.
