It might not be the best place for families with small kids who'd prefer a short, and safe, walk to swimming and restaurants. We ate at Breezes, a restaurant in the West Village, and both the food and service were excellent. I would recommend this restaurant for anyone staying on or off the resort. The staff is very friendly and they try to be helpful. However, we did have a little trouble. There was a broken fridge in the unit when we checked in (with a car full of groceries). We were told that we'd have to relocate since a fridge repair wasn't available (although we waited for over an hour for a repair person to show up). At first, we were told that the only available room was on the far edge of the resort - too far for the kids to travel to the pool alone. After some complaining, a closer room was found, but it had just been painted and the smell was pretty strong. After more complaining, we were offered a second air filter and some free activity passes, but no other room. We definitely were given the impression that, since we were staying as part of a vacation package, only certain rooms would be available to us. In fact, we were told that River Island was part of a "different pricing structure" and that we weren't eligible to stay in that part of the resort. This was annoying since we'd booked a full price package that included accommodation and theme park tickets. I was surprised that we found ourselves subject to limitations regarding the room. I would not recommend booking this resort through a vacation package - I'd recommend dealing with the resort directly to be sure that you get the location that you want. Overall, I would recommend this resort because the rooms and the amenities are quite nice and it's located close to convenient shopping in Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, pity about the theft”
Reviews.Author: Budgefamily
Reviews.Content: We are currently at Orange Lake (our first visit) and the place is absolutely fantastic. The villa is spacious with everything you need. The pool areas are superb. The public areas are neat and tidy. A few of the activities are a little on the expensive side, but that is par for the course in a resort. BIG problem, though, is the theft today of two cameras, a video camera and a watch while we went out to the shops. The safe is too small to store everything and we could not carry it all with us. So we thought that the place is safe and secure and decided to leave the stuff in our rooms. Security arrived promptly after our phone call to resort services and took a statement. We would really like to know how this happened and who all routinely has access to villas. We are waiting for feedback from management at this point, but in the meantime have had to replace our equipment in order to record our holiday. They are apparently investigating.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: jeffbro
Reviews.Content: Generally, one goes on vacation to get away from every day life, including telemarketers. Given this was a Holiday Inn resort, we did not anticipate the daily telemarketing calls promoting commerce at the resort, or trying to push us into attending sales meetings. It was a nuisance at best. The room was ok, but somewhat dated in terms of furnishings and decor, and a bit worn. The kitchenette was useful and reasonably appointed, even with a dishwasher which was nice, and a top quality microwave convection oven, as well as stove top and fridge. But rooms are not served and we had to regularly cart our own garbage out. On another positive note, laundry facilities are provided and they were very good, with basic machines at no charge, providing even detergent. Very useful especially for a family with small children. After the first full day of our vacation, our daughter was exhausted and unable to dine out. On resort restaurants do not deliver, apart from one which will deliver pizza. We wanted Indian and ordered from off resort. We were told by front desk staff that ordering in was not a problem and deliveries could be received at our room. This was not to be. The gate staff refused entry to delivery service, and in a tired state, had to dress and make the long trek out to retrieve the car then drive the long distance to the gate. Gate staff advised that their job was to keep people from coming to the resort and using the water-park facilities, and that's why non-registered visitors were denied entry. Though it was pointed out that the delivery fellow was unlikely to use the water slides at 10 p.m. in the unusually freezing cold weather, the dedicated if not tunnel minded gate staff protected us all making the trip out to retrieve the food unavoidable. So much for the knowledge of front desk staff who said deliveries were no problem... Did dine at River Island, one of the resort restaurants, and it was superb. Food was better than average and staff were outstanding. The could not have been better in terms of accommodating and attending to every need. The waiting staff and manager of this restaurant should be put in charge of training all other resort staff, who were not nearly as attentive or accommodating. Resort internet service excellent and very fast. Had to reconnect to it manually though each time it was used. Checked out a day early, and found unexpected charges on our account, fairly substantial at that. Tried to discuss issues with manager, but he was too busy and walked away before we had a chance to speak with him, though he clearly saw we were expressing concerns to the desk clerk. In short, some pluses with the resort, but too many negatives to make it recommendable. Did receive a call from resort in response to Customer Survey we did online in response to an email invitation from them for same. Customer service rep had no idea why resort policies re deliveries are not uniformly known by staff and made no other offers. Apparently everyone gets the relentless sales call campaign, as we found out after our stay from others we know who have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: smiles419
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at orange lake for the past four summers. we are from florida so its just a little get away for us. we have a very large family & thats why we choose orange lake in the first place. We have elder, adult, teens & children that travel with us. I enjoy orange lake because there are many things to do without even leaving the hotel. we get a 3 bedroom sweet which is nice. the kids can all crash in one room & theliving room is pretty good size for a hotel room. I would recommend this hotel to a friend. it is also located in a good spot. its within 5-10 minutes to the theme parks. also they have a game room. movie theater & many pools including a lazy river and water slides. also they offer jet ski rentals. also orange lake has a few restruants located right there on site & ONE OF THE MOST AMAZING PIZZA PLACES YOU WILL EVER EAT AT. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort but be prepared don't leave ANYTHING in the room”
Reviews.Author: BLD1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort in October for 4 nights, in the East Village, 2 separate suites. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. There seemed to be a lot of activities available though we spent very little time in the resort. The issue we had with both rooms was that even though management said that there was no housekeeping performed with the short stay, they did come into our room and cleaned it on the last day we stayed. And lo and behold, things turned up missing. My daughter had left the money her grandparents had given her in her pocketbook in her bedroom. We were already on our way to the airport when she opened her wallet and found it gone. We had purchesed 2 packs of ciggarettes for the neighbor watching our dog. I couldn't be sure if we had left them in the room, but they didn't turn up. In our friends room they picked up the towels in the bathroom and w/o realizing also took a pair of elastic socks - the $75 type to prevent blood clots. Obviously that was unintenitonal but if they didn't come into the room, none of these things would be missing. I called the next morning and spoke with a women who took my name and number and said someone would get back to me. She also said to contact Lost and Found. I called them and left my name. Again no one returned my call. I called again a week or so later and asked for the manager. Instead the operator took all the information then said she would file a report with security and they would get back to me. Sure enough a letter came this week and said they checked lost and found and nothing turned up. I called back and asked if they really expected housekeeping to turn in the money they stole. I was told I waited too long to report it. So my daughter is out the money she received as a gift, our friends were out $75 not to mention the risk not wearing the socks - and the neighbor - well, he didn't need the cigarrettes anyway. I was told that even though they cleaned the room, I wouldn't be charged. Thanks so much. I've never had anything stolen from a hotel and I stayed at some that are not the qualtiy of Orange Lake and I've never had anything stolen - ever. Looking at some other reviews, it appears that I'm not the first to have this experience at Orange Lake. I normally use the safe if I leave something of any value in the room, but knowing that no one would be in the room, I had a false sense of security. Actually those I spoke to were rather surprised to hear that the rooms had been cleaned. So keep in mind that if you do stay at this resort, even though you're told there won't be any housekeeping, and its explained on their site as such, there's a good chance they will come into your room. LOCK UP EVERYTHING or take it with you. It seems management has no idea that Housekeeping is going into the rooms that they shouldn't be. And if you have any issues, be prepared to get the run around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fun for Family”
Reviews.Author: red86zed
Reviews.Content: Read the negative reviews before leaving in hopes of having no surprises when we arrived. Surprisingly enough we had no negative surprises for the most part. Check in was quick although we did have to wait right until 4pm before getting access. We stayed in East village overlooking the beautiful 18th green of Legends golf course. Fantastic! 3 bdrm suite was amazing as we had my two young boys ages 3 and 9 plus my in-laws along with my wife and I. Place was clean and beds comfortable. No bugs seen in our suite. Golf at legends was cheap at $35 a round including cart with GPS, awesome. Weather was perfect for our trip. Resort is close to Walmarts - 10min, Outlet mall is about 15-20min and Disney is just down the 192. Drive to airport was easy, 528 paid 175 in tolls although rental company tried to sell toll pass for $30+ saying I would spend about $5 one way. Don't listen to car rental company they only want your money. Organize insurance through your own policy at home don't pay the extra they try to sell at the kiosk. Resort was great, kids loved the mini golf and lazy river, get the pass for golf as it's only $13 for unlimited mini golf for the week rather than $9 per round. Got full pass for older son so he could have tube all week and do large slide. Lots of towels available at poolside. We had a vehicle which was great. Felt very safe with security at main gate 24 hours. Safe in room. Target superstore is across the street. Only negatives would be constant calls from staff trying to do timeshare tours, we took phone off ringer. East village got very bad smell from Disney Animal Kingdom next door, water treatment plant, whatever it was at time it was pretty bad but thankfully was only at certain times, would have to close doors. Smell was like death but like I said it was only certain times it seemed to carry our way. Drove to Tampa and Sarasota, beaches at Sarasota were beautiful. Time of year was great as not crowded at all, look forward to going back. Would definitely recommend the resort.

Reviews.Title: “don!t believe all you read and don!tbe to quick to judge!!!”
Reviews.Author: cookiedough_10
Reviews.Content: we have just returned home after 3 weeks at arange lakes. (2 adults, 20yr old, 18 yr old, and an 8 yr old).We felt very worried and reserved after reading reviews dated from september/october. Fears of timeshare pressure, cashless resort,unpleasant staff etc. One phone call to invite us for a talk, we declined, no further calls other than to inform us of activities on offer. at check in the receptionist was exceptionally helpful and informative and reassured us that our travel money cards would be most welcomed and readily accepted. The standard of our 2 bedroomed villa in the west village was acceptionally clean and brand new. Beds very comfortable, villa spacious and light., Garden/patio area well kept and landscaped. Very beaqutiful surroundings throughout the park. We persaonally favoured the pool at west village due to having lots of options, gym, games arcade room(didn!t really interest us), shop,beach,pool, water sports, bar,restuarant and good evening atmosphere and entertainment nightly. River island was good too, except the silly charge of 9dollars hire for tube (maybe charge 3 dollars and more people will be interested). The north village pool was a lovely relaxing alternative to west village very scenic, very good facilities here too shop, restuarant,, splash pools for younger ones. Again the staff at each village were very friendly and happy to help when they can. A car is a must to get around unless you enjoy a slow relaxing walk, however we did see the resort bus on many occasssions so know it does run frequently. We walked from west village villas to pool and reception a few times. Overall we loved to come back here after a day at the park and even called it home. We enjoyed lazy days here in between the disney park visits. Publix supermarket onsite was reasonably priced, however supertarget just across the road was a good and local alternative. We have already told many a family and friends about this resort and would most definately stay here again. A big THANK YOU to everyone at orange lakes for making our stay just perfect. Happy holidays !!!

Reviews.Title: “COCKROACHES, $$$$$$, DO NOT BUY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sherrychao
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Orange Lake Kissimmee. DO NOT USE THE INTERNET IN YOUR ROOM. I got charged $120 for internet use, there were cockroaches in the room, the gym machines were broken, the drinks are watered down BIG TIME! Drink shots. If you plan on buying DO NOT BUY FROM THE RESORT. There are tons of orange lake timeshares for sale on BUYMYTIMESHARE SELLMYTIMESHARE for 1/4 of the price they are selling for. IT SMELL LIKE SEWAGE EVERY DAY. There are few, if any, entertainment or games, etc. for owners. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS RESORT.

Reviews.Title: “Forget The Negative Reviews and Enjoy This Resort With Your Family”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Orange Lake Resort for Thanksgiving and traded Through RCI. Our two bedroom villa, North Village 3775, was one of the older units and needed updating. Having said that, it was very clean and everything was still in working order with no issues. Large rooms huge living room and screened off patios. Check in was really easy, we arrived at 1:00p.m our room was not ready so they give you the keys and your packet and then called at 4:00 p.m. with our room number, this is the best idea ever, all resorts should learn from this we just went right to our room. You can also use the pools while you are waiting and charge to your keys. They have lockers by every pool so you can change and enjoy the day. We really loved all three pools complexs, they are some of the best pools in the orlando area. The grounds throughout the property are amazing, you are truly at a resort. We had no issues with bugs, spiders, or any other critters. They have the best pizza and they even deliver, don't miss out. The food and drinks at all the bars in the pools are very reasonable around $5.00 per drink, and most meals are under $10.00 per item. The only negative I would say is the lack of barbeque areas compared to most timeshares, but with all the places to eat we could see why. I would also recommend taking your phone off the hook then they don't bother you. The resort is 2300 acres and feels even bigger, you need a car, the shuttle does not come often enough for a resort of this size. From our villa to the main road was 2 miles in either direction. You are within a 1/2 mile from any pool and can walk but most people drove. Most of the rooms are on a golf course which we really liked. Our villa was on a night golf course. Pools are all open till around 9:00p.m. which we liked. I don't think it matters if you have a newly decorated villa or one like ours you will really enjoy this resort and we look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort- would definately return but some things you should know...”
Reviews.Author: jenfischervieira
Reviews.Content: Security at entrances, appealing villas, well groomed landscaping- great first impression. The rooms were well kept and updated decor. We did not eat at any of the hotels restaurants because we didn't spend much time on the property. Great location- Disney is only a few minutes away, Universal is about a 20 minute drive. Ammenities were abundant- jet skiing, paddle boats, numerous pools including a lazy river, "beach", arcade and much more. Although there were a few things that we didn't like about our stay this hotel is great- we will definately return if we go back to the Orlando area. Below you'll find what we didn't like about our stay. The beds were a bit too firm for my husband and me, the pillows were very large and uncomfortable and the walls are paper thin. We could hear every door close and conversations as people walked by in the hall. We were usually awakened daily by the sound of knocking and the maids shouting "housekeeping" as they attempted to enter nearby rooms. Our refridgerator smelled like something had died in it and it was inoperable- not a big deal for us as we didn't need to use it. Lily, the concierge, was pleasant, upbeat and animated. She told us we could participate in an "orientation" that would take us on a tour of the resort and would show us all of the ammenities and it would only take 1.5 hours of our time. Yeah, 1.5 hours turned into 4 hours and we had to sit and listen to a timeshare presentation- this was very upsetting. Cesar, our "tour guide" was very nice and entertaining but the whole "orientation" experience was a neverending nightmare. Not only did this "orientation" take up half of our day but we were bombarded by a series of timeshare salesman who just wouldn't take no for an answer. My husband and I had explained our reasons for not wanting to purchase but when one salesman left another came to try to pursuade us. If we had known that this "orientation" was strictly about timeshare and was going to eat up almost an entire day we definately would not have wasted our time- or theirs. ADVICE: Don't attend the orientation unless you're thinking about purchasing timeshare- it's a complete waste of time and the incentive isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect. Have been four times and can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: QuinteTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have been four times since 2006 thanks to my sister and her timeshare. Each year we return we always have a wonderful time and hate to leave. This year we had 2 two-bedroom units side by side and decided to extend two more days and shared a three bedroom unit. Although they do make mistakes, they try to correct them. In the past I considered purchasing a timeshare for myself. However one evening I received a call in my room from "Mark" inviting us to a free breakfast. I was surprised and specifically asked "Is this a timeshare tour" to which he responded "no, it's a free breakfast". We arrived to find it was a timeshare tour and the breakfast consisted of doughnuts and coffee. I was so disappointed that I was lied to and the sales person was so pushy, I cannot be part of that. My sister however who is an owner has had a different experience than I had, hence her becoming an owner. I do find the beds uncomfortable, however I know they cannot please everyone. Upon check-in we were missing a clock in one bedroom, I called and they brought one right away. However the next day at breakfast the toaster did not work. I called twice, no toaster was ever sent so we finally just ate something else. They also mixed up our 2-day reservation and we were not put in River Island as we were supposed to be however they very kindly made up for this by providing us with a free Cabana rental, very good of them to do that as really all the new units are equally nice. I rave about the pools, the restaurants, the landscaping is beautiful. The staff is friendy, the rooms are clean and tidy, it's almost perfect. However the one beef I cannot get past is the tubes in the lazy river. You MUST rent these tubes, it's ridiculous. The river is not deep enough in most places to swim so you need the tube to keep the skin on your feet. You cannot take your own and if you are caught using one you didn't pay for they make you feel like a criminal. I witnessed people enter the lazy river this year not knowing about the tube rentals. They were happily floating through this beautiful river, relaxed, this is the life... Then suddenly they are harshly told to surrender the tube from a person hiding in the bushes because they don't have an arm band..? After much confusion and this poor employee having to explain this to a family with children why he's ruining their fun he took their tubes and the people were left standing there shocked. Of all the things to charge for, what's with the tubes??? They absolutely completely spoil the River Island experience with the way they treat us over inexpensive rubber tubes that are too large to comfortably use. Of all the things to be cheap over, I cannot understand it. By the time they employ people to sell the tubes and more to ensure you don't enjoy them, how do they make money off them? I don't understand the reasoning. Aside from this, Orange Lake is almost paradise. Every resort I go to I use Orange Lake Kissimmee as the standard of excellence. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “look no more ....the best is hear”
Reviews.Author: diamonds96
Reviews.Content: nice place to take ur family everything u need is in the area ..........this hotel is # 1 on my list ...........love it .....a place for ur kids .... bars ,,,dancing ...... relaxing

Reviews.Title: “Large resort with villas and apartments,nice clubhouse,adjacent lake with hire pedalos”
Reviews.Content: Approached off Hwy 192, and via a security gated entry road. Stayed in a 2bed villa overlooking the golf course. Checked in at 1am, and went through the process in 10mins. Didnt enjoy being woken up ( jetlagged) at 9am with a phonecall inviting us to look around the resort with a view of buying timeshare there. Furnishings were good standard, and everything in the place worked, The safe reqd new batteries, and house keeping were there within a couple of hours to attend to it. Although the resort had a water park, we didnt use it, as apparently it came with a charge. A small bus runs between the various `villages as the place is so large, (you need a car to get to the pool) On site there is a small store selling essentials, and a Disney desk in the clubhouse sells tickets to the parks, this helps avoid the queues. Located just a couple of miles from Disney, overall it was nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Kammom18
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on Orange Lake Resort in Kissimmee, FL, I was worried about what we find when we arrived. We arrived on Sunday, Nov. 7th to check in. The woman, I think her name was Natalie?, was very nice. She asked if we needed any park tickets or had any questions. We said no, she asked if we would like to attend an hour long session telling us more about the resort, we said no. We were not bothered again. We stayed in West Village in one of the villas and it had been completely renovated. It was gorgeous! Two very large bedrooms, one with 2 queen sized beds and one with a king sized bed. Both had their very own bathrooms and the master bathroom had a jacuzy tub. (Very nice after a long day in the parks!) It had granite counter tops in the kitchen and bathrooms. Beautiful flooring, washer and dryer, televisions in both the bedrooms and living room. The living room also had a pull out sofa. This could have easily accomodated 8 people, but there were only 4 of us, the hubby, myself and my 2 daughters. We stayed at this resort for 7 nights. We did not get a chance to see or even try out any of the pools or other things that this resort offered. Believe it or not, it only got above 80 degrees one day while we were there and although I know at least one of the pool areas was heated, we just honestly didn't have time because we had 7 day park hopper tickets.We did order pizza from one of the restaurants on the property one evening while we watched a Disney movie after a long day at the park. It was very tasty and priced the same as any pizza place, and they delivered:) I would most definitely stay here again. Here are the minor drawbacks to this "hotel": if you like having your room cleaned daily or every other day, then this isn't the place for you, but if you want to feel like you are staying in your home away from home, then I would suggest it. The other thing I found not so good, was that the towels aren't soft at all, it was like drying with sandpaper. And the water pressure is so hard, it almost hurt. But that's just me being picky maybe. Oh and one last thing, the housekeepers were still at our villa when we arrived. This was not such a big deal except that I think they felt rushed and left a wet towel from the previous renters hanging in our master bathroom! YUCK! Almost forgot, we received a note on our door one night stating they had been trying to get a hold of us. (I had unplugged the phones because of previous reviews about getting very early phone calls about taking the sales tour.) I called the number they left the next morning and a woman stated she wanted to send someone to our villa to do a quality assurance survey. I asked if it could be done over the phone, she said no. I told her that we were all still in our pj's and she insisted someone come in 30 min. I told her no, she put me on hold and then came back and told me fine, that she would try to catch us next time. She wasn't very nice about it and she thought we were the owners of the villa. Again, these are all minor things and we would still stay at this resort again. It was perfect for getting to and from the Disney parks. We purchased groceries at the Target across the street. Great location to EVERYTHING!

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice on the outside, terrible on the inside!”
Reviews.Author: Shayliz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as a timeshare guest for our honeymoon. All of the pictures, videos, etc that I saw beforehand looked amazing, and we were very excited. We were able to check in an hour early, but the actual check in process took about 45 minutes because they really take the time to hard sell you on a timeshare presentation. We gave in just so we could check into our villa. Our first villa was in the West Village. It was 2 bedrooms, 2 bathroom and very spacious. We definitely enjoyed all the room that the villa had and the upgraded televisions and such. The pools were nice, probably better for kids than for couples but we enjoyed the lazy river a few times and mini-golf once. The second day, we returned back to our room to find a roach crawling in the kitchen sink.. we figured "okay, it's probably just a one time thing." .. I wish that were the case! When we came back the next night from theme parks, a roach ran OUT the front door when we opened it. We called maintenance, and they came to our room and sprayed bug spray. The next morning, there was a dead baby lizard in the kitchen, assuming it got into the bug spray. I was ready to move rooms at that point, but my husband convinced me to stay..... that is, until he got up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom and stepped on a roach in the bedroom. To the resort staff's credit, they did move us to another room right away, and we were moved to the 5th floor of a tennis villa's building. The room felt stale, but the amenities were very nice (huge master bath had a real jacuzzi tub and a screened in patio with a great view of the golf course and a lake) I had hoped that since we were no longer ground level, our insect problem would be over... false. There were tiny bugs on the counter in the kitchen and again.. the second day we discovered a roach in the kitchen and one in the bedroom. We wound up checking out a day early, which the staff didn't seem too surprised about, and paid $130 to stay someplace else for the last night we were supposed to stay there. Not exactly a romantic first week for our honeymoon. I wouldn't stay here again even if it was another timeshare gift. Oh and the timeshare presentation? The free gifts aren't worth it - every time we said no, thank you - they sent another person to our table to get us our "gifts" which was really just another person trying to sell us at another angle. Finally, after explaining another time how we 1. don't even own a home 2. just had an expensive wedding (to which the guy asked how much we spent on our wedding - as if it was his business) - my husband laid his foot down that we were finished with this presentation and would be leaving. That is when they finally took us to the redemption center. The 60 minute presentation wound up being 90 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer's Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Deema913
Reviews.Content: First off I'd like to say that this is a beautiful resort. Absolutly stunning! The problem is with the staff at this resort. The first year we went we were guests and agreed to sit through the timeshare presentation. After over 2 hours of trying to convince us to buy, we did. At first we thought this is going to be great, until we started receiving bills for different things. Things that were NOT mentioned to us in the presentation. The information that was presented to us was very misleading. It took almost a year just to get them to send us our membership card which is ridiculous! I've called many times for assistance with different matters but the staff they have in customer service are extremly rude and not very helpful. **Before you buy they are the nicest people ever, but one you are an owner they couldn't care less about you. ** It's sad really. I would recommend this resort to everyone if they could get their act together and treat their owners as well as they treat the potential buyers but unfortunatly this is not the case. Since we're stuck with this with no way out, I can only pray that our experience improves. But honestly, it is one of the nicest resorts I've been to, and I've been to a lot of high end resorts!! This year I'm taking a friend with us. I'm curious to see how she['s treated compared to us. Review to follow in December!

Reviews.Title: “Huge condo - everything you need right there”
Reviews.Author: angus123
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 with a 3 and 4 yo. The 2bdrm condo is huge and the kitchen is perfect. beds were comfy, 2 baths were huge - plenty of towels. Pool is 5 star. Suprisingly short drive to Disney. Publix and super target right around the corner - and Carraba's and an ale house - what more could you ask for? The only complaint I have is that it wasn't all that clean. I lifted the bedspead and a roach ran away. Granted it's florida so they're everywhere, but it could have used a more thorough cleaning. I"m super picky, my husband and kids thought it was fine. And the decor is updated - for the price, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “everything in one place”
Reviews.Author: LINAKA90
Reviews.Content: Fantastic with everything and more. 3 bedroom plenty of room and nicely kept. The grounds are wonderful-even the wildlife found roaming on property provides a home feeling even though the complex is huge. Several pools and many activities. Shuttle transportation allows you to visit the other villages which have different types of pools and activities. Made the grandkids want to stay and play for awhile even though Disney was so close by. Had a lit golf course--cool

Reviews.Title: “Was a perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: olivekeeper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, for the Muddy Buddy run and ride. We had a 2 bedroom vila and it was super clean and beautiful! A ton of space for our 6 members of our family. This is a time share. However we were never hassled in anyway to purchase anything at all. If I HAD to complain about something it would be that when you take part in the amenities you have to pay for the floats, which can be pricey. Other than that I have no complaints. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, FIVE STAR”
Reviews.Author: Reilan
Reviews.Content: We were given a week's stay at the resort as a gift to our child who was turning five by his Godfather. I was really worried about all the negative reviews that I read. We reside in South Africa and are accustomed to staying in four to five star hotels. We were really surprised. We stayed at West Village. We had none of the sales pitch and the check in after a three day road trip from New York was a breeze and a welcome indeed. We spent most of our holiday at the Theme parks however the rooms were fantastic. I am a very fussy traveller and have been to Europe, Australia and the West Cost of America and canada. This was one of our best stays. Will definitely recommend this to all South Africans wanting to take a Disney Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary getaway could not get any better!”
Reviews.Author: StreetRodders
Reviews.Content: 1. First of all this was arranged through a friend who managed to get us 3 weeks at Orange Lake. I must say that I was pleasantly suprised by everything at Orange Lake. 2. Check-in was hasslefree and easy. Staff where very pleasant. As we were guests were were asked if we wanted to partake in a sales presentation - to which we agreed. 3. Exercise rooms are adequate - and there are two located on the grounds 4. Pools wre very clean and well utilized. Especially the Lazy River which we used as well. 5. The on-site Retuarants are conparable to the ones off-of the grounds. Price variations was appropriate considering which reatuarant you ate at. 6. There are 3 Golf Cources - one of which is an executive cource. Mini-golf is also available. Golf lessons are available. 7. I did notice that there were also tennis courts on site. The fact that Orange Lake is West of Kissimmee and away from the Hustle and Bustle (and all the neon lights) made it a much more relaxing place in the evening. Obviously being adjacent to Disney the main mouse is close at hand. My wife and I spent sone time away shopping as the malls are close by. Overall I would rate this as excellent. Great for adults (we are in our 60's) and the kid's that were there seem,ed to be enjoying them-selves as well. This is a well established resort and in the end we actually arrange to purchase. Bob and Pat Klowak Wasaga Beach, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools. Food not so great.”
Reviews.Author: BFUNK80
Reviews.Content: The pools and lazy river is awesome! Great relaxing. we went in September so not crowded very easy to use all amentities. The resort is big and many different areas to see. All the restraunt on site were not good. We left and it went out to local chains just to get some decent food. We also had a broken dishwasher and the bathroom pocket door broke with us inside! Lots of fun things for kids to do though!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort for all the family”
Reviews.Author: Nich_Shropshire
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Orange Lakes as part of our honeymoon and whilst I stayed there 10 years ago I was very nervous, having read some of the reviews on here, at taking my new husband. However, I had no reason to be worried. Check in was fine - although I could see how it would take a while in the busier months. We were asked to take a tour of the hotel in return for vouchers but declined as we wanted to spend our week as we pleased which they seemed to accept. We did receive a few calls during the week, with messages left on our voicemail detailing the latest offers and events on site but, it didn't bother us and we certainly didn't feel hassled to attend the tour - if you don't want to go just say no. We spent a few days off site and the rest were mainly spent at River Island relaxing in the lazy river, playing mini golf and sunning ourselves. We ate in a number of the restaurants on site and all meals were very nice, reasonably priced and a wide selection of meals were on offer. I would definitely recommend this resort to couples and families alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to meet up with friends!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Indtraveler44
Reviews.Content: Met friends at Orange Lake Resort to do our annual Epcot Wine and Food Fest trip. We generally stay on Disney grounds. Thought the resort was in a great location. Close to grocery stores, restaurants and shopping. We needed to pick up friends from the airport and it was only a 30 min. drive. The six of us took a taxi to Epcot (planning to do some wine and beer drinking) cost about $30.00. Well worth it. The resort was very nice, we were in the North Village on the golf course. Don't golf but lots of people did. The condo could use a little updating but it was great size and clean. It was equipped with everything you need for a weeks stay. We did go to the lazy river everyday to relax and beat the heat. Had lots of fun floating down the river (even though we were adults). We had a great time with our friends at Orange Lake Resorts and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: RealMcCoy25
Reviews.Content: I got talked into spending $199 and 2 hours of my time touring the property for 3 nights at this resort. I immediately started planning what I was going to say when they tried to talk me into buying. We arrived at the resort (no problems with check-in, by the way) and were amazed at how huge the property is. We were surprised even further when we opened the door to a very spacious and tastefully-decorated condo in the East Village. Another reviewer commented about a small living room, but our condo had a very spacious great room and a bright and airy kitchen. The master bedroom had a king bed and the master bath, with a shower and oversized tub, was probably bigger than some of the bedrooms in my home. The condo could easily sleep 8 people, with two full size beds in the guest room and a sleeper in the sectional. It also has a full size washer & dryer. We ate at the River Island Grill at least three times and they were all positive. My husband wasn't crazy about their nachos, but I thought they were pretty good. If you're taking kids, be sure to take them to River Island, which has a lazy river pool, pool slides, playground, game room, miniature golf, an inflatable giant water slide, as well as lots of lounge chairs and 2-3 cocktail bars for the parents. They do have poolside service, but the waiters can be hard to find at times. My only complaint is that our 2-hour tour actually took about 5 hours. However, I'm sure that's because we ended up buying a unit here. If you had told me the day we arrived that we would end up buying a time share (here or anywhere else), I would have laughed in your face; however, WE DID IT! This company blew away all of our pre-conceived notions about time shares, and their 10-year financing plan made it fit well in budget. We think (HOPE!) we made a great investment.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAY **this is long/very detailed**”
Reviews.Author: 2kdz_momma
Reviews.Content: We were worried prior to our stay with all the negetive reviews! There was nine of us traveling together for this disney vacation! We rented two, two bedroom suites (just the way the families decided to do it, so we each had our own getaway)! **Check-In/Tour** Our check in went super smooth, AL was great! We expressed that we were hoping for something near one another, he came back with side by side rooms! GREAT customer service! He told us all about the tour, which three of us adults decided to take! They offered some great incentives to take the tour, it did last a little longer than 90 minutes but I expected that so I wasnt suprised! We toured with a gentlemen named Peter, he was polite...until we said NO a few 100 times! After reading reviews about the tour we were prepared to tell several people NO, the reviews were accurate! When we told Peter we werent interested, he went and got someone else, he wanted to show us so more numbers and we had to tell him no, once again he went to get another gentlemen, he also came up with some lower numbers, we again had to tell him no and when he left he sent over a women in which she tried to change our minds one last time before bringing us to the gifting/ticket window! Were we frustrated, not at all because we expected that per previous reviews! Positive feedback regarding the tour: the property is beautiful and they give a great overview! Negetive feedback regarding the tour: you leave your car in a different area than you tour, and they dont bring you back to your car, there is a shuttle however the sign above the shuttle said 19 minutes! It was faster to walk to the car just a distance away, would be a great service for them to return you to car after, I mean they head that way to get another group it would just be an added courtsey! **Room/Grounds** The two bedroom suites had plenty of space, more than enough! The master bathroom was awesome, loved the large tub! We stayed in the east, we were able to see the disney fireworks everynight from our living room and balcony!! It also over looks a golf course, so if your a golfer than it would be perfect! Yes we had a messages on our phone everyday, but it was about specials and things happening around the resort! No bigge! The resort is huge, you will drive to the pools/dining and other amenties, however there is a shuttle if you perfer! They have two entrances and will suggest which one you enter! There is a grocery store and stuff at the entrance, very helpful! There is also a target across the street if you perfer that! Important things to remember, this is a timeshare resort! There is no housekeeping, you make your own beds, take out your own trash and wash your own towels and dishes! They do supply a few boxes of laundry soap, and a few things of dishwasher detergent as well as an extra roll of paper towels and a few extra toilet papers rolls!. We did not get any extra garbage bags or anything in our room, however my mom did next door. They also left conditioner in the bathroom but no shampoo, it didnt matter to me because we didnt intent to use it anyway but it was just strange! Positives about the room: East buildings are quiet, they have the trash drop right next to the elevator (very easy drop off), they have beach towels at every pool, and again the rooms are spacious Negetives about the room: Cooking for nine in one room was a little difficult pan/plate wise, we had ONE frying pan and two sauce pans so when cooking for a large group it could get tricky! We also did have to call maintance twice....once for the tub (the jets wouldnt work) he came right over, switched a switch in the circut box and it came on, the second time we called after trying to use the garbage disposal, something metal was stuck in there, again he came right over and fixed it! Final thing, dont plan to sleep on the pull out couch, it was uncomfortable our guest didnt use it after the first night! (However most pull outs are uncomfortable, so this shouldnt be a suprise) **Pools** We went to the pools in the North area, and the new river island sections! Manly because we had small children with us (age 2 and 6)!! The 6yr old loved playing water basketball and they both enjoyed the waterslides! The lazy river was a nice added bonus for everyone! Keep in mind again that this is a timeshare resort and you will have to pay extra for the mini golf/bowling/watersports/ and other amenties (the hippo and tubes)! This could be shocking if you arent prepared! We had an awesome time, and WILL stay at this resort again in the future! I didn't leave with any regrets, only wish we stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “too much lip service no real service”
Reviews.Author: HTripp
Reviews.Content: The management at River Island was horrible.After speaking with over 10 front desk people and a manager nothing was done,we continue to wait for a 1 night refund after sleeping on a boxspring,waiting 3 days for a corkscrew ,were told a manager was coming to our unit 4 times and he never showed.Spent more time complaining n waiting than enjoying our stay.The phone rang 4x a day w/messages about buying a unit.If your going to relax do Not stay there.Total incompetence.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - Mostly ...”
Reviews.Author: posterchildTN
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were pleased with our stay in the East Village of Orange Lake. We stayed on the ground floor in a 2 bedroom unit. It was very well decorated, well stocked and didn't show many signs of wear. The tvs and showers worked great. We also had a screened porch with a view of the golf course, which was nice. The spaciousness of the unit was a plus. Beds were comfy, linens were ample. Full size washer and dryer worked great. Parking was ample and it was great to park right outside the unit. Saving steps is important when you spend your days at the theme parks! Free wi-fi was nice and worked great. Basically, it felt like a comfortable, roomy, well appointed place to come home to. We visited the River Island pool complex. I've heard people describe it as a mini-water park. Well, not quite. It's definitely more than just a pool, but it's not quite a water park. There are several large pool areas, two large water slides and a very large, meandering lazy river, which we loved. I would say it's comparable to Stormalong Bay at Disney's Beach Club, but without the pirate ship theming. We rented a cabana one day -- nice experience. We ate at one of the restaurants by the pool at River Island and the food was fine. We had no problem with the "cashless resort" business. Just not a big deal. The shops around the resort were NICE. I found TONS of stuff I wanted to buy. There are lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. I could live in the SuperTarget across the street. There's also a Publix and a Walgreens nearby. Olive Garden and Giordano's are very close. Driving to WDW couldn't have been quicker or easier. I had done my research, so I wasn't surprised about the size of the resort (huMONGous!), the manager calls (minor irritation, but they really should back off on those), or the cashless business. I think some of the negative reviews are because people are expecting one thing and get another. Overall, OL exceeded my expectations and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. In fact, we're planning to go back next year. Now to the cons: (1) Bugs - This came as no surprise to me since there was a crack at the bottom of our front door where you could see light coming in. Of course, bugs are going to come in. We bought a can of Raid the first day just in case. Well, we needed it. Next time, I will request that we're not on a ground floor unit. We saw maybe 3 full size roaches and lots of baby ones. Uggh. These are exterior corridor units, not enclosed like a normal hotel. Bugs are going to happen, I guess. Buy a can of Raid at the deLIGHTful Super Target across the street (loved that place). (2) Smell - Several nights, it smelled FOUL outside the unit. Never inside the unit, but if you walked out to your car -- blech. I chalk that up to the fact that OL backs up to Disney's Animal Kingdom. Don't know if that's the reason or not. It didn't happen every night, and like I said, you couldn't smell it once you were inside, and there was no reason to hang around outside unless you were going to your car. Minor irritation, really.

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando Spot”
Reviews.Author: Golferjeff
Reviews.Content: We had a timeshare weeked banked and took a flyer when this place came up. Some of the negative reviews here had us a bit worried. So first to clear up many of those (at least from our experience). We were in a 2 bedroom West Village - room was clean (although a small lizard ran in one day - but it is FLA), Room in good repair - did not have flat screens but was well stocked. Checking-In - another common complaint but we found check-in fairly easy - the woman told us about the timeshare presentation and we said we were not interested - that was it. Phone Calls - there were daily mesdsages left on our phone but they had more to do with what was going on at the resort that day - not a problem at all. Towels and Housekeeping - a very common complaint on here. As many have stated this is a timeshare resort - it is like being in an apartment for a week - if you do research going in then you should be preared for it. Resort is huge - yes it is depending on where your unit is you are going to have to drive to pools and other activities - no getting atound that. Our Experience - We found the resort to be great, We went to Disney Parks 2 days and they were easy driving distance from the resort. The various pools were great we went to 3 different pool areas while we were there and enjoyed them all. Restaurants - we had meals there a couple of times and found the food to be ok and fairly priced. There are grocery stores near the resort so you can load up with all the stuff you want and use your ful kitchen back at the resort. One complaint - wish they had people serving poolside so you didn't have to get up when you wanted something and walk to the pool bar. Real Treat- If you want to give yourself a treat get a Cabana on a hot day. We found this to be a resort and that many of the complaints did not ring true to us (does not mean they were not valid for the people who posted). We will be staying here again the next time we go to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: gloryoung
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this resort. Had a fabulous time.Grandchildren loved everything about it.Ideal for Disney & the parks.Lazy river super!!!Apartment was everything i would expect on a resort like this.If anybody finds anything wrong with this place they must be very hard to please!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort. Definitely Coming Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A_Shinning_Star
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I booked this resort through AMEX, their customer care and professionalism is outstanding. I got an amazing deal on a 2 bedroom Villa Upgrade, the booking process was fast and easy. Check-In; Check-In was another story.... we arrived at the counter to Check-In and were greeted promptly by a nice rep who confirmed our booking and wanted to give us a 2 bedroom apartment. We insisted that we paid for a Villa to which she said "we call everything on this property a Villa, even the Studio Apartment". I requested to see if there was an actual Villa available, she said she would call some office to see, we ended waiting over an hour for the office to reply that they don't think there is anything available. at this stage I was very upset, the kids were cranky etc. I requested to talk to a manger, and was told they won't be able to help me any more than the Check-In rep. I kept on insisting and said I would call AMEX to Complain, as this unacceptable. soon thereafter, the manager became available to talk to us, and within 2 minutes (literally, 60 seconds) he had us in a "Golf Villa"... Lesson learned, ask for the manager right away, you might save a headache. The Villa; Now that Check-In was over.... we got to this beautiful Villa in their "West Village" I couldn't ask for anything better... this was the best Villa I have stayed at ever. no one bothered us with Time-share presentations, we used the pool in the North Village once, (as we went to theme parks etc every day.... ) it was nice, clean and cool.;.. the resort is quiet and secure. we looooved staying in this resort. The resort location is great, close by to Disney and Sea World. there is a Publix, Target, and 24 hour Walgreens within 2 minutes. There is even a Kosher Restaurant (Cohen's Deli) within 10 minute drive. Overall, we had a rough beginning but then our vacation ended a blast... we had a great time, and looking forward to staying at this resort again (If we get a "Golf Villa")...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time Share property”
Reviews.Author: Jimshelbytwp
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week at this mega size time share property...very clean, continual unit updates, on site transportation, very good restuarants, excellent pools, 2 golf courses (18 holes...Legends is by far the best to play), 2 nine holes (1 lighted for evening golf). Great for family..not too far from Disney. Check in is time consuming because of pitch to attend time share opportunities...and if you do decide to attend the "hour" presentation, be sure to plan on at least 2 hours...if you are a time share afficinado you willingly accept these conditions/presentations...and sometimes you can get a very good deal on extras

Reviews.Title: “nice place with lots recreational facilities and a walgreens opposite it”
Reviews.Author: Awful_Kgp
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a two bedroom apartment with two huge bedrooms and a huge veranda with cooking and washing facilities. there was a golf course and a recreational room. there were 2-3 swimming pools along with a lazy river. there was a proper restaurant along with a complete store .

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: lup47
Reviews.Content: When we checked in around 2 pm , we were told that our room might not be ready until 4 pm, the official check in time. After taking time for a late lunch, we decided to find our unit. As we approached the unit, the maid's cart was in the hall next to our unit and the maid was standing by the cart and talking on a cell phone. We noticed it was about 3:15 and decided that we would walk around the complex for a while. At 4:15, we went to our unit and the maid was still at the unit next door, talking on the cell phone. My husband called the front office and complained and a supervisor came over. We were told that our unit would not be ready for another half hour, so it was 4:45 until we were able to get into our unit. A few days later, the only toilet in the unit got clogged. We called maintainance about the problem. My husband found a plunger in the bathroom vanity cabinet and tried to unclog the toilet but was unsucessful. About 15 minutes later, someone came with a plunger to try to unclog the toilet. He was also unsuccessful and said he would have to contact someone with a plumber's snake to try to unclog the toilet. We told him that we had tickets to a show and would have to be leaviing the unit within 30 minutes. He could not guarantee that someone would be there before then but stated that the person has a pass key and could get into the unti if we were not there. Since no one showed up in time, we secured our belongings and left. We returned about 10:30 that night and no one had come to unclog the toilet. We called maintainance and got an answering service who had no idea of the problem and could not tell us when someone might be there. Since this was the sole toilet in the unit, it needed to be fixed that night. Around 11:15, a young man came with a plumber's snake and unclogged the toilet. As he was leaving, he said he would have to call housekeeping to clean up the bathroom. After he left, we went in to the bathroom to find clumps of feces on the floor, toilet and tub. The bathroom was in worst shape than any public toilet could possibly be. We called housekeeeping since we did not trust that the young man had done so and sure enough, they had not recieved any call. Again, it was an answering service who had no idea when someone would arrive. Around midnight, a man came to clean up the mess. We were glad that we had said no to purchasing a unit, especially after what we experienced. Staying at any Holiday Inn property will be very unlikely in our future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for my daughter.”
Reviews.Author: bwca44
Reviews.Content: I was a guest with my brother and my daughter. I have been a guest through the Latitude package that I purchased two years ago. I was told that I would be able to stay 3 weeks. However when booking the travel dates I ran out of points and was only able to stay 6 nights two times. I paid 1900.00 dollars for this so I was misled by the salesperson. When I booked my trip for October this year, I was told that I would be able to stay overlooking River Island. We went to our room and it was on the other side facing the street. I called to try to get another room and was told that all of the rooms were booked. We never saw people coming from the rooms, so we are not sure that the rooms were actually booked. Our room was very dirty. The floors had not been cleaned, and there was dust everywhere. There was no vacuuming of the baseboards and windows and behind the end tables. I also found bugs inside the lampshade fabric. We have allergies, so my daughter had a stuffy nose every morning. Housekeeping was called and they came and told us that they did not have hoses for the vacuums, so they were unable to clean the baseboards and the windows. I was booked for the sales presentation on Friday the last day of our trip. I was told that I was unable to change the date. My daughter was scheduled for a Princess lunch at Disney. I had to drop off my brother and daughter at Disney. I was supposed to meet them after a 90 minute presentation. I went to it and after going through 3 people and 5 hours I was able to leave. They knew that my brother had called and my daughter was crying because I wasn't there with her. I was told several lies such as you will not be able to change to points if you buy from someone else. I was also told that If I was an owner I would have been able to get a room overlooking River Island. I am a widow and I told them that I wouldn't buy without consulting my financial adviser or someone else in my family. I was told that they don't know anything about you and you need to take charge of your own life and start traveling with your daughter. We also left the room for the day on Wednesday and left my daughter's autograph book on the kitchen table. We came home and found it to be gone after housekeeping left us new sheets and towels. My daughter was able to get 21 signatures so she was very disappointed. We had to buy her a new book. We called guest services and was told that they will look for it. We know that we did not misplace it and it was taken.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the desperate saleslady...”
Reviews.Author: GraceDiva
Reviews.Content: The check in process was a bit long. The location was okay. It was close to one or two restaurants, Publix and Target. Parking was not a problem. We had a two bedroom, which was spacious except the living room area was a bit cramped. Our stay at Orange Lake was okay until we went to a sales meeting. The saleslady said things, like she would " kiss our feet if we bought a timeshare." The ongoing pressure was horrible. How many times does a person have to say No, before they understand? After I left the room the saleslady came running behind me and even got physical putting her hands on me.!! I have never have such a thing to happen to me before. Stay away from this resort...the sales folks there are beyond desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Owners since 1998 - Bad experience this year in East Village”
Reviews.Author: Chr1sEla1ne
Reviews.Content: My family purchased a timeshare at Orange Lake in 1993 and have returned every year except twice. I'll give a basic review of the resort followed by the bad experience this year. Orange Lake is in close proximity to Disney, Universal, and Sea World. A Publix grocery store and Super Target are within a mile of the resort. There are numerous restaurants onsite and offsite to satisfy eating requirements. And plenty of outlet malls within a 10-15 mile radius. The property we own is a 2 BR suite in Bldg 86300 in the East Village. As of October 2010 some of the buildings in the East Village are getting exterior improvements--painting, resurfacing, etc. Our suite is in good condition, but without improvements soon it could drop to fair. The refrigerator made a loud humming noise, the bed and window coverings are faded, the spa tub isn't clean (gray matter comes out of the jets), vacuum cleaner did not work, and dishwasher did not clean in a single cycle. A fresh coat of paint and carpeting are also needed in the next year. The washer/dryer, stove, microwave, DVD player, and TVs all work well. As a sidenote, the TVs are not flat screen/HD models. Wi-fi signal strength is good throughout the unit and does not drop connection. Overall, the unit is good, especially considering we don't spend all of out time there. But we can see how it has "aged" over the years and the property we own at another resort has done a better job replacing electronics, furnishings, and decor. After 4 years River Island is still a nice little water park (within walking distance from the East Village). There are plenty of chairs to lounge in, a spot of sand to play in, and 3 pool areas connected by a "lazy river". There are water slides, cabanas, bar, arcade, shower/restroom, gift shop, and restaurant all in River Island. If you have kids they should enjoy a day or two of water and games. The resort has security that drives around and has a strong presence around the resort. There are also shuttles to transport one between the different villages. Tennis courts, miniature golf, and small fitness room are also available. One of Orange Lake's best features is it's golf, but I'm not a golfer so I can't review that. BAD EXPERIENCE We purchased shoes at one of the outlet malls, but left them in the unit at checkout. After 3 hours on the road we realized the shoes were left so we called the resort. Security checked the room, but the shoes were gone and Housekeeping didn't turn anything in to Lost and Found. The resort took our contact information, but never contacted us. After a week of calling we finally contacted Holiday Inn Club Corporate, they in turn contacted Orange Lake and then got back with us. The shoes were never turned in and Orange Lake is not liable for lost or left items. We understand they are not liable, but we were dissatisfied with how this was handled by Housekeeping or whoever entered the room after we left and Resort Staff. I didn't expect Management to contact us back because they have more important things to deal with, but Guest Relations could have contacted us at some point. Whoever took the shoes should have known better considering this is an owner resort and I return there year after year. Lessons learned: 1) Never leave belongings behind. 2) Lock your valuables when you leave your unit or take them with you. 3) In the future use Holiday Inn Club Points to stay at a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here...should say something”
Reviews.Author: majk_p
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March of last year and loved it, so we tried it again in October of 2010 and guess what? Loved it. We even took the inlaws this time and they stayed in the 2 bedroom condos. They loved it too. The pools are great, the staff is wonderful, the arcade is fun, the proximity to Disney, Universal, and Sea World is good. We didn't eat at the resort but my father in law said they ate at the golf restaurant and they enjoyed it. We stayed again in the West Village hotel and has no problems. The only small issues...everyday they called to either invite us to the owner's meeting or to inform us of some event happening at the resort...and when we checked in we were encouraged to attend the 'become an owner sales meeting". It just took a polite no thank you and there was no more mention of it, but last year there was no mention of this meeting. I'll go back in the spring though. This place is really nice. New, daily towel service would be good in the hotel though, without the surcharge. If it wasn't for these minor issues Orange Lake would be a 5*, but its still a strong 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Now I get it.”
Reviews.Author: sathomps10
Reviews.Content: To start, I have now stayed at Orange Lake 3 times in the last 3 years. My first two trips were great, but now I understand the negative reviews, and how a few experiences can ruin a trip. I won't get into the size of the resort or anything else, because it is huge and beautiful. You get that from other reviews. Here were our problems: 1. The first day we were there, our daughter wanted an inner tube. We bought her one from the local stores, and went to the lazy river. Immediately we were told we could not use our own tube on the lazy river. So.. We went and grabbed a blue one, then a young kid working for orange lake grabbed it out of my daughters hand and told her if she wanted a tube, there was a $9/day rental charge per person. Now.. Why would I rent a $1 tube, for $9 a day? Would you rent a $20,000 car for $180,000 pet day (9 times the cost to just buy it)? So.. Instead of enjoying the lazy river, we walked it, then said heck with it. 2. On the 3rd day there, we went through a tour with a serious intention on buying. My sister bought into their latitudes vacation program 2 years prior, and we all liked the resort. For 2 years I've researched prices, so I knew what the going rate was. Online, you buy a week anywhere from $1,000 up to $5,000 depending on when you want your week, and what village you choose. In fact, my brother purchased a week in Febuary for $1,000 online. We get through the tour and onto the numbers. First pencil $33,000 for 133,000 points. Ok.. That's crazy. So I mention online prices, etc so they offer a "pre-owned" timeshare (arnt all rooms used anyway) for $10,500 but it's every other year. Ok.. Better, but not what I want. This is where it got interesting. The "manager" told me there would be a $7,000 charge to convert a used timeshare online to the points system. So as the sales guy walks away, I call my brother. He said the charge is only $795. So now I'm irritated.. Realizing they have no problem being untruthful. And I get it.. A used car salesman wants you to buy a car from his lot, not from someones front yard. I do get it. So.. After another manager comes.. I tell him to work on the price, and to let him know I've done my research.. I mention trip advisor, the good, average, and many negative reviews. The guy says "You can never trust online reviews, especially trip advisor". I found that interesting seeing that obviously Orange Lake responds to both good znd bad reviews on this site. So now I'm untrusting .. And I decide I'm not going to buy at this time.. So a 4th guy comes out and offers me the latitudes program. Nice.. My sister did it.. But I've been there going on 4 hours.. Not deciding anything now. So.. At the same time, my sister was doing a tour (a requirement for doing the latitudes program). We all get back to the room, all slightly annoyed and my sister tells me, they considered buying but they wanted the latitudes one more time before spending $5,000 or more. They told my sister "Oh.. We font offer that anymore.. In fact.. You were one of the last customers on that program from a few years ago". I laughed and showed her the brochure they let me take, and the price they offered for the latitudes program. Another lie, caught red handed. So.. On to the 4th day. We decided to extend our stay 3 days. My sister called the front desk since the reservation was in her name. 3 hours later, 20 telephone transfers.. And we extended our stay. The problem.. Every person tells you something different. Yes, you can stay in that room.. No.. You have to move.. They are overbooked.. Etc etc etc. Thank god for Jodi at the front desk. She was the only person to truly give us accurate answers. So lastly.. On our last night.. We decide to eat at river island grilling company. Easy, walking distance, etc. We sit down.. Look at the prices.. $24.95 for a new your strip! Seriously? Im not cheap but you've got to be kidding. After talking a few minutes.. 7 of us get up and decide to go yo outback. Our total bill at outback was $30 for 3 of us. It would have been at least twice that if we had stayed. So in the end.. Nice trip, but a true realization that you can't believe a word they say. They nickel and dime you for everything here. It's beyond insane! Another example.. Their "onsite" arcade is points based. Donkey Kong, $1 per game. It costs a nickel at Nickel World. Who pays $1 to play donkey Kong? Anyway.. Good luck. If orange lake reads this.. We were your guests in 81229a from oct 10 - 13th, and then you moved us to 82225 October 14th - 16th. I was a guest of my sister, and now.. I'm not so sure if I want to be an "owner" after the lies. What happens after you own and you have my $$? I used to recommend Orange Lake.. But now I'm not so sure.

Reviews.Title: “overall=pleased,only small issues”
Reviews.Author: magami
Reviews.Content: my family had a blast on our disney vacation, and when we werent at disney we spent most of our time on the resort. river island was awesome,,POOLS WERE WAY TOO COLD! like an icebath,,until the last day of our stay, they decided to heat them up a little, which woud have been nicer at the beginning of our stay. BUT we still had a good time, YES the sales pitches and phone calls are a bit too much,,, I imagine it is harder to pitch a florida vacation timeshare thats not right on the beach, so its understandable..didnt keep me from enjoying myself, the garbage disposal in our villa smelled like mold, they need to clean them with bleach or something,and the living room furniture was the most uncomfortable furniture i have ever sit on, they were nice looking, but hard as a rock,, and yes the lazy river tubes were too expensive,$9 a day, but we did get them and we had a good time with them , and the puttputt and the hippo slide...i would come back if i ever plan to visit disney again,

Reviews.Title: “nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: teckstar35
Reviews.Content: The place is very spacious and clean. very close to disney. perfect for family trip. kitchen is spacious and plenty of space. the bad part about this place is the bed sheets. they are not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect every time we vacation there”
Reviews.Author: PJLEWANDOWSKI
Reviews.Content: We have a wonderful time and the accommodations are excellent every time we have vacationed there since we joined six years ago. We take our family and friends with us and we get to enjoy it with them at no additional cost. We love the Lazy River and the Putt Putt. You pay one price for Putt Putt and play all week on the pass. Very afforable for a big group. We always look forward to our winter break at Orange Lake Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lies Lies Lies I can not believe they are even in buisness”
Reviews.Author: joe194546730
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nasty Bathrooms unclean dirty dishes bath clothes ext.... They pressure the people at the front desk so hard the older lady that checked us in almost wet her pants because they would not even let her go to the bathroom. They tell us to sign up for a time share tour that is only 90 mins it took # Hours we told the sales reps we were not interested and they would not let us go until they let us go our vacation was horrible

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB!”
Reviews.Author: cjbclb99
Reviews.Content: Before we decided on our vacation this year, I constantly read the Trip Advisor reviews for Orange Lake Resort and was quite perplexed by them. I didn't know what to expect should we decide to stay at the resort - but I took a chance because my daughter wanted to go to Florida. Our timeshare is deeded for Orlando so we took advantage and decided to come down. Upon arrival - we were greeted in the lobby and upon finding out we were owners, we were motioned to another line. We arrived late around 10pm that evening - they were still nicely staffed for the amount of guests in the lobby. Our checkin agent was VERY PERSONABLE and very attentive - he didn't rush us as I had many many questions from being perplexed by the whole ordeal. I didn't know what we were going to receive regarding the sleeping accommodations - and upon our arrival - WE ABSOLUTELY LOVED our 2 Bedroom Villa in the West Village - it was gorgeous - spacious - and our home away from home. It was me, my husband, and 10 year old daughter and it was plenty of space for us. The only issue I had was the front door light bulb had blown - which was quickly replaced once I made the service call. My daughter is avid swimmer and there were PLENTY OF POOLS AND LAZY RIVERS to go around. Instead of going to the parks - we could've stayed at the resort the entire length of our stay and been content. But because we were there - we took our daughter to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventures (she's a thrill ride seeker) - but once we rode all the rides - she immediately wanted to go back to the resort. Granted - we were bombarded with calls to attend presentations, which we did because we have been very pleased thus far. And yes, we did upgrade to the Priority Club status - as yearly vacations with our daughter is very important. We had a great time - starting from the checkin all the way down to checkout. If it didn't rain daily between 1pm and 3pm - we would've had an even better time! I would definitely recommend this resort. Plenty to do with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't have to leave the resort if we didn't want to!”
Reviews.Author: 83TRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Orange Lake Resort had everything on site that a vacationer could possibly need. Check in was a breeze. We enjoyed the pools, the lazy river, the restaurants, shops and entertainment. Definitely would make a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Best way to do Disney World with Young Children”
Reviews.Author: michellevo
Reviews.Content: We love Orange Lake Resort. We rented a two bedroom condo in the West Village and it more than exceeded our expectations. The check in can be a little rough but after than you cannot beat the stay. We would go to the parks (which are closer to Orange Lake Resort than some of the Disney Properties with Animal Kingdom just 5 minutes away) until about 2:00pm when our children would be needing a nap and then head back to Orange Lake for some relaxation. No problem there since they had their own room and we could actually have some quality time together as a couple. Then get up and go to fireworks show and a few attractions. We ate most of our meals at the great restaurants that are around and one evening just grabbed take out and brought it back to the place. Also, we saved so much money and it is just easier with little ones to eat breakfast at the place while we were getting ready. Once you stay at Orange Lake for Disney World (this is our third time) you will be spoiled and not happy anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly cheers, with a smattering of boos...”
Reviews.Author: cdinlondon
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire as a 4 star property in the Disney Main Gate/Celebration area. This concerned me a little as most sites rate it as a 3.5 star, but we were going to be busy most of the trip and I got it at a very good rate so beggers cant be choosers. Here is my breakdown of this enoromous Resort. Pros, 1) Amenities - There is everything you could want to do at this resort. They have golf courses (I didnt see a single person on the course our entire 4 day stay), a waterpark, a lake with various watersport activities, and the list goes on and on. 2) Rooms - There are many types of rooms at this property, it is sort of a hybrid between a hotel and a condo complex. We stayed in what I would call the hotel part of the complex and the studio rooms were an excellent size, with fridge, convection oven, dishwasher, flat screen tv and comfortable beds. 3) Security - Everytime you go into the complex they check your parking pass and so forth so it felt very safe. 4) Location - I wasnt sure which side to put this on, for us this trip we went to the Disney Waterparks on two days, and Magic Kingdom one day, and we flew into Tampa, so the location for us was excellent. However if you are doing Universal and things of that nature as we usually do, or flying into MCO I might consider a different location. Cons 1) No housekeeping - This was never mentioned to me either through Hotwire or when we checked in with Steve at the front desk. I probably would have been more upset, but since the room didnt have a safe this worked out not too bad. 2) Sales Pitch - I read the reviews about this and so I came in aware, the only time it was uncomfortable was at check in when I had to say no 5 times when Steve tried to get my wife and I to go to a presentation. ( I know he was only doing his job so not really that big a deal) I also did as many previous posters suggested and unplugged the phone. 3) Resort Fee - I cant stand that so many hotels have gone this route, it is especially annoying when you book through Hotwire or Priceline as you generally dont know what you are getting into @7 plus tax, the only benefit from it I could see was the wireless internet which wasnt the most reliable. I also didnt like that it was a cashless resort, being from Canada I dont like to use my CC when travelling as the CC companies hit you with the lovely foreign exchange fees. Having said all that I would still probably stay here again, however if I did I would make sure we had nothing else planned. This is the type of place that you could spend 3 or 4 days at and not be bored at all, without leaving the resort. A couple of tips in the area, there is a super target just down the steet as well as a publix for all your goodies. If you are going to Tampa pay the 50 cent toll, hwy 417 it will cut 10-15 minutes off your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: ElleVee288
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn Club Vacations Orlando for two weeks starting on the 26 Sept 2010, when we arrived we were checked in very promptly by very friendly and helpfull staff, we had travelled from South Africa so were very tired, but we were offered a beverage and our accomodation was available for us on arrival. Great Service. During our stay the staff were extremely helpful. The accomodation was awesome, clean with every appliance you could need, with all the detergent to go with it. We enjoyed it so much, we would definitely plan to go there again. The resort is wonderful, the staff is friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to chill close to all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: GrahamMcFTM
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort worried following some of the reviews on various sites. There is nothing to worry about at all. This place is superb.
