We stayed in a three bedroomed villa on the ground floor of a block in the East Village overlooking the golf course. East Village is very quiet and away from the main parts of the resort. There is a lovely pool area beside the 86700 block. After long days at the attractions the East village is a great place to chill. Our Villa was tops. Loads of space clean and well equipped. The resort seems very safe to me. Security on main gates and driving around the resort. As others have said this is a Timeshare resort. They did ask if we wanted to go on the "Tour". One firm no and we were not asked again. We did get phone calls but only to inform us of the events on the resort. We did see Gecko's outside. What do you expect its a resort in the countryside. We also saw fantastic Cranes and Egretts. If you want the convenience of a resort you could not better this place. If you dont and want a home from home holiday go rent a villa on an estate.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: plastic orange
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort based on opinions on a number of sites, plus the resort website itself (very accurate), and I can say I was not disappointed. I travelled with my wife, daughter and niece, and stayed from 30th August till 27th September in room 5412 (ground floor) in the Tennis Village. My daughter in particular had done her homework, and we'd requested the East Village (newest) based on general opinions, but were allocated the West Village on arrival at the desk (super quick and efficient booking in process). We queried this allocation and were informed that this was a lot quieter than other areas - must have known us. I definately got the impression we could have been re located if requested so was happy to give it a go. The accommodation was on the ground floor in a 5 storey block, and comprised 2 bedrooms - 1 master with large ensuite - jacuzzi bath and separate shower, and the other with 2 double beds and separate toilet/shower. There was a large well stocked kitchen with lounge/dining facilities and an outside room with meshed screening for sitting out overlooking a large pond - very nice outlook. The unit was one of the non refurbished ones, but was entirely adequate for our purposes, being clean and tidy. We were very close to the main reception area and pools, and having explored all the other areas of the resort came to the conclusion that the booking in clerk had judged our needs spot on. We had the expected call asking us to a timeshare presentation, but we fobbed them off by saying that we were busy for 2 weeks (niece was only staying 2 weeks), and for them to call back then. This they did, but by this time we had heard that the sell was quite intense, plus we had inadvertantly left our parking pass on the car whilst at the nearby Publix store, and had a flier put on the windscreen offering resales for $2900, so couldn't see the point of spending the $15k they were asking for (not that we had any intention). In fact, talk at the pool was about how the regulars felt that the entertainment etc had taken a downturn over the years. We relayed this information to the caller, and we were never disturbed again. Every day there was a message left on the phone informing of events of the day which was useful. During our stay we had 3 visits from housekeeping, so were adequately provided for with the essentials. The resort itself is beautifully maintained, and staff were always courtious and friendly. Pool areas were particularly pleasant with our preferred area being the one closest to us. We didn't eat on site, but noted that there were a variety of eateries, each themed to different tastes. It is a 'cashless' resort, with all purchases being billed to your credit card via the room key - this was settled at check out (again super quick), and could have been paid by cash if requested. We'd certainly stay there again without hesitation, and really the only improvements I would like to see is the provision of better quality evening entertainment (would keep folk onsite), and perhaps some facilities which required payment should be provided free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: jamulb
Reviews.Content: We visited with family members who are timeshare owners. The room was nice--clean, updated and comfortable. The grounds were also nice. The entire resort is HUGE! Lot's to do for kids. The pools are awesome--especially River Island. The bars were good (we went to the pool bar and also the sports bar). Convenient to grocery stores, restaurants etc. It's right next door to Disney and 20-30 minutes to Universal. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful at the "cash free" resort”
Reviews.Author: Steve30531
Reviews.Content: Having been sufficiently hassled to buy a time-share (90 minutes does not equal 3 hours) we returned home to find that a bartender had overcharged our card making a $4.00 tip $40.00. The resort refused to return calls and letters and then refused to work with my bank after I disputed the charge on my card. $36.00 isn't a big deal, but I can't be the only one. Be careful.

Reviews.Title: “A turn around”
Reviews.Author: delancy2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Florida to buy a house. We reserveved 4 weeks at Orange LAKE RESORT. We were assigned a unit that had the smell of fungus, it was due to sitting water in the bathroom and air condition duct. I called for help-- it came promptly and very effectivly. The Mananger MANNY was ver helpful and kind. He got us another unit and continued to follow-up on us. He was very polite and understanding. I fther is anything negative, it is the phone ringing the 1st and second day about every 20 min. to try to sell us a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun for us!”
Reviews.Author: lionqueen813
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for a few weeks before arriving at The Orange Lake Resort so I felt prepared for what to expect. Our check in process was painless. All of the staff I encountered during our week long stay was courteous and helpful. The resort is indeed huge but we saw many shuttles in operation during our stay. We had our own vehicle so transportation was not a problem. I will always wonder how they came up with a standard speed limit of 23 mph on the resport property (23 seems so random but I'm sure there is something scientific about it). The grounds were well manicured and our two bedroom villa had been well maintained although the furnishings were a little outdated. The pools were delightful and the nightly sunset party was good family fun. I have stayed at many different Orlando resorts during the years and was pleased with our experience at Orange Lake.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY THERE - ITEMS STOLEN FROM VILLA”
Reviews.Author: EBC535
Reviews.Content: My advice is go to Orlando – Florida you will have a blast. Just do not stay at Orangelakes – Kissimmee Whilst the accommodation is okay if you do not mind styling from a 1980’s timewarp, reasonably clean and sized. The resort has lot of short comings and nearly spoilt our holiday (1) Whatever you do not call house-keeping – which you are entitled to one free clean up after staying 10 consecutive days. We had them in and they do not just clean, as we had a further unscheduled visit 24 hours later when we were out. They left our window catch off and open for someone to access our bedroom and clean us out of our mobile phones and electronic apple products. It would have been worse if I had not used the safe in the room. (2) Management – I had several meetings with management and head of security regarding this matter, they just do not care. I have called from England over 5 times and sent numerous emails to senior management of the resort. I finally received one insulting email of $150 offer as a gesture of goodwill which has not been received. Which is an insult considering my items stolen were worth over $1500, it happened on their site, with their security and more than likely their staff. Whilst the above was my worst experience of the resort, I did also notice the following – The size of the resort is huge, you will need a car to go everywhere. The Water-park does not exist, I spent 30 mins trying to find it on site, its just a pool and a lazy river and a baby slide (must be over 48 inches tall to use, not 46, 48 inches to use it). The slow river is managed by the gestipo, I saw one person surrounded by 5 security people because he refused to pay for a ring at 7.30pm and just wanted one ride around the slow river on a ring he found by the side. The restaurants & bars are over priced for the area and do not come with the Florida hospitality you normally hope and expect. If you like dead toads and geekos then you will love this resort because there are loads of them. After staying 12 days there I also noticed that I had received over 25 messages on my room answer phone on top of the ones I had said no to on the phone trying to get me to go to the time share seminar, even though I made it very obvious to management and check in that their behaviour was on the verge of harassment. I really would recommend you look somewhere else to stay and enjoy your holiday. Holiday Orange lakes is a real disappointment and can only be compared to a stay at Fawlty Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Family Christmas and Wedding. Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: kizzytyler5
Reviews.Content: My extended family gets together every year and this past year we went to Orlando for my uncle's wedding and our Christmas. We stayed in the 2 bedroom villa on the back side of the property. They were absolutely wonderful and were bigger than some apartments I've been in. We played golf at their course which was very enjoyable. The food at the restaurants we ate at was always good. The wedding we attended was right on the lazy river, this is an excellent venue for a wedding. The reception at the golf club was fabulous as well. We stayed for the weekend and would gladly return for an extened Florida vacation

Reviews.Title: “They don't care about your safety and health”
Reviews.Author: ckaminsky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Orange Lake Resort August 21-30 , When we checked in the staff was very nice and upgrade me to a 3-bedroom east village room because I'm a platinum priority club member with Holiday Inn, The first day was great we unpacked and played mini golf. The next day after Disney we noticed all the windows had plastic on them and things where taped over like they where going to paint. We had a note taped to are door that told us they where paint are building. For the rest of are stay we had to deal with paint smell, not being able to see out the windows, wet paint every where. The painters all had masks on, but when the guests had to leave we had to hold are breath and walk through the paint mist. One morning my 4 year old ran to the elevators, when I turned the corner he was sanding behind a painter ( with a mask on) and I could see the cloud on paint mist around him ,I yelled at him to come to me and we would take the 5 flights of stairs down. When we got to the car my 4 year old son said Daddy I don't fell good and throw up in the car. The resort was not crowded so they could have closed off the build. We saw other guests that all had comments about the painting. When I told the manager at check out he said you should have call and we would have given you another room. I told him we where all unpacked and you should be more pro- active and less reactive. You know they will be painting when we check in, Would you want to stay in that building with your family, He said no Absolutely not. Then why would you put your guest there. I have complained to priority club three times and still no word from them or Orange lake Resort. I wasted 250,000 priority club points on one of the worst vacations I have had. Even the cockroaches where running to get away from the paint fumes. A few nights on the way up to the room my son would play a game see how many bugs I can jump on and kill. I didn't tell my wife and son they where large cockroaches.Then on the last night we walked to Legends to get something to eat with my wife ,son, two friends and there 4 year old. When we got there at 7 PM we where the only ones there. We ordered dinner only no appetizers. After an hour my son and his friend where started to cry for food. I asked the waitress why 8pm we still do not have are food. She brought out some chips and say " Give these to your kids" My friend had to stop me from throwing the chip back at the waitress. That was the icing on the cake. I am very upset with holiday inn and shocked that they allow orange lake resort to use there name, Orange lake resort is not up to the high standards I'm use to at Holiday Inns. I hope this review will help others stay away and have a fun vacation in Disney Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Dont believe the Negativity”
Reviews.Author: TheLittlew00ds
Reviews.Content: This is the first time Ive written a review but I feel I need to give this place some positive feedback. We booked the resort on the basis of some of the good reviews of the resort versus our alternative of Lake Buena Vista via Virgin. Im so glad we ignored the negative views. First thing to clear up - timeshares. Ive stayed in timeshare resorts before and had some nasty experiences. Maybe im a little bit more aware as a result, but as others have said here if at check in they ask you attend the presentation and you dont want to, just politely keep saying your not interested and no thank you. I think my discussion lasted about 2 minutes. Yes I had a follow up call a day later - i simply told them I was happy to recommend the resort and didnt need to attend their presentation. Their kind offer of free golf or dinner etc was politely refused. We stayed for 2 weeks and heard nothing else after this. Rooms - we booked a 2 bed villa. We expected the worst. We got a nice clean spacious 2 bed villa/apartment in the North Village next to one of the many golf courses. Yes it was a little dated but it was clean and looked like it had been recently painted. The cooker was fine as was the fridge freezer. There was even a dishwasher. It was fine. It was typical 4 star RCI standard. Oh yeah and there was free wifi in the room which was an unexpected added bonus. The pools are huge. Now granted we stayed slightly out of peak season but we were there over Labor Day and the pools were dead. Plenty of sunbeds and no problems. We had no problems at River Island using the lazy river without a wristband as we just picked up abandoned inflatables. The only problem we had was with the pool staff sticking to their guns about height restrictions on the water slide which meant my son could go on but not my daughter. This is kind of problem I dont mind having! The complex is huge - probably bigger than the village I live in in the UK. We had a car so this wasnt a problem (how you would survive without one in Orlando outside of Int'l Drive/Disney is beyond me). We never ate at the resort as we had a car and there are plenty of nearby supermarkets (Target and Publix) and restaurants on the 192, including Kissimmee itself. International Drive is probably 20 minutes drive away with even more choice. That said the prices were in line with Disney parks. Yes the onsite shops are expensive but then you are paying for the convenience. Use the supermarkets. Disney parks are within 10 minutes and Universal about 25 min drive. Id go back to Orange lakes in a second given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: joinkb
Reviews.Content: I really can't say enough about this place. We read the reviews before going and was a little concerned, but also realized you can't please everyone no matter how hard you try. We arrived on a Sat and stayed in the West Village from all the readings everyone stated these and River Island had the most up to date rooms (yes, its true!) 1st night we stayed in villa 3050. It was very nice a tad dated, but clean and very spacious. The next day we were moved into villa 2318 as a part of my timeshare stay courtesy of my mom. Now this villa was beautifully decorated all updated electronics i.e. flat screen TV, Spa tub, granite countertops with a nice soothing colored decor. There were 6 of us in my group and this worked out great everyone had enough room and the kids had a place to run around and play. We were facing the golf course (which hardly had anyone on it EVER) it just looked like a huge backyard for them to run and play. All the attractions were close enough if you have a car. Now to say yes this place is HUGE!! However the West Village and River Island have all the entertainment and the West Village seems to literally have everything you seriously don't need to go anywhere just enjoy the pool, movies, music and food and that's your vacation really no need to spend all that $$$$$ on Disney if you've been a lot (like me) and let me say their pizza is DELICIOUS I would have never thought their pizza was that good. I'm originally from NY and very picky about my pizza. Now about those pesky people trying to get you to go on tour. We politely declined and was never bothered again. And for those $9 tube rentals at River Island uh please there were soooo many ones laying around just grab one and float your heart away no one will bother you wristband or not TRUST ME! Needless to say we LOVED it here so much that we bought a villa. Not from Holiday Inn but from a wonderful guy we met while vacationing there and trust me you can NOT beat the price and location of the villa WEST VILLAGE. With all this said know these things: this is a CASHLESS RESORT (use your debit/ATM CARD NO PROBLEM) they will try to get you to go on tour DECLINE, DO NOT BUY ANY TUBES and the giant slide looks fun but trust me you won't die if you don't slide on it no big deal!!! Sit back in your villa and RELAX. We saw NO BUGS, FROGS, ROACHES VERY CLEAN VILLA. No room service WASH YOUR OWN STUFF, and lastly Target is much cheaper that PUBLIX!! There were a lot of lizards though not inside though!! Have fun relax a little!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful... The Devil lies in the details”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_Oakville
Reviews.Content: Now that I am back in Canada, I want other people to be aware of this trap called Holiday Inn – Orange Lake Resort. We had a large group of 5 families, friends in common, who decided to visit Orlando for a week and see among other things, the new Harry Potter Castle at Universal. My family and another family decided to share a villa for 8 people in this apparently beautiful resort, at least in our dreams. We have been mislead by the Holiday Inn Website, which shows villas and rooms that, apparently, do not exist at the Orange Lake resort. We paid in advance for a “luxurious resort-style villa”, as described in their Website, to obtain a discount. After reading a few bad reviews at TripAdvisor, I called the Holiday Inn Reservations and also the resort directly to make sure we would be staying in one of the renovated villas and not have any bad surprises in our arrival. We were driving from Atlanta to Orlando, and planned to have a late check-in. We arrived at the hotel around 10 p.m. after driving for more than 6 hours straight and the reception was excellent on arrival but their effort to sell us one of the timesharing options was quite annoying even after we firmly said no to timeshare. It might have been the reason why they assigned us the most disgusting villa in the complex. We went to the villa which was in the West Village, which was a huge disappointment. It could only be described as a foul smelling dirty apartment. Most of the appliances were old and broken, clothes from previous guests were still piled up on the sitting room, the windows looked as though they hadn’t been cleaned for years which made the place darker, and the bathroom was filthy. The furniture felt like it was worn out and at least 20 years old. It was certainly not what we had paid for and dreamed for. I went right back to reception and they directed me to talk to someone at Guest Services. Many people were already there complaining to similar issues with their villas. After talking to a lady and being informed that they did not have the villas shown on their Website or anything else that could please us, they decided to refund our money, which was the least I was expecting. By the time I got all resolved, it was already almost 11 p.m. My friend and his family had not yet arrived at the hotel. We were expecting them to arrive later than us that night. My family and I, tired and hungry, had to wait outside of the lobby for more than an hour for our friends. I was totally embarrassed to convey to them the very bad news. I was the one who negotiate and book this hotel. The end of this sad story was two families in Orlando, including children, at around midnight, hungry, tired and without any place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with a family”
Reviews.Author: Babydunn
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best family hotels that I can recommend. The room was very luxurious and cozy at the same time. The kitchen was very cute and had all the ammenties that you need for a weeklong vacation. I loved that it had a washer and dryer in the room. I also loved the whirlpool tub in the bathroom. The pool areas are so nice and well maintained (and very fun for all ages). My daughter loved the arcade, beach area, and activity room. The hotel also had weekly activities to participate in. The bed was also very comfortable. We also loved having a dvd player in the living room. The hotel also had it's own restaurants so you didn't have to leave it you didn't want to.

Reviews.Title: “Not handicapped friendly”
Reviews.Author: SEWARD006
Reviews.Content: We asked for handicapped condo unit. We discovered there is no handicap access to bathrooms, restaurants and no automated door openers for handicap people! The shuttle service is good, even have handicap vans, however, when the driver neglected to secure our scooter, it tipped over during a turn! Not good. Recommend this, yes, with reservation. Check your room for cleanliness before unpacking and moving in!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location to do disney!”
Reviews.Author: wk333
Reviews.Content: Read all of the reviews before visiting this resort so had some idea of what to expect including the negative comments which prompted me to write my report. Yes, they offered the timeshare presentation at check in. We said no and that was that. No pressure or hassle. Stayed in the North Village in a 2 bedroom appartment with views overlooking the golf course. Extremely spacious rooms with everything we needed including washing powder, dishwasher powder etc. Close to the North village swimming pool which was great for the kids. The resort was huge but we hired a car so that was no inconvenience. Did not use the shuttle but saw plenty around. I loved the fact that it was a cashless resort as you did not have to worry about carrying money. You get receipts for everything so I monitored spending as we went along and had no surprises at check out as some describe. Target and Publix supermarkets were conveniently close so we stocked up on essentials like beer and wine but there are plenty of eating places both in the resort and on the 192 road outside if you don't want to cook (which I certainly do not do on holiday!!). The closeness to the disney resorts was excellent yet you were a little away if you felt like chilling out away from the hustle and bustle. All in all I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who wants to explore the disney area without actually staying in a disney hotel and the restrictions and limitations that imposes.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations (A LOT)”
Reviews.Author: sandyyybelle
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Orange Lake Resort this summer for 3 nights. We got a deal for $299 for all 3 nights as long as we would attend a "tour". The resort was very nice and clean. The condo we stayed in was also clean, very large, had a nice balcony and everything that we could possibly need during our stay. Having read reviews about the resort before going, what I found the most shocking was that the "tour" was definitely not as bad as every review made it seem. We went into the "tour" knowing that it was actually a timeshare presentation and to be honest, we were both kind of nervous. The first sales guy we talked to was very nice, and told us upfront that if at the end of his presentation we said that we do not want to buy a timeshare, he will have to ask his manager to speak with us and someone after him and so on. He showed us around River Island, which was very nice, and told us about his own experience with his timeshare. At the end of his presentation we said no, we would not like to buy a timeshare. And, as promised, his manager came to try to convince us. We had to say no to him a few times and then someone else came to speak with us, but only briefly. The last person we spoke to filled out some paperwork giving us the deal we were promised (3 nights at the hotel for $299 instead of the actual price of $900) as well as $200 worth of mail in rebates to Holiday Inn hotels. Not a bad deal for 2 hours of our time, I would say. The best advice I can give to someone going into this "tour" is to know what to expect and make the best of it. Keep in mind what you are getting out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake Resort...you can do MUCH better as a single”
Reviews.Author: slowjazzOttawa
Reviews.Content: RCI recommended this resort as it was the only one available on short notice...so they said. FIRST, I made the mistake of agreeing to their "1-hour" timeshare presentation...it actually took almost 2 hours before I got my promised $50. The resort itself is massive. They have several pools and a host of restaurants , most reasonably priced. The pools at the registration desk have very liberal policies and I saw several people swimming with open sores on their skin. No shower is called for before entering the pools. I felt like I was swimming in a putrid soup, so I avoided the pools after the 1st day. This "cashless" resort forces you to maintain a strict budget by making you keep track of your recipts, so that you do not go overboard. I had a very small bill as I avoided their drinks, food supplies, and restauants, most of which are highly inflated. . This resort is about 18 minutes from Orlando main attractions so you can get to most attractions by car. You must rent a car there as it is on the highway and the shuttle is expensive as well as taxis. All in all, I disliked the place and I would not go o again with my family. The room I stayed in was dated and I found a couple of bugs in the bed...bedbugs??? I have never seen them before. But I did have bites on my derriere after the 3rd night. The entertainment was geared to kids and fairly limited for adults. Frankly, I found the place easy on the eyes but boring as hell. But if you like golf which they have you may like it.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid stay at this beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: MimmoChanty
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and the staff at the counter was very friendly. My fiance and I arrived late in the night and were very tired and the staff made it very easy for us...... the resort its self is very large and a car is recommended, hertz rental on site, the grounds are very well kept and the pool and lazy river areas are very clean. The room we stayed in was in the west village and was clean and spacious, some disturbing odours throughout the hallways on the main floor in the west village so i would recommend staying on 2nd or 3rd floor. The only problem we had was that the resort is quite expensive, $8 cocktails and $4 pops??? the restaurants were good, marketplace had good pizza............ We definatley would consider returning back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Base for Disney Holiday!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulWhiting
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews I was a little worried about the resort! HOWEVER!! No need it was excellent. Having jumped the sales hurdle on check in about time share and ownership we were given the keys to suite 86616 which is in the East village and given a map of the site, Which is huge! We made our way via the site shop for the basics and headed for the accomodation. Upon arrival we were very happy. The rooms are spacious clean and modern with everything you will need. The view over the golf course was lovely. Whilst on site we uesd the pools and lazy river and the buffett breakfast was fine and average pricing. The bar areas were good and I even got to watch the ARSENAL game. I would highly recommend this to families but shop around do not go direct you will save a lot of money. We paid just over £105 per night for a 2 bed Villa. This was on an internet booking site.

Reviews.Title: “With the opening of River Island and North Village - the West is done”
Reviews.Author: BigWash
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at Orange lake. I could not come at the fixed time. So i traded my week in and took a week two weeks earlier. Well.. They tried to give me a a downgraded version of what I owned. Then, the room I was finally assigned was not cleaned. Finally, when it was cleaned, we learned you have to stay 10 days before you have you room cleaned in the West Village. this used to happen on the 4th day. In the North Village (the Signature Series) Villa's, their rooms are cleaned 5 times in the week time person. I remember when the West village was kept up and considered great. This trip was terrible and it did not help that I had a nasty neighbor that was too lazy to walk his trash 20 feet to the trash bin. Do not buy from Orange lake! I will donate my time share here to a church!

Reviews.Title: “treaeted very well”
Reviews.Author: richie34
Reviews.Content: booked a room with booking .com for 70 a night . when we arrived at our room which was on the first floor of the check in building, it was very damp in the hallway and there were blowers running to dry the floor. went right back upstairs to customer service and they immediately upgraded us to a 2 bedroom villa in the west village. heard some bad things about booking .com and orange lake but cant find any fault with either so far.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Overall. Good Value. You could do MUCH worse!!”
Reviews.Author: jken043
Reviews.Content: If you read the reviews before you go you will have a wonderfaul time. First off. One simple NO at check in got the timeshare presentation off of the books. I then disconnected both phones in the room because I had read revies that they will call you up every day. i was never approached again on my stay about becoming an owner. The resort itself is great. They have like 9 pools and a host of restaurants which were reasonably priced and as good as any chain restaraunt out there. This is a "cashless" resort so if you are on a budget keep track of your recipts and do not go overboard. You will be just fine. Also, the Villa I stayed in had a full kitchen and washer and dreyer so we made some meals in the room and all of our laundry was cleaned by the timewe got home. This resort is within 10-15 minutes of all Orlando main attractions so that was great as well and we were able to escape disneys clutches for a little bit. LOL All in all I really liked the place and I would and probably will go again in a few years when my daughter is older. The only Cons I could think of would be that the room we stayed in was a bit dated (but still very nice) and that my wife found one spider....which you could find anywhere i guess. Do your research and you will have a great Time at Orange Lake!!

Reviews.Title: “freakishly huge resort - kids had a great time”
Reviews.Author: klloomis
Reviews.Content: We're here at day 2 of our trip at Orange Lake. We are staying in the west village in a one story villa. The rooms are large and comfortable. More than enough room for 4 adults and three kids under the age of 7. Check in was a little odd. We did an early check in via RCI and got our keys but not a room number. We were told to call back every 1/2 hour or so to see about our room. We went to lunch and called after and told our room was ready and given our room number. When we opened the door, the cleaning staff was still in the room. Tried to explain, but the staff didn't speak english, so we had a little issue there. That being said, the room was very clean when we finally got in. We had the world's hugest spider living on the front porch, but we back to a woodsy area, so it probably came from there. The cleaning crew got rid of it. Lizards are everywhere around here, and if you leave a door open you are definitely going to have visitors. This place is WAY too big for me. You have to drive to all the areas (north, south, east, west village). If you don't mind packing the car and taking a road trip, it's not so bad. The kids had a great time at the beach club pool, then played miniature golf, followed by the lazy river pool. We had some nice people who were checking out give us the 7 day fun pass that they had already paid for (not using the entire time), so it was nice. Kept busy all day without having to leave the resort. We still have a lot of resort to visit. Tomorrow, we have the timeshare ownership visit. I've been to these before, and they are most definitely annoying, but no is always no with us, and we have a few techniques to rush it along and not waste our or the salesperson's time. This is a timeshare, and I've been to quite a few. As they go, this one is very nice. I prefer a smaller resort, but the room is beautiful and the kids are having fun, so can't complain there. We're only a few minutes from Disney and some of our favorite places to visit, location's great.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyDisappointed
Reviews.Content: We booked a reservation for the first week of August/2010 in an apparently good deal price-wise. When we got there at night on August 31, 2010 we were offered a room that still had clothes from the previous occupant, the curtain was torn and I did not accept that room. When I went to management to complain and ask for my money back there was already a line of people complaining to the manager. Stay away from this place. It is a timeshare trap!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service ever!”
Reviews.Author: chrystallstar
Reviews.Content: Unless someone tells you ahead of time you don't find out until you get there that this is a NO CASH facility. Because we are from out of town we ONLY brought cash. They were very nice and accommodating AT FIRST but things quickly went down hill day two. There were cockroaches in the room, frogs and geico's. They had us go on a tour where they try to pressure to buy a timeshare and kept us there THREE hours! We finally agred to purchase a small vacation play and informed them that we ONLY had cash. They took our cash deposit stating "we'll do it for you but we need a credit/debit card on file with your driver's license to process the transaction". After much begging and pleading we agreed to pay the cash and give them my husbands old debit card (that he happened to have in his wallet) and they PROMISED not to charge the card. Needless to say they took the cash and STILL charged the card which cost us NSF fees. Since we've left there in April we have called, faxed them our bank invoice, sent letters and everything else we could think of and they will not refund our money or return our calls. As a matter of fact anytime you call there you WILL get transferred from service rep to service rep and get nowhere. They even hang up on you sometimes! I have never experienced a company that treats their customers in such a nasty and rude manor! We plan to file a grievence with the BBB and seek legal counsel!

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jack90
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orange Lake and I did my homework before going. I read a lot of trip advisor reviews which told me A) most people who complain are in the East Village B) Be firm with time share sales people C) you have to pay for tubes and activities D) Dealing with customer service is frustrating and E) there is no maid service. Well guess what? Being armed with this knowledge we had no problems at this resort. I had phoned in advance and requested either a river island unit or a renovated West village unit. Surprise!! They assigned us to the feared East Village. I asked the front desk clerk why our requests weren't honored and she told me that there were no river island units available and there was nothing she could do. Her mistake was not pretending to actually look for a better unit for us, so I went for it and insisted that they honor the reservation. I had read that people don't get timely replies from customer service so we wanted to get the right room the first time around. I also mentioned the tendancy for negative trip advisor reviews of East Village units. A half an hour later and a discussion with the manager (who I didn't think was going to help us) and they gave up. We were put in a river island unit. (as a side note, there were at least 3 units in our hallway that were vacant the whole time we were there). All of that sounds pretty negative, but we actually had a great time. The unit was fantastic, zero bugs, everything looked new and it was spacious. The kitchen was well stocked. Also, we were there for over a week and at the one week mark, they came and cleaned the room and left enough TP and soap and fresh towels to easily last a week. Condo sales people? I can't imagine why people have such a problem with this. We just took our phone off the hook in the morning and that was that. Sales people are not wandering the resort harrassing you at the pool or restaurants. the correct price for tubes is $9 per day (I have seen prices from $7 - $10). We bought 7 day passes for $50/person that got us unlimited tubes, mini golf, bungee jumping ride and the big hippo slide (which is a hoot). Not cheap and we didn't use it enough, but a much better value than paying individually for the activities/tubes. The also have a 3 day pass that was $34.95 (I think). The days do not have to be used consecutively. During our stay, we noticed that about 25% to 50% of people were floating on the tubes through the lazy river with no wristband. Not sure this is always the case. I never saw any employee take tubes away from non-payers. There were always plenty of loungers by the pool. The staff were all very nice. Especially the young woman who ran the bungee jumping ride (its for kids, not actual bungee jumping). Even the front dest manager (who was not overly friendly during our check in issue) - we saw him at Target the next day and he stopped my kids and asked how they were enjoying their vacation. Would we stay there again? tough to say. We really liked it, but I am not sure how much of our enjoyment was tied to being in a very well located unit. We like resort environments, so I am not sure we would risk being in one of the more residential type of villages. I would, however, recommend the property to anyone who gets their facts before they go. Since you are reading this, that means you!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are Fly Drive”
Reviews.Author: BatWillow68
Reviews.Content: Booked through Virgin so flight and welcome at airport excellent. Alamo car hire also great. You can see when you arrive at the resort (not signed particularly well from road side) that it is going to be a good place to stay. Security at both gates, lovely grounds very well kept, the apartments / chalets are well maintained from the outside. Check in was a little slow as they tried to sell us tickets for parks and a timeshare but just said we were not interested and that was fine. We had a 2 bedroom villa, had one double extra king size bedroom with ensuite shower and jacuzzi bath (huge bathroom) then a second twin bedroom with 2 queen size beds and a shower room next door. Plenty of cupboard and wardrobe space. I think there was abed settee as well. Large washing machine and tumble drier in small room in hall, nice to come back with all washing done! Kitchen / Dining / Sitting Room, table seated 8 so plenty of room for us 4, outlook over golf course. Kitchen very well equipped with everything you would expect, we had 2 bulbs go and a broken plastic section of the kitchen ceiling while we were there and these were fixed immediately. Inside apartment was in good order and clean, you can have it cleaned while you are there for a charge or if over 10 days it is cleaned again free of charge and this was done very well. Plenty of towels. Pool towels supplied free of charge by pools. You do need a car to get around to the Theme Parks, you could manage to get around the resort using their transport but if was not that regular. You need to drive to the Pools or restaurants. Mainly because there are not footpaths round the whole resort , only part. But if you have a hire car this is no issue. We used the Breezes restaurant and Island Grill, they were not the cheapest places you could eat in Kissimmee by any means but we thought good quality for the right price. We also used the Legacy Bar but that was more of a sports come burger bar and we had enough of burgers in the Theme parks. We also cooked some evenings in the apartment for a change. For breakfast we either ate in the room or drove to the local Dennys or Ihop (the best) for cooked breakfast, that cost around $50 for four of us and you did not need lunch as well there was so much. There is a Super Target and Publix supermarket just off site which were very convenient. Disney World is around 10 minutes and Sea World and Universal 20 minutes by car and no toll roads if you use Interstate 4. If we go back to Orlando again we will definitely stay here again but as we have done all the Parks three times now will be waiting until we have grandchildren to take!

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel, it's a timeshare trap”
Reviews.Author: jleaseburg
Reviews.Content: We thought we were staying in a nice "hotel room" and ended up in a musty smelling basement room as we were invited to listen to a supposed hour presentation on the timeshare offers for the nice 2 bedroom/living room/kitchenette room they showed us. The presentation ended up being over 3 hours long and we had to tell 4 different people that we were not interested in buying a timeshare. This place should not be listed as a hotel. The room you see when you click on their site is the nice timeshare room that you can buy, the actual room you will get is the basement hotel room. There is a lot to do on the compound, but it is not included in the room price. If you are looking for a timeshare then this would be the place for you, the timeshare rooms are very nice. But the rooms they put out for non timeshare holders are horrible. We were very disappointed in the room and the way we were treated when we declined buying a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “wonder accomodations - be an educated traveler”
Reviews.Author: jeffcarp
Reviews.Content: We returned to Orange Lake for the 3rd summer in a row. We enjoyed our stay in the West Village. We had a 2 bedroom villa. We traveled with 2 other families so we had 3 villas total. All were well furnished, comfortable and in good operable condition. Lets get a few things straight related to other reviews. This is a TIMESHARE. It is NOT a hotel. You are your own maid. You wash your own towels. You don't get your room cleaned by anyone. Timeshares have timeshare salespeople. If you don't want to listen to them then DON'T GO to the presentation. Despite some reviews here you can't be forced to go to the presentation. You go on your own free will. Tell them no and move on. I've never attended a presentation there in 3 rooms of staying. Don't accept the discounted tickets or free mini golf passes and then complain about the sales pitch. Say no. This place is very large. You may be lucky and be able to walk to the amenities or you may not. Luck of the draw. You likely will need a car. There is a free shuttle service but it is usually packed with kids. There are thousands of units spread over 3 separate villages. It really is a more like a neighborhood. Each village and each building is subject to its own remodel timeline. I'd be willing to bet that with this many units, some building and some unit is under renovation every day of the year. This means that some units will look like the website pictures and some units will look 5 years old and in need of TLC because they are. The pools and other amenities are very nice and enjoyable. Yes, there are charges for the inner tubes, mini golf etc. There are also pools that are free. You have the choice. Overall, this place is top notch and we enjoy every chance we get to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, pick another resort. Don't waste your money here.”
Reviews.Author: CSIlulu
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to leave this resort. The service is horrible, the front desk service rep don' t know what he is doing. I need to extend a day stay, the guy told me to call an extension once we get to my room and the rep should be able to give me the quote and complete the reservation over the phone. then the rep on the phone told me to go back to the front desk for help. You must spent $9 for each tub for the lazy river, you will get yelled at if you use your own. My advise, go to Hilton, they have the best service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Vacation In Florida!!”
Reviews.Author: Brittnee09
Reviews.Content: I have been Going to Orange Lake Resort In Orlando Florida since I was a baby ! My family and I go every year in May, as a child my brother and I enjoyed every day there, there are many activites for young childern to see and do ! I love my aniamls and I am going to school to become a Vet Tech so i really enjoy watching the Croc Shows that Orange Lake has. now in my teens i still have a blast , we bring a friend every year and they too have a blast . Playing mini golf is our "fav" thing to do or if you like to golf Orange lake has the best corses around !. Orange Lake is huge and has lots of place to explore! Its in a great location just down the road from The magic kindom and right next door to Animal Kingom! If Your looking for a place to vacation in Orlando Orange Lake is the place to go trust me you will have a BLAST!!!! Orange Lake Owner: Brittnee C.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!!!!! This is NOT the same Orange Lake!”
Reviews.Author: tbooker5
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviewer that said that Orange Lake is not the same as it was before Holiday Inn took over. As I write this review I'm using the free internet that is now being offered. However, after arriving at 4 in the morning in getting in bed in our unit in the North Village around 5 I was awakened by a bedbug crawling on my neck. When I woke up my wife and turned on the light there were at least 5 bedbugs of various sizes crawling all over the bed. There were also spider webs between the lamp in the living room and the coffee table. We were moved to another unit in the North Village. After returning from dinner that same day, I tried to close the drapes in the living room only to find in infestation of HUGE ROACHES!!! When we called the management and explained that we were 24 year owners and have observed a decline in customer service and cleanliness we were simply told by the manager the he simply apologized for our inconvenience. Then about an hour later my 17 year old daughter found a beetle in her bed!!! So far this is the worst vacation we have ever had!!! We are going to request another move in the morning but at this point, I have very little confidence that things are going to get any better. This will definitely be our last trip to Orange Lake Resort after 23 years of ownership which doesn't seem to mean anything to the Holiday Inn Club management.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Would definitely return!!”
Reviews.Author: mamact68
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Holiday Inn Club Vacation, Orange Lake. Had a wonderful time! Did a lot of research prior to going and booking and knew ahead of time about the time share pitch and that this wasn't a hotel so didn't expect daily housekeeping. Checked in by Flo at the front desk and was not pressured at all about time share presentation. One question was asked if we wanted to attend, I said no and that was it. Made sure to disconnect the phones in the room so we weren't bothered at all by early morning sales calls. Check in was smooth and quick, I already knew about the extra daily room charges as I read about it here and also on Holiday Inn's website. This is a cashless resort so they put a $200 hold on your credit card when you check in. If you don't want to use a credit card, you can buy gift cards in different denominations starting at $25.00. We stayed by River Island (room 81705 - view of the parking lot :( . Room was beautiful, newly furnished, clean, lots of space, airy and bright with flat screen TV in living room. Nice jacuzzi in the master bath to soak in after a long day at the parks. Loved having kitchen available to make meals in and full sized washer/dryer. They supply you with detergent for 3 washes, but you'll need to buy paper towels, extra toilet paper, dishwashing detergent and sponge. Target and Publix located nearby to get supplies. There were 5 of us staying in the room and we had plenty of space. River Island kept us busy and entertained. You can get a poolside massage, go down the lazy river (be prepared to pay $9.00 per day per person for a tube, but you really don't need one to go down the lazy river and you can find loose tubes just hanging around. There are 2 sections where the employees hand out the tubes and sometimes they check to see if you have a blue wristband on. Just keep your hand in the water when you go past and move quickly!), play mini-golf, volleyball, go down the Hippo (very large inflatable water slide) or just relax in a hammock. Try to go early to get seats under an umbrella. Lots of chairs available, just limited shady spots and umbrellas or you can splurge and rent a cabana for the day. We ate at Anchors for lunch, prices very reasonable. Kids meals cost $5.00 with drink and fries. We pretty much just ordered kids meals for the adults too (hamburger, hot dogs or chicken fingers). Had dinner at River Island Grilling. Food was just okay, gator a little chewy, sushi good, horrible warm lava cake! Should have just gone to Starbucks for dessert! Two teenage boys (13 and 18) spent time in the arcade during rainstorm. $20 for 1000 tickets + bonus tickets seemed very reasonable until you saw that each game cost minimum of 45 tickets to play, average game used 90 tickets. At least it kept them busy for a while. There is a lake with a small beach by West Village where you can rent paddle boats, Sea-doos, jet-skis, paddle boards, mini boats etc....Would have done the paddle boats ($20 for one hour) but didn't want to be in the middle of the lake during the thunderstorm. This is a huge resort so you do need a car to get around. There is a shuttle service which they say runs every 15-20 minutes. If you plan on using the shuttle, make sure you bring an umbrella to cover your head from the sun while you wait. There are scattered benches throughout the resort where you wait for the shuttle, but they're out in the open, no cover. Overall, everyone was very impressed with the facility and had a wonderful time! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the $$$$!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYGIA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Orange Lake because we were traveling with family and young children and got a GREAT deal on Expedia.com. The rooms were a GREAT size (2BR 2BA villa) for family of 4 (but says sleeps up to 8, but I don't think it would be comfortable with more than 4-5) Full kitchen was a bonus, so we could get foods that kids liked, and the washer/dryer was probably the biggest perk!! They even give you 3 boxes of laundry detergent to get you started. The Publix is on the property so you can get your groceries right when you get there. Drawbacks... we made the MISTAKE of going on the Tour and they said it was going to be 90 minutes which it was over THREE HOURS! We considered buying the timeshare, but that was really a ridiculous amount of time for us to be there with two children under 6 in tow... if we had known it was going to take so long, we would have brought food, and things to occupy the kids. Turned us off the the timeshare idea, and we didn't buy. Other than that, the hotel was great! Two waterparks for the kids, hippo slide, a trampoline, mini golf... would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort. Rude Sales people. Mediocre Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: AnnualFamilyVacation
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, which was approximately thirty minutes early, I had the ability to check in at that time, but was informed that the room was not ready (we stayed in the East Village)and should receive a call when it was. I sat in my car for an hour (In the FL heat) and never received a phone call so I called the front desk and was told that my unit was ready and was given the unit number. When I entered the room, the cleaning employee was still in there cleaning the room. I drove back over to the West Village to find out approximately when my room would be ready since the employee who was cleaning the room did not understand english. At that time, I was told that by the time I get there (to the room), It should be cleared. Although It was when I returned, the overall time spent waiting for my room in the FL heat was 90 minutes. So, my recommendation on how to improve the resort:... make sure the rooms are ready at check in time. We get into the room and it's beautiful. I was totally satisfied with it. That night, we order pizza. Not what I'm used to but it was edible. Breezes was a good restaurant. We had a waitress from the Phillippines who was fantastic. The second night we went to Breezes the service wasn't as good. We had breakfast at the River Island Grill and the buffet was good and the serer was quite friendly. At the lazy river, we sat around the pool and enjoyed ourselves for hours....until we were told that due to an unscheduled cleaning, we needed to vacate the pool. Someone had pooped in the pool!!! NASTY! During my presentation, I had the pleasure of meeting Maria from Florida, who was my salesperson. The presentation went well (although it lasted 4 hours) Because timesharing is new to me and the purpose for me being there was to understand the business and to see if this was indeed the right choice for my family and me. I was not prepared to buy on the spot and as I had mentioned to Maria in the presentation, I like to have an opportunity to pray on making such a spontanious decision. Maria left and brought her manager to the table, Jorge from New Jersey. I explained to him as well that I would like to pray on the situations since that is the way I make all of my decisions. He RESPECTED that. After I told him that I would not buy, he sent Wanda from Florida to my table. Now Wanda is quite an animated creature, who appears to be Korean. When she introduced herself, she said that she represents the "head bosses" of the resort. She askes me a few questions and I gave her the same answer I gave Jorge and Maria...that I would prefer to pray on it. At this time, Wanda began to "poke fun" of my faith by saying "God does not control your every move! He does not help you with EVERY decision!" At this time, my husband walks away. He is angry. I have a little more patience, so I chose to sit there and listen to her criticize my Lord - Jesus Christ...She went on and on...she belittled Christ so badly that all I could do is sit there and ask God to forgive her because her ignorance had come to a head and at this point she looks stupid. After all the "rucus", Mark from Canada overheard what was going on and came over and apologized for her actions. He genuinely expressed concern and assisted in making the situation better. Because of the experience I had with Wanda, I find it diffucult to refer anyone or to purchase timeshare from a company who shows disrespect and are persecuted because of their Christian faith. Since all of my friends are Christians, I wouldn't have any to refer. My goal one day is to purchase time share from a reputable company who will respect my Christian faith. If Wanda is the face of Orange Lake then Orance Lake is not the place for me. OH I ALMOST FORGOT....be prepared for them to place a $250.00 hold on your credit card for incidentals...they don't tell you that until you check in.

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING ORLANDO RESORT”
Reviews.Author: vacationdreams10
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort - but BEWARE - it's a Time Share. Check in is long and tedious. After an 8 hour drive we arrive at Orange Lake tired with two kids that were not feeling well after the long drive and they could not find my reservation. I made my reservations through Expedia and I had all the confirmation information but that didn't seem to matter - while Corporate was looking for my reservation I had to hear about all the amentities and the cost of each - BUT if I took the tour everything is discounted and free theme park tickets were avaiable. When I was pretty firm that I wasn't budging on the tour, they instantly found my reservation. The resort is beautiful but you are nickeled and dimed for everything. It is a cashless resort so the end result may surprise you. We stayed for four nights and never left the grounds. It is beautiful and well cared for. The annoyance of the phone ringing every morning trying to persuade you to take a tour grew tiresome - but if you could let that get by you, it's worth dealing with. Food was very good, entertainment good and tons to do - AT A COST. We chose Express Check-Out. Just drop the key at the gate house and leave. The bill is mailed to you since they already have your credit card on file. We decided to go this way since we needed to get back on the road and didn't want to go back to the registration desk and be drilled about their tours. My family loved this resort and so did I. The time share thing is annoying. If people are interested they are going to take the tour, if they are not interested, just give up. They are never going to buy anything and you are wasting everyone's time.

Reviews.Title: “Never AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationuser
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and enjoyed it. Now that Holiday in vacations is onsite service has gone DOWN. When I booked online I asked to be on a high floor I was told their booked to capacity and no other rooms were available. I hung around the lobby and over heard other guest getting the rooms which I was told were not available. I tried to check out and was told I would not be refunded but the magically found me a room in the East village which was not available 25 minutes ago. I said no to any tour to get discount on tubes for their so called water park. I stayed in building 88000 in the east village, I killed 6 large bugs in five days my 9 year old was scared to sleep in her room. At 9am every morning the phone begins to ring. The room decor was atleast 10 years old , the bed was Very uncomfortable the living room furniture smelled. I witnessed one of the house keeping staff sleeping on the luggage cart with her shoes off. STAY AWAY from this place, I am using their free internet to write this review .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations, Nice watersports, Great value”
Reviews.Author: daniles
Reviews.Content: The accomodations in West Village and the watersports on the lake are fantastic. My family and I had a wonderful time. I plan to go back. I would not advise going to the timeshare presentation unless you plan to buy. They do a very hard sell and kept us there hours, talking to various sales agents. I was told it would take 1 hour, but we were there 4 hours. Overall, I had a nice time and so did my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away - Enjoyed The Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: pghfootballfan
Reviews.Content: Well I must first off say after reading "all" the bad reviews from others I was hesitate about staying; however what a "great" choice to check it out for myself. I have lived in Florida for 10+ yrs. and never knew this hotel existed(what a hidden tresure). This was a "4" day get away for myself, boyfriend and my "2" teenage boys. I did my review prior to staying so I was prepared for the "deposit" ($250.) at check-in ( I put this on my credit card and after checking-out it was refunded within 24hrs) this deposit can be used towards purchases made while @ the resort - yes the resort is "cashless" (except for arcade), which was not a big deal because we didn't have to worry about carrying cash w/ us everywhere. (You can use debit, credit card or charge to your room) When we arrived check-in went rather fast; yes they did try to schedule us for "Timeshare" Tour but I mentioned I was not interested and it was a done deal (no pressure). "NOTE" - this is a "timeshare" property - not and "all exclusive resort" ( the villas are just like homes and you do need the basic's for your stay). We stayed @ the "Westside" clubhouse, the room was very clean and was in a "perfect" location (standard hotel room - 2 beds, kitchenette, huge bathroom). The resort is huge and very much spread out between the different villages(being from the area I did have a car; which I chose to park) they do provide shuttle service which is "hit / miss" we got lucky a few times and didn't have to wait and then at "River Island" we did have to wait 15-20 min; they will drop you off where needed, so the shuttle service was not as bad as some have mentioned. From what I observed "East Village" is the oldest and furthest away (did not even visit ) "River Island" is the newest village and is set back from the other villages (this area has the "lazy river" and other water slides - there is a $9 charge for rental of the floats, but we chose not to purchase and just walked/swam the area (others doing the same) "North Village" also had a water slide, but also had basketball & volleyball nets in the pool which the boys enjoyed and made several new friends. "West Viilage" is the first village from the entrance as well as the regristration clubhouse, this is where we found to be the most happening (besides "River Island") there are "2" pools one is the main pool it is rather big and can be crowded the other one is smaller and set-away and seemed to not have as may kids in it. The beach is also at this village where there is water activities (tubing, jet ski's) and sand volleyball. There is a resturant/bar "Breezes" that the food was very good and priced within reason they had entertainment in the evening for the children as well as the adults, we found out that you can purchase a "souvnier cup" with a frozen drink ($7.50) or beer ($6) and refills could be done during your stay (frozen $5 - beer $4)they also have one for soda's; not sure of the price though. There is also a "pizzeria" and the pizza was good as well as priced fair. Over all our stay was "great" the boys made new friends and we will difintely go back; there was plenty to do and never left the resort. Just note: this is not a place for someone looking for a "quite" get-away there are alot of families and kids through-out. Check-out was fast and simple (we had no added expenses) the staff was very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it anymore”
Reviews.Author: bletizia52
Reviews.Content: Dont get me wrong,I have been to orange lake many times in past, before this, was last year and 2006, before they started their renevation. But anyways,Recently my stay at orange lake 2010 with my wife was just OK, And I say this in the best possible way. So much has changed since many years ago. Always cash was allowed, not anymore cash is not allowed, only debit, credit card, or room key. another business tactic to get you to spend more money that YOU don't have. I dont know about others, but i came with a set amount to spend, and i didnt get anything on site, the prices are sickening. When me and my wife were packing our stuff getting ready to leave, a cleaning lady used master card key for room and never knocked or said "room cleaning", they barged in, thank god chain lock was on and were both dressed, what if we were having sex at that moment?.. Just a scenario.. but they paced the outside of door back and forth and said " arent you guys leaving?".. like how rude can you be??.. was not even close to check out and wanted us out. and i came to conclusion that people here are only good for money, but not the service provided to them, and OH!, another thing, yea, the shuttle may be helpful, but you say you wanna go to publix to driver.., well have fun getting off and walkin 10 minutes past main gate to shopping center. Not so much activities for adults, only children activities, it is a nice resort, but they gotta do a late night thing for adults, such as dancing and partying and put the kiddies to bed. People who vacation here are nasty as well.., im from ny and im more polite then these people.. some people were raised in jungles the way they act. I remember before they renevated, they had a HUGE olympic size swimming pool and a baby pool on the side of it, strictly for kids.; Now they made one size and lowered the amount of feet from 8ft to 4 ft and shallow end is a fountain thing now. worth it to buy your own food, and rooms in clubhouse provide you without a frying pan to cook your own burgers or meat, another tactic to get you to buy a burger for 8 dollars and a little less than a handful of fries. All in all, my stay was relaxing, would recommend relaxing here, but minus the kiddies that stay here. It would so much better, thats why disney is down the road, or not till the kids are teenagers and responsible, then its a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Average all the way, won't be going back.”
Reviews.Author: vacaymommy
Reviews.Content: There was nothing extraordinary about this place other then acreage it sat on. We flew there from Michigan and didnt plan on leaving the resort so we didnt bother renting a car. We took a cab there and planned on using the free shuttle service the resort supplies, to make our way around pool to pool and back to the condo. The shuttle service is my biggest complaint. They tell you it runs every "15 minutes". Truth is, it can be longer then that and you're left waiting at the shuttle stops, baking in the sun, theres no unbrellas or coverage whatsoever while you wait. And sometimes the shuttle will either pass by without stopping or will stop and yell out to you.."Where to??!!" And alot of times, that particular shuttle isn't going to your destination but youre promised, very rudely most of the time, that the next one is on its way.....moooore waiting!! Its very frustrating especially when waiting with hot children. My next complaint is the price of everything on this resort. Average food, average shops, average everything and yet its over priced ridicuously. IF you bring your own car, take full advantage of the full kitchen your room provides and get some groceries to make your own meals. Its a "cashless" resort so they want you to charge everything to your room. With all intentions of keeping track, we were still SHOCKED to see that our bill after a weeks stay was double what we thought it would be. Keep your receipts!!! Do not, under no circumstances, attend the "tour". They promise you a 60 minute tour to learn about the time share. We sat for 3 hours listening to some salesman try and guilt us into buying into it. Teling us how we "deserved" this and our children did too. The more no's you give them, the more salesmen they will bring to you to try and close the deal. And you'll be amazed how they will start out at one price then after a few no's, the price will drop 90%...at least ours did. Its awful and uncomfortable and not worth the waste of your vacation time. The beds are uncomfortable and the pillows are huge. My kids couldnt even use them. The rest of the 3 bedroom condo we had was clean and everything we needed. The staff, for the most part, was rude. The pools are great, lazy river gets really crowded and you can't relax on your tube. One thing I didnt like about that was no tubes or flotation devices were allowed in the river except for the rentable ones the resort provides. They come in 2 sizes, small and large...large is ok for an adult but the small ones are not suitable for children under 7. I wouldnt recommend this place mostly because of the rude staff and shuttle service but if you have your own car, I can see where this would be a much more enjoyable vacation. There is an overpriced Publix nearby, dont buy groceries there. Go to the Super Target across the Street, way cheaper. And No matter what they promise you as a gift for attending the tour, dont do it!!! Not even the "7 day pass" for free tubes which you pay $40 up front for but get refunded in the end. Its not worth it. Besides, half the time, tubes nobody is using are floating around for grabs anyway. We had our wristbands checked one time in 7 days to see if we actually paid for a tube.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: savrub
Reviews.Content: I've got to say after i booked i saw some of the reviews here and became concerned. After i arrived all my concerns went away... The place was GREAT! Check in was fast and friendly. Our Villa was clean and furnished with everything a family could need, it looked new. The pool areas were awesome, the lazy river was great ($9 a day for tubes way too much) all the activites were great. You dont need to leave this place for anything! I highly recemmend it! The food @ Breezes was great as well as the pizza place. Only thing i did not like is having to drive to all the areas because the resort is way too big, they have shuttles but they take a while.

Reviews.Title: “It's Huge, It's for kids, It's Really Huge”
Reviews.Author: jackkaufl
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in (after driving over a mile to check in) and another mile to our 3rd floor condo, we found the room not quite ready. The bed in the master suite was not made. One day later we gave up on the icemaker but it was fixed within four hours. Food is acceptable about a 3.5 out of 5. The condo we were in was about 1500 square feet, very roomy. The big waterpark was a favorite of the kids. This place is huge and you need a car to get around while still on the grounds. They will call you every day to try to talk you into attending a timeshare presentation. Within 4 miles are many restaurants. Several golf courses. Beware the extra fees NOT quoted when you make reservations. Fees add about 20-25% to the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and need a coat of paint”
Reviews.Author: Dwilde1
Reviews.Content: Not a terrible hotel although a little musty within the villa. Beds and pillows not up to normal holiday inn standard. Villas have everything you could want and resort has all ameneities. Would I stay again..... No I don't think I would but this is only because I think it needs updating from the 80s/90s decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place !”
Reviews.Author: Nadi_79
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place!Just visit few days ago.UNFORTUNATELY, me and my family didn't have enough time to see it all and I am sure we missed a lot:(:( I really like this place.The rooms are beautiful ,very comfy,very clean.The bathroom shine .There are only few things that I don't like.My room was inside the building(we stay in room with two queen beds with kitchenette),so I see the front desk.Personally I hate rooms without balcony or windows allows you to have some fresh air and sunlight .The beds are sooooo comfortable ,I slept like a baby :):)For a short stay you will have everything you need.Just so you know at the front desk they are very nice,but too pushy to convince you get involved in time sharing offers.He make me say to him this "Look,I said No and that no will not become yes " ....with the smile :):)But he was keep trying and I don't like this.For those two little things I am not giving them excellent.Good luck to everybody.:):)

Reviews.Title: “not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: blackmist
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 5 night stay at Orange Lake- We booked back in April for our July Vacation. The deal was too good to pass up. Read all the reviews after booking and became very skeptical. When we arrived we had a small scare when our reservation could not be found. Manny at the desk was very polite and friendly. Eventually all was straightened out. No pressure with time shares here. Our room in the West Village was clean and spacious. No bugs or snakes as I had read in other reviews. Perfect for a family of three. The grounds are beautiful. The pools in the West Village were crowded, many teens, but the lazy river with its pools were better. We did get frequent daily calls but didn't answer knowing we would be pressured into the time share mumbo jumbo. In all the staff was polite and friendly. As with any where else there are some exceptions. People who work in customer service sometimes forget what their job is. During the only social hour we attended (they have these every afternoon) we walked around meeting with other guests. My son asked for some ice cream. It seemed they had been passing it out all hour. The young lady which had three bowels in front of her rudely stated "social hour is over" We extended our vacation by three days, and when we asked if we could have a room for two more nights we were told no because they were too booked up. Now to let you know, this resort is huge with many ,many, many rooms. I only wonder if maybe we were told no because we were unwilling time share participants. So all in all we did get what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE!!!CAN'T SAY ENOUGH. CLEAN,CLEAN, CLEAN!!! 10 out of 10!”
Reviews.Author: vin316_99
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying this. First this is NOT, I repeat NOT a HOTEL PERIOD. This is a Timeshare Resort do not expect to go there and not have them try to get you to buy it is their JOB just like MC' D's they flip burgers, well guess what here they sell vacations. DUH. Second the people below with the negative reviews must have went somewhere else and wrote a wrong review. I went with my wife and a 10 yr old, 9 yr old girls and a 3 1/2 yr old boy. I am an owner and this is my 1St time here, the timeshare was bought on EBAY for $255 yes that is correct $255.00. People thought I was nuts, but I did my research. I got in late and checked in at about 11:45 PM, MARK from NY was great, he checked us in. I entered the lobby and there were people in there checking in, but the lobby director looked at my paperwork and said "Oh your an owner, right this way sir" and directed me to an open associate (Mark). He told me he would give me 5 passes for my whole family for mini golf and tube rentals and the hippo slide for free to go on a tour for 60 Min. I said yes because I haven't seen the whole resort (just pics) and the passes that he gave me were $50 each do the math. We went and saw Judy and she took us on a tour and we saw some newer rooms that had been built recently. We spent about 90 min and it wasn't high sales pressure especially when they found out what I paid. I had a Villa in the West Village and it was remodeled and it was CLEAN. The pools were great and they all had plenty of TOWELS. There was security on duty all DAY and NIGHT at the gates checking for your parking ticket. The ppl that say there is no security or maintenance staff on duty are NUTS or BLIND. There was maintenance working all the time, working on the grounds and everything. Lets get to the price of things, I am not sure where everyone is from but I am from NY and the price of things were cheaper or right around the same at the resort. Food was good, my kids wanted to eat there at Breezes Bar+Grill again and again, kids I think ate for $4.99 or less and for all the families reading this I know you can't beat that. Know what to expect, this is a CASHLESS resort, it all goes on your room card so keep track. They have 10 pools, 9 restaurants 4 golf courses and 2 mini golf's. A long relaxing lazy river and if you do not want to pay $7 per person a day for the tubes, then travel down the lazy river and scarf a vacant tube for yourself and pay $0 its that easy. They don't allow you to bring tubes into the lazy river for obvious reasons, they would like to sell them to you so don't be stupid and write a review saying "I can't believe they wouldn't let me bring in my own tube", it's like asking McDonalds if you can bring in your own grill and fire up some hamburgers and just use their chairs to sit in. LOL The resort is HUGE, but the shuttles were always going. I had a rental car, but always saw shuttles running. They have a grocery store onsite, a Disney center, a rental car site at check in, you can check out tennis racquets, basketballs, volley balls, movies and games you name it. It is true what others say, you do not need to leave this place to have fun. I took my family out to Disney and the first day the kids were asking when they could go back to the pools while we were at Animal Kingdom. This was my family's first time on a plane/down to FL/to Disney and to see where my crazy self bought property. I also want to say I checked in in about 15 min, not 1 hr like others state. Take it for what it is worth, but if you are a family I would stay in a renovated WV Villa over any of the high-rises to include the new ones. I drive into my own driveway, get out with my groceries and walk in my front door you can't beat that. Staff was great, helpful and courteous from suggesting some nice tropical drinks by the pools to where things were located. You have any questions feels free to ask me. If your thinking about buying or staying at this resort, don't listen to some of these idiots. Obviously everything can't always be pristine perfect, but my stay was and I stayed from 7-14 to 7-24-2010. The resort will deliver food also to your door.

Reviews.Title: “The cleaning service needs updated”
Reviews.Author: jorie56
Reviews.Content: The Villa we stayed in was a little not cleaned as I thought professional people would do. I found coloring papers behind the couch, the lamp shade was crumpled, the screen door was broken as if kicked, the veranda table was filthy, (I had to by brillo pads to clean it), the comforter on the bed has blood on it. The people who were upstairs, their children kept throwing trash in front of our door and a lot of unruley teenagers, and my son's ball got stolen at the pool. The maid service thought we were leaving before our stay was over, they do not update their cleaning service books very well. If you stay here it is a ok place, but, beware of the cleaning staff and watch out for the teens.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! AWESOME! AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmom08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our annual trip to Orlando for 4 days and 3 nights. The resort was awesome. The condo was clean and spacious. My children especially enjoyed the lazy river and the water slide on site. Note - There is a fee for inner tubes for the lazy river. There is no way to avoid it.
