I thought I would by purchasing my own before we went, but they would not let us use them. Also, the food around the pool is expensive. I will bring a cooler next time for my kids. This is not a hotel, so we didn't get housekeeping. I was aware of that since we always stay in this type of resort when we come. You just have to make sure that everyone picks up after themselves, and it will be fine. We stayed in the East Village, and it was great! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: PicklesMom
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this beautifiul resort. It is HUGE! I read quite a few of the reviews, and if you do your research, you will be fine. If you do not want to tour the property for the timeshare presentation, be very emphatic about that at check in, and when they make that first call to your room. Also, they will hold $250 on your check card, or charge your credit card, but that is because it is a no-cash resort. We checked in on the 18th around 5PM and it was very smooth with no delays. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom villa in the North Village overlooking the golf course with a screened in porch. It was great. The only drawback was them cutting the grass at 5AM, but not really a big deal. The villa was stocked well and they provided enough towels for at least 10 people. They provide some detergent for washing clothes, for the dishwasher, and for washing dishes by hand. The first two days we did not leave the property except to go to the SuperTarget. The pools are great, and the staff is friendly. When the temperature reached 98 degrees, the fruity drinks from the bar were worth the $9 (keep the glass, and the drinks are $7). We played miniature golf, and when we couldn't get to the second 18 holes, we were given a raincheck to come back later that day. One note, the pool lifeguards are great. There was a missing child for a very short time, and they immediately closed the slide in River Island, got all the children out of line until the child was located which happened by the time all the kids got out of line and got into the pool. We never felt our child was not safe there. The Disney Parks, several restaurants, and gift shops are close to the resort. We did not want to leave, but we will return. We have recommended this resort to everyone we have talked to since our return.

Reviews.Title: “Our 1st trip to Florida”
Reviews.Author: AKVSMom
Reviews.Content: So first I would like to start my review with yes this is a TIMESHARE Resort, not a hotel !! We knew this and why because my husband researched this resort and bought a timeshare on Ebay for $ 225.00 . Yes that is $ 225.00 , a resale. His review is all so on here too. So I have read all the bad reviews on no house keeping and how noisy and dirty and poor service and this and that. Everyone has their own opinion and I know this. But our trip was nothing more than PERFECT !!!! Our flight from Hartford Conn. was delayed and then had to land to fix a filter so our flight took almost 5 hrs instead of 2 and half. So I was expecting the worst showing up at 11 30 pm. After reading all the reviews that it took forever to check in. My husband and 2 girls were in and out in 15 to 20 minutes. Then we took off to our Villa in West Village and let me tell you our place was beautiful. Everything was clean, there was enough towels and starter stuff for us. We knew we needed to buy food and extra things and also knew there was going to be no house keeping, and why, research !!!!!! I had no problem doing our laundry and cleaning up after ourselves. Since we were already owners they offered us a tour so we did go to the presentation and took a tour because it was our first visit and there and wanted to see and learn where everything was, there was no pressure at the end to buy into anything more than what we had. They were really nice and took no for an answer . The only messages on our phone was about the resort and what it offered that day and they were all prerecorded . They gave us our free passes for mini golf and the tubes for the Lazy river for taking the tour. We ate at Breezes which was very good and the staff and service was excellent. They also deliver too !!! Everywhere we went we saw maintenance people, cleaning people, SECURITY driving around and there was Security and all booths every time we came and went. Disney parks are an easy access. We heard but didn't see fireworks that was okay we saw them at Magic Kingdom. The kids loved the pools . We swam until 11pm one of the nights . Everyone was nice and friendly, it was nice seeing families having fun and laughing and enjoying their vacation. It was out 1st trip to Disney also so staying here made it perfect. The kids got to see a Gator show and hold a gator !!!! We ordered pizza from the market and it was also good. Everyone says it's expensive but we are from New York so the prices were the same for us and plus we used our coupons from the resort, which saved us $$ too. There were always plenty of towels at the pools expect when it downed poured for 20 minutes due to the Storm Bonnie. It was also cool you could just use your room card to purchase food and anything that you wanted so you didn't have to bring your purse or wallet. I loved every minute we were there and can't wait till next July !!!!!!!! The only regret that I have was I wish we stayed more at the Resort than running around all the Disney parks, but hey we will be back next year so not to worry !!!!!!!! Check in is 4pm checkout is 10am

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: vacation-ISTA2010
Reviews.Content: This place needs to be shut down. The housekeeping is horrible. The 1st room I checked in to was not clean- the kitchen floor had food stuck on the floor and had not even been swept let alone mopped. The refrigerator had hair in it and the ice maker had run over indicating that no one had even cleaned it from the last guests. The living room had other obvious trash on the carpet- I found a food wrapper behind the sofa. The bathroom had random hair all around the sink, in the stand-up shower and on the floor. The master bedroom had hair on the bedside table and dust bunnies and other items of trash on the carpet. We weren't traveling with kids so we instanty knew that the broken silly band on the floor was NOT ours. The housekeeping supervisor came in to clean the unit. Later that night, my sis in law discovered bugs when she pulled the bed back. We assumed they were bedbugs. HORRIBLE! We made them move us immediately. The 2nd unit- There was also random hair in this room- on the bedside table again, in the toilet and in the refrigerator again. We found a bloody towel tucked beside the hot water heater in a closet. We had the housekeeping supervisor to clean this room as well and change all of the beds while we watched. This only a snippet of what we experienced at this so-called premier resort. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THAT ANYONE CHOOSE THIS AS THEIR HOME RESORT. NEITHER WILL I RECOMMEND THAT YOU STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Cold people....Will not return ...”
Reviews.Author: Harrinsue1980
Reviews.Content: Dear Hubby and I went to Orange Lake (will not call it Holiday Inn -we have been going there since 1985) on July 14 we checked .. around 12:00 pm we spoke with Michael at the desk. He was so nice and helpful until we kept saying NO to the tour... than... he got very cold. I had asked him if our unit was ready he said he will call and find out. Michael gave us our keys, map to the place and ignored us the rest of the time. Did not call and when I asked him again he ignored us. So we took our chances. We drove to our unit -86261- Great view of the fireworks -Disney was right in front of us.. It was ready.. brought our things in.. and off to go food shopping... very easy access to Publix, Target and there is a Wal-mart about 5 minutes down 192 off of 27. Came back and went to the pools... West Pool.. water in the pool was ok.... North Pool ... a little cooler but River Island very warm... By the way.. Frogs every where ...Road, walkways and even the pool areas...alive and dead.. was not cleaned up. Everything WAS going good until.... Some one vandalized my new car..It got egged (I guess Security does not drive around much or not at all....) When I went to customer care in the main building, in my egged car (using up my windshield washer fluid) I parked it right under the awning where people park to check in at 9:30 am. I went to the front desk and asked to speak to a Manager I was taken to Customer Care... I spoke with Security and filled out a report.. Customer Care was good until I spoke to the supervisor--N-- (because management was busy, the customer care took my phone and my husbands cell number and was told that management would call us when he got back... but never did so I spoke to ... N...)She was cold said she would credit my account $10.00 to get it washed... I told her I cant see out of my windshield and I did not have anymore fluid to clean it.. so she said she would call someone to clean it for me. She called and the person who was suppose to come could not get up there until around 1:00 pm ... so I was in the main building just waiting for someone to even acknowledge me and tell me they are sorry or even can I get you anything.. Nothing... So mind you the egg is still on my car and it is 90 degrees and getting hotter...(Egg takes paint off of car when sitting) .. While I was waiting a guest came up to me and asked if that happened here and I said it sure did and he said he was going through the same thing door bell ringing and knocking, when he would go to answer the person or people would run away..... also another guest (an OWNER) told me ...while in customer care, she had fruit flies in both of her units... and another guest said she cleaned her own place because they told her that her place was clean and it was not.. she also washed all the dirty towels and sheets and went to target and bought more... she waited for over an hour also.. but when someone who stays at there place all the time and has paid using those they sure bend over to help them out... and gets an upgrade...to Signature.. Anyway...back to my car...while I was waiting for this person to come clean my car the manager came to me and asked what happened .. while I was taking pictures of where all the egg was... roof, hood, windshield and wipers and the whole wipers even in the cracks where the vents where so down inside as well...He said that they were not responsible to what had happened and that they were cleaning the car out of there own pocket and asked be to calm down and relax...He also was a cold person... and went on his way..said he would see me when he got back.. He came back and did not even acknowledge me until after this when I asked to see him again ... after what had happened... Well 1:00 pm came and pass .. N came out of the restroom and said oh your back .. I said back from where I have been here since you told me the person who will clean your car will be here around 1:00 I have not left. She forgot about me... I was so upset I started crying because I knew what was going to happen... egg + heat + car = paint..well a lovely young lady saw that I was crying and gave me some tissue... thank heaven for her. That's when I asked to speak to the manager... I went in to his office and again he kept telling me that they were not responsible for this... I kept telling him it happened on there property so really they are.... Well after I started to cry ... he went out to speak to .. N...and they gave me a certificate to get something eat.. finally after around 5-10 minutes someone came to get my car... around 1:30 pm while my car was being cleaned I went to get something to eat and drink.. still upset.. while I was there a worker at Breezes told me that there has been people breaking into cars there and other things happening there which he could not say but you get the picture... While I was walking back I get a phone call telling me my car is doubled park and I needed to move it or it will be towed... can you believe this...I saw my car was back and I was told to go check it out... I did and guess what and nice chip in the paint where the egg was... I KNEW IT...and to top it off again they -N and some other women who I never met-...kept telling me that they are not responsible for this...and this other women told me oil was spilled all inside her car which was brand new as well... OK... so anyway N said she would have a letter for me for my insurance so I can get this chip taken care of... Now ... the next morning.. I get 4 phone calls in a row so on the fourth one I picked it thinking it would be Customer Care... N...Not.. it was them trying to get me to take a tour... I told the girl after what happened yesterday and you want me to take a tour... I laughed and told her everything and also told her how cold the people in this place was... and I will never return....NEVER... Never got that letter from Security about my car ... so now I have a chip in my car from my vacation...

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS A HIGH PRESSURE TIMESHARE SCAM!!! BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheBrewFamily
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend with the family. The Hotel made me book a '90 minute' presentation of the resort. THIS WAS A HIGH PRESSURE TIMESHARE SCAM. I would never reccomend this place to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE ROCKS”
Reviews.Author: chrispy08
Reviews.Content: I would hope the management of olcc reads these reviews and clamp down on the timeshare pitch because that was the only downfall to the trip. I figured I would be immune to it because I'm an owner but that's not the case. The resort itself is huge but the shuttle will take you anywhere for free. Runs every 15 min. Lots to do, there's actually no need to leave the resort! We swam in the pools, mini putted, played in the arcades, ordered pizza to our room and ate out in the restaurants. All these people who complain about the costs...this is not an all inclusive resort. You would have to paty for mini-putt anywhere! Our 2 bedroom villa is in the West villiage and has been renovated. Flat screen tv in the livingroom, tv in each bedroom. New kitchen stove and microwave all was great. Staff was responsive to any problems we had..jacuzzi had tripped the breaker and was fixed within 1/2 hour of phone call, safe batteries were dead and also fixed within 1/2 hour. I am counting down the days until we return in March 2011. I have travelled all over the world,Sandles resorts, Rui, and other big chain resorts and OLCC can hold their own against any of them.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: kykatt
Reviews.Content: The complex is LARGE.. maybe TOO LARGE. They run shuttles to their Pool complex but It takes forever for it to show up.They have two slides, but one was not even open when we were there. We were in the main building.. Mattresses were soft... WAY SOFT. They did not have a vacuum in our room. Kitchen equipment was very outdated. Bathroom needed a serious remodel. Bright spot... Lake was pretty and the washer and Dryer was free to use.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel over croweded with uncontrolled and unsupervised kids”
Reviews.Author: Krautie
Reviews.Content: When we first entered our room, the entire room smelled like sour clothes that had been left in a washing machine. When we discovered it was coming from the bathroom, the shower curtain was sour and smelled the entire room with this odor. There were so many kids in the pool during the day and at night, that the pool was basically unaccessible to adults. The kids in the pool were unsupervised and uncontrolled. You could not go in the hot tub because there was over 12 kids in hot tub at night. The kids were so loud in the pool at night, that we had to raise the volume of the television just to drown the kids out. There was approximate 35-40 kids in the pool at the time of our visit at any given time. I am all for kids having a good time, but they took over the hotel and the hotel staff didn't do anything about it. My fiance woke up and looked out the balcony window at our truck in the parking lot, and there was a bag of garbage left in the back of the pick up, an empty case of water, an empty case of tropicana and empty box of beer. We had to call down to the office twice for them to go take it out of our truck. It was ridiculous. I've stayed at this hotel before and it was a great experience. I would recommend this hotel to people, but I would recommend you ask before you make your reservation if the hotel is expecting kids and if so, how many. We were told that there was an international soccer tournament in town being held at the Wide World of Sports Complex.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful, relaxing, vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: KKL_SouthBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Orange Lake Resort with 7 of my family members. We all had plenty of space to put our things, sleep, and relax in the condo unit. There are different pool areas for different types of activities. We visited the lazy river pool to enjoy the different activities offered there such as floating in the tubes,water slides, the D.J.'s games, or just to chill with a frozen drink. When we wanted something a little more quiet, we visited one of the other pool areas where there were less people, but still great facilities to enjoy (including the aforementioned frozen drinks!) We stayed in the West Village in a 2 bedroom unit. It was clean with modern appliances. The staff responded immediaitely to any requests, and we did not answer the phone so we were not bothered at all by the sales staff. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TammylasW
Reviews.Content: I was a nervous wreck about checking into this resort after reading the reviews here- I experienced none of the issues written about. I booked this trip through American Express. I got here shortly after 4:00pm for check in, which took 20 minutes and had a super friendly clerk who did not even mention "time share". Our 2 bedroom villa in the East Village was spotless and had everything we could possibly need, including extra towels, toilet paper and detergent. Everyone was friendly and helpful, including the front desk when I called for extra sheets for the pull out sofa and got them within 45 minutes. Our villa was huge, we had free and fast internet connection and tons of activities for my two kids, 5 and 12. It was an awesome vacation and I would highly recommend this place to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Cowgirl103
Reviews.Content: We just returned after staying for 3 nights. Our room consisted of one bedroom and combined kitchen/living area. The room was all redone and very nice. There were 2 flat screen tvs and the bathroom was super large with a big tub. Check in was quick and painless. One question about the time share but a no answer was accepted. We spent two days at the lazy river and another day at another pool. Chairs were fairly easy to find. The towels were always stocked. The grounds were well manicured. Easy access to nearby restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place to stay I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: 01bama
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many places and have never after 18 years had reason enough to go online and complain about anything anywhere, but this place takes the cake. We stayed in West Village. The hallways smell horrible, the room has a horrible smell that seems to come from under the bathroom counter. The walls are paper thin - noise up and down the hallways at ALL hours (kids running, crying, and adults hollering) of the day and night as well as the noise in the rooms from other guests is exhausting. The other guests seem to have no courtesy for others who may be sleeping/resting. After being here 8 days, guests have come and gone and they have all been noisy. We asked the front desk if there was anything to be done - had to leave a voice mail because they are always so busy and put you on hold. NO RESPONSE - even as a courtesy to us. If we could have left without losing money, we would have. The timeshare spill was not an hour and a half - it was 21/2 and we finally got up and walked out after continually telling them nothing personal, we just didn't want to buy a time share. They got really huffy and offended. On a good note. The pools/tennis courts were nice, but the music around the pools were so loud you couldn't even dose off in the sun! Won't stay here again - if we buy a timeshare somewhere, would go through DISNEY.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: osumeghan2
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from a week at Orange Lake. Overall, the resort was decent, but there were some downfalls. First off -- it is a huge resort. After having read several reviews of the resort, we decided to rent a car for the week. We have a 2 toddlers, and relying on shuttle transportation to get around the resort isn't really convenient when we have naptimes, cranky kids, and an enormous amount of pool toys with us! We were SO happy that we had a car to get around. Our villa was in the North Village, and the pool that was closest to us wasn't as fun for our kids as the River Island pool, so we drove to the River Island pool everyday to swim. The villa was spacious, but the kitchen was ill-equipped compared to other timeshare places we have stayed in the past. Otherwise, the accommodations were okay -- not fantastic, but nothing disgusting or dirty. We were there over the 4th of July, and our neighbors were extremely loud in the streets, setting off fireworks -- not the resort's problem, but still a nuisance when we had toddlers trying to sleep and being woken up at midnight. We were happy to be close to Disney and went everyday.....but the "strip" near the hotel is kind of shady -- not really anywhere I'd want to eat/stop/shop. The Target and Publix were incredibly convenient. The sales pitch was heavy at registration, and we went to an early-morning sales meeting the day after we got there. After reading reviews, we were ready for the worst, but everybody was very friendly, warm, and took no for an answer! Only took us 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “all about money”
Reviews.Author: kennk
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our recent stay at OLCC. It seems that the family values are gone and being replaced with inventive ways to make more money,. In example, the new charges for floats at River Island. Why is it that we rent a float but it can only be used by me and not my wife when I'm not using it? More money. Then you have the GESTAPO checking to make sure that only the people that have a wrist band are using the float, again more money. Family values gone. Then we no longer have a family pass for miniature golf, again more money. Where is the family pass that we used to be able to afford? Again more money. How about the food and drinks, again more money. Our stay was not what we had in the past, especially since everything is now about more money and less family value which we had in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: suesmart32655
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at this horrible resort. The worst accommodation I have stayed in in years. What they call a "Villa" I would call a smelly, outdated, old 1 bedroom hotel room that was clearly built in the '80's and has not been upated (or properly cleaned)since. Every day the stair wells were flooded from the rain and we had to wade through deep puddles to get out. The carpet in the hallways and the room was dirty and in desperate need of cleaning. Trying to get hold of anyone on the phone was at least a 10 minute ordeal as we were left on hold every time. At one of the pools we went to the chairs were filthy, not just from a little rain/bugs, but thick black dirt that had obviously taken a long time to accumulate. We only stayed because we had family members vacationing there also. We could not wait to get out of there. My favorite part was the 8am call from the sales staff to see if we would be interested in buying a time share there.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting venture”
Reviews.Author: CampMcElroy
Reviews.Content: Here is the low down on the resort - First, check-in took around an hour. We finally got a room at the East village near the pool. We were aware of most of the services provided including washer and dryer in the room. We came prepared with laundry and dishwasher detergent, extra toilet paper. We knew about the maid service, ie if you want you can call for service for a charge, but we opted to bring our own cleaning supplies since we were there for seven days. The resort has FREE shuttle service to the different villages. If you need to leave the property, you would need your own mode of transportation. The resort has gone to a non-CASH resort which means you either allow the resort to hold your creditcard number to your room or purchase a gift card in the amount of $25, $50 etc. I guess the resort could be more enjoyable if the resort held your creditcard number and the activities are just charged to the room. But, we're in a recession and I chose to book the hotel room with a Wal-mart credit card on an advance purchase so not to overspend at the resort. So, when they ask us to hold our credit card, we told them we didn't have one. They also turned your telephone off for outgoing calls, but most people have cell phones and that wasn't a problem. We also purchased one gift card for $25 so my son could play one 18 hour of golf $9 + tax. We brought our own tub down, but couldn't use it at the lazy river, therefore, we didn't ride it. The biggest and annoying problem I had with the resort was the phone calls constantly for a time-share tour. I ignored the telephone up to Wednesday and my sister answered the phone. I told the corporate office I was not interested in the timeshare tour and to remove my name from their computer - they did. I explained to them that I was a PAID guess and this was not a free timeshare trip so, please do not disturb my vacation and the calls stopped. LASTLY, there were two incidents at the resort - (1) a man was arrested in front of my building - don't know what the problem was and I started seeing bugs in the bathroom - big cockroaches. I have terrible allergies and I had to send my husband to the store to get bug spray. He did remind me that the front door had a gap at the bottom where the rubber seal had worn. Oh, the only other place that accepted cash was the game room where the kids can load the machine and receive a game card. I couldn't even get a cup of starbucks coffee with CASH. Although the concept of having an non-CASH resort seems fine, but the resort could make a whole lot of money if they accepted cash. Overall, the room in 8700 building was beautifully laid out and cleaned. I will come again and maybe stay at a different village to see the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Objective”
Reviews.Author: simoncchapman
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to Orange Lake on Route 192 in Kissimmee in Orlando Florida. Our first visit here was was for our Honeymoon (Sept 2007) had done an RCI week exchange from our Greece timeshare. This time around was a Lattitudes package we purchased in 2007 for £995 for 250,000 points spend (which at the time was ok). We stayed in the East Village the first time and were extremely happy with the 2 bedroom apartment we had. This time around we had our 16month old Daughter and the wifes sister with her husband and daughter, and again a 2 bedroom was more than enough for us all. The 2 bed apartments in the East village are HUGE, the Master bedroom and en-suite are massive (the beds are like 2 single bases pushed together with a huge single mattress. The apartments themselves are well kept, the only small thing which makes them look slightly dated is the old style TVs which could do with swapping to LCD's perhaps. The kitchen is well stocked with pots, pans, cutlery and even has an ice maker in the huge Fridge. The living area is pretty big with a good sized dinning table and outside is a balcony which is netted off (to keep the little flies, pets out etc...) The apartment was cleaned after the first week, including bedding, towels etc.... we werent really bothered with towels everyday as we used the washer/dryer most days for our own clothing and kids clothing. Just a quick note to say having the washer and dryer on a 2 week holiday like this with small kids is fantastic. The whole of the site has Free wifi which was running smoothly for the Majority of the 2 weeks. They had 1 or 2 outages but nothing major. Car parks are huge and overall the site is very quiet and well kept by the Dozens of gardeners we saw every day! The resort is absolutely huge and you really need a car to get around, the onsite shuttle service is OK if you need to use it but can upto 20 minutes wait. The resort isn't in the best of location to see all the sites, but is pretty close the Disney entrance (ironically the grounds of the site neighbour Animal kingdom) and is about 15-18 miles away from the main International drive attractions. If you have a car though its not a big deal. Now sadly to the bad points: the check in process took over 30 minutes due to the staff not really knowing what they were doing with my Lattitudes package, the supervisor kept running around trying to look busy but not really doing much. I had to wave my arms (figuratively speaking) 3 times to make it clear I hadnt been dealt with. FINALLY got an older member of staff who booked me into the room with 5 minutes and took my creditcard swipe. During our stay we went to the restraunt for breakfast as we walked in we said "4 adults for the all you can eat breakfast" and we were seated in a nicely furbished area and offered coffee and juice at the table. The breakfast was ok, lots of eggs, bacon grits, sausage gravy and was all very nice. When we got the bill its turns out the all you can eat breakfast didnt include coffee or juice which was charged at an extra $2.50 a cup. Its a nice place but any chance they can to fleece you for every penny they do. Basic breakfast for 4 people and 2 toddlers came to almost $70 which is sneakily billed to your room. Now being veterans of RCI timeshare weeks we knew we had to endure the usual sit down sales pitch for "90 minutes" which we all know turns into more like 3 hours. Firstly we were sent to the wrong building, then after driving all the way to other side of the site and leaving my car there we were shuttled by golf buggy all the way back to the original building about 1km away (??????) the free breakfast consisted of coffee, juice and buns but nothing considered a real breakfast. The salesfolk are polite but seriously oppresive, its serious high pressure sales here, nothing more. Lets be under no illusions here they want your money no holds bared. Eventually after refusing about 5 deals because I didnt have a permanent job at the time, I had some sales manager insinuating if I didnt take his fantastic deal I was a poor father to my family, I guess thats when I lost it and got seriously wound up and as I was just getting into giving him both verbal barrels he waved to a porter who was stood looking blank and said "what you need me now?" and got up and literally ran off into a backroom. The porter still looked blank and clearly didnt have a clue what he was on about. At this piont the sales woman who knew things had gotten awkward got up and said "thanks for your time" and quickley disapeared. Then a quality control guy appeared before we left to guage our experience and feedback. He listened to our objections for a couple of minutes (not writing anything down) then it turned out he wasnt quality control at all but a last ditched attempt to sell us YET ANOTHER form of timeshare. After the whole episode we walked out and asked who would take us back down to our car. "You can catch the shuttle bus from just our here sir" so we sat in the baking sunshine with our 15 month old daughter for 15 minutes until the driver turned out and took us back down to the car. All in all this is a fantasic site to stay in we thoroughly enjoyed our two weeks away and the the lazy river is a stunning pool (although you have to hire the rubber rings at $5/day EACH!!!!) I would say the facilities are 9/10 but since taken over by Holiday Inn the staff and sales pitch is what lets this site down.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Value, Worth the trip!”
Reviews.Author: littlebearhugs
Reviews.Content: We spent the last seven days at the Holiday Inn Orange Lake. We traveled with a group of 17 including 5 small children. I have two timeshares I traded through RCI and rented one three bedroom condo. I read the reviews before I went but knew from previous experience to take the negative reviews with a grain of salt. This resort is a timeshare rental resort, not a hotel. If you know that before you go, you are already aware that there is no housekeeping service and although they do provide you with an ample amount of toilet paper, soap, etc., to start, you will have to purchase more supplies on your own. We found all three units we had to be clean, well kept and had ample space for all in our party. My favorite unit was the three bedroom condo. It was very large and we often had everyone over to the this condo and no one ever felt cramped. It tooks us less than 20 minutes to check into all three units and we were not pressured into going to a timeshare presentation. One firm no was all it took and the check in and check out staff were both helpful, friendly and courteous. The only negative about the whole trip was the repeated phone calls to try and get us to go to a presentation. If it really bothers you, just take the phone off the hook. The grounds and pools are well kept. They do not charge you by the hour for the tubes, it is a one time fee for the day. You can also purchase a weekly rental at a discount if you prefer. We cooked often in the resort and did not try the restaurants so I don't know if they were good or not. We ordered some food by the pool at River Island. It was fine and typical of what you would find in any resort area. The resort is very close to all of the Disney parks and it was very easy and convenient to drive there every day. The resort is massive and although they do provide a shuttle to get around, we used our car and did not find it inconvenient at all. There is a Publix and Target close by as well as convenience stores and restaurants. We had a wonderful time and would definitely visit this resort again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Disney World:you won't have to leave the resort!”
Reviews.Author: steve34609
Reviews.Content: We exchanged through RCI for this vacation.We have friends in our neighborhood who own at Orange Lake and they are always talking about it. My wife's girlfriend and two daughters came to visit us for a month from Europe and were planning to see Disney World. So,we decided to combine our vacation with theirs and book a two bedroom,two bath suite in early June. After learning as much as we could about the resort via the website and the concierge,we set off.While the rest of the group was at Disney, I went to the resort to check in. The only real problem that we encountered during the entire week was simply the fact that I had called ahead and requested an early check in.For some reason this request had not been documented in the comments section of my reservation. I arrived at about noon of our check in day and I went through all of the paperwork and the timeshare appointment pitch. I was told that our unit would be ready soon,so I decided to drive over to see what progress houskeeping was making on getting it ready.Turns out,the fellow that was occupying the unit barely spoke English and did not understand that he had to check out then check into a new unit that day,since he had booked two full weeks.I was a little flustered and went back to the check in desk to report this.The staff jumped on this and Chris in management swiftly,and I mean swiftly, procured us an UPGRADED unit (two queen beds in the second bedroom) that was ready immediately for move in.It only got better after that. The resort is huge and fab. The units are luxurious,maintained and spacious.Everything worked.The only problem I had with the unit was that the yellow lights on the patio actually attracted bugs in the evening.So I unscrewed it.Our unit backed up to the golf course. There was a small pool/hot tub nearby as well.The only drawback was the highway noise from 192 at night.Emergency vehicles and trucks could be heard at night,despite the closed windows. We were on Southern Magnolia street. If you are a golfer this will be absolute heaven for you.No ifs,ands or buts. I don't golf,nor did anyone in our party, but the Legends course is lighted for night play and kids golf free. I think there are three courses at Orange Lake.This resort is SO close to Disney,you may as well be staying on Disney property!The toll road between the two entrances to OL takes you North,directly to the west Disney entrance,which is barely used.Avoid the traffic and save time.You're there in 5-7 minutes. The activities and amenities are truly far too many to list.Just go and see for yourself! We loved the lazy river. The windward bar,right at the pool,serves delicious pina coladas. The water slides on the pool complex were enjoyed by the kids.The only thing that we did not like about the resort was the little fees for this and that.Wireless internet service was free and it worked well.There was no daily resort fee.The fees for the tubes on the lazy river was $7/day.The fee for a locker at the pool complex was $9! Miniature golf was NOT free.We have never paid for it at all other timeshare resorts we have stayed at.Use your car as a locker.Put your valuables in the trunk and take only your room key and car key to the pool. Your room key is linked to a credit card when you check in.Keep tabs on it closely.Though everyone seemed to be having a great time and we saw no "riff raff"...ya never know. The game room/arcade at the main clubhouse was,in one word, superior. Absolutely cool.There is also a large conference room where recently released films are shown. Feel free to leave your kids who are twelve or over,at the activities room while you parents take a break and watch the film.There is also a paid babysitting service active at the resort. From mini malls elegantly laid out and stocked,to poolside eateries and bars,to lake activities to golf...this place is too much! It's billed as the largest RCI resort in the world,but it is also one of the best,as well! Go! You won't be sorry. Orange lake is not "Waldorf or Ritz Carlton" elegant but it is definitely upscale.If you need that type of elegance and level of refined service, pay the money book a hotel room and spend wads.Orange Lake is a very family-oriented resort. Compared to the many other timeshare resorts we've stayed at,it's five star.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a family trip or a weekend out.”
Reviews.Author: tashan7
Reviews.Content: The resort is well spread out in a huge land mass and it has got almost all the facilities you would need on a vacation. Located close to the famous Disney and Universal theme parks, offers the best family experience. But you might want to rethink going here if you dont have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Average Facility, BUT, know what you are getting into!”
Reviews.Author: saluki34
Reviews.Content: We chose this location to stay for 6 nights during a family wedding in Orlando. As a platinum Marriott member, the Marriott World Center and surrounding resorts were our first choice. However we had 5+ other family groups that decided to stay here, so for convenience we joined them. Prior to arrival, I read most of the posts on here and was ready for just about anything they threw out at me. Some of the major concerns of the prior guests came front and center, others didn't. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa in the East Village. First off, BEFORE you make a reservation here please realize that this is not a full service hotel. If you want that in a resort, Go to the Marriott Sable or Imperial Palms resort. Your room is supplied with towels, minimal soap, toilet paper, tissue, dishwasher soap etc. Outside of that, you are on your own. If you want your towels washed, you do it yourself. There is a Super Target and a large Publix grocery store just outside the property. Additionally, the entire resort is cashless. This leaves you with 2 options to make any purchase; a credit card or your room key. Not a big deal to me but some people seem to be annoyed by this. There is free wi-fi throughout the resort. I found it to be pretty reliable and usually did not have problems with access or speed. This is a time share facility, so be prepared for the sales pitch. Upon arrival, we were taken into a separate room for a one on one check in. This took about an hour. They do not just hand over the keys and tell you where your room is, you get a complete overview of the property, all the great things about it etc, with several sales pitch dings in here and there. You will also be given an incentive to take the tour which they said will only take 45 min or such. My parents chose to do this, and were not real happy when it took 3 hours of their time. My advice would be if you chose to do this without the intent to purchase and only want the incentive, is to not be very friendly on the tour. They take friendliness as incentive to push harder and draw out the tour. Also when you check in, they DON'T charge you $250, but rather put a credit hold on your card for that amount. There is a difference that some people don't realize judging from reading some of the other articles on this site. This is the same thing that happens at most gas stations, when you run your card, an automatic hold is put on your card for typically $50.00, when your purchase is over, then the gas station releases the hold and charges your credit card. Same thing here, they put a hold on your card for $250 for your on property purchases, when/if your purchases reach $250, they process the charge and put a hold for another $250 and so on. That is the extent of the facts as I saw them, I will now outline my experience and some of the issues that I came across. The East Village is pretty far from the main pool, however we did have a nice view of the Magic Kingdom fireworks each night at 10pm. Our villa was on the 6th floor of the unit and looked fairly nice. Upon closer inspection the floors and bathrooms were very dirty. My wife typically wipes down the floors and surfaces with clorox wipes, and after doing so, she had half the container used with each wipe completely black with dirt. The decor of the rooms was nice, the beds were well used and not very comfortable. The views were nice and other than that the room was ok. Our first day there, the AC didn't work, June in Orlando is not a great time for this. It took them 4-6 hours to get this resolved. The next night, which happened to be our Disney day, we arrived back late to find the elevators out of service. So we had to lug all our goods, strollers and 2 very tired kids up 6 flights of stairs. The next day after returning from our day's activities, we found our room keys to not work. I have stayed in enough hotels to know where not to put hotel keys (around cell phones, blackberries, magnets etc), so to have all 4 of our room keys fail, esp when one had been kept in the car, was a bit suspicious. Anyways, I called the hotel reception and explained our situation and was told to hang tight and someone would be out with new keys. I offered to come to the reception and get them but was told not to worry. Long story short, it took 10+ phone calls and almost 1.5 hours for someone to finally get new keys to us. Unacceptable in my book. The next day, my parents' unit lost their cold water. Cold water? are you kidding me. The solution presented to them was to shower in another unit. Those were my main problems that I came across, the phone rang the first couple of days, asking us to take a tour, we finally got a bit aggressive and told them to leave us alone. My main issue with this resort was that once you got outside of the reception area, it seemed you were on your own. People were not as friendly or helpful as, say a Disney resort or other top level hotel or resort. After complaining, we got a 2.5 night comp to our room, but that took some prodding as initially they pretty much had the attitude that, "oh well, things happen, not our fault". Personally, if I am going to spend the time and money to go to a resort, I do want an element of personal service and attentiveness. This facility lacks that. The food that we did have, was pretty good, especially the nachos. As with anything on property (and any typical resort) it is a bit overpriced. When it was time to leave, it took us 2 hours to check out, because the room comp was not applied correctly and they couldn't figure out how to do it. Very unorganized. The pools were nice and the water slide at river city was very fast. You are nickel and dime'd for any extras that you want like tubes etc. I was disappointed at the lack of general property upkeep. The lawns, bushes were not properly maintained. The buildings were consistently covered with spiders and webs, etc. Overall, in my opinion this is an average discount resort that does not focus on the little things to put it in a higher class. If you are looking for an average place to stay for a decent rate without any typical 1st class amenities, then this is your place. The kids had a good time at the pools and some of the events that were held. Personally, we won't be returning. I would rather spend a few extra dollars on a Disney property or at another fuller scale resort. But if budget is your main priority and you don't mind the lower class deficiencies, then you may enjoy this place

Reviews.Title: “What a joke !!! Never stayed at such a rip-off hotel”
Reviews.Author: triopoms
Reviews.Content: Well be prepared to stand for an hour or more for check in, then conned into a tour, charged a 250 dep. and a 30 dep. Once you don't go on the tour or buy good luck on getting things fixed in the room. Amenites are charged BY THE HOUR including the tubing, and large pool. No change of towels or maid serv unless you stay more than 10 days incl coffee packets. If you want it you have to pay for it. You have to drive to various areas of the resort. Food is overpriced for the quality. Constant phone calls by the resort. All the beds were so uncomfortable we all came home with hurt backs. Me and my kids were almost run off the road on the resort and they did nothing. Most of the employees are so rude. Lied to about the room and the shuttles. Has to be one of the worst hotels that I ever stayed at. They do not disclose all of this on their site.

Reviews.Title: “they need to be up front with the extra cost”
Reviews.Author: Sallyknoxville
Reviews.Content: If you look at the breakdown of the hotel offers and surcharges they explain in some areas of the resort, nowhere does it say you will have to wash your own towels, buy your own toilet paper and no cleaning services. If you don't want to wash your towels you have to pay and pay for cleaning service. I had to go down a hallway to a wash room to wash my bathroom towels every day. Not the vacation I wanted. Oh the worse part of washing, broken nobbies on the washer and dryer on at least 1 of them. The showers could have been cleaner, other hairs and such. Carpet was wet from being cleaned not even at 4. The water park yes is free but their are cost to use the floats in the lazy river. Their are a lot of hidden fees they don't say about in expedia or Holiday Inn sight. The place is handicap ready mostly. They have the elevator, ramps, the automatic doors, but then you have to open a very heavy glass and steel door to get to the room. The place has potential, but I would not go back. A better resort a mile from Sea World is so much better for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: countygal
Reviews.Content: 6/20/10- 5 days 4 nights. We were invited to listen to the timeshare presentation in exchange for discounted rate vacation and it was worth the 1 turn into 4 hours long presentation! I read all of the reviews first before we went and I decided that dispite some negative comments we would still try it out. We were so pleased with the check in process, it was quick and easy...Once we got our room info I was a little scared at what we would find. To our surprise the room was just like we saw online. Beautiful! We had a family of 5, 2 adults and 3 children. We cooked everyday and saved so much money. We had more than enough room even for our guest to come and visit us for dinner. They were very persistant when it came to purchasing property. We declined not to just one salesman but to 3! They were kinda mean but we did not let that bother us. The Pools and River Island was worth the trip by itself since we were not going to any of the parks. Be ready to stay busy because they have the entire week filled with activities for everyone. Don't worry about trying to do everything because you wont be able to.. The property is HUGE! We stayed in the East Villiage on the Golf Coarse. It is very quiet on this side. We were able to see nightly fireworks at Disney which was very cool. My only complaint would be whenever the wind blows a certain way there is a god aweful smell pretty much like raw sewage! Once the wind stopped blowing the smell died down. The place was clean and it had everything I needed to cook with and to tidy up while there in the condo! Try it at least once, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip, do your homework”
Reviews.Author: williwigs
Reviews.Content: First things first, Orange Lake is not a hotel, and no one is going to clean your room but you. It's a timeshare communmity. Look on Ebay.com and you will be able to find a very affordable week. We go just about every year during July and stay for less than $800 a week. Much cheaper and larger than a hotel in Orlando. It is convenient to all of the theme parks and outlet malls. Less than 10 minutes away. It is about an hour from the beach either way, east or west. There are family activities on the property for children of all ages. There are several pools. There is a movie theater. The restaurants are pricey and the food is just so-so. Every condo we have stayed in has been very clean. I would not recommend staying in a unit that is near Irlo Bronson Highway. Ones further back on the property seem to be "owned" and are kept up. The shuttle service is nice and I have never had to ask for anything more than once. This is a nice family oriented property. There may be a problem with the language barrier but I have been going to Orange Lake for the past 10 years and I have never had a problem that would keep me from going back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place, TONS of summer fun, NO PRESSURE”
Reviews.Author: likearushingriver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a few nights, and then I had some friends come join me when he had to go back to work. (We live locally). We receieved a week's stay as a wedding gift/birthday gift from an RCI Member. Check in was VERY fast, and when asked if we wanted to do the sales pitch, we weren't really sure what our schedule was like, so the lady was really understanding and friendly and said we could schedule whenever. I only received one phone call the whole week from a very very friendly lady asking how our stay was and if I had any questions, and asking me if I knew when we would be able to achedule our sales pitch. I told her I wasn't sure when my husband would be back to the resort, (if you are married, both must be present). She was still very friendly and said that was fine, and gave me the number to reach her. (When my husband came back, we went to make an appointment, but they did not have any left for the day, and we were leaving the next day, and they do not allow sales pitches on the day you check out.) There was ABOSLUTLEY NO PRESSURE to attend the sales pitch. The room we had was nice, family oriented, tropical. Nothing fancy, really. NO bed bugs, we always check because we had a mishap on our honeymoon, but none there, thank the Lord. We did find spiders, and as for me and my friends, it is the worst thing you could find in a hotel :-P One in the master bath, 2 in the "guest" bath, 1 in the "guest" BED (yes, actual bed) and one IN the master bed... The front desk was absolutely horridied when I told them, and would take care of it. Publix is extremely close, but very expensive; nice to have, but not a very good value. All the dishes were clean, all the cooking pans and utensils were clean, everything was organized. There were plenty of extra blankets and sheets. We went on a walk all around the resort, which was long, but beautiful- it helps to be a good directional person, because my husband got lost a few times in the resort- it is HUGE- I, with the map, did not get lost at all. The pools are great, all with lifeguards. The best two pools are the ones at River Island (with the lazy river and waterslides) and at the complex behind the main lobby. There is so much to do. Suprisingly, non-alcoholic drinks and refreshments are not as expensive as you would think, and comes in handy when lounging around the pool. In the evenings, at the main pool behind the beautiful lobby, they have lots of activities throughout the day, but the one we liked the best was watching the karaoke! Mostly kids performing oldies/disney songs, it was a blast to watch as the sun set on the man made beach on the lake with volleyball nets, hammocks, and palm trees galore in the background. It is a GREAT, fun, summer atmosphere. I cannot tell you how much fun we had. It was a true blast. I also felt very safe, as to get on the property, you had to prove you had reservations there, and/or a (free) parking pass. We did not do this, and I can't remember the exact price, but for those traveling from nothern states, I would recommend splurging on a poolside cabana for a day. It comes with a private pool lounging deck, a fully stocked mini fridge, a fan, cable tv, and I am pretty sure wifi. I can't wait to go back; it was a week of great adventure. We loved every minute of it, and it was a week full of memories!! All staff was very friendly and helpful, and we appreciate the family friendly feel of this resort!

Reviews.Title: “best resort vacation we had”
Reviews.Author: landguydelhi
Reviews.Content: Being apriority club member my 1st option was to look for holiday inn, when we had my wife's family visiting us and we wanted to take a break to enjoy tourist spots of florida that kids enjoy. We were 6 ( 4 adults, a teanager and kid)and resort villa that said it would accommodate 8 was our obvious choice to spend 4 nights and 5 days there. We got a very good deal for booking in advance and when we arrived we loved the clean and neat fully furnishe facilities provide with smiling straff to take care of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty to do....”
Reviews.Author: avpkathy
Reviews.Content: My family is enjoying the property. We agreed to sale presentation to save BIG money on other items, but left and opted to pay full price for everything!! We are staying at East Village, overlooking the golf course and watched the Disney fireworks tonight. They have plenty to eat, but could use much "simplier" food for my picky kids.

Reviews.Title: “MOLD, MORE MOLD, & LIES!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FAMILYFUNTIMESFORALL
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS PLACE. It looks beautiful from the photos but don't be deceived. We never even found one of the pools since no one that worked there knew where they were. Then, after giving up on that, when you get to the room and found MOLD EVERYWHERE, then you'll want to throw up. The showers had mold in them. The doors were full of mold. The toilets under the rim were full of mold and poop. They look like they have NEVER been washed. The grout was discusting between the tiles in the bathrooms and kitchens. Since there is mold in the rooms, then there has to be mold around the pool areas too. We didn't even get that far because you can only stay in a room NEAR the pool if you OWN a timeshare IN THAT RESORT. Otherwise, you are driving around in circles for a minimun of 10 minutes to try and find the pool. Anyway, the MOLD was the main issue. The other issue is that when we were looking for our rooom, we saw linens and towels in piles laying by the room doors half under the shrubery by a few of the rooms. There were maids hanging outside by their golfcarts smoking and talking and not working. It was very distasteful and trailor trashy. Orange Lake needs a lot of work in every area especially cleaning. We immediately spoke to the management and they didn't even look surprised about the mold which was very sad, and they did give us a full refund of our 12 days. There were a lot of people in that office with complaints about their stay. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. IF THERE IS MOLD, I WONDER HOW MANY BUGS THERE ARE.....ESPECIALLY BED BUGS AND ROACHES. We didn't stick around to find out. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good resort once you get past the sales pitch”
Reviews.Author: azztoyou
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest... we're talking a resort that is part of Holiday Inn's / RCI's timeshare bundle. That's where they make their money. If you think that you'll come in and not get 'the pitch' you're foolish to start. The bottom line is, it's their job to sell you. A firm no goes a long way. Beating around the bush doesn’t help anyone. After reading all the horror stories on the sales pitch, we were greeted by a nice young guy from Pittsburgh on arrival. He asked to participate in the timeshare presentation, and it took two firm no's and that was it. Done. He gave us our keys, said have a good time, and we were off. Once we got into the room, to avoid any other opportunities for 'the pitch' we unplugged the phones. Simple... as I don't know anyone that actually uses them in this day. Enough on that. The place is very nice. Can't say it’s the nicest that we've stayed at, but it is an overall good value. Family friendly, the resort is geared toward the 30-40 year old crowd with generally younger children. There is much to do from swimming, jet skiing, golf, etc. to just lounging around in a hammock. We stayed in west village, literally across the street from the pool. Walking distance, although you cannot walk between villages. You'll have to use either a car or the shuttle. Room was clean, neat and tidy when we arrived. In room wireless internet, jetted tub and a good deal of room. For the techies, there is enough bandwidth to run three wireless PC’s and a wireless cell phone without latency. You only get a limited supply of TP, paper towels, detergent, dishwasher soap, etc. If you have a larger family, plan on buying or bringing some from home. Evenings between 5 and 7 are pretty neat by the pools as there is entertainment each night that is all geared toward the family. Hula hoop contest for the kids, push-up contest for meatheads, all for prizes and free drinks. Overall, would go back again…

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: lifesgreat
Reviews.Content: We went to this resort with Disney as our agenda. We used the two bedroom condo to sleep, eat breakfast, and cool down between parks. We used the pools only for about an hour total during two visits. Check in was quick, and there is a Super Target and Publix pretty much next door. They give you 7 coffee filters, a couple rolls of TP, a couple of laundry powders, small lotions, and shampoo. We bought more TP and paper towels, but we never used them. We just weren't at the resort that much. The two bedrooms, kitchen, living areas were really nice to spread out. After hot days at the parks, we could relax. The drive to disney parks is very quick and easy. I don't know any different, but I would recommend this location to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great pools area for parents of small children”
Reviews.Author: riple3
Reviews.Content: I love going to the Magic Kingdom every year and Orange Lake just makes our vacation that much better. After spending time at Disney we could come back and relax in the wonderful pools... The only problem is that they can be quite a distance from the room you are assigned. This is an enormous property and has 3 quite large pool areas...each with it's own personality. We have a 2 year old and 4 year old and Splash Lagoon was our favorite pool. It was specifically designed for small children. I am now disappointed when searching for hotels to stay, I cannot find the pool systems that are similar to the ones offered here. The rooms are also large, clean, and nice for families. Many things to do such as movies shown on site, the alligator show on site, balloon animals for children, poolside bingo, nightly music, and close to Disney. I only caution if you do the time share presentation, they are high pressure sales people who will take up half a day trying to sell you a timeshare so beware. In general skip the time share presentation and enjoy the resort and all of the other amenities it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe everything you read! (but most of it)”
Reviews.Author: R_CubedTexas
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a little leary about this place after reading some of the reviews, but I absolutely love this resort! Most of what you will read in the reviews is true. We arrived about four on a Friday afternoon. When I walked in I was a little suprised how many people where checking in, and it seemed to be taking forever. Then a manager came and whisked me off to another office where I knew the "sales pitch" was going to begin. The man was very friendly and professional. Yes he began his pitch and I politely turned him down and that was it! Like the other reviews state. This place is huge! We had to leave the check in desk, get back on a major highway and drive about two miles to RIVER ISLAND where our condo was located. Forget about walking around this place it is just too big. They do offer a shuttle, but fortunately we had a rental car. Our room was a king suite and four of us stayed there. My wife and I and two kids. The couch folds out into a bed and we had the room with the king bed. The unit is very well layed out and you will love the convenience of the washer, dryer and kitchen. Only inconveniences, no oven and no bathtub. It does have a huge shower. We ate most of our breakfast and lunches in the room. And the washer and dryer enable you to bring less clothes,saving on luggage charges. It is tastefully decorated and was very clean. THIS IS NOT A HOTEL. You do not get daily maid service. You can if you pay for it, but otherwise you're cleaning up after yourself. The previous reviewers that griped about not getting clean sheets and maid service did not do their research. This in no way dissapointed me. Like I said, we where on River Island. It is next to a nice shopping area and a great pool complex that included a lazy river and two water slides. Tubes are available for rent, but you can still use the lazy river without them. We had dinner dinner at the River Island Grilling Company. It was pretty good. The service was a little slow, and there wasnt that many people there. Another night we ordered pizza from their pizza restaraunt "Paisans". It was a little under cooked and expensive, but they where huge pizzas.They have many places for you to shop, eat and drink. All of them are a litlle more than you want to pay, and less than they want to make. But it is convenient. There is a Publix and a Super Target very near for necessities, and much cheaper than the resort. Just remember you have to lug all your groceries to your room, which may or may not be a short walk. We used the bell carts nest to the front door to take ours. There is a sign at the pool entrance that says no coolers or alchohol but we saw several people doing it with no problems. Obviously they would rather sell it to you. We just bought the refillable souvenir glasses and filled them with our own stuff. The resort is very convenient to Disney World. It sits in the backyard of Disneys Animal Kingdom. We went to the DW parks every day, but I could have easily stayed at the resort and had fun. They offer many activities for the whole family. It is very well kept and maintained. Great security, and the landscaping is beautiful. Orange Lake is a great value for what you get. I highly reccomend and whould stay here again. I hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great, sound vacation”
Reviews.Author: wemarionFishnGolf
Reviews.Content: Had a blast staying here. No problems with the room... and the 1-bedroom was excellent size. Free Wi-Fi worked very well and was pretty good speed as well. Kitchen was clean and well-equipped. Our room was just a few steps away from splash lagoon, a great 2-section pool with a water slide, water volleyball, water volleyball, kid's pool, etc. Just a little pressure on the check-in for timeshare, but it was very short and no pressure. Played golf at the Reserves for $34! One of the all-time best values in courses I've ever played... greens were in great shape and playing through basically wetlands was well put together. I didn't eat here so can't comment on the food or service. Used the shuttle on the grounds which was a nice touch as the place is absolutely huge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lucifer12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake for five days. First this is a very large resort. They have shuttles to take you to different locations but having your own car is a big plus. This is basically a timeshare community so there are no housekeeping services for the first 14 days of your visit. All of the units have a washer and dryer and plates and drinking glasses so if you don't mind managing on your own it is great. You can choose to prepare your own meals or enjoy the on site facilities. It was perfect for us. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The staff was helpful and friendly. The only bad thing I can say about the place is that they charged me twice for the visit but quick corrected the error.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: erineile
Reviews.Content: Great place - wonderful pool areas - friendly staff - clean rooms (but limited amenities). We were there in a one bedroom suite for 8 days and missed having a few amenities like a set of drawers for our clothes in the bedroom (we used the closet floor) - having only one mirror in the suite which was in the bathroom - however, we had a refrigerator problem at 1 am in the morning and promptly received a response to our maintenance call. (Note: daughter & family had all this and more in their 2 bedroom Villa - no shortage of room there). Plenty of stuff to do on-site without leaving property (been to Disney - been there/done that/ - spent time just relaxing around the pools while grand kids and parents sweated it out at the parks). Additional notes: (1) Because we were on the Vacation plan and not Timeshare (although we are RCI members but booked our room thru Holiday Inn Vacation Club/Travelocity), we had to pay a $7.95 fee each day for resort services. (2) We also had a bad experience with the Timeshare sales people, but this was rectified after we complained to the Hotel Manager who gave us cash coupons to compensate us for showing up for our 60 minute presentation which the Timeshare representatives said we had to stay for a 90 minute presentation. We refused and thus were not allowed to cash in on any of the rewards.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PTEAAE
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: May 22 - 29, 2010 Location: River Island , room 82129A first floor facing the parking lot When we arrived 11:00p.m. there were several other couples checking in. It was a slow process (25min). The attendant booked us for a "tour" - I knew it was the sales pitch that everone had warned me about. I was just going to call the next day and tell them we weren't coming. When we got to our room I was a little disappointed that we weren't on the pool side of the hotel but it ended up being GREAT! There was a screened in porch that opened up to the parking lot. We got a parking space right by our door and it ended up being very convienient when loading / unloading. The room was fantastic. Tons of space and we needed nothing all week!!!!! When we woke up the next morning we went to Super Target right across from Orange Lake and went grocery shopping. We ate most of our meals right in the room. We had originally intended to spend three days at Disney but we were having such a good time at River Island that we only went to Disney one day! While I am on the topic of food, we did eat at River Island Grill twice. The food was very good and not that expensive. Try the sushi, it is rolled fresh to order! We spent almost all of our time at the zero entry pool in River Island. My husband and I got cocktails and sat in the shallow water and watched our kids have a blast in the water. We did have to take away the tubes that we brought from home because they don't allow any tubes but theirs in this particular pool. It is expensive but if the kids are under five they get one for free when an adult buys one. There are a lot of people that go down to the pool early and put a towel on the "good" chairs. Unless you can get to the pool before 9:30 expect to see a lot of "taken" spots. The drinks by the pool are weak and you had to order doubles or top shelf liquor in order for them to taste any good. We did this and allowed the kids to buy ice cream and hot dogs all week and we got Starbucks coffee everyday and our bill was not outrageous. The day came for our 90min tour. We were told to bring our receipt (from check-in)and nothing else to the tour. We decided to walk to the tour reception building (not far from River Island). We got there, we were hot... it was 92 degrees. We were told we were at the wrong building!!! We walked back, got the car, drove to the correct building. When we got in, we were refused our tour because we didn't have our drivers licenses and a credit card. We were mad!! As we were leaving, I remembered that they charged me a $30 deposit for the tour. I went back in to get my money back. A manager came up and informed me that the receptionist was wrong and they didn't need our liscense and credit card and that we could take the tour. I told them that wasn't happening and I just wanted my money back. It took them 20 min to give it to me. The next day someone called us and asked why we refused to take the tour. I explained that the tour was refused to us. They asked if we would take a tour. They offered us cask to take the tour. We got $80 and free tubes for the kids for the week. We took the tour, it took 3 and 1/2 hours!!!!!!!!! Five people tried to close us! I had a 3 and a 1 year old with us and they did not respect that at all!!!! Don't go on the tour! You can buy one of these deeds from someone online for nothing!!! Don't go on the tour!!! Also, do not buy your tickets for Disney at Orange Lake. They sold us our tickets at a "discount" and when we got to Disney we found out that we paid MORE for our tickets than we would have at the gate. Other than the tour and Disney tickets the experience was wonderful!!! It was relaxing, quiet and lots of fun!!! There is live music by the pool (it didn't bother us at all, we didn't hear it) and "dive-in" movies. Lots of activities if you want them. We are going again next year.... we just know what to avoid now. The beds are good, not great and I really needed my own pillow. I was so tired at the end of the day it never really mattered. One other thing, don't bother packing a bunch of clothes. The washer and dryer in the rooms are new and very nice. We did laundry everyday (bring beach towels, you don't get many towels in your room) and basically wore only our bathing suits!! We needed to buy toilet paper, soap, food, salt & pepper, laundry soap, dish soap and a britta water filter. Expenses: There is a daily fee of $8 in addition to your room charge. Daily tube rental fee of $14. No parking fee. Grocery store and liquor store across the street from Orange Lake. Buy Disney tickets from Disney. Don't go on the tour, its not worth the "freebies" Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PLACE AND FUN”
Reviews.Author: KittyKatB
Reviews.Content: Check in was jammed pack but more staff stepped up and got us checked in fast. Room was just beautiful two big bedrooms 2 full baths and very clean. Just a walk away from the main pool which was taken care of. All the staff were very helpful and so positive. Great resort. Grounds well kept

Reviews.Title: “Signiture Collection Joke”
Reviews.Author: scarface
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? To put it bluntly. This was the worst RCI exchange property I have experienced. Level of service was a joke, room was average, location was good, so many problems. Check in was quick but having to fight off time share sharks was painful. I hope my home property does not treat people like I was treated by these skunks. The room wasnt half bad at first site. We stayed in a two bedroom on the 7th floor. But we quickly learned looks arent everything. Our fire alarm beeped every morning at 7, sink leaked all over the kitchen floor, breakers in the room kept flipping which causes a loss in power, no hook ups for ipod, stove dirty......I would keep going but you get the point. Requested these things be looked at but it didnt help. No one ever showed up to fix them. Requested extra toilet paper but no one came with it. I had to steal it off a maid cart. We did have a private area in the pool. Not half bad. I hate to write a review like this but this stay was miserable. If you decide to go here I wish you the very best of luck. I will never go back and we stayed at their so called "signature collection". Find another property in the exchange.

Reviews.Title: “Umm not a good Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Resaa
Reviews.Content: Yeahh Well we drove all night to get to disney and then we went to magic kingdom the next day without sleeping we have an awsome time at disney just dead on our feets.When we got to the hotel This Lady Name Stacie or Stacy Chaeck us in she was BEYOND annoying she couldnt take a hint She kept droning on and on and hitting on my dad. Then she scamed us on this hotel breakfast crap my dad had to give her a deposit to go which he was told he would get back-Never happened.When we got to our room it looked like it had just hosted a frat party And the last thing we wanted to do was wait half and hour for the hotl to assign us to another freckin room. Theresa really nothing to do there besides swim and we were told there was a water park there which ended up being one slide about ten feet tall.The fire alarm went off every time we used the toaster and when we called about it they sent a guy who justl itteraly barged in our condo and told me in was all noramal very rudily.We never got new towel becasue we were expected to wash our own .The food is terrible and when we caled about the cleaning service we were told they come every 2 weeks would not recommmend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome time- with a few complications.”
Reviews.Author: laura-jean1997
Reviews.Content: I first went to orange lake resort the summer of 09 for Disney World and Universal studios. When we first arrived we were overwhelmed with the size fof the place. There is no possible way anyone could walk around with out getting lost. When we checked in at the front desk the staff there harraed us about the timehares. A lady named 'Stacy' hit on my dad and would not allow us to just check in and leave, proposing we stay and sit in on a timeshare meeting for about an hour or so after an 11 hour drive. Stacy continued to call our room and through out the week and harras us about the time share. When we finally got checked in we drove a long way across the resort to out 2 bedroom suite. When we walked in it was not clean by any means. The room had not been cleaned up after the last guest had left. But this issue was quickly resolved with us being put in a different suite down the hall.] The rooms themselves are very spacious and nice. The furniture is relativley new and comfortable. We were very excited when we walked in. It was extremely NICE. But after 5 days of stay we had called the front desked and asked why we had to pay a cleaning fee when no one had cleaned our rooms since we had been there the saff told us that we had to wait until th 14th day of or stay until iot got cleaned. We were only staying for 8. Then the next day we called for clean towel and they told us wed have to take the dirty ones and wash them. Bu overal this resort is very nice, large, and comfortable. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Deal On A Very Good Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jclark38251
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend booked this place well in advance. We were a bit sketchy at first beace we are a young couple, me being 23 and she being 20, and we had never stayed at such a huge resort before. When we first got there to check in we were amazed at how big it was. At the time there was not alot of people so we got to check in right away. The check in process was a bit long and we did end up giving in to the sales pitch to go on one of those timeshare presentations. That was totally worth it. We ended up doing a 90 minute tour but they paid us 75 dollars to do it, even though we didnt buy anything. That was pretty sweet because we had only paid 77 dollars per night to stay there so it was like getting a free nights stay. The room that we stayed in was probably one of the nicest I have ever stayed in. It was nice because they gave me a free upgrade!!! The pools were nice and warm and there were plently of things to do there.... golf, swim, the lazy river, putt putt, massages. They pretty much had everything. Every hotel does have its downside though. This one only had a few though. My first problem with this place was that it was so big that it kind of made it hare to find slot of things at the resort. Next was the pools. Im a pretty tall guy and the deepest part of the pool was about 5 feet. It wasnt anything major though because i was on vacation and i found other things to entertain myself. Finally the last of my cons would be the hidden fees. I booked this place about 2 and half months in advance, and thought i was done paying for it..... well i ended up by paying an extra 8 dollars a day for a resort fee and when a 250 dollar deposit for using a debit card rather than a credit card. They said ill get my deposit back within 2 weeks though but i didnt expect to have to hand over that much having already paid for the room. Overall this place was awesome and wwe will definately come back but i do recommend that if you are a younger couple like us, that you use the pools during the week cause the younger kids flood the pools on the weekends!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jenjohn10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort twice and had a great time both times. My children are 13, 10 and 6 and they all enjoyed themselves.
