Last year we visited the theme parks but this year we just hung out at the resort and did some local activities. You really could just stay a the resort and relax as there is plenty to do. Two things that I may suggest; buy or bring your own pillows as the pillows provided are very fluffy but difficult to sleep on. Second, as far as the pressuring phone calls to buy a timeshare, we unplugged the handset to eliminate that problem. Overall we love this place and would not stay anywhere else in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “do a little reserch and you will be fine”
Reviews.Author: fourxnelson
Reviews.Content: we stayed a week it was a little overwelming but once you get the shuttles down your good to go. we had no issues the staff helped the whole time we will come back---to the negative people they must have been rude or somthing but do a little practice on no because they will try a sales pitch but just tell them you can get a better deal on ebay even buy someone elses week but go before the end of may not alot of people and the parks are easy to get around anyway this is a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Did my research and still enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: c3hoeller
Reviews.Content: Upon reading many reviews of this hotel, I was a bit concerned but at minimum felt at least prepared to stay in this resort under my family's RCI timeshare ownership. I knew within 24 hours of arrival at this resort I must write a review. I just had to debunk some of the comments of the nay-sayers about this resort. Upon arrival, many were checking in and out. They had people handing out popcorn, soda and beer samples, and balloon makers for the kids. Creating a fun & service orientated environment was certainly first on their list. Because of reading reviews, I expected them to ask me to attend a timeshare "pitch", to charge me for tubes, minigolf, and watersports, and to be a cash-less resort, all of which were true. In addition, and just like other timeshare locations we have stayed, we also expected not to receive cleaning services, but to provide the necessities to maintain cleanliness of our room ourselves. Again, proven to be true. Our stay was for a week and we had more than enough dish soap, detergent, paper towels, and everything was in working order. One thing that seems to upset most of the reviewers is the timeshare pitch. We were offered, accepted to attend the "pitch", and ended up canceling our appointment without hassle. We did talk to a few folks the night before our scheduled appointment to find out about the process. They did tell us the appointment was 1 hour from the time the sales person got to you (so their appt was 2hrs). They also said there was a room and play center for you to leave your kids while you did the tour. And finally, the end result (discounts) seemed to be based on pre-qualification questions (ie. if you plan to golf, visit parks, use resort tubes) because everyone received something different. Because we traveled with a 10, 5, and 1 year old (whom I would not leave in a strange place while on a tour) we sent my husband to the meeting. They would not allow him to do the tour alone (they want both decision makers) and since I wasn't interested in being there potentially 2 hours with 3 kids, my husband asked to cancel and get our money back (we pre-paid for our discount ticket- insurance for them that we'll come I'd guess). They did try to reschedule us 2x's, but the dates didn't work with our plans so they refunded our money. No hassle and no phone calls. Doesn't sound that "Hard-sell" to me...they were just doing their job in trying to be accommodating. The discount wasn't that important to us either. All in all, the 2 bedroom unit that we had was spacious, up to date, very clean, and felt like home away from home....just the way we like it. We ate at the restaurants a handful of times and the food and service was good. The number of pools was satisfactory...we did a different pool each day we were there in between our other Orlando adventures. Each proved to provide lots of fun for my family the whole day through. There are daily activities~ many by the pools like hula hoop contests, line dances, and other entertainment~ that always brought an element of fun even if you weren't participating. The fitness facilities were satisfactory some offering more equipment than others. We met about 6-7 families who own timeshares at Orange Lake and all LOVE the resort and have come back regularly for years (most 15-20yrs). My family really enjoyed this resort and would love to go back. My suggestion is just do your homework like any other trip you plan...go to the website, know what to expect, and you can't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and convenient to the Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: MadMin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I looked for a resort that was in close proximity to the theme parks, and Orange Lake was recommended by the timeshare we currently own. This is a humungous resort- you will need wheels to get from one village to the other. A car would be very convenient since you can drive to the other villages and go off resort. But if you plan on spending most of your stay at the theme parks like we did, we opted out of the car rental and instead used the daily shuttle service that the transportation desk helped us booked to whichever park we wanted to go to for a $15-18 per person round trip. This is a timeshare, so if you expect to have a few hours of your stay interrupted by a sales pitch than it is not too hard to get through. Especially since we were able to get really good prices on the park tickets because we sat through the presentation. The 2 bedroom that we stayed in was very clean, with a master bedroom and master bath; Two queen beds in the second bedroom, another full bath, a living room, full kitchen and dining area, and enclosed porch. Love the lazy river in the newest village River Island, and the free internet everywhere is great! I am already planning our trip back here in 2011, since we didn't get to go to all the parks the first time around.

Reviews.Title: “Property is very nice, rooms are very...”
Reviews.Author: Harbins2305
Reviews.Content: Property is very nice, rooms are very large but service is horrible. Air cond was broken for 3 days, maint. came and "fixed it" after 12 hours of reporting the problem. Sales people call daily to sell you property timeshare and they are a cashless hotel. Hotel is too large to maintain service, no daily room cleaning or towels for a 6 day stay!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with villa”
Reviews.Author: laurathompson
Reviews.Content: We have owned in Orange Lake for 11 years ,this year we didn't take our own week or unit and were put into one of the older villas that had not been renovated what a disappointment we fell through the sofa, fell down a step half way across the room. The beds and pillows were very firm, all very different from the renovated villas. We will not be stopping again unless assured we were to have the upgraded amenities.

Reviews.Title: “nice place big rooms suites staff not to helpful”
Reviews.Author: gosabres1
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice but when we got there our keys to our room did not work so we called on a phone outside the hotel by the elevators they told us to come back to the desk which is about a 5 minute ride so we did and got new keys only to find out those didnt work either so i called again and they said to call maintenance which i did and waited another 20 minutes only to have to call again and then they finally came , and then we couldnt leave until someone else came and took the lock apart and fixed it all together at least 2 plus hours wasted and no real appologies it wasnt a good start. The hotel is very nice close to all parks shopping and arenas and big rooms but if your expecting hotel service this is not the place for you. They dont come in and clean daily nor do you get coffee or even toilet paper when your out your on your own need towels wash them in the washing machine in your room. So its all good as long as you know all the details up front and its not a surprise when you get there. Did enjoy having the washing machine and dryer tho came home with all clean laundry!

Reviews.Title: “Greatful Daughter Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: Share12345
Reviews.Content: We gave our daughter and a friend one week vacation at Orange Lake as a gift from college. They e-mailed almost daily with all their adventures. They said the room was beautiful (River Island) and that the service was outstanding. They enjoyed the resturants and entertainment. The location could not be any better as they were there for the theme parks which border Orange Lake. They never felt any pressure from sales people or anyone else. They just had a great week. Thank You Orange Lake for making their vacation a good one. We look forward now to our next vacation there and I know it will be just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Harrassed by timeshare sales staff”
Reviews.Author: rgb33
Reviews.Content: Recently I made of gift of my timeshare exchange to my niece for her honeymoon. On May 2, 2010, the newlyweds after a 14 hour drive arrived at the above resort. They presented the customer service rep with the guest pass and a copy of my receipts in which all costs were paid up front. They chose not to divulge all of thier personal info which included employement status. The customer representative (serious negative attitude), informed them that they could not stay in the resort unless they were gainfully employed. The representative also went further to state that they also would need to pay a 200.00 fee if they chose not to view the timeshare sales presentation provided by the resort. The newly couple, who have not traveled extensively and were made very anxious regarding the customer representatives hard nose sales attempt. They were coerced into viewing the presentation. The focus of staff is driven to sales as opposed to customer service. I was so impressed with the website for the resort that I had planned to try to coordinate a family vacation there in the next couple of years. Needless to say I will not be completing those plans. Also the resort does not except cash for any purchase.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Crackercheese
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at the resort, staff were friendly and very helpful. We had to stay an extra week because of the volanco in Iceland and they kindly let us stayed in the same villa eventhough it was booked for someone else to arrive the next day and put the arriving guest in the villa they were going to move us into. It was a relief not move the suitcases and children to another part of the resort fo the extra week even when becoming a little stressed. Food at Breezes and River Island restaurants were delicious and not over priced for a resort...family of three, main course with drinks approx US$40.00. The villa was clean which was very important to us. We had to call maintenance twice to repair the washer and fix a lamp that was not working and they showed up within 2 - 3 hours and repaired both. Everything you want on the resort is there but you pay a bit more than if you were to go to Target which is a approx. one block away from the Resort on US 192 East or Publix (5 mins drive) which is the same distance from the resort. The resort is 7 miles long so you get around the different villages on the shuttle bus or your car...you cannot walk...as the villages are far apart. We stayed in the West Village about 2 mins walk from the Clubhouse which was very convenient for us and would stay there again as it was near to the Sunset Celebration they had at the poolside each evening and my five year old daughter thoroughly enjoyed the entertainment. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sprawling complex geared toward golfers”
Reviews.Author: hungryal
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Orange Lake, using our RCI points, and found the resort units to be spacious, well appointed and comfortable. The layout of the resort was a bit impractical for us, since we didn't have a car. The shuttle was burdensome; though it travels to all the locations, it takes a long time for the shuttle to arrive at the shuttle stop. The supposed waterslide area was busy, not very imaginitive, and expensive. The lazy river, the centerpiece of their river complex, was nice, but we had hoped to have some swim up bars, which did not exist. Overall, a very nice experience in terms of our lodging, but we didn't really find the resort attractions convenient.

Reviews.Title: “River Island Grilling Company”
Reviews.Author: art666
Reviews.Content: WARNING!!! - If you happen to drift into this on-site restaurant for their buffet breakfast, be aware that each glass of beverage costs you $2.50. As soon as you sit down, they serve you a glass of orange juice even though you did NOT ask for it. No free refills for ANYTHING. Every time they refill your cup or glass with ANYTHING it's another $2.50. Unless you have tons of cash to blow, stick to WATER.

Reviews.Title: “Huge resort!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveBeaches_8
Reviews.Content: The one reason why I picked this resort was because of the waterslides and lazy river. I figured we did not need to see a water park. Did not realize that your child MUST be 48 inches to do the blue tube slide which had life guards watching the kids. You are also NOT allowed to use your own float at this pool (with the lazy river). You have to rent their tube. You may use your own float at the other pools at the resort....just not at the lazy river pool. One other slide which was smaller was unsuperived by the staff....thank goodness or my daughter would not be happy. Both kids had an awesome time there. The pool towels are smaller than the towels in the your room. One good thing....once they were wet....return them and get dry ones. Less laundry I had to do!! The resort was huge! We are not golfers, but looked great for all those golf lovers! We were in the east wing with three bedrooms which was awesome for two families. We only spent two days at the pool. The rest of the time was at Busch Gardens. Checking in was fine. The guy wanted me to go around and look at the resort....try to sell us a timeshare. I have one already....no thank you. He was not bad as what other people said it would be like. I told the guy that my husband wants to sell ours and HATES timeshares....no pressure at all after that!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: blaneygirl
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to think of this place based on some of the reviews but we really liked it. We rented a 3 bedroom place that was nice and huge! It could have slept 12. They had towel and toileties but no one cleans your place but who cares? How dirty can it really get. there was a washing mashing so wecould do our laundry before heading home. The water areas are great and saved us a ton of money instead of going to the water parks in Orlando. Drinks are reasonable, people are friendly. We'll go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the sales pitch pressure”
Reviews.Author: Sriv726
Reviews.Content: When we booked the trip, we understood that this was a timeshare resort but figured since we were booking through an internet website that we would not be bothered with the sales pitch. WRONG! After a long day of travel to get here, it took close to 40 minutes to be checked in. Upon walking into the lobby we were immediately escorted to a side room where we were first told we would be charged an $8/day amenities fee -- no mention of this when we booked the trip. We then received constant pressure to "take a tour of the facilities" which we were told would take no more than 90 minutes. The agent checking you in is very careful not the use the words "sales presentation" -- they want you to believe that it's merely a guided tour of all the resort has to offer. The tour was over 2 hours and you see none of the resort. You are taken from one sales presentation building to another to a 4-bedroom "signature" condo back to a sales presentation building. We then had to meet with THREE different salesmen trying to get us to buy a timeshare. Once they realize that you do not want to buy, you are left on the sidewalk outside of the building (which is nowhere near where you left your car) to wait for a shuttle. The 2-bedroom/2-batch condo that we stayed in was nice, although the master bathroom was a little strange -- toilet was in a separate "closet" and there are no shelves in the shower for shampoo/conditioner/etc. The waterpark on site is a good way to spend a lazy day, although again you are nickeled & dimed....$9 rental charge for a tube for the lazy river which is required if you want to go into the lazy river. The rooms do not have internet access which is a drawback. We would recommend to a friend, but only with a warning!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but be prepared to do a lot of walking and driving”
Reviews.Author: tfmelvin
Reviews.Content: It may be the most attractive and best-kept resort in the Orlando area but there are some things you should know. The resort is huge and getting from one area to another is not easy. The roadways within the resort are terribly confusing making it very difficult to access friends rooms, restaurants, pools, activities and shops. We had to drive around and around to try to get where we were going since we were not within walking distance of anything. The on-property shuttle is not consistant and may require a "transfer" to another shuttle. Our room was perfect and the pools were nice but not enough to have my family stay again. Check-in was an hour long. After airports, renting a car (the hotel does not have any airport or park transportation), driving, entering the wrong entrance and listening to 3 very hungry and tired kids, the long check-in was not welcomed. The icing on the cake was that the property is cash-free which would have been handy to know before our arrival. Orange Lake, take note, perhaps you should send a welcome packet including the cash-free policy and the check-in speech. My overall experience at the resort was not pleasant which, as a Holiday Inn owner, I regret to say.

Reviews.Title: “a great resort but DO YOUR HOMEWORK”
Reviews.Author: ChefFatCat
Reviews.Content: Time and time again I read about people complaining about all the little things Orange lake does not do. They did not clean my room daily - I had to wash my own towels - I had to bring in my own toiletries - I was bugged to go to a time share meeting - etc. People for the LAST TIME GET IT THROUGH YOUR HEADS - THIS IS A TIME SHARE NOT A HOTEL. OK now that I got that out of my system lets talk about how great Orange Lake is. It is located right on Hwy 192, just a couple of miles from Disney. It is right in the center of all the action and around many great restaurants and shopping centers. The resort is huge and very well maintained. Even though there is a free shuttle that takes you throughout the resort, a car is highly recommended. I have a wonderful 6th floor 2 bedroom condo on River Island - which in my opinion is the best spot of the resort. There is the newly renovated West village which is made up of mostly housing style units on street settings. The East and North villages which are surrounded by golf course settings and are mostly condo style, and River Island condos which surround a tropical oasis. The units are very well maintained with all the amenities such as a full kitchen, washer and dryer, 2 full baths, ample TV sets, balcony, A/C etc. Some of the older units are being remodelled as we speak, so request a new unit if this is available to you. Orange Lake has a multiple supply of pools, activities, jogging and walking areas, wildlife, golf, tennis, kids activities etc that you can never leave this resort and not get bored. It is important to remember that this is a home away from home. You will do your own mid week cleaning, laundry, have the option of cooking your own meals and bring in most of your own toiletries. They do give you a nice little starter kit when you arrive complete with paper towels, toilet paper, coffee, garbage bags etc but you will need more before the week is over. If this does not suit you then don't stay here - go to Disney or comparable and pay over 3 times the price for the luxury of "maid service". Since Orange lake is a timeshare, they will ask you to come down to a sales presentation. If this is not in your plans simply decline - be firm about it as they will push you to come - simply say no thanks and end it there - they will not bother you again as they know you are not a buyer and will waste their time. I have been going to Orange Lake now for 6 years and I absolutely love it. It is not perfect but then again what is. They are always upgrading and improving every time I go. I highly recommend this resort for all, but research it first online - get all the answers - know what you are getting in to and decide if it is right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome -- I would visit again!!!”
Reviews.Author: razzyfrazzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 4-day stay at the hotel with our year-old baby. We were given a room in the West Village right in the clubhouse. The room was beautiful and spacious-- we had a kitchen and small dining set that was a good enough size. We had a microwave and fridge and even a dishwasher. The property is on a great location, right on 192 which I discovered is where most of the shopping/activities are. It's very close to a Super Target where we got some supplies for our room. Our baby enjoyed the stay as well, although we were mostly outdoors for vacation. We did take her swimming one of the days to the North Village pool complex called the Splash Lagoon. It was great, not crowded at all. The water was a little cold but it was a sunny day so it was fine. About the resort being a cashless one, they told us right away, so no big deal with that. They do try to get you to go to those tours they have. One day they called us and I said I'd think about it and the next day they called again, my husband was asleep and he just picked up the phone and hung it back up. They're not pesky or anything, they just try to pitch it to you if you sound interested. All in all, I would come back here again. We're probably coming back next year with my parents and sisters. It was a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: amberleemay
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! The rooms were very spacious and the pools were A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! By far the best place we have stayed in Orlando. Besides the pools, they also have shuffleboard, an arcade, racquetball, tennis, mini golf, 4 golf courses, etc. So much to do on one resort - you don't even have to leave the resort to have a great time. This is a timeshare place, but we were not bugged at all about buying, and we did not have to attend any meetings. In fact, it was not even mentioned which was perfect! My husband and I live about an hour away from Orlando, so we go to Orlando quite often. We like to stay for the weekend a lot of times, and this time we stayed at Orange Lake Resort with another couple in one of the two-bedroom suites. It was nicely decorated with lots of space. The kitchen was nice to have - we made our own food while we were there to save some extra money. We did not go to any of the restaurants, but based on the $2.50 soda at the pool bar, we decided it would be best to dine in the room. The beds and sofas are not the best, but not horrible. They could use an upgrade in that area. And the pillows are very thick - I think they are high quality, but I enjoy a much flatter pillow. Overall, I would highly recommend this resort, and I will be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - lots to do for teenagers”
Reviews.Author: gcr23
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of nights at Orange Lake - not enough time to experience all it had to offer. The condo was huge, very clean, very comfortable. Our boys loved the lazy river and all the amenities. The pro shop at the Legends Golf club was very accommodating to my eldest son allowing him to play for the junior rate and let mum drive the buggie, it was a beautiful course. The staff was very helpful, had fun at the Legends restaurant with all the tvs. Seen the comments about checking in, we had no problems, were asked if we would go on a tour for money but declined politely as we did not have enough time and were not hassled. There were a couple of messages about offers on the in-house phone but nothing to get annoyed about, we just deleted them. Would love to return and spend some more time there but how you fit in the Orlando attractions and everything Orange Lake has to offer we are not sure.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't as bad as it seems”
Reviews.Author: lorymoose12
Reviews.Content: Soon as we arrived the room was ready. I really don't have any chief complaints except for after we toured and checked out the next morning we left everything on the card and it seems as though they took back the same money that you toured with and charged it to our room. We don't even have a clue why we were charged an extra 109.00 dollars for. Also that was seperate from the amenities that we used while on property. But all in all if i had to stay there again I would because of it's cleaniness and hospitality was surperb.

Reviews.Title: “Week gone bad”
Reviews.Author: DrD1
Reviews.Content: I was told the $7.95 daily room charge that you pay is for "the pool towels and the "free" internet," so that is why your room isn't cleaned the entire time you are staying in the $300 a night "hotel". Not only isn't your room cleaned, you are charged extra if you ask for clean towels, but you can wash them yourself. Sounds like a great vacation activity, doesn't it. Also, after using 2 rolls of toilet paper by the 6th night of our stay we were told, at 10 p.m. after a day at Disney, that you are on your own after the second roll. Why wasn't that in the room description? Last complaint - it is a cashless resort. Everything must be charged to your room or on your credit card since it is an easier way to lose track of your spending.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our month stay.”
Reviews.Author: laing1
Reviews.Content: We stayed Feb 28th to March 28th so really were able to get the "feel" for the place. Check in We arrived at noon so were not expecting to get into our room but it was ready. There were a few people in line so not so bad but I was selected? to go to an off area office- and later another 2 couples were escorted here. I let the girl know I was "up" on my knowledge of the resort having read pages and pages of reviews from Trip Advisor. I requested a tower room not a villa but despite her trying to get one I couldn't get one as we were here too long. It makes sense as an owner might come in during that time and we would have to move. Well then we start in on the breakfast spiel. "Nope but thanks.." Long story short she held my Visa "hostage" while appealing to my sensibilites to go to the "breakfast". Smiling I reminded her she didn't get me the tower bldg.... so no deal. (place happy face here)....So on to our villa. THE VILLA We are right around the corner (I'm still here) from the West village. Everything is a 5 min walk. We are off the main road on Sandhill (2401) and our back yard is the 17th green for The Reserve golf course. Thank G.. we did not get in the tower. We LOVE it here. Groceries? walk 'em right in no elevator -- tons of sunshine front and back . Reminder to you that there is limited sun in tower and screens in front of ea bacony. We have a 100% view of the Disney fireworks down the fairway so no obstructions, We sit inside and watch them every night. Walked into the villa and simply went "OMG.." It is perfect. Granite counters breakfast bar w/ 3 comfy stools. Dining room table ready for 6. Walk further in and down a step into the living area -2 couches one which could become a bed both comfortable huge desk for my computer (free wi-fi) large screen flat swivel tv safe located in cabinet underneath.All the decor is south seas. Excellent taste whom ever did the decorating all furniture top notch. 2 bedrooms one front one back ea has their own ensuite. Our bedrom is a king size bed sliding 8 ft? glass doors so most of the room All of this villa was spotless. Houskeeping Each week they come in on Mon. all new bedding/ towels/dust tables/vacuum/leave a welcome pack of Tide (3) dishwasher soap(3) paper towels /tissue / tpaper dish soap salt pepper so quite happy w/ the amount they leave. Again most pleased with the cleanliness. Breezes This is the action area of West Village. Restaurant prices are good. They often have a disc jockey playing a good variety of songs lots of activities for the kids 2 huge pools one more so for the kids as shallow and water spouts- the other deeper and quieter with more seniors. Most days (quiet pool) at 2 there is" Bingo" playing 5/6 games with cash pots from say $100 to $200 and up depending on the number of people playing. Here you can use cash. $5. for 6 boards. Yes you either use your Visa or the card they give you to charge everything. It sure adds up quickly so be careful. At 4 there is Happy hour and drinks are 1/2 price BUT only certain drinks so ask. There is a small sand beach with a surprising # of watercraft that you can rent. No swimming as too many boats make it dangerous plus water is a strange colour not making it particularly appealing. This is not really a "lake" as so small and it is more of one of the many holding areas of water with Florida being so close to sea level. Golfing We golfed twice at The Reserve and the prices not too bad. There are lots of specials every week including half price golf club rentals. It depends on where you want to golf as to when and where you will find the specials. They give you coupons at the gate and it tells you what is the special of the day. Each day as well they will leave messages on your phone as to happening events. Final Summary We have really enjoyed our stay here and would come back in 4 years. Please note that folks that own here have huge maintenance fees. One lady we spoke to has owned for 20 years paid $10,000 for 1 week then ended up w/ another unit so now 2 and she pays $750 /week each unit for fees. We feel a little humbled to only pay the RCI fee. Yes our experience is that this is a really good gold crown resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - GREAT Facilities for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: Bugsy56
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks at the Holiday Inn Club - Orange Lake, Kissimmee Florida. We had stayed here last year and decided to return for 2 weeks this year. Even 'tho the weather was about 5 degrees cooler than normal, we were pleased that the all the pools and River Island had heated water. The units are well appointed and if you DO need something, just call Housekeeping and they will quickly accommodate. We were there during School Break and it was busy, but Housekeeping followed up with a phone call later in the day just to ensure that everything was 'up to par'. Although we didn't have little kiddies with us, I was really impressed with the changes this year, particularly for the children. All restaurants on the property were offering Kid's Meals for under $5, with a free dessert! The 2 for 1 coupons in the Resort Book that they give you on check-in was great for visiting Legacy Bar at night.....can't beat $4 for TWO Blue Moon beers...in a nice setting. The grounds are well maintained and CLEAN. Every night they had activities around the resort and we decided to try things this year......it was great! Don't miss the Welcome Party on Sunday Nights....great food & fun at no cost! Our teenagers had fun attending too. For St. Patrick's Day, they had celebrations at a number of restaurants......and you didn't feel as tho you had to 'eat' there to participate. Hat's off to the Staff at Orange Lake! I think, they 'got it' and are trying to become truly family-oriented..... I wouldn't hesitate to recommend staying here, at any of the villages.

Reviews.Title: “I was worried for nothing”
Reviews.Author: CoolJCPA
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Orlando. We had been wanting to take the kids to Disney for a long time, but simply didn't want to spend a ton of money on staying at Disney. We had the chance to stay here for about $650 for a 2 bedroom unit for a weeks stay in the East Village. We just had to sit through a 2 hour time-share presentation. I then read the reviews on here describing a very painful and high pressure sales presentation. I must say I was worked up for nothing. We spent the first 1.5 hour of the tour looking at the property and hearing the sales pitch. The last 30 minutes we met with 4 different people trying to complete a sale. We simply said "NO" and responded with "We are not interested". They were polite and said thanks and we got our voucher for 2 tickets to Sea World and left. They were herding people through there like cattle and it didn't look like they were selling many. I also heard horror stories regarding check-in. It took 10 minutes. Also, we would get 1 call a day around lunch describing the activities for the day, but no sales calls. Regarding the property, it was beautiful. We didn't use the pools or restaurants, but it was pretty and about a 10 minute drive to Disney. I will stay there again, but found out that you can get good deals on Craigslist and book a week from an owner on Craigslist and not sit through the presentation. Again, I was very impressed with the property, but not to buy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but the pools were too cold to swim in....”
Reviews.Author: LYeary
Reviews.Content: this resort is nice, has pretty pools, jacuzzis, etc., but the pools were way too cool to swim in comfortably. My husband and I went to a disney resort also, the coronado and the pool was like bath water, very comfortable and fun. Yes, this resort has a beauiful pool system at river island, but if it's too cold to swim in, who cares? i answered the phone once for the time share pitch, and told the lady i had lost my job and was not in a position to buy anything, never heard from them again, this little white lie gave me some peace...we did see the pitch area, it's terrible and high pressure. don't go.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort,”
Reviews.Author: ireneflorida
Reviews.Content: having just purchased 2 weeks at orange lake. (bought from private company) I did not appreciate the fact that i had to queue up for over 45 mins with just 2 people being served at any one time, only to being bombarded by someone trying to sell me more, we only purchased 3 weeks Before arriving at the resort and didnt like the hard sell when we had just spent 14hours travelling, despite our bad start we have only good things to say about the resort, all staff are pleasant, other than the booking in people, the resort is well maintained, the unit was Spotlessly clean and we look forward to many more visits to orange lake

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan_12372
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and and another couple. We loved the facilities. The grounds were absolutely beautiful and well maintained. There were tons of activities to do. We stayed in the West Village in a fab 2-bedroom, where each couple had their own bathroom and bedroom. Kitchen was great. Pools were nice. The only downside were the staff harrassing us everyday with phone calls for one promotion or another. Check-in is also very annoying. We went late in the evening and the line was long and each rep spends at least 30 with each client with their sales pitch and all. The woman we had was nice, but very slow and I just wanted to process my own information and get behind that desk. Even when we turned her down on the offers, she still tried to convince us and repeated herself and asked us the same questions three times about whether we like golfing, etc. We had answered her the same everytime. Once we got out of that, it wasn't too bad. The resort was well located. It was close to many restaurants, Target, liquor stores, Publix grocery store, and many conveniences. It was also a short drive to shopping or to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Scam- Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: golfingisthebest
Reviews.Content: When booking a hotel in Cleveland OH I was asked if I wanted an opportunity to stay at their Orange Lake resort in Orlando some time in the next year for $99.00 3 day/2 night stay. I would have all of the luxuries of the resort available to me including pools, golf, tennis, fitness etc. I said sure - what a mistake! I had to pay $199 up front and I paid an additoional 195 for an extra 3 nights and only found out LATER that I and my wife also had to attend a timeshare sales seminar for 2 hours and then we would get a voucher for $100 but the voucher could only be applied to the next Holiday Inn vacation. When we arrived they had us staying at Holiday INN sunspree resort. This is not a resort but is simply an upscale motel/hotel (more motel - a nice motel) with a pool that is >10 MILES OFF THE ORANGE LAKE RESORT. Our flight was delayed and we arrived around midnight. We went directly to Sunspree from the airport as my children were very tired (thinking at the time the Sunspree motel/hotel WAS on the resort). When I went to check in at Sunspree they told me I had to check in at the Orangle lake resort then come back to Sunspree. No transportation was provided and cab fare is $30 ONE WAY. I was confused because I thought I was on the resort. Thanks for misleading ME. Thanks for ruining my familys winter vacation. We wanted to stay on a resort and that's what I was lead to believe. Its not what they said, its what they didn't say that was very deceptive. In talking to the Sunspree staff and the cab drivers I was told I was by no means the first person fooled by this. The Sunspree nightly rate at the time of year is about $100/night. So do the math from the info above and you will find out (mainly because you have to pay for transportation to and from the Orange lake resort) I received no deal whatsoever. Also they booked our timeshare sales seminar at 12:30 pm which completely kills 1 or 4 days of our vacation. My kids very very upset and bored. I was extremely mad, so much they just cancelled the time share sales seminar since they had no hope in [--] of me ever buying one after they mislead ans mistreated us. If you want me to get interested in your resort and buy a timeshare - wouldn't it be prudent to have us stay on the resort??? This is the second very negative experience I have had in Florida in the past two years. In conclusion our young family (who travels annually) is finished with Holiday INN and related properties, finished with Florida and finished with the USA. We will instead go to family oriented all inclusive resorts in the Bahamas, Mexico or Cuba like normal Canadians.

Reviews.Title: “When we arrived it was late, I had two...”
Reviews.Author: Duffer2010
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it was late, I had two sleeping kids in the car. I entered the lobby to find three parties in line to check in. There were 4 out of 20+ terminals in operation and after about 5 minutes the party in front of me turned to me and said "we've been here 15 minutes". I had read the reviews about the strong armed sales at OL so I assume the check in process includes a sales pitch. The line began to groan and Someone flagged down another employee who looked available only to get a blank shake of the head. The same 4 people who were checking in were there after 20 minutes. 20 minutes! I finally said something to what appeared to be a manager and they got the line moving. Over 20 minutes to check in. I was steaming and the poor guy checking me in did his best to avoid any attempt at prolonging the process. After getting to our room the phone Baganda to ring. I made the mistake of answering it. It was a sales associate checking to see if everything was alright. Apparently she didn't know about the check in fiasco and after all it was almost 10 pm and my kids were in bed trying to sleep. We stayed there three nights and the phone rang no less than 5 times a day. I never answered them. I can only imagine.

Reviews.Title: “The timeshare vampires and construction noise really spoil this paradise”
Reviews.Author: tripster616
Reviews.Content: Lovely accommodations (east village bldg 86200) except we were awoken every morning by construction crew who were running lour machinery as they were refiniching the exterior stucco. Then the phone would ring with sales bots bothering us to spend spend spend........... My sense is that they are desperate to squeeze you for every possible dime. Perhaps timeshare sales are in the toilet. Why spend 40,000 for a time share to visit once a year only to be nickeled and dimed at every turn???

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jennabebe38
Reviews.Content: My inlaws have a time share at orange lake and they've been going for years, It was my first time there with my husband and it was wonderful! lots to do on the resort and lots to do off as well and so close to the parks!!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: newtraveler1111
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing! It is huge, it has a waterpark, stores, golf and more! I would recommend this to EVERYONE! Whether you want to just chill in the sun or go out to the sites, this resort is the place to stay. Obviously, it is not within walking distance of any major attractions so we had a rental car for the week. We had a two bedroom villa for three people. One room had two twins and another a queen/king. Each room had its own bathroom! There was a balcony, a large kitchen, dining room and living room. You will not regret staying here! There is shuttle that takes you around the resort for free! I will be going back! Very impressive resort! As for the previous comments about phone calling for timeshares, we never received one call. We had one phone call and it was the staff asking us how our stay was going and if there was anything they could help us with. We also went to get tickets to disney right on the resort. The staff was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “First Disney family vacation”
Reviews.Author: carr0004
Reviews.Content: The place was okay. Very open and big so walking to all amenities is out of the question. My biggest complaint about the place is at check in. We waited for 20 minutes to get to check in and their was only 1 person in front of us. Then the worst part about the trip was that I had to give a credit card for incidentals. I handed the sales rep my debit card with visa logo and he said that if I used a credit card it would be back in the account immediately at checkin. They don't take cash so they asked that everything get charged to the room and we can pay with our debit card or with cash at departure. I usually don't like having credit cards so I said, only if you guarantee that my credit card does not get charge. I only have a $200 credit for things like this. So the rep guarantee that I wouldn't get charged. Little did I know until after my trip ended at the checkout that he charged $39.00 on my credit card on the same day he told me to my face that nothing would get charged. This was for incidentals. If I had known that, I would have not given my credit card. Then on checkout time at 10:00 a.m. I go to settle my bill with my debit card and found out that they charged my credit card for the food charges that morning at 6:00 a.m. when they weren't supposed to. All the front desk girl said was, sorry, that wasn't supposed to happen. Now, being that I was promised nothing get charged to my credit card when I questioned it twice before handing it over, got two charges on my card. They eventually refunded on the credit card and charged my debit card but their word meant nothing. I told the CSR that I can use my company credit card if nothing gets charged so that it would release when I check out right away and use my debit card to pay. Now , company credit card has been charged twice and my boss will probably be revoking my card and possibly losing my job because the service at this place is shady. I called downstairs to ask questions about disney parking and it went into voicemail and 10 minutes later, a csr calls back to sell me on a timeshare meeting. She didn't know anything about my voicemail that I left for disney parking questions. We had to unplug our phone's so it won't ring in the mornings everyday out there selling us on going to their timeshare breakfast meetings. It was like getting a root canal finding someone at the front desk at any hour of the day to answer any questions. Also, the hallways in the club house smelled like old moth balls. I would not recommend any one go here. When they make a mistake, they just shift the blame to a nameless person and then that was it...

Reviews.Title: “average resort with potential to be nice, but would not recommend now”
Reviews.Author: ashleyJM
Reviews.Content: Check-in: was fast and they offered complimentary cups of beer, pop and wine. Also during check-in is when they try to pitch the time share breakfast. My husband and I have been to A LOT of timeshare presentations in Mexico and they offer tons of great stuff, including free spa, hundreds off your bill and discounted excursions. This place offers a lousy $40 per couple!! That would pay for just a couple drinks!! Personally, we did not find it worth it at all and simply told them we were not interested. She then said, ok I will give you $60 to go... again we did not find it worth it especially we weren't planning on spending much time at the resort. Don't plan on getting discounted disney/universal tickets through the timeshare presentation... however, we did get Universal/disney tickets from those shady looking booths along the highway that say "discounted tickets." You do have to do a timeshare presentation through Westgate, it was just fine, lasted 2 hours one morning and we received half-price 2-park universal tickets. Golf: my husband golfed and he suggests not booking through the resort. Book through wholesale webites (teetimesusa). He met some owners while golfing and even they had to pay more to golf than my husband did through the website. The Reserve was below average- the grass was more brown than green. Legends is a decent course if you get it at the right price-the bar there also had decent food. Neither course is worth paying retail price for. Room: do not stay in the west village!! Any other village would be better. We stayed in the west and the rooms were below average hotel rooms with a stinky hallways!! The beds were okay, however the worst part about our whole experience was that they only gave us 3 towels and they expect you to use those the whole week! After long days at disney, we would come home and have to call for fresh towels everyday--and they would only bring 2 at a time!! Also, they weren't planning on cleaning the room for the whole week either, until I called and they offered to clean it once! Not very good service at all! The property: We would recommend this property for families with young kids/.pre-teens because the pools did look nice with lots of activities. It is a cashless resort. No spa. It was apprx. 10 min away from Disney which was nice and their are no tolls between the resort and disney. The shuttle to disney from the resort costs $16 per person!!! Disney charges $14 per car. THe resort had potential to be very nice (the pics on the internet look very nice) however, they need to update the rooms, and provide much better guest service! We come to realize on this vacation that sometimes it's the little things the resorts do for you is what counts--and this one did not pull through!!

Reviews.Title: “HIGH PRESSURE SALE FOR TIMESHARE UNITS”
Reviews.Author: CowboyDave1
Reviews.Content: Pros: beautiful resort, multiple pools and golf courses (read other reviews for what Orange Lake Resort has to offer.) Cons: NO breakfast (certainly not a continental breakfast as promised at check-in). Only coffee and small sugar donuts and muffins. Presentation: Very high pressure by "nice, friendly" associates. I'm basically reconfirming what others have said ...presentation NEVER lasts only 60 minutes no matter how many times you say "NO". We had to see four different sales people for probably eight different offers (units available for use every year as well as every other year) from approximately $6,000 to $30,000. They start offer with highest price/points and progressively move lower (making it appear that each deal is "better"). As previously noted by others, this is a points system timeshare. So if you're really interested in purchasing, try to get the highest points for the lowest price possible What totally upset me .... this is not an "exclusive" resort as stated in the presentation. Anyone can return to this resort by reserving units through "Holiday Inn" .... rates at approximately $150 night for one bedroom, $180 night for two bedroom and $230 night for three bedroom. For about $1,500 for a week you could stay at Orange Lake for a number of years without having the ownership obligation of taxes and annual maintenance fees. (Although it sounds nice, forget about the promises of "fixed cost" vacations for your grandchildren.) In our presentation, it was stated we could purchae extra points form $20 per 1,000 points; yet a previous review indicated they had an offer to purchase 1,000 points for only $10. I guess everything is negotiable at Orange Lake. My basic caution to the uninformed .... timeshares are NOT a real estate investment. They depreciate faster than a new car ..... meaning they don't have much value in the resale market.. Also, while the initlal sales price is fixed, annual maintenance fees generally increase each year . So, if you decide to attend a presentation don't later say you haven't been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place , Very high pressure sales presentation . Low value.”
Reviews.Author: TeddySavannah
Reviews.Content: Very high pressure sales , almost to the point of kidnapping and being held hostage . Would not recommend purchasing timeshare . yearly maintenance fee alone would pay for a motel with the same amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: butterflysweeti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is Huge, and I mean HUGE. Very beautiful grounds. Friendly staff. When we checked in at 1:00 pm, it took about 1/2 hour, but we were able to check in early which was good. We had reserved two rooms (there were seven in our family). For the first room, we were upgraded to a suite. We were so excited. Then we were asked, "Do you want to take a tour of the property". We thought sure, that way we will know where the pools and different things are (since they are all spread out - you couldn't walk to them. You would have to drive or take the shuttle that comes once every half hour) When the first room was asssigned to our upgraded suite, and we had now agreed to the tour (which turned out to be the timeshare presentation), there was not a second suite for the other room - and we would have been seperated by a 10 minute drive!!! I was furious! We were given an upgrade for one, but not the other, and therefore we given nothing!! Being a family - we were planning on eating breakfast and dinners together; we had one vehicle, and did not want to be on different sides of the hotel! A few rooms down the hall or something would of been one thing! The timeshare the next morning was a complete waste of time. The man was very friendly, but we are from Canada and had no intention on buying into the timeshare. We were told we would be having breakfast there. Our appointment was for 9:30 am. Breakfast consisted of sugar donuts & muffins. The "tour" we received was a tour of the room we could of had - if we were upgraded..... but we didn't. And they really play on your heartstrings too - just think - you are investing in your grandchildren's future. The timeshare also works on a POINTS system. So you need enough points to book for a specific week during a certain month - it was pretty confusing. The price started at $40,000 and then went down to $7,500 and we could visit every two years. Crazy! By the time we said NO to the timeshare to four different people and about 4 hours later....... we could finally start our day, and headed to the pool. The pools were really great. The lazy river was freezing and not worth the $8 we paid for the tubes to go around once, freeze, and have water poured all over our head under every bridge. Our youngest, who was 4, was using a floating tube that we purchased at their gift shop to help her swim, and she was told she couldn't used it in that pool! So we didn;t go back to the lazy river pool. The one at the main hotel was warmer & better anyways. The hotel is very close to shopping & dinning & Disney. We did have a really fun time. My husband & brother-in-law went golfing & loved it. And it actually was not that expensive!!! ** NOTE: The DO NOT ACCEPT CASH ON PROPERTY! We did not know this. Everything is billed to your room. You can then go to the lobby and pay each night or at the end of your stay, but if you just want an ice cream, a drink or a postcard - it must go on to your room number! Plus there is a $9 a night charge. Which we also did not know when we originally booked. We would consider going back to this hotel since it was really close to things and the pools were good, but we would never invest in a timeshare or stay for longer than a week. Hope this review was a little helpful in planning your trip. Don't hesitate to email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “~THE BEST STAY OF THEM ALL~”
Reviews.Author: Derek9509
Reviews.Content: This place was the right place for me and my new wife.Was so pefect, not one thing i have ever seen comes close to the time we shared in the lazy river!~

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: thedipman
Reviews.Content: stay away they have only one goal get as much money out of you as they can. lie if gets them what they wont.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good-Couple of Things to Look out for though”
Reviews.Author: ChayaNoelle
Reviews.Content: We traveled with two other families and our two children (11 and 7), seven children in all. It was for the purpose of visiting Disney and experiencing a good resort on the off days. The pool, lazy river, mini putt and golf courses were all very cool. Not much is free and nothing is cheap. The pool and towels are free, tubes, mini putt are not. The children did not tire of the pool and mini golf. We used these for the 2-3 days of downtime. None of the water in the pools is deep so it might not satisfy our older children (left them home). The room was very nice and clean. There too they don't give you anything. In each room most bathrooms had only one roll of TP per bathroom. one roll of paper towel, three boxes of laundry detergent, no dish liquid or cloths for doing dishes. There is a dishwasher but only a few complimentary packets were provided. The timeshare sales pitch, I put them off at the desk but he "Mike" at the registration desk insisted that it is at 7:45 and 61 minutes you are out of there. With pressure from the others we were staying with to get some deals we relented and agreed to hear the pitch. They charged your credit card $30, refundable if you show up. We arrived at 7:45, waited in line to get processed and waited in a side room for an agent to come and get us. Now it was 8:20 ish. Some difficulty registering one of our couples they said. We told the agent we were gone at 8:46 as promised by Mike. That sent things into a whirlwind. The agent (very nice-one would say sweet) said the presentation would take 90 minutes. We said thanks but no thanks and give us back our money. The manager said we would be on the road at 9:10. It was now 8:40. We agreed to stick it out to get the deals. The agent gave us an express run through the pitch then walked us out. I am looking at my watch, it is about 9:15. Not bad....except she was walking us to a demo condo to continue the pitch. Now I got angry. She took us back into the pressure pit. Her next manager came out but in 30 seconds he knew to escalate this. The next manager came out, 30-60 seconds later they are going to get the 'guy ' who gives you the vouchers to get the deals. You travel to the desk and then you have to decide what deals to take right now because you can't come back to get the same deals later. I tell you all this that you can decide for yourself. Don't bring your kids with you because the daycare is a little playground that they have to use for the 90 minutes your gone to somewhere else in this big resort. In the east village you are next to some pretty nasty smelling stuff. It varies in intensity. Sometimes we didn't smell it at all. Two nights we couldn't open our windows and walking to your car in the morning you didn't feel like breathing-had to though, too far to make it. While golfing we could hear the Animal Kingdom Safari P.A.'s on one or two holes. The smell on some holes almost brought you to your knees. It affected my golf score! Just another excuse. The resort says the smell is Animal Kingdom but while in the Kingdom you never smell it. I am not sure it isn't the marsh all around or the dead fish that the vultures eat and leave around the golf course. Who knows? If you want ,google Orange Lake County stench and see what comes up. The little 9 hole course you can golf at night for $35-40 including rentals and a few golf balls, (tees are complimentary) and your children can golf with you for free. That was nice. The ball rolls a long way on that kind of grass that is all brown. The greens were better though. Oh! The online internet access is free in your room!!! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: MaxineMadison
Reviews.Content: Our villa was wonderful - cleaned and well maintained. My only complaint is that I felt like someone could look into the bedroom and living room with only sheer curtains. The placed was "stocked" with things like coffee, dishwashing soap, TP, etc. to get you through the first day or so - we bought TP and soap, but otherwise we were good for a week! Lots of things to do at the resort = the Lazy River was fantastic, but we could only look because of husband's injury. Minature golf and regular golf, pools, eating places, you name it, it was there. I HATED getting the daily "robo" calls about golf. The prices for miscellaneous things is high, and you do get charged for EVERYTHING. I wanted to print out boarding passes for our flight home, and I had to use their computer and had to pay for it. The minature golf price seemed high, but then we don't usually play minature golf. Overall, it was extremely nice and convenient. I did feel a little "nickled and dimed" though.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: emptynestmother
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a problem checking in, but then Went down hill after that. The girl said we were staying in newly renovated section, we stayed in east village . It was ok but never again, it was too far to go any where,drive to exercise, we did have a small pool, but to cool to use it.Please people if you are reading this, don't do the timeshare meeting. We were there Three hours,unless you want to buy. pressure,and more pressure.

Reviews.Title: “not a hotel, time share location”
Reviews.Author: MplsMnVacationhound
Reviews.Content: I have been in alot of hotels throughout the country, I stayed in the west village that is comparable to a HOTEL suite. When you enter the room, you go right to the bedroom which is located right next to the hallway, you hear talking and doors closing constantly. They try to sell time shares throughout the stay. Housekeeping and towels are at extra cost. Shuttle to the theme parks are at extra cost. IF YOU WANT A TIME SHARE CHECK INTO IT, BUT IF YOU WANT HOTEL THIS IS NOT THE PLACE TO STAY

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: 23Vacationer
Reviews.Content: This was the best RCI resort I have stayed at in recent years. It would be entirely possible to not leave the resort at all during the week. There are tons of things to do onsite, the only downside to this is it felt like there were too many activities with fees. For example, extremely beautiful lazy river, but you have to rent the the tubes. Also, they have 4 mini golf courses but we had to buy a week pass to them (only $30 at the timeshare presentation for 8 people to golf the whole week). The prices weren't too outrageous, it just would be nice if more of these things were included in the price of the stay. The pools were kept at 80 degrees, which meant that we used them even on days that might've been a little too cold to swim normally. There are signs saying not to bring snacks/drinks into the pool area, but we brought a cooler in and nobody had any problems with it. Both of the restuarants we ate at in the resort (Breezes and River Island Grilling Company) had good food. We went to the timeshare presentation, it wasn't bad. Didn't last longer than an hour and a half and we received $40 for food and drinks at the resort. Just practice saying no. Overall, it was a great vacation, and the resort had a lot to do with making it a fun time!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with a fun sunset celebration”
Reviews.Author: AlohaMamaMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and wish we would have had more time to hang out at the resort. Our first night we went to the sunset celebration and it was really cute for the kids with a hula hoop contest and balloon swords for the boys. Great walking/running trails and the staff was very friendly. The weather was too cold for the lake or pool for our family but they looked great. Also the units were very nice and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “caution think before you purchase”
Reviews.Author: wannabe778
Reviews.Content: Prior to purchasing check out how many point you get for your unit, the cost of the points if you run out is $10.00 per 1000 point which sounds great, a 2 bedroom place in the beginning of march in River Island cost an owner 200,000 points, another words it would cost an owner 2,000.00 if you related it to money. You can get on line and rent the same place the same date for $1,450.00 saving you $500.00 which means other than saying you own it you are spending more than you need to just to be an owner. That is how they take care of the people that purchase from them, they rent to outsiders cheaper than their own who keep the place going. I'm sure not many people have figured this out, however the place is beautiful, has lots to do, they keep it up, and it has great golf. I just think it stinks that they charge owners more than the public, so rent don't buy.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: tinaina
Reviews.Content: Staff was great, so helpful! The perfect getaway for families or just for 2! Would highly recommend and would definitely stay there again! Beautiful condos, beautiful grounds, lots to do just on the property alone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Ugly Timeshare Pitch”
Reviews.Author: longinforabeach
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week visit to Orange Lake. It is a very large resort with the reception and check in area in the West Village. We were given a beautiful large and renovated 2 bedroom Villa in the West Village area of the resort. I had read all the previous comments about the timeshare presentations, but even so we were convinced to go to "Welcome Breakfast" the following morning. We were told breakfast would be provided and it would be a maximum of an hour. Also that there were activities for the children. When we arrived for our welcome tour, we were told we could leave our 7 year old son in the childcare centre. It was monitored and they provided activities and snacks. But then we were taken to another area of the resort. 1.5 hours of HARD sell later and we were finally released from the timeshare presentation and taken back to where our son was. I almost felt like crying. Just say no to this timeshare presentation unless you are seriously thinking of buying something. After this being said, this is a beautiful resort with lots of activities for people of all ages. The activity people were great with our kids and we had lots of fun. When we were there kids under 10 golfed free at the Legend Walk Course. The pools are all heated so even though it was chilly we still were able to swim. The sunset celebration at Breezes was fun and I would recommend the River Island Grill for dinner. Our meal was great and all restaurants have a kids menu. All areas of Disneyworld are about a 10 minute drive from the resort. We chose to drive and park right there. It is $14.00 to park for the day and you can use that pass at more than one park a day if you are hopping around. This way we were able to move about on our time schedule. I would definately go back back to Orange Lake but would avoid the "Welcome Breakfast"

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare experience ruined our stay”
Reviews.Author: jerseyshoregolfer
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare unit for an Orlando stay with our children and grandchild. RCI offered us a 3 bedroom in this resort and we looked forward to our stay for over one year. We were happy with the 3 bedroom, except the unit was on top of an access road and we heard the road noise. Anyone who has stayed at a timeshare property can expect to be asked to attend a timeshare tour. We were solicited at check in and were open for the experience. The lady at check in presented us with a few sheets, showing the discounts you could receive if you attended the tour. She did tell us we were under NO OBLIGATION to buy. These discounts were ours just for attending. All of this information must not be communicated to the Sales personnel, because they are very high pressured sales people, who make you feel very guilty for not buying into their program. The resort is about 15 minutes from Disney. You need a car to get around the Orlando area. We were told by the Salesman that if we did not buy, we could not exchange again through RCI to come back here. It's just as well. We would not be interested in returning. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “I do not like green eggs and ham!”
Reviews.Author: 4travel12345
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were good, The suite was relatively large, clean, and well appointed. That being said, I have a distaste in my mouth from having recently participated in the resort's "time share presentation." In order to scoop up a measly $50 of discounts on park tickets, my wife and I agreed to listen to one of these chats. Our mistake. For an hour, we listened to a sales person repeat himself about what made this resort "exclusive" (nothing). What made their offer to me "exclusive" (again, nothing). After having been given that soft sell, we were introduced to the salesperson's manager. We began the discussion by resolutely explaining that we did not want to purchase a unit. He responded be being condescending, pushy and manipulative. After being told for the umpteenth time that we were not interested, the manager left in a huff and a puff. Then, someone from "corporate" came to "interview" us before we left. Guess what? Another pitch, another rejection, another pitch, another rejection. Finally, someone from "marketing" (isn't that what we had just been through?) came by. He asked a couple of questions that were, of course, designed to open the sell up again. No way, now how.... So, unless you really enjoy being strong-armed, don't sign up for the time share presentation...even if there is a breakfast (more like mini-muffins and donuts purchased from Costco) and $50 dangled in front of your eyes. I'd also highlight that you should expect to be nickeled and dimed at this resort. Seems like it is a couple of dollars extra for everything. When I go on vacation, I want relaxation. I don't want to have to pay extra for every minor (and I mean minor!) convenience. Although the resort has seven pools, none of them are indoors. Kissimmee can be awfully cold during the winter. .

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by Outside, Inside is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: coastlove
Reviews.Content: We just spent Christmas week with our adult children in the Orange Lake Resorts West Village. The yellow buildings with orange tiled roof look old and a bit ugly but inside the renovated two bedroom bungalow is a beautiful large "home". The kitchen and dining room are tiled, the bedrooms and living room are carpeted. There are TVs in both bedrooms and a flat screened TV in the living room. The decore is updated and stylish. However, as others have commented if you look a little closer you will notice the rooms look good on first glance but really need to be cleaned better. We loved the large spacious areas with two sofas and two chairs in the living room and dining table that could sit 6 easily. The carpet had dirt spots that were not removed even when they tried a second cleaning. Seems like this Holiday Inn didn't suppy the cleaners with anything but vaccuums and the place is starting to need a good cleaning. Our white socks became black after a few days walking around the bungalow. They supplied 3 packages of dishwashing soap, one package of liquid dishwashing soap and tea towels. No cleaning cloths or scrubbing pads are supplied. There was one paper towel suppled. You need to bring your own cleaner for kitchen countertops, stove and sink. If you get the floor dirty anywhere you need your own cleaner. Location is good but would recommend a car as the shuttle to Disney is $10 per person round trip. Taxi would be $35 - $50 depending on which Disney Park one way. The pool area was very clean and large with a nice hot tub. The bar had great food and there is live entertainment at night at the one bar with the Sports Bar as an alternative. Shuffleboard and the table tennis were the only free entertainment for adults with the mini-golf costing $7 per person and the billards or arcade games also charging. In general the place is beautiful and the staff friendly. Just be prepared to do your own cleaning as the once a week cleaning doesn't cut it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, few activities”
Reviews.Author: pmt3
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the River Island complex right now and are happy with our large, nicely decorated room. Check in was crowded and I had to say "no" to the timeshare tour (which she insisted wasn't a timeshare tour) about a dozen times before being told our room wasn't ready (at 3:45). At 4:00 we went in another line and finally got our keys. Got to the room and the cleaning lady was still in our room. Biggest disapointment here is that we were under the impression there were a lot of activities and there really isn't. The villages are very spread out and the majority of activities are in the west village. Even those are pretty few and far between. We are Floridians and have spent many vacations at similar Orlando resorts with non-stop (and mostly free) games, shows, contests, music, etc. Most of the activities at Orange Lake are either cancelled this week or cancelled indefinitely. No comedy night, no polynesian review, no iron chef competetion, adult game night cancelled, the pool games were cancelled yesterday . The river island pool area is beautiful but they have closed down the lazy river the last two days in the middle of the afternoon for a one hour cleaning! It took me 1/2 hour to find one vacant pool chair to sit in and then an hour later they announced the pool would be closing. Also, almost all of the activities, tubes, perks, etc. cost extra, and it is very difficult to get information about anything. My husband and I each called several times about various events and no one answers the activity phone. Shopping is close, which is good because they only provide two rolls of toilet paper per bathroom for the week. There is a Publix down the street with similar prices to our Publix at home. All in all, realize that this is a very spread out resort, and probably fine if you are doing the parks every day and need a spacious place to sleep. I wouldn't recommend as a destination resort if you plan to spend most of your time here. I hope check out is better than check in!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay in west village”
Reviews.Author: WarringtonFerret
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week in nov. stayed in a 2 bed single story apt (bungalow) very roomy and lovely views of golf course. dont fancy the other areas with multi floor accomodation.staff were pleasant good shuttle service around resort, IT IS HUGE, will return when we can

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!! THE TIMESHARE THEY ARE SHARKS, PROPERTY OK unit run down furniture, appliances are cheap”
Reviews.Author: Sonnychacha
Reviews.Content: Wow, I wish I would have listened to everyone on Trip Advisor. They are very sneaky when you check into this property. The lady that checked us in outright lied in front of my 2 teenage daughters. She said oh, they just take you in a room with large interactive TV's and show you all the other properties, of course they will try to sell to you, but no high pressure sales at all. She also said that 90% of their guests are through RCI (I'll get to this later). She said that with 4 of us tube rental would be $8.00 each plus tax each day we rent, if we attended just a short 60 minutes and view the interactive TV's we'd receive complimentary tubes our entire stay. We kept saying no, but finally caved. Oh, by the way, they charge YOU $30.00 to go, but when you show up they reimburse you. I talked to one lady waiting for the sharks and they were offered free tubes and mini golf, they had to pay $60.00 to go and were never told they'd get their money back, after talking to us, she said she would be getting her money back. We set it up for the next morning at 8:00 to get it out of the way and let the girls sleep in. I also confirmed with her that after 60 minutes we can get up and leave and still receive our gift and she said yes, if the 60 minutes are up and you want to leave you can. We were unfortunate to get stuck with Ron Moore, who right off the bat told us he normally only sells to "owners that want to buy more weeks", so I guess we were to feel honored to have him????? That should have been our first clue to RUN and RUN FAST. He took us to look at a 3 bedroom unit (which we were already staying in). I made the comment that we were Hilton Grand Vacation owners and found the furnishings, countertops, appilances, etc,. to be well below the quality of HGVC, he didn't like that comment. We then went back for his sales pitch. We explained we were not ready to buy and were happy with the HGVC. My husband very politely told Ron we're done, don't want to buy and we're leaving. He did not take kindly to that. He looked at the front of our sheet and said I see you're doing this to get free tubes, is that the only reason... well dah, hello, of course it's the only reason. He said next time you go on a trip and are offered something free to attend the presentation to not do it, for it's a waste of his/their time!!! Could NOT believe what he had just said, they went on to send out 3 more people to close the deal. We started at $35,000 for an older unit and by the time the last one got done we were down to $75.00 for 6 or 8 weeks of usage - what a joke. We also mentioned we were not happy that the front desk girl lied and told us it was all in a large room with interactive TV's. We also questioned if they are selling the units fastest than they can build, why would 90% of the occupancy be RCI? Ron told us the girl didn't know what she was talking about. Anyway, we got out of there in 90 minutes - totally disgusted. Ok, on to the unit. Great size and layout, one thing I didn't care for was room with children in it had a window facing the main walk (anyone could look in or break in). Appliances are very cheap, furnishings were so-so, all of our sheets had small holes in them. Still have the old TV, no flat screens to be found. They had "want to be surround sound" in the living room. You would get a channel on, sound would come on for a split second and go away. Talk about thin walls and poor structure. We could actually hear the people above us drop a bar of soap in the shower. They had small kids that were constantly, until midnight, running around. We had to call every night to complain and NOTHING WAS DONE. Did not feel to secure in the building we were in, poorly lit parking lots and did not see one security vehicle patroling while we were there. The grounds were beautiful, the lazy river ok, but you certainly do not need to rent a tube. The kids had more fun floating, walking it then using their tubes. Also, they take away tubes at 7:00 p.m. but it stays open until 10. What's with that? By the time we got back from the parks, we could not get our "free tubes". So our 90 minutes of pain and suffering was worthless for we only "rented" tubes one day. Would never stay at this property again nor would I recommend to anyone. Again, poor quality and very large, you do need a vehicle to get around. Also, shop at the Target Super Store if you decide to go. Publix right by the place is actually owned by them and prices are SKY HIGH and it's very run down and dirty. Bottom line, go somewhere else! We got out of there not spending one penny.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Think Your Getting--Not A Hotel... A Timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: kapyVirginia
Reviews.Content: This was not at all what I thought I was getting. If only I had read the reveiws before I booked this trip that I saved for 2 years to take 3 children on I would never gave booked it. i booked under travelocity, thought I was getting a 2 bedroom suite in a hotel that had beautiful pictures in the website of the grounds and big spacious rooms. Never a mention that this was a timeshare. You were going to be harrassed from the moment you walked in to attend a seminar to buy a tmeshare and that if you didnt agree you were given a room, not at all what you booked but a room the size of a closet for 5 people with now window, you didnt know if it was day or night out. I still didnt get that I was not at a hotel and when we ran out of toilet paper at 6am I went to the front desk to ask for some and was told to walk across the street in the dark and buy some.. Yeah never again.. A big fat waste of money.. what you see on the website you are not getting. I have yet to see anything that looks like the pictures on line.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice rooms, service almost non-existent”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: This resort is a vast, sprawling time-share complex southwest of Disney World, on the western edge of the touristy US-192 corridor. I took this mini 4-day vacation as a break and to maintain platinum status on both Priority Club and US Airways. I chose this place due to its very reasonable rate $85 for a 2-bedroom villa and very generous Priority Club bonus points which easily put me over the top for maintaining Platinum status. The resort is a gated community. The guard at the main (west) entrance did not have a list of people checking in, so when I came in, I had to get out of my car and get my reservation information out of my luggage in the trunk before the guard let me into the check-in area.
