I came in after 11 PM, so I was the only person checking in at the time. It turns out that my unit was several miles (literally) from the check-in building. Even with a map, it was very difficult to find, because there are no signs directing guests to the units. When I was in the general area, I actually found a maintenance van, and asked the guy how to find my unit. He said he didn't know how to find my unit because he'd "only worked there a few months." This gives you an idea about the size of the place and the difficulty of finding units at night. I found my place eventually, and it wasn't what I thought of as a villa, but rather it was a condo on the third floor of a huge, Stalinist, six-story building. The unit was quite beautiful, with the advertised 2 bedrooms, a full kitchen, 2 bathrooms including a jetted full-sized bathtub in the master bathroom, and a porch fully enclosed with mosquito netting. The wireless internet was difficult to connect with, but I was able to connect fine after a long phone call with my tech-savvy domestic partner in California. I could not get the DVD to work. The TV's were old-style, neither flat-screen nor HD, but ample in quantity (three!). Although the units weren't all occupied, my unit was very quiet, and I easily slept without earplugs. The only problem was a lawn-mower which ran under my unit at 7 AM, so despite the good insulation, I ended up having to put in earplugs anyways. The complex has a wide variety of activities to keep guests occupied, but if one wants to go out, it's a ways to most places. The closest, of course, is Disney World, but just to get to the nearest (east, in my case) entrance was 4 miles. It doesn't sound like much, but the speed limit in the complex is 23 MPH, and one can get stuck behind the shuttle vans, which I clocked at 19 MPH, and they have signs saying "Do not pass." Count on at least 15 minutes to get to the nearest Disney World park (Animal Kingdom), 30 minutes to Seaworld, and at least 40 minutes to the Universal complex (even further to downtown Orlando). If you want the red light on your telephone to be able to tell whether someone's called you, you will need to clear it of the daily messages automatically left on, which are 60 seconds in length, plus go through 3 voice-mail menus just to delete the message. Since I arrived with 3 or 4 of these daily messages, it was quite a time-burner to get those messages off. Once you get your unit, you're on your own. Although their literature claims there will be weekly housekeeping, once you get your unit, you are told you have to stay over 10 days to get any housekeeping (not that it affected me). The early 9 AM check-out time didn't seem to be early enough for the housekeepers. They came in at 8:20 AM as I came out of the shower. Check-out was difficult. Since it was several miles, an almost 10 minute drive, from my unit to the registration area, I tried to check out through the TV, but they don't have that set up. I then tried to check-out by phone. After 3 voice-mail menus, I was put on hold for 5 minutes, only to be put onto two other voice-mail menus, then on hold for another minute. After that, I was connected to an answering machine. I gave them my name and room number, and asked that they e-mail me my bill. They never did, nor was the bill available on the Priority Club website, which it usually is. I finally called them directly again, to which they said they wouldn't e-mail a bill, but would snail-mail it, and, a week later, I'm still waiting. Despite the size of the resort, there is no evening entertainment. The latest entertainment is the Tradewinds Bar, which starts closing down around 10:45 PM. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants, but did look at the menus, and the prices seemed reasonable. I found the bar prices at the Tradewinds Bar also reasonable for a resort. So these are nice units, but one has to be aware that this is not a hotel. You get your keys and you're on your own. I can't say I didn't get my money's worth, but they definitely did a good job of convincing me not to get a time-share unit here. I get better attention from my homeowner's association.

Reviews.Title: “Wish We Stayed Longer at Orange Lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: rival88
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a one week stay at Orange Lake through an exchange. We stayed on the 4th floor of a building located in the East Village. I had requested to be on the top floor (6th) and near a pool (sort of) but at least they put us in a building where we had a great view of fireworks every night! Traveling with me were my 3 kids (4,2 and 4 mos), my husband and my mother-in-law. We had a 2BR unit. Prior to coming, I had heard of Orange Lake before and was really excited to find out we got it through an exchange. It was every bit like we had imagined, a fabulous resort with a lot to do right on site - you never have to leave. If you look at my history, my family has stayed in many properties all over Kissimmee and Orlando - so we have been to quite a few different resorts. My favourite thing about this resort is all the different amenities it has to offer: a nice beach, many pools, a few different arcades, River Island and how close the Publix and Target was (practically on site). The only thing I didn't like about the resort (which really is not a huge dislike) is the size of the resort, you really do need to drive from one place to another (fine for us since we rented a car) but it does lose the small resort charm where you get to know other families, the workers etc. My biggest surprise was that the timeshare presentation was pretty painless and no, they did not hound us to attend it all week. They called once the second day we arrived and we accepted. The kids enjoyed the snacks they offered and they gave us a quick guided tour of the River island area. After 2 hours, we walked away with $70 cash. We thought it was worth it. I don't think i have ever given a resort 5/5 but I have to say that Orange Lake was a lot of fun and I would definitely go back. Oh ya, I just remembered one strange negative and that is the smell of manure or fertilizer at different times in the air. Why they would use a stinky fertilizer like that (and the odour can really get unbearable at times - especially in the evening) is beyond me. No, the smell is not coming from Animal Kingdom as rumour has it!! Anytime something broke down, even late into the evening (ie our washer) someone came within the hour to fix it. For a resort their size, i have to say I was extremely pleased with the service. When we checked in they had people making balloon animals and handing out popcorn to the kids. We only stayed a week but we were definitely sad to go. We could have easily spent another week at Orange Lake. Hopefully we will have the opportunity to return in the near future. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ask. With the 3 kids, it is tough to type long detailed reviews like I used to. if you have booked at Orange Lake, trust me, you will not be disappointed. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Disney,,,,,,but watch your wallet/spending!”
Reviews.Author: Shorty698125
Reviews.Content: Well lets see here. My wife and I stayed here for two days during our honeymoon. We searched all over the internet for a nicer upscale place to stay close to Disney. We chose this place off of tripadvisor and also the great discount they gave us (300 for two nights for the biggest nicest "villa" they had at the north village--which has the lazy river attached to the complex). The first thing you must note is that they put a 250 dollar "hold" on your credit card for a security deposit that was not listed on the website. When we arrived at the hotel everyone was very friendly and eager to help out in any way. The room we stayed in was awesome! But if you have children make sure you get one with a tub all we had was a shower stall. It had a stackable washer/dryer combo whcih was very handy. The pool area was very nice and clean also. Second note if you want rafts you have to pay for them(actually rent them for 7 dollars plus tax) which I thought was ridicoulus since you have to pay 7.95 a day just to use the "facilities" they have on the complex. (hence my title you have to watch what you pay for cause you could end up spending more than you want to). On that note the whole complex is "cash free" which means you have to use a valid credit card or easier your room key to charge things. If you use your room key things could add up fast without realizing that you spent that much. Also things on the complex are a little overpriced for what they are. 9 dollars for a mixed drink?? 20 dollars for a dinner?? My advice if you are staying longer than 3 or 4 days go to the Publix (local grocery store) and buy groceries and snacks for the family and use the full kitchens they have in the rooms (which we saw a couple of families doing while we were there). Like I said it was a nice place and clean and had a couple extras you don't find at regular hotel's and very close to Disney but watch your wallet/spending when your here and you'll have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space / close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: papago2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the East Village the 1st week of December. Since we were in Florida specifically to see Disney, we didn't use any of the amenities - but I wanted to provide some information on the resort and rooms. 1. When driving in, make sure you use the West Village entrance. If you are coming from I-4 or the airport, it is the 2nd entrance on 192. If you use the East Village Entrance, turn around and go down 192 1/8 of a mile. We wish the guard told us this, instead he made us cut through the resort, which gave us the scenic tour and felt like a 'forever drive' - not a great first impression after traveling all morning. 2. Check-In - I read all the reviews about the horror stories of the check-in process. So when checking in, I had my guard up. I basically went to the desk with a mission, get the keys and go. I may of come across cold and possibly rude to the lady behind the desk, but whenever she asked a question I said: 'No Thank You'. It also helped that I left my husband and sleeping daughter in the car. When asked about discounts 'No Thank You', when asked about our plans 'Not Interested' - worked like a charm. I was done with the check-in in less than 10 minutes 3. Room - the room was surprisingly spacious. We were on an exchange, so we are only familiar with the Wyndham Cypress Palms, Star Island (in Orlando). The decor / out datedness of the rooms are similar. However it did seem very spacious. We did have a couple of comments on the 2 bedroom villa: A - we had a bottom floor unit, which was great especially when our daughter fell asleep in the car - very easy transfer B - Washer / Dryer: full size - not your standard stackable unit found in many timeshares C - 2nd bedroom had 2 full size beds and own bath. However the bathroom had a small shower only. Which means if you travel with friends and they have a child who only takes baths - they need to use the 'tub' in the master bathroom. D - Towels are 'hard' - needs to be run through some fabric softener E - Didn't have a good starter pack - ie: we didn't go to the grocery store until the 2nd day, hoping we can just make coffee with the starter pack. Even the coffee maker was a 12 cup, the starter pack only included enough coffee for 4 cups. Dishwasher soap, only 3 were included. Which means you are forced to buy more (which you end up leaving, hopefully for good use from someone else) when you are there. The same with laundry detergent, etc. Sink - no sponge is included / makes it very hard to wash pots and pans, etc ... If you stay there and cook within the unit - bring some staples or be prepared to purchase the staples F- We didn't use the on-site grocery store. There is a Publix and Target right before the East Village entrance G - we didn't use the pools (I thought it was too cold in FL) however I did call and find out they did not have an indoor pool throughout the entire resort. They did say the pool was heated at 84 degrees (however I didn't test this out) H - Patio - our room has a screened in patio. This overlooked the golf course. It was very cosy and inviting. I - Wi-Fi: we got great wi-fi within our rooms. This worked well with our laptops and our IPhones. The speed was better than what we have seen at other timeshares. We were even able to connect to our sling box at home and watch movies in the evening at reasonable speeds 4. Attractions - The resort is very close to Disney. It took us around 10 minutes to get to most parks. This was very convenient All in all, I would recommend the resort to a family. Having a full kitchen and washer/dryer is helpful when you have young kids. In addition, since our daughter goes to sleep early, we love having the extra living space (and we do not need to tip-toe around).

Reviews.Title: “More like an apartment complex but worth a look”
Reviews.Author: devathabhi
Reviews.Content: Only the old section of the resort is spaced out and has private cottages which are awesome. But the new zones in the resort are more like apartment buildings, but very comfortable and spacious rooms. The convention center, the sports arena and the resort activities are very good. There is a wave pool, and two very long lazy pools to keep you in the relaxed phase all the while. There are other water sports such as jet skiing and para sailing. They also have a full fledged library and a movie theatre as well. Infrastructure wise it is well equipped, with a constant shuttle service that loops all around the resort, a fully functional supermarket and a wide variety of stores and grooming centers. And best of all, it is very near to all the Disney resorts and theme parks. I have stayed in this resort twice and have loved it both the times.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Push During Check In”
Reviews.Author: den223
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 3 nights in a 2 bed-room villa. Although the villa was clean and very spacious, the decor was dated in the 80's. Our overall stay was comfortable but I would not stay here again. The following are the reasons: 1) Check-in took 45 minutes because timeshare talks were included. The conversation started innocently with "what are you planning to do?" Then from "which parks" to "discounts", "must be decided now"... The salesperson had no regard for my hints of being hungry at 7:30PM and the need to go to dinner. 2) The property is enormous, and one should not come here without a car. 3) There are no straight roads so it is very easy to get lost. We got lost going to the supermarket and returning to the villa, a few times. There are too many identically looking buildings and houses constructed on crooked roads. 4) The villas are so far from the main pools that we didn't see it worth while to use the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a hotel this is a time share resort said the manager”
Reviews.Author: Brierfielders
Reviews.Content: We left Key West with a couple of nights without accomodation. We rang Expedia. They booked us a Travelodge in Florida City(Excellent) and a Holiday Inn in Orlando. We expected a Holiday Inn. It took over an hour to check in. We had had a long drive. We were asked at check in if we wanted an extended check out etc. After waiting an hour to check in we asked if we could eat and unpack and come back to these practicalites. Of course ! We did return a little later. We were not entitled to an extended check out because we were guests not owners. We had to pay 10% extra for all shopping ,restaurants, amenities because we were guests and not owners. There was no maid service, room service because this is a time share resort and not a hotel. We needed to use the internet to check in with Virgin 24 hours before the flight and print boarding cards if possible. The internet was closed from 7.30 pm. The manager even closed the owners internet access at this time(By the way it was 6$ for 1/2 hour on the computer + printing charges of 3.50$) The manager was rude and dismissive, probably because we were not interested in time share. He turned his back on us said 'Have a nice day' and walked away ! The reception staff were horrified by his behaviour and tried to help us. The Resort Services manager helped us book in with Virgin free of charge and was delightful. There is loud music throughout the resort. It is all the worst of Butlins ! We found some peace on the beach but had to lay down on the sand as all the sunbeds were rigged to be sat up !! Clearly we don't want people relaxing !! The room and bed were comfortable and well equipped although the toilet didn't work too well !! We were told there was a good fish restaurant by the Lazy River. We went by shuttle bus as it was too far to walk. My dress was wet through when we arrived as someone had wet the seat on the bus. The restaurant was holding a children's quiz at 7 pm when we arrived and served 'fast food'. This is a place to avoid. It looks pretty from the road. Don't be fooled ! There were charges for everything. Indeed we had a charging card for the phone, where you ring a freephone number and have pre paid for your call. They charge an international charge for freephone numbers !! We had stayed at many hotels on our trip and could use this card freely and for free but not here !!

Reviews.Title: “Arrgghh, Orange Lake Lies!!!”
Reviews.Author: baaaba
Reviews.Content: We just came home tonight from staying at Orange Lake for 4 days. The resort is beautiful, there is no doubt about that. For the first time ever we golfed at the resort which was a lot of fun. My problem with this resort is their timeshare presentation. My husband and I are owners, we have been since 2006. This summer we were offered a discounted package to come down, listen to a 60 minute presentation, and then we could be on our way. We arrived for our timeshare ontime, the guy who talked to us, Joe, was a total jerk from the start. I informed him that we had only 1 hour for this, he argued with me telling me that we had to sit and listen to him for 90 minutes, him and I argued the entire time. Some of the lies he told us was that to stay on this resort for a week would be over $2000 (Lie!), that they only offer owners these "special packages" once every 4 to 5 years (Lie, we have been going every fall for this tour just to get the discounted room rate), and he made us sit there for 90 minutes even though my paper said 60. We were forced to tour their top line room, as he was driving us on open golf carts he would drive really fast around corners, it felt like he was trying to knock me off. It was ridiculous. Orange Lake is nice and I would recommend it, however their sales team is rude and once they know that you are not buying they become complete jerks. We will never go down there for another timeshare presentation, I would rather pay a bit extra and skip the presentation. Orange Lake doesn't care about their owners or guests, we will continue to go down there because it suits are needs and our unit is paid off, however, I would not recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place, can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: 3Mkids
Reviews.Content: My husband, three children & myself thought this resort was phenominal. There is so much to do for everyone. We went on the wave runners, played mini-golf, swam in all of the pools & my husband golfed the Legends Course, which was right outside our door. On the last night of our stay, the kitchen sink backed up & they sent a plumber out at midnight, when the maintenance person could not resolve the issue. Each & every person that we came in contact with during our stay was very accomodating. The location of this resort is very convenient to all of the Disney Parks. We are definately coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to vacation”
Reviews.Author: shuttertravel
Reviews.Content: We were given a offer to stay at a friends timeshare for 2 nights as we were headed to Disney for a day and they had a empy room to share. WOW, WOW, WOW, this is an amazing resort, our 3 year old son did not run out of things to do, we did not even have to leave the resort as they have there own Publix's supermarket. The waterparks are fantastic and then we find out they also have a beach and lake you can jet ski on! The golfing looking spectacular and our room had a view of the fireworks from Disney. This was a amazing 2 day stay, if it weren't so expensive we would be buy a week timeshare there.

Reviews.Title: “...Good Resort, Good Location, NO ROOM SERVICE AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: juiceandjaja
Reviews.Content: Why in the heck would you not have any room service, every other day or at least once a during the week. This is vacation, cleaning should be optional. Also, the checking folks are shady, they tell you your room is ready, until they learn you are not going to thier sales pitches, then all of a sudden you have to wait a few more hours for your room. The hound you pretty good to get you to one of these resort pitches.

Reviews.Title: “Big Resort, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hoosiertreker
Reviews.Content: This was a mother-son fall break trip. I wanted a good size unit with a kitchen to cut costs. We got exactly that. We booked straight through the Holiday Inn website. The rate was less than $100 per day for a one bedroom. My 10 year old loved the pool with the lazy river and water slides. The DJ was a lot of fun and kept us busy with resort games when we needed a break from the water. We also used the miniature golf which was fun. The food at the two restuants we tried was average at best, but convenient and not nearly as expsensive a similarly average food at Disney resorts. The sunset party at the lake pool is a lot of fun with a fire juggler, live band and fun activites. The staff had even set up a haunted house during the week leading up to Halloween. The downside -- I called four times over three days to get a light bulb. The alarm clock also didn't work, but I didn't even try to get help with that. The onsite ticket sales are not worth the hassel. At check-in, I had to argue with the onsite Disney representative about what tickets I wanted to buy. She was clearly being compensated for selling something I wasn't buying and after traveling all day, I wasn't in the mood to argue. Then we went to the Kennedy Space Center. I was sold "tickets" in the lobby when I stopped to ask directions to the highway. I figured buying tickets at the hotel would save time at the attraction. But, was I was actually sold was a VOUCHER. This voucher required that we stand in an extra-long line for tour groups and other complex transactions. We found other equally annoyed Orange Lake guests in that line with us. We all thought we had tickets and didn't appreciate the 30 minute line to redeem teh vouchers. If you stay away from the onsite ticket sales, the resort has tons to offer and the staff was actually fun. I have already recomended to my best friend that she consider Orange Lake for her Christmas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Snarky”
Reviews.Author: da_drow
Reviews.Content: Check in-- (the good) went relatively fast considering how crowded it was. They brought over drinks while we waited. We drove down all night from New York and were exhausted. We arrived at 2:30 (check in is 4:00) the young lady at the desk was super nice and was able to give us a room. (the snarky) She gave us maps asked us if we wanted to do the "introduction" a.k.a time share presentation first. She called house keeping asked what was available and got us a room in West Village immediately. The Room-- (the good) Clean comfortable and had everything you could need for your vacation. West Village is the original buildings that were recently refurbished so there were little things like the sliding door in the living room didn't open but that was minor. Internet, hot water worked the whole trip. the beds were fine. Not luxury but fine. (the snarky) My one complaint is that OL eliminated the mid week tidy. So bring/buy extra paper towels, toilet paper, dish washing detergent, (the good) First day the herons were dam near up to the patio as I was having my morning coffee. (the bad) Every night when we returned to the room these little frogs covered the door. Once a frog one was right on the door knob. The Facilities-- The resort is huge but we were close to West Village and shuttle buses ran around. Pools were beautiful. We went to the west village and river island. Lazy river was fun. We didn't do use of the water slides. There were plenty of lounge chairs. Tubes are available for rent. We ate at the pool side grill in river island. The food was good and reasonable priced. (snarky) We used the vouchers from the time share presentation--NO CHANGE IS GIVEN SO SPEND IT ALL. Don't golf but I saw people doing it right outside the bed room. (bad) Must be mating season because these flys were every where. Two flies attached on everything. Landing on you if the felt like it. Not moving when you shoo them away. Location-- Walgreens across the street. Target and Publix close by. Several restaurants in the area. Close to Disney. The gates of Animal Kingdom is right at the back. We didn't go to Disney. We went to Universal. Universal was 40 mins. away. Do stay here if you are plan on doing most of your sight seeing and activities outside of Disney; it is too far.

Reviews.Title: “Resort has a lot to offer if you have the time”
Reviews.Author: travelfeverOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1500 square foot condo on the back side of the resort in May of 2009. As all other comments reference, the resort is mammouth and you need a car to make the resort really work for you. Our unit was extremely spacious and nice and close to a pool. We were not able to stay in the new part of the resort, however, you can access any part at any time. Unfortunately, weather was not on our side and we were not able to use all of the ammenities but there was a alot to offer. There is so much to do at the resort, it is diffcult to decide what to do especially if you are doing other Orlando activities during your trip. The positives: Super Target and several restarants are across the street. Our two bedroom Condo was awesome and perfect for small children. Great lazy river and amenities at the resort. WORD OF ADVICE - The resort is right in front of the back entrance to Disney and we did not discover this until the end of the week. If you hope on the toll road right outside of the entrance, you will be at the front of one of the parks in 5 minutes or less. It is amazing how close it is. Negatives - really do need your own car to save time when visiting this resort. Another family member booked a room on Travelocity and was given a room in the main building without windows and their reservation was lost. BOOK DIRECT through Holiday Inn Reservations - we were treated very differently. Enjoy your stay at Orange Lake Resort. It is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, shame about the service!!”
Reviews.Author: Gilly65
Reviews.Content: This is a very large resort, we stayed at the West Village which is the oldest part. The villa was very nice. We stayed there for 3 weeks, the first 10 days in villa 2225, we had to be moved because we were infested with fire ants, after 2 days in another villa (2190) we got ants again and had to have pest control out!!! we only had maid service twice in 3 weeks and were left clean sheets and expected to make our own beds!!! we had 2 phone calls a day badgering us to go play golf!! grass cutters woke us up at 8am several timesduring our stay, our villa key card failed to work a couple of times and my daughters charm bracelet stolen from the pool area. The pools were nice and the River Island village looked nice. I dont think we will be returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families and groups with kids.”
Reviews.Author: Moxey2009
Reviews.Content: This was a Moms and kids trip, with kids in 10 to 13 years of age. We got a 2 bedroom villa in the Riverwalk section. This was our first trip to this resort and I was really surprised at how nice it was. The complex is large and you definitely need a car to get around if you want to go off the property or between sections. The 2 bedroom villa was advertised as being "fully furnished" and it was, even more than I expected. There were dishes and flatware, soap for the dishwasher, paper towels, soap for the washing machine, as well as the complementary soaps, shampoos, conditioners, and lotions that are present in other hotel rooms. There were plenty of towels, wash clothes, and hand towels. There was a toaster and coffee maker and a starter pack for the coffee. Everything that a person would need was available in this space and all we needed to do was bring in our own food and drinks. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were very nice. The rooms were clean, spacious, and well designed. The bathrooms were very clean and nice. The master bath has a garden tube with jets....bonus! The water park at Riverwalk was very nice and there were plenty of chairs. The staff were friendly, polite, and helpful. The prices at the bars and restaurant were very reasonable. The gift shop prices were good, too, and there was a small grocery area with lots of selections. As far as complaints, the only things were that there could be better information about all of the amenities, especially since this is a timeshare property and they're trying to sell time for these units. The arcade closed at 9pm during our stay, but the closing time posted in the guide was 10pm. We were asked at check in if we would participate in the timeshare tour and we declined. We did not receive any further calls about this. There were a couple of maintenance issues with our room. A phone call to the office and someone was knocking on the door almost as soon as we hung up. Very nice! I really liked this resort and I'm already planning my next family vacation there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: ThaHaitian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 3 year old daughter stayed at the Orange Lakes Resort in Feb. 2009. I t was a lovely place. We had a HUGE 2 bedroom condo all to our selves. We were only 5min away from Disney World. The resort was very big in size. We did not get to explore much of the resort since my family lives 30min away however. we love the lazy river pool. All in all, it was a great stay and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AMJLkld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake Resort for our recent trip to Walt Disney World. Wow! It is a huge property, with lots of amenities. Our favorite was the pool area, complete with a lazy river, slides, water fountains, and hammocks. We wish we had more days at the resort to play! It is located on 192 W just minutes to the west of the Disney parks. Great location, great accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families!”
Reviews.Author: AmazingWorldTravels
Reviews.Content: Wonderful property - huge - lots of pools to choose from. I would recommend staying at the River Island Complex - the rooms are slightly larger and its the newest complex. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and it was perfect for our extended family of 4 adults and 3 kids - lots of room to run about and the amenities such as full refrigerator, microwave, kitchen, etc were very useful since we were traveling with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicki34
Reviews.Content: We've owned at Orange Lake for 20 years so I am biased. Despite the huge growth in the size of the resort it has not lost its appeal. Its clean, the staff are helpful and welcoming. The location is fantastic and if you want a lazy day the only difficulty is picking which pool to relax at. Some of the activities on site are a little on the expensive side but if you just want a sun lounger and a pool its a cheap deal. Its a safe and secure resort with great facilities like a supermarket and pharmacy just off site. Its an ideal location for young and old and as a family we will definately keep on returning.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: tinelongislandNY
Reviews.Content: It felt safe, clean and there was so much to do we we able to safe alot of money by avoiding the Theme Parks.. We have to young boys and when asked if they wanted to go to Disney (again) or stay at the pool. It was unanomous.. The pool with the water slide and lazy river at Orange lake it was. There are game rooms, movie nights, multiple pool areas a man-made lake with jet skiing. Everything is extra of course but compared to the theme parks we did save alot. The rooms were clean an modern. The only complaint I have was actually on our 2nd visit in 2009. My older son, then 9 cut his foot on a piece of glass on the beach.. There were broken beer bottles from the night before. I think you shouldnt be allowed to take any glass on the beach or do a better job inspecting it before you allow guests on it.. He cut his foot and required multiple sutures. It ruined the rest of our trip.. No walking and no swimming! UGH!.. their compensation was a $10 gift card to the game room. I was mortified. Im not sure we will go back.. If I had to rate the place from our 1st trip I would say 10.. But if I had to rate it on the second trip i would say 2 or 3.

Reviews.Title: “It was like a home away from home....but peaceful!!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi2001
Reviews.Content: Orange Lake was a great place to stay. It seemed like it was centrally located from all of the activities that we had planned. There is also a Target and Walmart within 10 minutes from the resort which was a big plus. There are so many activities for the family to do just on the resort you wouldn't even have to leave!!! We had a great time their food was great and not too expensive either. We are already saving money for our next trip to Orlando with our kids this time and we wouldn't stay anywhere but Orange Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools and a welcome respite from Disney”
Reviews.Author: melandpat
Reviews.Content: This was a great spot for young kids. The condo we were in was spotless, and kept very clean throughout our stay. The kids loved all the different pools, and since we drove to Florida we had our van and didn't mind driving to the different pools. The prices of snacks and drinks were high, but during happy hour (I believe it was 4-6) it was "buy one, get one free" which made it more manageable. It was great to come back from the parks and relax by these pools. Inside the condo, we had everything we needed to make dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Charged for everything”
Reviews.Author: leg161
Reviews.Content: Overall the resort was very clean and there was a lot of do. The timeshare was clean and big. The resort made you pay for every little thing. Like the lazy river, they wanted to sell you a pass to use the intertubes on the lazy river. Also all of the games you need to first purchase a game card, then you had to put money on the game card.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, great pools”
Reviews.Author: Tooman
Reviews.Content: The room was big, included full size washer/dryer and detergent to do 3 loads. The pools were wonderful, kids loved lazy river and water slides. It is very close to Disney but 20+ minutes to Universal and Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Loved It so much I am writing a review!”
Reviews.Author: DirectBaltimoreMD
Reviews.Content: How can anyone give this a bad review. I have stayed at Nick Hotel, and the Marriott Timeshares. They were all nice, but this hotel was amazing. The Sports bar was great for the whole family to watch the game. The food at the River Island pool restaurant was awesome, it was a great place to hang out with your family (I didn't like to food at Breezes as much.) The rooms were huge! We had a three bedroom and all rooms were big and comfy. The staff moved us to a room near a pool with no problem. I would certainly go back. Just watch your food bills because they were adding gratuity without telling you, causing a double tip. Once we figured it out the restaurants credited us the difference, so all was well.

Reviews.Title: “Resort was awesome - room was just ok..”
Reviews.Author: tomandnikki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake in the West Village the week of Sept. 27 2009. Check in was a breeze, took 10 minutes and no big sales pitch. The girl at the reception desk was very nice, however when she showed us the map of where our room was - it was very far from any pools so I asked if she could get us any closer to the pool. She looked and said nothing was available which I found odd since the resort seem empty... I read many of the reviews here and on other sites so I knew not all of the rooms had been remodeled. From the photos online, it looks like the entire resort is high rise buildings, but in the west village most of the rooms are villas. It was nice and private but not at all updated - old furniture, appliances and the beds were really bad. We had a nice patio overlooking the golf course but it's not screened in so you can't sit out there after dark because of the bugs. I would definately recommend a car - this place is HUGE. We golfed at the 9 hole course that is lit up at night and that was fun (bring the bug spray). Ate at Legacy grill twice and saw the comedy show which was fun. The mixed drinks are a little pricey - but your on vacation so what do you expect. They do have happy hour by the pools in the afternoon. We were at the parks most of the time and wish we had more time to spend at the resort because there was so much we didn't get to see and do. Not sure what Disney was like because we didn't make it there this trip but Universal was empty. 5-10 min waits even on the new roller coaster (Which was awesome!). FYI - the resort does not accept cash at all - you have to use your room key to pay for everything. Overall - I would go again but would definately request a new room. I liked how the villas were private and it felt like you had your own little house but I don't think my back could handle another night in that bed!

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT stay!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOVINaVACATION
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 boys and I just got back from Orange Lake Resort, we stayed at the West Village. It was amazing. Check in took maybe 10-15 minutes, no one asked me about a buying into a timeshare. We were gone most of the time, but I did get a call 4 days after we arrived asking us abount a siminar, I said no, and that was it. Pools and rooms were great, everything was clean, I didnt see the first bug. I would definitely stay here again, and next take more advantage of the adminities!!!

Reviews.Title: “Experience - More Bad Than Good”
Reviews.Author: PrincessPiggyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Sheets and towels not as clean as appeared. We re-washed the towels and linens. Who wants to do laundry at the start of your vacation. I understand bugs and insects can be common in humid areas. There were ants everywhere creating a village in all areas of the kitchen. (We purchased cleaning products, but did not help. Each day was a cleaning chore and felt like we were at home cleaning. We ended up throwing away food and keeping everything in bags and in the refrigerator) Hairdryer in room turned off after few minutes of use. Had to wait 10minutes to re-use. Sounded as if the hairdryer was going to blow a fuse. We allowed ourselves 2minutes of hairdrying to avoid a short in the suite. The Safe in the room did not work at all after it was serviced. Security was called to fix. Battery was changed, even the main board was replaced. We didn't use the safe after that. Received too many calls encouraging to join join join. Our group wanted to relax at the resort and get to the theme parks, not constantly retrieving these types of messages thinking these calls may be from families at home. Check-in was smooth, however didn't appreciate front desk enticing group to attend a meeting and get something for free when clearly we mentioned we were not interested. Two bedroom suite we had was spacious and Mears Shuttle worked out great getting our group to and from the parks. River Island had the best pool - The Lazy River.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jerseybeachfan
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week stay at Orange Lake and we loved it. We stayed in the West Village on the 3rd floor and our room had recently been remodeled and was very nice. Beds were comfortable and our 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom unit had plenty of space and everything that we needed. I have a bug-phobia so since it was Florida, I was on the lookout but I can honestly say that I saw none in or around our room! We rented a car to drive to Universal (20 minutes) and the Animal Kingdom (10 minutes). There is a shuttle around the resort but we chose to drive so we could stay on our own schedule. The lazy river at River Island was just fantastic! We spent 3 full days just relaxing and swimming there. I do agree that $10 for a tube is a bit much but we did enjoy them. We also had fun over at Breezes where they have outdoor music and dancing in the evenings. There is so much to do here that we wished we had a few more days to just hang around the resort. We skipped the time share presentation and unplugged the phone in our room so we were not disturbed the entire trip. It's all what you make of it there and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: holiday_florida
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews were fearful but we had no issues at all. The checkin lines were good, plenty of towels, the ammenties are worth every penny . The lazy river was wonderful and we got a cabanna which was a lot of fun! Had 2 families both with small children and they loved it. Will be back again and again! We did notice the Animal Kindom smell but it didnt put us off.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Services”
Reviews.Author: Jay97821
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the Orange Lake Resort we were expecting a pleasant and relaxing stay. However, our perception quickly changed as we waited in line for 30 minute while checking in. This wasn't due to an excess amount of tourist, instead they barely had anyone behind the counter. As the line continued to grow, the resort finally decided to add more people behind the counter. The wait was followed by some horrible customer services. The lady that helped us to check in barely spoke any English and was very rude. She failed to answer our questions and simply told us to call the customer service instead. The room was clean, however they offered very minimal amounts of daily needs such as towels and they overcharge by a ridiculous amount for any extra towels or detergent. Thankfully there is a target directly across from the resort which is very accessible to anyone who decide to rent a car. Overall the stay was very sub par and the customer services were definitely atrocious. Both the check in and check out experiences were so bad that it literally ruined the trip. On top of it the customer services through the phone lacks professionalism as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Week at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: TN20something
Reviews.Content: We stayed in River Island for a week in a two bedroom ground floor unit. There was plenty of space for two couples and an infant, and everything was comfortable and well appointed. And we didn't hear our neighbors at all. River Island is the only "village" with WI-FI at this time- which we really enjoyed. Our drive to SeaWorld and Universal was about 20-25 minutes. We didn't go to Disney, but it was super close. There is a Publix and a Super Target right outside the gate. Hard to beat the location. The River Island pool complex is one of the nicest pool areas I have ever seen at a resort- but the pools at all of the other villages were also nice. Our 1 year old enjoyed Splash Lagoon in the North Village as well as the "beachlike" areas in River Island. I cannot say anything negative about the service, accomodations, or activites at Orange Lake. Everything was great- especially our first meal at the River Island Grilling Company. Second meal wasn't as good. Don't sit outside if the bartender is the only server or your service will be too slow. The clam chowder at this restaurant was very good. The only negative really is the timeshare presentation. We have been to many of these and can usually tolerate them because you get something good out of your hour. But all we got was a week's worth of tube rentals for the lazy river and a coupon book. And that just wasn't worth it- especially since the presentation lasted about 2 hours and "breakfast" was just crummy donuts. Skip the presentation, stay in River Island, and I can't imagine that you would have much to complain about. Thanks for a great vacation, Orange Lake. Oh- and be sure to drive to the East Village at 9 on a cloudless night, take the elevator to the 6th floor, and enjoy the fireworks show from Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “This place takes some beating”
Reviews.Author: Amfrom
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this resort and it's difficult to find a fault. The staff are attentive but at the same time not in your face. The resort is kept spotlessly clean and the external areas are immaculate. Located off the US 192 it is idealy placed for the Disney Parks and approx 30 mins from Sew World/Univeral Studios. The golf courses look good (didn't play any of them) and there are activities a plenty for children. I can't wait until we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be”
Reviews.Author: vprman123
Reviews.Content: I read most of the reviews here before I came and was cautiously pessimistic. Check in took 5 minutes at the most even though we got here at the earliest 4 check in. We politely declined any gift and breakfast offers. If I could say anything negative about the place it is they are persistent. I had heard about the phone calls and people were right. First morning we were here we got a phone call at 8 in the morning while asleep. It continued at least 4-5 times a day for the first few days. We ended up unplugging the phones but it was not a huge hassle, we didn't answer the phone. Please remember this is a timeshare and there job is to get you to own here. We were in the "dreaded" West Village I had read about on here. All the rooms have been refurbished in the last year. Everything in our 2 bedroom villa was brand new including a flat screen television. I would have bought the place and lived in here if I could. There was a giant king size bed in the master bedroom. We had free wireless internet in our room that was very fast. The only problem with the room was the sliding glass doors were broken and a pipe under the sink was leaking. We called maintenance and a very friendly man named Ed was here first thing in the morning and fixed all the problems within 15 minutes. It is just a couple miles away from all the Disney parks. It was very convenient for us to be able to get in and out so quickly. We immensely enjoyed our trip and plan on coming back here as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: lisa1013
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in we were told that I room wasn't quite ready but they had a different one they could put us in. In was in a hall that is under construction with dust everywhere. The bathroom fan was dangling from the ceiling and above the shower was covered in mildew.Our carpet remained wet. We woke up the next morning at 7 am to the fire alarm going off and had to evacuate. Shortly after returning to our room the construction started that rattled the room and was too loud to have a conversation. I reported this to the front desk who offered us a 2 bedroom villa which was nice until we pulled back the comforter in the master bedroom and it filled with blood stains. When swimming in the pool i kept catching hair in between my fingers. Looks great from the outside but be leary of the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Most Relaxing Vacation I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: FLEastCoastFamily
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Orange Lake Resort. It was a bit confusing to know where to go when we arrived at the Guard gate, but the security was friendly and directed us to the West Village entrance. When we arrived at the Check-In there were staff members to greet my family and I. My children, both 5 and under, were welcomed with popcorn, drinks, and balloons. Check-in took about 30 minutes as the employee informed us how we could receive complimentary breakfast for attending a quick informational session on the resort. We would also enticed to take the tour for a free all day pool side cabana rental and two free raft rentals for the lazy river. Having read the reviews prior to our stay and knowing we had no interest in purchasing a time share, we declined. The staff member was not pushy at all and we never received another ask for us to take the tour. We stayed in the East Village at a Two-Bedroom Villa. The room was not read until 4pm, and even though we arrived at 2:30pm we were told not to enter the room until 4pm. However, I did notice on the Room Attendant sheet in our villa that the room was ready at 1:45pm. The Villa was so nice, I would not believe that we were able to book such an amazing room for so cheap. It was clean, cozy and spacious. Our room had a kitchen, stove, microwave, blender, and all of the things you would need to cook a nice meal. We also had a welcome pack with dishwashing detergent, soap, laundry detergent, salt & pepper, sugar, coffee, and lots more. The only thing I would bring if you are staying at the villa is a sponge or dish cloth to wash your dishes. We had a DVD player to watch movies at night and there was a TV in each bedroom as well. We were even able to wash our laundry in the washer and dryer in the villa so there was not a pile of dirty clothes to bring home. The East Village pool was right next to our villa. At night you could even see the Disney fireworks from the balcony in our villa. It was awesome. On our second day we went to the River Island. If you wish to float down the lazy river on a raft you have to rent one for about $10.75 for a two person raft for one day. You are not allowed to use other rafts on the lazy river. River Island was awesome with all sorts of things to do, I felt like we were at a water park. There is a giant inflatable Hippo slide that costs $3 per slide, $9 for an hour, or $15 for the day. There were so many things to do. There is even a Starbucks right near the pool! There was an arcade, putt- putt golf, and so much more. It was so relaxing and the zero entry pool was great for kids that are still learning how to swim. I am definitely going to return to this resort and if I had the money, I would most definitely buy a timeshare here. I don't think I will ever stay at a regular hotel again when you could stay at the Orange Lake Resort. We were able to cut costs by cooking pizza and making our own lunch in the room. There are excellent restaurants within the Resort or you can drive just outside of the gate to Publix, Super Target, Outback, Olive Garden, Carrabbas, etc. I can’t wait to go back! Florida East Coast Resident

Reviews.Title: “Too big for their britches !”
Reviews.Author: JawjuhJoker
Reviews.Content: This place could be nice ... if you have very deep pockets and dont mind that you either need to drive or take a shuttle to the glorious ammenities that they offer. Do be advised that almost ALL of those glorious ammenities come with an extra price tag. Yes folks, even the lazy river that they so highly advertise is NOT FREE. You have to pay a tube rental. And the price of ANYTHING at the on-site stores is riduculous. We were in a six story building in the west village and it was a ten minute walk to the closest pool and a 20 minute shuttle ride to any of the other water features that this place offers. And quite frankly .... if I'm gonna pay $10 a day for a tube PER PERSON then we'll just go to a water park that has a full days worth of activities. The rooms are spacious and the furniture is pretty to look at. Unfortunately it's the most uncomfortable I have ever sat or laid on. Little things mean alot when you are booking at an elite resort such as this one and ..... this one falls well short of being even close to the top of any of the four or five star resorts in the Orlando area. They can't even afford decent shower heads ..... so after a night of sleep on a mattress that is as hard as the floor you don't have a nice invigorating shower to look forward too. A soft rain would be more effective than their shower heads. I would rather stay at Vistana or Celebration again. We went here because we like to go to a different resort every year and what a mistake. I would not reccommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...”
Reviews.Author: exercitus
Reviews.Content: I booked a two-bedroom villa for myself since I wanted something roomy since I was just staying in Orlando for one night. This place is amazing, the location of the resort is just a few minutes from Disney and near everything you need, from a pharmacy to grocery store and ever a gas station, just a minute away. The resort itself is spectacular, very well kept. My two-bedroom villa has amazing, walk into the kitchen and the first thing you notice is the size, its huge... I had a dining room that will sit eight, a living room with flat panel television and DVD played, two couches and chair. Master bedroom with bathroom and whirlpool tub. Second bedroom has two doubles with its own bathroom and a deck that spans from the living room to the master bedroom. Very well furnished and clean inside, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it......”
Reviews.Author: pollytrem
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare appartment at vacation village, Kissimmee for 2weeks here. We much preferred Orange Lake and hope to go again next year. We were a little nervous having read quite a few bad reports. However, we absolutely loved it. The place is huge and fantastic and there is a continuous free shuttle bus which takes you around the whole place. I can't really praise it highly enough and had to drag the kids to Disney some days as they really wanted to stay at the pool. My husband and son golfed every morning and in the evenings we took the shuttle bus to the various restaurants and pools. It meant my husband and I could both have a drink if we felt like it. My advice to you if you are thinking about going here is just......do it! However if you are the type of family who like to look for faults and reasons not to have a good time then I'm sure you'll find fault somewhere. We were just grateful for the chance to stay at such a wonderful, friendly, entertaining resort and any problems we had just aren't worth mentioning. We stayed in the West Village and loved it. Lots of reviews state it is old etc but having visited the whole Village, it's the part we would have picked anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space, lots to do, and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: mgmilton
Reviews.Content: Check in was great. I did agree to listen to timeshare spill which they promised would be one hour - lasted hour and a half with at least 4 different persons convincing us to buy. We were strong and didn't. Came back one night and soapy water was all over the second bathroom floor; but service was quick to clean up and dry the carpet. Kids loved the space and what the area had to offer. We didn't get to use the amenities because we were out to enjoy Islands of Adventure, Universal Studios and to visit family. Pretty large place so you have to drive or use the shuttle to get around on the complex to enjoy the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: JackieMD1
Reviews.Content: Orange Lake was a terrific value! We had a 2BR villa, beautiful and spacious with a great patio on the golf course, nice to have breakfast on. Our dishwasher began to overflow one day, I called maintenance and someone was at my door w/i 15 minutes and solved problem quickly. We were with a 13 yr old and 15 yr old, both thoroughly enjoyed the activities. We golfed, mini golfed, went tubing and jet skiing, and played pool volleyball. We signed up for the tour at check in, but later cancelled, and were not harassed further. Previous reviews said the tour lasted about 2 1/2 hrs, we saw a couple on tour at the pool and I asked them how long they had been on the tour and they indeed said about 2 hours. If you have time to kill, it might be worth it, but be prepared for 2+ hours! Pools were great, don't bother renting a tube. People kind of abandon them toward the end of the day, we picked up couple up and floated around . Walgreens, Target, and many restaurants within 5 min drive of resort. Overall great time, We're planning to return in November!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...but”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslanders
Reviews.Content: My family and I (17year old and 8 yr old), Stayed the last week in July. We own a studio timeshare elsewhere and exchanged it for Orange Lake. The place is well appointed, and the grounds and pools are quite nice and well mainted. We had an easy check-in which was a surprise given all the comments. We were asked abt the timeshare at check-in, but was not pushy. We did however recieve a few calls, which when told politely, hung up and tried calling again. This stopped after the 2nd day.. I really like the place and all the satff were helpful and accomodating. The only issue I really had, but is a big issue was the room itself. The beds were comfortable and we had a fridge, stove, microwave and coffee maker, but the room seemed very dated. The bathroom was absoultely horrible... Toilet was dirty bathroom had mildew..The carpet in the room although appeared clean, did not feel clean and we wore slippers all the time... If they changed the carpet, put a fresh coat of paint on the walls,and totally redid the bathroom, this place would be awesome..

Reviews.Title: “Fun for all, and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Jaydee914
Reviews.Content: I had stayed for business at a similar resort, and decided that this would be a great quick vacation with my girlfriend, her 8 year old daughter and 12 year old son, and her 15 year old niece. Check in was pretty easy - just be firm with the person behind the desk that you have absolutely no interest in buying a timeshare. The condo was great! It was a very clean 2 bedroom, with a hot tub in the master bath, 2 queen beds in the second bedroom, and a pull-out couch in the living room. The kitchen was less than well equipped, however. There were plenty of utensils and cookwear, but no cleaning supplies, and not even salt and pepper! If you're planning to cook, plan to bring EVERYTHING. Our second night there, we went to River Island Grilling Co, which was very good and reasonably priced. The property is huge, so there's a lot of driving to be done. It seems like there's a pool within walking distance of each building, however. My only other complaint is that the Splash Lagoon isn't really much of a waterpark. There's a tiny waterslide and pool volleyball, and that's about it. River Island, is pretty cool, though, and there's no entrance fee, which I was concerned about when I made our reservation. We also went down to the lake and rented a boat for an hour. It came with a driver to do some tubing, which worked out great. The kids had a blast making laps around the lake! Overall, we had a great time. In fact, I'm considering coming back for future business trips to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Visit at least once! Amazing, absolutely amazing.”
Reviews.Author: JensDiversion
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed her based on two reward nights I had earned. We were interested in the 1.5 mile lazy river! We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and it was AMAZING! Living in Florida i understand you have to get used to bug so this is the first thing i look for - there were NONE! All the facilities were new and very nice. The staff is wonderful. This is a time share but they rent rooms so they offered us $100 to go the timeshare lecture (we hadn't planned on it but on vacation who couldn't use an extra $100). I so would have bought in to this timeshare as i think they have wonderful places and our one on one salesperson, Jennifer Garner, was amazing. However, it is just not the right time. So we went back to just enjoying time with family. The villa holds 8 people and that's what we brought (my husband, three kids, mother and father in law, brother in law) and each of them was treated well by the staff. The property is so large there is a bus system that took my kids to the arcade, water park, lazy river, restaurant, where ever anyone needed to go. Part of the family watched a Bears game a an onsite restaurant while the others went to City Walk at the front of Universal for dinner. The next night we grilled on the screened in patio. Full kitchen - just bring food. Villa was so spacious 8 people never felt like they were stepping on each ot Pher. We plan to go back and later, when we are ready, buy into this property!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, close to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: saraben
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Orange Lake Resort and my only comment is that we spent too long in the Disney Parks and not enough time enjoying the extensive facilities at the Resort. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant time”
Reviews.Author: Kate0306
Reviews.Content: We were a party of five ages 50/48/16/8/7. This was an exchange through RCI and after reading some of the older reviews I was a little concerned, but as we were doing Disney, I figured we wouldn't be too bothered about the state of the accomodation anyway. OK, first our check-in. As we arrived their was a small steel band playing, which lifted our spirits, after a drive from the airport (first time driving in USA ever) in torrential rain. Greeted immediately by staff member who found us a vacant space at check-in desk. Check-in staff very friendly and efficient. The poor bloke tried his hardest to get us to go to the presentation and offered all manner of rewards in the form of restaurant vouchers ($70), free tubes for the lazy river etc etc, but I just kept saying No Thankyou with a smile on my face, and eventually he gave in with fairly good grace. God love him, he tried his best but he was no match for me. We were put in an apartment in Tennis Villas in the West Village. This had parking right outside and was only a stones throw from the main building, the two pools, the lake (which our balcony overlooked) and The Marketplace (small shop and cafe). The apartment was huge, main bedroom was ensuite with shower and jacuzzi, second bedroom had two queen sized beds. Kitchen was good size and well equipped, (the oven was vast). The welcome pack was totally adequate. Because we were staying for a fortnight, we got complementary cleaning halfway through our holiday and yet another pack of products. Every member of staff we encountered were attentive and helpful. The swimming pools were lovely. We ate at Breezes in the West Village three times and it was lovely and a welcome change from burgers and fries (they do a different theme every night in a family-style menu). The waitresses were great, nothing was too much trouble for them. There was tons of entertainment on all over the hotel complex, but sadly we hadn't the energy to see it, as we were so wiped out from touring theme parks all day, though we did go to the gator show on wednesday morning, which cost $5 and was well worth it. All in all this was a great place to stay, very near the theme parks (we used the 429 toll road ($1) to get to disney which runs right by the hotel complex and saves you long queues in traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Totally fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: chrisandgeoff
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews I was a bit dubious about my holiday but all I can say is it was the best place I have stayed in Florida and have been going for the last 8 years. Check in was smooth and quick and I was invited to the Timeshare tour which I initially agreed to but decided to back out of. When I went back to do this the staff were so polite and helpful and I was not bothered about the tour again throughout my 14 day stay. The place is huge but once you are used to it, it basically goes in a big loop, did not take long to get to the main road. I stayed in the North village in a one bed condo (Block 3400) and it was fine, my patio looked onto the pool and was heavenly. OK the washer cupboard door fell off but was fixed within an hour. The grounds are clean and picturesque, the pool at the North village was tranquil but the lazy river at River Island was a great place to sun bathe and have fun in the water. I absoultely loved it and it only took 5 minutes in the car but I am sure I could have walked there had I wanted to. Both pools were very warm and even warmer at night. The children were playing on the slides right up until the pool was closed at 10pm My experience was so good I want to go back there again and would not hesitate recommending this place to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't bother staying here again”
Reviews.Author: yobuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a high-rise on an upper floor. The condo itself was nice. When sitting out at night though, you could smell a foul stench which we believe was from Disney's Animal Kingdom. Aside from that, the pools were nice, but the lazy river was horribly overcrowded. Security was horrible, as I was awakened at 3:30am by a group of kids having a party in the parking lot on a Thursday night. The complex is pretty far up 192, which means you sit in traffic trying to get to the parks if you don't leave by 8am. In addition, it took 10 minutes just to get from our parking lot to route 192. I found this to be very annoying. We did not golf during our stay, but the golf courses appeared to be very well maintained. We've stayed in much nicer places much closer to the parks. If you plan to spend most of your time on the grounds golfing and don't mind overcrowded pools, this place is for you. Lastly, the 1 hour sales pitch is really closer to 2 1/2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: akaladyfl
Reviews.Content: This place is large. I was not prepared for the size of the place even though it was stated in previous reviews. Check in took a long time. I have never stayed at a resort where only certain clerks can handle cash. My stay was prepaid but upon arrival I was told that the $7.95 resort fee had to be collected on site. I attempted to pay with cash and the clerk could not find anyone with the authority to handle the transaction. I then placed the small charge on my credit card. It was a strange transaction. I only stayed one night and did not see anything except for the main registration area. I drove to Orlando to meet a friend who was on vacation with her family. I wanted a place that was larger than a hotel room so that everyone would be comfortable once we finally met. This place worked out great for us. We had 3 TV's (no flat screens) and a DVD player to keep the kids occupied while the adults talked. Free Wi-Fi was also available. The villa had a combination living and dining area, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, washer and dryer, along with a full kitchen. According to front desk the East Village is a newer addition to the resort. The room was modern and was comfortable. It was not a plush room but, I personally was not expecting it to be. My daughter had to drive to the pool area as it was not in walking distance. As we were checking out of our villa my daughter forgot her camera and it was returned to her by housekeeping. Some of the staff did appear to be a little stiff (cold) but I attributed that to the sheer volume of people they deal with on regular basis. No time for small talk in their business. It was a good stay. This place is great for large families and groups. I would advise renting a car if you can. It will make getting to the stores and outside restaurants easier. There is a shuttle bus just to get around at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Orange Lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: Essexfamilyontour
Reviews.Content: I have just re-read some of the reviews and can only think we were looking for different things from our stay at the resort. Yes the waterparks and swimming pools are good (although very busy, expensive to hire tubes on lazy river) and overall the resort is very well maintained. The location of the hotel was excellent - just off the 192 which is my favourite place to stay in Kissimmee. What I did not like was how faceless the whole experience was. It was a 15 minute check-in as it was heavy on the sales pitch. It was then a 10 minute drive to our accomodation. I booked a 2 bed villa - which I assumed would be a 'stand alone' unit - but turned out to be a 2 bed apartment on the 6th floor. I also paid extra for waterside - yes the apartment block was waterside but we had a view overlooking the parking lot. The apartment was well furnished - with a washer dryer etc. It was clean - but had no housekeeping service whilst we were there (for four days) , and had only the basic minimum number of towels. There was a problem with our safe that required us to call maintenance on at least 4 occasions - I think it was assumed that we would be happy to leave our valuables in a safe that would not lock. I checked out with a phone call as was advised and assumed the bill would be posted to my holiday inn priority club account within a few days. 5 days later there was still no record of my stay - eventually I did get my points put on - but after 2 emails to the hotel I have been told I have to call the hotel directly as they cannot email me my bill - so I am still none the wiser as to how much the stay cost me. If we were returning to the area I think I would stay at a more basic resort nearby as we were just using this as a base for a short stay in Orlando and do not feel that we got the most out of the hotel's facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Vacation-great pool areas.”
Reviews.Author: mcspree
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week long vacation staying here. This was our second straight year staying here with my brother, his wife and baby who are owners there. We stayed in the West Village both times and it is safe to say that last year was good and this year was even better. Some little things like adding a DVD player to the room helped make the "in-room" experience part better. The location where we stayed was also very good. We were located 2 minutes walking from the clubhouse where you check in which included an arcade, a new fitness center and internet cafe among other things, and 2 minutes walking from the brand new pool and Water's Edge area they built in West Village. That area is equipped with a new restaurant, bar and is surroundd by new cabana's. This area is also adjacent to another, seperate pool called the "stage pool" which is small but nice and quiet. Also in the West Village you have tennis courts and basketball courts that are located right outside most of the villas. You also have the lake right there which has jet ski-ing, kayaking, paddle boats and other water activities in the lake. You can also rent fishing poles and go fishing when you like. In another village (north?) is Spalsh Lagoon. It has a pool that is constructed very well and has a basketball hoop and volleyball net located inside of it. It also has a cool water slide that is perfect for kids as well as it has a nice quiet area for adults to relax in that was not crowded at all. It also has a "kiddie pool" for younger chldren. It is my favorite pool in the resort. River Island is good too, although it can be very crowded. The lazy river is fun and pretty neat just to chill in if you have a tube. If not, you can float or swim through and it is not that bad either. I HIGHLY reccomend getting a cabana as it is worth whatever you will pay, even if it is for one day. We did two days in the cabana at Water's Edge in the WV and both times it was great. TV, phone, internet, drinks and small snacks await you when you arrive as well as a couch, table and two arm chairs. Very relaxing.As with anything there are some things that could be better. Paying 7 bucks for tubes at River Island is a little much. I understand that probably has t be SOME fee, but 7 bucks is a lot, especially if someone has more than 1 kid. Some things tend to close pretty early, like the basketball courts and the tennis courts. Lights on at like 11pm, which if you are out with family all day, it is nice to play a little ball without the sun at night. The restaurants are alright,-River Island restaurant is very good and I would suggest getting the brownie sundae or the bananna foster for dessert. Plenty of restaurants outside the resort as well as the resort is close to everything, including Disney World, Universal and all the parks. Overall, this is a solid family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: triathleteman
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after reading some of the comments regarding this property.....We had no problems whatsoever. Check in does take 15min per group if on RCI...this is because they pitch the sales seminar...we just said sure no prob, gave them the $20, and where whisked through. We didn't show up for the seminar, so $20 saved us the hassle at the desk, and the sales seminar. $20 well spent. All staff we met were super helpful, EXCEPT I called down to the splash shack (tube and towel cabana) and the girl who answered the phone put us on hold for quite a while....however given that is the only place to get tubes, and towels they were probably busy. EVERYONE else we met was extremely nice, helpful, and we really enjoyed ourselves. The only time we were asked if we were guests or owners is at minigolf, because the price differs. Now on to the critique of the amenities. We stayed in North Village, right at the pool, really really nice. Our 4, almost 5 year old loved the pool and small slide. The lunch cafe is expensive, we didn't eat there though so we can't comment on quality. There is a height restriction on the slides in River Island. 48 inches. Our son was too small, kind of a bummer! We did eat at the restaurant overlooking the River Island, pricey, but good food! After a week of eating at Ponderosa, Shoneys, and Sizzler it was a welcome change! The grounds are very well maintained, everything was spotless, and we were very impressed with their maintenance crews. We would most definitely go back, it was a fantastic vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Area...Non-existent service! Skip this place!”
Reviews.Author: pconner71
Reviews.Content: We stayed as "guests" not "owners" at this resort. I say this because it is VERY important to all staff at the resort to classify you so they can treat you accordingly. Any time we'd ask an employee a question, their first response was, "Are you an owner or a guest"? Each time we had an interaction with an employee of this resort, we were treated rudely and curtly. If you can avoid dealing with anyone who works there, you may have an enjoyable stay. The room we were given had extensive mildew damage, as evidenced by the unfinished patching on the walls. We kept the AC on all the time so as to deter any mold/mildew growth while we were there. Our first day at the pool, which is why we selected this resort, we encountered two giant water bugs in the pool. If you google "giant water bug" you'll see what I'm talking about. They were nasty and made us paranoid the rest of our stay since they were easily 3" in length with a head that had 2" pinchers on it and they weren't afraid to use them. There was no way I was going to let my 6 year old daughter even near one of those things! Really, we were able to make the best of this trip, but were so thankful all along the way that we were not owners! How I feel for the people who actually are! Also, the activity schedule stated poolside games each day and they were nowhere to be found. They also have poolside DJ each day, but the music selection is restricted to the same 5 or 6 songs, so that gets pretty old after week. Please note that putt-putt golf is extra and is not included in the price of your villa. Save your money and stay at Marriott's Harbour Lake resort instead. You get unlimited putt-putt for the length of your stay, awesome poolside entertainment and games for kids, fishing, and use of grills. We'll be going back there next summer for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but please read!”
Reviews.Author: 1BUCKEYENUT
Reviews.Content: So here it is plain and simple: Although you book through Holiday Inn you are treated as a timeshare guest, which is pretty strange. You will be called DAILY to sign up for a timeshare tour. This is a resort and not a hotel - you will be given one set of linens and a full washer/dryer to launder yourself. This place is HUGE and you cannot walk from place to place. You must have a rental car -it is 1200 acres! If you do not sign up for the timeshare they do not tell you the ins and outs of the place. They do not have early check in or outs. They will NOT give you the keys until 4:00 or after and they knock on your door at 8:30 on check out day to see if you are ready to leave. They give you a SMALL supply of toilet paper, paper towels, etc. and you will need to go to the grocey for the rest - which is right outside the entrance to the resort. If you buy a drink at one of the pools/bars, keep your cup as it is refillable for only a few dollars. We found this out on the last day after collecting cups all week! Also, all of their receipts have coupons printed on the bottom for the resort gift shops, etc. - they did not tell us this until I discovered it on the last day also! Very convenient location to all the parks, but we really missed the beach! They claim to have a beach but it is a small pond with some sand on it that knowone uses. Overall this is a very nice place, just a little strange being treated as a timeshare guest when you clearly arent. Pretty clean and spacious and VERY BUSY! Allow plenty of time to check in - it tool us over an hour since they are trying to talk you into timeshare and buying tickets to parks, etc. Oh, and buy your Disney tickets before you get there. The discount ticket places are a rip off - they are busted daily - and the state of Florida will not allow AAA or the resorts to sell discounted tickets. You can buy them at Disney.com or AAA before you arrive and save LOTS of money!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: ElissaRN
Reviews.Content: As many others you can be wary when reading the reviews but we really loved our one week stay at this resort between July 10th-17th. Check in was a long process - they had 3 separate line up when you first entered, one for owners, one for RCI exchange and one for people who are just renting the units. The last one was only being looked after by one staff member but seemed to have the longest line up. When we check in - they made it sound mandatory that you attend their 'welcome meeting' and - BEWARE! - they tried to take a deposit from my credit card to ensure that I would go, which they said would be reinbursed with credit at the resort and a discount coupon book.
