This discount coupon book is in no way worth the 'deposit' that they try to take from your credit card. Now on to the better parts.... our 2 bedroom condo was located in the newly renovated West Village and was really nicely decorated, clean and brand new inside. We did have free WiFi in the room but at times it did not work. The kitchen is stocked with all the conviences of home along with a washer and dryer tucked behind a sliding door. Living room/dining area had a large dining table that sat 6 people; 2 couches in the living room - one being a queen pull out and a flat screen TV with a DVD player. There was also a large balcony (we were on the second floor) which had sliding doors both in the living room and master bedroom. Master bedroom had a comfy king-size bed and ensuite bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. The second bedroom had 2 queen beds and a doorway into the second bathroom. The grounds are definitely huge but well maintained and you will need to use a car to get around (my husband and I thought that they should rent out golf carts so people can get around - which would be better for the enviroment, instead of us needing to drive to the pool) There is a shuttle that takes you around the grounds that we did see often but never ending up taking. We mostly used the pool area in the north village "Splash lagoon" where they have a small pool that was only a foot deep which entertained our toddler for many hours. We did venture over to River island as well - the pool area is beautiful and the lazy river is so nice. The tubes cost $7 to use them for the day or they have double tubes that will run you $10. We did not eat at any of the resturants onsite so can not comment on them. (However we love the fact that there is an Olive Garden just across the street!) The distance to Disney is really close. You can actually see Animal Kingdom Lodge (where we usually stay when we go to disney - as we are DVC members) just off in the near distance when you are driving into the resort. In fact it pretty much takes us the same amount of time to drive to the parks when we actually stay at AKL compared to driving from Orange Lake. The really only downside was that we were not able to see and do everything the resort offers as it is so big. We will definitely be going back to this resort again but will probably spend a week at Orange Lake and then a few more days in a Disney resort, just so that we can enjoy more of what the resort has to offer (definitely checking out the golf courses next time) as well as enjoy Disney! All and all it was an excellent trip and I can't wait to go back! Hope this help, I have added pictures of the room/grounds because I always rely on people actual pictures on tripadvisor to get the best idea of what the rooms look like compared to the hotels professional shots which usually never looks like what you actually get.

Reviews.Title: “be carefull”
Reviews.Author: lehighfamily
Reviews.Content: we booked our trip threw amex travel over the phone. we requested a 1 bedroom condo. when we arrived at the resort at about 10pm. we were told we were actually in a standard villa. BEWARE if this happens to you DO NOT leave the foyer. DO NOT go to your "room". The staff here will not help you get to the room you booked. They have told us they have no villas and they are full, yet if i go online to any travel website i can book a villa. They just can't be bothered to move you once youve been in your room. we are in the club house. In a tiny room with a tiny kitchenette. we wanted a larger kitchen with an oven etc because we have a toddler who runs wild in restaurants, so we like to eat in, normal i think. but unless you want microwave meals in a cramped room beware. there is enough closet space for 1 person and a tiny tub (which was dirty and had pubic hair!!) The house keeping charge is $54 to clean this tiny room, my cleaner at home only charges slightly more than that to clean my whole house!! there is 2 washing machines and dryers half way down the shabby corridor, which of course is allways in use. we have 2 towels between all 3 of us...just loverly. when we went to use the washers our neighbour told us she's waited 2 days to use them and her towels were "ripe". we went out to the store and bought toilet paper, washing powder, dish powder etc, as they probably wouldn't have given it to us if we'd asked. we did get a ride to the store from 1 of the staff which was nice (we didn't hire a car which was bit silly really, as the hertz desk lady told us she was all booked up and i've not seen the shuttle bus once).. the pools so far have been pretty good and the guest are friendly. our baby is having a great time of course, but being so cramped together and not being able to block off the kitchen is a real hastle and a bit of a hazard. its hot outside for her so weve spent a lot of our time in our "villa"...more like a room in a super 8...so just beware you know what you are getting or are a single person, or 2 buddies who are going to be out and about all the time., then this room is fine. we are trying to get our trip refunded and have spent a lot of time on the phone with our travel company, which also sucks. it is nice here, its just a shame no-one who works here gives a damm if you are having a good time. we wont be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: tealady726
Reviews.Content: Everything was clean. So many places get a worn out look in Florida but not this one. I thought the staff was friendly and helpful. Be sure to try the water aerobics!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Awful, pathetic horrible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: lphilpot
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Orange Lake Resort started off aggravating. We arrived at 10am and check-in is at 4pm. They told us our two bedroom was still being cleaned. We checked in periodically during the day but they told us it was still being cleaned. We finally got in to room around 5pm only to find 4 to 5 employees sitting in our room watching TV. Their attitude to me was sarcastic. I was mad and called the front desk to report this incident. They gave us a water slide ticket for our trouble. Whoopie!!!! The last day we were there someone came into our room and robbed us of jewelry, 2 ipods and some money. We felt it was retaliation for reporting the incident the first day Management was extremely unsympathetic and rather rude. We stayed in River Island the pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “It is ok”
Reviews.Author: Tripster010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel stay a month in advance,and we got a moderatly cheap stay from expedia. When we got to the hotel the staff was very helpful, they helped us check in fast and easy. The location was helpful because it was close to disney world and the kids wanted to be the first ones to get there. When we got to the room, we were dissapointed because it was very small and the beds were all dirdy and there wasnt enough room for my whole family. As for the cleanliness of our room there was mold growing on the side of our bathroom, and no one took a shower. Luckly, there is a game room and that took up most of our time. While we were there hurricane fey was passing through the area so we only went to the beach and pool for a while cause our little one was affraid.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok, would prefer to stay on Disney for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: jjlimoli
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before many times, but have not been in awhile. The place is very large. Rooms are nice, we stayed in a 2BR condo. There is a full kitchen which makes having meals less expensive than going out to eat. The pools are great but I did not enjoy the river island complex as it was WAY to crowded and floating in the lazy river was like being on a subway at 5pm on a friday in New York City. The other pools were great and there are restaurants at each complex, typical burgers and dogs and overpriced of coarse. We had a few issues upon check in, the woman at the front desk gave us the wrong keys to our condo and it was a 12 minute drive back to the desk to get the right keys, and because we did not check in till 11PM we opted to call the front desk to tell them about our problem and they send security up to let us in and told us to go to the front desk for the exchange in the morning. We went to make the exchange the following morning and was told that we were put into the wrong room and had to change rooms, same building just up one flight. What a pain because we already unpacked EVERYTHING. (2 adults 3 kids) so we packed up and moved up one flight. We were compensated a $50 gift check to be used at any orange lake restaurant on property. There was a fee to use the tubes at the crowded river and a fee to use the hippo water slide, a fee to use the internet which this place does not offer WiFi in rooms. I feel that should of all been included seeing we paid $2500 for a 2br condo for 8 nights. Anyway it was not a bad place i would of prefered to stay on Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Excelllent stay at East Village”
Reviews.Author: CaneFanatic
Reviews.Content: My wife, our two children, ages 9 and 10, and I stayed at Orange Lake's East Village in a 3 bedroom condo during the week of Memorial Day. Even though it rained during some of the afternoons, the rain did not spoil our vacation. We were asked to take the time share tour right when we checked in, but declined and were not asked again during our stay. Check in was slower than check out, but not too bad. My son broke a drinking glass during our stay and the charges were waived. We have stayed at Orange Lake Resort several times before and are really impressed by the improvements that have been made over the past few years. FInally internet connection is available from just about anywhere in the resort and not just in the new sections or near the club houses. The West Village Pool area has been completely redone and it is more inviting for families with small children since they converted the pool to a zero entry one, compared to the olympic style pool that was before. The depest part of the pool is only about four feet, so it is great for those families that have children who are still learning to swim. Our children are both good swimmers, so we had no worries at all. One afternoon we ate dinner at the new Breezes Restaurant and it was a good value for the money and the food was good. We tried all the pools, from the West Village, to Splash Lagoon (North Village) to RIver Island and we liked all of them, but our children specially liked River Island because of the Lazy River. The resort was not really crowded most of the week, I guess because for most children school had not yet finished, so we did not have any trouble finding sitting areas around the pools with umbrellas. I used the exercise room facilities at River Island and all the equipment is great, our children played at two of the three video games arcades and they had lots of fun. We ordered dinner one night from Paizanos, the inhouse italian eatery, when we had friends stay with us a couple of days, and the pizza, calzones, wings and pasta were very good. The burgers, hot dogs and chicken tenders sold by the pool areas were all nice adn so were the fries.. We did not eat at the RIver Island Grill during this stay, but we have before and the food has always been great, just a little higher price than the other places to eat in the resort. We visited two Disney Parks during our stay, Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios and had a blast, specially at Hollywood Studios because it was during Star Wars weekend, since we are all big fans. If you ever visit during this time in the future, stay around for the "dance competition" righ before they close the park amongst all the Star War characters, we really had a lot of fun watching all of them and Darth Vader stole the show with his dance moves. Overall we had a great vacation and highly recomend Orange Lake Resort, it seems to get better every year.

Reviews.Title: “West Village Fears Be Gone!”
Reviews.Author: Kent1915
Reviews.Content: After psyching myself out that our West Lake Village through RCI would be a nighmare, I was more than pleasantly suprised. Unit was recently remodeled and I didn't ask for that. Clean, well maintained, best exchange we have ever done. Check-in was irksome wiht the whole "you have to take the tour" thing, but we cancelled and it was no big deal. It was a nice unit, HUGE resort, lots of pools, all around a good time. Will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good resort for Orlando theme parks (or not)”
Reviews.Author: Lockwrench
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Orange Lake is it's proximity to Disney without paying Disney rates. The resort has plenty of nice amenities. The pool areas were nice, but there is a lot of competition for good seating. That is the reason that they offer "premium" cabanas for rent at one of the bigger pool areas. The restaurants we went to were quite good, and there is a shuttle that takes you around the property so you don't have to drive to any of the on property amenities. There is golf too, but we didn't play. The units were nicely appointed and quite roomy. The kitchen was up to date and had the basic equipment to make a few meals in the room to keep expenses down. There is a brand new Super Target just outside the resort and a Publix that is literally just outside the gate for groceries and sundry items that might have been left at home. It is a timeshare resort, so keep that in mind when you are invited for presentations and lured in with free loot or cash. Overall, Orange Lake is a sprawling resort with plenty to do on site and Disney right next door. I would recommend it to anyone interested in taking the kids to Disney without blowing their college fund.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and Enjoy a Trip for Two”
Reviews.Author: Illini_Fan_9
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at Orange Lake Resort. Overall the location and on site amenities were very good. My wife and I are members, and we have stayed multiple times at this site. The lowest point with this site is the high-pressured sales - that is to have you join or upgrade if you are a current member. Ignore the offers presented at check-in, and the daily phone calls for a short introduction / presentation to the site. Again, we relaxed and enjoyed the area - Tampa, Ocala, and Daytona (all within a short 1 hour drive). Staff is excellent - lost my car keys at the swimming pool area, within 15 minutes being aware they were missing - staff at the front desk (lost / found) had them.

Reviews.Title: “great resort, but look out for "time share" trap!!”
Reviews.Author: gottatip
Reviews.Content: My husband and three kids just returned from Lake Orange on June 19, 2009. We arrived on Sunday, June 14 around 10:00am. Check in was easy; hardly anyone else was there. We were informed about the time share presentation during check in - promised $80.00 to spend at the resort & discount Disney tickets. We were also told that the presentation would last no longer than 90 minutes. Check in is not until 4:00pm, so we spent the afternoon at River Island. Don't waste your money renting a water tube - you'll find lots of them "deserted" around the pool. There is lots of food choices, but things aren't cheap. Every "extra" - food, miniature golf, water rides is another extra fee. We rented a two bedroom villa in the North Village. Very nice; clean; with fully stocked kitchen. Remember, though, this is a time share; not a hotel. You'll need to bring your own shampoo, etc. There is a Publix grocery store on the property, but spend the extra few minutes and travel right down the road to Super Target. Much cheaper & better selection. No room service either. Make sure you have access to a car. The resort is huge. There is a shuttle service, but I'd definately recommend having your own transportation. (gotta make a trip to Target, remember?!) We tried out the pools in the North & West villages, along with River Island. All were clean, but quite crowded. The West Village is where the lake is - kids liked it, however, you cannot swim in it. Towels are complimentary. Back to the time share presentation. We were scheduled for the 7:45am tour. Very crowded - at least 200 people scheduled. Our presentation lasted 3 hours - not the 90 minutes promised. It would have taken longer if my husband hadn't gotten very "upfront" with our sales person. They simply do not take "no" for an answer. Very high pressure. It was a stressful morning; admittingly, the only reason we agreed was because of the discounted ticket offer. They did finally give us a discount on tickets to Disney World & Epcot. We were also given $80.00 in vouchers to use at the resort. The vouchers came in increments of $10.00, however, they will not give you change. Plan ahead before you purchase something. Later, we met a couple who opted to not sit through the presentation. They received a daily phone call, pressuring them to attend. If you can spare a morning and have a lot of patience, it might be worth sitting through - if you're looking to get into one of the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CGA2009
Reviews.Content: Wow, is what I say to Orange Lake Resort. This was the best family vacation that we have ever had. It was my husband and I , our son, my mother and father, sister n law, and niece and nephew, and still room for at least 3 more people. We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa in East Village, and it was spectaular. 3 full spacious bedrooms, with 1 having a sleeper sofa. 3 full bathrooms. Spacious living room with another pull out sofa. We enjoyed family nights watching the LA Lakers win the NBA championship, and had movie time. And there's so much room that everyone was able to enjoy their own private time as well. The waterparks, and pools were great too; the kids really enjoyed them. The resort is really huge, we didn't get to see it all. We were there for 5 nights, and I would have loved to stay for 5 more. Excellent resort, and Excellent deal. We checked in on Saturday, Jun 13, arriving around 8:00pm, and there were only 2 families in line ahead of us. Receptionist said the line had been out the door earlier in the day, so you may benefit from arriving a little later. Also, we received a phone call the first morning with the sales pitch, but I wasn't there to recieve it. They called every other morning, and we just didn't answer the phone, so there's your answer to the presentations. So don't listen to the nay-sayers, it's all what you make of it. My parents are already talking about making reservations for next year.

Reviews.Title: “We had an incredible time”
Reviews.Author: OrangelakeOwner
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we spent a full 3 weeks at our resort. And just loved it. We stayed in the East Village, by the 10th green, walking distance to pool and River Island. Golfed all 4 courses at tremendous discounted rates. These courses are as challenging as they are scenic. We took the owner's update tour, and recommend taking it to learn of future developments. Two hours for $40 in Orange Lake money plus a coupon book are well worth it. We had a miscommunication with our cleaning dates, but this was resolved to our satisfaction. We ate at the River Island Grilling Company restaurant, and the food was great. The portions were generous to the point that we enjoyed the rest the next day in our unit. (2 meals for the price of 1) The West Village pool renovation was top-notch. Enjoyed Breezes Express. (chicken fingers & fries) Close to all the main attractions in the Orlando Area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place... lots of space and a very large spread out resort/timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: JbuffettPH
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights booking through Holiday Inn reservations for $105/night prepaid non cancelable rate online (which was cheaper than booking through the resort with their timeshare introduction package). We had a 2BR condo that was on the golf course inthe west village. This property is set up in 4 villages and West was totally remodled in the last year and everything was very new on the inside. Some of the villages have 5 story buildings. You need a car here even though they have a buss that makes the rounds from our condo to the pool was a 10 minute ride. One of the villages has a pool for smaller kids. Disney was a short 15 minute ride from the property. The lazy river is nice and the "waterpark" two slides and a pool connected to the lazy river was nice. Didnt dine at any of the restaurants on property. so cant speak to that. They offered at checkin to do the timeshare presentation offered $75 cash or $100 in restaurant credit on property and after saying I wasnt sure and had to check with the wife the offer went up to $100 cash or $120 restaurant credit. We didn't find the time to do the presentation so I can't speak to how hard sell they are but at the rate I paid a week is less than the matinence fee for the place annually. Paid the 8$/day resort junk fee up front and was hoping toget a room that my wife wouldnt have to walk as much and near a pool but was pre-assigned and told that we could only move to a unit with its porch facing a major road but the unit in the West Village while it didnt look that nice outside it really was nicely done inside. Actually she probably had to do less walking in the room we were assigned because you park right in front of the unit as opposed to having to navigate a building and you can park up close by the pools in each of the villages. Had to call for washcloths but that was jsut an oversite from housekeeping. Other than that it was a great place for a very reasonable rate. There is no "room Service" and if you wanted hosekeeping you cna arrange for it at the desk. the room had a washer dryer and came with three 1 load boxes of Tide and detergent for the dishwasher (which was very helpful) The bathrooms were furnished with shampoo and other things one would find in a standartd hotel room

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place. Read poor reviews with caution.”
Reviews.Author: jeffcarp
Reviews.Content: We are halfway through our stay at Orange Lake and really love it. I'd first like to address the negative reviews that you may find here. First and foremost, this is a timeshare. A timeshare doesn't have daily maid service. A timeshare doesn't replace your towels. A timeshare doesn't pick up after you. This is a timeshare - you do your own laundry, your own dishes and you are your own maid. If this isn't appealing to you, then you shouldn't stay at a timeshare. Informed travelers should immediately discount those negative reviews complaining about the fact that they couldn't get new towels. (Hint: use the washing machine). Second, the number of negative reviews about getting "roped" into a long timeshare presentation is stunning. DON'T GO. This, again, is a timeshare folks. Timeshare salesman have one goal - sell you a timeshare. It is amazing what some people will put themselves through for a free perk. No one has come to our unit, grabbed us by the arm and forced us into a van to attend a timeshare presentation. Don't go and it isn't a problem. There are several complaints about timeshare salesman calling the units early in the morning. The first thing I did when I checked into the unit was unplug the phone. Solved that problem. There are several other complaints about no Internet access. They don't advertise that you get Internet access, so that shouldn't be a surprise. What IS a surprise is that I am writing this review over the complex's free WIFI access from the clubhouse, which reaches my unit easily. It wasn't advertised that I'd get this but I am. Let's get one other thing out of the way. Yes, this place is HUGE. It is massive. It is (I've heard) the largest timeshare complex in the US. How people get here, see it is huge and then complain about it after the fact, I will never know. Know what you are getting into before you go. Whether the fact that it is huge is a problem or not depends. We are in the West Village, in the single story golf condos. We can walk, within 3 minutes, to the West clubhouse and all it has to offer - pools, mini golf, restaurants, arcade, ice cream, pizza place, etc. The fact that it is huge isn't a problem for us. If we were further away, we'd need to use the free shuttle service (think nice car rental style buses with air conditioning). The complex has everything - pools in each village. This week (first week of June), there were hundreds of chairs available at every pool all day long. No issues with finding a place to lounge by the pool. The condo was very nice - recently redone with new furnishings, appliance, paint, etc. Just a very roomy, very nice condo all around. As one of the largest timeshares in the US, I am sure there are condos that aren't so nice. Each condo has a refurb schedule and depending on where you are in the refurb schedule for the particular condo you get, you may have a different experience. I only know that our condo was great. The location is very good. It is close to Disney, right on highway 192. There is a brand new SuperTarget within 2 minutes. A Walgreens is right at the entrance of the West Complex. There is also a Publix grocery store. We will eagerly be back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negative reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaemap
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful. Took the family and stayed at a 2 bd villa. The villa was big, clean, comfortable with everything you could want. Staff was excellent. Arrived at 5pm on a Sat. and check-in line and time was short. We did go on the "tour", only because we rec'd $100 cash. It did last 3 hrs as other mentioned, but if you want to cut it short, just say "no, I am not employed at the moment" and the tour will end there. We did have to get a little "aggressive" in saying no at the end (and to 4 people, bosses of bosses, etc) but we took it at the beginning of our stay (Sun morning) so it was ok and worth the extra $100 bucks to spend...in cash not credit at the resort. There is so much to do at the resort that we didn't have time to do it all because of the other sight seeing things we wanted to do, but if you just want to relax and stay there, it would be worth it. Plenty of grocery stores around, Super Target, Publix and a Wal Mart about 4 miles down the road. This resort is near everything. From our Villa which faced the galf course we could see the fireworks at night that they put on at Disney, at least the times we made it back to the resort before 9pm anyway. We had a light bulb that was burned out in the entry way when we got there...just called the front desk and went out to dinner. By the time we returned, the light was fixed. The have express check out, just call and leave your last name and condo address and time of departure and just drop your keys in the box on the way out...didn't even have to leave the car. The pools are great and there are plenty of them. There are fees for things, but some things especially events for the kids are free. The Laxy River doesn charge $7 per tube, but you can wade/swim in the river (pool really) and there were always disgarded tubes floating around if you wanted one. Drinks at the pools are pricey..at first...$8 adult and $6 kids (slussy things), but you get a glass that you can keep for the kids and get refills for $2.50 anytime at any pool, and for the adults you get a glass and coupons for refills for $2.50 anytime at any pool. We didn't eat on the resort, we were always out at dinner time, so can't comment on the food. The pools open at 7am so if you love a morning swim or quiet time sitting around the pools, there was hardly anyone there at that time. No, house keeping did not come in everyday to make our beds or clean our mess....but come on folks this is a resort, not a hotel. If you stay a week or more, you will have to buy more TP, laundry soap, coffee and filters, but no big deal. Beds were very comfortable and walls were very thick...could not hear neighbors at all. I will definitely stay again and if you are into buying into a timeshare, it is a nice place and they do have some good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: dargil
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at Orange Lakes,and we were really surprised at how everything was.They upgraded us from a studio to a deluxe 2 bedroom 2 bath villa on the golf course.Everything was new and spotless.We never had one call trying to sell us a time share.All the staff that we encountered were very pleasant and hepful.We approached this place with trepidation after reading some of the reviews,but are so glad we didn't cancel.Will we return, you bet we will,later this year hopefully.Some people you just cannot please.Just go and have a great time..

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice place and location for a Disney visit”
Reviews.Author: susan822
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North Village of Orange Lake. Our Unit was spacious, nicely decorated fairly clean. The units are a bit dark. I loved the screened porch and the master bath was great with the jetted tub, perfect after a day at Disney. We had problems with the lighting that illuminated the stairwells it took 4 phone calls to get it fixed and it was very dark going up and down with no lights. We loved the pools

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend~Beautiful Resort!~Can't to return!”
Reviews.Author: candie123
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in a 2 bdrm in the North Village. We were right on the lighted golf course. Not that we golf, but it was pretty. The room was much larger that expected and just beautiful!. We each had our own bathroom as well. I have to agree, this is a time share and you don't get room service. And so what. This isn't a hotel. We did call to get clean towels and TP, and the response was 20 mins. Not unreasonable! We also got a follow up call to make sure we got what we needed. The cutest thing is we had ducks and flamingos coming right up to the window and looking right at us, like feed me, feed me. Check in was very fast and easy. The gal at the desk was very helpful with information and directions. As far as the phone ringing, most of the time the calls went directly to the voice mail and the phone didn't ring at all. We just ignored most of them. We did get a call regarding timeshare. The person on the phone said it was not a sales presentation but just an update since my friend already had a timeshare. But when we got there it was a sales presentation. We quickly stated we did not want to participate. He apologized. After speaking with his mgr and after 20 minutes of waiting, we agreed to forfeit the offer and they quickly put us back on a shuttle back to the parking lot. That would be my only complaint. Other than that, the pools are beautiful and the whole property is fantastic. Good place for people of all ages and families as well. Nice to have the kitchen so for those who want to cook, can. We did a couple of times to save some $. Since it rained practically the whole time we were there, we didn't get to enjoy the pools as much as we liked. But at least we had a beautiful room to stay in since we stayed there more than anticipated. Did do Disney, Epcot, and Animal Kindom, between the rain. I recommend this resort to any one. Don't let the other reviews bother you. Some people just expect too much. If you want room service, then stay at a Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay but extras will cost you”
Reviews.Author: revvw
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 including 3 teens and a 10-year-old had a great stay at Orange Lake. We rented a 3 bedroom villa in the East Village. Our beautiful view overlooked a greenside pond and offered a nightly view of Disney's fireworks. Our room was great for our family, especially since the rainy weather limited outside activities. Wifi is available for free throughout the resort. We did not visit any of the area's theme parks. The resort had more than enough to occupy our attention. The River Island water park is great. Two water slides, zero entry pools, and a long lazy river offer much variety for all of us. Towels are available at all the resort's pools without cost. Tubes for the lazy river will cost you $7.50 per day per tube or $220 for a Family rental of four tubes for the week. You will pay to play miniature golf, ride the huge inflatable, and any water front activities. Your bottom line can go up pretty fast with these extras. The staff at every part of the resort was friendly and helpful. Every question we had or need we desired was met quickly and properly.

Reviews.Title: “Great timeshare, definitely would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: heatherinPhilly
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Orange Lake in May 2009 on a RCI exhange. Check-in was very quick, no pressure to attend the timeshare presentation as mentioned in previous reviews. We had a renovated two bedroom unit (2400s) right near the entrance to the West Village which was very quiet, and backed up the one of the golf courses. The unit was clean, nicely decorated, and very spacious. Flat screen TV in the living room, with DVD and free wireless internet. For those people complaining about no housekeeping - this is not a hotel, nor do they market themselves as one. It is a timeshare community, in which you do not get housekeeping during your stay unless you ask for it, and pay for it. The resort is beautiful with multiple pools and restaurants, although we spent most of our time off site at the theme parks and outlet malls. Disney is 5 minutes away via a $1 toll road, or a bit further if you do not want to pay the toll. Universal is about 20 minutes away. The only complaint that I have is the continuous phone calls throughout the day - one morning the phone rang 5 times before we left for the parks around 10am. I understand that they are trying to sell timeshares, but I also know that it doesn't make for a very relaxing experience if the phone is always ringing. All in all, I would definitely stay here again, and hopefully have more time to explore and enjoy the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: jojo015
Reviews.Content: I was leary about staying at Orange lake after some of the reviews. We stayed in a 2 bedroom Villa in the West Village May 3 to May 17 (2300's) absolutely beautiful. The unit was perfect I have no complaints. We had lots of room and it was decorated first class. I had made an earlier request to be close to a pool. Our first assignment was too far ,so back to check in I went. I dealt with Lynda on the customer relations desk, Orange Lake would be lucky to have all employees like her. Friendly , polite and efficient what more can you ask for. West Vilage pool was extremley clean and the kids favourite. Lots of chairs around the pool. We sat every morning and evening on the patio which looked out on the golf course. Lots of wildlife around birds, frogs a hawk even a racoon. We didn't do a time share presentaion, they were a little pushy at check in but after that no problem (No early morming calls as I have previously read) All in all a wonderful 2 weeks

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lanpd
Reviews.Content: Great comfortable, very clean updated rooms with wonderful views of one of four golf courses. Very close to the parks with a road close by to the main road leading to the Disney properties. At least seven great pools. Good restaurants. Almost like a lttle city. Will stay there often!

Reviews.Title: “WIll not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nascar8and20
Reviews.Content: The disappointment started when after we checked in and were given the key to our romm, we brought down all of our luggage (there were 7 of us staying a whole week, so we had a lot of luggage). We were staying in a room on the 2nd floor in the main building where you check in. When we got upstairs we tried to open the door w/the key and it would not open, when I went downstairs(mind you I was 6 months pregnant) to the front desk and let them know, they told me it was because the room was not ready. I then asked them why would they not tell me that when they had given me the key so we wouldnt have brought down all of out luggage, they were not able to tell me why so I went to speak to a manager. I let them know what had happend and the manage gave me a new key to a room that was ready. Once we got to the room, it was not the same type of room I had requested. The roon I had reserved had a full kitchen, this one did not. It had no kitchen. I was so pissed off by then, that I didnt even go downstairs to tell them anything. I just stayed with the room. Even staying there a week, they do not change your towels or linens or no any house keeping, when I called and requested more towels, they told me they do not provide more towels, we have to wash it, thats why they give you detergent. The whole week we looked for the trash dispencer and never found it, any of us. I would ask them and never found it with there directions. They never had ice on any of the floors. In order to get to the large pools w/slides, you had to take about a 20 min drive. Once there it was worth it, it was nice! The had bars and palces to eat and little shopping areas. The only good thing about this resort it the pool & slide area!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, near Disney--”
Reviews.Author: ann2122
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in 2-two bedroom units for one week beginning May 8, 2009, as an RCI exchange. We had a quick check-in around 10:00 p.m. and were delighted to have our rooms located next to each other. I had requested a crib (earlier in the week) in one of the rooms, but when we got to our rooms, each one had a crib and a high chair in it, which made it nice, since my 2 year-old grandson could sleep/nap in either room. The rooms were very clean, spacious, had flat-screen TVs in living room and master bedroom. "Starter kit" had all the basics we needed: Tide, dishwashing soap, Dawn packet, paper towels, coffee, etc. Location is great--near Disney. Also Target, Publix, Walgreen's very close by. Lots of restaurants. We were very pleased with our accommodations at Orange Lake and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Golf Break 2009”
Reviews.Author: love2travelwfamily
Reviews.Content: My son and I made our 4th trip to Orange Lake; we had not been there in 4 years and after reading some reviews I was leery but it was wonderful. We stayed in the West Village, quite, serene, just beautiful. From the check-in desk to the car rental people, everyone was wonderful. There wasn't any high pressure sales pitches once I told them my husband wouldn't be joining us. Our villa had been recently been redecorated, painted and new appliances. We had a blast. The several things I would recommend, first of all a rental car or some type of transportation is needed. The shuttle bus drivers were wonderful but the stops are far from the villa and grocery store. Secondly, eat at the Legends bar and grill. The fish and chips are great. Finally, go to Celebration and eat at the Celebration Town Tavern, wow was it delicious. Go grocery shopping at Target or at the Publix down the road; not at the Publix on site. The prices are higher and the lines are long. This was a wonderful golf vacation as my son played 5 out of 6 days.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the negativity... It's only partly true!”
Reviews.Author: ashleymckay
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this resort on travelocity for $86 per night. We flew in to Orlando, drove to Daytona for three nights, then drove back down to Orlando to stay at this resort for the last two nights of our vacation. After reading all of the negative reports about this resort, I actually tried to cancel my reservation. To my surprise, cancelation means no refund. My fault for not reading the fine print. Anyway, as we were warned, as soon as we checked in, (which didn't take as long as everyone else claimed,) we were asked to participate in a "tour" which of course, was a time share presentation. It began at 7:45am the following day and we were told that if we completed it, we would get $110 in free food and beverage from anywhere at the resort. We agreed. The tour wasn't bad.There were at least a hundred participants, yet somehow we all got our own host (Doug) who took us around individually and showed us their immaculate condos. INothing like the promotional room they had us staying in... but that's besides the point. Anyway, after the tour was over, the sales pitch kicked in. At first we were being polite and listening even though we were not at all interested in purchasing a time share. Then, after we said "No" for the 20th time, three more people had their turn at us in hopes to change our minds. It was all fine and dandy until they started throwing insults at us, saying things like, "What? You can't even afford $175 a month? Why are you even on vacation if you can't afford $175 a month? That's when I told them that we were done and we wanted to leave. At this point, what was supposed to be a 90 minute tour had become a 3 hour lecture. But, we did end up getting our $110 and it was well worth it. There is a restaurant in the resort that I believe is called Riverview something or another and it has delicious food! I used the vouchers to get us a steak and lobster dinner with gator as an appitizer. Mmmm... It was great. The best part was the seating. We went around 9pm and we got to catch the movie in the pool. Yes, it sounds crazy but there is actually a huge movie screen that drops down so that you can sit in the pool and watch a movie! We didn't actually sit in the pool to eat our lobster, the deck out back of the restaurant overlooks that pool. It was absolutely beautiful! All in all, the service was great, all of the waitresses and hosts, and whoever all of those people who stand around in hotel lobbies, they were great too. The only downside is, as others have montioned, the pictures representing this hotel/resort are misleading. It was my belief that when I stayed here, like at any other hotel, the pools would be right out back. There are indeed quite a few pools at this place, yet I only saw two. It took us about 15-20 minutes to get from one side of the resort to the other and it's very easy to get lost. There is no way you can walk from pool to pool unless you are in need of exercise. There is, however, a bus that is always right out from that can take you wherever you want. I actually wish I would have stayed a few more days. It was plesant in the sense that everything you could ever want was right inside that little community. On the morning we were to leave I got up extra early and Iayed out by the pool and watched the morning pool exercise class. It looked like so much fun! To bad I'm 23 and not 63. I would have totally joined in! And one more thing. If you feel adventerous and want to leave the resort for a nice romantic dinner, go to the Colorado House of Beef. Corny name, great food. I got the snow crab and it was the greatest thing I have ever tasted! We were the only people in there, too. The place was dead so the service was great. All I can say is do it. Take the chance. Stay at this resort at a really cheap price and take the tour. It pretty much gives you your money right back to you. Just make sure you don't lie to the timeshare guy and let him believe you're interested when you're really not. It gives him false hope. JUST SAY NO! After he gives his speech of course. If you walk out too soon you won't get your $110! any more questions feel free to email me at ashleymckay2@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great value, close to parks, great place to relax.”
Reviews.Author: gfplux
Reviews.Content: I was staying with family in South Florida and my daughter booked this over the internet for a two nights to spend one day at Animal kingdom.. Check in was very quick and we said NO to the time-share meeting. This was supposed to be with breakfast, last 90 minutes and we would get a $90 credit to our room to spend on food and drink in the resort. Our room turned out to be a huge two bedroom two bathroom, full kitchen apartment on the 5th floor in the East Village. The outside of the block is a little utilitarian but the interior of around 120 sq meters was perfect for our stay. Our room number was 86654 and we paid total $300 for two nights. We were two adults with a 3 year old. We had lunch at River island Grilling Company having their lunch special. We spent Saturday afternoon at River Island on the lazy River. We had no trouble with space but economic times are hard so perhaps there are less people staying. Sunday we went to Animal kingdom. This is 15 minutes away but there is a short cut (do your research) which halves the trip time. We ate at Legends Clubhouse in the East Village early Sunday evening but would not do that again. Service was poor and bad humoured. Monday our check out day we spent the morning in River island on the Lazy River. Ate lunch again (very good) at River island Grilling Company having their lunch special again! Great resort at these prices. I believe my daughter will return in July.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly perfect”
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the neutral or even awful reviews of this resort, I was slightly reluctant to go, but since the trip was booked and paid for, I had little choice. Check in was quick and easy, although I was a bit disappointed to find out that the couple we were traveling with were in the same building, but on a separate floor on the other side. Our room was beautiful: clean and nicely decorated. However, there was some construction going on down at the other end of the hall that left a slightly musty odor in the hall and occasional dust , but luckily, it did not make its way into our room. The pool areas were beautiful. Lots of chairs, towels, and plenty of staff around. One morning I got up early to read and without even asking for it, a worker brought over an umbrella asking if I would like some shade, which I desperately did. The lazy river was perfect, nice and relaxing, and on two occasions we got tubes for free as people told us they were abandoned. Another great thing is down by the beach area you can get jet skis and such and the worker there, Jerry, was incredibly helpful and informative and made our jet ski experience even better. My only real complaint came the first morning at 8am when my husband and I awoke to the sound of construction outside our room and then 10 mins later came the obligatory phone call about the timeshare. The woman asked us if we would like a complimentary breakfast and to learn some more information so we could go back to tell our friends about it, and I told her the only thing I would be telling my friends at this point would be that on my vacation in which I was expecting to relax and sleep in, I was woken up at 8am by construction outside of my door. She never phoned again and the construction started much later the following 5 days. Also the view from our room was simply of some air conditioning units and another building, but really, we didn't spend that much time in our room, and when we did, the view was really a small detail compared to the nice decor inside and the convenience of having a stove and refrigerator to use. The location was within a couple of minutes of Disney and Seaworld and there is an abundance of restaurants, grocery and convenience stores within a few miles. I would recommend this resort to my friends and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We love Orange Lake !”
Reviews.Author: teakaym
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the two bedroom units. Very clean, and in great condition. Beautiful view outside our patio. The resort itself is beautiful, and highly maintained. Check in was a breeze. Only 10 min. from Disney. The pools are very clean, plenty of chairs and umbrellas for all and just listening to the music and relaxing is a dream come true for us folks up North ! Will always stay at Orange Lake when we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the resort!”
Reviews.Author: travelfam5fitz
Reviews.Content: Where should I start.........we had a great vacation at Orange Lake! One of the best resorts I have stayed/exchanged through RCI. Yes it was BIG! As everyone has said.....I was worried about my trip after reading all the reviews but really I was pleasantly surprised. Yes we had to drive to the pools; my kids were a bit bugged about that but it really was only a short drive. Seriously......who would go to Orlando and not rent a car. My check in was easy and the ONLY negative about the trip was the push to "pre-gift" items, tell you about the great prices for the parks, tube rentals, but of course......you need to go to the TimeShare 1 hour meeting. I signed up for the tubes because I was under the impression you could only use the Lazy River by using a tube but after spending 5 minutes there I realized my family would be fine without a tube. I immediately went back for a refund, which was handled quickly and efficiently. On Friday and Saturday afternoons the workers "threw" the tubes into the Lazy River at 5:00 for anyone to use for the remainder of the evening so my kids were able to "try" the tubes but after 20 plus minutes they were done with the tubes and just swam as we did all week. (We sometimes stayed at the pool until 7:00 or 8:00pm.) I also was worried that we would not have poolside seating from some previous comments but we must have been there on an off week because there were so many chairs to choose from we had the pick of the crop even when arriving there at 10:30 am. Note....the slides are a blast at the Lazy River, nothing I have ever experienced and try walking against the current; great exercise!!! As far as the room, it was spacious for 7 (2 bedroom for 8), quiet location in the West End with everything in great working condition AND Free Internet Access in our room. We did not utilize the pool or restaurants in the West End but spent everyday at the Lazy River Pool, restaurants and shops. The drive was about 3-4 minutes from our unit. It is great that they have Starbucks, Burger/Hot Dog lunch area or their restaurant for lunch or dinner. Just do beware that with large parties at the restaurants on site they do add on a service charge (18% tip) to your bill so no extra tip is required. My kids met lots of friends, spent evenings in the Lazy River until closing, and we all felt very safe in the complex. This resort was so close to all the chain restaurants, Disney World, Universal, and shopping; it was a great central location for that Orlando experience. Overall we had a wonderful trip here and I am sorry that I can't exchange here again for another few years. I would definately recommend this resort for anyone traveling to the Orlando area!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a quality resort that strives for excellence and almost succeeds.”
Reviews.Author: TheFleetyles
Reviews.Content: The check-in staff was friendly and positive but failed to include the information that we needed most. Save yourself some time and disappointment by saying no to their timeshare presentation. The suite was comfortable but not as good as some of the other resorts we have stayed at in the past. They don't provide room service during your stay. Instead you get a washer and dryer so plan on washing your own towels and doing your own housekeeping (not my goal for a vacation.) Rent a car as the cost of shuttles from the airport and parks will exceed the cost of the rental vehicle for the week. We called housekeeping so we could set up the hide-a-bed for the kids and the love seat for the youngest of our three. It took three calls and five hours to get the bedding we needed to the room. The staff was arguementative throughout the process and no one apologized. We attended the time share preentation mid-week after being promised that it would last no more than one hour and that we would be provided breakfast. The person who came out to do the presentation asked us about our stay was going so we told her about the situation we had with housekeeping. She told us that they only provide room service for owners, and that as RCi members we were "second class citizens, after all they only shared 200 of their 1800 uits with RCI." Breakfast was stale doughnuts and some ovely ripe fruit. We passed. A few of the staff apologized but no one tried to fix any of it. There isn't enough sapece to truely explain the small issues that combine to make this a MUST MISS resort!

Reviews.Title: “Objective view, mother with two children”
Reviews.Author: motherphysician
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews before visiing and could not understand such a huge discrepancy. Now-after visiting-I do understand. All depends where you stay. I got room in West Vilage. As RCI exchange program I got a studio on 1st floor, Well.. There we go.. NEGATIVES: 1. NO WINDOWs. Just a piece of glass inserted in the wall. If you have claustrofobia or like fresh air once in awhile - forget it, not to mention that in case of fire you pretty much locked inside the room, no way to escape. View was horrible, but that did not bother us. 2. COCKROACHES. We'VE seen them in our room, fat, happy and unpleasant. 3.CHECK-IN. That process took forever, so be prepared. POSITIVES: 1.Wonderful swiming pools, lots of activities on the ground such as mini golf, kids club, arcade 2. Staff is friendly overall. 3. Location is great, close to Disney etc.,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent timeshare! Some people are never happy!”
Reviews.Author: livingnowforfun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 14 year old son stayed at Orange Lake April 17th through the 24th. Just like last year, we had the best time! We stayed in the West Village once again in a renovated unit and the place was spotless! I can not understand some of the negative reviews except to say that some people are never happy and are always looking to complain about something. Many of the days we were out and about at the parks but did get to spend two full days at the pools and had a great time. Moon, who is part of the Fun Team was great with the kids and adults during the activities at the pool. My son enjoyed the new arcade in the West Village and we also had a couple of great meals at the River Island Grilling Co. restaurant. As far as phone calls, many were recorded reminders about golfing and since it was just a message we just hung up. We only received one asking us if we wanted to attend a timeshare meeting. We said "no thanks" and that was it. End of story, we never got another phone call. It's vacation people, why let a couple of phone calls ruin your day. Really, there are more important things in life to worry about! As for the grounds, they are impeccable! Every where I looked, I saw people tending to the grounds and it showed. As far as the prices of drinks at the bar, I think it's a good thing that they are pricey because it helps limit the amount of alcohol that people consume since the bar is right at the pool where there are lots of kids and families. Plus, you can always go the the convenience store!

Reviews.Title: “They Don't Even Try to Make You Happy”
Reviews.Author: BlandonBicycle
Reviews.Content: Misrepresentation from the start. Service staff seemed to be trained to tell you that there was nothing they could do or that they didn't know who could be contacted to help with a problem. Once you were staying there they considered you to be captured money. They represented themselves as a four star resort. The only way this is true is if they are grading on a curve with a high score of 10 stars. They look for ways to soak you for money and they have no system in place to resolve disputes or problems. On the first day they woke my wife up early by calling the room to try and schedule us for a sales presentation. It went downhill from there. If you have young kids and low expectations this may be alright for you. Better to save your money and stay a little further away from Disney at a normal hotel. Amenities will be better and frustration will be less.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort...great service and staff....4 star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimmo32725
Reviews.Content: We live about 1hr from the resort. I wanted to get away for the weekend and with a 6yr old I needed a resort with activities but also upscale. This was a great resort. The room we selected was a one bedroom with king and pullout sofa. Beautiful layout and decor. Pools were great, lazy river super, restaurants great. We never felt pressured about anything. We also rented a cabana which was pricey at $119.00 per day but it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: checkde
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite in North Village. The party consisted of two couples, one with a one-year old and the other with 11 month, 5 year old, and a 7 year old. We also had an 11 year old with us. The suite because of the pull out bed in living room was able to easily accomodate our group. The decor was decent, the bathrooms great, and the kitchen a little subpar especially the drains. Our suite overlooked the golf course, but you barely noticed it was there. Overall the resort provided a very relaxing atmosphere. One big negative though was the lack of sidewalks. Some suites are almost within walking distance of the pool areas but walking in the resort is risky, especially because the posted speed limit of 23 mph is not strictly adhered to. The location is decent, a little far (because of lights and traffic) from I-4 which we used a lot to get to restaurants and to visit friends, but very close to Disney World. In terms of conveniences in addition to the Publix and 24 hour Walgreens mentioned in other reviews, there is a seemingly brand new Target directly across from the east side of the resort. This was incredibly convenient. The pools were great for the kids. The river area was neat with the lazy river, slides, etc. but are mostly younger group of children preferred the North Village pools which were less crowded and generally more fun for small children. Finally it is not clear from the website or other reviews but free wi-fi is available throughout the resort. This was a great resource.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation and service with great location”
Reviews.Author: Mutleyuk
Reviews.Content: My Son - age 13 and I have just returned from Orange Lake and cannot recommend it highly enough. I had some mixed feelings after reading previous reviews but we had great service. The accommodation was a 2 bedroomed condo with both bedrooms having en suite bathrooms. Check in was quick and easy and, we had a couple of issue early on such as a leaking tap and the safe did not work but these were sorted within half an hour of calling reception. There was so much to do at the resort but we hardly scratched the serface as we were out and about most days - the pools were lovely. The location is ideal - on the 192 with easy access to the I4 for all the attractions. There are supermarkets at the entrance and restaurants nearby. Couple of tips - take a satnav if you are driving - reduces the stress dramatically , and don't be put off by a few negative reviews! You do get a couple of phone calls inviting you to timeshare presentations but I was quite firm about refusing and did not feel pressured. Overall I was really happy with the resort and would definitly go again

Reviews.Title: “misrepresented and misleading”
Reviews.Author: chinookgeo
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here! We booked a suite for 8 nites in April. When we arrived, some wait to check in. But once at desk, the clerk seemed to know nothing. Every question I asked, she had to disappear for 5 minutes and return with the answer. I had booked a minimum 1 bdm suite or villa. When we finally got to our room, it was a small motel room! It was dark and narrow, with two beds shoved up against the wall and a small kitchen on one wall. And the cost was $200 a nite! I complained and they said that it was a standard "suite" - what a joke. I threw the keys and papers at them, and immediately called Visa who cancelled all charges. We found another place. All the photos online make this look nice, with large multi-room suites or villas. HA. Be very careful about staying here. Bahama Bay is MUCH better! We have stayed there twice - large condos and very reasonably priced. Oh, and they do pitch the time-share thing to you also at Orange Lake. It is just a revolting place. And for a Holiday Inn? My opinion has dropped for that company. I travel a lot for business

Reviews.Title: “flagrant false advertisement”
Reviews.Author: orangelakesucks
Reviews.Content: I had booked a one bedroom villa 2 1/2 months earlier and before doing that I knew what I wanted. Did I get it? Hell no!!! I had all my documents with me showing what I purchased and they still didn't do a thing for me. My 5 year old son fell asleep in there lobby because we arrived at 8:30 at night and they fought me tooth and nail. I didn't get up to our room until 11:30 am. The following morning they still could not do a thing for me. I was given a $100 gift card which could only be used on their resort. One hot dog, two burgers, and a couple of drinks......$44. They claimed that they did it out of good will even though they really aren't losing anything out of it. Since I've been home I have talked with hotels.com who I booked it through and they have all my documentation. For anyone else who got screwed by this resort they should go to BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU or CONSUMER AFFAIRS which I did and I am trying to receive a full refund. I was told if they didn't give me that then CONSUMER AFFAIRS provides me with a lawyer at the resorts cost (when all said and done) and to sue for false advertisement. It is going to cost them more in the long run because they don't have a leg to stand on. I have full proof of what I paid for and this is how they work. Now they will learn the hard way. Would I reccomend this resort to a friend? Absolutely 100% not. Oh and by the way Hotels. com stands behind me 110% in what I intend to do. Good luck getting advertisement ORANGE LAKE!!!!! You are just burning bridges.

Reviews.Title: “Never come back”
Reviews.Author: TripEdvisor
Reviews.Content: We just returned from OL last week. We had a terrible impression about this place and definitely never come back. We booked 1 bdr unit few months ago in West Village. By arriving we were placed in studio and despite multiple attempts to change, we were told this is our Club Hose one bedroom and this is only what we have. I am not sure what kind of guests they expect to have - the only somebody from old village of development country who has no idea what is the studio and what bedroom mean. They will be impressed for sure! Unit was ridiculously small. You walk right in to the "bedroom" from the corridor. They placed the bed in the entrance area and they declare this space as a bedroom, There is no window, no closet there. Absolutely dark and no air at all. There was a terrible noise from the corridor around the clock. Conditioning system is very old and when AC worked it sounded as a tractor. We could not sleep during the night as result of this noise. We traveled with a little boy and the first night we wanted to get him sleep on the sofa bed - no way! - no linen was provided. After our call to reception we were waiting 2.5 hour! to get the linen. Kid was already sleeping in our bed as it was 11:30PM. Unit does not have kitchen - just a kitchenette with fridge which you may use for few bottles of beer. We did not find anything what could impress us in this place. Very outdated and primitive. The service was unacceptable! Absolute rejection of any your needs! We travel a lot around the world and this is the first time when we were provided with so pure and ignoring service. We spoke with 9-10 different "managers" trying to get change. It took us 6 days! to have us heard. Finally... 2 days before leave we were moved to River Island 2 bdr unit - this place was nice. Fortunately there are a lot of activities outside the resort. We went to Disney, Universal, Kennedy Center and many more.

Reviews.Title: “Service was awful”
Reviews.Author: esceclan
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Sunday afternoon, and were guided to the correct line (there were 3, one for owners, one for renters, and one fro RCI members), but waited 30 minutes to check in becasue there were only 3 reservation clerks working. Finally a man from another area came over and checked us in. We had 5 people in our room, so one slept on the sleeper sofa, which was fine except that there were only sheets provided (no pillowcase or blanket). I called housekeeping to ask for a blanket and was told that they would send one right up. After 20 minutes I went to the customer care department on our floor and asked for one. The people there were very nice, but it took them another 25 minutes to locate a blanket. As they came back to my room (now 11pm), the housekeeping stafff was just bringing a blanket up. It wasn't so much the time as it was the fact that adequate linens were not in the room to begin with. The next day after retruning from Universal Studios, we found our room had not been serviced. We were not told as we checked in or at any time by anyone that there would not be any housekeeping service. The beds were not our concern, it was that we did not have any clean towels. I called housekeeping again and was told to call the front desk. I called the front desk and the woman I spoke to told me that clean towels were not provided unless you stayed 14 days or more. She offered to send towels to me for $7 each.

Reviews.Title: “Time Share Sharks!!”
Reviews.Author: caro1935
Reviews.Content: We have been owners at Orange Lake for the last eight years. It is an outstanding resort! We just returned this weekend from a 7 night stay.. I highly recommend the resort; the grounds and units are great!! However, I do not recommend that anyone attend the time share pitch.You will be promised a small reward...probably $40 of Orange Lake bucks. This dividend varies from person to person...some people ask for cash instead, and get it if they insist. Other people negotiate and get $60, $70, $80 or more!! So when they offer you $40 of their script to spend on their property, hold out and request more...you can get it!! The time share presentation is an absolute joke. For us, it is called an "owner update" because we already own. It is not an update of anything except to try to hardsell us into buying more weeks or a unit with more bedrooms than the 2 bedroom we already have. When the sales girl found out we are not interested, another person comes to try to convince us that this is what we should do. They really got kind of insultive to us for not wanting to buy addition time or larger units. We actually are interested in buying another week, but looked elsewhere. A few miles away, we toured Majestic Dunes ($70 dividend). They showed us resale prices (from units they apparently repossessed)....much cheaper and just as nice if not nicer that Orange Lake!! Previous postings talk about Orange Lake charging extra for everything...they do!! They give you absolutely nothing. At Majestic Dunes, the miniature golf was even free...I was impressed!! I do not know if their course was similar to the three at Orange Lake because we have never paid to play at Orange Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great pools”
Reviews.Author: majk_p
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day break (mid March 09) and we had no problems, especially of the ones other write ups discussed. The desk staff was helpful and friendly, and the pools, shops, and grounds were wonderful. Its true that its not a hotel, but they did provide soap, towels, etc...but only some. When we needed some shampoo a Target was right across the highway. My kids loved the arcades too, where all the machines actually worked! Our room location wasnt the best, but we werent in the room very often so it didnt bother us, and we noticed very little noise at night from within the hotel. All in all I thought it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating”
Reviews.Author: khler
Reviews.Content: I had confirmed the reservation over the phone which took a lot of effort to do. I spoke with 2 different reservations agents which had minimal to no knowledge of the property I was interested in. I was on hold for inconsiderable amounts of time each time I had asked them questions. It was frustrating but even more irritating that most of the information I had received was incorrect. At check-in I was asked on whether I was an owner or not and was directed to where we should be waiting for the next available agent. At that time, we (my baby in my arms and my 7 yr old daughter) were the only guests waiting for assitance. There was a different line that was quickly getting longer but was getting assisted much quicker than we were. I had probably been standing in line for longer than 20 minutes and had asked several employees if I was in the correct place. Eventually - after an exhausting wait - somebody from one of the check-in tables in the back offered to help me check-in. As soon as we got to the villa - it was not what I had been promised or told of over the phone. I had asked if the rooms were all on the ground level. It was important for me since we had kids and were there to celebrate my daughter's birthday. Which is one of the reasons why I booked at this resort. I wanted to change speak with someone regarding changing to ground level perhaps but after going through all that trouble - it was just exhausting to even think about doing it. And by then - our friends and family had already arrived. The villa in itsef was nice except that someone would expect to have more than just 1 packet of decaf coffee in the room or the option of regular coffee since we do not drink decaf. She also told us that the resort was completely smoke-free and smoking was not allowed even in the balconies/patio. Some of our friends and family declined to decline our invitation because of this. And then I found out that smoking is not allowed in the villa itself but is allowed on the patio's/balconies. On the day that we were supposed to check-out - we had 5 employees calling knocking on our room stating they needed to check and fix something on the patio. Housekeeping checking on what time we were leaving the room. Calls to our room checking on the time we were leaving and more calls - I believe from employees as well but excusing themselves that they have the wrong number. This all happened before the 10 a.m. check-out time. They did not even have the courtesy to wait until after check-out time to do all these. It was definetely a nightmare...something . Me and my husband work in hotels as well and I just cannot believe what a nightmare it had been. As a paying customer - I believe I am owed a certain degree of good if not excellent customer service. I mean I loved the resort and amenities - they just need to work on their staff. After all - most people who even think about spending their hard earned money on these tough economic times deserve to get the most of what they spend.

Reviews.Title: “Calls calls and more calls.”
Reviews.Author: cet413
Reviews.Content: I go on vacation to get away from phone calls and to sleep late but that is not what I was able to do. They called an average of 5 times per day. I ended up unplugging the phones but then then I was awoken with a morning leaf blower. UNFUN

Reviews.Title: “orange lakes overrated , poor staff and management”
Reviews.Author: claudia0809
Reviews.Content: I am a timesher owner at orange lakes I was very disappointed with the condition on my room. Staff and management are very poorly trained I felt that I had taken a wrong turn and could possibly be at the motel 6 with the type of service I received. Very pricey with poor service. i would not recommend this resort

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Scoobie_8
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort before as an RCI exchange. Stayed in the West Village as it was being renovated. Our unit was clean but needed updating. Found the location to be ideal for area attractions and golf. Decided to purchase a week of timeshare and returned in December to see our unit. GREAT location. We are in the East Village, on the top floor over looking the 4th green and the pool...and a view to the evening fireworks at Disney. Our unit was clean, well maintained and was ideally suited for 2 families. We have a 3 bedroom and 3 bath unit. Brought my brother and his family. We had the Master suite, they had the Guest suite and my niece had the kid's room with 2 queen beds. We wanted to golf, my brother and his family wanted to see Disney. The resort itself has lots to do and the pools are great for kids, especially now that the West Village pool complex is complete. As we were travelling primarily as a couple, we avoided the pools with the kids and used the small pool connected with our unit. Perfect. The best thing about this resort is the location . It is quite large, and you certainly need transportation but the grounds are clean, well kept and the golf courses are in fairly good shape. If it is a golf holiday you are looking for, know that there are MANY off site courses and there are many price points to choose from. Convenient grocery store, had reasonable meals on site and found the staff to be helpful. We will continue to use our week and bring family members that would not normally have the opportunity to stay in a resort type setting. We did attend an update with the timeshare personnel. Found that we did not feel pressured, although if you own, there are always things you learn when you attend such a presentation! Note...high speed internet should be available in all units sometime this year. That will be a great improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: JeanineMB
Reviews.Content: We traded into the resort through our RCI timeshare. We stayed in a 2-bedroom West Village condo. It looked recently renovated, with updated furniture, paint, appliances, etc., and had a nice view of a small lake and golf course. It's a great location for all the usual attractions; easy drive to the Disney, Universal and Sea World properties. We really like having the comfort and convenience of a full kitchen, washer and dryer, and two bathrooms, as well as all the pool and recreation facilities. (Especially with two young children.) The River Island complex was where we hung out the most when not sightseeing. We had a rental car, but the shuttle bus service seemed to run frequently around the property to the pool and clubhouse areas. I would not call the customer service outstanding (a request for fresh towels was ignored); but we basically consider ourselves to be on our own at a condo, and handle our own laundry, food shopping and toiletry purchases. If the occasion arose, we would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: amoss72
Reviews.Content: My husband, children and I have stayed at Orange Lake numerous times. We don't even look for anywhere else to stay in Orlando because we love it here so much and know we will be well taken care of. The two bedroom units are very spacious and well maintained. We generally ask to be in the West Village because it's close to the general store and basketball courts and main building. You can always hitch a ride on one of the shuttles and go anywhere you want on the property. We always rent a car at the airport. Orange Lake is so easy to get to and get around to other area attractions. WDW is less than 5 minutes from the resort. There are also plenty of great places to eat right on the same road the resort is on. We like to get groceries and eat at least two meals a day in our room. The kitchen has everything you need to easily prepare and serve just about any meal. River Island is awesome. I can't say enough great things about it. We are going again in April and I can't wait to see what the new pool looks lke. You really would never need to leave the resort. There is so much to do and every day and night they have more than plenty activities planned for you to take advantage of if you so choose.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Strabo
Reviews.Content: Our stay was part of an RCI exchange. We had a 3 bedroom "villa' in a multi-storey complex in the West Village. It was a ground floor unit that looked into the golf course. Our unit was recently renovated so everything was still clean & new. The villa was large enough to accomodate 2 families very comfortably. The adults took 2 rooms with attached bathrooms. The 4 kids shared another room that had 2 queen sized beds. Check-in staff were very friendly and efficient. It was our base for Disney World & surrounds. We did not use that many facilities except for the pools in River Island & the mini-golf courses. We bought a mini-golf family pass which entitled 8 persons unlimited play - it was really great value and we had such a blast. It was a fun family activity on non-Disney days. Fortunately, we had no issues whatsoever & would highly recommend the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake could care less how they treat owners and guests”
Reviews.Author: sweeney
Reviews.Content: First of all...this place used to be the AAA number 1 resort. Now, you have staff that is rude. Management that doesn't care and sales people who will treat you nice and tell you what you want to hear in order to sell you a unit but once you buy....they treat you like crap. The golf is a joke. $135 for a poorly manicured course.(general public price). 79 to golf for owner and 89 for a guest on a golf course that has more dirt spots on it than any other I have played. Save money and travel 30 minutes North to Clermont and golf the beautiful areas up there. the orange lake resort course is over priced and overrated. Best thing about Orange Lake? Proximity to disney and other attractions. Still a quiet place to stay. The staff needs to be trained better and the service to the condos needs to improve. Try getting someone who speaks English......very difficult

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: shyguydwlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during christmas week of last year. We booked studio unit (in west village clubhouse) via expedia. We arrived little late (around 9pm) so only 1 family was waiting for check-in before us. Check-in was done quickly and smoothly. While front desk was quite busy in the afternoon, it was relatively empty in the evening. We're located at unit on the lakeside (back side of clubhouse building). Unit was quite better than we expected (or shown in homepage). Room is beautifully renovated, very clean, without any serious troubles. Even though it is said to be 'studio', bedroom is separated from living room area by door and bathroom area in between. Pullout sofa bed could be used as 2nd bed. Kitchen is quite small but sufficient for making small meal. (there are stove, refrigerator, sink (all of small/mid size) and cookware). However, they need to be re-arranged. For example, one pot with wrong lid, all different glass cups or dishes. There are two big screen LCD TVs (one in bedroom and the other in living room) with DVD-VCR combo. There is no laundry in our suite but we could use in shared laundry room located in hallway. We got a call next day after we checked in. We said not interested then never got bothered again.
