We usually left in the morning and came back in the evening. That might be why we could avoid sales pitch. For driving to WDW, we found taking 429 was quite better than 192 in terms of traffic. It is toll road but it should be worth. Much faster and no trouble about traffic. For grocery, just couple of minutes drive to publix (east of 429), approx 10 min westbound drive to walmart. And there are tons of restaurants on 192. There are some little downsides; in clubhouse studio unit, it is not easy to ventilate because living room's window cannot be opened. And we have to take relative long walk between our unit and parking lot. But they were just minor things for us. Definitely, we would like to come back if we would have any chance to visit WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but take the timeshare hard-sell with a pinch of salt”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekers0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake on marketing promotion deal gained through a family member. The price was really good value and location fantastic to visit the Orlando parks which was our main reason for being there. The condo had pleanty of space - it was only 2 of us staying but it would have slept 8. Two bedrooms, 1 master with huge en-suite, a second with 2 double beds plus a double sofa bed in the living room. Everything was provided for a long stay - washing machine, dryer, dishwasher, a real home from home. The room was clean, tidy and we even got a small welcome pack with everyday things like washing powder and kitchen roll etc. The view we had looking out over one of the golf courses and we also had a private balcony. The downside to our stay at the resort - as part of the deal we were required to attend a no obligation, marketing presentation about the timeshares. We were pre-warned and prepared for this but still were not quite ready for what we recieved. In summary, after the overview the hard-sell started. Each time we said no they brought someone else to try. If you end up staying with this kind of deal just say No (unless you really want a timeshare) and keep in mind the savings that you made on the price. It was just about worth it, we saved about $400 on a 3 night stay. This would be perfect for groups of friends or 2 small families, there is a water park in the resort and they can even do their own take away if you don't feel like cooking/going out.

Reviews.Title: “no soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: moosexing
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orange Lake west village and stayed in the main building in a one bedroom studio that we got free as a guest of a friend who is an RCI member. We wanted to warn anyone from staying in the main building suite units. Our first room was old and right next to rooms that were being renovated. There was constant construction noises so we asked for another room away from the work. Our second room was also older which was not such a big deal for us since we got it for free, but the big problem with the rooms was the noise!!! We could hear everything in the rooms next door. We could hear the TV next door as if it was in our room and honestly believe that it was not turned up that loud, it's just the walls don't have any soundproofing. We even heard our neighbor snoring every night. Our room was also near the laundry and vending area so there was constant noises from that as well. The AC was also very loud as well as the refrigerator, the only plus about these is that it helped drowned out the noises from the rooms next door. If you plan on staying in these rooms I would recommend bringing headphones if you want any sleep. Just to note, a soda from their vending machines is $2.75 give me a break… The west village resort itself was just ok. The newer river island was much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Security & Service”
Reviews.Author: WI-earswearer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Orange Lake Resort - West Village. The resorts amenities are nice and clean, however the security and customer service provided during our stay was less than acceptable. There are many other resorts around the Orlando area that I have stayed in over the past 10 years - we vacation in the area about every 18 months - that I strongly suggest you do not stay at this resort. Our truck was broken in to while parked on the resort in front of our unit. When we found that our door lock had been punched out of the vehicle sometime during the night we immediately called the resort security. We were headed to a breakfast reservation at Disney and were EXTREMELY UPSET to have to wait 30 minutes for someone to show up. We called several times during the 30 minutes and spoke to the Security Manager who didn't seem at all concerned that our vehicle was damaged on their property - he was very nonchalant and unsympathetic to our situation. We then wrote a report with the resort security and also reported it to the Orange County Sheriff's dept. We then talked to 2 people in Resort Services, who claimed the resort was secure and that no one could get in without security seeing them - although the bordor of the resort along Hwy 192 is not fenced in and has a golf fairway running the stretch of the border, that anyone could run across and be in the resort - guest services believed that it was impossible to believe that someone entered in this way. The guest services personnel suggested that they do not know the type of people that are guests at their resort and insinuated that any guest on the property was most likely the suspect in the break-in. I find it very unfortunate that the employees of this resort believe that the guests of their resort are criminals and bad people. Maybe they should change careers from hospitality to working at a county jail or state penitentiary. We also submitted some paperwork to the legal department of the resort. After 7 days I called resort services to see if there was a response. I was told that the legal dept had reviewed our information and had an answer in 2 days, however resort services was to call us with an answer and they claimed to not have our telephone number to call. The phone number was on the paperwork that was still in the legal dept - how hard is it to call back a department and ask for the phone number off of the paperwork. I find this to be very unprofessional and the service to not be customer orientated at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for DisneyWord”
Reviews.Author: mrjanto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here so that we could go to Disneyworld. For the most part, we enjoyed our stay. The negatives: 1. Check in does take some time because they want to be sure you don't want to sit through their timeshare presentation. I had to tell them several times that I wasn't interested. 2. In addition, the girl had to answer text messages that she kept getting on her phone while she was gathering my information. 3. She needed a credit card to put a deposit on (I had prepaid through RCI.) I gave her a Discover card, but she was very reluctant to accept it even though she told me that it probably wouldn't be used. 4. Our screen door was falling off. 5. The sheets were dirty in my sister's room. 6. They called at least once a day to see if we wanted to listen to their presentation. 7. We had to wash our own towels if we wanted clean towels during the week. Other than all that I really liked the place. It was close to Disney. The traffic is probably worse at other times of the year, but we had a very quick drive. The unit was better than anything I'd seen at a timeshare. I did not get a chance to visit the multiple pools, and I did not spend any time at the activities center. I did enjoy my morning runs around the property. Yes, I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “concerns for orange lake”
Reviews.Author: imc410
Reviews.Content: several issues with resort.... 1. pools and hot tubs not properlly maintained 2. low staff numbers 3. very low staff moral 4. management not impowered to solve concerns 5. issues with resort and staff are passed off from one manager to another.......never getting resolved

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and good accommodations”
Reviews.Author: mjm2002msw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort using RCI points, although we are Wyndham property owners. Upon arrival, resort is very large...expansive. Includes golf course, pools, water park, restaurants, etc. There are 1-story villas & 3-4 story condos. Upon arrival check-in was very smooth. We were able to check in at 11:30 a.m., not the usual 4:00 p.m., giving us time to get luggage in our room and head to Disney - we didn't have to worry about leaving the park and coming back to check in, then returning to the park. Our room was in East Village, clean, nice and had all amenities expected at a time share resort. Rooms are laid out almost exactly like we're used to at Wyndham. First time used dryer - there was a problem in the dryer that left dark brown streaks on our white/light clothes. Also the front door & back patio door would not close on their own - we had to basically slam them shut. Called maintenance in the morning, and they were there within the hour to fix both problems. We paid the $20 to do the "45 minute breakfast and time share info." We did get our money back in cash after completing the meeting. Unfortunately breakfast was VERY disappointing. 2 types of muffin & 2 types of donut. Coffee, juice, & some bananas & apples. They say you pay $20 so they don't lose money if you back out. HA! I wouldn't pay $5 for the "breakfast." During the meeting, our guy was very nice, personable. We told him we weren't interested in buying b/c we own a great deal of points with Wyndham. Of course, when he was done the 2nd person came in. When she didn't get anywhere, a 3rd man came over. This guy was a complete JERK to the other couple with us. After realizing we had NO desire to buy from RCI, he started in on them like a pit bull. Made some derogatorry remarks about why they weren't purchasing & their poor choice. After sitting through that mess, we finally got our $50 food & beverage coupons for resort restaurants along with a coupon book for local attractions. We also had the opportunity to purchase attraction tickets at wholesale cost. While we really wasted our time with the sales pitch, we ended up having a very nice dinner at River Grille. Food was delicious and service was great. Overall our stay at Orange Lake was very good. We were on the golf course and occasionally could catch views of the fireworks from one of the parks. Yes, there was the periodic morning "aroma" from Animal Kingdom. But it didn't stick around long.

Reviews.Title: “One and Done!”
Reviews.Author: uffdlguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orange Lake "Resort" on Jan 1-3 of 2009. It had some ups and downs, we'll start with the ups. The main positive of this complex was the scenery. It was very tropical and secluded, so you had no idea how close you were from the highway. There were a lot of pools to choose from, which was nice. It also had several tennis and basketball courts, and had a few golf courses, though we didn't go golfing. Well, that's about all the positives. When we booked our mini vacation, we booked in the North Villiage - since we were told that it was the newest section of the resort. We told them we would not accept any other locations and they said it wouldn't be a problem. Well, once we went to check in, they said they gave our rooms away, and it took over an hour of fighting at the front desk to get our correct rooms. We booked two 2-bedroom villas. The villas themselves were pretty nice. Had a big master bedroom/bathroom and also a nice living room. Neither of the villas were perfect though. One had no water at all coming from any faucets and the other had a busted tv. There were also water stains all over the ceiling. They got the water turned on after one full day, but it never was right... really had no pressure at all. Also, the walls and ceiling are very thin, so anytime someone in the unit above us even walked around, it sounded like they were about to come through the roof. If you are used to all inclusive hotels, this is NOT the place for you. This resort obviously makes a killing nickle and diming their residents. The only thing free at this resort is the towels at the pool (if you can even find any). They sell you a $8 cup that they say can be used for drinks all around the resort ($2 refills each time), but everytime you go to a different pool or bar they say they can't do the refills, sorry. Sure, going in their lazy river is free... but what is that? You want to actually use a tube on their lazy river... oh, that'll be $10 for the day please. Miniture golf is $9 a round, a 12oz steak at their resturant is $30, the ability to use the water slide at the pool is $100/person/week, the bar near the front pool doesn't have fountain drinks, so a bottle of water or a CAN of soda is $2.50, a little spray bottle of suntan lotion is $10... it goes on and on. The resort is so large you have to drive everywhere, you have to bring your wallet everywhere, it's just a logistical nightmare. There are enough other resorts in Orlando that don't try and nickle and dime you every chance they get... we'll never be coming back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best--if you stay in an unrenovated room...”
Reviews.Author: DetroitMama
Reviews.Content: My mother got this thru an RCI exchange...we were located in the north village circle, 2nd level. Short and quick: older villa. big, but had problems. we had to have a housekeeper come and clean the caked on dirt/scum/whatever it was, on the nightstands. ALL of them. sink leaked. had it fixed. sink handle in the master bath came off and mom used a kitchen knife to screw it back on. no recycling--i called the front desk and they said leave it separated from the regular garbage. i had a feeling they didn't really throw it in the recycling bin---and i never saw a recycling bin ANYWHERE? no internet (although the tech guy i talked to said they are getting that with the first of the new year). sheets a little rough. loud air conditioning, loud pipes. jacuzzi could've used a spritz with some bleach, staining around the jets. in fact everything could've used a spritz with bleach. i just felt that everything was wiped down, not REALLY cleaned. i really did try to find the silver lining in everything, but one day i feel i just kept calling the front desk to complain, i was really annoyed. i told my mom to request an updated room, but she really isn't the pushy type and didn't really ask very well. when i called about the problems, they were attended to quickly, but should i have THAT many problems to deal with? pools were beautiful. towels were readily available, and the areas were clean in the morning. my problem was nighttime when i went swimming when the crowds were gone.....seems they clean up in the morning, but in the evening, lots of old towels lying around (especially around the spas!!!! gross!). they really need someone just to use a dustpan and pick up the little things people leave behind, not just in the morning, but REGULARLY--like even once an hour or every other hour! especially during hightime. it was really annoying and gross. not really looking forward to coming back, unless we get a renovated villa. since we aren't owners there, i don't see that happening. disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: FamilyHoliday78
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 bedroom unit in the West Village. This unit was dated and in need of a fix up. Had a water leak that saturated the dining room carpet, took some days to dry out. No separate showers, showers over baths with probably 20 year old shower heads and plastic shower curtains. Air con unit was old and switches on and off intermittently at night. TV's are old and no DVD in unit - still have a single video machine in the room to play VHS format. There is no wireless or other internet available other than around business centre for a price - rooms are far away with no connectivity. Resort has a kids play area, but no facility to leave kids attended to do fun activities as at other resorts. Parents must stay with children at all times even in kids area. Only once a week havea parents night out where kids watched for 3 hours. Staff are helpful and friendly, bird life and other nature (raccoons, squirrels etc great for a resort) Pools also very good. Overall not up to RCI Gold Crown status. I would not recommend this resort!.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort, no problems”
Reviews.Author: Stmickey28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake between Nov. 1 to Nov. 15, 2008 and had a blast! Yes, they do try to talk you into taking the resort tour upon check-in and they did call a few times. We just politely told them no and had no problems. We stayed in a two-bedroom villa in the North Village. House keeping is only once a week, but they do supply you with the basics; dishwasher soap, broom and dust-pan, paper towels, vaccum, toilet paper and some other odds and ends. They had a large garbage bin neatly tucked off to the side of the villa, where you can empty your garbage bags. If you need any extras there is a Publix just near one of the entrances. We had a nice view of the golf course and a pool within a minute walk from us. Also the resort is huge, so use your car or there is a resort shuttle you can catch. River Island was great and has lots of parking. Stores, bars and food is close. It cost $7.50 to rent an inner tube or $10.00 to rent a double inner tube for the lazy river. The main building where you check-in has an arcade and small bowling alley downstairs, also where you can get inter-net and where you can access the man made beach area. You can not swim at the beach but can rent water vechicles. Also had tennis courts, basketball courts, and lots of golfing. The market place store has a few groceries and souviners. Also they have sandwiches, hot dogs and great pizza! You can even have a pizza delivered to your room, I highly recommend it! I did not see any bugs in our room, however my friends who were in the Master Bedroom did find a beatle in their bed. They called the front desk and an exterminator and house keeping were there that afternoon. We did not see any bugs after that. Over all I would recommend this resort, it's very close to the Disney parks. The only drawback I found was that it is huge and can take a while to get around.

Reviews.Title: “The Good The Bad and the Creepy Crawly”
Reviews.Author: Sandra74
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from a 5 nite stay at Orange lake (nov 11-15) and I have some good, some bad and some disgusting details to share will all. GOOD -beautiful gardens and pools -spacious, clean ,rooms -full kitchen provides ( we saved alot of money on food) - close to everything ie. shopping centres, disney -staff quick to solve any problems. BAD - hounded daily to attend timeshare seminar -numerous phone calls throughout the day to invite us to events on the property that cost money -check in ridiculous, went to 4 people before anyone would serve us, took well over 20mins to check-in Creepy Crawly -lizards everywhere including our villa, we had to have maintenance come to our villa at 9pm at nite to search for a lizard because we didnt want our 1 year old sleeping with it. while looking for the lizard maintenance discovered a few roaches HUGE!!!!!!!!!! roaches Needless to say I demanded a new room and was granted one. Would I return Yes would I recommend the property yes, other than check in and the numerous critters walking around this property is beautiful its like being at a resort in the caribbean for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orange Lake Resort!”
Reviews.Author: retiredtraveler59
Reviews.Content: I traded into Orange Lake on an RCI exchange with great trepidation, as I had read some very bad reviews on Trip Advisor. I'm so glad that I did! I was pleasantly surprised. I think that perhaps the problem some others had was because they were placed in non-renovated villas or in the Club house units--and perhaps their stay was at a very busy time. When I inquired, they said that most of the villas in the oldest part of the resort, the West Village have been renovated or are in the process. There was no choice on villages for an RCI exchange--all are in the West Village. I had hoped that perhaps I could talk them into allowing me to go to the newer villages--River Island or North Village if our villa was unacceptable. As it turned out, I would have chosen this area--and this villa It was more peaceful than the other villages. Our unit's sliding glass door in the back looked out over a golf course pond--with cranes and herons. (Three herons walked up to our patio while we were having breakfast outside--I think that they would have walked inside if one of us had not been standing in the open doorway! ) The Golf Villas are all one and two stories. The one story one that we were in had lovely cathedral ceilings. The villas in the other villages have 2 to 7 floors and screened in balconies. I could not have been more delighted with our newly renovated golf villa: # 4247. I loved the sunny Caribbean style decor--the granite counters, the jetted tub in the king size master bedroom, and furniture--it was spacious, clean--and appeared very very unused! It was well-equipped with a dishwasher, microwave, full sized washer and dryer, safe, --and even Fiesta Ware dishes. The carpeting was new. The "Starter Packet" with paper towels, dish washer detergent, coffee, etc. was a great help. I expected the worse for the check in process--but perhaps because it was not a busy time or that we arrived later--around 5:30, there was barely any wait. At check in we were asked to see a time share presentation (only 1 hour), and I declined (thanks for the warning Trip Advisor writers!). I was told that someone would call me, and of course she did. But once I told her we were not interested , she accepted that and willingly listened to the concerns that I read on Trip Advisor, and answered my questions. She even told me where we could pick oranges!. As she promised, I was not called again about time share presentations. I was so impressed with the grounds and many pool areas--everything was clean (even the public bathrooms) and well maintained. Everyone was friendly and personable and went out of their way to be helpful. Also, thanks to other Trip Advisor commenters, I bought a $5.99 tube at Publix to use at the River Island Lazy River (fun!!) to save the rental fee. I would be hard put to find a fault with our vacation experience, with one exception : Although there are many areas throughout the resort that have wireless internet access, there is no access inside the villas. So if you really need to utilize some of your vacation time to do work, it is a real pain in the neck. And it would be nice not to have to pay for it! The other minor complaint was that the only info at check in (and in the unit) was a map, event calendar, and menus for the restaurants. There is a need for a packet of info about the villa itself --info on how to use equipment, inventory, rules of use, how to leave the unit--do we take off sheets, etc?, how to check out, where to put garbage and recyclables and how to use the phone. They said that they were working on it. Although I've benefitted from Trip Advisor comments, I've never commented myself. This time, I felt that it was "pay back" time, and Orange Lake needed a good review. I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family resort”
Reviews.Author: Themigfamily
Reviews.Content: This has been our second visit to OL lake and we loved it both times. We stayed at the west village villas and where concerned when we arrived from reading the reviews. We where pleasantly suprised that most of the units have been remodeled and it was very nice. NOt as big as the unit in the East and North village. Positive: Both the splash lagoon and river Island are great for the kids. Excellent golf from the low handicapper to beginner. The legend course was outstanding. Negative: I had to do some work while on vacation and had to pay for internet service. As place of this size should be providing free WIFI service. They stated that they will be providing this next year. Do not go to the Timeshare presentation. If you like the resort you can purchase resale from any of the reputable resale companies on the net. We liked it so much that I came home and just purchased a 3bd unit at North village for $5K. OL lake wanted 15K for a 2bd unit.

Reviews.Title: “loved it again”
Reviews.Author: blaro2NiagaraFalls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake from Oct 29th to Nov 9th 2008. We were two families in a two bedroom unit at River Island. Our children ranged from 5 to 15. In the past we stayed in the West and East Village, this time we wanted to try River Island. We booked through our Visa travel and used some or our points to defray the cost of our stay. It was expensive but we truly enjoyed ourselves. We had requested to stay on the first floor because we had a few children in our room and we did not want to disturb anyone below us. When we checked in with Alicia at the front desk we had a mix up with the Visa payment and this was handled very quickly with both parties and I have to say that Patrick was quite helpful in getting this resolved. There was no line ups for check in and we were greeted as soon as we stepped in. After the paperwork was resolved Alicia gave us all the details of the resort and the amount of keys that we had requested. When we arrived at River Island we found out that we were on the 5th floor. You will know what floor you are on by the 3rd number that follows 81. We had also asked Alicia if we could have a unit that faces the pool and she said that she did not know how the room numbers worked. We ended up facing the rear parking lot. It's not a bad view mind you, but I called the front desk and asked about our request. I forget what the girls name was but she said something like they don't rent out level one and that the rooms facing the pool are reserved for owners? I don't know if this is true but hey our room was very nice, we were pleased. When you arrive every unit has a doorbell and a peekhole. Our suite had a fully equipped kitchen to the left and a washer and dryer to the right. Upon arrival you will get a starter kit with some basics that you will need til you get to the grocery store. Also to the left you will find the master bedroom with a comfortable king size bed and an array of pillows to choose from. There is also a desk and a sitting area to read a book or lounge for one person. The main bath is big with a separate area for the toilet. You will find plenty of counter space, a large jacuzzi tub and a separate shower. There are also shelves next to the shower and I used this to put our pants and shorts. They supply the bath towels (thick) and also some toiletries. A hair dryer is also supplied. The master bedroom also has a good size closet, a 3 drawer dresser (not enough if you have to put clothes for 3 people) that's why I used the shelves in the bathroom, either that or I brought too much clothes. The living room dining room area is beautifully decorated. The L shaped couch has a double pull out. The kids found it more comfortable if we took the mattress off and put it on the floor. Extra bedding is supplied but we were missing the fitted sheet so we called housekeeping and it was delivered within 20 minutes.Afterwards someone called to make sure that we did receive it. There is a plasma tv, dvd player and safe situated on the tv unit facing the sofa. The dining room has 3 chairs and a wrap around that fits 7 for sure. There is sitting for 2 at the counter in the kitchen. The second bedroom has two double beds, a 3 or 4 drawer dresser with a tv above it. There is a good size closet also. The bathroom has a good size counter, toilet and stand up shower. There is also a shelving area that you could use for whatever you would like. There are phones in each bedroom and in the kitchen. For the internet connection ($) the plugs are in the master bedroom or in the kitchen. Once you purchased it then it could be wireless. In the broom closet you will find a vacuum, broom, mop, iron and ironing board. Now back to the kitchen: full size fridge that makes ice, microwave, can opener, toaster, coffee maker, blender, dishwasher and all the accessories needed to cook. Yes no pizza cutter but you do have a cork and bottle opener :) Our unit had a balcony that had a table and four chairs. We often ate lunch there. I was worried that we would hear noise from the hallway and the other units but the units are very soundproof. We did eat at the Lazy River restaurants. All were good but costly. Hopefully you will have MerciDieu as your waiter, what an awesome guy!! tip him well he deserves it!! The lazy river is lots of fun. We did like the other reviewers and waited til later in the day and were able to use tubes that other people had left floating. The kids enjoyed the hammocks, playing in the sand, sliding down the slides...we tried the pool at splash lagoon and liked that both pools were heated. Be careful when walking in sandals around the river island area, it is slippery when you get a wet patch. We did get a family pass at the putt putt area. For the price you pay for one week it's worth it. We also did the hippo slide for a day. Now talk about fun. We laughed so hard. There is shuttle service around the resort. Orange Lake is quite big so this is nice to have if you did not rent a car. We did not wait very long for a ride and we did tip $1, they were very courteous and helpful. Once they dropped us off at the front gate so we could go to Publix for groceries. It's about a 5 to 10 minute walk. After they drop you off they will let security know that you have gone and when you get back security will call the shuttle to let them know to pick you up. Rick was great at the front gate he even let us wait inside. If you are going to play tennis the best spot for this is at the Check in area. You will find over 6 courts and have better surfaces then any other area. We really enjoyed the haunted house they had going during Halloween. Well thought of, great job!! When it was our last day we asked to check out later and they let us. This was very nice since we had a late flight out. Now the guys or concierge that work at level one by the elevators were extremely helpful when we had a question and it was nice that we could check out right on the spot. I must say they were friendly to both adults and children and always had a smile and a greeting. Now you might wonder why I put above average for the overall experience, well I have to say that the rugs could use a cleaning as could the tiles. There was some dust in some areas. I think they have to keep and eye on this because its the little details that count for some people. I am not saying that the upkeep is not good, far from it. We constantly saw that the grounds were being attended to but some things might be slipping that maybe they are not seeing. Some of the loungers could also use a good scrubbing. Not once did we regret our stays here at Orange Lake, and we do appreciate that our comments count since they do send you a survey to answer via email. Keep up the great work!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: mommy48386
Reviews.Content: I read through so many reviews on Orange Lake that I was expecting the worst when we arrived. It was above our expectations. Our 2 bedroom condo was exactly how the pictures displayed it. It was clean, roomy and the grounds are beautiful. They do invite you to a breakfast tour. A simple no at check in and a simple no when they called was all it took. We stayed 4 nights and the supplies they had given us was plenty. One of the smoke detectors was beeping when we arrived in our condo. I called housekeeping and they sent someone in 15 minutes. This was the best place we have stayed in Orlando. We go to Orlando every year. We usually stay on Disney property. All I can say is that Orange Lake is a gem. We are already planning on going back in the spring of 2009. If I can offer any advice, make sure they put you in the East Village. It has been updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: gbeken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a two bedroom 2 bath suite at the resort. We even had our own porch overlooking a lake and the golf course. The villa had a washer/dryer, dishwasher, and everything needed to cook a great dinner while on vacation if you wish. The resort has mini golf, a huge golf course where you can rent a golf cart, pool, waterpark, beach where you can rent equipment to play watersports. There is also a small marketplace where you can buy groceries. Also during the evenings when driving to our villa we saw deer grazing near the road. The only complaints that we had was that they did try to get us to go to a time share seminar, which we rejected. They woke you up in order to leave messages on your phone updating you on the days events, and it was really too big. We got lost trying to find our villa on the first day. From the main entrance to our villa it took almost 10 minutes. All in all it was a great vacation place and it was extremely quiet during all hours of the day.

Reviews.Title: “HAD AN AWESOME TIME !!!!!!! I can not believe the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: 5kfamily
Reviews.Content: Wife and three kids(11,7,4) just returned from a wonderful stay at Orangelake resort. We stayed Oct. 25-Nov. 1 We traded our Puerto Vallarta timeshare for Orangelake through RCI. I was a little apprehensive with reading some of the negative reviews. That changed as soon as we arrived. Upon arrival did not have to wait at all for check -in process which went very smooth. Staff was very helpful in explaining how to get around the resort. At this time I was also pitched the timeshare deal with a "tour of the facility." I declined. I should add that I did receive three phone calls to our room,during the week, asking if we had changed our minds regarding the Tour. This was slightly irritating. But it was only a 30 sec. phone call and easily dismissed as our stay was amazing. Anyway, we stayed in the East village which is about a 3-4min drive from the West village check-in area. I highly recommend a car to get around the huge resort although there were shuttles that conveyed guests all around the resort. The unit was a two BR /1 bath/2 showers and was very spacious, plenty of room,clean and modern decor. Kitchen had just about everything we needed except for a pizza cutter. The only negative thing about the unit was the pantry door in kitchen was broke- the slide on top was missing. We did not need the Pantry as there was plenty of counter space to put our food. So it wasn't a big deal. The pools at this resort are fabulous. There was a nice heated pool right outside our building which we took full advantage of . River Island which was about a 2 min. drive from the East village had a beautiful pool / lazy river area. It is basically several pool areas attached to the lazy river. There are also two smaller water slides that the kids liked. There is also food, shops, massage area, and a bar. It is a great place to lounge around and/or play with the kids. The North village and West village also had really nice pool areas. All the pool areas had hot tubs. The West village also has a lake which was OK. You could rent waverunners and paddle boats , fishing poles, etc. We did fish but I don't think there are any fish in the lake ; ) There is a nice beach area but there is no swimming. There was also plenty of other activities- video game room,ping pong,table games,play station games, etc... I need to mention that this time of the year is great for visiting the Disney parks. There are not a lot of people which is nice. The lines for attractions are short which makes your wait times very minimal. Some things were a bit expensive at the resort (putt-putt golf $9 per person)but you don't have to do these things and you would still have a great time. I would take the negative reviews with a grain of salt and overlook some of the petty things that people complain about. All in all we had a great stay and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise !!”
Reviews.Author: bcemre3
Reviews.Content: We've been to Disney World probably 100 times since it opened. Most of the time we stay either with relatives or in one of the many Disney resorts. This time, we needed R & R away from the hustle bustle of Disney and chose to stay at OLCC in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit in the West Village even though the past reviewers found it mediocre at best. The price was right since it was off season. To our surprise, we found beautiful landscaped grounds with an almost perfect unit. I was a bit nervous at first because the elevator was pretty unappealing and that was our first impression of the building -- I've been taught that you never get a second chance to make a first impression !!! This area needs improvement. Once in the unit, it was fabulous. Almost everything was redone with new appliances, furniture, beds, window treatments, etc. The view of the lake from our kitchen, living room, bedroom and large balcony was spectacular and we had the first hole of one of the golf courses below us. The furniture was very comfortable. I had to call maintenance two days in a row to replace my "it should have been replaced" shower head that had water spraying everywhere but on us in the shower. The bathroom faucet was also not new and was leaking all over the brand new countertop. (This never got repaired correctly) All in all, everything else was just fine. Because of what we had read here previously, we decided to just unplug our phone in our room -- this is the BEST suggestion we could give anyone. Everyday at 8:14 AM, there was a message left from one of the staff members about an activity going on that day. Hey -- we are on vacation and NO ONE is going to wake us up at 8 AM unless there is a fire!!!! This way, we also missed all the calls asking us to go to a presentation -- so ------ we never went to one and no one came knocking at the door asking us to. All in all, we had a lot of fun and would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “OLCC every year...”
Reviews.Author: peace_luv_sun
Reviews.Content: I consider myself a good source of info on Orange Lake since my bro has owned there for over 20 years and I have for one year. Been there every year for a couple decades so I've seen the changes and growth since the 80's. I take lots of other vacations also so I do compare accomodations. I'm not here to "sell" Orange Lake, they don't need it but here's my humble opinion and clarification on a few things I've seen written. The grounds are well kept and lush. It is a very large resort. You do need to drive if you're going from one end to the other. Shuttle service is available and will drop you anywhere on property. Rooms and villas differ with the West Village being the newest since remodeling began this year. They are not ALL done yet, so if you book into West you may get an old unit. The refurbished units are lovely. Many pools; WV has zero elevation olympic size pool among others; if you have small kids you'll probably spend lots of time at River Island (small water park) If you appreciate low key there are smaller pools that are very quiet. North Village has shallow pool with slide and volleyball net in water. Lots to choose from. Restaurants are pretty good; newest one still being built in WV; opening in Feb '09. My biggest complaint about them is they're all too cold! A/C blasting all the time. With a million restaurants down 192, we rarely want to eat on property. Just our choice. Staff is very courteous, again just MY experience. Check in was super; this year we only stood in line about 2 minutes and someone came and got us and walked us over to another desk in lobby to save time. LIke that. Am I saying I've NEVER had a crabby look or word in 20+ years--no. However, it's pretty much all positive for me. Location is great. OLCC borders on Disney property. 192 can get jammed up pretty quick but allowing an extra 15 minutes at certain times of day takes care of that. A few things I've read in reviews that are not correct are as follows: 1) there is no charge to get into River Island (water park) It's part of Orange Lake. There is a fee for this gigantic slide outside the fence at RI that does not belong to Orange Lake. Strategic placement though. I've never paid for a tube rental yet. We just use one for a quick trip down the lazy river and then let it lay. There are handfuls of them just laying around. Maybe because October is "down season"? 2) You don't HAVE to ever spend more than 90 minutes at a sales presentation. I listen, ask questions and at the 90 minute mark, look at my watch, smile and say "gotta go". I've not had anyone give me a hard time or be rude. It's all in your attitude and how you handle them. I just did one this month for $80 in Orange Lake "bucks" Works out nice to have them for spending in the bars , restaurants and snack shops on site. They also offer discounted park tickets and golf fees among other things. Also have never had a sales person "hound" me by phone as some reported 3) Internet use is "expensive"...it isn't. Anyway the entire property will soon be WIFI so it's a mute point. I've droned on long enough, point being...every traveler does not expect (and receive) the same treatment. I've had 95% good experiences at Orange Lake and have heaps of happy memories. I'm a pretty positive person and realize you get what you give. My humble opinion would be: if you're thinking about OLCC, give it a try. Judge for yourself. Whether you're playing a round of golf, having a frozen cocktail on the beach or sliding down a water slide like a big kid...you can make some memories too. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: dandywalleye
Reviews.Content: Well, this is our third trip that I have researched before going and once again we had a much better than expected stay. This was our first trip to Orange Lake Resort and I had read many negative reviews. I have to admit that our experience there was great. The resort was clean and for the staff was friendly. We booked this resort directly with their marketing department since we had already planned to take a timeshare presentation. We saved several hundred dollars on our bill since we took the presenatation. We were told when we reserved that we would not know which village we would be in until we checked in. That worried me a litte, but when we checked in, they put us in the newest village at River Island and we had only asked to be put there when we checked in. Our room was great and looked just like the photos...it even had a dvd & vcr combo player. We couldn't find anything to complain about other than the staff didn't seem to know much about any other part of the resort other than where they were working. We found the beach to be closed to swimming even though we had read you could swim. The lake was a little disappointing...not at all what I had expected. The timeshare presentation was as most are. We have been to them before and they are all pretty much the same. We were upfront with the salesman and told him we planned to buy in the future..not that particular weekend. He went thru the presenation, was kind and curteous and never was too pushy. We told him we were much more likely to come back and purchase later if we weren't turned off now. The whole thing lasted a little over 90 minutes. Many reviews complained about the miscellaneous charges for tubes, water slide, etc. They definately do charge for all the extras, but then you only have to pay for what you choose to use. My kids never paid for an inner tube for the lazy river...they either went without one or found ones laying around...and we were there for 8 days. We did play mini golf once and they gal working only charged us for the adults and let the kids (12, 10,& 9 yrs) play for free. Not all staff did that...you just have to be nice and you'll soon find out who will bend a little. My girls also had their hair braided at the resort and it was much cheaper than at any of the parks. We paid $35 instead of the $50-$60 we found every where else. The restaurant food was probably among the best we ate for the week...other than what we cooked ourselves. I loved that everything we really needed was right out our door. We did venture over to one of the other villages for a Dive In Movie night and watched Iron Man while our kids swam. We could see Magic Kindom's fireworks right out on our patio at night. I really think that your resort experience is much of what you make it. If you have unrealistic expectations, your going to have a bad experience. Remembering to be kind and undemanding will go a long way! If we make it back to Orlando, we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointments”
Reviews.Author: kmsheesley
Reviews.Content: Just as background on myself I have a Degree in Hotel Management and have worked in the Hotel industry for some years. I'm not the type to make complaints and understand how the business is ran but for once I am opting to speak out. I recently stayed at the resort this Oct and had a poor experience. We stayed at the Sheridan Vistana resorts for our first few nights and an had excellent experience. We did our Disney visits while there and reserved our pool play for the boasted waterpark at Orange Lake. Disapointments started as we walked in the reception area. There was a very small amount of staff available for check in and waited over 35 minutes just for one guest in front of us. The checkin is 4pm (which is common for waterpark resports) We recieved access to the water park and headed there while waiting for the room to be available. The park was advertised as 12 acres!!!! HARDLY. They have 1 lazy river with a few side pools and not much more than that. In addition we happened to be placed in the furthest location from the pool area. There was a 7 minute drive by car just to find it over their spread out design. After checking in we were guided to our room by the bell boy. His ideal plan of route was to walk around the building guiding us past the dumpsters and in a side door leading to the basement. They put us in a discusting room in the bottom corner. There was no windows or daylight to be seen. The shower did not work propperly. You felt dirty just walking in the bathroom. There was not noise barrier to the music being played in the lobby and we heard this into the wee hours. It took 4 requests to have a crib delivered to the room and it was not till 11pm that our infant was able to lay down to sleep. And finally to top it all off we had additional charges after checkout. Supposedly expedia charges $12 for the convenience of booking through them but fails to make it very obvious during the time of reservation. There are much better options around the Orlando area to spend your money. Do not be lured by the wine and dine of a timeshare here.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PLACE! U WILL LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: LOUGATZ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many timeshares and hotels in my 22 nation traveling past. This hotel is one of the best! ALL the things you would want are here! Jet ski, pools, restaurants, you name it all on the premises! Only a few miles from Disney gates! The rooms are spacious and clean. You want for nothing! The only negative is no computer access from the room I was in and no DVD players...The cable TV is also very limited. For a few dollars more they could throw in at least one HBO channel...Stay here without hesitation!!!!!!!! It is amazing.........

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: peacefrog2180
Reviews.Content: I was very leery about coming to Orange Lake. A friend originally recommended the resort, but I had read a lot of bad reviews after I already made reservations. We booked our 3 night/4 day stay through Hotels.com so we ended up with a unit in the oldest section West Village. We had no problems checking in. Everyone was so friendly. My party was myself, my husband and our 9 month old daughter. We were asked if it was our first time there, and we said yes. He explained a lot of stuff to us, showed us on a map where our room was. Gave us a calendar of events for the week, was just very very friendly. He talked us into doing the tour and timeshare session the following morning, and in exchange we were to get $50 cash and 2 free tube rentals and a coupon book. We said OK. We then went to our room, and boy were we SURPRISED!!! We originally booked a 1 bdrm unit, but we walked in (we were in a 2 level unit, and we were on the top floor) to find that we must have been upgraded to a 2 bdrm, 2 bath unit! Our daughter had her own room and bathroom!! The kitchen came fully stocked, we even got a bag of garbage bags, extra TP, a roll of paper towels, a sponge, dish rag, dish soap, laundry soap, dishwasher soap and coffee. I thought it was nicely decorated and very large!!!! Yes, the love bugs were in full force outside, and they freaked me out at first, but they actually got better as the days went by. Only thing I was disappointed in, was that I had called way in advance requesting a high chair, and pack and play for my daughter, but they were nowhere to be found. I called the front desk, and was told they would bring them to us. 5 mins. Later a knock at the door, and our high chair was there but no pack n play. He was never told about the pack n play. So he said he’d bring one to us later. Well, maybe 5 mins. Go by doorbell rings again (yes each unit has a doorbell!) and there he was with our pack n play. We later received a message on our phone in our unit making sure we got the high chair and pack n play. That first day we did some shopping at the outlets, and then Downtown Disney. Came back late, and went to bed. Next morning we had to be at the timeshare thing by 8:15 am. They gave us donuts and juice and we met with our sales guy. We got the history of the resort, a tour around the resort in a golf cart, more info about the resort. Then we ended up at a building where we sat at a table and discussed about our vacations past and future. Was told some more about the timeshare industry. Then a tour to River Island, the newest, nicest section of the resort. The room we toured was amazing and beautiful and everything you would want in a condo unit/timeshare! !!!! Then back at the table to discuss price. At first we had said no thanks, as we could NOT afford it!! They kept lowering the price, and we kept saying no. we went in there deciding to say no. Our daughter was getting fussy. We wanted to get to Epcot Center that day, by now about 2 hours had passed, maybe even more. We wanted or $50 and to get out of there!!! Then he says he is calling his manager over to see what he can do for us. He offers us the same unit, in River Island but for half the price and an awesome affordable monthly payment, it was a foreclosure unit! We discussed it among ourselves, and decided to go for it. Vacations in our family are important, and we did fall in love with the resort the short time we were there. And we do plan to take vacations for a very long time. We were sold on the whole “points” system, with being able to exchange points for all over the world in other timeshare resorts. And the fact that we own the deed to our week and our unit, and the fact that we can pass it down to our kids, and then their kids and so on, someday. So we were there probably another hour or so, after final paperwork was done, this and that. We did not get $50 but we got $70!!! They take your picture with your sales guy, you get one copy. We buy our tickets to Disney for 2 days. And we were out of there. And could not believe what we had just done! HAHA. We were off to Epcot for the rest of the day, again got back late, but had an amazing and awesome day! Perfect weather, I might add the whole 4 days we were there. Next day we got up and I cooked us breakfast in the kitchen. Then the 3 of us were off to River Island to enjoy the beautiful pool and lazy river. We walked around and took some pictures of River Island. We actually went back into the unit we toured to get pictures of the room to show family and friends back home. It must be open during the day. We had no problems getting in there, and we remembered where it was on the bottom floor of the one building in River Island. Then back to our room to get ready and off to Magic Kingdom for another amazing awesome great day!! We did not have enough time to get full use of the resort, and with a 9 month old, it was a little hard too. We plan to go back for a week next year (in the fall) and use the pools, the lake/beach area, the mini golf. Hubby says he might have to take up golf (there are 4 golf courses on the resort!). We hope to bring our family along with us one year, as our 2 bdrm, 2 bath room sleeps 8 people! One room with a King size bed, one room with 2 double beds, and the sofa pulls out to king size bed. The rooms in River Island are just beautiful. All in all, we were impressed with resort, the staff was so nice. We can’t wait to come back next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: mightyjar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Orange lake from Oct. 4-11 and were put in the West Village 2 bedroom facing golf course and 192. The condo itself was updated and very clean. Lots of room with everything you need. The staff were very friendly and helpful and upon a check in we were whisked away to a private room for check in and agreed to go on a presentation of the Resort for 60 minutes that would not be the same as the other 90 min. presentations as we were guests of owners. Wrong! The tour was painful and they sent 4 different salesmen at us to convince us to purchase. Our host Tito even tried to make us feel poor and cheap for not buying. I was very adamant from the outset we were not interested. For our 2 hrs we received $50.00 in resort money, a coupon book and free tubes for River Island. This place is beautiful and I really liked it but my biggest complaint is how far away from the pools and clubhouse we were. We needed to drive or take the shuttle bus to get there. Also everything costs so much money. The putt-putt, inner tubes, hippo slide etc was all at a cost. Even owners get nothing free. Other than that I really enjoyed this resort and would probably go back again. The pools are wonderful. My kids really enjoyed Spalsh Lagoon and River Island. One of the nicer places we have stayed while in Florida. Would definitely recommend but do not take the presentation/tour.

Reviews.Title: “great time and great location”
Reviews.Author: texaspoke150
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the resort and after staying there for 7 nights I was amazed at some of the reviews. The property was clean, the staff was friendly, the villa we stayed in slept the nine of us very easy with room for more if needed. The pool areas were very large and very clean. It is a timeshare property and we are not owners so they did offer a one on one visit to review what they had to offer but we declined to spend our vacation time listening to something we are not interested in and not another word was spoken about it. From our unit we could watch fireworks from Magic Kingdom and it was literally a 10 minute drive to any of the Disney parks via a short cut my wife found. We were sad to leave because it was just like home but in a southern paradise. I would recommend this resort for any visit to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Its Great, why all the bad press!”
Reviews.Author: DTSUFC
Reviews.Content: Firstly I don’t understand where all the bad reviews come from. We stayed in a three bed in the North Village in one of the villas around the golf course. The trip was booked through RCI and we have stayed at a number of very nice resorts in different countries. This was booked as an exchange week in the West Village and on reading some of the negative reviews were very apprehensive. We all spent the two weeks wondering just how people could give this place a bad review. The staff were friendly, the whole complex whilst huge did not seem overly busy or crowded together, the resort was very clean with what must be a huge team of gardeners for the amount of green space, and the villa was spot on. The villa itself had three large bedrooms each with their own bath room. The master bedroom had a large bathroom with Jacuzzi with the other two being smaller but perfectly adequate. The kitchen come living room was a large area with all the usual furniture. The air con was fantastic, and needed to be! Yes this may not quite be 5 star but its not bad at all. If you want to be picky the large telly and tvs in each bedroom were CRT’s and not LCD/Plasma and there was a video player not a DVD player shock horror. The kitchen was clean and well equipped but I agree the finish was only average, but a good average, not anything that will spoil your stay in any way. You have to be very picky and I would suggest a sad sad person to find serious faults. Some reviews mention pressure to attend a time share presentation. This consisted of, at reception on arrival “we have a meet and greet tomorrow, what time would you like to come” to which we replied “Were not interested” end of conversation and receptionist still smiling and being friendly. A week later a phone call “Come to our meeting and we will give you $70 cash” reply “no thanks” again polite and no problems. There was no knocking on doors, no constant phone calls, and no people suggesting they would be out on the street with their 5 children and pregnant wife if you don’t buy that you get at many time share resorts. The pools were all clean and well thought out and the lazy river area was by far the best. Here I found there were enough sun loungers for about 10 each but unfortunately I only picked up 2 towels so could only make use of a couple. Towels are free by the way at the side of the pools. I would advise though at peak season you may struggle for a table/parasol if you turn up mid afternoon but this is the same for all resorts I would have thought. Everything at the resort costs money, tubes for the lazy river, access to the big slide etc but given how cheap we got the villa I was expecting this. The location of the resort means you need a car. On site there is a regular shuttle service, On a rainy day this did not just stop at the bus stop but took you back to your door. Site is ideal for the Disney parks and about 20/25 k to universal/IOA. This is our second time to florida and the 1st with a sat nav, its worth every penny, far far less stressful and means less ‘assistance’ from the 5 back seat drivers in my vehicle. I wont talk about the parks or I will be here all day. All I would say is that if you can dodge the hurricanes like we managed you will get 12/13 days of good weather (low 90’s) and very quiet parks with little or no ques where it takes longer to get around the que than it does to que at the end of it. We managed to stay on many of the top rides and only que’d for about 5 minutes for the front rows. Shikra 7 times in an hour, duelling dragons 6 times in an hour, 4 times on the front row etc etc. I took hundreds of pictures and if anyone wants to see any or ask further questions they are welcome to e-mail any requests to dtsufc@hotmail.com. Well back to the rain and cold of the UK whilst I plan my next break, anyone know of any good timeshare ski resorts for next feb!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: flgrl76
Reviews.Content: We had read so many reviews we weren't sure what to expect but we absolutely loved the resort! The rooms were huge and the pools and lazy river were awesome. We left the kids home this time but we kept saying how they would love this place. The staff were very friendly and one firm "no, thank you" about the timeshare tour and we were left alone. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and so close to WDW”
Reviews.Author: Paula590802
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful. Less than 10 minutes to Blizard Beach, MGM and Epcot and less that 5 minutes to Animal Kingdom (boarders on Animal Kingdom). We watched Magic Kingdom's fireworks every night from our patio. So much to do on the resort, save some days for exploring the resort. You will visit River Island on the resort continuously, because of the lazy river, slides, parties, activities, mini golf, and so much more. I have stayed at a lot of places in Florida (since 1975) and this one is, without a doubt, number 1. Take in the Gatorland Zoo presentation, well worth the $5.00 entry fee. We stayed one week and we didn't get to do everything we wanted to. Shuttle buses stop and pick you up and drop you back daily. Wildlife everywhere. Staff are extremely helpful and friendly. We will be staying here again....and again....and again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT the #1 resort in the #1 vacation destination”
Reviews.Author: lisa1063
Reviews.Content: We exchanged thru RCI. I was nervous given the bad reviews I saw. We were in the west village and felt duped because the picture on the RCI website is not an indicator of what you get. However, that is not Orange Lakes fault. We chose to do the presentation as the owner of 3 timeshare weeks, I like to see what is out there and wanted the discount on tubes. We were in and out in under 2 hours. However, the person, Tracey who took us around was obnoxious. She kept saying they were the #1 resort whenever I questioned anything. We prefer snow, so there is no way we would buy in Florida, but when she covered my 10 year old daughters mouth who was talking about the various places we have vacationed, it was uncalled for. After that I was done, and reported it to the manager, who still wanted to sell us the timeshare. They berated the ones we own which was inappropriate. however, we laughed it off and had a good week. Our goal was a downweek with our daughter who had been at camp most of the summer. She opted not to go to EPCOT as she wanted to lounge by the lazy river. We rented a cabana ($119) for the day and it was worth every penny as we had family come by and it was a party. The minature golf and water sports (jetskiing) were also great. The resort is big so you do need a car, the shuttle looked pretty regular. The lack of a DVD and hookups for the one we brought was a pain, but a short trip to radioshack and $26 we had an adaptor and were able to play WII when it was raining yesterday. There was no lack of chairs etc at the various pools as we tried them all. Shady chairs were few and far between (and taken) but there were chairs. This past week is considered a down week. Maintainence did bring us two new (but old models) TV's when two didn't work. however, a lamp was never repaired. While I wouldn't go back because I prefer mountains, overall the resort was average and not the worse place in the world. It is large, they do leave messages about what is going on in the resort, but gasp.. they can't understand no thank you when you don't like golf... It is close to the parks, it is close to grocery stores, and has the basics to make meals. There were no grills which was a pain, but supposedly if you ask for a dvd player at the front desk they will lend you one if it is available. I thought Sunterra was better when we stayed there last time, however, orange lake is in the process of remodeling the west village and wil have dvd players and plasma tv's within a year

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: jaeander
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. It is great for people of all ages who like to just "chill" and relax. People who do not have to go to the parks. No need. There is so much to do on the property. There are golf courses, 11 very nice swimming pools (although at least one or 2 could be a little deeper.), water parks with a lazy river (one f the best I have ever seen), activities for the kids, 2 putt putt golf courses, driving ranges, basketball courts, etc. There is a Publix, Japanese, restaurant, Chinese restaurant, etc on the property. The employees (in all departments) are very helpful and extremely nice. (I have been in some of the best resorts as well as a couple of what seemed to be the worst. I lived overseas for 4 years and have experienced many different environments.) I would recommend this resort to anybody & everybody. By the way, our ENTIRE family loved it. It was us, our two daughters who are under 10 as well as our teenage daughter & son. (Ages 15 and 13) It is also off 192, which is close to everything.....Wal-Mart, Old Town, many, many restaurants & stores, plus just down the road from the Disney exits.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and comfortable, but not 5-star”
Reviews.Author: SSwith3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake Resort the week of August 15, 2008. The last half of the stay was pretty much ruined by Tropical Storm Fay, though it helped to draw attention to some of the good and bad at the resort. Overall the resort is very comfortable, clean, well-maintained, with gorgeous grounds and nice sized pools and water activity areas for families. With 4 18-hole golf courses surrounding the units, it's a golfer's dream. First the good. The unit had ample space for a family of 5. The three kids slept in the second bedroom, which had two queen-size beds. The living area was generous and comfortable, and the kitchen more than adequate. The surroundings were quiet and peaceful, and the balcony had enough room to have a meal on. River Island, Splash Lagoon and the West Village Pool area had plenty to offer. The lazy river was nice, but there was plenty of space to take the sun as well. The kids enjoyed the slides and mini golf. The entire property looked very well kept; the grounds are huge and beautifully landscaped throughout. From the East entrance to our unit in the East Village was almost 2 miles! The Publix located onsite made grocery shopping easy, though at a (slight) premium. Despite booking at the West Village (older) through RCI, we were promised a newly-refurbished unit over the phone, and were in a newer East Village unit when we arrived. The resort seemed pretty empty, however, and I'm sure it was not hard to find space. Now the not-so-good. To begin with, for such a nice resort one expects to see a level of quality throughout, but in a number of respects, things were "chintzy". The kitchen, for example, had a stove with uneven burners, and no window in the door of the oven. The counters are inexpensive laminates; the cabinets have plastic handles. All of this is easily overlooked, but it presents as something less than first class. And similar choices were made in the bathrooms and bedrooms. Sheets were clean but older and covered in balled up bits of cotton. The predominance of white in bathrooms, coupled with the plastic shower floor and bright lights gave a less-than-relaxing ambience. Despite the fact that wireless internet is offered almost everywhere else in town (including Holiday Inn, Days Inn, even Denny's!), it was not available at the resort, except in one of two designated "internet cafes". During the storm, these were closed, meaning that there was no access whatsoever. It's not that I want to use my computer while on vacation, but I can't afford to miss my e-mail. At best, it meant a one-mile drive from the unit, plus $6/hour or a daily/weekly rate. While sitting in the unit waiting 30 hours for the storm to pass, there were many times that the lack of internet connection came to mind. Everything comes with a price tag. The use of rafting tubes is over $7/day/tube. For a family of 5 it amounts to more than $200 in a week. On the one hand, they will reduce this to $20 if you take the "tour"; on the other, this is one of the cheapest "gifts" I've ever been offered to attend... and on my vacation, no less. The beautiful grounds were great for my daughter to practice her X-country running. But they also meant it wasn't easy to get around without either a car, or using the resort shuttle. At other resorts, we have felt that the proximity of all the amenities was definitely a plus. The distance here was a negative for us. Lastly, during five of the seven days we were there, we were treated to the rather intense "perfume" floating our way from Disney's Animal Kingdom, right next door. It was strong enough to keep us all inside! Bottom line: We enjoyed our stay and we would go back, but it wouldn't be our first choice. It's closer to a 3 1/2 star resort than a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: BellaMami
Reviews.Content: The orange lake resort is really big. we stayed in the 2 bedroom villa. it was really nice and clean. This resort is perfect for families.my only problem is you need to drive around just to go to the pool. And also if you want to get cheap tickets from them you will have to attend those meeting at 11 am they will try to get you to buy time share. So if you dont want to waste your time listening to some bs i suggest you go to those giftshops and buy from them coz they sell it even cheaper than the resort.

Reviews.Title: “It's Changed! Not for the better!”
Reviews.Author: ncarr2001
Reviews.Content: We were very dissappointed to say the least and will NEVER stay there again. Keep in mind, my husband and I stayed there 2 previous times and had a wonderful relaxing time. I will not make this review long, and will just list the pros and cons. We stayed in River Country in a two bedroom condo. The room - very pretty and clean (except for one stain on the master bedroom rug). We had a view of the parking lot! Nice to hear car alarms on vacation! All new appliances and a big 42 inch Flat screen TV in the living room. Spash Lagoon - very relaxing and fun with the waterfalls. Very clean too. Water is a nice blue. The other pool (North pool?) is also very nice, a little more crowded but not bad at all. Pool is also very clean. The chicken fingers at the snack bar in River Country are very very good. The other restaurants - not so good The bartenders at the River Country bars very nice and make excellent drinks. The room smelled of fish every time we entered! When we complained, I was instructed to chase down the maintenence people and ask them to see what they could do. What happened to THEM contacting housekeeping. By this time I was so frustrated and didn't want to deal with it anymore, we just went to Publix and bought a can of Lysol. It didn't help! The living room couch is uncomfortable. Tried the pull out bed and it was like laying directly on springs! The beds were so uncomfortable, we took the queen size matress from the second bedroom and placed in on the living room floor where we slept for the week. The pillows were just as uncomfortable! Hard as a rock! River Country pool is really quite gross. I assume this is because the water at the highest point is two/three feet tdeep. It is so overcrowed that even the so called lazy river gets congested with people. I was totally grossed out regarding the number of toddlers wearing diapers in this very overcrowed and DIRTY pool. I never saw anyone cleaning this pool the entire time we were there. My father in law slipped on the grime of the pool and hurt his hand. Not customer focused at all - everytime you turn around there is a charge for something. Float costs $10 per day for a double and $7 for a single. Give me a break! You even have to pay $5 to slide down a big blow up slide. Ridiculous! Believe me, we are not complainers at all, but I felt compelled to write a review. It is sad, because we did enjoy our previous stays, but it is obvious that the resort is no longer customer focused and is more concerned with sales and becoming even bigger resort! I am seriously thinking about writing the VP that is on the resort TV channel all the time! Ahh, I think I just want to forget about this vacation! 5 Star - Royal Crown - or what ever... I do NOT think so! I even told the timeshare sales people that they could not pay me enough to buy a timeshare there. What was there response? How about if we give you a really cheap timeshare? That says it all! Thank god my husbands family were all there because we had a great time with them!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time With The Kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: mother-of-4-kids
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to do a review on this resort because the kids had such a great time. This is the first review I have ever done on a resort, and this one really deserved my time in telling others how great of a time their kids will have. I have stayed at many other nice resorts like the Marriott Grande Vista, Silver Lake, and Wyndhams, and this one offered so much more for the kids and the adults to have a great time. When we arrived the people were very friendly. We stayed in a West Village Golf Villa 2 br./2 ba. It was very large and clean. The entire resort (which is about 3 miles long) is beautifully landscaped. The golf villa had a golf course and lake in the back yard, and we could pull right up near the front door. It was like having our own private house, rather than staying in a building and having to park in a large parking lot and going up an elevator. We were able to easily and quickly just carry our groceries right into the front door by walking up the front yard walkway. If your kids love fishing, this is the place!! My son (11 yrs. old) and my niece (13 yrs. old) were catching so many fish!! Every 5 to 10 minutes they had a large mouth bass on their hook! These fish were big, 12 to 24" long, and the kids were having a blast! Every morning, that was the first thing they wanted to do, is walk out the back sliding doors to the lake. We could see them right out the window. There are 3 swimming pool areas. They are huge!! One has a very long lazy river, with waterfalls, and a gigantic pool with two water slides, and pool volleyball. Very, very big. Most of the pool is not deeper than 3 to 4 feet. There are also very large areas that are great for little toddlers that is 1-1/2 feet - 2 feet deep, which is perfect for them especially if they are practicing swimming. They have all kinds of things to do at this resort including an enormous sized inflatable water slide called the hippo. Just go to their website to see photos. There is literally so much to do there. Huge gamerooms, bowling, bingo, mini movie theater, activities center, miniature golf, ping pong, pool tables, you name it! If you go to this resort, you will need to have money to spend on all these extras. The hippo slide is normally $13. for one hour or $18. for the day. However, they gave us a $3.00 off coupon. We paid $10. because due to the overcast sky looking like rain, would not sell us an all day ticket, but let the kids ride all day long anyway for the $10. I cannot stress enough how much fun the kids had on this gigantic slide!! They kept going down it over and over again, every which way. Children 9 and under were free for playing miniature golf. Technically, they charge $10. a day for the inflatable tubes but do not worry about that. There are so many tubes laying all over the pool area, stacked up everywhere. People that go on the timeshare tour get unlimited tube rentals for their entire family for the week for $20. so so they do not bother to return them, and there are literally tubes everywhere. All I can say is this is the first resort I have went to where the kids (ages 7, 10, 11, and 13) did not one time say they were bored or nagged us to take them somewhere. They were so happy and occupied with everything to do here. Truly amazing place. Restaurants also, and stores. The resort has a free shuttle that will pick you up right near your unit and take you anywhere within the resort complex for free. This was great for the kids if they wanted to head to the miniature golf or game room area, and I was not ready to leave yet. They could go where they wanted and then I could meet them there. GREAT PLACE TO STAY WITH KIDS!!! FOUR NEGATIVES I CAN LIVE WITH: In the area we stayed, there was no wireless internet access. We could only have it at the clubhouse area. We could use their computers or use our own. If you book here, and you need wireless internet, just make sure that they have it where your unit is. Most areas there do have it. Everything is pricey at this resort, and costs at least double what you would expect to pay anywhere else, and almost everything you do there costs money. Some things are free like the movies, swimming, pool slides, playing in the activities center, etc. Anything else, there is a charge. There are no lifeguards at the pool areas or at the lazy river, only at the slides. However, the water is not deep. Most of the water is about 3 to 3-1/2 feet. I believe they should definately have lifeguards as it is easy for a parent to lose sight of their kids. Lifeguards should especially be around the Lazy River so parents are not forced to have to go around it with their kids every time they want to go in. My kids are older, so it wasn't too much of a concern for me, but for smaller kids. I am really surprised there were no lifeguards. We had ants in our unit, and we had to put all food items in the refrigerator. Most places in Florida will have ants, as it is a common everyday problem here. I have lived in South Florida for over 20 years, and know that ants are hard to keep out. However, they could do a better job with spraying, I think. We will DEFINATELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to visit, wouldn't want to own”
Reviews.Author: newbutterfly13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer with family members who are owners at this resort. For that reason, I don't have information about the check-in experience other than waiting around for about 30 minutes, which can be typical of timeshares. We had a two bedroom unit, not the newest but not the oldest either and found it very comfortable. Furnishings were pretty updated and everything seemed to be in working order. The entire unit was also very spacious with good seating for family meals. We really appreciated the washer and dryer in the room, but due to things like this there was no maid service and you even have to strip your own bedding at the end of your stay. I don't know how much this place costs to own or stay but overall it didn't add much value outside the hotel room. There is a nice waterpark on site with slides, beach and lazy river, but everyone must pay admission, intertube rental, tent rental, etc., etc. I've stayed at other timeshares with similar activities but they were included in the cost of the room. There was a smaller pool onsite which you could use without charge. Also there was no spa on site. It is very close to Disney, within a 5 minute drive and lots of resturants/shops on the way, including a Walmart. The property is huge and took a few days to get our barrings and stop getting lost. We took a tour at the end for a few extra dollars and saw some newer, much nicer units available for sale. I would stay here again, especially with family but if I were buying I would look for a place with more included for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but watch out for the timeshare salesman around every corner”
Reviews.Author: dbutcher
