Reviews.Content: Do you want to be hard sold a timeshare with a promise of cheapers theme park tickets, or plastic tube rental for their on-site water park? and what about, clueless, idiotic staff, some of whom are rude and obnoxious to you ..... If so then this is the place for you... if not, read on. When you check in to this resort the staff are kind and courteous, as one would expect when staying at a resort of this nature, you will be invited to a "welcome meeting", and asked to pay "$20", which they will credit you back and give you a discount off park tickets, or the tube rentals for their waterpark.All you have to do is go to their "welcome tour" around the resort and facilities. It is in fact a hard sell timeshare opportunity, even though they pretend it isn't. We sat through two hours of hell, by not 1, not two but 3 different people, each being told, "NO", and still they kept throwing people in front of us and offers to convert our weeks into points, bla bla bla.... Quite frankly digusted with all of that, set the rest of the 2 weeks we were there off to a bad footing. If you are going there, stay away from the older villas in West Village ( most of them are badly in need of repair, and no particularly spacious, though i must say more so than the apartment blocks ) Most of the staff were fairly courteous, with exception of the odd school holiday jock, who just doesnt listen is generally rude and takes more than a few times to get things right. Also most of the cleaners don't speak any English, so if you want anything be sure to ring it through to resort services, otherwise, what you ask for, may not be what you get. During a two week stay, the mandatory cleaning schedule was once, which was complimentary. If you wanted more frequent cleaning, then it would of course come at a price. Towels and bed lined changed once in a two week stay ( when we have always experienced nothing less than twice a week in a Gold Crown Resort ), was in our opinion below acceptable standard, If you get a prepaid toll free phone card, beware, they will charge you a dollar everytime you ring it, even if you haven't connected long distance ( kind of defeats the object of having the card ). Finally, the messages.... Oh God the messages..... every day, message after message, about golf or poker, or timeshare sales,or extending your stay .... after day 4 this was driving us all crazy!!!!!! resort itself is very nice, but not for everyone, and I shouldn't imagine us again.

Reviews.Title: “Big Place & Nice”
Reviews.Author: LinAnnBish
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orange Lake Country Club. Wow! is this place big. It has 4 golf courses on the property. We played on the Ledgends course which is is PGA course and on the 9 hole course Cranes Bend. Both courses were excellent. We stayed in the West Village. The resort itself is very large and divided into villages. Each village has a big pool, clubhouses etc. There are 2 gyms available at diiferent villages. They provide a free shuttle to get around the resort or you will have to drive. We were lucky and had one of the smaller pools right across from our villa. The largere pools were very crowded but able to handle the amount of people One of the pools has a lazy river and water slide for the kids. This was one of the busier pools. The larger pools have cabanas in which you can rent. They are pricey but do include a refrigerator, 3 pc comfy patio set, tv and ceiling fan. The Villas were nice and roomy, and included a washer & dryer which was nice. However, you must pay for maid service. Overall nice experience and great golfing. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed”
Reviews.Author: JZOLD
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Sunday Aug 3 2008 stayed in room 86741 room was nice and clean (3 bedroom) Everything seemed to work ok. On Tuesday Aug 5 we went to River Island for the day it was very nice. When we got back to our room we found that some one had been in our room a breathing machine (cpap) was taken off the night stand in the master bedroom and also are Disney tickets were taken off the same night stand, we called security and they came up and did a lock review with a computer in the key slot on the door, they told us that while we were gone some one from house keeping was in our room, at that point they told us they would check with house keeping and get back with us. About one hour later they came back to the room withthe breathing machine saying the person took it by mistake, I asked if they took the Disney tickets by mistake also, They told me the only way they could help me with the tickets is if I had the reciept for them. I tried to explan to them the we come to Orlando a couple times a year and we had our tickets from a visit in May an I did not have the reciept, I also told them that I stayed at OL in May. They told me they would get back to us in 24/48 hours. Today is Aug 11 and I am home now and still no word from OL. iF YOU STAY HERE LOCK AWAY ANY THING OF VALUE THE EMPLOYEES AT OL WILL COME IN YOUR ROOM AND ROBB YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NickieMTL
Reviews.Content: We where at Orange Lake for one week in July 2008. This resort is a complex of 3 villages with approx. 3000 units. 3 golfs, 11 pools (my favorite was the Lazy river-style pool that floats you along, winding past waterfalls, spa and all the pretty scenery of this complex). They also have a shuttle that runs from 7 a.m. to 11p.m. It is huge! Our villa (2 bedrooms) was a little bit far from the pools but in a very quiet location. The villa was above the average and very well equipped. They provide a starting kit with everything you need: salt & peper, dish and dish washer soaps, kleenex, etc. Everything is very clean and very nice. And it is very, very well located: a ig supermarket (Publix) at the East gate lot of restaurants around, 5 minutes from Disney, 10 minutes from Wet&wild and Wonderwork, 15 minutes from downtown Orlando and 2-3 minutes from all the major

Reviews.Title: “I've never been disturbed more times by hotel staff!”
Reviews.Author: Funinthesun027
Reviews.Content: My family and I travel to Orlando frequently, so we've come to know the better hotels and resorts in the area. Although we had never stayed at the Orange Lake Resort and Country Club, the reviews were pretty good and the pool area and amenities looked appealing online. To begin, this resort is a timeshare and while that is not a bad thing in and of itself, I made my reservation for a hotel suite, not expecting to be bombarded daily with phone calls from hotel staff trying to sell me a unit. The phone calls came at all hours but the most annoying calls came at 8:00 a.m. The first day we were surprised by the calls and simply took the phone off the hook. That compelled the hotel staff to come to our room and knock on the door at 8:15 a.m. to inquire if there was a problem with our phone. The air in our unit was broken. We called maintenace the moment we arrived and were told someone would be out to fix it. They came to fix it at 9:30 p.m. It broke again in the middle of the night so we called maintenance again. They came out to fix the air 3 times in a 3 day visit, including one 11:30 p.m. repair. The whole time they refused to move us to another room. Finally on our check out date, a repair company came out and informed us that the units airconditioning was broken for several weeks and they were shocked the unit was rented out. Meanwhile, the phone calls from the sales staff never let up. A total of 15 messages in 3 days. Not only did they call, but on 2 occasions they knocked on the door when the phone was taken off the hook for peace and quiet. The unit in this resort was very nice but it did not make up for the clueless staff, constant harrassment, and lack of accountablity from maintenace and customer service. We will never stay in this resort again...there are too many choices in the Orlando area to put up with this.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of older apartments”
Reviews.Author: MrsV2B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment in the older part of the resort. First impressions were that the apartment was very dated and in desperate need of re-furbishment. But we could live with that. However, the list then grew... The dishwasher rack was broken, there was broken glass in the dishwasher, the coffee machine was broken, there was crumbs and crisps under the sofas, there was a cobwebby elastic band ball just behind the TV unit, one of the bathroom sinks was rusty, one of the bathroom locks didn't work, there was a ball of dust/fluff/hair in my bed, the balcony furniture was filthy, both sun loungers were broken and the outside balcony lights didn't work. We didn't go looking for problems but my 3 year old is inquisitive hence the discovery of crisps under the sofa (which she very nearly ate) and the elastic band ball (which admittedly kept her entertained for a few minutes). The bus service to the pool etc... was a good 15 minute walk along a road with no pavement, and the buses ran every 20 minutes, but no indication of which 20 minutes. Not a great experience with a 3 year old and all the stuff that needs to be taken for a day out at the pool. The supermarket at the entrance to the resort is also over priced, it's worth driving out to a different store to get the better deals and lower prices. Most definitely would not reccommend a stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Orange Lake!!!”
Reviews.Author: lcavett
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from Orange Lake and we loved it!! I read the reveiws and found them VERY helpful. I took one of the reviewers advice and we stayed in East Villiage (near Publix) -- perfect. The condo was brand new and absolutely beautiful! Plenty of room for our family of 7. And we had a car too - another absolute necessity for Orange Lake. This place is huge! We found the staff very helpful and when we told them we were not interested in a time share presentation no one bothered us again. We are Bluegreen owners and did an exchange week so the price was right too. LIke everywhere in FL. they do nickel & dime you. Charging for tubes -- putt-putt etc. We were there for Disney so we only did the pool for 1 day -- so it wasn't that big of deal. At Bluegreen it is rare that there are additional charges so this something we are not used to. Orange Lake is in an excellent location and seemed to have really good security too. I would return there again in heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, make sure you......”
Reviews.Author: g8tr
Reviews.Content: If you book direct you get better everything. Travel sites eat away at property profits, so go directly to Orange Lake and book. Sure you must go through the motions of the 1 and a half tour, but you can always say no to the persistant sales person. If you stay with no tour you get the older rooms and further away from the River Island pool. The time share/buy a week sales pitch is worth it for what you get. CHECK IN early! you can request for River Island. We got a very nice and clean 2 bedroom on the 5th floor. Right out the back door is a great pool. Lazy river and kid friendly pool. Sure they charge you for a tube, or just go to the Pulix up the street and buy your own raft. Bars are by the pool, but they are there to make money. Bring your own cooler! Once again hit the publix or the liquor store right down the street. The place is not a hotel. So you must do a little laundry and dishwashing while your there. You save a ton, by cooking. The room was well furnished all the way up to a 50" flat screen. A full kitchen is very nice to have especially with kids. If you want a place were everything is done for you, this is not for you. Go to a hotel. If you like the freedom of cooking and doing things on your own, then go for it. Only bad part was the fire alarm going off at 11pm. Fun to see a couple hundred people stagger out to the pool area, then back to the rooms after they said someone just pulled the alarm for fun. 3 nights was $180

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: lucks27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went thru RCI for this vacation. The place was in better shape than most RCI resorts I have stayed at over the years. I really did not use any amenities because we used it as a hotel to visit Disney. They have a great pool, but we did not use it. But, I have to give them a big round of applause. I left my engagement ring on the sink countertop by accident and realized it once we were at Disney. It is a timeshare we did not think our room was going to be cleaned, it wasn’t the other days. Well they must clean the rooms at your halfway point and it was the day I left my ring. When we got back to the room my ring was still there, and all I can say is Thank Goodness!!! The room itself was clean and comfortable. The sheets didnt really fit the bed well, which was strange. They kept popping off the corners. Also the boxspring fabric was torn to the point that it was hanging down, but otherwise there was no complaints about the room. They have a coffee maker, dishwasher, stove top, microwave and fridge. As an FYI, if you are going to purchase disney tickets, but them at the counter when you check in, not at the disney vendors. The prices are cheaper if you purchase them at the counter.

Reviews.Title: “Our kids had a wonderful time at Orange Lake!!!”
Reviews.Author: southgulfcove1
Reviews.Content: About 6 years ago we stayed at Orange Lake Resort in the North Village. We enjoyed our stay back then. After reading the reviews we were concerned about going back. At checkin we were greeted by someone who went out of her way to accomadate us. Unfortunately, it was her last day working at OLCC. We were assigned a renovated unit on the 2nd floor at 42xx. Checkin process was rather quick. The unit was very clean,bright and updated. Though, the T.V. in the living room could have been bigger and the reception could have been better. But, we barely turned on the T.V. with the exception of the kids and adults who played Wii on rainy days. Yes folks!!! June is the wettest month for Central Florida and you can expect tropical monsoon like weather at times. But don't let that scare you into not coming. We still managed to put in a couple of good days at Universal. Avoid the long lines at the Simpson's in Universal Studios....The kids ages, 9,10,12 and adults did not think this ride was worth long 90 minute wait!!! We do not recommend this ride if the line is long. Mummy is much more fun but there are some restrictions... OLCC Kids enjoyed Splash lagoon more than River Country. The slides at River Country were too slow for them. Splash Lagoon is smaller but the rushing waters make it more enjoyable for all. Splash Lagoon has a volleyball net and a Basketball hoop. Lazy River was okay for 1 day but not worth the money to keep going back....besides it was too far from West Village. Splash Lagoon is closer. I was surprised to not see any bugs in the unit After all this is Florida and it gets hot so for those of us who live down here we know what to expect. We also had a large porch with a nice view of the golf course and lake. Golfers come out early to play so if you plan on sleeping late you may want to request a room, if possible, away from the the golf course and/or Orange Lake Blvd. (car traffic) . Oh, and this morning OLCC mtc was mowing the lawn at 06:15 in the morning. That was definitely inconsiderate and uncalled for. Overall, We enjoyed our stay at OLCC this year. We have stayed at Silver Lake, Vistana, Summer Bay and OLCC. If we had to choose again we would probably choose OLCC again. Though Summer Bay comes in a close 2nd. If only they had a nicer pool area and were closer to the attractions! And don't get me wrong Vistana is nice also. Publix is close by. Walmart is about 4 miles west on 192 then turn right on U.S 27 about another 1/2 mile. P.S. You will get calls in the morning. If you tell then you're not interested in their presentation they shouldn't bother you anymore otherwise just take the phone off the hook. Have Fun at OLCC!!! We did.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: FunLovin'
Reviews.Content: If you're traveling with a large family or group and looking for convenience and distraction for the kids, this is a good place to consider. We had 7 people in our party when we stayed here, so the two bedroom duplex-type units were great for us. The resort was conveniently located for trips to DisneyWorld and there is a modest-sized grocery store on campus. The pools were fun for the kids, there was a free theater and a few other activities that kept the kids occupied during non-park times. The rooms themselves are sufficient as far as having a kitchen, lots of sleeping accomodations, etc., but there is no luxury here. It's just what it is meant to be - a place for a family to crash after a whirlwind day at the parks. It could definitely use updating of decor and new mattresses, linens, etc., but it was clean and worked well for what we all needed. It did feel a bit like they were cattle herding with the lines in the lobby for checking in and out, making transportation arrangements, etc., but that tends to be the case with large 'resort' environments near the parks. We would recommend this to anyone with a large group who all want to stay together.

Reviews.Title: “One word - Misleading”
Reviews.Author: md6531
Reviews.Content: This review is a warning to those booking a stay at this resort through Expedia. When we booked this resort as part of an Expedia vacation package, I called the resort, gave them my reservation information and requested that we stay at the River Island area. We were told that they could not guarantee that we would be able to stay at the River Island area and that was ok with me. The female on the phone told us that she would at least record the request in the system so that the check-in staff would have it when we did check-in on our arrival. She said that they would try to accommodate the request if possible. As a side note, I asked her if we would be hounded about timeshare because we were not interested and she told us that when we check in just mention that we were not interested and that would be it. Upon our arrival, we were told that we were limited to staying at the check-in clubhouse and staying on the first floor. The staff at the front desk told us that certain first floor rooms were dedicated to those that book rooms through Expedia and other similar travel services. The front desk staff also told us that we were not eligible to stay in any other areas. And yes, they had our request that the female, from my earlier call, had told us that she would record into the system. We reluctantly went down to view the room. To get to the room, you had to exit the building through a side door from the main floor, take an elevator located outside down one floor, re-enter the building and walk through a poorly lit corridor that was used to store several large housekeeping and maintenance carts. At the end of the corridor there were two doors. One was the entrance to the golf cart storage and maintenance garage and the other the entrance to the first floor rooms. After finding the room we entered and the first thing we see is a large vent cover disconnected and leaning away from the wall. All of the wires were openly exposed. Ironically, we even had to wait at the check-in desk because they said the room was to ready yet. The lighting in the room was very poor and it had a very pungent smell. We returned to the front desk to reject the room and requested another room. We were then told that we could not change rooms. I finally had to call Expedia. After about an hour on my cell phone, since they wouldn’t even let me use a resort phone, the Expedia agent called the front desk manager and finally got us relocated to a room on the main floor. I decided to give up on an upgrade option. It was hard enough to get to where I was. After getting our newly assigned room, we proceeded to get our luggage and that took another fifteen minutes to find someone to get us a luggage cart. Within a half an hour, we received a phone call inviting us to participate in a timeshare seminar. I politely declined yet I received a phone call from the same female resort representative everyday that we were there. So much for the “just tell them your not interested” that I was told. During our stay we had to request towels when we needed them. They do not provide them as a daily service. And during our stay we realized that they nickel and dime you to death. Want an inflatable tube for floating at River Island ($7.50 per use per tube). There was a twelve-dollar “Resort Fee” that we were not told about. And the staff was very disrespectful. We experienced staff with very smug attitudes and they would talk amongst themselves in other than English languages when in our presence. My family and I consider ourselves as very polite people and we are definitely not the Hooty-Tooty types either. We are just a simple down-to-earth Midwest family. Needless to say, we will not be returning to this resort and definitely do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, No Need to Exaggerate”
Reviews.Author: Sarizona
Reviews.Content: My mom, stepdad, boyfriend, and I visited this resort the first week of June 2008. We had a great vacation, and overall liked our accomodations. However, there were some negatives about this resort. Most importantly, the personnel tend to exaggerate the resort. It is a very large, all-encompassing resort, but it seems like they even go so far as to make up details that aren't true to make the resort seem even nicer. This affected our family because we were told all the rooms were renovated, only to be put in an unrenovated room (West Village). The room itself was not bad, but as an RCI transfer, our original property was a lot nicer. This room was advertised as newly renovated with a hot tub, new furniture, etc. While the room wasn't a dump, this was simply not true. We were able to switch rooms to the North Village, but it was a production. The "Dive-In Movie Pool" we were informed about was never found by us. I kept looking for it, but I think the check-in lady made it up. Either that or it's not built yet (they were renovating a pool). That was a disappointment. The staff is not super knowledgeable about the resort details. Don't bother asking them where stuff is or what time it closes. We were either given no information or faulty information regarding those topics. It was really difficult to get any real information from anyone. The lake was also kind of disappointing. It was very small, and there was not much to see in the way of nature. Also, non-motorized craft as well as jet skis had to share the "lake." It was really more of a glorified pond. Side-note: 2-person kayaking is NOT fun. All you do is hit eachothers paddles and make eachother mad. We switched rooms to an actual renovated room, and it was much nicer with a hot tub and screened in porch and all. However, there was a VCR in each room. VCR? Really? Just spring for the DVD player or nothing, I'd say. Some of these points may seem picky, and they are. The main idea is that as a state-of-the-art resort, everything should be PERFECT. A lot of these things would not have bothered us if we were told up front about them. Or not told about them if it wasn't true. It was just a case of overinflated expectations, I think. I think having such a large resort (7 sq mi) is a positive and a negative. On one hand, the resort had almost anything you'd want available (groceries, mini golf, pools, etc...); on the other hand, it was hard to find many things. You must have the map on hand at all times, and you can't really walk anywhere. Even the pool in our complex was a good 7 min walk. Our room was located 2 miles from the front desk lobby. They do provide shuttles though, which is helpful, and there's plenty of parking if you want to drive places. The pools were could find (3 out of 8) were nice. River Island is particularly impressive. The pools close at about 9 or 10, and the river and slides close at 7 pm. However, gates are not locked, and pools are not guarded. I guess that can be a bad thing if you have terrible children wandering around the resort unattended, but it was nice for us. My boyfriend and I had the lazy river and hot tub all to ourselves at 10-10:30 pm. While the resort wasn't overcrowded, it was nice to have a private (PG-rated, I swear) swim. The location of the resort is very convenient. It is practically at Disney, and there are a plethera of restaurants and shops. There's a Super Walmart nearby, and the groceries are way cheap there. Perfect for vacation. You could probably buy all your meals and souvenirs at the resort, but it'd be expensive. We didn't really buy anything there. There were birds and other wildlife around, which I liked. I guess people could see it as a nuisance or danger, but I quite enjoyed our 3-pawed raccoon friend. He didn't bite us or anything, and the birds would walk around in groups. It was cute. Overall, I would say this is an above average resort. If they want an excellent rating, they're going to have to take some of those opulent claims and make them true.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities Nice....Rooms outdated”
Reviews.Author: lesliedee
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a large resort near the theme parks then consider, but beware of the timeshare sell!!!! Be prepared to bring your wallet they will make every attempt to nickel and dime you to death. They wanted to charge us $220 a week for 4 unlimited tubes for the lazy river, putt putt was pricey, and golf courses were over prized for the courses. To get the bargain on all these amenities you must sit through 2 hours of them lecturing about timeshares. Of course I had no interested in purchasing, but I did get 4 unlimited tubes for a week for $20, 8 people unlimited putt putt for $30 for a week, 4 rounds of golf for $30.00 each round, and discounted Sea World tickets. The 2 hours of the rambling was well worth all the discounts they offer with the breakfast, but make sure you get everyone!!! These should be the normal prices anyway. Its ridiculous anyone should have to go through that pitch to get normal prices. We used a friends timeshare and were stuck in the West Village which is outdated. Our friends own in Splash Lagoon, but they wouldn't put us in that area (another time share rip off). The dishwasher wasn't installed in the cabinets and tilted out every time you opened it. The washer, dryer, and dishwasher were so loud that we could only run them when we were out during the day (no one could sleep through them or watch TV). The kitchen is poorly stocked with pots and pans (i.e. pots have handles that are about to fall off and there isn't enough to cook a large meal unless your creative). The beds are hard as a rock. 5 of the 6 people in our group complained of back problems after sleeping in them just after 2 nights. It was a long night for some members of our group. On the upside pools are spectacular!! Putt putt is fun! The proximity of the resort to the theme parks is spectacular!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful and Relaxing Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: kidsandtravel4fun
Reviews.Content: We just got back on June 2nd! I was terrified about heading out to this resort. We were taking our two young children on a trip to Florida to visit family, while spending time on our very own resort. Once I started checking the reviews, I was horrified to hear all the complaints about this place (ie. garbage everywhere, unfriendly staff, horrible and disgusting rooms, too big, too far from everything, close to the toll highway, can't see the fireworks....) I got myself all worried and decided to call the resort for information and to request a clean room, stressing that I was traveling with very young children. We also called to request a crib and a high chair. I also mentioned that I worried about what I read about West Village and she said they were in the process of updating all the rooms. During our conversation, she got a bit defensive because she realized that a lot of my questions were based on the negative reviews that I had read. I was still a little skeptical after I got off the phone, unsure whether she was truthful or not. Actually, lets change that to "a lot skeptical". But I was ready to argue if need be, darn it...to get a decent, clean, newly furnished room, if I wasn't happy with what I was given!!!!! When we got to the resort, we were pleased to see Security check for VIP tags on your car window. They directed us to the registration building. The place was spotless, there were tons of staff directing you to the next available desk. The woman greeted me and was very friendly. She told me that we were staying in a great unit in the EAST village. When I told her that I was getting worried about this place because of the reviews I read, she said that "all you have to do is call the resort directly, speak to us and we will accommodate you as best we can". Calling ahead did make a difference, a crib and high chair awaited in the room. When we arrived to the building, I was so worried that my husband waited in the car with the kids while I checked it out! It was fabulous, a clean, spacious 2 bedroom condo with all the perks (full kitchen, clean bathrooms, towels, toilet paper, paper towel roll, 3 tvs etc. We were also overlooking the golf course (which was taken care of every morning by 7:30 am by several staff). The pools were fabulous (beach type entry into the water)! My three year old loved that! The water park was amazing. Sure they charge for the tube, but my son used it once and didn't request it again. Sure the resort is large, but you can choose whether you want to head to the water park for the day or lounge by one of the quieter pools. You can choose to eat at home or head to the restaurants. Yes, Publics was busy and somewhat overpriced, but if you choose to cook, you're saving a lot of money overall. A rental car was a very important asset. Walking to and from the different locations was quite a way and during the day, VERY HOT. We didn't use the Shuttle but saw several of them going back and forth throughout the day. Sure, a few of the phone calls were to invite us to a presentation, but we just simply said we were not interested and that was it. Sometimes, we came back to the condo to a message about a special event. We listened and hung up. Disney Village, the parks, Orlando Downtown, Prime outlets, Shops and Restaurants are a short drive away. We really felt like we were on VACATION on a resort. We checked-out one day earlier to head to North Redington Beach (2 hours away) for a few days and I can truly say, Orange Lake and the beach made a great family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: adamsfamily2
Reviews.Content: We got an exception deal through Expedia which is why I chose it. I noticed quite a bit of bad feedback on it but decided to give it a go anyway as I really wanted a large place to stay with our family of 5 for the 2 weeks we were there. We planned to take in the Disney Parks so we knew we wouldn't spend a lot of time at the resort anyway. I wish we had more time to spend here though! Lots of nice pools and other ammenities (like the West Village arcade) we didn't get a chance to do There is nothing wrong with this place at all. It is GREAT! Expedia lists it as a 3.5* and I felt this was accurate. We were given a villa in the West Village in the appartment style villas in the 5500 building. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable with 2 bdrms, 2 full bathrooms and large living and kitchen areas. We stayed for 2 weeks and I was very happy with everything. The pools are well kept, clean and beautiful- we especially enjoyed the lazy river at River Island! Yes, we had to drive 5 mins from our room to get there but that was fine by me! We also used the pool in the West Village in the evenings as it was open until 11pm. We enjoyed having it to ourselves at that time of night! They are improving and adding things to the West Village so I am sure if will be even better once the new pool area opens. According to signs it opens Summer 2008. But even without the added ammenities we still enjoyed the West Village. Just a few things worth mentioning so you know what you are getting into here. The place is HUGE. I mean enormous. You should have a car, although they do have public transportation you can use. We enjoyed drinks at the Tradewinds Bar in River Island but for the best service sit at the bar- the bartenders are great! You will receive daily calls (for us at 8:44 am daily) which I presumed to be timeshare invitations. I never answered the phones and the time of the calls didn't bother me as we were always nearly out the door when they came in. If you are bothered I suggest unplugging the phones or try answering the first time and telling them you are not interested. We were NEVER pressured by anyone to buy anything. The front desk staff were always pleasant. All in all. A great place to stay. Close to Disney, great value for the money! Will definately return

Reviews.Title: “Too big, pricey ammenities, noisy and smelly”
Reviews.Author: JayR5160
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort through an rci exchange and stayed in a nice two bedroom unit with 1 1/2 baths. The kitchen and bedrooms were nice. 3 tv's. Somewhat dated, no dvd players and one vcr. The resort is huge. I was lucky enough to be next door to a pool and a shuttle stop so I was able to get to all the recreation areas without driving or walking but not all units are on the shuttle route. The landscaping smelled like catfish stink bait and a outside fire alarm kept going off without reason. This resort is about making money. Soda was 2:75 a bottle. the mediocre miniature golf course was 10;00. Groceries in the marketplace were outrageous and videogames were double to triple the free world price. Inner tube rentals were 7.00 and the grill food prices were higher than you will pay in the amusement parks. Fourtunenately, their was a Publix supermarket 2 miles from my unit and numerous restruants 3 miles away. The pools were nice and the lazy river was very unique and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the West Village”
Reviews.Author: jenn477
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom in the west village. The unit was updated and had more than enough room for a family of 7. The back door and patio overlooked the golf course. The pools were out of this world as was the service. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The resort does offer a shuttle but you can use your own car.. probably alittle quicker and more direct. There is a Publix food store at one of the entrances and a 24 walgreens at the other. There are also plenty of places to eat within 5 minutes of the hotel. Overall... we had a great stay, never felt on top of each other in the room and NO ONE was on our back to have to take a time share tour. They did ask and we said no thank you and that was it!!!! Close to both Universal and Disney but actually cut back on the parks to stay and enjoy the resort!!! We would def come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everthing”
Reviews.Author: shaqmcnabb
Reviews.Content: I loved Orange Lake. Everyone is so nice to everybody. The rooms are very neat and roomy. one thing i do have to say is that the older rooms are gross and outdated. But besides that, river island is great! the pools are always open and they have a convietant shopping mart on their property. I LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome West Village stay!”
Reviews.Author: kjgca
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, i was a little scared to be honest. We checked in a little late around 8:30 p.m. Check in was fast around 20 minutes. We stayed in the 4300 building in a two bedroom it was remodeled and looked beautiful. All the staff i encountered were very nice. We did go on the "tour" . The guy was nice and accepted that we said we were not interested. They didn't bother us again our whole time there. The pools were very nice. We mostly went to splash lagoon for the kids carnival and the shallow waters for the children. We have a one and two year old so, it was perfect. We did eat at the restaurant at river island twice and i have to say it was not that good :( . But we mostly used our kitchen anyway. Overall it was the perfect place, and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - West Village”
Reviews.Author: trpcbreez
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by any negative reviews of this resort. It is a beautiful resort and centrally located to all Orlando has to offer. From my experience (and other reviews) I do believe all RCI exchanges are in the West Village. There are two types of accomodations in West Village, villas (condo-like units) and hotel-like rooms, which are located in the same building where you check in. This newly remodeled building also houses a coffee shop, internet cafe, game room, kids club, as well as desks for Disney, rental car, and RCI, etc. The top couple of floors are the hotel-like rooms. Ours was very much like a standard hotel room, (two double beds with a pull-out sofa bed) with the addition of a mini-kitchen with full size refrigerator, dish washer, microwave, and four-eye stove top. Bathroom was standard hotel like. I had the opportunity to see a two-bedroom unit, which had flat screen TVs and seperate sleeping quarters. The accomodations were nice, but if you're traveling in a large group, a villa might be more comfortable. The resort itself is seperated into different villages, each with it's own restaurants, pools, shopping, etc. West Village currently has one pool with a snack bar and is located close to putt-putt. When we visited, they were almost finished with a second, larger pool adjacent to the first pool. There were always plenty of available lounge chairs. Also adjacent to the accomodations we were in, is an 80-acre lake that offers a small but pretty beach with palm trees and lounge chairs, as well as rental boats, jet skis, etc. West Village does not currently have a restaurant but the restaurants in the other villages are close by (by car or the on-site shuttle service). There is a convenience store next to the check in that offers sandwiches, drinks, and your typical resort-type merchandise. We did not use the on-site shuttle service, so I can't comment on the speed (or lack thereof) of same. There are a couple of very nice shops and restaurants in River Village. This is the largest village and home to the lazy river and restaurant where we ate dinner several times. The service was a bit slow but expected due to the number of patrons. There is only one restaurant on site that serves breakfast and it is located on the practice putting green. The food there was also good. I have no complaints with this resort at all. However, it is so large, it is impossible to see everything. Off grounds, there is a grocery store located just outside of one set of the entrance gates, as well as lots of other nearby shops, restaurants, etc. For something different, try Sleuths murder mystery dinner theater. It's located off International Drive in Orlando, approximately 15 minutes from the resort. I took my eleven year old daughter and she loved it. The price includes beverages and hors dourves prior to the show, as well as dinner and beverages during the show. Don't let any negative reviews about RCI exchanges through this resort worry you! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: Nelliemay
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by many of the bad reviews because I thought all in all the resort was very nice. Friends of mine invited us to stay when they were upgraded to a three bedroom condo. We stayed for three days. Our bedrooom was the size of a large hotel room. The overall size of condo was very large, clean and open. We stayed in the East Village which is a close drive to River Island. River Island was a wonderful place to spend the day. It has the lazy river, various pools, slides, two bars, tons of lounge chairs and a small food court. It is only a ten minute drive to Disney. Their is a Publix Market located at the resort which made it convenient to stock up our kitchen. I would reccommend this resort for families and those who prefer renting condos over hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “West Village RCI Exchange”
Reviews.Author: Creekinwa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one week in a two-bedroom villa in the West Village. This was an exchange through RCI. We stood in line for 30 minutes before being checked in, and it took another 30 minutes to be checked in--the woman checking us in kept talking and talking about her own life! We were told that the villas in the West Village are being upgraded -- but we ended up in one that had not yet been upgraded. Small repairs need to be made (i.e., roller missing from dishwasher rack). Hand and finger prints were on the sliding glass doors. There was no DVD player or jetted tub, nor was there a screen porch or umbrella for the table on the patio. No barbecue and no barbecue area at the resort. On the plus side, the beds were VERY comfortable, and it was very quiet. The villas are on the golf course, and the view from the patio is beautiful. Location is close to all Disney parks. The resort tour was not pressured and was very close to being the hour they claim it will be. However, after being driven in a small golf cart on the tour, we were left sitting there (when it was finished) and told to take the resort shuttle back. Driving through the property, it looks like the other areas have nicer units, and the units in the River Island area are very nice. The Publix market is close by and has everything you'll need. The River Island Grille served delicious reasonably priced food. The bar was jumping! Pool area beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Orange Lake River Island”
Reviews.Author: binkyboy
Reviews.Content: We booked through the orange lake website and requested River Island. We absolutely loved it! The rooms were beautiful and the beds were very comfortable. The pool did get crowded but the west village pool is closed. Check in did take awhile, there were only 2 staff members checking people in. Everyone was very friendly.The pool and lazy river area is beautiful. The slides are great. The blow up Hippo ride/slide was $4.00 or $13 hour and was a blast! The hammocks are relaxing, the arcade is clean and restaurant in River Island was expensive but very good. You can play mini golf all week for $40.00 a family. The resort is large but we saw a lot of the transportation buses. You can buy disney passes on site. Don't worry about all the negative reviews. They are building 2 new complexes in river island but the outside work is almost complete and the noise didn't bother us. Seaworld and Blizzard Beach weren't far. There is a vacuum and broom in the room so we cleaned up ourselves and didn't need to have the room cleaned. This is a family resort and not one person bothered us about a time share, we unplugged the phones when we got there. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Fair Trade??? Nooo Way. . .”
Reviews.Author: digsthesand
Reviews.Content: My father traded a three bedroom and two bedroom condo in exchange for a three bedroom and two bedroom. After a half hour of waiting to check in, we ended up with a the three bedroom in the East Village, which was very nice, however, the two bedroom turned out to be a ratty old studio in the West Village--that reeked like stinky hallways in apartment buildings and must. There was one window that didn't even have a view. The room was dark and outdated. The water barely trickeled out of the shower and the closet door was falling off the hinges. The floors were filthy. Our intent was to have all of us traveling together be near each other. This didn't happen. After at least three attempts at trying to get a two bedroom condo (which, mind you, we were supposed to get in trade) through RCI and through the front desk, were told that there was nothing they would do for us and if we were able to move out of the room, they would charge a cleaning fee. They were more concerned about this "cleaning fee" than granting our request. The lady on the phone kept repeating something about a cleaning fee, over and over. I asked her why she didn't clean it before our family moved into it a few days before. She said they'd call maintenance about the closet door. Why didn't maintenance just fix it without having to get a complaint first? Tacky. In our three bedroom condo, the lock would not work, so we could not all leave our condo at the same time. Somebody had to stay behind. We called maintenance and they had to come and reinstall our lock. The lady was rude on the phone. The maintenance man, who was very nice, said that the keys they gave us were used over and over again and scratched. They were so scratched that they wouldn't work anyway. They cost about 40 cents a piece. The front desk reuses the keys to save costs??? Everything costs money at the resort. . . you'd think they could afford new keys. The pool with the waterslides and lazy river were so crowded, the only way to get a chair would be to sleep on it overnight. There were no tubes left to purchase and the ones that were purchased sat by tables with nobody using them for hours. Sometimes there were no towels by the pool and piles of garbage outside of people's rooms. The stench from Animal Kingdom was sooo vile one evening that it literally made people gag. There are a lot of little critters in the garbage cans, too. Raccoons by the kid pool, not cool. The last day we asked to stay later b/c our flight did not leave until later. We were told 11 a.m. was the latest we could check out. They locked us out of our room at 11 bells on the nose. Once you're out, you're out. We had to call security to open the door b/c they couldnt open it from the front desk in order to get the rest of our belongings out of the condo. Rediculous. A few positives, it is close to good restaurants and the sports bar is nice. The bartenders are pleasant. Publix, the grocery store, is very close and convenient. That's a plus. The weather was unbeatable. That's pretty much the only thing that reallllly made Florida worthwhile--oh, and being within driving distance of nice beaches. We have never been treated so poorly at a condo/resort. Usually, if there is an issue with anything, it's remedied within a few hours. It just felt like they could care less about their customers. RCI really didn't seem too concerned about our issue with the room, either. We read reviews before we left so we had an idea of what we were getting into. We hoped for the best. It was just really disappointing. If you want to stand around and wait in line and pay out the nose, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort-Loved Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: cookiecutta
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just gotten back from staying at Orange Lake Resort. We were there from April 19th to April 26th. We absolutely loved the resort. I read all of the reviews here after I booked at Oraqnge Lake and was expecting the worst. I was so happy when I opened the door to my unit. The unit was very clean, no bugs. The decor was bright and tropical. The rooms were very spacious. All and all we were very happy with the look and floorplan of the unit. Check in was a breeze. Total, it took about 10 minutes. I rented the unit from an owner. There were so many activies to do at the resort. Our teenagers had a blast. They utilized the shuttle around the resort with no problems. They had a couple of teen events. One cost nothing, the other one was $10 each and that included unlimited use of the HIPPO slide and Island Mini Golf for 3 1/2 Hrs. I think it was well worth the $10. My kids also went to the arcade. It does cost money, but what arcade doesn't. I think it was reasonable and all my kids enjoyed it. I have 4 boys 13, 12, 8 and 2. The pools are great. We used the River Island and Splash Lagoon pools. My kids never wanted to leave them. They have a lot of stuff to do there with your family. Aside from the pools and arcade they have movies for the kids and Swampy's club, where they do arts and crafts, open playstation time and interactive games. They have a Kids Carnival on Tues. & Thurs. at Splash Lagoon. They have a Beach Blanket Blast on Wed. in River Island. They also have a Gatorland Show on Wed. where you can touch an alligator, cost $5 a person. There is always something to do there and I feel the costs are reasonable. I definitely would go back there. It is definitely a great resort with lots of things to do and very family friendly. I highly recommend it to anyone wanting to have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake is Great!!! Don't believe bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: jennwayne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake from April 13th- 20th. I had been at Oraneg Lake 8 years ago and loved it. It was still great. We stayed in the East. I'm not sure why people complain about this resort. I am VERY picky and usually only stay at 5 star resorts- this resort is amazing. It is huge....but we walked everywhere and we have a baby. There are also shuttles around the resort, and there is parking everywhere. The resort is beautiful and very clean. There are always people cleaning and doing landscaping. It has beautiful grounds. There are 8 pools. We weren't at all of them- but the ones we were at very very clean and warm (they are all heated). The rooms are huge and clean. We could have easily slept 6 or even 8 people in there. My husband was concerned after reading the reviews- and after we got there he wondered what all the complaining was about. he loved the golf. There are a ton of activites for kids and adults, I'm not sure how anyone would be bored here. We ate at the restaurant at River Island and the food was amazing....a little pricy but not too bad. We bought our groceries at the Publix onsite. Very convenient. The resort is so close to everything- it's not hard to find where you're going. We went to Disney's Animal Kingdom and Seaworld. Both close to the resort. As far as the timeshare stuff...they do call you. They called 3 days in a row. The first day I told them we had an 8 month old baby and that we wouldn't be attending. They were NOT pushy at all. As soon as I told them no they left me alone and asked if there was anyhting I needed at the resort. The next 2 days they did call. I declined again- and even got some directions from the girl. Not a big deal at all. I think some people just have to complain about something. If you don't want to talk to them- don't pick up the phone!!! We weren't in the rooms often anyhow. Anyhow it is a beautiful resort- great for kids and adults. We are planning on going every year now. Abbsolutely nothing to complain about. The only thing they need that could make it better would be an all inclusive option:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Facilities, Average Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: gandalfNY
Reviews.Content: We did an RCI exchange for a 3 bedroom unit, expecting to be placed in the West Village. However after a slow registration process (waited 25 minutes despite having only two people ahead of us in line), we were pleasantly surprised to receive a unit in the East Village. It was easily one of the nicest units we have exchanged into in over 15 years. The third bedroom was nicer than most of the hotel rooms I've stayed at in Orlando. The main and 2nd bedrooms were clean and spacious. There was plenty of room for the six of us who stayed there. The grounds and pool areas, especially River Island are exceptional. However, they get packed and you need to grab chairs and/or tables early. We received no welcome package detailing activities for the week and when we called were told to go back to registration to get one. We received two calls for timeshare presentations, but politely declined. I would certainly recommend this resort to others, but they seemed to be very sales focused. The resort is huge and you will need to use the car often to get where you want to go, unless you want to waste time waiting for the sporadic resort shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Aewsome Resort”
Reviews.Author: LDRNTraveler
Reviews.Content: April 4-8, 2008 I stayed in the West Village in a 2br/2bth villa. The villa was great. The decor was flashy tropical Florida, but it was still nice. The west village is quiet. If you want noise stay in River Island. River Island was absolutely beautiful. The pools, lazy river, bars, beach & cabanas were nice. There were activities almost every night. We did karaoke. There were 2 nice arcades & fitness centers. We were very pleased with our villa & the property. The only minus was that on our last day a dying roach appeared in one of the bathrooms. It looked like the same type of bug a traveler posted in a previous review.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless rooms, close to everything, lots to do at this resort”
Reviews.Author: sandralu
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare and booked with RCI. The rooms were large, very modern, and decorated very nicely in a tropical decor. Counter tops were a very pretty granite. The 2 bed/2 bath villa we stayed in was spotless. I am am a neat freak and didn't find as much as a speck of dust or chip of paint off. It was wonderful! The furniture, bedding and towels looked new. Our unit had a washer/dryer and detergent was provided. The kitchen had all kinds of soap, coffee, tea, sugar packets, etc, which was nice. We liked how close we were to shopping/restaurants and Disney and Seaworld were not super close, but not too far of a drive for us. Mini golf, lazy river, many nicely kept swimming pools, tennis, basketball, and many other on site activities kept our teen kids busy. The resort is huge and they have a shuttle that runs thru the complex that the kids could go on. There are shops and restaurants at the resort. Staff were all very nice. Within the resort there is a large lake with a sand beach. The beach shop was closed for remodeling. Normally they rent fishing poles, paddle boats, jet skis, etc. It looked like it would have been fun if it was open. Having to pay extra to rent tennis rackets, use big slide, mini-golf and some others activities was not a big expense, but annoying. No maid service included during stay, however could arrange tidy and new towels/bedding for a fee. This is a very active resort and not especially quiet - lots of people and some traffic noise. Very fun for a golfer as the course was lovely. Families with kids would also have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: canadagirl91
Reviews.Content: I was very worried pulling into Orange Lake after reading several horrible reviews. All the worry was for nothing. That place is fabulous. We had a 1 bedroom suite in the north village. It was very clean and had all the amenities one needs. The pools were fantastic. River Island area is just beautiful. We were planning a day to one of the water parks but saved the money as the children just wanted to stay at the resort pools. We did not eat or drink at the resort . A pina colada cost $10.00. A little much in my opinion. The food looked to be reasonably priced though. Our children are 4 and 8, but the resort is great for any age with so many activities and things to keep you busy. We will definately stay there next time around.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaGoGoGo
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand how so many reviewers have totally opposite experiences at the same resort. All I can say is we found our two bedroom villa to be clean and roomy and contain everything as advertised. Check in went quickly..even so quick I could not enjoy more of the free pizza and wine they served while we waited in line all of 10 minutes. The pools are wonderful (reserve a spot early!) Prices are high at the resort for everything so bring as much as you can, go offsite or be prepared to pay. Otherwise, I have no problems with Orange Lake. To be honest, it seems like most of the negative reviews stem from misunderstandings about the type, location or size of the units guests end up staying in. I suggest to avoid this, be positive before you go as to where you will be staying and get it in writing. And make sure you are familar with the size of each unit and the layout of the resort (it is getting huge and actually the roads are busy at times with walkers and traffic) and then you can make a good decision on where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rpdk9900
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake the from 3/36 - 4/2. We were placed in West Village in a one bedroom suite, (we never called ahead to reserve a specific room). It was actually the same building that the reception area is located. The room was very nice, it looked as though it was recently updated. It had two flat screen tv's, one in the bedroom and one in the living room. A very nice kitchen area and at least a king size bed in the bedroom. The only thing I didn't like was that there was no balcony or windows that could be opened. We had a very nice view, we faced the beach. River Island and Splash Lagoon were great. They do get crowded but the kids loved it. The arcade is nice too but a bit expensive. The location of the resort is great. It was really easy to get to Disney. 192 does get busy but if you go at the right times it's not bad. The Publix grocery store on site is great. The only other bad part was that we didn't get clean towels everyday, they cost extra but there was a washer and dryer where you could do laundry and it was free. They are doing some renovations so the main pool was closed but there is another pool right next to it that we could use and it was walking distance from our room. It was our first time staying here and we would definitely go back again. LOVED IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in the East Village”
Reviews.Author: aloricat
Reviews.Content: We are owners at OL and were able to exchange for a 3BR (we own a 2BR in the West Village since the mid 80's). We just returned from a week long stay at OL. I initially booked for the West Village for a 3 BR, but was put in the East Village. The East Village is comprised of 6 story tall building units. Our building was the farthest on the resort, but right next to a smaller pool. The unit was clean and suited all our needs. Sure the appliances are not state of the art, but this is a rental unit that tends to get quite a beating. If you call maintenance, they usually address the problem within 24 hours. The only complaint for our room, was that our unit was so close to the pool, you could hear everyone at the pool until closing time & we could hear our upstairs neighbors get up in the early morning. They used to offer once a week clean up, but they no longer offer this, without a fee. If you keep your unit as your home, this should not be too much of an issue. The washer and dryer is handy in the event you want fresh towels and they do offer a "started kit" of garbage bags, detergent, paper towels, tissues, toilet paper & dishwasher soap. This kit was suffice, aside from a few extra garbage bags & a good sponge for the dishes. The East Village is the closest to the Disney resorts and and clear days you could see the fireworks! The West Village Club house has gone through some good renovations and at the time of my stay they were still in renovations and redoing the large West Village Pool. I have 4 kids and they enjoyed the game room, free movie "theater" and free popcorn offered at the clubhouse. Splash Lagoon is a great alternative to the River Island. We only visited River Island once, it was A LOT of fun by VERY crowded. It seems people would come out at 8 AM and reserve lounge chairs. We arrived at 9:30 and saw very slim pickings. The lazy river is a lot of fun, and great for relaxing. The required rental tube (you can't use your own) are $7-10 but that is nothing compared to what you would pay at the water parks. The cabana's at the River Island were overpriced at $100 a day!. Also, we had small items stolen at the River Island pool (sand toys & baby floats).Pool parking at River Island is also hard to find past 11 AM. Splash Lagoon & the smaller East Village Pools are more "family friendly". I would also avoid River Island Units as they are currently constructing new buildings in that area and you can hear construction noise. The front desk staff didn't have a clue on what was going on, event-wise. We got a different answer for everything. Pickup a resort schedule when you check in for resort events. I would definitely come back and recommend to a friend. The resort has good amenities and activities and is a great break from the crowded parks. There is a grocery & pharmacy nearby and we saw a sign for a Super Target arriving soon, across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomwyant
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in the North Village of Orange Lake Resort for Spring Break 2008. Our two bedroom condo in the North Village was absolutely beautiful. It was probably THE best condo we've ever stayed in. The entire resort exceeded our expectations. The food in the restaurants was delicious, the pools and water areas were fantastic, our kids loved the game/aracde room, and my wife enjoyed the fitness room. The location of the resort is great. We were close to everything we had planned to do. Without a doubt, our vacation was four star! We were worried after reading some of the reviews on this site. Honestly, we found nothing but first class accomodations and amenities all the way! In fact, we are already looking forward to our next visit to Orange Lake Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Kids”
Reviews.Author: FLSydney
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at Orange Lake and had a wonderful time. We stayed in a junior suite located in the West Village. The West Village definitely needs updating but the rooms were decent size and we loved having the kitchen with a full size refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher. The box spring on one of the beds was disgusting and looked like it had been involved in a crime scene. The furnishings are quite outdated but hopefully they will address that issue soon. Since we are locals, we chose Orange Lake for the amenities (for my 8 year old son) and they were plentiful. We really enjoyed the game rooms and the pool, waterslides and lazy river at River Island. I did take somebody else's advice and go over early in the morning (8:00 a.m.) to claim our chairs around the pool. The pool area is huge and there is a lot of seating but at 12:00 p.m. it's very difficult to find any empty chairs. We also enjoyed the movie theater and the beach area. We ate at several of the restaurants and the food was very good and reasonably priced. The drinks at the pool bars are a little expensive but you can bring your own cooler to the pool area. We did receive a call each morning for the timeshare tour but we just stopped answering our phone after the first call. We had no problems with check-in and we found the resort staff to be friendly. Overall, I would definitely recommend this resort especially if you can get a room in the north or east village since they have been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice.”
Reviews.Author: tkdmom
Reviews.Content: I'm an RCI member and traded my unit last year for a two bedroom two bath unit in Orange Lake West Villas. We stayed at building 4, Unit 2508 week of March 28th, Fri to Fri check in/out. Here are the plus and minuses: I was going with the assumption that it was going to be miserable and I even warned my family ahead of time that if it was a dive, then we will go back home. I called RCI several times and called Orange Lake several times begging to stay in the Eastside or in the refurbished rooms. Of course, they will not guarantee and say they will put a request in. When we checked in, we were informed from the check in clerk that when you do call Orange Lake, they can put you into a room, of course it will be in West Village but it could be done..especially if you call soon enough even though they say it is up to the checkin people at the resort....Well, we were placed in a refurbished unit. The Bad: Parking is outdoors and the elevators to the unit are in great need of cleaning. Looks like someone spilled dark drinks on the walls and its left there stained. Garbage bins on each floor in front of the elevator is not pleasant to see or smell, especially after a long hot day at the parks and returning home to see that and smell it. Of course, its not like that all the time, sometimes we get lucky and someone on the grounds actually empties it out. Our building was on the third floor of five floors I think and our unit faced 192 which is the main drag to Disney. Its the older section of town back in the day before all the resort style hotels were ever built. I can also compare to Pidgeon Forge, or 441 in Fort Lauderdale..for those of you who may be familiar. Anyway, our building is the first set right when you turn into the resort and at night, you can hear the cars go by, which isn't too bad, but it is bad when the truckers honk their horns early in the morning or all the emergency vehicles that go by, at least once or twice early in the morning. Whoever stayed above us, sounded like they were moving furniture every single night but it soon dies down and then it's pretty quiet. We also faced part of the golf course, so be prepared for maintenance workers working on site at 8 am ..so if you want to sleep in, it's kind of hard. The Good: The Unit is nothing to look at from the outside, but once you walk in, its clearly a different story. Nice long hallway. Master bedroom on the right, with a king size bed and its own bathroom. Nice size bathroom with a jacuzzi tub/shower enclosure. To the left is another small hallway with its own door, that separates the second bedroom which contained two queen size bed, its own flat screen t.v. and out in front, is a bathroom with a tub/shower. The door can be closed giving complete privacy to the second bedroom user. My daughter liked this a lot. Before reaching the second door to the second bedroom, there is a closet which has the stacked washer and dryer. All bathrooms are in dark brown with black granite, nicely decorated aand smelled extremely cleaned and new construction like smell. Kitchen very nice with brand new appliances and brand new kitchen ware. Furniture in the eating area and living room very new and comfortable. It was a pleasure to come home every evening. We thoroughly got lucky and enjoyed our stay. If I could be guaranteed this unit again, I would definately come back. I could see that the one story units looked very old and the furniture was old wicker. Oh, for those that like to drink coffee outside, there was a very large screened in patio which was accessible from the master bedroom as well as the living room area. If you trade your unit, call Orange Lake directly and very sweetly tell them your concern and ask to be placed in the refurbished section..like ours 2580. They can do it, even if they say no guarantee. When I checked in, they said, let's see where they put you because we are at full capacity and I don't think we can change it..so it can be done. 192 traffic can be pretty bad, with bumper to bumper traffic so be patient. It was very hot there this week, but I had a nice time with the family and was so greatful to be placed in a nice unit. If all the units looked like mine, on the inside, it gets gold crown, outside, I would say silver. Hopefully, they will upgrade all the older units for everyone to enjoy. I did not use any of the facilites so I cannot comment on those. I was however, very greatful to be placed so close to the entrance making entering and exiting quite easy as I could so how large this place was. I hope this review helps,

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: vanturner
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived at the resort on 3/23. It is ironic that reading previous reviews said they called the resort ahead of time and asked to reserve a renovated room. We did the same thing and was told that NOONE can request a unit especially being the week of spring break. Upon check-in they said couldn't do that and they would not be able to accomadate our request. Upon entering the unit I was dissappointed. I currently own at three other resorts and this resort fell far short of being what I am used to as quality. Listing the items *shower curtains were moldy, asked to change and it was never changed *had to call the first night for stock in the kitchen, paper towels, dish cloths, dish soap, coffee and filters(there is usually atleast 1 to get you started), Toilet Paper *TV's old and dated- vcr no DVD- Rental for VHS was $4 ugh!!!! *business center rates were OUTRAGEOUS!!!!!!, staff pleasant though *screen doors would not close completely *interior felt old and dirty/ dated We went through the new units that they were selling and I can honestly say that I still was not impressed nice but not up to my standard *all other time shares that I have stayed at before offer a minimal tidying up atleast one day a week. If you want it here it's a charge NICE POOLS but all other amenities pricey it could easily cost a family of five an extra $300-$500 This was my second trip to Florida and If I plan to return I do believe I will go with a Disney Resort

Reviews.Title: “10th Time Here!!”
Reviews.Author: peaceandlovexi3
Reviews.Content: I LOVE ORANGE LAKEE! okay so i am a 16 year old girl and have been coming here for as long as i can remember. I've read some others reviews and they complain but i think they were at a different place because every single time i have been to orange lake its been excellent. it is a great hotel for kids and teens as i always make new friends when i go down there. its only a short distance from disney world and downtown disney and has water slides.!

Reviews.Title: “I was horrified at what my timeshare had turned into”
Reviews.Author: landlordly
Reviews.Content: I exchanged my timeshare from Vistanna Villages and was aghast at what we received in the exchange. I didn't like it because it had no window or door that opened to the outdoors and there was someone underneath us in the morning using a hammer drill. The hallway smelled of sour milk and almost everything was outdated If they had chosen to stick with the seventies theme throughout it might have been better , however, we had no desire to revisit the seventies . They should have told us ahead of time it was the nostalgia suite. We could have stayed in a nicer hotel for the yearly maintainence fee on our timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated Resort”
Reviews.Author: NoCal_0421
Reviews.Content: Stayed at West Village in one of the units that has not yet been remodeled. Shower curtains had mold on them, called the office for replacement that never happened during our week of stay. The pools are beautiful however they charge $7 a day to rent the intertub for the lazy river. Everything had a cost; minature golf, water slide and water tubes. Our unit was suboptimal; vertical blinds hadn't been dusted this century and the unit just looked aged. No DVD player available, only VHS tape player and who even has any more VHS movies? We did find a great airboat ride that my entire family enjoyed. If you are going to aquatica make sure you arrive at 10am when they open. We got there around 1pm and they had already reached their capacity therefore the water park was closed to any more guests. The water park on site was clean and fun, arrive early for pool side seats. Grocery store within 1 mile of resort, Walmart within 3 miles of resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - planning to go back again”
Reviews.Author: LizBrampton
Reviews.Content: We went with friends on their RCI time share exchange to Orange Lake Resort. Our family had originally booked to go last year but my son was hospitalized. I research every destination thoroughly and I knew this place had something for all of us. For the golfers they have 4 golf courses. 2 18 hole and 2 9 hole courses. For the loungers a beautiful pool at River Island - but go early its like the carribean, you have to go really early to reserve your lounge chairs - and bring your own towels - that way people won't remove the resort towels and place their own. A great lazy river for the kids to spend hours playing in. You can get a tube for $10 for a day but the kids don't need it and many people just swam or walked through it. There are 2 waterslides at River Island as well. At very important for the caffine folks - Starbuks. Yup the real thing, coffee and Latte's and cappucinos. We stayed in the East village which backed on to the Arnold Palmer designed course. The condo was wonderful. Very spacious and perfect for 2 familes ( 4 adults and 4 kids). We could walk from our unit to River Island but when we went, we went for the day so we packed snacks etc. The only problem with the East Village is that there is no wireless access. You have to go to River Island or West Village for access. North Village and West Village had basketball courts and tennis courts. Our boys loved using the hoops. West Village had its pool under construction. It will look great once its done. West Village is primarily made up of little bungalows. We thought we were getting a West Village unit because it was an RCI exchange but when we checked in they gave us a unit in East Village without us asking. There are also 2 mini golf areas one at River Island and the other at West Village. The watersports at West Village were closed because the lake was still too cold. We loved it and are planning to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Oasis away from Disney...Just get a refurbished room”
Reviews.Author: lprstn
Reviews.Content: Ok, I was a bit concerned when I traded my timeshare with RCI to this resort, but was keeping my fingers crossed for a refurbished room, and called ahead to validate that request, and it paid off! Best things about resort Amenities galore! New arcade, tons of splash parks, onsite beach, watercraft rentals, close to Disney, but a vacation away from Disney also. Best attractions or restaurants nearby Houlihans!!! Awesome food right nearby. Also pretty good restaurants onsite that offer room service. Review I was placed in the West Village, refurbished section (rm: 2591), and was extremely happy with the room's earth tones and modern design. It was a bit smaller than I have seen, but new appliances and amenities were nice. You walk in and see the breakfast bar, with square benches, the coach is a pullout and they have extra space for eating with a built in dining unit. It doesn't have a separate dining room area, but you don't miss it because of the breakfast bar and built in dining area. The masterbed and livingroom open up onto a large balcony which is screened in. The bathrooms have small tubs that are whirlpool. The Masterbed has a kingsized bed, and the 2nd bedroom has 2 doubles. There is a flat screened tv in the living area which is carpeted. The kitchen had more than enouph for us to cook dinner and breakfast. We went to the parks for 3 days and hung out at the resort for 3 days, to enjoy the beach, the watercraft rentals, the arcade, the golf and putt putt. They also had tons of activities like a carnival, laui, bingo, flag football, golf show and live bands...the kids and I had tons of fun while my husband had to go home to work for 3 days. We even went on a Timeshare tour with them that was non-pressure and easy going...we didn't buy but could see why someone would want to. I was a bit concerned after reading the past few reviews, but as far as the amenities they really are plentiful and enough available for those that don't mind spending extra $$ to enjoy them (like: putt putt, golf, riding water crafts, internet (yep you gotta pay for it). The resort had a great accomadating staff (the time we were there) and services a plenty. I really don't understand why anyone would have to complain about the amenities. It was crowded when we visited ... but we were there during spring break and everyplace was crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Don't unpack!!!”
Reviews.Author: GLUBS
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy doing your own laundry, making your beds, and fighting for extra towels, this is your dream vacation. We are a family of 5. The room was last updated early 80's best, A so called suite that sleeps 5 looked like a hospital emergeny room, with a pull out and 2 beds lined up on a wall in a narrow room. We had to move the kitchen table and stack chairs to pull out the sofa bed. The pull out had no pillow so I called at 11pm for a pillow. I was given linens and told they had no pillows til the morning. Thank god for the throw pillow or else I was out of luck that evening/!! And lets not forget the view of dirt and construction. A total disaster. This is 8 levels down from the Comfort Suites. I actually feel funny rating this a 1 because it is still a positive number!! I repeat, DO NOT BOOK!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: 1AngryLawyer
Reviews.Content: We are owners of several timeshares and exchanged into Orange Lake through RCI. The website shows a lovely 2-BDR condo and lists all amenities and we thought we'd get a condo like the one on the website, especially since we were told that when we booked. However, we were stuck in an old single-story unit with a rotten view, moldy smell, old furniture, a toaster that caught fire (replaced with two different toasters), and a decade-old VHS. Oddly, the resort rents DVDs, but not VHS! Nowhere in Kissimmee are VHS tapes available. Moreover, we were offered the "timeshare tour" and two gifts for our two qualified buyers by the marketing dept in mid-week. However, the tour salesperson -- Greg -- was beyond rude, was extremely evasive regarding timeshare fees, and never provided us with a price for the timeshare! The condo we were shown on tour was the one on the website and when I said this was the condo we should have received, he insisted that we were located in an older unit because they reserve the good condos "only for OUR owners and you're just an exhange." This salesperson didn't even know that the "cinema" in the West Village was gone or that a couple pools were closed! He also demonstrated a remarkable lack of knowledge about wildlife and the Florida environment. Finally, the sales staff insisted only one gift could be given because the marketing dept had only forwarded one name! They refused to contact the marketing department to straighten this out. Talk about "bait and switch." I'm also sending detailed info to the FL Attorney General's office. Do NOT visit this resort!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let The Pictures or 3 1/2 Stars Fool You Too!”
Reviews.Author: Eugie1981
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of price and the pictures seemed nice and safe. The pictures shown on all of the websites are for the vacation rentals and time shares. They are NOT of the "clubhouse" where all of people booking hotel rooms are put. I was there for a 2 night stay, but checked out after one night and ate the $135 loss for my sanity. There is also a $12 per person per day "resort" fee, which I have a hard time understanding what is "resort-like" about this roach motel.
