There were trash bags and dirty bath towels in all of the hallways and an ever present odor of old cigarettes, pets, and mold throughout all of the rooms in the clubhouse. The first room that they put me in had not been cleaned from the previous guests that had stayed there. The hotel staff was nice enough to move me to another room that was cleaned, but it was very hard to tell the difference. I wouldn't even recommend this place to someone who just wants a place to fall asleep at after a long day at the parks or attractions. My advice, next time I'm looking to save money on a hotel...I'm looking to a well established chain. Worst of all, Expedia wouldn't allow my review to be posted. I've learned not to trust the reviews on that website because all of the ones prior to my visit were positive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Klops3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very apprehensive, having read some bad reviews over the past year. But, in a nutshell, the 1 week stay, with our grown children and 2 grandboys, was EXCEPTIONALLY good. Seven of us were in unit 2520 and I've concluded that the West Village "2500" units are all rennovated and our 2BR was outstanding -- sparkling clean, spacious, upgraded with beautiful new furnishings, appliances, floor coverings and decor (even a new large flat-screen HDTV). Everything in the kitchen and bathrooms was brand new- the countertops, sinks, faucets, etc.! These units are just inside the main gate; however, they overlook the golf course and the highway noise was not a problem. This turned out to be a bonus for us because we were in and out of the resort so much and didn't have to drive far to our unit. One of the pools (good for kids) was just across the parking lot. We booked thru RCI and all RCI guests get the West Village...not a problem, but I'd suggest you call the resort about 10 days ahead and kindly request an assignment to the "2500 units". They are in the process of upgrading West Village (the oldest area) and have started at the front. Then tell them to put a note on the assignment "do not move". If the clerk will do it, you've got it made!! The staff was extremely competent, friendly and helpful. Check-in (20-30 min. during prime time) and express check-out (instant) was efficiently handled. My wife left a clutch purse (containing 2 pr. glasses and a watch)at one of the pools and 2 days later checked at the Island Trader in the River Village to see if it had been turned in. The very helpful staff gal (sorry I didn't get her name) actually remembered seeing this clutch purse in the Sun Shop at the North Village! She was given permission by her boss, Cynthia, to leave her post of duty and meet me at that shop, along with a security person, and unlock it since it had closed for the day! My wife met them there and, sure enough, there was the clutch purse with all its contents! This is going beyond the call of duty as far as I'm concerned!!! All the staff was outstanding. We did have to call for linens for the sofa bed, but they accommodated that immediately and called back the next day to double-check. The phone did ring each morning but we took the phone off the hook at night, having been warned about a Timeshare talk. At check-in, there was no real push for a Timeshare presentation after I politely told them No Thanks. A car is needed to get to the River Island, etc. and the other pools which are also great for kids. The grounds are beautiful and clean. There are plenty of restaurants within 2 miles right outside the gate and the resort is only 10 minutes to all the Disney parks. Do not be alarmed about bad reviews, if you can get an updated West Village unit. We wish we would have had more time to spend at the resort but our reason for being there was to go to Disney which we did on 5 days. We did spend one lovely day at River Island pool (loved the lazy river-just resign to the fact that the float tubes have to be rented; our grandkids were too small for the slides) and North Village pool- great for kids. The only restaurant we ate at was the Legacy Grill in the East Village and the food was very good. The Publix on-ground is handy and quick but we drove to Super Wal-Mart to get the bulk of our groceries for better prices. Houlihan's across the street, next to McDonald's, has a great breakfast buffet for $5.99. Please do not hesitate to stay at this outstanding resort... we were sorry when it was time to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake-West Village, 2 Thumbs Up!!”
Reviews.Author: Momof3GrandBlanc_MI
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed in the dreaded west village at Orange Lake for 6 days. I was pleasantly relieved to open the door of our one-story duplex to a completely renovated 2 bedroom villa. Everything was clean and appeared to be brand new. It was great to be able to park right outside our door. We also loved the large patio that overlooked the golf course. The pool complexes are first rate. Splash lagoon is a bit less impressive but far less crowded than River Island where it was almost impossible to get a lounge chair after 9:30-10:00 AM and very hard to keep track of your kids due to the spread out nature of the design. The smaller pools scattered throughout the property and also very nice and much warmer. A new family pool complex is also under way at the West Village. The property itself is beautiful and well-maintained. You really do need a car, although the shuttle buses did seem to come by every 20-30 minutes. The only negative was the lack of customer service. I was the only one checking in and it did take almost 30 minutes, 3 customer service reps. and 2 computers to complete the job. It seems very few have actually been trained. The fellow who was finally able to quickly check me in didn't want to give me any info about the property, handing me a map instead. All in all it was a great stay and we would definately go back. You can't beat the spacious villas. Even with renting a car it was still cheaper than 1 cramped traditional room at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastGirl1
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week at the West Village #2091. Check in was slow as mentioned, but it is in the newly renovated clubhouse .. the trailer was gone. I was very apprehensive due to the negative reviews, but I think most of the West Village has been renovated now. We didn't have granite counters as was previously mentioned, but out counters were clean. The draperies and carpet looked pretty new. I'm pretty sure the beds were not new .. they squeeked when you got into bed. But, I still slept pretty well even though the pillows were small and hard. I enjoyed the West Village units because you have a large outside patio that is not screened in. The only thing missing was a grill. We did receive a few requests to attend the sales meeting, but we graciously declined each time. My husband played golf every day and enjoyed all the courses. The property is huge and you cannot walk to places. But there is a shuttle that operates every 20 min from 7 am until 11 pm. It makes a circle around the resort. We spent our week at the River Island Pool which is large and has plenty of lounge chairs. People do start placing items on the chairs EARLY. One day I dropped my husband off at golf at 7 am and walked through the pool area and there were already towels on some of the chairs. Do not fret about staying the the West Village, they are very adequate and clean. Email me with any questions. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cpjc
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a one-bedroom suite at River Island for 10 days. We had no wait or trouble at check-in and only received one call for the tour the entire stay. We booked RI after reading mixed reviews about West Village and are glad we spent the extra money. We had a great room with a full kitchen and a washer and dryer which, although very noisy, came in handy for small loads every day. Bathroom counter area was small. The best part was walking down the stairs and through the gate and we were at the pool/lazy river in less than a minute. We did notice may people driving from other villages to RI which we would not want to do. I am a runner and ran around the whole complex numerous times and all the areas were beautiful and very well maintained. We rented a car and got around very easily to the Disney parks. One of the greatest money-savers for us was the Publix grocery store on-site. It has absolutely everything you could possibly need and more. We bought groceries and ate breakfast every morning in our room and lunch most days as well before we went to the parks. This and the large suite made us feel much more at home than a regular hotel room. We don't care for much interaction with staff or other guests when we travel so we found this very comfortable. As other reviewers have said, there is plenty to do and you could spend your entire time there with your family and not even go to the parks. They even have Starbucks on site. The "fast food" from Anchors was quite good quality. We ate at the Legacy Grille one night and the food wasn't exciting or inexpensive so we ate dinners at the parks or off-site for the rest of our stay - many restaurants within a 5 minute drive. One staff member did tell us that they are building two more buildings at RI over the next couple of years which we could see are very close to the current building. I'm not sure if they've started yet, but it will be very noisy I'm sure so be sure to ask before booking and stay at the other end of the building. Overall, an excellent stay. It's been almost a year since we stayed and my 6 year old still asks almost daily when we are going back. That's the best stamp of approval.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here”
Reviews.Author: bighachi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the East Village from Feb 22 to 29, 2008. We had a great time and found the room to be in excellent shape. A couple of the appliances were a bit used but they still worked fine. Overall the room was very clean and appeared to be in good repair. To comment on some of the other reviews: The resort is definately huge. We never did see the actual lake on the property. The East village is within a mile of the River City water park/shops and can be easily walked. There are sidewalks throughout the property. It would be a hike to get to the West Village from the East however. Someone commented that it was hard to get to due to traffic. Anything on 192 in Kissimmee is hard to get to due to traffic. Particularly when the theme parks are letting out. Orange Lake is on the less congested side of 192 and has easy access to I-4 and route 27 within a few miles. We opted out of the sales meeting breakfast. We were not contacted again during the course of the week by anyone on the staff. There were phone messages left about resort activities not none were sales pitches. I will say that the resort nickle and dimes you. The Lazy River floats are $7 for one and $10 for a double for the day. Mini Golf is $10 a head although you can get a family pass good for a week of mini golf for $40. The Treasure Cove arcade is expensive with most games costing nearly $1 to play. They do it with points on a card so you get 50 points for $1 and then the games cost anywhere from 38 to 80 something points to play. Most were 42 points. Overall it was a great stay. The rooms were quiet and we did not hear any activity from our neighbors through the walls, above or below. I would go here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Some Concerns”
Reviews.Author: mv200110
Reviews.Content: We spend a week at Orange Lake. At first we were concerned with the number of negative comments however overall we had a good time. We stayed in the North Village which we were happy about because of all the negative comments about the West Village. Our unit was clean, however needed some minor repairs: the fan in one bathroom did not work, an outlet cover in the kitchen was off and the cover on the bottom of the refrigerator fell off. The third day of our stay, we woke up to find the back window of our van broken out. Nothing was stolen out of our vehicle. We contacted security. Someone came out and took a report, stated they would send someone to clean up the glass and provided us two names of window repair companies. No one showed up to clean up the glass, we sweep it up ourselves, one of the phone numbers provided to us was disconnected. We found our own repair service in the phone book. We never heard or seen anyone else from the resort for the rest of the trip. There was no follow up. This was disppointing. I called and left a message for the manager on duty expressing my displeasure on how the situation was handled but never heard back. We are not sure if it was a golf ball or a random act of vandalism. We lost a whole day of our vacation dealing with the situation. On another note, called for a new iron as ours was broken, received quick response.

Reviews.Title: “Simply horrible”
Reviews.Author: lauren0511
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I bought a week at Orange Lake from a co-worker. I read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor and was concerned, but the price was good so we decided to take a chance...What a terrible mistake. The resort is very difficult to get to in that the route here involves continuous traffic jams. Orange Lake is a very large property and to get anywhere, you really need a car...there is shuttle service available, but the waits are long... They have two sit down restaurants. Both truly have good fresh food, but I have never experienced service so poor in nature. No reservations allowed, so you always have to wait for a table. Service is slow and very often you get your main coarse before your apetizer..If you are at the pools and want a drink from the pool bar, be prepared to wait at least 20 minutes in a very long line... We signed up for the "1 hour" timeshare presentation...took 2 1/2 hours... I will NEVER stay in a timeshare property again. I will say that this resort is very pretty...and the pools are nice...but while they will tell you Walt Disney World is only 3 miles away, the traffic makes it a 20 minute drive... Next time I come to Orlando, I will be staying at a resort that specializes in service and nice amenities...!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous holidays - go every 1-2 years”
Reviews.Author: Nicola1301
Reviews.Content: I have been to Orange Lake Country Club on 4 occasions and every time I must say I have never had a complaint. My family and I usually go ever 2 years in early September and are going this year and next (my parents go every year). The only thing that isnt always the best is the weather!!!! We stay in the tennis village which looks onto one of the golf courses. The rooms are always immaculate and the staff cant do enough for you. The complex is huge and you can use whichever pool you want and come and go as you please. We dont eat in the complex due to us all loving the restaurants in orlando so I cant comment on the food. But we have always had a fabulous time at Orange Lake. Looking forward to going this year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: OhioGrandma4
Reviews.Content: I had read so many bad reviews after we booked our vacation at OLCC that I was worried sick. We went with Our grown childrenand their families, which also included 2 2yr olds and 2 new babies, all I could think of is all the money they had spent on airfare and rental cars and what if I had booked us at a place they would be disappointed in. We checked in and went to our rooms and were very pleased. The rooms were clean and Beautifully decorated. The Pools were all very clean and beautifully lanscaped, with slides, waterfalls, rain features. Yes you pretty much had to drive down to the pool from our rooms, but it didn't bother us. We played putt putt in the evenings it cost us I believe 25.00 per family for the entire week. The lazy river is what our older children like the best, but for the little ones it was the slides. It was just sooo pretty there. My son-in-laws both called their Mothers and told them it was the nicest place they had ever stayed, and one of them has stayed alot of nice places, in Hawaii, California, Hilton Head and who knows where else. A cousin to one of them stayed with us, and her family travels all over the world, and she called her Mom and told her even they had never stayed at a place this neat. We are planning another vacation and the kids keep telling me that orange county will be tough to beat. We had tickets to Disney, and they only wanted to go one day,they said there was too much to do at the resort. (They were fre or we would have used them) Needless to say I worried for nothing. P.S. There was a Grocery store right at one of the entrances to the resort. The only negative things about the trip were the Heat (but the pools helped that) and watching the airline workers throwing the baby strollers and car seats off the plane onto the ground and then bouncing them up the steps to us.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: greencozmo
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort, to try something new. After reading several reviews I was a bit concerned. We traded our timeshare and made arrangements through RCI. One week before we were to arrive the resort phoned to confirm our reservation. The person I spoke with told me we would be staying in the East Village; however when we arrived the front desk said no way. The gentleman assured me we would be in a "Newly refurbished" West village unit. The check in process was very quick, I was concerned because I had heard this was a lengthy process. We told them we would not attend there "FREE" breakfast and he pushed for us to go (claiming this is how he makes his money), we simply stated no. Upon arrival at our unit there was a huge bag of trash on our doorstep. I phoned the front desk and told them I wanted it removed immediately. The room was not refurbished...simply repainted, but still very outdated. When we went to use the shower in the master bath the lever that closes the drain so you may have a bath instead was broken and wouldn't drain, consequently all four of us had to use one shower, it took them a few days to repair this. The shower itself had mold on the grout and on the actual shower curtain ( I felt as if I needed another shower) yuch! I woke up the next morning to find the same bag of trash on my front porch, I phoned the front desk to let them know. We left for the entire day and it was finally gone when we returned. The front door had a huge gap around the entire door, when the landscapers came by they would blow the lawn clippings right under and into the unit. The pots and pans were falling apart, the screws were loose on the handles, we asked the handyman who came to fix the shower for a screwdriver and fixed the pots ourselves. The sheets were however clean, that was a nice touch. Don't even think about miniature golf there it was $10.00 a person and definitely not worth it. The pool was clean, there towels are like sandpaper, bring your own beach towel. The water was not that warm at this time of the year, but the jacuzzi was nice. The restaurants were decent, our favorite was the pizza place inside the Marketplace (it always appears to be closed, I think the lighting is bad there), but very nice little place to grab something quick. Overall we will not return to Orange lakes, but it is always nice to try something different when you travel. There is no customer service either so if you go with low expectations you can't lose. We did not receive harrassing phone calls either for any presentations.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in a studio/junior suite”
Reviews.Author: braunco
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the basement. It was musty and dingy with no access to outside air. Not what I expect for the price. A motel down the road would be better, and cheaper. We got our phone call for a timeshare meeting at 10:15 pm, while our 3 year old was sleeping. Our next phone call came at 8:30 the following morning. I told her what I thought of the room and no one called us again. We certainly won't be calling them again. These rooms are unfit for occupancy. We will not book though Expedia again, they must not be aware of what kind of rooms they are selling.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SaritaKay
Reviews.Content: I have rented a unit at Orange Lake for the past 7 years. I am not an owner. I have stayed at other timeshare resorts in Orlando as well. None compare to Orange Lake. They have every amenity. I can't believe the negative feedback. I have stayed in the West, North and East Villages. I like the West Village the most! The units are clean and convienient. I have travelled with my family with anywhere from 4-15 people. The pools are clean. My only complaint would be that they charge you a fee to rent a tube at River Island and you can't use you own. BUT, My whole family when to OL and my mom left $1500 in cash in the unit!!! Yes, stupid, I know. I saw her panicked looked after she realized it a day later! We had checked into another unit! We went back to guest services. To our surprise the MAID TURNED IN EVERY PENNY!!!! THIS SPEAKS VOLUMES OF THEIR INTEGRITY!!! In my book, this is more important than any petty complaints. P.S. we rewarded the maid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amenities Additional Charge; Unhappy Service”
Reviews.Author: Seavair
Reviews.Content: First impressions linger poorly after an extremely long line at check-in reveals a staff agressively pushing a timeshare tour disguised as a "free welcome breakfast" . As you politely accept, you are asked for a credit card to be charged a "reservation fee" of $20 that will be refunded once you attend the breakfast. You leave the check-in experience feeling dooped and trapped. When we had to wait for our room, I asked several of the staff where we should go to wait. Not one recommended an onsite restaurant. I asked how to access the interenet cafe one floor below with my stroller and three different staff didn't know. I finally found out that I had to leave the lobby and use a service elevator that went through a laundry area to get to the cafe that charged me $9 to use the internet. The rooms are fine... relatively clean (we had someone come in to spray the red ants), large, and sparingly appointed with a few pouches of dishwasher soap and liquid dish soap. Most rooms, however, are far enough away from pools and amenities that driving is required. This was quite a surprise to our vacationing family with three children. It was suggested that we either rent a car to move around the complex, or that we walk to various pick up areas where a shuttle would take us to the pool area and back at a fairly regular schedule. We complained that we needed to be nearer to a pool, and were ultimately moved to an area close to a small back pool that we could access by foot, after we were told that any rooms near to the main pool area were full. I was surprised to find no written information in the room describing the resort and it's services...... NOTHING. We had to call restaurants to inquire about their menu, call the mini golf to find out their hours, call the main desk to ask about trash service and directions to the closest grocery store. The few resort restaurants have good food but very poor service. We could hear the staff loudly complaining about the management and about the menu prices to each other as we ate our meal. Our waiter leaned on our table as we asked for another drink, complaining that the price of wine had been increased without him being notified...."That's what I love about Orange Lake," he sneered. At a different restaurant, night two, our waitress told us her life story in between taking our order... answered requests with.."YUP".. as she continued to walk by, never asked if we needed anything, forgot to bring us our requested second round of drinks, and threw away the left overs we asked to have wrapped up. As we left a restaurant, a new employee was leaving at the same time, asking other employees about signing out.... "I know they want us to, but I never do....just call in a time tomorrow." I wondered what was up with the management that had produced such poor service and such poor attitudes! The amenities at the resort are all an additional charge. The use of the mini golf,.... the large balloon slide,... even the lazy river all come at an additional fee, leaving a visitor feeling taken advantage of. The golf area of the resort is beautiful and very well maintained. I wonder if retired golfers are really their demographic, and the rest of the vacationers are not. There is no shuttle to Disney from the resort. As our week progressed, first impressions faded. We ate off site, we spent time at the pool, we played mini golf, we drove to Disney, and we enjoyed our time together.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start .”
Reviews.Author: dublin4
Reviews.Content: When will timeshare resorts realise that trapping guests at check in and insisting that they attend 'free' breakfasts' with 'no obligation' and persisting with their salestalk no matter how much the visitors insists that they have no interest nor intention of buying, simply alienates and colours the first impression of any resort. Without any sign of our consent ,after a excruciatingly long pitch, we were informed that breakfast had been booked for us at 10.30 the next morning and then, unbelievably, we were asked for $20 cash each to hold the reservation. Beyond belief! We have owned timeshare in Europe and in Florida for over 15 years and , despite much adverse publicity, it has worked well for us.It is the sales techniques, such as those displayed at OLCC, that give timeshare a bad name. We were in the west Village..obviously the original part nearly 20 years old and it seems that they are, only now, renovating the place. Mostly small bungalows, we were allocated a 'wonderful duplex unit' which in fact turned out to be in an 80's style block of flats. We discovered we were very fortunate that our allocated unit was one that had been renovated, although in dull, dark sensible colours and still with the old ginger settee from many years ago.We were glad that being only 3 , we did not need it as an extra bed. The units are a good size and well equiped with the usual washer/dryer , dishwasher etc found in most resorts of this category'.The small pool nearby was badly in need of work and the public restrooms were rusted and sad. The much glamorised lazy river had floats for rent at $7 and is overlooked by an enormous building site with all the dirt and noise that comes with that.This resort constantly chases the buck. Internet access was in a room about 15 minutes drive away and available at $5.50 per half an hour. Surely in this day and age broadband should be available as a service in each unit.Certainly we have found this to be so in most other modern resorts.We used Kinko. The resorts is at the end of the 192 and about 5 miles from the entrance road to Disney. Apart from that it is far too far away from other parks..Sea World Universal, Wet & Wild...or shopping centres. I don't deny that our initial experience at check in coloured our view of OLCC but, for many reasons, I would never stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “RESORT GREAT- Transportation Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: MCGOFDK07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at River islands. The rooms were beautiful, spacious and well kept, the supplies were enough for a family of 4. Our limo company offered a 30 minute gorcery stop which helped. Checking in was quite a hassle but this was before the newly constructed registration area was open. This opened while we were there and it is beautiful and the lines looked short. There were plenty of customer service employees available the day we stopped by. The only complaint is the transportation. The shuttles are not marked so your not sure which shuttle to get on as to where you want to go. The down size or the lack of transporation vs. a park resort is you have to pay for transportation either car rental, not cheap in FL or pay for a shuttle to go anywhere other than the resort vs. complimentary. Ample pool chairs at the pool, golf courses are gorgeous and well groomed. My husband said they are challenging yet fun. Also we had a challenge with the consistency of the answers we received from employees as to how to get around. If compimentary transportation to the parks was available this would be a 5 star resort for any family looking to vacation in Orlando area. Right now it is expensive with the additional cost you incure to get around.

Reviews.Title: “a GOOD West Village Review”
Reviews.Author: wolfeontherun
Reviews.Content: I read bad reviews for months before our vacation. I became so anxious about the trip that I almost canceled. I wanted sooo bad to read ONE good review about the West Village!! Well, here it is. We stayed in the club house at the West Village, and had a WONDERFUL time! The room was nice. It was not dirty, and had enough room for the four adults on our trip. We did luck up and get a room with an outside view, so that was nice. We had such a great time, that we are already planning our next trip! The resort is wonderful. The lazy river is a blast!!! So, to sum it up.... We had a very good experience AT THE WEST VILLAGE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: motherof10
Reviews.Content: We booked through RCI and were placed in the West Village Tennis Villas. Which were clean very nice and spacious. They were also well decortated and we could see the Disney fireworks from our balcony at night. I read some of the reviews of this place especially the West Village I was really scared but very pleasantly surprised. There was a lot to do and the pools were very nice. We also found a nice restaraunt called Houlahans right down the road great food and great prices an extensive wine list. Over all this was a really nice place. Do not believe everything you read.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience if you unplug the phones”
Reviews.Author: MN1971
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to explore Orlando and its attractions with your family. We stayed in a brand new 3 bed/3bath unit at East Village. The resort is located only 5 miles from Disney and it is very convenient. However, remember to unplug all the phones you have in your unit. During my 5 nights stay there I got a call every morning at 8:30AM from the staff people offering me tickets with discount and inviting me for a "free" breakfast. What that means is once you are there they will do whatever they can to sell you a time-share in the resort. Thus, if you want to rest and not have inappropriate wake-up calls remember to unplug the phones. Other than that, there is no better place to stay with your family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: juni0r
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Orange Lake in Dec. 2007. I had booked this resort for a group of 8 adults on a golf trip. This is a time share resort. This place is great if you are going on a golf vacation. The units are huge. We had a two bedroom condo - one bedroom had a king, the other bedroom had two queens and there was a queen pull out. Each of the rooms had a TV. Full kitchen - even the utensils were included. Room had a washer/dryer. Balcony overlooked one of the 4 golf courses on site. Pool area looked great. There is also a water park at the resort. This resort would be great for a family. You could literally stay at the resort all week long if you wanted to. There is mini golf for the kids, water slides, 4-5 restaurants/bars, tennis, etc. I also noticed that the resorted posted a daily activity agenda, and it seemed that there were plenty of things for families to do. As I said, this is a timeshare resort. Upon check in I was asked if I was interested in a presentation, to which I declined. The staff were very polite and thanked me. I was not pressured at all. The resort in right on #192 in Kissimmee, just a couple of miles west of I-4. it is about 10 minute drive to the Walt Disney property - great location. I am planning on returning to Orlando very soon, and I will make Orange Lake my first choice, for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2007 at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: PurdueBEK
Reviews.Content: My family (me, wife and 2 kids aged 12 & 16) stayed at Orange Lake Resort during Christmas 2007 and found it to be a great place to stay - I traded a timeshare week. I had read the Travel reviews prior to leaving, which recommended avoiding the West Village. We called in advance to request not to be put there but were told we could not prearrange this. Fortunately, we were placed in a 2 bedroom unit in the East Village and found the accomodations to be really quaint & nice!! We arrived at the Orange Lake Resort (drove in from NC) at around 1 PM and had to stand in a bothersome line to wait to register - an employee gleefully said if we were "owners" the wait would be minimal. After about a 45-60 minute process we were told the room would be ready after 4PM so we headed off to Epcot (I had ordered our 7-day park hopper passes well in advance and had them on-hand). BTW - they are renovating the reception/check-in area (located in West Village) so I was glad to not be staying in their. The assistance about Disney from the service counter was very good and helped during the registration delay! Unfortunately, when we went back arounfd 10PM to get our room keys we had to wait in a line again (no express for those already checked in). East Village is very nice. We were on the 6th floor overlooking the golf-course. The unit had two bedrooms, two bathrooms (MBR had a nice whirlpool bath), a large kitchen with eat at counter, living room and dining area, plus a screened in porch. Also, East Village was nicely located as there was a seperate entrance/exit that was closer to Disney on 192 . We were typically not at the resort much except Christmas morning - we took a small Christmas tree and decorations and some presents and spent a couple of hours in the suite doing Christmas and breakfast. Disney World was great...so beautifully decorated. Even though the parks were busy we never felt crowded except when a main event was happening (like the parades or fireworks). We thoroughly enjoyed using the fast-pass system, which tremendously helped us plan our days. Highlights were Cirque Du Soleih, which was unbelievable as was the Candlelight choir at Epcot and the Harlem Choir at MGM. We also took tme to tour Disney's top 4 resorts and had a reasonably priced great lunch at the Floridian (gorgeous!!) Overall, we had a great time at Orange Lake and Disney and hope to go back someday with grandchildren. ALSO, the calls about timeshare were NEVER an issue...no pressure! Liked — Room & view Disliked — Registration and getting keys

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WestPalmBeachDgp
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom unit through a travel website. The unit we were given was an older unit and did not match the photos online. The large pool complex was about a mile away in a newer development - these are the photos you see online. While the unit was not what we expected it would have been OK except the heavy smell of smoke. At first we thought the place just needed to air out, but the smell just seemed to get stronger. It permeated all our clothes. The entire complex is supposed to be non-smoking and they charge a $250 fee for smoking in the rooms. Apparently, they don't spend any of it to clean up the room. The complex is convenient to Disney World and it's easy to get on I-4 and head anywhere on the west side of Orlando (where all the tourist parks are located). The kitchen is stocked with untensils, pots, pans, plates, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: jeffk410
Reviews.Content: There was 5 of us and we booked a trip and this time were in the middle ,but techinically in west village. This is not my first time staying their since we own a timeshare. East village is great ,but what is most unbelievable is River Island where we will stray come feburary 08. The River Island amentites are great the pools are unbelievable the food at the river island grilling company is also really good. It even has wi fi internet access( for a fee which i did not like) and starbucks coffee. West village is still nice ,but whats even better is they are in the process of redoing the whole thing! Orange lake is re doing all of the west village which will make the resort perfect by the end of 08. Everything about the place is great and fun filled. The only negative are the timeshare tours they are always longer then they say. The pools are all great the golf courses are in good condition. It is a secured facility. There is so many amentities that we go to disney 3 days and stay at the resort the others. The hottubs in river island are both huge and relaxing. We go during feburary vacation every year so its very packed ,but if you want a nice relaxing time go to river island at night since all of the kids are gone. This resort is great for anyone and has something for everyone. The interrior of the villas are both spacious and clean. i couild not be happier with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Callpage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from Dec 16 through Dec 23 in the River Island section and booked this through RCI. If you can get GPS with your rental car or bring a portable one along, we did and it made all the difference. We made the mistake of arriving at night, check in is at a temporary location in West Village due to construction. We were expecting this because Orange Lake called up prior to arrival to let us know, which was appreciated. West Village and River Island are divided by a highway, so once you check in you have to go back out of one section past the highway and turn into a vaguely marked area to get to River Island, not so fun/easy in the dark. We followed the sign to River Island but it took us the long way around to the condos which were marked 81000. Our condo was 81502, no building marked as such. We decided to see what was inside 81000 and once inside learned 81502 was in fact located in that building on the fifth floor. The 2 bedroom condo was clean, with a good view of River Island. No complaints on the condo or River Island. On Monday evening, the televisions suddenly stopped working. Called the front desk, maintenance, all the numbers for the resort and just got a busy signal. Since we wanted to see Monday Night Football, we went to the Legends Lounge, they had dish network and learned that all the cable in the resort had gone out. Would have liked to hear from someone at the Front Desk or from a recording. Had a great time with my 13 yr old son using the pool area and arcade. We ate at River Island Grilling, the food was delicious, the service was very slow, we were one of three families in the restaurant and it took 30 minutes to get our sandwiches. The Connections Lounge/computers etc. personnel were very friendly and helpful. They are putting up another building next to the River Island condos so it was quite noisy for most of the day, we only noticed for one day because we were at the parks most of the time. We were told we wouldn't have any maid service and returned back one day to find that our room was serviced and we left everything out, fortunately nothing was taken but dirty pillowcases were left on our son's bed. Went to the timeshare presentation, which was only supposed to be an hour was closer to 2 hours but the discounted tickets were worth it because I really know how to say "no thanks". Even though we are already owners at another resort, they tried to give the hard sell and actually told a few lies. If we weren't already owners, we might have fallen for it. I would pass the resort shuttle service. My hubby golfed at Legends (this was the only course open which we didn't find out until he called from home to make a tee time. If you are considering using the courses, call ahead to check on course availability) and was told by three separate shuttles they weren't going to River Island, so it was a long wait. The resort is so large that you would need to rely on the shuttle or drive to other Villages. We were so busy with the parks that we didn't so back to the West Village side. I heard there are tennis courts, basketball courts and a beach area but after a day at the parks, we just didn't feel like driving back over to the West Village. The Publix supermarket is close to River Island, not walking distance, they had a good selection, nice fresh sushi area and deli, the prices were similar to Los Angeles prices, no big difference. As we were packing to leave at 7:30am, check out is at 10am, Housekeeping rang our doorbell to ask what time we were checking out, I mentioned that since check out is at 10am, we would be checking out at 10am. We have been to quite a few places and have never had Housekeeping inquire about our departure, that was really the last straw. We won't be returning to Orange Lake, there are too many resorts in the Kissimmee/Orlando area to put up with mediocrity. We have stayed at Vistana Resorts and Hilton Grand Vacations Resort and both were better on all counts.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping stole my son's necklace”
Reviews.Author: truthfully_86
Reviews.Content: We were there for 2 weeks, the start of our 2nd week we were told housekeeping was going to change our beds and tidy up on sunday,we locked up our belongings, they did not show up. then monday there was a bag of sheets outside our door, we brought them in figured that at least they gave us clean sheets and towles. they did not call to tell us that housekeeping was entering our room. that morning we left my 6 year old sons gold necklace( from his baptism) under the comforter because we made our beds every day. they entered and re did the beds with the new sheets and insted of leaving the necklace on the night stand they took it. well sorry it magically disapeared. we called housekeeping they said they did not do the laundry and they will keep a look out. called and reported to the police, orange co. and they said they get a lot of calls about missing items and no one is to blame (no proof) after going to management, security, front desk, exc.dept, and more , follow up is not in their nature. every time i called i got the run around. still 2 mo. later no phone call, letter, nothing. I just tell my son some people are bad, don't cry, don't steal, most of all get a job as a housekeeper at orange lake resort because you can steal from the travelers and get away with it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious, Great Location, Helpful, but.....”
Reviews.Author: HumpheryFamily
Reviews.Content: In our party...Grandma, Grandad, Mummy, Daddy, Three year old & 10month old Booked through RCI Everything was as we expected within the accomodation it was spacious, clean & very private. We had a two bedroom (one room had one king bed the other with two king beds & the lounge had a sofa bed) two bathroom unit with fully equipped kitchen dinning room & terrace with lawn area it was unit 2423 in West Village. It was great however the Lazy River complex is promoted & the perception given is that it is big & beautiful, it's not very big at all! We went in mid-Nov & it was very quiet we consequently had a lovely time playng in the water etc however I'd hate to go in a busy time as there just isn't enought to do; it actually states pool capacity is 46 this is for the pool with the only water slide which is very short (approx 20ft) yet there are approx 200+ sunbeds around the area - even with it being very quiet the children (ours included) were heading for the slide & due to the lack of any lifeguard some children & their adult compaions were being very stupid & standing up on each other & surfing - this doesn't help when you're explaining to a three year old how to play-safely. The whole resort is immaculate it looks like a pretty film set & is pleasant & welcoming. We brought our Disney tickets using the offer promoted to us that if we went to a one hour talk we'd get the discount, we weighed it up & decided to attend however wished we hadn't bothered not only did they waffle on for too long,(3 hours+) it was a very hard sell & ended with the salesman insulting my father & basicaly because we had no intention of purchasing becuase we own a timeshare locally in the UK (where we use the sports facitlites all year) they were really rude. It put a big dampener on the day & ruined our pleasant perception of the place. We had stayed at Orange Lake about fifteen years ago & it was actualy better then as it seems they have got too big & although efficient at their job they have lost the personal touch - you are just another punter they hope to sell a timeshare to. Location is great for getting to the attractions. Another point is we hired our cars from Dollar at the airport, if there is a big que when you get to the rental desk, go across to the other terminal, we hired a trolley boy & he was worth his weight in gold; on his advise we changed terminals to a Dollar desk with no que we would have had to wait approx two hours in the original que. Also we needed two car seats, we hired them from Dollar for one night then went to Walmart & brought two to use for the duration of the hoiday it was far cheaper than hire & we just gave them away at the airport on the way home. Overall we had a fantatic time. Happy Holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTravelMama
Reviews.Content: We exchanged 2 weeks for 2 two-bedroom units (we brought my parents along). Since we booked through RCI we knew we were going to be staying in the West Village. I emailed and called to request the North Village if possible. Upon check-in we were given a unit in the west village. We explained to the girl that we have a 3 and 5 year old and would like to stay in the North Village near the pool. She asked if we would rather have 2 units together in the West or separate in the North. After seeing the construction in the West Village and by the looks of the outside of the units I decided that we should go for being away from my parents in the North Village. It turns out she found 2 units next to one another in the North anyway. Once the West Village is renovated I'm sure it will be nice but right now it is all torn up. The pool is not very nice (also not heated) and there is no swimming aloud at the beach. The North Village was amazing. Our rooms were great, right on the golf course and a nice screened in porch. The pools in the North Village are perfect for families with young children. We also had a great time in the Lazy River at River Island. The resort is big and you have to drive most places. Definitely request a room close to the pool if you plan to do a lot of swimming. Disney is also easy to get to, only a 10 minute drive. Having a 7 day Disney Pass we found it hard to decide which we'd rather do, stay the day at Disney or go back to the resort. The kids almost always said lets go back and go swimming. They called us twice to ask if we would come to a sales presentation. First they offered us $50 then it went up to $80. We politely declined and they were fine with that. Overall, I'd say Orange Lake is an excellent vacation destination and we will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Bulling the sale”
Reviews.Author: Valgus
Reviews.Content: They have what they call a "Water Park" and it's just a small lazy river with one blowup game, that's all. They called me every day very early in the morning trying to take me to their sale presentations. I had to keep my phone disconnected and hide.......................

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a positive experience.”
Reviews.Author: Javidtyo
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and our 3 boys ages 4,3, and 17 months used my fathers timeshare exchange for this unit. A month before we were due to arrive I contacted the resort and requested a unit in the East vilage. They said they would put in a request for us but couldn't guarantee anything. When we checked in we were indeed put in and East village unit. The unit itself was nice. The view from the balcony was spectacular. We could see the golf course and at night we could see the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom, Epcot, and MGM (from the Fantasmic show). We did have a problem with housekeeping. We had brought our pack n play from home for our 17 month old to sleep in and on our second day there we went to Magic Kingdom. When we returned that night our pack n play was gone along with our babies blanket. Nothing else had been done to the condo so I don't know why housekeeping was even there. Nothing else was missing so we assumed this was a mistake and that housekeeping thought the pack n play belonged to the resort but I still don't know why they took the blanket. We called the front desk and told them about it. They sent us a resort pack n play to use that night since no one was there at the time that could help us. When returned the next night the blanket was back but our pack n play was still missing. They did eventually figure everything out and we got it back a few days later. Still...we don't know why they were in our unit that day in the first place. Overall...the place is beautiful. It is huge though. We didn't do any swimming or dining at the resort so I can't comment on that. All in all it was a decent stay...with my favorite part being the view. But considering that housekeeping was in our unit on a day they shouldn't have been and they took our personal items...I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: karenshriver
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place to stay! Our 8 year old daughter decided that we would be back to visit, because it is "paradise." We loved the pools and the hammocks! The hayride and marshmallow roast were also charming. Orange Lake is near everything, including the Disney Parks and shopping. The people who work there were friendly. The weather was perfect! It was a great vacation! We stayed in the West Village. Before we left for our trip, we were told that the West Village was old and run down. Not true...it has been remodled and is a great place to stay. The appliances seemed to have some age on them, but they all worked. We will certainly be visiting Orange Lake, again!

Reviews.Title: “11/16/2007 just your average place”
Reviews.Author: SSPWeymouth_Mass
Reviews.Content: We just came back from one week at Orange Lake, the weather was wonderful and the condo that we stayed in was nice. The resort as a whole is extremly large and unless you have a car you must either take the bus or walk. If you walk you definately will get your exercise. Our accomodations faced the golf course located on the East Village, so it was very quite, relaxing with a pretty view. That said, you should first know not to go to the Publix market located at the entrance as you will leave your weeks fun money their. Take the time to go further down to Rt 27 and go to the Super Wal-mart, it is very large clean and has eveything that you will need for your kitchen. Make sure that you take the tour of the resort that is offered so that you can get a credit for the tubes, and a food/beverage credit. This will take a little time out of your first day, but will save you $250.00. The tubes otherwise are $7 per day and if you have a few children this quickly addes up. We saved $220.00 just by taking the tour. We did not buy and neither will you. The presentation is wonderful and the tour person we had was very sweet, but you can get a much better vacation booking trips on your own. The resort is only average, though they do try but they just miss the mark. We do a good deal of traveling as a family and we all agreed that this was only average. They need to have better service at the pools and golf carts instead of the bus would work out so much better for getting around the resort. If you are planning on staying between now and the spring of 2008 make sure that you ask to be put in either North or East Village. The West Village which is where you register on your day of arrival will make you want to get back on the plan and go home. They are in the middle of a very large renovation and have done a very poor job at making the area inviting. We never went back to this area once we checked in and neither will you. The rest of the resort is very pretty and you forget that all that ugliness exists at the beginning. If you are like us you will do well to go for a short drive to Celebrations just down the road. This is the planned community designed by Disney which was what saved our vacation. They have wonderful resturants the area is beautiful to walk, shop, go for an ice cream, take in a movie and just relax. They have everything set for Christmas right know and you get to forget all the craziness of Rt 192. The resturants at the resort are okay we ate at Legacy Grill and watched the football game, it is not fine dining. The wait staff is wonderful and the Grill very relaxing, the food was fine for what we wanted this particular evening. We had breakfast here as well one morning and our children liked it, especially since we sat outside and watched the golfers. But, if you are looking for fine dining which we want in the evening then you can only find that in Celebrations. You would also will do better to get your tickets for any of the attractions on-line prior to leaving. They say that they have discounted tickets at the resort, but on-line is still the way to go. If you are going with children and they want to play mini-golf, it also costs, as does everything there. The golf will set you back almost $30 for three players and the hippo slide is another $7 per pass per child. These are all the things that they do not tell you. If you are a guest at the resort all of these things should be included. Everywhere else we traveled all the activities on the property are included. Sometimes ,you will have to pay a small fee, but not like at Orange Lake. I hope that this helps the next traveler to Orange Lake, as I read the reviews prior to leaving and it made our trip so much smoother. By know what you are getting yourself into prior and are prepared your vacation will be relaxing. We had a good time because we were prepared, but we all agreed that " TOP NOTCH" accomodations are not what you are going to fined at Orange Lake. It is much better than staying right in Disney, but as far as vacations go this was and will only be your average type of vacation. Enjoy and remember just say "NO" to the time-share pressures, they make it all sound so wonderful, but you are only buying a week and a specific week at that. When we travel we want to do this when we want and not just because this is our week.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Resort EVER!”
Reviews.Author: RockyMtnOpinion
Reviews.Content: WARNING! I would sit down prior to reading this. This was the worst resort I've ever been to. Upon checking in, the resort looked very nice. The grass was mowed. Shrubs were trimmed and it seemed like a pretty nice place. When I made my reservation I asked for a unit as close to A pool as possible. Well we were no where close to a pool. It was at least a half mile to the closest pool and the resort doesn't provide shuttle service off their planned shuttle route. So we walked to and from the pool toting both kids. When we get to the NEW pool (after a 40 minute wait for the shuttle) the life guards informed me that my 5 year old, swimming son was too short to go on the free slide but I could pay $13 for an HOUR at the "Hippo". Keep in mind that the day before my son rode Space Mountain at Disney World with no problems. This same day it was a little over cast and NONE of the dining facilities were open. When I asked a manager why she told me it looked like it was going to rain so they chose to not open for the entire day! Even though this is Florida (it rains in buckets) and the pool was packed. Also there were SWARMS of bugs called Lovebugs. Apparently they are a genitically modified bug that was created by a grad student (science project gone very wrong!). They are worst in the spring but I found them to be incredibly annoying and will avoid central Florida in the future during these times(spring and fall) Now here is the worst part of my entire stay. On Thursday of our Sat to Sat stay I got a call from my credit card inquiring about fradulent charges. When I checked in I get the from desk my cc for incidentals and with in a half an hour someone was using it to buy shoes on ebay, a family history on some website, concert tickets and a bunch of stupid things. Well the moron had everything sent to their home address! I called the police and I plan on pressing charges. Now when I call the Front desk to talk to a manager about all of this they get me Jose who really didn't speak english! He flat out called me a liar and hung up on me. At this point I lost it and took a little jog down to the front desk to deal with Jose face to face. When I got there I was told the only Jose that worked at the resort was in grounds maintence. Little wonder he didn't speak english! This place sucks! I'd stay away. I could just keep going but there is really no need I think you get the point.

Reviews.Title: “Love O. L.!!”
Reviews.Author: macdonaldofmurligan
Reviews.Content: We're owners and go every year. After much research, we discovered that this is one of the best rated in the country. There are several restaurants and always some activity to participate in. Now that they've opened River Walk, there's even a nice relaxing river to float in. The service is always nice and everyone is very friendly. We've traded into other resorts only to discover how spoiled we've gotten. The rooms are smaller and the resorts always seem to have fewer amenities. Our only major complaint is that there are never enough luggage carts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation, again”
Reviews.Author: Travfromct
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time at Orange Lake, and our first time staying at the River Island Resort section. Let me say that all the different areas of Orange Lake have their charms. We've stayed in the West Village and enjoyed the quiet of a detatched Golf villa. While these units are the oldest, we have never been disapointed with the accomodations. For families with kids, it's actually nice to have a back yard the kids can run around in. We noticed many workers around the west village units backing what we've heard about all these units being agressively upgraded. We've also stayed in the North Village which was really nice. My point is, that while it seems everyone tries to get into River Island, in my opinion, the other villages are nicer they 90% of the other timeshares in the Orlando area (we've stayed at several). Now, about our last stay. Let me start by saying there is another building going up at River Island. Workers start at 7am sharp, and this can be on the loud side. We stayed in a 3 bedroom on the 8th floor and happened to be the end unit directly across from the work area. Luckily we have small children that were up at 7am anyway because sleeping late with the construction noise was not an option. The fact that no one tells you this when you book your vacation may be a source of irritation to people who like to sleep in. The front desk did offer to move us to another village, but we decided to stay where we were. The rooms at River Island are REALLY nice. We've stayed at many timeshares, and haven't seen better. I won't bother talking about the pool at RI, other then to repeat what others have said....it's awesome. I heard they invested $85Mill in this "water park" and it shows. The kids had a hard time picking between Disney, or the Pool...it's that good. The man made beach area was a great place for the kids to play, out of the pool, while we had a few drinks in the hammocks. The two pool bars and Restaurant were also a wonderful convenience to have outside your door, and If your kids like arcades, the one in the RI main building is great, with all new machines, unlike a lot of the run down arcades I've seen at other resorts. It might not seem like a big deal, but if you have kids on rainy day it's a life saver. Overall great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place - would recommend if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerlootoo
Reviews.Content: We booked through RCI and were allocated an appt. in the West Village - reading all the reviews made me nervous so on arrival I asked for a place in the East Village. No can do was the reply so we accepted our "condo" in the west village. it was perfect for us - right opposite the swimming pool which the kids enjoyed till very late in the evening. We spent some time at the Splash Lagoon which was very nice altough the snack bar was expensive. Went to the Gatorland Show which encouraged us to visit Gatorland another day - glad we did as it was one of the best experiences for the kids. Very pleased with the appt. very spacious and a lovely balcony which because it was enclosed with an insect net, the children were able to use it as a football pitch! Our appt. did back onto the 192 but did not find it noisy and it didn't bother us at all. Got the hard sell at check in but declined the tour. The phone rang in the appt. every day but we didn't anwer it. When we did eventually answer it we were told we were "hard to tie down" ... again, refused the tour and never heard from them again. I would def. recommend refusing the tour unless you are intending to buy there ... it's not worth your precious holiday time. I would def. stay at Orange Lake again. It's proximity to Disney is fantastic and the local eateries were good too ... especially Houlihans buffet breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake Worked Well For My Family”
Reviews.Author: elmerfudd8675309
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children ages 12 & 9 had a very successful stay at Orange Lake. This was an RCI exchange that I booked in January of 2007. A few days before we arrived, I called Orange Lake to verify our reservation (they had our reservations) and at that time I politely requested any where other than West Village if it were possible. I was polite with my request and did not make it a demand. No guarantees were made to me during that call. I thanked the gentlman on the phone for his time. Upon our arrival, we went to check in at the temporary check in office (new building is still under construction) and got in with not much of a wait. They have kid games outside with loud music cranked - this was tacky to me and cheapened the resort to a county fair carnival atmosphere. Also, I won't leave our kids with strangers so this type of arrangement where you dump your kids and then go register wasn't an option for our family. We were pleasantly informed that we'd be staying in the East Village and I thanked the gentleman. We were given maps and sent to the next line where you get your parking pass and room keys and get hit up for a tour of the resort. We booked a tour and then cancelled later just so we could "get on with it" or other wise we might have been trapped. We drove to our east village unit and were thrilled with the accomodations. Two bedrooms, two baths, nice sized kitchen and living room with attractive furnishings and decor. We also had a nice washer and dryer which we used often. Part of the deal with staying at a time share is you wash your own towels (this is not a big deal) as so many of the reviewers have complained about this. You pay what you pay by NOT having some maid come daily, otherwise, you'd not be able to afford staying here -plain and simple! I'd give up maid service daily for more space anytime on vacation. It's wonderful not to have four people crammed into one room for a vacation. I was offered maid service during our stay because we were there for more than a week. We chose not to and cleaned the unit ourselves, using clorox wipes we bought and ran the sweeper that was in the unit. We took care of our unit as if it were our own home. This is something I think is lacking in some of the Orange Lake attendees. The evidence of this was in the open air halls where it looks like people have let trash dribble all over the hall on the way to the trash chute. People should double bag their trash if it is leaky. I can't imagine owning here and then mis-treating my timeshare like that. Some people are just disrespectful and sloppy. We used the pools at River Island. They are gorgeous and very big. We ate at River Island Grilling and at Legends Sports bar. Both were nice. We did the mini - golf (very fun) and we walked around a lot and enjoyed the wildlife. We also had a spectacular view of the Space Shuttle Launch from the golf course outside our unit. That was truly amazing. I never viewed the interior of a West Village unit - I would not like the ones near the West Village Clubhouse only because I would not like all the noise and the traffic. We stayed in building 86400 and it was so nice and quiet at night. Very peaceful for sleeping. It was our home away from home for 10 days. We had a rental car and driving to Disney was a cinch and took very little time. We had a GPS unit with our car rental which takes away the hassle of maps. We never got lost. If you are staying at the resort you WILL want a car. I would not like to wait for a shuttle. When I say the resort is huge it is HUGE!! It is like it's own city. We used the Publix for our groceries. It was clean and had a pretty good variety. It might be a little more pricey but it sure was convenient. All in all I would give Orange Lake a 9 out of 10. Congratulations Orange Lake - you exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Too big, too much hard sell”
Reviews.Author: CHKiddy
Reviews.Content: Orange Lake is a vast complex with several pools. You need to get in the car to get anywhere within the complex itself. River Island gets very busy on warm days, and the inner tubes for the lazy river cost $7.50 per day (or $10 for a double). Splash Lagoon is quieter and all in all much nicer. The 50m pool and West Village club house were being 'remodelled' but no-one had bothered to warn us, The on site resturants are expensive in comparison with what you can get just 5 minutes down the road. The nearest supermarket (Publix) is only just off site - on Orange Lake owned land I think - and it's expensive compared to standard Wal-Mart. Internet access is expensive ($8 per hour) and only available at river island. Staff at the business centre were just not interested in serving the customers. Our apartment in North Village was spacious and clean - but no hooks to hang caps, swimming gear etc. on (sounds daft but drove us mad). Well equipped kitchen except no scissors !!!! But the worst was the hard hard sell of time share. We were invited to a 'tour and breakfast' which we were assured would 'start at 10 be in the pool by 11'. We (somehow) were also persuaded to part with $20 at the time we agreed to the tour which we weren't quite sure what for (see later). All this happened as we checked in amidst the temporary tents and building site that is currently West Village. We wanted the tour to see what was there so took up the invitation. But the tour was just a quick skip up the road in a golf cart while a sales man talked continuous nonsense to us. Breakfast was coffee and muffins. The $20 it turned out was for a 'gift' so if we didn't stay the length of the sales pitch we didn't get the gift - but we weren't sure if that meant we lost our $20 or not. The sales guy was so convinced that he'd made us an offer we couldn't refuse he hadn't even bothered to ask about our income or even if we wanted to go back to the same place on holiday all the way across the Atlantic year after year. When said we weren't interested and we wanted to go he got most offended and made out that we were trying to get something for nothing (breakfast, 'free' gift). 2 and a half hours after starting the 'tour' we eventually got away with our 'gift' which was a weeks worth of inner tubes at lazy river for 4. This experience completely overshaddowed our stay and we will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ever want in a hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: traveling_italian
Reviews.Content: This Resort is beautiful the pool areas are perfect for little children and adults the waterfalls are so relaxing. There are great restuarants right inside the resort. They had a free huge buffet at the pool with free wine and beer and Juice for the kids, with a live band playing by the pool side. Being right by Disney was great and you could spend your whole vacation at the hotel and be completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “love O. L”
Reviews.Author: wallykil
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a week at orange lake.We were there from Oct 20 till Oct 27. And we had the best time we ever had on vacation.River island was great and the kids and I loved the lazy river.It is just great .And everyone at OL was friendly and helpful.We stayed in a 2 bedroom in north village .This place was way more then we had expected.With all kind of things to do there.There were 5 in our group and we all had a great time.there is Something for all at orange lake.This was our first time there and we are all ready talking about buying a second week.Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at Orange Lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: kwood29
Reviews.Content: Date: 10/19 -- 10/26 Review of Orange Lake Orlando We just returned from OL. We did an exchange with RCI. After reading many reviews I was a little leary. However we had an excellant time. I was scheduled for West Village but requested East Village at check in. It was no problem and we had a really nice two bedroom two bath condo. The screened in porch was large and an excellant spot to watch the Disney fireworks every night. There are just a couple minor things I would suggest that being ceiling fans in the bedroom and proch there were none and to up date their VSR player to a DVD. But the AC worked great I just like the noise of a fan at night. Like I said very minor, other then that the condo was great. It also over looks the Ledgend Golf Course. We went to River Island most of our days. The other pools were very nice but we enjoy people watching and had a great time floating down the river at the island. It did cost $7.00 for a single tube or $10.00 for a double tube. To me it was worth the money as we laughed the whole time. Lots of fun. I would go back. We did not do a time share presentation and were only asked once which we declined. We did not have any other confrontations about time shares. We found everyone to be helpful and just enjoyed our time. I think if you look for negatives you will find them but if you go with an open mind you can have fun no matter what. I would reccomend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “RCI is a joke, loved Orange Lakes”
Reviews.Author: janey8
Reviews.Content: Never exchange through RCI. We exchanged through RCI and asked if we could exchange to River Island, they told us to contact Orange Lake and lets just say after sending off three request it never happend.BIG disappointment espesially since we live in one of the most beautiful places in the world, BDA. We stayed in East Villiage very nice and clean. we stayed there before and loved it. After reading some of the reveiws they had me checking everything but all was well. River Island is huge. My husband and i enjoyed it even though we had rain all week. We thought the gym could have been larger since the complex is huge and staff could use some in-house training on how to serve people better. Over all River Island was great. We wasn't happy with the sells pitch they act like everyone should say yes to buying a new unit. Loved Orange Lake will go back real soon.

Reviews.Title: “1st time at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: pauldp
Reviews.Content: 1st the bad point, Sales Pressure, even though we have a time share 2 bedroom apartment they still want you to fork out more money in upgrading to a 3 bedroom or pool side view (SO BEWARE). 2nd the good points, a) Apartment was clean and well equipped for our stay. b) The River Island complex was brilliant for relaxing but don't expect to do any swimming in it, as it’s only a maximum of 4" deep. c) Whilst we there it wasn't too busy but this might alter as the complex is still being built. There are a few things organised at night around the pool but you’re not forced into anything you do not want to do. d) The Starbucks shop was a regular port of call for us especially in the morning but the service was a little slow at times. e) If you’re into wild life or a nice early morning walk the Nature Walk at 7.15 every Mon, Wed & Fri is a very enjoyable must. f) The twice weekly shopping market at the river island complex was a nice touch, giving you a chance to pick up some nice trinkets. g) The fishing at a few of the lakes was interesting with lots of tiddlers to catch with the odd large Bass to keep your interest going. OVERALL we had a very enjoyable time and we are planning to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: TyRyJack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of Oct. 13-20th, traded with RCI. After reading all of the horror stories regarding RCI trades, I was worried. I had called the resort and RCI ahead of time with my concerns and asked to request another Village, was told no by both parties, stating that RCI only owned in the West Village. About 2 weeks prior, the resort called me to tell me about the construction, etc, and I again expressed my concerns about the West Village units. The person I spoke to this time did put in a request for me, when we actually got there, they honored my request, but told me that he was not actually supposed to do that. Check in was smooth, however very crowded, since it was prime time on a Saturday. Although construction is going on at the front of the resort, they manage to keep it organized. We never laid eyes on the inside of a West Village unit, we stayed in a 2BR East Village unit which was very nice and spacious. MBR had a king bed with a master bath with a jacuzzi tub, 2nd BR has 2 queen beds and another bathroom. Washer, dryer, full kitchen living room and dining room. Although the resort was very well maintained, it was HUGE, almost too big, you could not get to much of anything without a car. River Island was nice, however we liked the pool at the North Village much better. River Island is very pretty with the landscaping, but the way the pool is set up, you cannot see your kids unless they are right in front of you. We ate at both restaurants, very good food, maybe a little pricey. On Sunday, the Legacy Grille had every football game on different TVs, you just told them your team and they sat you where that TV was, my husband loved that! The resort is very close to Disney, maybe 5 minutes. We only went to the Animal Kingdom and Mickey's Not So Scary Halloween Party, which was AWESOME! We got to the park at 4pm (that was the earliest you could enter if you only had tickets to the event) and the most wait we had was maybe 10 minutes max. The parade was great too, definitely worth seeing. Overall, the resort is very nice and I think we lucked out on NOT getting the West Village, from what I was told, all of the units will be remodeled by February of 2008, and the rest of the resort under construction will be done sometime in 2008. ALthough this was a nice place, clean, etc, I think I would rather stay at the Sheraton Vistana Villages again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: rspiess
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this resort is very close to Disney. It is also an easy drive to Orlando if you plan on doing Universal or Seaworld. Before the trip, I read many horror stories about this property and was prepared for the worst. After we entered the property, the first thing that was noticed is the construction. There is MAJOR construction going on all over this property. After locating the check-in facilities, we went through the process. The process went fairly well with little problem. The largest problems were other guests attempting to push and shove their way further up the line. Upon arrival at our unit, we were very supprised to find that we had been placed in a newly renovated 2br condo. Since this is a single story building, there will be no stomping above us!!! Everything was very up to date with new paint, furniture, and appliances. After we were settled, we drove around the property and commented as to how well the grass, streets, and trees were maintained. We visited several of the pool areas and they were very nice and clean. As far as our interaction with staff is concerned, everyone was very nice and helpful. It seems that the experience of this property will be hit and miss until all of the units are renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Oh myyy gawwwww.....”
Reviews.Author: ohmygaww
Reviews.Content: Checked in at the Orange Lake Resort after a very late flight into Florida. Was ready to enjoy our stay. When we walked up to our room in the West Village. As we approached the door I smelt a faint smell of mildew. When we opened the door, it was very outdated I looked around and noticed that we were being greeted by a very huge roach on the kitchen floor. As we walked through the villa we noticed that there was a smashed bug on the bedroom floor. Nice, just what we wanted to see. We called the front desk and explained that we were unhappy with our room, they agreed to give us another. They even met us in the the parking lot, hmm, I wonder why???? Said that the maid must have overlooked the cleaning of the room and gave us a key to another room which turned out to be the same, bug infested. We called RCI and told them of the situation and headed off to a beautiful clean and comfortable hotel in downtown Orlando. Most of all they kept their rooms very clean so that the bugs stayed outside where they belong. To add to my review, what amazed me was that when we returned the keys the second time to the front desk, they simply did not care and made it very clear as they said BYE BYE as we left out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation week”
Reviews.Author: hmcrn2
Reviews.Content: Our entire family came down for my sister's wedding in Orlando. A friend has a timeshare through RCI, so we decided to go for a week, and were able to get condos very inexpensively. We rented four. They would not promise that we could all be together, but when we arrived, they did put us all side by side. It was wonderful, because we could leave the patio doors unlocked, and the kids (and adults) could run back and forth betweeen condos very easily. We were in the West Village, units 2043 - 2046. These are definately older units. Ours were all two bedrooms, with two full baths. (no Jacuzzi's) The units are quite large, with full kitchen, dining room with table for six, living room with couch, love seat, and chair. Back patios had two chairs, table, and lounge chair. Comfortable even if a bit shabby. They give you a little package of stuff when you arrive in your unit - three rolls of toilet tissue (plus what was already on the rolls), dish soap, trash bags, dishwasher detergent, laundry soap,coffee for one day, and 7 coffee filters. We had to buy another packet of laundry soap, but it was only $2 at the convenience store at River Island.
