Publix is outside the East gate for food, but they WAY over charge for everything, so be prepared. All the water parks were great. There are extra charges for things, but i really don't think it was bad. We shared tubes, and even though it states that you can't bring in food and drinks, everyone did. (sandwiches and soda) No one ever checks or polices. Plenty of towels to be had at each pool area. The River Island Grille and the Legacy Bar both had good food. The pizza was ok. Very overpriced for what you get. My husband and two others golfed a few days, and said it was good. (right out the back door - literally!) Pelicans, cranes, herons, all kinds of birds out the back door too every morning. Great to watch while sipping my coffee. I would definatelly recommend a car, even for in the resort, it's much quicker and parking is no problem at all. The timeshare talk is a total joke. It is definately 3 hours of sell. Breakfast is a muffin or a donut and a beverage. The "coupons" etc, can be gotten at any ticket booth or hotel in Orlando. The one good thing was $50 in food vouchers for the restaurants on the resort. I would seriously recommend not going to the talk if you don't want to buy. It's just not worth the time. Oh, one more thing - Disney, Gatorland, Universal, EVERYTHING Orlando is so close! We are already planning our next adventure down. I can't wait to go back. It really is that good.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: kiminky07
Reviews.Content: My family just returned last night from a week-long stay at Orange Lake. I too was a little worried about the reviews I had previously read considering that I knew we would be staying in the West Village. However, I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the condos are once we arrived. It more than met our expectations. Some items need replacing, such as the blender, hairdryer, etc. but a very nice place overall. My only complaint would be the size of the resort. The villages are spaced quite a distance from each other which becomes an issue if you want to spend a lot of time in the different pool areas. We went to River Island first but found that we enjoyed Splash Lagoon much more than the other pool areas. I had difficulty watching my kids at River Island but not at Splash lagoon because of the size of it. Overall, I would certainly stay at this resort in the future!

Reviews.Title: “RCI Exchange Here a RIPOFF”
Reviews.Author: ConneticutBijou
Reviews.Content: We exchanged a week through RCI at the Sheraton Vistana Villages in Orlando, Florida for Orange Lake Resort after hearing good reviews from an owner friend of ours. Our unit was #2019 in the West Village and was a disappointment from the start. The two bedroom unit was nowhere the value of what we traded in, no whirlpool tub in the master bedroom, no Lanai or screened in porch, the lovebugs were just horrific and you couldn't sit outside and enjoy yourselves because they were all over everything. The master bedroom had water stains on the ceiling and you could see where the ceiling had already been repaired. The back deck was strewn with debris from the trees and didn't look like it had been cleaned before we arrived because my wife swept it when we got there and it stayed fairly clean for the week that we were there. We moved the sofa only to find a lot of dirt on the floor under the sofa which we vacuumed because obviously their housekeeping did not do a good job before we arrived, that's if they cleaned it at all. We attended a sales presentation with Ralph who asked us to have an open mind for his sales presentation. When I complained to Ralph about our accomodations, he replied that it was RCI and not the resort that was responsible because RCI apparantely requests their exchanges to be located in the West Village which is the oldest part of the resort. Even though I told Ralph that I had a bad taste in my mouth about our accomodations and I would have a hard time to keep an open mind, he did absolutely nothing to try to satisfy us but casually continued on with his sales presentation. One would think that if a resort is trying to sell you a timeshare, they would place you in one of their newer units; however, the closest we got to a new unit was in the walkthrough the model unit with Ralph. We are very skeptical about using RCI again, because in listening to and reading more reviews, it appears that it is routine for RCI to place their exchanges in the oldest units and rips people off and there is no recourse or any apology from RCI. Travelers Beware!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: ShelOt
Reviews.Content: Our extended family (4 adults, 2 kids ages 5,5,3,2) stayed at OLCC in October 2006 for a Disney vacation. Another family member owns the 3BR Tennis Villa unit we stayed in. All I can say is "WOW"... this resort has everything you can imagine. Yes, it is very large and you definitely need a car to get around. We knew this in advance so it wasn't a problem for our group. I am noticing a pattern that most of the negative reviews come from people who went through the timeshare presentation. We were also notified of this in advance and didn't answer the unit phone once. Upon check-in they asked my husband if he wanted to attend a presentation and he politely declined... they politely accepted. The unit: Our unit was a 3 bedroom which was unbelievably spacious! There was more than enough room for our party... Again, it might be inconvenient for some people to not have daily maid service.... but we were properly informed... so this was not a surprise to us. The location in the Tennis Villa was perfect! Just a short walk to the clubhouse and the pool area. I understand it is under construction now but it was a fantastic location for us at the time of our visit. The property: The resort is absolutely huge. All of the different areas have their own "personality". The River Island area is really nice. The kids (and adults!) had fun floating around and swimming in the pools. Splash Lagoon was our favorite area. This wasn't as busy as River Island as it is not quite as new. The little waterslide was perfect for kids! The spray park was nice for the little ones, too. The golf courses looked really beautiful. We packed so much into our schedule that we didn't get to play... this time! All of the grounds and walkways were meticulously cared for. Its hard to touch on everything because there is just so much to do and see! I feel like we didn't even scratch the surface of this resort! The only problem we encountered on this trip was when we attempted to go to the River Island Grilling Company. We went there and asked how long the wait was. They told us 20 minutes so we took turns walking the kids around the River Island complex. About 30 minutes later we asked when our table would be ready. They told us it would be AT LEAST another FIFTY minutes!? We explained that 30 minutes ago they said it would be 20 minutes.... etc... They didn't feel bad at all which rubbed me the wrong way. We ended up leaving because it was way too late for the kids at this point. Again, that was the only problem we encountered at OLCC... and that had to do with restaurant staff / management... not the resort. We loved this resort so much that we ended up buying a week after we got home. A little tip for you that I learned... you can buy timeshare units on resale and save a TON of money! (Of course you always need to be sure you are working with a reputable company!) I highly recommend this resort to any family traveling to Orlando. Its really funny... my kids ask... "When are we going back to Orange Lake"... not Disney!!! Haha!

Reviews.Title: “A Famliy Legacy”
Reviews.Author: 2010luvit
Reviews.Content: My parents have been going to Orange Lake since the eary 90's and the first time I went was when I was 6 years old. I'm now 15 and let me say, I'll never stay anywhere else in the Orlando/Kissimmee area. The resort is absolutley beautiful. There are several pools and even a water park now. This place is fabulous if you're traveling with teens. There are so many things for your teen to do and you don't have to be with them. They have teen partys, there's a movie theater, mini-golf, an arcade and the best part is.... you don't have to drive to them. Just hop on the shuttle bus and it'll take you wherever in the resort you want to go and it's free. I've never seen any insect there and even if there was it's Florida, Florida has bugs just like the rest of the world, but personally I've never seen any. The resort is very clean, my parents own a timeshare in the newly built East Village and it is gorgeous. I hear that if you go through RCI, then you automatically go to the West Village which is kinda outdated (hint hint, don't go through RCI) but overall the rest of the resort is very nice. They have restaraunts and so many things to do as a family also. And the best part, it's like 10 minutes away from both Disney and Universal Studios. Orange Lake also has it's own highway that goes directly over the normal road and straight to Disney. Getting to Disney on the main road takes forever because everyones in the ares isgoing there, but since Orange Lake has it's own road it takes a lot less time because it's just the people from Orange Lake going there. The staff is very nice but I do agree, don't go to the seminar about buying a timeshare. Only if you do intend to buy should you because they are kind off pushy for you to buy but other than that the staff is very nice and helpful. Which trust me once you get there, you;ll autpmatically want to buy. The resort is pretty big so I wouldn't recommend trying to walk from the East Village to the West Village (tried it at like 1:30 in the morning with my friend, had to wake my mom up to come get us, that was interesting) but definatly bring like a bike or skates. Also all the rooms are smoking free, which means...... now smoky smelling room when you walk in which is very good, because there's nothing like walking into a room full of smoke as soon as you get off an airplane with recycled air. And if you like golf, this is definatly the place for you. Some place don't even have a golf course but orange lake lol my dad jokes around and says Orange Lake is a golf course with villas on it. Instead of it being a resort with golf courses. Overall this resort is definatly one of the best I've ever been to. Staying at this resort is a privledge really. My friends own a timeshare at Westgate which is down the street. Compared to Orange Lake it's really garbage. It's my favorite place in the world and I don't think any place will break that record. Not one complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....not great”
Reviews.Author: klbur
Reviews.Content: Ok…I have never done a review about a resort I have stayed at before, but I felt compelled to do one for our stay at Orange Lake Sept 8 - 14th 2007. 1st of all….RCI exchange so of course we ended up in the West Village in a two bedroom Condo. It was supposed to have been recently renovated……I doubt it….but it quite nice….just older. It was clean and served its purpose. Definitely better than a hotel room The grounds are beautiful but huge. I recommend that you rent a car if you are going to stay there. The real problem with this resort is the attitude of the staff. I don’t just mean at the front desk ….but everywhere. Don’t get me wrong…they were all nice and courteous. It’s just that they all seem to think that they are the biggest and the best and we should have felt privileged to stay there. I actually had a staff member comment on how beautiful the resort was and how lucky we were to be able to stay there. It was almost an arrogance that became irritating as the week wore on. It was just little things. Our porch light was out when we arrived. They sent someone out to fix it right away. They sat out in our driveway for about a half hour just talking. Finally they came to the door and said it was a sensor problem and they couldn’t fix until the next day……trust me….they never looked at the light. It finally got fixed our last day there. One evening I was entering the gate and the guard was talking to a girl in the car in front of me that was blocking the entrance. At first I thought he was giving her directions, but very soon it became apparent he was just talking to her. After a few minutes another guard came over. I thought, finally he’ll move her along so I can enter. No, he just joined in the conversation, laughing, joking and high fiving each other. They didn’t seem at all concerned that I had to sit there for over 5 minutes before I could enter. The staff was only a minor irritation to an otherwise great week. Don’t be afraid to stay there. I would stay there again, but it wouldn’t be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but not for the future”
Reviews.Author: zooman21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at OL the first week of September through RCI. We also took a "tour" that was supposed to last only 90 minutes but it took well over 2 hours. We were promised breakfast but that never happened. Most employees barely speak English. The facilities are great though. The River Island complex is very nice. The thing I was upset about was the lack of WIFI Internet throughout the resort. If you want WIFI there are only select areas and it costs apx. 10 dollars an hour. We also ate at River Island Grilling Company and Legacy Grille. River Island was ok. The hosts weren't very informative when I asked them what they had to offer. There also was no signs of any management throughout the night. The food at River Island was ok. We ate lunch at Legacy and it went really well. Food met expectations. Overall, this place just seems to obsessed with making money instead of pleasing its current guests/owners.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT BEWARE RCI MEMBER”
Reviews.Author: ZMANVirginia
Reviews.Content: If you exchange through RCI be careful!! Almost all of their units are in the older/dated west village units. I read the reviews on trip advisor and after speaking to an Orange Lake reservationists, I requested an East Village unit through RCI but was told none were available since most of their units are in the West Village. I made this exchange a year ago… I then called back Orange Lake Resort and requested an East Village unit, they put in the request but could not guarantee it since we did not own there. At check in we were assigned to the East Village and it was very nice. It was clean and well appointed. The East village also has its own pool which was never crowded. The units are large and have screened porches with views of the golf course. The staff at Orange Lake is very helpful and accommodating. This is a very large resort and a beautiful one. RCI was not much assistance with this stay. The best they could offer was to tell us if we were unhappy they could TRY to find us another resort. However there appeared to be plenty of availability at the East village. Also there are two other villages at orange lake one is the River Island area which is only available to resort owners, and the North village which we did not visit but I was told were nice. It is approx. 20 min. to the Disney lots from here, close to everything. This is a great place for all. It is becoming clearer all the time that one should consider buying direct at a nice resort instead of using RCI because they seem to have very limited availability at the nice resorts even when reservations are requested a year in advance. Make a reservation then call the resort and request the east village if the resort can accommodate you they definitely will. RCI is not much help.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake Resort rates above average.”
Reviews.Author: revygirl
Reviews.Content: This review is a little long winded but I wanted to give a good description of the strengths and weaknesses of this resort. We stayed at Orange Lake Resort August 19-26th 2007. The summer season dramatically drops at this time so the resort had a comfortable amount of guests. I chose the Orange Lake resort under a guest certificate through RCI. I have to admit that I came very close to cancelling my booking after reading several very scary online reviews of this resort. However, in the end I decided to stick with it and try out the property. I am a very discriminating traveller who is used to staying in 5 star/diamond resorts. I take note of the small details when it comes to hotel and restaurants. The check in process at Orange Lake was quite fast, painless albeit a little rushed and impersonal. It literaly took only about 2 minutes to check in. During check-in, my daughter enjoyed the kids welcome cart (face painting, animal balloons, popcorn and lemonade). This is a nice little treat they have set up, however I did notice on the schedule that the kids welcome is only set up at certain times. I was then directed to "marketing" to obtain my parking pass. This is where they try to lure you in for a timeshare presentation with the reward of free attraction passes. The gentleman was nice enough in his bid and let me get on my way once I explained that I wasn't interested. We were given a two bedroom/two bath unit located in the East village overlooking one of the golf courses. The buildings in the east village are six story complexes which look like small apartment complexes. The drive to the unit was a little lengthy, however the scenery along the way is nice as all of the grounds are very well kept. Upon entering our complex, I noticed that the elevator and outside hallways definitely need to be cleaned a little more often. Even though the hallways are outside and subject to the elements (dust/dirt/bugs, etc...), it is a shame that they are not maintained to the same standard as the grounds. I have to say that I was EXTREMELY relieved when I opened the door to our unit. It was very nice and cool (ac worked great)! I was extremely impressed with how spacious it was (approx 1000 sq feet). It was very clean including the bathrooms and kitchen. The appliances were in good shape however the dishwasher and washer/dryer definitely were on the noisy side (still bearable though). There was sufficient initial supplies and dishes, etc,, The unit was decorated in the bright Florida colours (Iblue and yellow), however still looked very nice and quite tasteful. One of my favorite features was the HUGE sectional couch in the living room. All four of us could sit on the couch quite comfortably at the same time. The living room TV was acceptable, however they should be looking at replacing the smaller TV's in the bedrooms as their age is starting to show in the picture quality. I checked the beds when we arrived, the bedding was of fairly good quality and the maitresses were clean, in good shape and were very comfortable (I'm VERY picky when it comes to bed quality. After all one of the most important aspects of a good stay is a good night sleep. The master bath had a huge spacious ensuite with a big jetted tub and separate shower. It was white, simple but nice and clean. There is a blow dryer available in the bathrooms, however they appear to be a little old and could probably use replacing. The patio was enclosed and had a beautiful view of the golf course. The only thing it was missing was a barbeque. My only complaint about the room would be the cushion on the eating table bar. It was a light color and VERY stained with food/drink spills, etc. So much so that we actually avoided sitting on it as it was quite disgusting. Again it's a shame that everything in the room is so nice, yet they don't take the time to recover a cushion that desperately needs it. I thought that we would receive a mid week cleaning and towel exchange but was advised that that only applied to stays over seven days. All in all, I would rate the suite an 8 out of 10. As far as the ammenities goes, Orange Lake rates quite high in my books. During our first night, we attended the Orange Lake welcome party at the "West Village" pool area. It was a great time, they had hula hoop competitions and dancing lessons along with prizes. Again it's all in the details, there were a few pool chairs that needed a good cleaning, I wasn't really interested in spending much time swimming at the West Village as it is starting to show its age. River Island and Splash Lagoon however are awesome. Very nice and very clean. There were lots of chairs available (again the season was winding down). The river is alot of fun for both adults and kids. My only pet peeve about the pools was that they only provided towels until 7 pm, yet the pools were open until 10 pm (the towels were pretty thin and cheep looking as well). I noticed that most of the resort "activities" were located at the West Village pool. We ate on property once, at the River Island Grilling Company. It was very good all in all. I would definitely eat there again. As far as the staff/Customer Service goes at Orange Lake, this is probably one of their weakest areas. I really didn't come across anyone who really went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Most of the staff seem to have a very curt and "not really interested in helping you" attitude. It really anoys me when staff are not properly trained to be professional and hospitable. A fiendly helpful voice and a smile goes a long way in my books and it appears that OL's employees are definitely lacking in this area. The only really nice employee I encountered was one of the Massage Therapists but he didn't actually work for Orange Lake. All in all, Orange Lake was a real hit in alot of areas like room quality/spaciousness and choice and quality of swimming facilitiesand activities. The misses were the Customer Service, lack of attention to the "little details". I also wasn't crazy about the size of the resort and the fact that you have to drive to the pools. The location of the resort itself is acceptable but you would definitely need a car if you stay here. I was quite satisfied with my stay and would definitely stay here again if I wasn't planning a week of amusement park visits. The activity schedule had some neat things going on like kite races, nature walk, etc. I think most of the really bad online reviews have come from guests who were placed in the old "West Village" portion. We were given a large handout showing the total refurbishing of the West Village that is currently taking place. By time we left, they had actually started the refurbishment of the check in centre that we had used. It looks like it will be quite nice and completed sometime next year (2008). No doubt once it is done, everyone will then be asking for a room in the West Village! I did receive an email on my blackberry shortly after check-in, requesting feedback on my stay at Orange Lake. It appears that the current management are interested in the opinions of their guests, so hopefully this resort will continue to get better and better.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but don't get tricked into the presentation!”
Reviews.Author: Mandersjo
Reviews.Content: The resort is truly awesome, the room was great, the pools were beautiful and everything was kept up and clean. The only thing that almost ruined our trip was when we got tricked into going to the timeshare presentation. Here's how they do it: We got a phone call at 8:30 am on our first full day there. The woman on the phone said she was making sure our room was okay with us and also that there was a breakfast at River Island that we were invited to. She said that if we came to the breakfast and listened to a presentation about the remodeling of the resort we would get $75 to put toward food or disney tickets. It sounded good to me, but I asked her, "Is this going to be a sales pitch?" No, no absolutely not, was her reply. SHe said it would last an hour, maybe 90 minutes tops. She said that they just wanted us to know what was going on with the resort so we could refer others to come visit. She also said that it would not be a tour. Well we got there and got put with John from Ohio who preceded to hard sell us for the next 2 1/2 hours. They take you away from where you park in a golf cart so you can't get away, take you on a tour, ask you rhetorical questions the whole time, and by the way there was NO BREAKFAST! I told him first thing the lies that the woman on the phone told me and he "acted" shocked. We learned later that this is what other people were told and is probably how it's done every time. We ended up ending the presentation, i was in tears and my husband was furious. We told him first thing that we were not going to buy a timeshare, that we didn't want a tour and that we were promised breakfast. What we got was over 2 hours wasted on our vacation, a couple of cookies, way more stress that necessary on vacation and a bad attitutude toward the resort. Like I said, we resort was great, but this presentation almost made us not want to come back. We would never buy a timeshare from people who LIE to us to get us to the presentation. Believe me, it was not worth the $75 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “this place is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: woo_vacation
Reviews.Content: Okay, This place is truely amazing and I have seen no other place like it. Everything I about it is a thumbs up! Don't listen to all these negative posts..maybe they are hard to please and I'm sure that not all bad things happen...it's just bad luck. When I stayed here we hit Hurricane Jeanne on the last day and everyone was a huge help. All the staff were helpful and nice during the 15 nights we stayed. There are lots of things to do there if you don't want to go out to all the theme parks. There are 8 pools there and they are all well kept and clean --- No Problems at all. There's a golf course , jet ski hire & more. I didn't visit the golf course though so I can't really give an opinion to that. Basically this place is worth a visit and it is definately 110% worth going...Thumbs up all the way!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but stay away from time share presentation”
Reviews.Author: BobbieZ
Reviews.Content: We recently arrived home from a weeks stay at Orange Lake. It claims to be the largest resort in the world and you can see why....it's huge!!! The grounds are beautiful and the newer units are lovely. The amenities are like nowhere else....10 pools, 4 waterslides, 3 arcade, 4 golf courses, restaurants and snack shops, stores, etc. It does have it all. You don't have to worry leaving the property if you don't want to. Now things on property are a bit pricey....arcade games $1 each, $7 a day per person to rent tube for lazy river, inflatable slide has a per person cost, and golf prices are nuts. The one other thing I wasn't happy about was you only got maid service and clean towels ONCE during your stay. You had to wash your own towels or pay $7 a day for new ones. Our unit didn't have a washer/dryer in it. Only one on the floor for everyone to use. Most other building had them in the rooms. We stayed in a studio unit in the west village. It was ok, nothing near as nice as the units in the River Island section. Ours was older, but did have a lot of things to do in the clubhouse. They are supposed to do this section over very soon. Our kids loved the pools that were open late, so after a long day at the park we swam outside our room before bed. The also have a small lake with rentals for boats, jetskis, etc. We didn't find enough time to do that but it looked great. We ate at the River Island Grilling Company and it was faboulous...don't miss the bananas foster...yummm!!!! I would go back again, but skip the timeshare presentation. It's just like the others...a load of crap!!! They talked us into it (we were looking to buy a timeshare somewhere) and told us it was only an hour unlike other places and offered us wholesale ticket prices and a $60 food voucher and said we'd have time to think about it. We go, they take our kids and put them in a daycare thing, and take us by golf cart over a mile away. After 3 1/2 hours later, I'm flipping to go get my kids and they didn't want to let me. They said if I left before the presentation was complete we got nothing. So I stuck it out, and was so upset. They expected us to decide then, when the told us we had all week to think about it. It wasn't real high pressure, but they sure made you feel bad. I felt like i was lied to and the prices were nuts!!! There are a ton of timeshares in FL and they tried to tell us the had the best trading power which they don't. Disneys timeshare were almost half and they give you a year with the price guarantee. Then I wanted to leave and asked if we could come back to get our tickets since the kids aren't used to being left in a daycare. They said sure, but gave us our food voucher before we left. We came back and hour later to get the tickets and they didn't want to give it to us. They said we left so that was it. I was pissed!!! I ended up in tears before it was all over and swore never to come back. We did get our tickets, but I will never do a time share presentation anywhere again. Granted this had nothing else to do with the resort, so don't judge your opinion of this resort on that alone, just don't go to it. The resort also has a disney planning center on site and the people are wonderful there and so helpful. For a Orlando resort not on Disney property this is the best one we'vve stayed in so far. Last time we stayed in the Westgate Leisure resort...yuck!!! This was a 1000 time nicer than that. Just keep in mind when traveling to Orlando, the nickel and dime you for everything everywhere. So be prepared to spend far more than you budget for this trip. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience--- Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: jnjm3
Reviews.Content: I am going to be brief. Did not get the room I was told when I booked the room. There was a black fuzzy spider crawling on the curtain when my son opened it to look out the window. Air conditioner did not work-- stayed 80 degrees for 1hour. Asked to change rooms-- stated that it wasn't the room I was sopose to have anyway. But since I was only staying one night no big deal. They put me in another room. The air conditioner worked. Everything was veryyyyyyyyy dirty. The bathrooms out by the west village pools were disgusting. Even my 5 year old was scrunching up his nose. The morning to leave my daughter was sitting on the sofa bed ( the one she slept on) and she let out a bloody scream. There was this huge spider with long legs crawling on her. I killed the spider kept it in a paper towel and gathered our things and went to the front desk. The young man was nice ( new to the job) not a surprise it seems all their staff is in training. ( the pool guy, the girl that was trying to plunge the bathroom toilet by the pool and the two guys at the front desk that I worked with were all new to the job) The young man took me to member services where Dee told me they spray every day. Bologna!!! I have to say that they didn't try the sale pitch with me because I live in Florida-- just an hour away. They also didn't send me to get a parking permit either. The clientele is very low at this resort. The type that get the free nights to see the resort. If you are a timeshare owner of a nice resort, it would be a huge waste to stay here. If you are coming to Florida for vacation, there are way better resorts to stay at with great pools. That was the only plus was the pools. I surely wouldn't want to take the chance of sleeping with any spiders.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: ilovmy3kidz
Reviews.Content: We were excited about this trip, and booked their "Quad Queen" suite so that all of our party could stay together. The price we paid was about what 2 moderate hotel rooms cost, so we figured that was ok. The bad feelings started at check in. After standing in a long line we were finally in, then we were sent to another line just to get a parking permit. This is an excuse to give you the time share pitch. We refused, refused, and refused again. Finally got the parking permit, was told to use the side door. Parking was impossible to find for such a large place. I actually couldn't find the side door! After walking back and forth around the outside of the building, I found the door - behind a wall, behind a dumpster. Nice. I got up to my floor and started the search for our room. This was a quest in itself, room numbering seems random. I found our room - the door was propped open by a towel and only had 2 beds, not four. I called down to guest service, waited on hold, got transfered, waited on hold, finally got someone. They corrected the room and did send someone up to help me move the gear. The room itself. Blah. Outdated, somewhat dirty, the hot water handle fell off in my hand from the shower (I found the little "H" sticker on the side of the tub, so obviously it has fallen off before), sandpaper towels, no shampoo (even though we were in a regular room, not the condo side). The pool river complex, was OK. My kids could not use the waterslide (must be 48") so my 7 and 5 yo were disappointed, after paying a "resort fee" on top of the room rate, we still had to pay $7 for tubes for the lazy river. On the whole, big disappointment. We could have stayed on disney property in 2 rooms and done better! Also, you keep getting the condo pitch in messages on your room phone. Why would I want to buy a condo when the room they are putting you up in to show their hotel stinks????

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: MarleneU
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traded our timeshare week in Cabo San Lucas for Orange Lake CC and we were quite disappointed. When we arrived on a Saturday mid day, there was massive chaos in the West Village Clubhouse. People were everywhere and there obviously was not enough help. When we checked in we were advised that our room would be on the first floor of the building we were located in (West Village). Like another reviewer, the stench of mildew or covered up dirt was so strong in the hallway and it did not get better in the room. Although the room appeared clean, there was obvious mildew problems. In addition, throughout our short 3 nite stay (we chose to leave early and not complete our "vacatino" week) there was some sort of scratching in the ceiling much like that of mice or some sort of rodents. Although we did not see any critters, it made me feel uncomfortable. The walls are thin in the building and you could actually hear conversations in the hallway from inside your room. There were tons of children everywhere so if you are expecting a quiet vacatino, go elsewhere. The building housed an overpriced small sundry/grocery store but beware that a 12 oz. beer--one can-- was $4.50. If you are looking for fun in the sun and will not be in your room very much and IF you could tolerate the hideous smell, you will be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the Nay Sayers”
Reviews.Author: orangelakelover
Reviews.Content: I can not believe some of these reviews. We have been going to Orange Lake for the last 10 yrs. To the point that we have purchased 2 weeks there. Our kids only want to go to OL. They are 6 and 9. Our rooms are always clean and never once have we seen any bugs in our units. If everyone could have a tube for free in River Island, everyone would be complaining at how jammed up the water would be. THERE ARE 8 POOLS THERE! You dont need to buy a tube to enjoy River Island. You dont need to swim in River Island every day. If you are there for 7 days hit a different pool each day. It is a no brainer people!!!! So you have to jump in the car for a 1 minute or less ride to the next pool. Honestly people....what are you complaining about? Some people love to have their units away from the pools to they can have some quiet time. Those people would say the little drive is worth it. Plus...how could you honestly fit 8 pools in one area? Imagine how packed it would be then Any timeshare presentation is going to be a hard sale. Orange Lake is the only timeshare that we own that told us the truth (dont buy in Hilton Head w/Coral Resorts...they are a bunch of liars and we got burned on that one) For those that have never been this is the most amazing place to take your kids. We only leave the resort for 1 day and that is /c the kids love Gatorland. There are 2 miniture golf courses that the kids love. They swim a little, play golf a little. It is a great way to break up the day. Staying at any resoort, you are going to pay a little more. You are paying for convenience. I do agree that the Publix is overpriced. For those of you that have afound a better family friendly resort, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Problems, but would stay again,”
Reviews.Author: ccra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort the week of July 15-22. The resort is a beautiful facility,however there are some things they need to work on. We had 3 condos for our family. When we got to check in they were in 3 different areas of the resort. We ask that they be put together and it took 2 hours for them to find the rooms close together. They were reserved a year in advance through RCI. If you are not a owner it takes awhile to get anything done. The elevator went down and we were on the 4th floor. When I called and ask when it would be working, they could not give any information as to how long it would be down. Lucky, it was only down for the one day. We stayed in a 3 bd 3 bth room. The master bath was the only room with a bathtub. This is difficult when you have small children who do not take showers. The rooms are beautiful. My husband and son played golf and loved the course. The pool in the East Villa was next to our building. It is a great pool for children. We could set on our porch and see the pool and golf course. It is really close to the attractions. It is a beautiful place and we would stay again, they just need to work on treating visiting the same as the owners.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - **** THIS PLACE IS AWFUL *** GO ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: dooka355
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, Orange Lake looked like a very nice place. We have stayed at Time-share resorts before, so we more or less knew what to expect. Boy, were we wrong! We booked our stay through Hotels.com. Once we were checked in, we were told that we would be staying in the main building of the West Village. We were then "directed" to the "customer service" desk to obtain our parking permit. We were informed that to use the tubes in the Lazy River, there would be a $7, per person, per day charge (as we were a family of 4 staying for 7 days, this would amount to $240.00) unless we would attend the "non-heavy sell" timeshare pitch for 60-90 minutes. If we did, the tubes would only be $20 dollars for all 4 of us for the week. There was no mention anywhere on their site of a tube charge at all, so already we were feeling a bit pressured and ripped off. We then found out that there is also a $7 per day charge to get new towels. The hallway to get to the rooms STUNK. It reeked of a horrible mildew and sweat combination smell. The suite itself was nice, a kitchenette, two bathrooms and two queen size beds. The bedroom area overlooked a game room, but this closed about 11:00. We found out later on, that there was very little hot water in either shower. Upon "trying" to get to sleep, we found out, that the walls were "PAPER THIN". We heard the couple next door to us, talking, "being intimate" (loudly, try explaining that to an 8 year old) and playing music until 4 am or so. Keep in mind, that they were performing their business at a normal sound level, but due to the walls being so thin, it sounded like they were right in the room with us. In the morning, I went to the Management office and explained the situation and calmly asked to have our room changed. The receptionist looked up our information, and then told me that there were no other rooms available, which I found hard to believe. When I questioned her about this, she told me to contact Hotels.com to see if they would upgrade me to a more expensive suite and that all of the walls in the rooms of the main building were the same way. I asked to speak to a manager, who then told me the same thing. It was only when I told him that it was poor customer service, did he then say that he would try to do something. I asked him to send someone to look at the showers also. I contacted Hotels.com, who were told the same thing. An engineer came into the room and told me that the shower valves were broken, and it would take many hours to fix. I'm not sure which of the above worked, but the manager did call back, to say that they had found a "no show" room and that they were moving us. Upon getting to the new room, we found that the overhead light in the bathroom was out, not a big thing, but in additon to all of the above, it just added to our misery. We did not have to sit through the timeshare presentation, because my wife told them flat out that the only reason we were there was to get a coupon for the tubes. They gave us the coupon without subjecting us to the hard sell. The pools were nice, the Lazy River was fun. We handed our coupon for the tubes in the first day, and after that, they did not even ask for any names (or of others,it appeared) If you ask me , the tube charge is a big scam. The smell in the hallway does make its way into the rooms at times. My brother who came up from southern Florida for the weekend, and stayed in a two bedroom suite in the North village, did find a few large roaches crawling around in the morning (roaches, not palmetto bugs). Orange Lake falsely advertises it's services, charges you for EVERYTHING, and is not very clean. I would absolutely not recommend it. We are not a picky family, but this is the worst place that we ever stayed at,

Reviews.Title: “a slice of heaven in florida”
Reviews.Author: GATRavelDiva
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our visit to Orange Lakes Resort. We are owners, however our week is in January so we decided to visit the resort on a 3 day package and it was great!! If you have small children, big children, or no children you will love this resort. There are so many wonderful things to do and see. 1. Golf , Golf, and more Golf!! 2. Water sports 3. Game room 4. tons of restaurants 5. spacious accomadations! You can bring the entire family and be comfortable! This was a great time for us and we truly love the being apart of the Orange Lakes Family!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Caem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort about 15 years ago with our two young children. We had a great time and I wonder now why we did not go back sooner. The place has expanded much in the past years. We stayed in East Village in a 3 bedroom condo that was beautiful, clean, and well stocked. There was a small pool not far from our condo where our daughter and her friend liked to sun and swim. I enjoyed the small but up to date gym which was adjacent to the pool. My son and his friend enjoyed River Village where the lazy river is, miniature golf, shopping and water slides. I personally found the place to be too busy for me and stayed at the smaller pool. The pool at West Village is great - I went in the evening and had plenty of room to do laps. The nearby lake beach gives one the feeling of actually being at the ocean. My son and friend made good use of the shuttle service throughout the resort because this is a BIG resort and you cannot walk to everything. One of the nicest things is that there is a Publix grocery store right at the end of the resort - you don't even need to get on the highway to go grocery shopping. Across the street from the main entrance is a good size Walgreen that is open 24 hours which is accomodating if you have a late arrival. The only bad experience I had was really not the resort's fault. The number of parents who let their children go to the pool without adult supervision - even though the sign says you must be over 12 to be at the pool alone. The small pool by our unit did not have a staff member on duty so this happened a few times while we were there. Several times children under 12 were unaccompanied by an adult, some of them could not swim and often times their behavior rude. But all in all the vacation was great, weather hot and sunny and the resort had a lot happening - no reason you even had to leave the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Scam Artists”
Reviews.Author: Markus75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the OL resort through a referral and was aware that I had to endure their sales pitch at the end. However, my friend convinced me that the property it nice and the price you pay for it is well worth it (he doesn’t own a time share nor does he plan on it). So when booking my stay I requested a one bedroom condo which was not available but they told me that the price difference to a 2 br is only $20 a day (total $105 a night) and I could always change it later when something becomes available. Of course nothing became available but it was still ok. We stayed at the newer buildings all the way in the back of the property. At least it was quiet but we had to drive everywhere. We did not take advantage of most offering at this resort except for River Island which was ok (a bit crowded). On the day before check out I was to take the tour. So i went and a 26 year career broker tried to convince with high pressure sales tactics. Well if it sounds to good to be true it usually is I told them and I said I would need time to think. Of course she did not like that and did not even take me on the tour. Good riddance. However, when returning I found out that they charged me an additional $750.00 for my 4 night stay because I did not take the tour. Well, I had to call several times and called my Credit card company to dispute the charges. Overall, the property is ok but not worth they hassle they put you through.

Reviews.Title: “River Island - Almost Disaster, but Staff saved the day!”
Reviews.Author: ADAMcAllen_TX
Reviews.Content: Stayed two weeks (June 1 - June 15) at Orange Lake's River Island. Check-in went relatively smooth with about a 10-15 minute wait. Orange Lake Country Club is HUGE - the size of a small village (5 sq. mi.), and bills itself as the largest resort in the world. Discovered however that they did not have my 2nd week in the reservation system. Talked to the RCI rep and OLCC staff and were able to resolve problem. The staff member, Michelle Thompson, was able to clear up problem. Apparently the condo unit was sold, and no more weeks were allowed to be banked for that unit. Anyway,River Island / OLCC is very close to Disney Main Gate (15 min. drive) - as a matter of fact, OLCC shares its property line with Animal Kingdom. Lots of activities for families and children. Lazy river was awesome. Disliked the $8.00 fee for inner tubes for the lazy river but obtained voucher for one week's use by attending a 1 hr. timeshare sales presentation. Doesn't really matter - always found a whole bunch of unused floats literally "floating" down the lazy river. Pricing at the resort restaurants about $ 2-4 above the typical price for lunch or dinner. Grounds are GORGEOUS! Good security / checkpoint. *ROOM* 2 bedroom is almost 1,200 sq. ft. Full Kitchen, spa/jacuzzi in MB. washer/dryer, dishwasher, all utensils, porch, plasma T.V. in living room. Awesome Bonus Week Rate through RCI (< $500.00/ week). Everything looks BRAND NEW!!! *RESORT ACTIVITIES* Lots of golf, swimming, boating, music(S/M/W), luau (not worth it) *NOTES / TIPS* -Plenty of parking at River Island, but sometimes had to park about 2 blks away from unit. -Double check your reservation 72 hours before check-in (especially if your staying more than 1 week) -Don't buy groceries at the nearby Publix superstore at the entrance (way overpriced!) go down about 3 miles to the intersection of Hwy 192 / Hwy 27, .5 mi north there is a Super Wal-Mart with a large selection of Disney memorablia. -Super Target 4 miles east of entrance near S.H. 535 / Hwy. 192. -Avoid the timeshare presentation if you are short on time. -Lots of restaurants (the usual fare- McD's, Wendy's, Taco Bell) down Hwy 192. -Miniture Golf Pass for whole familiy / week for about $35.00 -Nice gift shop in the River Island Exchange (restaurant, burger shop, game room, exercise room, business/computer room,) *DISAPPOINTMENT* OLCC not having week 2 of my reservation in OLCC's reservation system - a near disaster for a planned 2 week vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: psummers_co
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orange Lake Resort July 6th through the 13th. This was a week traded through RCI. I must admit I was a little hesitant due to some of the previous reviews we had read on Travel Advisor. Well, I am here to tell you we had a wonderful time. My wife, our two teenage children and I had booked a two bedroom unit last March. At check-in we were told that we were being placed into the River Island portion of the complex. All I can say is WOW! Granted this is the newer part of the resort but it was fabulous. The décor, amenities and layout was perfect for us. The River Island water park (okay it’s not a full blown water park but it sure is huge) was a blast. Yes you have to pay to use the tubes for the Lazy River but in my opinion it was worth it. There are plenty of lounge chairs and we never had to search for a place to relax. There are slides, water volleyball games, refreshment cabana’s as well as pool side drink service. Yes the resort is huge and is best navigated by car, but they do have a shuttle service that ran on a fairly regular basis. We did go to a Timeshare sales presentation just to take advantage of the incentives. It was not high pressure at all and was well worth the discounts offered. Once we informed the sales staff that we were not going to purchase they finished the presentation and never contacted us again during our stay. Actually it was quite painless. My son and I golfed at the Legends golf course and had a great time. It sure was nice to have four different courses right there in the resort. All in all our experience was excellent and we will remember the Orange Lake Resort as one of our better family vacations. Oh, BTW – don’t get me started on heat in Orlando during July, but that’s another story. :0)

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: PaFungirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 8th stay at Orange Lake and I must say that you can't find a better deal any where on earth. We always stay for 2 weeks usually in the same villa the entire time. This year we switched to a 3 unit the 2nd week. There was no waiting, we were offered bell hop help wich we did not need. When my husband took the kids over to our 2nd unit it was by Legends and our kids were very unhappy because they weren't close to anything. The staff was very accomodating and switched us to a unit next to slash lagoon. There were some kids horsing around by the pool one night and it only took a comment to a staff member to have them removed. The club house is dated, but the renovations there begin in October and it will be as beautiful as river island. The staff at Orange lake are only as friendly to you as you are to them. We are there every 2 years and the people who have been there as long as we have visited remember us every year. I have never had a dirty room, and one year I complained about the dishwasher and 20 minutes later a brand new dishwasher was installed. We could spend our 2 weeks inside the resort and have a perfect vacation

Reviews.Title: “You must read this review!!!! not good!”
Reviews.Author: ABILLYBOY
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth, room in River island was in great shape, nice and new. The clubhouse area was an absolute mess, disgusting filled with un-supervised children & teens. I cannot believe that there is actually a restaurant in that facility. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. We visited all pool areas during our stay where I witnessed the following: VANS AND TRUCKS FULL OF CHILDREN (NON GUESTS) being let out at pools with no adults, clearly being dropped off for the day. I witnessed this on two seperate days and even asked teens at the pool where they were staying and they laughed. Anyone simply telling the guard that they are "Checking in" can get by security no problem. There was a TON of un-desirables throughout the property and for what it's worth my timeshare is now for sale as I am very disappointed at what this beautiful resort has turned into.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the resort, but it is very large”
Reviews.Author: girlsruleNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at Orange Lake. I was very nervous after reading numerous reviews about the resort. I was pleasantly surprised!!! After taking advice from other vacationers, we requested the East Village, and had a 2 bedroom villa. Very nice accommodations. We have 2 children, 5 & 6, who were thrilled with the resort. It is very large; you really need a car to get around. River Island is the big attraction ( we bargained for 4 tubes daily for free to take the 60 minute tour/sales pitch). You don't really need to rent the tubes, though. There were plenty of people without them in the pool each day. The great thing about River Island is it is so huge, that you can always get chairs. We had no problem arriving at different times: 11:00am, 1:30pm, 6:00pm, and had great lounge chairs/tables to sit at. There is so much going on at the resort, you really don't want to miss anything. We stayed at Disney for 3 days, prior to arriving at Orange Lake. So we had already done the theme parks; we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the resort, and will be returning next year for another visit. Splash Lagoon is the other water park. We visited that one evening and were not happy at all. So after an hour, we headed over to River Island, until closing. I recommend staying in either the East Village or River Island Village. It's the newest and best areas of the resort. We also made several trips to the Publix Supermarket. As with any supermarket, you go early/later in the day to avoid the long lines and crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked Orange Lake!”
Reviews.Author: short815
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake during the last week in June 2007. (This was actually our second trip to the resort.) We loved it each time we visited. Our accomodations were clean and spacious. There was alot to do at the resort creating alot of fun for our daughter (age 5). Disney is close by so that was also a plus. I would say the developer should work a little harder to keep up with the maintenance on the older units, but we were definitely happy there and will return. We stayed in the West Village (older area in 2007). We stayed in the North Village a few years ago. Never had to call maintenance about anything. I think this resort is great for families. It is large and we used our car to get around. I think if you are looking for pure luxury and a very "adult" experience -this is likely not the place. If you are looking for a fun, relaxing, middle class family vacation, this is the place. We liked it enough to purchase a small resale unit on ebay.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really Gold Crown?”
Reviews.Author: calif0rniam0m
Reviews.Content: Orange Lake...the pride of RCI in Orlando. Well, we just got back from a 2-week stay. We spent our first week in a studio in the West Village Clubhouse. If you like the dark & dingy feel of an inside cabin in an old cruise ship, with little light, a window that doesn't open and no proper ventilation, then this is the place for you. If you don't mind calling "housekeeping" at 4:00pm for missing supplies and getting a knock on your door at midnight, or having someone from that very same "housekeeping" dept. rapping on your door EVERY day at 7:30am to ask if you're checking out, then by all means book this resort. And if the picture on the TV comes in a little fuzzy, don't worry, the conversations you'll be able to hear coming from the hallway at all hours of the night and day will be enough to keep your family entertained. Or... there's always the free movies offered every night at the clubhouse theatre...as long as you don't mind the smell of a little urine or the sound of rowdy teenagers running rampant. And most surprising to us.. though most of the families that were there were just regular, hard working, decent folks trying to have a nice vacation, there was also a definite undesirable gang-like element whose intimidating and inconsiderate attitudes made it hard to believe we were actually staying at a Gold Crown resort and not some cheap, cheesy, roadside motel. Now, in all fairness, not all of Orange Lake resort is like this. But this is a HUGE place...as big as a town. And if you are unfortunate enough to be placed at the Clubhouse in the West Village, you are definitely on the wrong side of the tracks. The 2nd week we were mercifully given a 2-bedroom unit in the North Village. The unit was spacious and well kept and the grounds were lovely. But this did not make up for the fact that you had to load up the car and drive EVERY time you wanted to go to the pool. And if you wanted shade, you needed to wake up at the crack of dawn to get a good spot. The resort's newest attraction, the River Island water park, is great...if you're willing to fork out $10/day per inner tube (they don't let you use your own floating devices) and wall-to-wall people doesn't bother you. And if, while floating down that lazy river, getting stuck time and time again in a bottleneck traffic jam as bad as any outbound freeway in a major city on a Friday afternoon sounds relaxing to you, then Orange Lake is the place to be Oh, one more thing, if all I've described doesn't sound exciting enough and you're looking for some adventure and a "little" competition, don't miss Saturday afternoon grocery shopping at the Publix just outside the resort. Those 3000 other shoppers really give you a run for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake is Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Five's_a_Crowd
Reviews.Content: Intimate it is not. This place is huge but is neatly divided into four quarters, each with their own swimming and entertainment venue. One could easily never leave the campus and have a great vacation the whole time there. It appears golf-centric because there are at least two full courses but I'm not a golfer and enjoyed plenty of other things. We exchanged our South Africa timeshare for a three-bedroom, three-bathroom unit on the sixth floor of a six floor unit. Gorgeous. Our unit was in the newer East Village near the lazy-river. I've heard some stories about the older West Village but will not perpetuate rumors of which I can't substanciate. They looked fine when we drove past them daily. I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “River Island at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: kattimc
Reviews.Content: We have mixed feelings about Orange Lake - there were some definite high and low points. First off we stayed in the new River Island complex which was quite nice - very clean and upscale. We can't say enough about the ammenities here! River Island the waterpark was a ton of fun but crowded! We were there in the off season and by 11a it was packed, but you can't beat the lazy river. The staff at check-in was a bit abrupt and they do hard sell the condo "tours". As a matter of fact you can't get your parking passes w/o being coerced into taking the tour. The fire alarms kept going off during the week. We evacuated (for no reason) multiple times and one lady staying there advised us this happened to her the same time the previous year?!? Not sure what that is all about. However, you can't beat the location and it really is a nice play to stay and play.

Reviews.Title: “The West Villiage is Perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: IEAO
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 2 weeks at Orange lake. We arrived not knowing what to expect given some mixed reviews about the older West Villiage where we were staying. We were however delighted by the accomodation allocated to us which had recently been refurbished and refurnished, to a very high standard. We had a very spacious 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom property. Orange Lake is a vast, mainly timeshare resort, with thousands of units it does cover an enormous area though so you never feel crowded. Avoid their 'Vacation Ownership' sales staff, they are painful !! To get the most out of Orange Lake you have to be a golfer, however we did use the River Island water park area, which was great. If planning a vacation to Orange Lake do allow some time to enjoy the resort's facilities, we did only a little having pre-booked Disney, Universal tickets. etc..Only 15 minuites drive from most of the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “(Thank Heaven!) It was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: painefree
Reviews.Content: In fairness to the resort, I thought it was important that I post a review. After reading all the other reviews, I was WORRIED SICK about staying at this resort and booked a few extra hotels, "just in case", but I'm pleased to say that everthing worked out just fine. We stayed in one of the West Village towers June 1 - 8, 2007, Mom, Dad & 3 school agers (7-9-12) and I cannot complain about our accomodations. The condo was clean and spacious and with the door closed, we couldn't even hear our kids! I can't say it was meticulously clean, I brough Lysol and asked the kids not to walk around barefoot,but we checked under mattresses etc. and I was very comfortable staying there. Orlando has lizards and these annoying little "love bugs" this time of year, but we didn't have a bug problem in our room, though I heard that some others may have. We were happy to be on a higher floor for that reason. We didn't have any problems with customer service, though we didn't have many requests either. We received sales calls, but it was just as easy to not answer the phone. We made one service request about the toilet overflowing and they said they'd send someone up who didn't show, but it was getting late so I didn't worry about it. When we called the next morning, someone came and it turned out we had a plunger in the room all along, but he took care of it and we didn't have a problem anymore. We ordered pizza a few times to our room and came just as planned without incident. The kids LOVED the lazy river, the arcade and beach volleyball. It was SO nice to be able to have so much to do at the resort on our off days from the themes parks. Trust me, I'm pretty picky. Bad accomodations are a deal breaker for me. We checked in early (though the room won't open until later) and after we got the key, we went by the room and begged housekeeping to let us in to see the room. Once we saw it for ourselves we were okay. With a larger family and a modest vacation budget, we typically stay at the Residence Inn and I'd compare Orange Lake to that. It's not the Ritz, you may need to clean under the rim of your toilet and in the jets on your tub, but overall, it was a good stay. I'd pay about $125 a night to stay again...(this time we used a guest pass from a friend)

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: MarioW
Reviews.Content: I just came back from vacation in Florida. First part of our trip (me and my wife) was in Orlando. We stayed in Orange Lake Resort and Country Club for 4 days. When we got there, we were a little disapointed. We expected more after I had seen pictures on the expedia but our room was in the West Village (the oldest one). The room was supposed to be with 1 King SIze bed but we got room with 2 full size beds, and there was no other room for us. They advised us to call expedia because we booked through them. After this they wanted to invite us for free brakfast (to sell us the Time Share) but we didnt want it so they left us alone but stopped to be nice. The rest of our stay was good, nobody bodered us. We loved the River Island (the one on the pictures) lots of fun but the location is on the North Village so you need a car or use a shuttle to get there. The internet access is to expensive. 6$/hr is way too much. Over all I am happy. Mario

Reviews.Title: “Nickle and dime you to death”
Reviews.Author: GreenCJ
Reviews.Content: The resort was to big...I enjoy smaller resorts like Big Cedar close to Branson. We stayed at the River Village side with the large pool area. We were on the 5th floor overlooking the parking lot. The good side to that was watching the fireworks at Disney's Animal Kingdom at night. Our condo was a two bedroom and we were in the extra bedroom with four people...two crowded! They charge extra for everything. They wanted to charge us for extra dish washing detergent but after complaining they gave it to us. They charge extra to use the tubes in the lazy river. We called for extra towels because I didn't want to wash every day and the charge would have been $7.00 extra per day. The next time we go somewhere like this I will consider an all inclusive resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying in RiverIsland at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: GBGAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased when I found out that our reservations were for River Island. There is no better place for a family with children. First, the lodging: the River Island section of Orange Lake is the newest - opened in 2006. It has about 6 or 7 floors and is absolutely beautiful! The 1 bedroom was perfect for me, my husband and our 2 children (7 and 3). The bedroom was separate from the rest of the rooms, the children slept in the livingroom in the sofa-bed. Our unit looked like a model. Beautiful colors, very clean, modern - everything you would want and need. There was a kitchen with new appliances (of course), a dinette area, living room, bathroom (shower only) and a washer/dryer room. We were on the bottom floor, so our screened in patio led us right outside. Honestly, we couldn't have been more pleased. I can't speak for the other areas of Orange Lake, but from the outside, they looked nice - but not as nice as River Island. If you have children, the other advantage of staying in River Island is that the pool /water area is literally in your back yard. It's a HUGE pool with tons of pool chairs to use; I really enjoyed the lazy river where you could use their floats and float throughout the area. There was a large area with sand and hammocks as well. We didn't partake of the restaurants and gym in RiverIsland, but that was all very convenient as well. We ate one evening on the property - there was a Luau night on Thursday. I would pass on that...the food was okay, but they could have made it a bit nicer (served on paper plates, plastic utensils, etc.) for $20 pp. The entertainment was pretty good. The final advantage to this property is that it is literally 5 minutes from Walt Disney World! It is right down the street and that was extremely convenient. Would I stay here again? ABSOLUTELY if you could guarantee me that I would be in River Island. We were there for a whole week and I can't express how pleased I was with our accomodations!

Reviews.Title: “No worries , the West village is good !!!”
Reviews.Author: Kizzy10
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late having had a 9 hour flight to Miami then a 4 hour drive up to Orlando, so it was around 9pm. The check in was very quick and no sales pitches or pressure to attend any sales talks (maybe because I was prepared after reading other reviews and told them how tired we were !!) We already knew we would be in a West villa so were quite aprehensive. However the villa although a little old is wonderfully spacious and we looked out over the 9th hole. My son loved all the visiting wildlife and it was nice to have a patio to sit out at in the evening . Everything worked and it was clean and tidy. The furniture was spotless and the decor was lovely, the only fault is that the bathrooms are a bit small, but how long do you spend in them and the kitchen a bit outdated but had everything you needed. My husband checked out 2 of the villas when we at the pool at River Island and he said that he preferred where we were as the villas were much bigger and he thought that the whoever did the interior designing must be living in the past !!!!! They are also more like a hotel block with no luxury of a patio, just screened in balconies, I don't know about the other areas but this is just an opinion. We had messages on the phone everyday but just listened and then cancelled them, no-one bothered is at all during our stay regarding purchasing a unit. Staff were friendly and so were the people staying there, my son has made a freind who he will keep in contact with from Illinois. He used the Treasure cove arcade alot by the pool, not cheap so you have to make sure you don't let them have too much to spend, but it was good for him to go and make friends and get away from the heat. The love bugs at the North pool were relentless, so we gave up with that one and stuck to River Island. I think the charge for the floats is a bit much, ($10 for a double ring )but you could often share with other families and some people offered theirs up if they were leaving the pool area, which was really nice of them. All in all we had a lovely time and would stay again and I would recommend the West villas, the location is great too as we were able to walk to the club house. Depends how fussy you are about up to date mod cons !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “RIver Island is a nice building, with nice units!”
Reviews.Author: RuthLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I went to Orange Lake with my family of 3, and we were pleasantly surprised with the rooms at River Island. It is a timeshare, but very nice, if you get a room, try one facing the pool, instead of the parking lot. It has a beautiful view. The rooms are a very nice size, with Flat Panel Tv's, very nice! We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, it had a lot of seating, and tv's in both bedrooms, plus the flat panel in the living area and a full kitchen. The lobby, is not really a lobby, but just elevators to the 8 floors in that complex. But outside of the building there is some shopping and even a Starbucks. While we got there we did have to wait for housekeeping to finish cleaning our room, but only about 10 minutes...In my opinion it should be ready when they give you the key to your room. Also, they seem to keep the units pretty clean, the tiled area were a bit dirty, but not filthy, they should try cleaning them a bit better. During our 5 night stay, we even encountered the carpets being cleaned, which made the halls smell very nice, like a fruit smell, that was nice to see, there was a spot in front of our door, and when we came back from the pool it was all gone! It seems as though the property cares. I don't know about other areas mentioned in other peoples posts, but River Island is a nice Family resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Khaliah01
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great resort! I was so apprehensive after reading the other reviews of the West Villiage but, it was fabulous! Definitely 5 star's. We stayed in a 2BR, 2 bath villa in the West Villiage, the bathrooms were great, with the whirlpool bath tubs and granite counter tops. There was a full kitchen, dining room, and living room, along with a balcony complete with table, chairs, and loung chair for sunbathing. We rented a car (which I highly suggest) so we got to see the whole resort (which is huge) and all of the surrounding areas. The only restuarant we went to was The Girlling Co., the food was great, and so were the drinks. - Make sure you bring I.D. with you if you're a drinker, the first time we went I was unable to get served wine because I didn't have my I.D. (HELLO, it's vacation!). The pools were great, a lot of kids but, that's to be expected, the lazy river was really cute, and very relaxing. We did get one sales call to go to one of the seminars for the timeshare, we went, declined, and got $80 in food gift certificates for any of the restuarants or sevices on the resort. I would highly recommend this resort, and don't be afraid of the West Villiage, the only reason most people get placed there is because it's like 75% of the resort! Hope this helps : )

Reviews.Title: “Hated it! Spend your money elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Danamo
Reviews.Content: If you book a 1 bedroom suite or a suite with 4 queen beds be prepared to be disappointed. These room types are only available in the oldest (original) building on the property (WEST SIDE). It is not even close to 3 1/2 stars. It is Motel quality (low ceilings, bad furnishings, cheap sheets and noisy pipes and compressors) maybe 2 stars. It was clean, but horrible in every other way. My 4 year old son continually asked if we could leave. Even he did not like the room. If you book through Expedia you will be treated like a second class citizen. The front desk said "Sorry, if you are unhappy you need to call Expedia we cannot help you". To be fair, the East side of the resort was beautiful in every way. We did not see inside the rooms, but the outside looked very nice and modern. The pools were as good as we had hoped, but geared for children over 48 inches. We asked to pay extra to upgrade to the East side and they would not let us because we booked through Expedia!!!! The food was dreadful. We seriously think they may have been selling Pigeon breasts and passing it off as chicken. It was the worst chicken sandwich I have ever tasted. This was at the pool side grill so I did not have high expectations, but I really cannot explain how bad it was. The bartenders and servers were very friendly and helpful. Under no circumstance will they allow you to check in even a minute early. According to the front desk the locks are on timers and will not work until 4pm even if the hotel is half empty (which it was). Ridiculous! Children must be 48 inches tall to go down any of the water slides at the pools. My children are young and did not understand why they could not go. They cried and cried until we had to go to another pool with no slides. The lazy river pool was easily the best thing about this hotel and we could not enjoy it because of the slide rules. It would have been nice to know that before we booked. The resort is huge and unless you are lucky enough to be staying in the condos right by the lazy river pool you will have to drive or take the shuttle. Not fun. I think this place could be OK if you book directly through the resort and if you book a 2 or 3 bdrm condo. If we had been on the East side and our children a little taller, this would have been a very different review.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected !!!!”
Reviews.Author: enidminko
Reviews.Content: Well, where do i start ! My family & i (party of 6 adults) arrived at OL on Sunday 6th May at approx 1pm. We went to check in, expecting the worst news possible (to be allocated a West Village unit) - but to our delight, we were given the East Village - room 88116. It was a ground floor unit at the very end of the block - which backed directly onto a golf course. We were extremely happy with the unit (3 bed/3 bath) - it was spotless, in perfect working order & looked exactly like it does on their website. Couldn't have been happier with the location/standard of the place. The resort itself is massive & unless you're super fit - you have to drive everywhere - which didn't bother us at all. We didn't make use of many facilities during our 2 week stay - as we were at the parks every day. We did however use the small pool in the East Village - which was fantastic, hardly a person in sight most days!! Didn't use any restaurants - so cannot comment on them, although the menu's & prices looked reasonable. We did not get hassled at all to go on any timeshare tours etc, although we had several messages left on the phone (the phone does not ring though - just a little flashing light... not annoying in the slightest). We had a fantastic fortnight & would 100% return again. All the staff we encountered were friendly & helpful, so a big thumbs up to them. I am now very depressed to be home ! Hope this helps & enjoy if you're going ! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Orange Lake's West Village!”
Reviews.Author: GaTravelingfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake's West Village from May 12, 2007 thru May 19, 2007 as a family vacation. We had the two bedroom unit. When we read the reviews on trip advisor we were concerned but it turned out to be wonderful. We had plenty of room for the seven of us. The unit was just a the one shown on their website! The Olympic sized pool, beach and band stand pool were in within any easy walk. There were tennis courts, basketball courts and miniature golf very close by. The pizza restaurant was very reasonably priced. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. We did have a problem with the coffee maker and requested a replacement. This was taken care of within 30 minutes with apologies for the inconvenience. My husband took golf lessons with the golf pro being very friendly, patient and knowledgeable. The golf course was superb. This resort had all the amenities you could ask for - you didn't need to ever leave the resort! We look forward to visiting this resort again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: sarahdm714
Reviews.Content: We were referred by a timeshare owner. The first price quoted went up 3x times AFTER we booked the trip. Kept coming up with excuses that we had been given wrong prices. Likes: location-very convenient to Disney, restaurants various pools-best for ages 5-10 yrs old (slides too small for older children) 3x-bedroom set-up. Nice kitchen, living room, bedrooms Dislikes: -mowing the lawn (VERY loud) at 5:45 am 2x mornings in a row outside our room!!! -increased prices AFTER booking -RUDE staff: -in computer area (connections) in the main center...on their cell phone while answering questions, short, unfriendly -While driving, a shuttle bus was pulled over to the side. I slowed down, stopped behind it, then passed it, never going over 15 mph. The driver followed me from East village to West/Main check-in and said "didn't you see the sign to not pass the bus?" I said "no, I am sorry, I didn't" She said "sure you didn't" and gave me a thumbs up sign! I asked 5 other guests (all drivers) and none of them saw the sign. -room keys deactivated a few different times. When this happened, we called guest services. It took 30+ mins for someone to arrive with a new key. -River Grille was HORRIBLE! I explained that I have a cheese allergy. I asked for no cheese in my pasta dish and salad. The salad arrived, covered with parmesan cheese. I said that I was sorry, but could not eat the salad due to the cheese. She said "there isn't any cheese on this, honey" ...My husband had to point out the 1/4 cup of parmesan cheese to her. She brought over a second salad, also with cheese. It was under the lettuce, so didn't notice it by the time she left the table. THe manager came over to say hello, asked how everything was, and we nicely told him about my allergy and the cheese on the salad...he apologized, brought over a 3rd salad...you guessed it...mixed in the greens was cheese. I just shook my head and gave up. My pasta also had cheese in it. I just boxed it up and gave it to my husband for leftovers. UNBELIEVABLE!!!! Food that we did try was 'okay'...do not order the shrimp pasta dish-gross! -bugs bugs bugs....surronding pool area. But it unbearable to sit on lounge chairs. Hundreds of them!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Fantastic - Loved it (West Village Too !!) - Going Back Next Year!!!”
