Reviews.Author: WelshGirlCardiff
Reviews.Content: Having booked this resort for 12 months, and following all the reports on here, I was a little worried to say the least! (Well, actually I was dreading getting a West Village room!) ...... but .... what a suprise .... HAVE I JUST COME BACK FROM A DIFFERENT RESORT???? ... We stayed there for 3 weeks from the UK, and loved EVERY minute of it. When we checked in, it was speedy and the reception staff were helpful. No delays, no problems and certainly no lack of information. The directions given to us initially, was to look out for a "swamp" (This worried me to say the least) ... when we got to the room, it was actually the FISHING LAKE!! Please don't be put off by the description. The location of this room was totally unsuitable, as we were travelling with our 4 year old twin boys. Although it was ground floor, there was no screened in balcony, and nothing to stop them from falling into the water, as the room was LITERALLY next to the lake - about 10 feet away? After going straight back to reception, the second man we saw was very apologetic, and understanding (as he has small children himself) and thought that maybe we were given this room as we wanted to stay in the same room for the 3 consecutive weeks, but swiftly changed our rooms .... the second room was 4013, and absolutley great! The allocation was sort of a 2 bedroom bungalow (semi-detached to a 2-floor block) On entering the room, it was SPOTLESS. The room has been completely refurbished (as have ALL the Villas/Rooms/Apartments in the West Village). The washer and seperate dryer were brand new, and came in VERY uselfull during ur stay. The kitchen had marbled work surfaces, and every part of the place was splotlessly clean, and everything matched - even the wallpaper and curtains (believe me, I have read complaints about this too!!!) We ordere pizza onsite the first night, and it was quick, and gorgeous! We picked up basic breakfast provisions, planning to go to the Super WalMart the following morning. The days that weren't spent at WDW were at River Island. Mainly as we were travelling with 4 year olds, the pool(s) and fountains were more suitable. The pools are beach style (zero inch entry, and maximum 4ft 2inches by the pool volleyball nets. The lazy River was brilliant, and you could go in there with arm bands on (or smaller floaties for babies - the sort they sit in with a solid bottom and holes for legs - not smaller rubber rings which were not allowed in ANY part of the pool, neither were float boards) It seems that maybe our expectations of a resort appear to differ from a lot of othe people. The flashing red light on the phone didn't make any noise, so you could ignore it if you wanted (it was no big deal, just listen to the pre-recorded message, usualyy for golf lessons etc, or just press the button and put the phone down on the unit and carry on with whatever you were doing. Go back in a few minutes and hang up once the message had finished! We were bothered by ANY live calls, although we had about 2 or 3 messages left every week. Yes, this respirt is very big, and a car is DEFINATELY an advantage, and necessity for most, but there were shuttles that ran from designated spots every 20 minutes to every pool and resort activity. We went to the sales tour, and did not feel under any pressure to buy at all, and in fact, found the tour and information very uselful. We would seriously consider buying here if we did not already have financial commitments. In fact, we are going back there next year, and it's already booked !!! The only complaints I could make was that there was no screened in balcony on the West Village buildings, and was not pleasant to sit out of an evening (lots of bugs). There are NO COMPLAINTS about the room, cleanliness, decor, staff, food - in facrt anything! We knew beforehand the size of the reort, so this was no suprise. Having stayed at other Timeshare resorts, we were also well aware of sales pitch etc, and a polite"No Thank You" ALWAYS works. Please feel free to e-mail me if I can add anything further for you. We loved this place, and as I said, definately coming back. The staff were brilliant, and the one occassion a maintenece man came out to fix our sliding door, he was there within 20 minutes and very pleasant and informative about the reort and wildflife. Talking of wildlfe ... we had the pleasure of feeding squirrels and Ibis every morning, and a lovely racoon came by almost every evening. (For a City girl, these were treats) but the best thing had to be the 2 parents and 2 young Cranes that appeared about 7.30am every morning. They were very tame, and I hand fed them peanuts. It was so sweet!! There is nothing to worry about at all with the West Village. It is brilliant..... go there, enjoy it - you are on vacation after all.

Reviews.Title: “Service was very bad”
Reviews.Author: sweetasarose
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The room was nice. The pools were nice except they are not as spectacular as the photos indicate. The slide in splash lagoon is for small children. In the picture it looks like it's for teenagers and adults. The service was terrible. Here is a list: 1) 2-3 phone calls daily trying to sell us something. I called three times trying to get the phone turned off so we wouldn't get that annoying blinking red light with sales messages on it. 2) One day we walked into our condo, making all the racket a family does. My little girl walks into the bathroom and encounters a strange man in there. It was a repair man (who had come to the wrong room). Now, I understand that mistakes like that happen. But he should have announced himself when we walked in instead of hiding in the bathroom. My little girl was pretty frightened. 3) I walked to the desk where tickets are sold and asked what we could do besides going to a theme park. The answer was: Why did you bother coming to this resort if you weren't going to go to a theme park? Evidently the person who said that was the manager! 4) We went to the sales presentation (felt like a cattle call). When touring one of the pools, the sales person pointed out a bar and said (in front of my children) "this is where you can get drunk and make fools of yourselves." Then said to me "Your husband has a big stomach. I bet he drinks a lot of beers". Needless to say I was so stunned and hurt I just mumbled that we rarely drink. 4) The housekeeping staff rang our doorbell at 8 am the day of checkout then ran down the stairs. We found out later that they did that to several guests who were checking out that day. 5) There are many other times the staff was just rude or stupid that I was starting to wonder if there was something I had done! I've tried to talk to the supervising staff. One was sympathic but the other made it plain that she was only saying some things so I would go away. I do not think any of the staff who made rude remarks to me will be talked to or disciplined. I would not go back if they gave me a free week.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: noelle1156
Reviews.Content: I exchanged my timeshare week to Orange Lake and was disappointed! It is an OK resort, not Gold Crown Standards. Positives: - close to Disney- about 10 minutes to main gate. - close to restaurants- right off the main strip - very nice pools- I have 2 toddlers and they loved the pools because the ones we went to were shallow enough that they could stand. Other pools were deeper. - Pizza restaurant was good - Grounds itself are clean Negatives: - Front Desk did not tell me anything about the resort. They just provided a map. - No free maid service. I had no idea where to put my garbage that was piling up after a week. No change of towels unless you request. - Fire Ant hill right on the edge of the walkway where you park the car. I had no idea that the mound of sand I saw was a fire ant hill until my sister who lives in Florida told me. My kids could have inadvertantly stepped on it. - Unit was nice, but had missing light bulbs, no dish drain,. - Resort charges about $2 a call for 1800 numbers ( when using your calling card) - Playground was nice but pretty worn out. No swings. Very small - Our unit was right on the golf course which was nice, except you had to worry about getting hit by a golf ball or golf cart if you went on the grass. ( even at night) - Much too big. You need a car to go to the pool for most units. To go to other pools ( river, splash pool) it took us almost 10 minutes to drive. There is a shuttle that runs pretty frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: ErinEP
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Orange Lake during the third week of April. Overall we enjoyed our stay, but it was rocky at the start. Online it tells you to get off of I-4 on exit 64B, but it is just exit 64, the roads have changed, and at first we drove by the exit. When we found our way to Orange Lake we were initially put in the West Lake Village. Our unit was a one floor home that looked like a small ranch house. When we entered our unit we were very discouraged because it was just so old. The washer and dryer was in the kitchen which had rough floors, the living room had a small couch that only could sit three small people at most, and out of the living room was a small patio. The patio had just a plastic chair and table set that looked upon one of the golf courses. The patio just was not very appealing, and the doors going to it were hard to open and very dirty. The bedrooms/bathrooms were the worst. The second bathroom was as big as a small hall closet. The bathtub was dirty, and small but took up most of the space. It was old and needed to be replaced. The master bath did not have a jacuzzi like all of the other units in the resort. The televisions were as old as the unit, 25 years old. We were fed up, and called the front desk to ask for a unit change. We were especially mad to learn that our family member with a guest certificate was staying in the East Village. They had no issue moving us to the same building as our relatives. The East Village was so beautiful, the building we were placed in had six floors. Our unit was on the fourth floor with a view of the Legend's Golf Course and Club House. The unit had nice yellow walls with cheerful decor that consisted of a sectional couch, dining room set with a bench, a kitchen with a bar area and an enclosed patio. The bedrooms were a good size however the beds were nothing to rave about. The master bedroom had the jacuzzi I was wishing for, and a large vanity area. To take a virtual tour of the unit just go on www.orangelake.com. We were very pleased except for the fact that we did not get our welcome kit that should have had paper towels, coffee, dish liquid soap plus salt and pepper. A call to the front desk took care of the problem. The pool for the East Village is a best kept secret because it hardly ever has a person in it. The crowds flock to the River Island which is quite spectacular with its lazy river, but it is always too full with small children. Many do not pay attention when they are swimming down it and tend to run into people. I would stick to the other village pools. The shopping in the River Island is nice because it has a Starbuck's and a nice gift shop area. Overall we had a nice time and would go back to the East Village, I highly recommend asking for the area when you check-in. At night you can see the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom in the East Village. I recommend bringing golf clubs because the courses are great especially the Legends designed by Arnold Palmer.

Reviews.Title: “Average resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: NjGgg
Reviews.Content: .The unit is old with lots of bugs! 2.port-a-crib instead of normal full size crib! 3.our light was not working! The pools and location are good!

Reviews.Title: “All Lies From Start To Finish !!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: john0506
Reviews.Content: Well lets start with what I was told when I booked my so called "breath-taking" room! The woman I spoke to on the telephone to book my reservation told me the room was so nice that we would not believe it ! So I thought that $149.00 for three nights plus the additional $124.00 per night for two nights more (we stayed a total of 5 nights) was a good deal. Boy was I in for the shock of my life when checked in at the front desk. Check in time was at 4:00 PM. We did not arrive until 9:00 PM. The woman at the front desk said that our room was dirty and not ready yet ! WE BOOK A MONTH AHEAD OF TIME!! So she said no problem, I have a different room for you (nicer)! So she left the front desk to check to see if the second room she suggested to us was ready. A half hour or so she returns to the front desk and says that room was not ready either as it was also not clean! She stated she wouldl find us a better room while looking in her computer. Her statement: at last I found you one! She gives us our room cards and directs us to our room. By now its 10:30 PM. We are very tired from our long trip to Florida, and we were not in the best of moods. To go to our room, we were heading to the basement level passing the boiler room. I do believe it was an entrance for the maintenance staff. When I opened the door to the room the moldy smell was to much for me!! So back to the main desk. The woman at the front desk said she could not change the room after the room cards where made! So we had to go to the Customer Service desk. When we arrived there the woman working there said that she was closing for the night and could not assist us! So now what do we do!!! I then asked for the Manager who was very nice. He found us a room, but it was very dark (window was overlooking Game/Reception room and meeting hall inside the building! We had no natural sunlight in the room and the Game/Reception room held functions nearly every night with the loud sounds of the functions being held blaring in our room. We could not even hear ourselves think. We were there for 5 nights and never once had maid service. The rooms were very old, and the air conditioning unit in our room constantly made very loud "cranking" noises. We kept waking up during the nights thinking someone was trying to enter our room. We also ran out of toilet paper so I went to the front desk to get a roll. The woman at the front desk asked me for my room number and stated she will send someone with the toilet paper to our room. Well, I never did get any toilet paper. I went to a local store and bought some! On May 9, 2007, we went on our scheduled Time Sharing Tour. Mo, our Time Share Representative, who guided us, was very nice. We explained to Mo that we were very negative on the Resort because of the room we were placed in. We voiced our concerns and stated that because of the room we were placed in, how could anyone say YES in buying a Time Share in Orange Lake Resorts. Mo stated that we were not the first to complain about the rooms; that we should have been placed in a Villa. He stated that Orange Lake Resorts were using an outside Marketing firm who were responsible for placing us in the room we were in, and that Orange Lake's was going to release this outside firm from their contract in June, 2007. I explained that apparently, Oramge Lake does not seem to be concerned with the welfare of the clients if they allow this firm to place them in dark, old, dingy rooms, and not one of the beautiful Villa's they have on sight and that we were promised. Once out tour was completed, the Tour representaive thanked us for our time, and did not offer to drive us back to our car at the Tour Reception Center. We were left "stranded" and walked the long distance back to the Tour Reception center to retrive our car. One last note: the grounds and pools at Orange Lake Resort are beautiful, but the service and rooms they put you in have a lot to be desired. To anyone wanting to go to this Resort, make sure that you get in writing that you WILL be placed in one of the new Villa's, and not the old hotel room that we were placed in.

Reviews.Title: “River Island did not disappoint...”
Reviews.Author: thedcdiva
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the River Island complex at Orange Lake. We had a lovely, well-equipped two bedroom unit overlooking the pool complex. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the unit -- two large bedrooms, one with a king, the other with two queens, two large bathrooms, a full size kitchen including a full size washer and dryer. We had four adults and two children and never felt cramped. The pool area could get crowded and chairs were sometimes hard to find. But overall it was well maintained, with plenty of towels and a nice pool side bar. Across the pool complex there were a few decent shops and restaurants. It's a timeshare property, so don't expect daily linen service and fresh daily towels. But we had a few minor problems when we checked in (i.e., the safe could not be programmed), but they were quickly addressed by staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: luvmiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lakes April 22-27 in the WEST VILLAGE. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice, clean and spacious our 2 bedroom condo was. There were two couples and an infant staying in the condo and we had plenty of room and did not feel crowded at all. The master bedroom had a king size bed with a full bath and the other bedroom had 2 queen size beds with a separte bath also. The one thing I did not like is you have to drive to all of the pools, or you are in for a major walk. The walk is just too far, which is kind of an Inconvenience. The pools were warm, clean and beautiful. I would recommend Orange Lakes for a vacation in Orlando, but I personally would rather be on the ocean, so we probably would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “First Time- Great Time!! I Miss It!”
Reviews.Author: toosure
Reviews.Content: We were there from 04/21- 04/28 2007. We are in our mid-late 20's and we had a WONDERFUL TIME! This resort has it all. Yes, some areas look slightly outdated but whatever. The room was great, we were in the east village. We went to River Island and ate at all the places to eat besides Kemmons. Everywhere was great food. I loved the jacuzzi in my room- what a treat! Our room was clean and I inspected first, no complaints. It was very family oriented.. not loud with crazy people running around. Very close to alot of attractions and overall we had an awesome time. The pools are great. So what if you have to drive to them or whatever. No biggie. Nothing is perfect, but Orange Lake was just a wonderful experience. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sanitary”
Reviews.Author: NikkiIndiana
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Orange Lake. We were there the first week of spring break so it was very busy. We expected this to be the case and that part didn't really bother us. The facilities are nice but they are not particular on cleaning especially around the pool areas. During our stay we were at the River Island Pool and POOP found in the pool ( We were right by the employee who retrieved it). I realize that this does happen with kids but normally they would evacuate and drain the pool (happen to us at a Disney Resort before). They did NOTHING. When we arrived home two days after this incident my two children (who love to swim) ended up getting a bacteria infection on their skin and the doctor said it was most likely from a public pool/ hot tub. They needed an antibiotic to clear it up. Coincidence? I THINK NOT!

Reviews.Title: “What a Complete Delight!! ”
Reviews.Author: JumpstartMichigan
Reviews.Content: Ok people, I worked myself into a complete worry in thinking what "could of been" from these reviews posted on this site. BUT I'm hear to tell my great story. Our family of 7 stayed at the WEST VILLAS on Spring Break and I think we used everything available and loved it. Our room was a 2 bed 2 bath unit (#2494) and it was decoreated cottage style. Our check in took literally 3 minutes. We checked in on a Sun. around 5:00. We choose to do all our grocery shopping at Publix 1/2 mile away. They had events that went from morning until night. I personally enjoyed the poker tournements. The tennis courts, volleball areas, and basketball courts were all easy to get to and NEVER had to wait. The pool areas were busy but easy tolerated due to the fact our kids were there to swim and I loved to sit in the shade. We golfed on two courses and got a Starbucks every morning. We checked out every area of the complex and could see no differnce from West side to the East side. We ate at one of the poolside restruants for lunch, tastey and fair priced. Our family did travel to Cocoa beach for the day and loved it (1 hour dive) we have gone to Disney many times and chose to go to Typhon Lagoon for one day. I hope this helps all of you with your decision to stay here. Feel free to contact me by e-mail w/any ? I have tons more that I could offer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MikeSouthCoastUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in middle of Feb 2007 - what a fantastic place. Stayed in one of the 3 bed appartments. Clean and modern. Our appartment had a view of the golfcourse. Splash lagoon, the new water area was excellent - so good did not bother going to the Disney water park! It was not overcrowded. It was so good we brought a timeshare (we had looked at others but this impressed us the most). Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “exellent”
Reviews.Author: mrmonkfish65
Reviews.Content: this was our first use of our timeshare,we were very nervous after reading some of the negative reviews on trip advisor.we are not owners at orange lake but we are rci members.our accommodation was a villa on the west village,it was clean spacious and quiet,cant see what all the fuss was about re west village,the amenaties are exellent especially if you play golf,water sports or tennis.We never used the pools but they looked really good although very busy.We would certainly stay there again and has made us glad we bought our timeshare, if this is what we can expect for future holidays.Also the location was ideal for visiting the parks,but if anyone is not hiring a car i would re think and get one hired as the shuttles were quite expensive.well done orange lake..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Time Share”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru2007
Reviews.Content: We are not timeshare owners and after this experience we have no desire to ever visit a timeshare. Our friends who have a timeshare had Orange Lake call us to present a sales pitch to convince us to stay at Orange Lake for $400/5 days. We thought it sounded reasonable and the salesperson said a modest downpayment was due. We agreed and paid $223.00. 1 month later I have a medical condition that is going to prohibit me from traveling to FL in the next 6-9 months. They told me "so sorry" but they could only extend the deal through December and thereafter if we agreed to pay $50.00 more then they could extend the deal for 3 months in 2008. I told them that we would prefer to be reimbursed because there is just no guarantee of our travel. I asked to be reimbursed and then we could decide whether or not to travel to Orange Lake in 2008. They said that they were sorry but they would not reimburse us. After all of the awful stories we've read on trip advisor, this just confirmed everything negative others have said about this place. While we may have traveled here in 2008, now we know for sure that we will never visit Orange Lake. Stay away and know that they are lying from the moment they make you the great offer to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A+ resort - but Beware of high pressure to BUY!”
Reviews.Author: OakFamily
Reviews.Content: We traded with RCI over a yr ago to Orange Lake for March Break, but was very concerned re: all the mixed reviews here. In fact, we stayed in the North Village and LOVED it! The condo was beautiful, backed onto a golf course and could walk to a fabulous pool area great for small children. The larger water park was VERY busy - only went once. Here's the catch - even tho we own with RCI, they still tried to sell us - HARD. We were offered discounted Disney tickets and told ours would be only a 60 min presentation to current owners - ours was just over that, but we were very firm from the beginning that we were NOT interested. I understnad that some couples were high pressured for over 2 hours. Then we had to wait in line for over 2 hours to get our voucher (with everyone else who declined to buy). I even went back in the PM after the morning rush and still had to wait that long. I am sure the people who did buy or upgrade did not have to wait in that line! I understand they want to sell units, but I was very disappointed about the lie told that it was only going to be one hour. It's hard to say if the $ saved was worth 3 hours of my time on my first day of vacation. I would likely not do that again. Beware of the high pressure sales tatics!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place depending upon your location”
Reviews.Author: amy006
Reviews.Content: West Village - the units that have not been remodeled are as bad as everyone says they are. Everything is old, saggy and outdated. It is not ideal for children because the main pool in this village is not heated. I wouldn't want to swim in an unheated pool, either! We stayed in the East village in a 2 bdrm unit and were very happy. It looks just like the pictures on the website. We exchanged our week through RCI and this is considered a Gold Crown resort. I would say it is if you don't get stuck in one of the older units in the West village. There are new swim areas in the North village and River Island village that we liked a lot for our 4 1/2 and 2 yr children. Very kid friendly there. My only complaint about the resort is how big it is and the time it takes to get from one village to another. With 2 small children, it is not easy to walk to another village to use the pool or eat, etc. My idea of a vacation is not about getting in a car and driving to the pool but that is what we had to do. There is a spring fed lake on the property with a nice beach with beach chairs. It is a nice change from the pool. The main reception area has a Disney Planning desk which was very helpful. You can ask questions, make reservations, and buy tickets. There is also a general store in this building which is helpful if you just need one or 2 things. The Publix is just outside the entrance to the property. We ate lunch twice at the River Island Grilling co. - the flatbreads are great! Also ate dinner there and had good food. We ate dinner at the Legends sports bar which is the golf clubhouse and had good food there, too. From the time we left our unit to the Main St entrance of the Magic Kingdom was about 45 minutes. Downtown Disney area was a little less time. We can't stay there for another 3 years with RCI but I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Not for us”
Reviews.Author: urkidn
Reviews.Content: Exchanged through RCI and upon check-in we were assigned to the dreaded "West Village". Asked to be moved, and told the usual "we're fully booked, etc". After much persistance, we were finally given a unit in the East Village overlooking the golf course. which is exactly as shown on the website so we were happy. The plastic bag containing unit supplies for 8 people for a week was a joke, 1 roll of paper towels, 3 dishwasher tabs, 3 rolls of toilet paper, 1 box of tissues, 2 garbage bags, etc. We only ate onsite once, at the Legends Grill. Food and drink was expensive and quality was marginal at best. Houlihan's across from the resort on Hwy 192 became a favourite. They have a happy hour that runs from 2-6 and 9-CL with $1 beer & $2-4 drinks and $5 appies and meals. This resort nickels and dimes you to no end, $1/phonecall, $9 for a pool ring/day, $5 for a ride on an inflated slide, unless you opt for the $36 weekly pass, mini-golf was $9/person. There was no menus for the onsite restaurants in our unit nor was there a local phone book, tried to get one but was told they didn't have any. The timeshare presentation was a nightmare. "Kim" told us that since we are already owners elsewhere, we could have$160 for 2 couples to attend a 1 hr tour so we could go back home and encourage others to go there. Arrived on time but waited 20 min. for our guide, Billy. 5 min into the tour, we told him we had a tee off time in 1 1/2 hours and he abruptly closed his books and said it wasn't enough time and refused to continue. He stated that there was no such thing as a 1 hr tour and that he was giving us the usual sales presentation. We wasted another 15 min filling out a "report" and were offered no compensation whatsover for our time. Golf fees have gone up considerably in the span of a year and if you're staying in the West Village, bring helmets for the kids because your yard is the fairway. I saw shots that landed within a couple of feet of someone's patio! On our last day, the maid was at our door, 8:00 and again at 8:50. Very annoying! On a postive note, upon check out we asked to have our phone charges reduced because of the timeshare experience and they knocked $39 off the bill. Overall, with so many choices in Orlando, we will definately not be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “All OK Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: hacksawCanada
Reviews.Content: In a nut shell, Very Good! We went as a family with 3 children ages 14,11,7. We had a two bedroom condo in the West Village. I read the reviews and I was alittle scared but decided to go anyways. I was glad that we did. The accomodations where very nice. We had fridge, stove, washer dryer it was all good. We drove down the road to the WALL-MART spent $150.00 and got enough groceries to last the week. We took mom out to dinner 4 times and I cooked dinner the other nights. The pool in the west village was awsome, the kids loved it plenty of towels, lounge chairs, nice music. Good family vacation. Staff was friendly and very helpfull. Our blender broke, I called front desk and in 18 minutes there was a very nice man at the door with a new blender. Shuttle was great as the place is very large. Get the all week pass for mini-putt, $32.00 much cheaper than $6.00 each per round, and we putted every day some times twice all for the one price of $32.00. Do yourself a favour, drive east on the 192 and go to Melbourn. Its about an hour drive through the beautiful country and you end up at the beach. CLEAN and FREE. The kids got to see and swim in the Ocean We continued on the A1A up to Cape Canaveral and returned back. Dislikes where very little. No internet in room, I had to go to main building and wireless was very slow. OK so your on vacation who needs internet. Well unfortuantley being self employeed I did need to check e-mails. The arcade in the main building was very run down and stinky. BUT in the North village they had a brand new arcade and the kids loved it. Lazy river... waste of money for tubes. We spent the $44.00 to rent tubes, the kids fell off them and they where a waste of time. We returned them no money back, and just floated and had way more fun. Forget Dysney, we spent the money at a DISCOUNT travel place and got cheap tickets to Universal Studios. The kids had more fun at ORANGE LAKE resort. No fitness centre, just a cardio room for those that work out every day you will be doing push-ups in your room and chin ups on light posts. You will get a message on the phone every day telling you about all the great deals you can get if you listen to their sales speach. Well just say NO THANKS, and continue on your day. So to sum it all up YES it was a good vacation and if you get the chance to go, DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation at Orange Lake!”
Reviews.Author: bjh5
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about our vacation after reading the reviews of Orange Lake on this site, but I had been worrying for nothing. We booked our stay through RCI, so I was expecting to stay in the West Village, but I was very pleased to find out our condo was in the North Village. We were in a building of 6 units - 2 uppers, 4 lowers, right on the golf course. Our two bedroom, two bath unit was very clean and well-stocked. The furniture and linens were in excellent condition. We loved having a full-sized washer and dryer. It allowed us to travel with much less luggage... a must when traveling with children. The units were very quiet - I never heard our neighbors or street noise. We liked that the complex was close to a Publix supermarket as well as other resturants along HWY 192. We did not have to go through any high-pressured sales pitches, although it was annoying to be asked to attend a tour just to get our parking pass. I firmly told the woman behind the desk that I wasn't interested and that we already had our park tickets. She didn't press the issue any further, which was great! We felt that the complex seemed to be geared towards older people and of course golfers. If you love golf, this is the place to be. The pool complexes offered something for everyone. We did not eat at any of the on-site restaurants. The one thing that I did not like was on the day of check-out we had a housekeeper at our door at 8:30 asking when we would check-out. We told her 10:00 (check-out time) but at 9:50 there was another housekeeper there wanting to get into the room to start cleaning. Orange Lake seems to be very strict about their check-in and check-out times. This was the only time that we have traveled that we were not allowed to check in early and were hurried out the door. I would definitely stay at Orange Lake again, and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes, what a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: sjwass
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed there for a family trip to Disney. The check in process was smooth except for the overly pressured sales pitch you had to tolerate to get your parking pass. When we checked into the unit, I was surprised at how dated the decor was. But the furnishings were acceptable. The bathroom was dirty and dingy, and there were dead bugs behind the toilet! The resort also didn't provide any extra trash bags. When we called the front desk to ask if we could have some extra bags, they treated us rudely and told us it was our responsibility. So that meant I had to go buy trash bags at my expense of money and time-not something I want to do on vacation. Also, they let the trash pile up outside near the trash cans for 3-4 days at a time. It was obvious that critters were feasting nightly as the ripped trash bags showed. After a couple of days the smell and sight we had to see every time we went in or out of our front door was quite nauseating. The pools were nice and amply stacked with pool towels. The golf courses were nice and the golf staff was friendly and professional. The restaurants were a mixed bag. The seafood grill restaurant was fabulous and we had a great meal there, but some of the other restaurants weren't even open when they were supposed to be. Overall, we had a great trip-mainly because we didn't spend too much time at Orange Lake. Oh, I almost forgot the daily call inviting us to the "sales pitch breakfast." One morning it came at 8 am. Totally irritating. Like I would ever buy here. I have no idea how it maintains a gold crown RCI rating. When I take my family back to Orlando, rest assured I would rather pay for a friendlier place than use my RCI week and be treated rudely. I really hope they read the reviews here because the resort has such great potential, but falls flat in so many areas.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: Teddy10572
Reviews.Content: We checked in promptly at 4pm. The two bedroom unit was very outdated. Carpet, furniture, bathroom fixtures, bedding and appliances were worn and had seen better days. There was a huge puddle of water under the washer that extended out into the middle of the kitchen floor. I immediately returned to the front desk and was directed to guest services. The service rep was rude and informed me that their policy was no changing units and she would sent maintance to fix the washer. I informed her that my policy was to accept an unit that was clean, bug free and in good working order from the onset and would accept no less. She refused to get the manager. So I took off my coat and sat down. I told her I would stay sitting at her desk as long as it takes to resolve this matter. After she got up several times and went into different offices, she came back about 30 minutes later and announced that the manager had found another unit. Orange Lake definitely has some staff training issues. Although, the second unit had been completely remodeled, I would not recommend this resort to my friends or family due to the poor customer service and unnecessary stress I encountered.. Beward, you are taking your chances if stay at this resort. If you don't luck out and get a renovated unit, your vacation may be ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Worst time share ever”
Reviews.Author: manneAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in over 20 timshare resorts over the last 10 years and have always been satisfied but this is the worst. We actuaky forfited our accomodation and checked into a different hotel and paid again. The resort room was accessed down stairs through the restraunt area and into the Piza shop dining area there is a door leading to a corridor also used as a service ally by all the cleaning and restrant staff to remove garbage and soiled linen ( of which several trollies full line the corridor. At the end of this coridor is a door to a new narrow passage of which approx 12 rooms are accessed ( I call them rooms and not suits as that is what they are) The room was dark and gloomy with a small outside window. No washer or dryer. The small kitchenet was actualy in the room. The TV was 20 years old with one of those old radio remotes and had very bad reception and color. No internet avaiable in the rooms only in the club house at their internet cafe. Room was in a terible state of repair with a broken closet door which did not close and hit the front door when you tried to entre the room, Had to step inside and close the front door before you could enter thr room, As the closet door was in the way. Tried to complain and asked for a new room or was prepared to pay for an upgrade to a two bedroom unit. was told cannot move as we were a RCI client. I we manted a new room we would have to pay $258 per day. As we were not going to pay $258 a day to stay in this dump. We left and checked into the Sheriton Vista resort at $156 per day. It is a 5 star resort were we were verry happy and would recomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: AuroraIL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Orange Lake though an RCI exchange and of course was placed in the West Village (do not look at the pictures in Orange Lake's website when deciding to stay here, I'm assuming they are of their newer units), that wouldn't have bugged me so much but we made these reservations 8 months ago and were given a unit that overlooked US 192 which is a busy highway in Kissimmee. To make matters even worse our one bathroom still had human waste in the toilet from the previous guests, not the nicest way to start our vacation. We tried to get a new unit, but were of course told they were "full." For the number of RCI points used this place was a dump to me. The room was average and all of the resorts amenities cost money, including getting a tube to use in the new river island complex. Plus none of the staff here seemed very friendly, especially the front desk staff. These are not things I would expect from what is supposed to be a "Gold Crown" resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hanoli2
Reviews.Content: We swapped our timeshare to stay here. This place is of top quality. We stayed at the North Village in Orange Lake and it was definitely a place we will always remember. Beautiful property and awesome pools and excellent location. Rooms are gorgeous (this is in the newer section) and beautifully maintained. Only complaint of the resort are the kids activities that are scheduled. Either no one shows up or they only last a few minutes. So much more they can do with this. The golf is great here. I like the par 3 nine hole and my husband (which I didn't play) loved the 18 hole course. SO close to all parks. Can only stay here as a guest every four years so take it if you can get it!

Reviews.Title: “Our first stay as owners...mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: JEMWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We are owners since April 2005 and last week we spent our first week staying at Orange Lake in our East Village two bedroom villa. Overall the unit was very nice, in good repair as it really is only about 2 years old. Overall was quite clean but...one disturbing thing...over the toilet ON THE CEILING in the master bath there was a glob of something my husband stated was, uhhh, fecal matter, to be polite. I didn't get up on a chair to investigate though...ugh. I just used the other bathroom since there was just the two of us. I did notice spots on the tile floor in the master bath also which led me to believe it had not been mopped. The second bathroom is perfectly nice but it would benefit greatly from a hairdryer installed in there. Also, one of the towel rings must have been recently installed as it still had half the neon green price sticker still attached to it's face plate. A little attention to detail here would go a long way. They supplied us with plenty of towels and facecloths, especially since the unit sleeps 8 and there were just two of us. The first couple days I was there had breathing difficulty (whereas I do not normally) when sitting on the sofa because of the scented cleaners they use presumably to freshen the fabrics. Kitchen was very well equipped and washer/dryer were fantastic. We had enough supplies provided by the management to get us through the week. Except for coffee, which you can pick up at the Publix right at entrance to resort. You get a starter pack of toilet tissue, trash bags, facial tissues, dishwasher detergent, dish soap, coffee, tea, creamer and sugar, also a box of laundry detergent. You can pick up more and softener at the Walgreens at the west entrance. We had plenty of dishes, glassware, baking dishes, and utensils. We ate at a couple of the onsite restaurants. Paisan Pizzeria was very good. Had subs there one day, pizza another night, all good. River Island Grilling Company...oh my...it was crap. Poor service, had to wait very long to get our cold tasteless food served by incompetent girl who didn't even bring half our stuff but offered to bring me my side dishes after I had finished. Hello??? She was just plain not good at waitressing. She kept walking up to our table and just staring at us eating. Creepy. Good thing we were using vouchers we had received from sitting through the "owner update" (aka 2 hours of pressure to upgrade our unit ownership. They do get a bit "testy" when they can't convince you. Consider yourself warned) or I would have been livid. It was a shame to waste our vouchers on this substandard meal though. The Starbucks onsite was convenient but staffed by indifferent clerks who couldn't smile if you handed them a hundred dollar tip. But nothing can beat the unprofessional attitude of the staff at Connections at River Island (their internet cafe). Just rude and unbelievable. The girls manning the desk ranted and raved and cursed on two occasions when I was there making me feel very uncomfortable while I was using the internet. I can't believe these girls are getting paid a wage for what they do. One stood outside gabbing with friends on her cell phone and looked a bit put out when she had to come inside to accept my payment. Another sat near me reading her emails and exclaiming loudly over them and shouting to coworkers inside the office. Unbelievable. As our unit is backed by the 18th hole of Legends golf course we were woke before dawn every morning while the greenskeepers drove their loud equipment up and down the cart paths and mowed greens all before dawn. I didn't anticipate that annoyance when we purchased. Funny, they don't tell you about some of these quaint charms when they are giving you the hard sell.... ;-) Another hilarious feature, black vultures circle the building all day. Really. You'd think you were staying in the Addams Family house! But they are quiet and well behaved and roost at night in the trees to the east and north of the village. They're harmless and I started to really enjoy watching them. We were told they circle around because just over the wooded area is Disney's Animal Kingdom and the animal manure is dumped on other side of our woods. Yum! To be fair, the new attraction River Island is very nice and I can imagine a family with young children would have a blast there. We did play 36 holes of mini golf there on some cool evenings. High priced, even for owners! But they do have a good special that allows the whole family to play unlimited all week for a good price. My husband loved this place and used the pools and spa in East Village a lot. He gives it a FIVE, I give the place a THREE so I gave it a average of FOUR... He's coming back to use our week next year with his golfing buddies and I'm staying home!! Bliss!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer-R-US
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed a vacation from Florida that we will never forget. The condos were nice, clean, and very quiet. We had a wonderful view of a pond, golf course, and Disney land. When we went, it was really nice outside for visiting attractions. Seaworld, Universal Studios, and Arabian Nights Dinner Show was close attractions that my family loved.The staff was very friendly. There is a gate so only the people staying there could get in. Some cons were that they had very little pools for the amount of people, and it was hard to find in the middle of the night. Right before we left, we accidentally lodked ourselves out and it took for ever to find someone to let us in because they didn't believe us. Overall, this is a wonderful place to stay for a wonderful Florida vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort!”
Reviews.Author: Diands41
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to OL was in 1994 with some friends who were owners. We were so impressed that we bought a timeshare and since then we have bought an additional unit in the East Village. Orange Lake just keeps getting better and better. You can't go wrong at this resort since it literally has anything and everything you or your family could want from a hotel or resort while on vacation. The convenience of being so close to Disney is wonderful. You couldn't ask for a better place for a family vacation...pools, restaurants, arcade, golf, fitness room, movie theater, store, cleanliness, repuatation and most of all safety. OL has full time security on the premises at all times and at the entrance/exit areas. The added bonus is the $50,000,000 they just spent for their guests on the new Lazy River.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort; both River Island and East Village Jan 19-23”
Reviews.Author: Tdottraveller1
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night extra at River Island as we needed the extra night; only spend 4 nights at this fabulous resort, but it was a great visit. Had a 3 bedroom place in the east village and 1 bedroom in River Island (both had similar decor, although River Island was a bit newer) Restaurant at River Island was terribly slow service, but otherwise great stay. Location is EXCELLENT to downtown Disney and other Disney properties. Universal is about 15-20 minute drive. I visited Disney for the first time and not sure if it's just me, but I thought the entire experiece was highly overrated (small parks, overpriced admission) Highly recommend this resort though; won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Little disappointed! London, Ontario”
Reviews.Author: Sunsensuous
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the East Village of Orange Lake from Dec 31st to Jan 7/07 in a 3 bedroom 6th floor unit. Overall our stay was very enjoyable. The River Island Complex is amazing with the lazy river pool, tropical scenery and restaurants. The grounds/landscaping of the resort are immaculate, however, the building/unit maintenance, housekeeping standards some of worst we have seen in vacation resorts. We had a problem with raccoons in the exterior corridors of the building a few nights and the staff failed to clean up the feces in the stairwells. The housekeeping totes were left in the corridor just off the elevator for the entire week along with bags of garbage. The elevators and exterior corridors were very dirty. We had roaches in our unit, kitchen and bathroom. The sheets on the beds were very old and rough and windows dirty. Our unit backed onto Disney's Animal Kingdom (Africa section) so somedays the smell of Lion urine was very intense. The new pool in the East Village is beautiful but they need to add some more features like lite tennis courts and basketball courts. On the day of departure the cleaning service was knocking on our door at 9am (check out was 10am). They waited outside our door until we left. If this resort focused as much of their attention on the units as they do the grounds/public facilities, this would be a spectacular vacation resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: adnil1962
Reviews.Content: We did a trade through RCI - I was a bit worried as I have done other trades to FL and have never had success. We visited during the first week of January. Orange Lake was incredible. We stayed in a North room. The room seemed to be brand new. We have stayed at Disney's Boardwalk previously and this room reminded me very much of that resort but with a kitchen and washer/dryer. We had a view of the golf course from our patio and we walked less than 50 feet to get to the pool/clubhouse. The unit was very clean. I found the staff to be friendly and very helpful. When I went to pick up my parking pass I was sure that I would get pushed to listen to the timeshare presentation but she just handed me the pass and wished me a good day. The grounds were beautiful - 4 golf courses, lots of organized activities for all ages, very cool mini golf course, river island was very nice (and big). They had a great convenience store on property and a Starbucks. We ate at the pool one day - our only complaint was that we wanted our burgers med/rare and the woman told us that she was only allowed to sell well done burgers. We did have a message on the phone (so the phone blinked all the time) - but we just ignored it as we figured that it was just someone trying to sell us a time share. The resort was very close to Disney (less than a 10 minute drive). We had a car but I did see quite a few shuttle buses driving around. They seemed to come frequently. We had pizza delivered one night. They took our credit card over the phone, delivered quickly and the pizza was quite good. There was no noise in the unit - we slept soundly. Water pressure was good in the shower and they supplied dishwashing detergent, laundry detergent, paper towels, etc. We had an excellent stay and have already booked a trip for next January.

Reviews.Title: “River Island was Awesome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jasperConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We went as a family of four ( sons 19 and 21 ) on a golfing vacation here. I choose Orange Lake because of the costs with four golfers. It seemed like a great value. When reading reviews before booking it seemed like I wanted to be in River Island or the East complexes. We choose River Island and it was fantastic. The two bedroom unit was large ,spotless and new. We are not owners or timeshare people. You don't need to be just tell them when you book so they can quote you correctly. You can't book a cheaper location or room then upgrade for free.The River Island complex has everything you need as far as pools, food ,coffee shop and ice cream. The River Island Grilling is beautiful and has a nice bar.When you first pull in the main entrance you can see the older one story units, they don't show well,but we did notice in other parts of the resort they are totally re-doing the interiors of those units.The two golf courses were very enjoyable yet challenging and in awesome condition, better than I thought they would be. We do alot of traveling and for the money I think the value here is fantastic!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYED the EAST Village”
Reviews.Author: NewburghMAK
Reviews.Content: Ask for the East Village, you will have no worries. Do not settle for anything else---you cannot get into the NEW River Island unless you own. Absolutely clean and beautiful inside and out!!! The grounds were immaculate, everything and everyone were wonderful. ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time In West Village”
Reviews.Author: Muskokahome
Reviews.Content: We did an RCI trade for the week Dec 17-23 and enjoyed unusually fabulous weather just under 80 degrees fahrenheit. Despite that, we think we would have had a wonderful holiday. We are two middle-aged parents and we brought 3 young adults (sons and friend). We had a golf villa in West Village and despit review, we found it was basic in terms of decor and facilities, but it proved to be quite wonderful overall. We had two bathrooms (the boys used one and it was messy throughout the week). I did laundry a few times and found the washer/dryer very good. We partially ate out and ate in. Overall, we found the River Island Restaurant very good with huge portions that we took home for the next day.. We attended Disney on 3 alternating days and enjoyed the new River Island at Orange Lake for 2 days. The boys especially loved River Island and also the lit basketball court that they used at West Village Clubhouse. They also used the pool and hot tub that were open until 11 p.m. nearby at West Village. We took the shuttle as a family on two occasions when we planned to have wine with dinnner: once to the Legends golf course restaurant and once to River Island. It was very convenient and once the driver returned us directly to our unit because he was not busy. We tipped the driver each time. We enjoyed Disney of course and learned from Orange Lake staff about a short-cut to the Animal Kingdom that was great for us. Also, we were delighted to know that Orange Lake has a Hertz rental service on-site; we returned a rental we got from the airport and would likely take a taxi or shuttle to the resort from the International airpoport next time. That was the most stressful part of our trip - arriving at night, from the Orlando airport, not knowing the roads, detour due to road construction, trying to find the resort. One negative: unless you enjoy harassment, avoid going to a sales promotion AKA complimentary continental breakfast for one hour. It will take at least 2 hours and you will be hounded to buy a timeshare for 11K or more. The newer units are gorgeous in decor but we could not imagine spending 27K+ annual maintenance fees for the "privilege". You can use all the resort facilities for much lower price. Overall, we were quite pleased and ended up buying a week at West Village on Ebay. That cost us a fraction of what the on site sales people wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvnflorida
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Orange Lake. We love it! There have been many changes and upgrades. River Island is great! The only negative we found was that the .televisions in our villa{west} were very outdated. We would definately return. I give this resort an A.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: terpfan1
Reviews.Content: A friend owns at Orange Lake and we stayed as guests. I had read many bad reviews of the West Village. So when we checked in I asked which village we were in and of course, we were in West Village. I asked to be moved to East Village. I told the clerk what I read on trip advisor. She said she could try but it would take a while because she had to look through the computer to find an empty unit (???!!!). I said that was fine. We were in no hurry. Finally after about 5 minutes she said she would just switch us with someone else. Our East Village apartment was beautiful. Everyone there was extremely nice. I don't think there were many, if any, empty units. The parking lots were full every night we were there. We had a great stay. Most of the people on here seem to have success when they ask to be switch so I would definitely ask if you go there and you are not an owner.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: lebeaublond
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-bedroom condo at Orange Lake through a RCI exchange. We are Club Intrawest members. After reading tons of negative reviews about that resort and its older section, we finally decided to plunge and go see by ourselves to make our own jugment. What a bright decision it was, as we noticed Orange Lake deserves its gold corwn status... We stayed at the East Village, the newest section, located within walking distance from the Lazy River pool. The flat was clean and spacious, the kitchen was huge...we had a balcony onto the golf course. Every morning, me and my older son would go out feed the exotic birds on our porch. A nice change from shoveling I might add... Resort personnel was very polite, the nature is lush, the on-site Starbuck coffee outlet made me very happy...there is a Publix within half a mile from the resort...it was extremely conveniant...the prices are good and choice of meat is great... Orange Lake is definitely a gold crown.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Awesome Customer Service and Room and I had RCI!”
Reviews.Author: pmazcomm
Reviews.Content: We nervously booked Orange Lake after reading many negative reviews especially in the West Village via RCI exchange. I am a cleaniness nut so to hear about the bugs and cobwebs freaked me out a bit. Well, we arrived at the resort around 5pm and I immediately asked where our room was. Of course, West Village. I freaked and asked to be switched. The staff person said she is not allowed to switch rooms, stated to call customer service on the house phone (she wrote down the number) and they could switch. So down the hall we went and I called customer service. Not a great call...she said room cleaniness or concerns about the unit would not be a reason to switch rooms. She suggested I go speak to management. So, I walked down the hall and spoke to a manager. He heard my concerns and while I never stepped in the room, I told him we were tired from our trip and didn't want to get there and find out the room was a pit. He did say the room I was in was not an upgraded room and tried to find another spot for us. He said there was nothing available at the moment but perhaps after checkin is done, he would be able to move us. He asked to try out the villa and let us know if it was unbearable then he would do what he could. So, with a sour face I left and we went to our 2 bedroom West Villa. We walked in and to my surprise it was really nice, and very very clean. And this was not an remodeled unit. No cobwebs, no bugs, all was okay. So as we started to unpack, we got a knock on the door. The manager said he couldn't bear the sour face and wanted me to have a great trip and he found a 2 bedroom villa in the East Village. I was blown away! He had a crew of guys there to take our luggage and escorted us to the East Village. He walked us to the condo and it was even more beautiful than the West one was. The space and decor was amazing. He was great and offered incredible customer service. Our stay was awesome! No maid service for the week was a bummer but I just did a load and that took care of that. The best part was watching Disney fireworks from our screened in patio! The grounds are huge and could be better marked. We were there in December so a bit chilly by the time we were done with the parks so we were not able to use the pools. Overall, I thought it would be a nightmare but was pleasantly surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Wow wow wow”
Reviews.Author: Mitch84
Reviews.Content: Well I booked Orange lake through RCI after hearing great reviews from my family who have been. We arrived about 9pm local time and were tired from the flight and a bit daunted by the size. We wanted to eat so we asked them for advice. They told us about the river island grilling co, got us in a car and took us to our appartment. Our appartment was lovely. HUGE, there were only 2 of us and we could lose each other in that appartment. It was clean and in good working order so all good. We went to catch the shuttle bus to the restaurant as we hadn't hired a car, it arrived and took us where we asked. The restaurant was great and we even had vouchers for free cocktails which started the holiday off nicely, service good, food good etc etc. The shuttle buses were easy to catch and came regularly, if you needed to get back to your appartment after hours the security would take you. The pools were lovely and clean, can't praise it highly enough to be honest. You could spend a fortnight at this resort without needing to leave

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic..AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Mavman00
Reviews.Content: Our family of 9 stayed at Orange Lake from November 11-18 this year. I couldn't have asked for a more perfect vacation! We have stayed before, in 2003, and had a great time then..but that paled in comparison to this year. We stayed in the Tennis Villas, the 5600 building. We loved the room, very spacious..spotlessly clean, and all of the appliances were new quality. We had a great view of the lake, sunsets in the evening, and the first hole of the Crane course. I highly recommend this resort for families, or anyone who wants to stay at a top end resort, near all of the major Disney attractions. We felt welcome, and were treated great by all staff. We honestly can not wait to come back. River Island was really nice, and lived up to the anticipation. It always boggles the mind when I read negative reviews of this place, although they are few and far between. Most who come here agree with me...THE place to stay for a fabulous holiday!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely awesome!”
Reviews.Author: topten
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Orange Lake every November for the past 6 years and it keeps getting better and better! The two bedroom villas are wonderfully decorated. The location is outstanding and the grounds beautiful. The addition of River Island, the new water park area, was enjoyed by all ages. The lake affords jet skiing and other water sports and the multitude of pools interspersed throughout the entire resort were a benefit. The movie house , the arcades and the miniature golf are some of the things the kids enjoyed. We had friends and relatives visit our resort, who were staying at the Westgate Villas and the Fairfield Orlando at Cypress Palms, and they were floored by this resort. The staff are polite and helpful. Yes, they try to get you to attend a sales pitch, but, make this your practice to learn how to say no. You will not be disappointed with this resort because Orange Lake is the true meaning of a top notch resort.

Reviews.Title: “Too cold in Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: jbeidleman
Reviews.Content: My parent's used RCI to book two two-bedroom units for last week. Not Orange Lake Resort's fault - but it was really cold in Orlando last week. It damped our visit. We used the pools a lot less. Overall, the resort was perfectly fine for a family visit. The number of messages from the golf and sales people was annoying. I hate the blinking light. They automatically send messages. We even received a message at 1:21 AM. That is ridiculous! My parent's checked in so I can not comment on that process. We stayed in the West side and had two adjoining units. Our kids played football on the golf courses - we did not see any golfers for the first 5 days. But the birds were very brave and even knocked on our window to see when we were going to come out to play. The sprinklers did turn on every now and then which made for a lot of laughs as we would get caught in the shower. A lot of the kid activities revolve around the pools so we did not participate in many. River Island was a hit despite the cold. We could only take it for short stints. Charging for tubes is a bit lame. Same for the $3 inflatable slide rides. We opted not to do it. The family pass for minature golf is a good deal. I am glad we had a rental car because the shuttle was not very frequent. I even gave others rides around the resort. I also found the people driving in the resort to be going to fast which is why I preferred to drive the older kids to the arcade or basketball court rather than have then waiting for the shuttle or walking. A few speed bumps could help. We did go to their theater one night. Nice touch. Go get popcorn from the bar. They played a DVD? I wonder why the rooms still have VHS? Time for an upgrade. The old TVs should be upgraded too. I have not seen a remote with out number keys in a long time. The resort is very convienent to Disney, Sea World, and the airport. We did not eat there. But we did buy Starbucks coffee every day at the River Island cafe. The kids even had ice cream - despite the blue lips from the cold weather. The units could have been a little cleaner but I have stayed in much worse. Having a washer and dryer, refridge, dishwasher etc... made having breakfast at home easier than a hotel and having to go out for every meal. Despite the weather - we had a lot of fun with family which is the important thing. Having two bedrooms, living room, kitchen and dining room was very spacious. And made the week much better for all.

Reviews.Title: “Where was the customer service?”
Reviews.Author: greatguy
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 2 weeks at orange lake. I had an RCI exchange and booked in 7 hours early to get a decent villa, and asked for a quiet villa and said that i didn't mind an older villa providing it was quiet. I ended up with a villa near the main entrance, which meant we could hear the 192 traffic, but it wasn't to big a deal. Unfortunatey though, the garbage men woke us most mornings before 7am collecting the rubbish bins, and if we were lucky enough to go back to sleep, we then got woken before 7.30am by the major building work next door. i asked to be moved but was told by the lady i spoke to that she couldn't make that decision, but promised me that the manager would get back to me within an hour. 24 hours later, still no call from the manager, and despite a few further calls, i was unable to make contact with the manager because he was busy! When i booked in, the girl at reception didn't tell me that i needed to get a car security entry pass from tickets sales! orange lake used to give the passes out when you booked in, but now they make you queue at ticket sales, who try to sell you your park tickets and a timeshare presentation. I called to have my tv remote replaced (i tried changing the batteries myself but it didn't make any difference), a week later this was still not replaced! Not a big deal, but a real pain getting up changing channels. I hired a ring from river island, and whilst it was next to me 30 minutes later, some nice person had taken it, so hold onto the hire rings with your life! I had fun with my son renting a jet ski for 30 minutes ($52), but the lady that hires them, was the most unfriendly person i have ever met. She was sitting on the counter reading a book whilst she was talking to me. It frankly put me off going back. Although this is a gold crown resort, they only have video players in the lounge, so i went to the reception to enquire if i could hire a dvd player, and an uninterested girl told me that orange lake had no dvd players. She did however, tell me that they rented videos, which were $6 a time, and were very old videos, that were not worth a free rental. No where sells or rents videos anymore (apart from orange lake), so the video players are a compete waste of time. Most days I had at least one phone call or message on the villa's answerphone telling me about the golf deals, and the timeshare presentation. Myself and my family left after 2 weeks, all feeling very tired and in need of a holiday where you can lay in after 7am. Orange lake is a massive resort, but I may have been staying in the middle of a jungle on my own, because the customer service was non exsistent. I politely told the lady who i booked out with how disappointed i was, and she took a call whilst i was telling her, and that was that!

Reviews.Title: “West Sunsets from the West Village!”
Reviews.Author: Himm2
Reviews.Content: I've been an owner in one of the first built one story 2 BR West villas overlooking the 3rd, 4th, 6th & 7th Crane's Bend Fairways with lake and sunsets to the west since 1983. I've never exchanged the unit and we go down there every year in week 44. Many times we have a group of over a dozen friends that join us in other units that they get great deals on if they take the 1 hour sales tour. While the newer North & East units are more modern they don't function as well for larger families or groups. The kitchen, dining and living areas have great open spaciousness and walkout patio and adjacent private parking space is a welcomed feature for the West Villas. The new River Island is a wonderful experience for all ages and we ate at the Grilling Company there twice and the Legacy Grill once. The restaurants in the West Clubhouse are not all that great. The West Pool complex is a good place to relax with music at night but Bingo does get a bit annoying during the day there. A game of beach volleyball and the water sports are always fun. We regularly play all four of the resort golf courses. The Legends course is the finest and most enjoyable course that I've played anywhere. The newly reopened & redesigned Reserve course is a huge disappointment to me. It is very unforgiving, frustrating and poorly planned. The 9 hole executive course, Crane's Bend, that goes past our unit is a pleasant way to spend a couple hours in the morning before heading out to the theme parks. The lighted par 3 Legends Walk course is a good way to spend an evening after dinner if you don't mind the exercise of walking your bag up and down hills. The newer minigolf course at River Island is a bit more challenging and attractive than the older one at the West pool complex. The weather has always been great around Halloween and I can't say that I have ever had a disappointing stay at Orange Lake in the 22 years I've been going there.

Reviews.Title: “loved this resort”
Reviews.Author: Darlee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just had a great week at Orange Lake. We did an exchange through RCI and when we arrived at check-in, WE requested a West Village bungalow and were given a 2 bedroom/2 ensuite bathroom. We like the idea of the car being parked right outside the door. Apart from a few cobwebs on the patio doors it was clean and well equipped with very new appliances. We had 2 minor problems, tumble dryer and waste disposal not working, we called housekeeping and the repairs were done within 30 minutes. Out the back of the unit was the 7th green of the Cranes 9 hole golf course and we had the most beatuful views of the sunset. We did a tour and did see the new accommodation which is really beautiful and new in the village near River Island. We enjoyed it so much we are returning next year. There is so much to do on site, the golf is great as are the pools especially River Island with the lazy river. We were there in October/November so it was reasonably quiet, it is probably very busy in high season. There are good bars and restaurants, the Island Grill does an excellent steak. All in all we felt that this was a great place to spend time when you were not at Disney, Universal etc. We would reccommend doing the early morning nature walk. It starts at 7.15am and costs $5 each but is worth getting up for. It gives an insight into what was there before Mickey. Word of warning DO NOT feed the wildlife. We had racoons, squirrels, large birds etc at the unit. For their wellbeing leave them alone.

Reviews.Title: “West Village Horror”
Reviews.Author: MamaKit
Reviews.Content: We had a bonus week through RCI and booked the week of October 14th. We were very excited as this was our first visit to Florida as a family. Unfortunately, because this was an RCI reservation, we were thrown into Dungeon room #5145 in the West Village. Upon arrival it took us about ten minutes to locate our room since the access hallway is adjacent to the dumpsters, noisy air conditioners and hotel utility vehicles. The hall doors had several layers of chipped paint and wallpaper and the carpets were filthy. Our room was very functional as it had a small kitchen with stove top, microwave, fridge and even dishwasher. The only window in the room (with bent and dirty mini blinds) looked out to the INTERIOR of the community room or game room. We immediately went to the RCI office and told the Rep there that we were willing to pay additional money to get out of that room. Unsympathetic and unmoved by our pleas, she simply stated that we booked a studio room so we have to stay in that studio room. We're not snobs and are pretty good about rolling with the punches, so we decided to stick it out and remain positive. After all we were going to be sight seeing all day anyway. The first day we hung out at the River Pool which is pretty nice. Second day we went out to Cape Canaveral National Seashore which is beautiful. That night we went over to the little lake at the resort which has a pretty beach. The picture on the web site fails to show the view of the other side of the lake which is of cinder block walls and what appeared to be dilapidated houses and a trailer park. Ugly. Still remaining positive we walked over to the pool since our daughter wanted to swim. We ordered cocktails from the pool-side bar and relaxed and did a little people watching. We quickly determined that maybe we were snobs after all since we were appalled at what we saw around us - Young kids (13 or 14) smoking cigarettes with their Tattooed and toothless parents, many other kids unsupervised and misbehaving and other adults "hooking up". We watched in horror as some kid continued to hock loogies, from the pool, onto the pool deck, over and over and over and over. That did it for us. We went to the RCI office the next morning and asked if we could have a partial refund since we were checking out. The Rep who was there (Cynthia) seemed very concerned and asked why we were leaving. I told her we weren’t happy with the room and she pushed her lunch aside and got busy on her computer. She found availability at another RCI property (Vacation Village) and booked us right then and there. She SAVED our vacation and should get a big fat raise as far as I'm concerned. We left Orange Lake immediately and checked into our new property which we absolutely LOVED. This actually turned out to be one of our best family vacations so far. Thank you Cynthia!! In all fairness, Orange Lake is very nice over in the East Village. The grounds are beautiful and the pools are nice. If you're not too picky, then the West Village Dungeon rooms may be okay. But to any discerning traveler, it might ruin your trip if you get stuck in there.

Reviews.Title: “Much Much better and hoping”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: We are owners. Last year's experience was terrible...arrived to a smoky, dirty room with cigarette butts and dirty towels. This time, a year later, our unit was spotless and very nice. We were in the East Village in a cheery spot. We brought my 80 yr old parents for the EPCOT Food and Wine fest and they loved the condo. We absolutely loved the new water park. We changed to the new Global Express points system because our experience with RCI has been simply awful. In five years, we've never been able to get an exchange with them even off season and months in advance. i hope this new company does better! There are a few drawbacks here. The lobby is an absolute zoo. You cannot check in until 4 pm. The mattress was very uncomfortable and in the 2 bedroom units, the second bathroom has no hair dryer. Other than that, it's well maintained (grounds/golf course) convenient to the parks and the shopping center next to the resort has a Publix, a Japanese restaurant and a Quiznos. Shuttles run regularly in this resort, and at the end of the street is a nice bus system. You can easily stay here without a car. The resort people told us that the place has new ownership/affiliation and a new CEO. Good. They need to have top management for a resort of this size. There willalways be petty problems with carpets, screens, etc as long as they are offering off season specials to people who won't be concerned with the property. But overall,. I feel that this resort is headed in a much more positive direction based on our stay this week.

Reviews.Title: “How to land in East Village”
Reviews.Author: 1trav31
Reviews.Content: Not wasting your time reading, I try to be as concise as possible on the things you are interested most. 1. Got it through RCI (like most of you), stayed there 9/29-10/6. 2. Assigned a West Village unit upon arrival, the place was filthy 3. Called RCI to complain and request for a change, they called me back within 10 minutes with a unit in East Village. West Villages room numbers are 1xxx, 2xxx, 3000-3299 and 4xxx; less old North Village room numbers are 3400-39xx, the newest East Vilage room numbers are 8xxxx (5 digits). If you end up in West Village, your vacation is over even before it's started, so do whatever you can to avoid, call Orange Lake before the trip to find out your unit-to-be, and call RCI if you find yourself getting a 4-digit. For amenities on the resort, pleae read other posts. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not a Gold Crown”
Reviews.Author: KF2744a
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to this resort for our anniversary October 8 - 15, 2006. The resort is very big and there is a lot to do which was a plus for us. We wanted a nice, quiet vacation where we didn't have to leave the resort a lot. First of all, our check in was quick and we were given a room in the North Village. After reading reviews from this website I knew I wanted one in either the North or East Village. We checked in at 3:45 pm but our room wasn't going to be ready until 4 so we went to the Publix that is right by the East Village entrance. It was great having a grocery store so close by. At 4 we went to check out our room and were satisfied. The room is spacious, has a good layout, and came with a nicely equipped kitchen. I've traveled to 3 RCI properties in the last couple of years and stayed at all Gold Crown resorts and I must say that compared to the others this was the worst. I'm not saying it's bad but I don't see it as a Gold Crown winner in comparison. We stayed at the Pueblo Bonito Sunset in Cabo and those rooms were absolutely amazing. Orange Lake does not even come close. Anyway, we checked out the new River Island complex first and it's very nice. If you have children this would be a great place to go. We do not have children so we were trying to find a quiet place to relax in the sun but unfortunately every place we tried was swarming with love bugs. It was really annoying and I hope the resort does something about this soon. The next day we checked out the pool in the West Village and I liked that a lot better.
