It seemed to be quieter and less crowded. Unfortunately, the bathrooms were disgusting. Not a big deal but just another reason why this shouldn't be a Gold Crown. The only downside of the pool in the West Village is that every day at 2pm they do Bingo over the loud speaker for an hour. We just wanted to relax and found it a bit annoying. Also, every day around 3:30 the bugs came and we were forced to pack up. We wanted to play miniature golf at River Island but it was $9 a person to play and I thought that was too expensive. I haven't played in years so maybe that is the going rate. We instead went to the older miniature golf course in the West Village and played there using the buy one get one free coupon we got after we took the tour (more on that later). We cooked in our room most of the time but we did go out to dinner once at the River Island Grill. We had the filet and mashed pots and they were very good. Service was a bit lacking but the food was yummy. The drinks are ridiculously over priced ($7 for a cocktail) but it was our one night out. All in all a nice experience. We decided to take the tour/owners update and our salesman James was very nice. It wasn't high pressure and we just honestly told him that his presentation was nice but were weren't interested. There was no hassle and we were out of there fairly quickly. All in all it's a decent resort but lacking a bit in cleanliness and maintenance. It looks like they are still expanding though so I'm guessing as long as you get a newer unit you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: Chill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orange Lake Country Club from Oct 8 - 15th. We were with RCI and stayed at the West Village. Ok, not a fancy dancy villa, but a decent, comfortable, quiet one. We had no problems with the villa and enjoyed the nightly racoon visits. We had no bugs or holes in the sheets or towels. In fact we enjoyed our villa very much. It was a short walk to the main area where I played bingo a few days for big bucks (I never won, but came really close) and there were lots of activities going on there. My son went to watch movies and play ping pong. The weather was great though there were a few 'love bugs'. Apparently bugs brought over from who knows where to kill misquitos, but don't and now they can't get rid of them. Not a big problem. We enjoyed all the pools and yes had to pay for the tube, but hey we were on vacation!! This is not a rental that fawns over you which is great when you are with a family. Most people either eat in their villa or in the restaurants on site which are not in your face style. That way everyone isn't so aware of what the other table has and it keeps the check-out tab down a whole lot. My husband and nephew played on one coarse and said it was quite challenging. It must have been because we found several balls in our back yard. On the whole I found it a great place. It's not a luxury timeshare, like one where money is no object and romantic and all, but for a nice reasonable vacation this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the West Village Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: antgina
Reviews.Content: After seeing the wonderful advertisements for this resort & given the fact that RCI rates it a Resort of High Excellence, we considered this a no brainer! The resort is huge! Lots of pools & lots of pool chairs. They boast about all of the restaurants, but they're mostly fast food type places near the pools and a pizzeria. Make the time to enjoy the meals at The River Island Grill, that was great. Now the bad....our room was dirty! Not at all the level I expected from a resort of this nature. The towels had holes in them, the kitchen floor turned our socks black from the dirt, dead bugs in the tracks of the sliders, mirrors with smudges on them, hair on the bathroom floor, cob webs everywhere, the cheapest toilet paper, papertowels & tissues we've ever used! The ironing board cover was burned, the kitchen counter had burn marks on it, the inside of the dishwasher was dirty. I could go on! We called several times and they first sent someone to clean the tracks of the sliders but they left the vacuum cleaner out when they were done! Then they finally sent housekeeping over to do a complimentary midweek cleaning but it didn't make up for it. My daughter didn't want to sleep in the bed! Make sure you do not get a room in the West Village Villas. Demand a room in the new East Village. My friends had a brand new suite there. It seems the RCI and other timeshare exchanges are given the icky rooms. We did have fun, the resort is very well groomed. Annoyed that you had to pay for the floats on the lazy river! Give me a break! Would I go back? Maybe, not for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!!”
Reviews.Author: jmst727
Reviews.Content: Our family of four had a fantastic vacation at Orange Lake. The two bedroom villa was beautifully decorated, very clean and spacious. Everything you need is there! Full kitchen with all the supplies, full sized washer and dryer, gorgeous master bathroom, bedrooms with televisions and ceiling fans. I could go on and on. The pools were wonderful and very pretty. Plenty of seating and towels. My husband played golf two times and said the courses were immaculate and challenging. Our villa overlooked one of the courses and provided a lovely view. The close proximity to the Disney parks can't be beat! We can't wait to return! Definitely a Gold Crown Resort!!

Reviews.Title: “On balance very good”
Reviews.Author: Angie7
Reviews.Content: We returned on September 4th, after spending over three weeks at Orange Lake Country Club. Before we arrived, I was very anxious that we would get one of the old style villas that everyone said to avoid, so I e mailed before hand to request the new apartments (waste of time) and was promptly given an old style villa on arrival. However, on reflection the "old style" was by far the best option. We overlooked a fantastic golf course, had lovely animals visiting us every day. Not horrible things, but lovely Ibis, Cranes, tiny frogs, Lizards, birds of prey and Racoons. Fantastic. !!! There are the odd beetles that get in; they are not to be confused with roaches though. The whole time we were there we only spotted one roach, and that was outside under a slide. So hardly worth a moan. We went without a car despite everyone saying we were mad, and managed fine, we used a Taxi to get to Disney and everywhere else, and this worked out cheaper and safer than getting a car. Orange lake is a huge place, and has nearly 2400 units, spread out over a very big area. There was absolutely No over crowding though; there was always a place to sit or a deck chair to relax on, never any problems getting a reservation at a restaurant. It is not the sort of resort where you are fawned and fussed over, so you do have to be independent and ask for what you want. such as being dropped at your villa rather than a drop off point, they will collect you as well if you ask, take your bags to your room and collect you on departure 9You do not need to tip). In three weeks we had about four phone calls from teh time share people, about attending a presentation, they were very polite when we said no, and increased the offer over time to $75.00 and free breakfast and a voucher book. We said no, as time is precious. There are four pools, a small one near the entrance, which is lovely, very quiet. In fact hardly anyone there, on a few occasions we were the only ones. There is River Island the new complex. This was quite busy, and although lovely we preferred splash lagoon, which was great for children aged under 8. Much quieter there as well. There is a 50 meter pool as well, great for getting fit. The pools were well maintained, we did see people taking water samples regularly for testing. Towels are in great big hampers and you just help yourself to what you need, so do not worry. In fact I would leave your suitcase free of towells all together. There are a several restaurants, all good value. The grilling company at River Island serve fantastic food. About £12.00 for a fillet Mignon, with starter and side order. Cheaper than UK prices for quality food. There are cheaper thing on teh menu as well. Childrens meals including a drink were around £3.00. The apartment itself was clean, and in good order. In did not have any wow factor but it had a nice kitchen, huge washing machine and tumble dryer. So nice clean clothes to go home with. Air conditioning, good general accommodation. The only down side was the bathrooms were small and a bit disappointing. But how long do you spend in the bathroom on holiday? The staff were always very nice, not too gushing or over the top. There are a lot of Americans that stop there, so do not expect a Brit holiday. Whilst we were at Disney, we would get a taxi to Animal Kingdom, as that was the cheapest and closest to Orange a Lake, then we used Disney transport to get around. We had a look in on Animal Kingdom lodge, thinking we might treat ourselves next year. In comparison to Orange Lake, it pales into significance. The hotel itself looked fabulous, the lobby was very luxurious, and the animals were roaming the savannah. It all felt a bit claustrophobic, there were a lot of people in a small place, long queues for dinner, much much smaller rooms than Orange Lake, and quite a small pool in comparison. So if you like a bit of independence, then Orange Lake is great and a much better option. Although the new units at Orange Lake are very luxurious the peace and tranquillity in the villas was great. I did not have to worry about telling my four year old to be quiet either, for fear of upsetting a guest below of above us. We had a great time, and world go back in a shot, I hope this helps you

Reviews.Title: “LIZZARDS”
Reviews.Author: brookeebabi6722
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Orange Lake Country Club for 6 days. Horrible!!!!!! The service and quality of the room was horrible. If you like lizzards, spiders and racoons as your guest during your stay then I would highly reccomend this resort. The bathrooms were nasty. There were no sheets on the beds. I requested to move to a better room and was told I would have to pay $72.00 to be transferred. What a joke. There were lizzards running everywhere. The room smelled and the spiders didn't make matters better. I travel every year through RCI and I must say this is the worse resort I have every stayed at. DONT WASTE YOUR VACATION with this resort. The funny part to all of this is that the resort tried to get me to buy TIMESHARE. I would not invest in any timeshare with this resort even if the cost was a penny.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return to Orange Lake!”
Reviews.Author: Sylvan1
Reviews.Content: Well we're home, and OLCC is definitely not for our family. We all agreed the resort had much to offer re: activities, but failed to meet what our family has experienced "Gold Crown" to be in our ownership and travels. We exhanged in through RCI and we were placed in a newly refurbished unit in the North Village, unit 3822. The positives of OLCC- the pools, pool towels were provided, the various activities/options, the unit size, and the unit appeared to be recently refurbished. Additionally, when we did telephone or stop by the clubhouse with a maintenance concern, it was addressed immediately (except for an exterminator being sent, as promised). The negatives (in our opinion)- ants all over the kitchen and living room, towels and loose trash left in front of our unit, unit not very clean, stained towels, holes in towels, holes in one set of sheets, no blankets or pillows for the sofa bed, jacuzzi tub jets did not work, hot water heater broke, dryer broke, replaced with another dryer that was not operating properly and smelled moldy, lied to by sales staff (Marcus said we had to take a 1 hour RI tour to use the new RI facilities), disherwasher not installed in cabinet securely, no ceiling fans in bedrooms or on porch, kiddie pool at Splash Lagoon needed a good scrubbing, no hot tubs at Splash Lagoon, and a leak that developed in our unit was not repaired. The number 1 negative in our eyes was staff attitude; customer service and stewardship/responsibility seemed to be non-existent. Maintenance issues can happen anywhere, but an ongoing maintenance schedule would have prevented many of the issues we had during the week. As for the bugs, yes, I expect to see a bug, frog, or lizard in my unit while in Florida, but I do not expect to have a swarm of ants in my kitchen and living room...for a week. Again, this was something that could have been prevented. Also, an exterminator never arrived, as promised. We stay at our unit at Seascape in NC once a year, which is like a blast back to 80s decor, but we don't care because the unit is clean and the staff is friendly. We also stay with Marriott often and we've not had the aforementioned problems. While at the Westgate Smoky Mountains, we had a mouse in our unit, and being in the mountains, we took it in stride and appreciated the exterminator coming out to catch the little thing. We are not a family that is impossible to please, but we do not expect or excuse multiple problems in one week, especially when the staff never took responsibility in caring about these issues. We were told multiple times "this happens all the time." My point is, if this "happens all the time" you are aware of the problems and should fix them, not leave them to be problems for your next set of guests arriving. In 6 years of timeshare ownership and trading, this is honestly the worst place we have stayed. No, it's not terrible overall or like a dumpy motel, but OLCC is not the top-notch resort it attempts to represent itself to be. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Wakolsons
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at Orange Lake and had a really nice time. The rooms were huge and very comfortable. They were also very quiet for the most part. If people were in the hall you could really hear them from the second bedroom but that was about it. The window in that room also let in too much light for my liking, but my son did not seem to mind. We did not get any sort of basic welcome/starter pack , which we didnt realize until we got home that there should have been 2!! So we ended up buying everything when we should have just called and complained. The room was clean and the beds were pretty comfy. We spent a day at River Island and rented tubes (which should be free) for the lazy river which my 4 yr old son loved. The pool is salt water and we got a bit sunburned so be sure to slather on the sunscreen. They also need more umbrellas around the pool area. They would get snapped up very quickly. We ate lunch at the snack bar Anchors and it was hot and tasty. We also had Starbucks coffee and ice cream from Currents. The coffee was a bonus because Starbucks is nowhere to be found except maybe at the parks. It was a bummer to have to drive to the pool but since we really came more for the theme parks, it wasnt a total buzz kill. We picked a perfect week to go to Orlando as most kids were back in school. We were able to walk on rides at Magic Kingdom and MGM and do some 2 and 3 times in a row. We could see fireworks from our balcony but they were pretty far away. The resort is extremely convenient to all the parks. We ate at the River Island Grilling Co twice. 1st night we just had appetizers and they were pretty good. Service was not great. The second time our waiter was clueless about the menu and bar drinks and my scallops was prepared wrong, so it was sent back and then when it came back the scallops tasted bad. They did comp my dinner but it wasnt the best dining experience. We ordered pizza one night and calzone on another from Paisan Pizzaria and they were both delicious and were delivered to our room very quickly. The onsite Disney ticket agents were so professional and helpful. The arcade was not huge but when tropical strom Ernesto rolled in, it kept my 4yr old happy. The resort did leave 2 messages keeping us posted on the storm. There are not really any good restaurants close by that we could find. Just chain fast food and dining. The cheesy gift shops close by do have some cute stuff and are definitely cheaper than buying stuff at the theme parks. Overall a great trip and a nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times @ Orange Lake!”
Reviews.Author: The_Camachos
Reviews.Content: We checked in 25 August 2006 for one week, check in process was a breeze, probably because we got there around 5pm and nobody was in line. During my check in they had popcorn, face painting and balloon crafts for the kids. They gave us a 2br villa on the North side just a quick walk to the Splash Lagoon. It was clean and very roomy. The only gripe I have about the villa is that my son could not hook up his PS2 due to no A/V inputs. Tip #1... go to your local Wal mart and for $16.00 you can fix the problem, believe me it comes in handy, when you are in a hotel with no A/V inputs. FYI Wal-Mart and Super Target are a 10-min drive from the complex. Kitchen was BIG, it comes with washer and dryer, dishwasher, micro and oven with a full size fridge. The bedrooms were very big and comfy. Master comes with a king size bed, and the other with 2 full size beds. There is also a full size sofa sleeper. From our balcony we could watch the Fireworks show from Disney, it goes on at 10pm. Our first day we went to River Island... Very nice but a bit too crowded. Since all the shade was taken we got a Cabana. For $99.00 you get 2 tubes, TV (this one you can hook up a PS2 without an adapter) table w/ 4 chairs, phone, fresh fruit and a half size fridge with softdrinks and water. Oh! and a USA today paper. The Cabana it self can be zipper close so you can leave your stuff in there with no problems. I forgot to mention that the Cabana comes with a ceiling fan... NICE! The lazy river kept us in the water for a while. We order food from the River Island Grill and let me tell you it was good and cheap ($4.95 for chicken finger, fries and kids drink/ Nacho plate for $8.00). River Island also offers Internet Cafe, Arcade, Gym, 2 Outdoor bars, 2 big slides, 2 Jacuzzis, ticket office and a Coffee shop serving Starbucks. Tip #2 if you are planning to spend the day @ River Island, come early! Our second day we went to Splash Lagoon, in my personal experience its a much better place than River Island. Less crowded and the water much cooler. Great place for little ones, my 2 yr. old was having a blast! We never answer the Villa's phone. That kept us from going to the timeshare presentation, which I was not interested. If you are planning to get a time-share buy it from a private owner. Bottom line: Great place for families, friendly service and top-notch facilities. Will return next year!

Reviews.Title: “loved it !”
Reviews.Author: crazyxbabi143
Reviews.Content: Hey! I just got back from a weeklong vacation at orange lake! My family of four traded into a 2 bedroom villa via an RCI exchange. Our flight arrived at 11 and we went straight to the resort. We were able to check in but were told our keys would not open the villa until 4. We were given a room in the west villiage, which we were a little upset about. We asked about availability in other villiages but told the units were assigned prior to check in. We drove around the resort and then went to the Publix which is in a shopping center connected to resort. We got food for the week amd then around 3 we went to see if maybe our room keys would work, which they did. At first sight we were all impressed. The unit was not like the floorplan on the website. It was very open with high cielings. My husband and i slept in the master bedroom, so i will start there. The bed was large (king size) and the room was also very spacious. We had our own sliding glass doors that led to the patio as well as our own bathroom. The bathroom however since it was an older low rise unit did not have a jacuzzi tub. My 15 year old daughter and her friend slept in the second bedroom and they had more than enough room in there! There were two queen size beds and a televison. The bathroom was connected to their room as well as to the living area. They managed to have enough drawer/closet space for the two of them, despite the fact that they packed more individually then the rest of the family combined! My ten year old slept on the pull out couch most nights, but since her best friends family was at the resort the same week as us she slept there alot too. The appliances in the kitchen must have been brand new, there was an eletric stove and a convection microwave as well as other new appliances. Our friends who also stayed in a two bedroom were given one in the north villiage and other than the master bathroom, i thought our unit was actually nicer. All in all the accomidations were impressive! We were a short walk to the main west villiage clubhouse, which was very nice. There they have 3 pools as well as the beach and mini golf. This was where the teenagers spent most of their time since they could get there without a lift. The clubhouse had games also like shuffleboard, pool, and ping pong. The beach was really nice as well as very empty most of the time. On the final day of the trip the girls rented a mouse boat for an hour and had fun! The east villiage river island pool complex is also very nice. The lazy river was fun, and in my opinon paying to rent tubes is pointless, it was much better to just swim along without one. The slides at the east villiage were cool, they went really fast actually! The exchange at river island was a nice place to walk around a little as well. Outside of the resort, the best day we had in orlando was when we did discovery cove, which i would reccomend to anyone! it was amazing! We went out to dinner most nights, and our favorite place to eat was houlihans, which was really an experience, and is also right across irlo bronson. Other than that we mostly stayed in the resort relaxing. All i can say is that for all you people who complained about how huge the resort is, take the shuttle? Rent a car? It's not a big deal - it just makes room for more stuff to do! You will have an amazing time at orange lake !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orange Lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: LoveMX
Reviews.Content: I had reserved 3 2-bedroom suites at the Orange Lake Resort for my birthday from August 19-27th. We had a blast. The resort is awesome! Our suite was clean, huge, and just all around great. You really need a car to get around, otherwise you are spending too much time sitting waiting for the shuttle. We tried out every pool....loved the lazy river. Everyone from check in to check out were great and very helpful. Word of advice on getting groceries.....their is a Publixs in the complex, but found them pretty pricey.....we went a little further west (away from hwy 4) and found another Publix, that wasn't as crowed or expensive. Was surprised at the prices of vegies & cheese...pretty crazy. We took a cooler (the kind on wheels) and we were able to take this to every pool, no questions asked. It was a life saver. some in our group went to Disney, others to Universal. Everyone had a blast. I would recommend this place to anyone! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK... the place is way too big.”
Reviews.Author: Laurie H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in December 2005. We had a 2BR unit that was backed upto Irlo Bronson. The view from our Master Suite and LR was of the highway. We also had MANY critters at our door in the evenings and early AM. All kinds of wildlife seemed to flock to us. When we called to report our problems, they went unattended. There was also a large amount of construction going on in the area where our unit was. Almost every morning we were woken to the sounds of large machinery being operated. This was especially a bummer the morning after we attended Mickey's Merry Christmas Party and we got home at 1:30am. We were so far away from the main bldg. although we did have a small pool near us. The cool stuff was a car ride away. If I ever agreed to stay here again... I'd insist on a unit near the action... not on the highway... away from construction. Luckily we spent the majority of our days at the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Suite, Huge Resort”
Reviews.Author: dougpickering5
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days at Orange Lake. First off this is a huge resort covering many acres. It was a 5 or 10 minute drive sometimes from the highway to our building. If you are interested in a specific resort attraction (pool, restaurant, etc) get a map and make sure your building is near it or you might find the distances to be an inconvenience. We stayed in a building between a pool and a golf course, we faced the golf course side. Very quiet and the room was huge. One of the largest one bedroom suites I've ever stayed in, via exchange or otherwise. Everything was clean and in very good condition. The decor was a little tacky but still bright and cheerful. We had very little interaction with staff outside of check in and check out and that went smooth. We got 1 phone call every other day asking us to go to time share presentations but a simple no each time was enough. The pool area was very clean and well maintained. We spent a lot of time at Disneyworld and basically visited just our room and the nearby pool but were very happy with both. We felt very secure and the attendant at the resort entrance we used always greeted us with a wave and a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a shot”
Reviews.Author: Rebeccam
Reviews.Content: Went here for a week with two friends in July 06. Had a great time and think the resort is pretty good. We had a massive apartment between the four of us, really clean and nicely furnished, with a balcony overlooking the golf course.There are a number of pool areas, which are nice with loads of loungers and a wicked slide and lazy river. One thing I will say, don't eat in the resort as it's quite expensive and there are better and cheaper places nearby. and defintely get a rental car if you stay here, the place is vast!

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort Ever”
Reviews.Author: ktbriggs
Reviews.Content: My parents and family went to Disney and stayed at Orange Lake Resort. We all stayed in the same room, (4 adults and 1 child) and there was no crowding. It saved on the purchase of two seperate hotel rooms and offered all the amenities of home. We had a perfect view of the Disney Fireworks every night and our balcony overlooked the golf course. It was absolutly beautiful! The shuttle service around the resort was very efficient. There were several diffrent pools, entertainment and activities going on for what ever your mood was. The only negative comment I would have to say is that the promotion of the time shares was everywhere, so towards the end of our vactaion, we decided to see what they had to offer. This proved to be extremely timely and what was suppose to be a couple of hours turned into half a day. So if you plan on taking a tour, make sure you have nothing else planned for at least 4 hours. We enjoyed it so much that we are going back again next year. I would recommend this resort for large families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort- but very spread out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake at the end of June. With four kids, our main focus was being near Disney World, and getting to the parks everyday. Orange Lake is about eight miles from all of them. We also wanted to be able to have a couple of mornings or late afternoons to just hangout by the pool. We found four different pools to choose from. All very nice with plenty of chairs and amenities. The problem that we found with Orange Lake was that we had to get in our van and drive to the pools, or anywhere else on their property. It is a huge resort. A very nice, well kept up, beautiful resort. There is an 18 hole golf course right in the middle of the resort with units all around the course. It was a five minute drive from the main entrance to our unit! Our room was great, one of the best units we have ever stayed in. If we had gone to golf it would have been awesome. We just got annoyed with getting in the van to go for a swim. Our kids are old enough to go the pool by themselves, but we had to drive them and either wait with them or schedule a pick-up time to come back and get them. It is a very nice place but I don't think I would go back just because of sheer size of the place and not being able to relax as much as we would like.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lexington118
Reviews.Content: like most of the other reviews we had a great time. the rooms were big and clean. like most places we have stayed the beds were hard but after a long day at the parks you forget about that quick. we didnt get a chance to enjoy all the pools but the ones we went to were very nice and clean. i do recommend you rent a car it is like 3 miles from the main st to the club house. we will go back again and mabey spend more time there then at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: litlbit
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at O.L. We were put in a 2 bedroom Villa in the West Village but quickly walked over and asked to be put in the New River Island area. At 1st they told us their was no way, that it was booked solid but when she plugged something in the computer, surprisingly a room became available. We think the place was actually half empty as this is where they take the timeshare tours. The pool/lazy river wasn't that crowded at all, not like some of the reviews made it out to be. We were put on the 7th floor directly above the lazy river. The condo was very nice!!! Clean and plenty of room for the 7 of us, with a screened in porch, so no bugs! Also could see the fireworks from Disney every night. The washer and dryer in the condo are a definite PLUS!!! So nice to be able to wash and dry suits and towel right away. The beds were also VERY COMFORTABLE! The food and service at the River Island Grill was excellent. We went over to the breakfast buffet in the old area (West) one morning and it was terrible. Don't bother wasting your money! It was soooo hot in there you couldn't wait to get out and the food wasn't the greatest or the selection, service sucked too!!! I think that's the only complaint we had. Also, the West village area is very crowded due to people checking in and out constantly. We were glad we were able to move to the River Island Complex. Oh yeah, the only other problem we couldn't believe we had to deal with was the number of times they closed the lazy river for an hour in the middle of the HOT afternoon for cleaning. It seems they have ALOT of accidents with "LOGS IN THE POOL" 3 times on 3 different afternoons, someone [--] in the pool and they had to close it for cleaning. Never in my life have I been to a resort where this has happened, much less 3 TIMES! I asked the waitress about it and she said you'd be surprised how often it does happen. The 1st day it happened we just heard through the grapevine and could hardly believe it but when it happened 2 days later, I asked one of the lifegaurds why they were closing the pool again and he's the one that said "LOGS in the pool, you know, kids!" I couldn't believe it! Then on the day we were leaving we heard it happeded again! That was our biggest complaint about Orange Lake. It was kinda the standing joke of the week, wondering if the pool would be closed again due to "LOGS" Check out time was 10am and our flight wasn't leaving til 7pm so we asked for a late checkout but that was out of the question. We were told the West and North Village pools had shower areas in the restrooms and we were welcome to use the ammenities until we left for the airport. We chose to go to the North pool until it was time to leave. This pool is very nice too and we figured it wouldn't be as crowded as the west. We found It wasn' t too crowded but they don't have showers in this area, only in the West Village so you may want to keep that in mind if you want to shower after checkout. All in all our stay at Orange Lake was very nice and we would definitely go back. As a matter of fact, my brother and his wife bought a vacation special that they can use in the next 2 years and their timeshare offer is frozen until they come back in case they decide to buy. My husband and I (40+) are already owners and traded through RCI to go to Orange Lake....Next year we're off to ST. Martin..........CARIBBEAN, HERE WE COME!!!!! We had enough of Disney for a while but as for my brother, his wife and 3 kids........they couldn't get enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected the worst but had the best”
Reviews.Author: no1toothfairy
Reviews.Content: Having spent most of the previous months before our trip reading the mixed reviews of this resort and being an RCI exchange, we expected that we would be left in what could be classed as sub standard accommodation. Now the kids have grown and left home we decided to have three weeks acting our shoe size and not our age. Our accommodation to our delight was in the east village, two bed, two bathroom and all modern appliances. All very clean and fresh. Could not find fault with anything. The apartment was serviced once a week and yes we did wash our towels but I found that as they supplied the washer/dryer, electricity and powder it was not much of a hardship. You do get a welcome pack and I did find ours after two days so look in the cupboard in a plastic bag that looks at first glance just to contain spare toilet rolls and you will find coffee, tea, dishwasher powder and a few other items to get you started. Would be better if it was left out in the kitchen so easier to identify especially if arriving jet lagged! Yes, the resort is very big but we only hired a car for two of our three weeks the last week we spent on the resort using the shuttle bus and walking. I timed a walk from our room to reception and it takes about 40 minutes, 10 minutes to river island and about 3 minutes to the pool in the east village. The bus ran very regularly and often if using it at night the drivers would ask for your block number and take you right to your door, if not the most time it would take to your room would be about 5 minutes walk from the stop. We ate in all the restaurants including the new tradewinds which opened whilst we were there and could recommend them all. The only negative area for us was we went to the country music night and found they shut the bar at 7pm. If driving to the disney theme parks use the toll road 429. (Not the 192). Leave the resort by the east gate (by the publix) turn immediately right onto the 429, (it runs through the middle of the resort). It cost 1 dollar in toll fees but we could get from our apartment to the car park in the magic kingdom within 15 minutes and most of the time we were the only ones using the road it was like having the m25 to yourself. Cannot comment on the older apartments but spent some time talking to some owners of these and they were saying that they were being refurbished and brought more up to date. All in all we had an excellent 3 weeks to celebrate our 30th anniversary

Reviews.Title: “Glad the negative reviews were wrong!!”
Reviews.Author: HardwayAl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake in a 3 bedroom unit close to the New River Island pool area from 9 to 16 June 2005. In a word the condo was awesome. There was plenty of room for the 10 of us and having 3 bathrooms came in handy in the morning when we were all getting ready to go to the theme parks at the same time. The condo itself had 1 bedroom with a king bed with a nice size chair , a desk, and a large closet.. It also had a large bathroom with 2 sinks, a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The 2nd bedroom had a double bed, a small couch that converted into a full size bed, a round glass table with 2 chairs, and a nice size closet. Its bathroom only had 1 sink and a shower. My daughter said the fold out bed was not very comfortable at all. The 3rd bathroom had 2 double beds. It had no other furniture besides small chest of drawers and a small closet. It had no bathroom in it but the 3rd bathroom is right outside the door. It also had only a single sink and just a shower. The kitchen is full sized and comes with most everything you need to do any cooking if you wanted to. They did no have any storage bowls for leftovers so we bought large freezer bags to do that. The living room had a large sectional couch which made into a queen size bed but my other daughter said it was more comfortable to sleep on the couch itself and not fold out the bed. The screened in balcony was great and we could see fireworks every night from both MGM and the Magic Kingdom theme parks. No bugs to bother us as we sat out there every night The air conditioning worked great and the ceiling fans were very nice as well. All in all I had no complaints about anything. The room was clean and there was no worn furniture or bugs or dirt or mold or anything bad. There were some raccoons that we saw on the 3rd floor landing that left their “calling cards” on some of the stairs but we managed not to step in any! The pool areas, the lake, and the other public areas were also very nice. They were building a new 36 hole mini golf course at River Island and they opened up a new steak and seafood restaurant the day we left so we did not get to try it. The two 18 hole golf courses were impressive and fun to play. Prices are good especially after 11 AM. They also have 2 Par-3 courses one that is lighted for night play. We did not play those as we were too busy. The resort was kind of pricey when it came to meals and other purchases. You had to spend $6 a peice for the floats to use the lazy river and the food and drinks were about the same as they were at all the theme parks. But the prices were what you should expect to pay at one of these places so it was not a suprise. we planned ahead and brought a lot of our own snacks and drinks to the pool with us. You are not supposed to do that but we did and no one said anything to us. If I had one bad thing to say about the place it would be that if you are going to spend your days at the theme parks and just need a place to sleep and get cleaned up, Orange Lake is too much. You could spend 3 or 4 days just doing the things available at the resort and never have to go anywhere else with the possible exception of the Publix grocery store which is right out the east gate or the property. We would love to go back someday and enjoy the resort more than we had a chance to.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lDLCNMEE
Reviews.Content: very nice place to stay. very clean many things to do for a family. we stayed in one of the two bedroom villas. we did have to drive to the pool, but all the pool areas were very nice. the kids loved the water slide and thee walk in pool and the fountains.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler027
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of resorts in the orlando/kissimmee area, so my comments are out of comparison. The room is cheaply appointed. There is NO ceiling fan in the second bedroom. There are no DVD players. The mattresses are uncomfortable and there are no mattress covers, so you feel every nook and cranny of the mattress. There are racoons everywhere in the evening going through the garbages. When we called the desk to let them know, they said "yeah there are a lot of them around here". Also, the resort is down wind of the 'animal kingdonm'. On a humid evening, the smell is thick. There are number of swimming pools, which is nice, unfortunately, you must drive to most of them. They didn't use a nice material when surfacing the decks though. You and your children will definately burn your feet, unless wearing water shoes. The black ground bakes in the afternoon sun. Further more, they just put in a lazy river which we were excited to use. You may only use it though with a rented raft for $6 a piece. If you have children and are there for a few days, this can be VERY expensive. Also, they put in a couple of nice water slides, those though are for children over 48". Again, something not advertised and something very dissapointing to children. The slide simply aren't exiciting for someone over 48". By the way, the surface of the pool deck at the lazy river is extremely slippery and again, very hot. Try keeping water shoes on both of your small chilren. The pool is supposed to be a fun place. Not only do they nickel and dime you at the pool, but we took our children to the arcade one evening and they won some tickets, but when my six year old brought up 38 tickets, they said sorry, that's only good for 35 tickets. They round down and not up. All my child wanted was an extra tootsie. All she wanted was tootsie rolls. Not a pack, just single ones, so she chose 7, they refused to give her 8. They wouldn't round up two more. This may sound trivial, but these are the things that you get for halloween and end up throwing out. These 38 tickets that she won cost $5. This was just a principal thing for me. Also, one day they had a bon fire that they had announced but canceled at the last minute due to chance of rain....it's Florida...there's always a chance of an afternoon rain. It didn't rain, they just canceled it with no explanation. Again, another dissapintment for the children. Another time, they had an 'aligator show'. For $5 a person, your chilren could see a terrible short movie and see a baby aligator and another small aligator. Again, $5 per person. It seems trivial, but for what they were giving you this should have just been a guest appreciation event. If we had never stayed at any hotels or resorts in the area at similar prices, we might not have expected much, but Orange Lake was easily the worst place we've stayed in Orlando. Their web site looks great, but it ends there.

Reviews.Title: “OLRCC - A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi! We are owners of a 2br/2bths by the Tennis Villa since 1998 and we have always loved to go back to Orange Lake every year. It seems to us that OL has always something that calls us back. Anywhere you go there will be people who are not, will not and cannot be satisfied. The last vacation we had last August, 2005, we brought with us our friends who have no other words but praises for the whole experience that they wanted to go back even before the whole experience is over. We loved the pools, - the 8-year old boys with us loved to frolic in them, - and we can't wait for the River Island to be in full swing. You can't expect the pools to be quiet and with limited number of people on a peak season so if you are somebody who doesn't want to be bothered we suggest off-peak season vacation. The villa itself are well kept and mind you, we have also stayed on those "old villas or condos" that were mentioned in some of the reviews when my mother-in-law was with us but we find no problems with it. About the OL bird that comes to "visit", we find it to be more natural due to the fact that it adds to the beauty of the resort. Insects are somewhat expected to be present due to the many lush shrubberies and the lake itself. The grounds are well kept. The amenities are superb and we are hoping the next the next time we visit OL we would be able to use it instead of going to the theme parks. We love the comfort of the big, well equipped kitchen that we have and the thought of Publix just "around the corner." It is always a welcome sight to see the starter pack provided each time we visit. Orange lake is always considered by us as home away from home. The next time we visit, we will be bringing in more friends and families who are so enthusiastic and expectant of what the resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get stuck in older section”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We dropped our bags and went to play, came back to the room around 11:30 at night. As I was unpacking, my eye's started to tear & my stomach went in knots. My hiusband and son were finding it harder & harder to breath. The place was filthy and the smell of mold was overwhelming. Did not sleep that whole evening. Went to customer care after a time share presentation first thing in the morning, they said the best they could do was see if they had a cancellation in another part of the resort and they would call us by morning. We had to avoid the room all day, second night no one was able to sleep, the room was making us physically ill. They did call by 8am to advise us there were no other openings in any other part of the resort, they could move us to another room in the same section. Being very leary, if one had mold what is the likelyhood that the rest in that section were the same. Did not want to waste my vaca moving from one room to another. Called RCI, they were great, found us another resort in Orlando that took us in immediately. Had to move once but to accommodations I could be comfortable to have my family stay in. In packing up I was disgusted when I noticed stains all over the boxspring of the bed where one of my sons had slept, (looked like blood or iodine, I took pictures and plan on a formal complaint to better business bureau and department of health) had seen that before I never would have stayed as long as I did to allow them time to service us as guests, I am sickened my son slept in that bed and that the matressed has not been replaced. There is no way housekeeping has not seen that. . They have the nerve to put you in thise rooms and then ask you to purchase an expensive timeshare? Never in a place were it is so blatent money comes before customer HEALTH & comfort. As for the rest of the resort, offered many nice amenities, Kemmons buffet was great, it could have been a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: chrisymomof3
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. It was great for all ages. There was plenty to do there. The pools were beautiful and the entire place was sooo clean. The rooms were huge and beautiful. Service was great. The only thing I did not like was that you had to wash your own towels to use throughout the week. If you did not wash them you would have no clean bath towels I am on vacation I really do not want to be doing laundry. Also they do not clean your room only if stay for two weeks we only stayed for a week and if we wanted the room cleaned it would cost 50 some odd dollars I thought that was outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back last night. After reading some reviews we were worried. Our 2 bedroon villa was on the west side. Everything was great and clean. The kids loved the pools especially the lazy river that just opened.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: screbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new River Island complex. Our unit over looked the new River Island water park which was amazing. There was so much to do and the way the park was set up was incredibly kid/toddler friendly yet enjoyable for adults as well. Our room was bright, clean and spacious - so new you could still smell the paint and the carpet - beautiful decor and everything was so comfortable. The hubbys loved the golf courses and even took the pro camp to help with their swing - we all found the staff to be incredibly courteous and knowlegeable and the best part was that there was even an indoor playground and internet cafe for those days that were to hot or too wet (which there wasn't many). Our family will definetly stay here again - for anyone looking to stay here - when you check in and they assign you a room - go across the hall to the reservations desk and ask to be reassigned to the River Island Complex - they will do it with no hassle and your family will LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Disney_Dreamer
Reviews.Content: After reading for months many negative reviews on Orange Lake we finally had an opportunity to check this place out ourselves. We were given a 3 bedroom unit in the North end. I must say it was one of the best places we have ever stayed in. The unit was huge and very well decorated. Everything worked and I never had any issues at all. The kids loved the many pools at Orange Lake we even got to use the new River Island which just opened. We will definetly be back we loved it here!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: HD83
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from the Best vacation I have been on . Orangelake has gotten better evey year. The management has got there act together, very customer friendly. We arrived late at night around 1:30am check in was fast and no bumps or line ups. We have a time share at this resort and I can see improvements every time we go. The only bad thing to say was at the main pool the bartender does not have people skills and needs to improve his attitude. Westayed here for 2 weeks and he was the only rude person we met and that says alot for the place has a big staff. Now for the good side security was around the place every were felt very safe. The grounds were the best kept and cleanest I have seen in my travels second to none. The condos were very clean and bug free We had all the comfords of home went to the Publix store stocked up on food and saved money.The pools very clean and well kept even had a guy in the pool cleaning the sides . Best pizza in the West village lots of things for the kids to do games play ground kiddie pools . Nice shops to buy things. the food at the place was great the Legends bar had good cheap food located by the driving range. The golf is like a pro course I think there are 3 courses to play one you can play at night . They have built a water park called River Island no need for Blizzard beach or the other water parks safe to let kids float the River. They have done a great job on this resort building River Island it is very pretty and sooooo new lifguards all around the river 2 big slides to go down. This is a resort to check out you may not go any were else

Reviews.Title: “totally fanatastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: karenstu
Reviews.Content: STOP worring we had a fab time!!! stayed in a brand new apartment (3 weeks old) in east village....wonderful...how could anyone moan or have a go at - not being able to smoke on balcony .....great no smoking policy, so every where is clean from nasty stale smoke. also they have a big refurb going on to ensure all apartments are all upgrade to non smoking. golf courses are just perfect my 12 year old thought he was Tiger Woods (played during a family special day) think it is Thursday pay for your round and get free clubs .... excellent quality and a nice par 3 course. It is a big inpersonal resort, but there is so much to do and I liked the good morning and good afternoons and fast check in's and outs....we had Disney to do as well as the Malls and outlet villages along with golf and sunbathing and swimming @ splash lagoon .... lots of sunbeds .... and space early midday or late afternoon x Publix is just around the corner along with a nail salon and hairdressers (slao now doing eyelash extensions) please dont be put off by the scathing reports, people like to have a moan !!! enjoy... enjoy have fun, live each day like its your last, love every day like your first xx have a great time xxxx

Reviews.Title: “Resort was "ok"”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyOhio
Reviews.Content: We spent last week at Orange lake. The resort looked nice enough at first glance. We were there on a guest certificate and were given a condo in the West Village at the end of a cul-de-sac. Our first impression of the unit was that it was older, and a bit "worn". It had been cleaned, but the floors were dirty, and all week long we had to wear socks if we didn't want our feet to get black from the floors. I had read reviews by guests who had requested a newer unit, so right away I called guest services and asked for a newer unit, possibly in the North or East Villages. Unfortunately I was told that requests were only accepted by owners. So we just stayed put. Like I said, the unit was "ok", but it jjust wasn't very clean, and it had a nasty smell. There were bugs, but I know that is to be expected in older places in Florida. We had a problem with our fridge not working, and I called guest services to have someone take a look at it. We left for the pool that morning, and when we came back later in the day, it still wasn't working. Since we had the fridge stocked with groceries we had just bought, I called guest services again, and the operator I spoke with said the first call had never even been logged. She made sure to log the call, and got someone out right away to fix it. As for the pools, again, they were beautiful at a glance, but they were very crowded. The pools also weren't clean, and I heard several other guests make comments about how dirty the pool water was, etc. Now, I don't mean to sound like one of those people who is unhappy wherever I go. I have done a lot of travelling and have had both good and bad experiences. As I said before, this resort was ok; I was just expecting better. We did drive around the resort and the new River Island area looks nice. My husband golfs and said the courses were fine. I've read several reviews stating that the resort staff was rude. We had nothing but pleasant experiences with the staff. As for the quality of the towels (also mentioned in a negative review), that is not high on my priority list. The resort was located near tons of stores and restaurants. It was very easy and to get to the Disney parks as they were only 10 minutes away if that. The convenience of a full kitchen and washer/dryer was one of the main reasons we got a condo. Unfortunately, this just wasn't a place we wanted to spend much time in, so we ate out more than we had planned. The washer/dryer were nice, but VERY loud. Next time we do Disney, we plan to stay at a Disney resort. However if you get a really good deal on this place, it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you smoke or have the smell on your clothes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife smoked on our patio during the stay, NEVER in the unit. We lost $250 credit card charge for this. Why put ashtrays in all the units then? In my book I consider this theft by the resort. After we returned home we called and discussed this. They did not listen what so ever. If we went to a local restrauant or bar in the orlando area and returned with the smoke smell on our clothes would we also lose the deposit? We love the resort but because of the theft by orange lake of the $250 we will not being staying there in the future. We have stayed there the last 4 years. When I were there on the first day our one year grandson had a toy go under the sofa. We moved it to get the toy and found an OLD sandwich which was there for sometime. Shows what kind of job the cleaning staff is doing but they can charge $250 to get the so called smoke smell removed from the unit! We've started plans to sell the unit and found we can't give it away. Our only option might be trade it away every year.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised after reading reviews!”
Reviews.Author: feggie
Reviews.Content: We went to Orange Lake in April, 2006 on a timeshare exchange. We read the reviews, and were worried it might not be a good experience. How wrong we were. The villa we had, in the East section, was gorgeous. It was 3 bed/3 bath. The furnishings were lovely. There was every possible kitchen item you could ever ask for. The Publix supermarket on site is wonderful, and charges the same prices as all the other Publix's in Florida. We were able to "run to Publix" any time we needed to. If you don't have a car, you might not be as happy, as the complex is huge. Every night we watched the Disney fireworks at 9 p.m. from our balcony! We were solicited once to visit the sales center, and we asked what we would get for our trouble. We were promised 2 tickets to "Arabian Nights" dinner theatre, which we received after our 1 hour (which ended up being almost 2) sales presentation. (by the way, the Arabian Nights is rather shabby!) They are slick, so you have to practice saying NO. If you do fall in love with the place like we did, you can buy resales from timeshare resellers at much lower prices than buying from the sales center.

Reviews.Title: “just too big”
Reviews.Author: chick2
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed here as a guest, I to found the resort much too big for us, we were in room (like a bungalow) 2007 near an entrance. Could not fault the rooms and the resort was nice, but we could hardly get a the pools, I had to sit on the edge of the pool, no spaces whatsoever, I thought the staff were fine, alittle bit miserable in the golf shops. We spent two days at the pool area, well only half a day, you could just about move. When we drove past moderate/budget hotels the pool areas were empty, we wouldnt go back to this resort, it maybe ok out of season, but in season, it would be a no.

Reviews.Title: “like paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this resort last year in april and i absolutly enjoyed my time there it is so amazing and beautiful there. i cant wait to go back some time soon. staying there was like heaven i loved it i recommed everybody to stay there it is the best. i promise you that you will have the time of your life. dont wait and start booking!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Spring Break vacation week at Orange Lake Resort and have nothing but good things to say about it. First, I guess from reading some other reviews, we were lucky and were given a 2 bedroom suite in the East side village for our RCI exchange. Check in was easy and fast. Our unit was about 5 years old (I think) and was large and well equipped. Upon arrival, we did notice a couple of maintenance issues which we called about and they were dealt with immediately. The resort complex is large and they are adding to it. The grounds are lovely and well maintained. My kids enjoyed the swimming pools and we enjoyed a couple of good meals at the Legacy Grill (without waiting). Overall, I would return here in a heartbeat. The location is close to Disneyworld and to the Orlando international airport. We found the staff friendly. The East Gate entrance closes at 10 p.m. We found that out one night, and had to use the West Gate entrance. Check out at 10 a.m. was firmly enforced on the date of our departure but our kids enjoyed the pool until it was time to leave for the airport. If you are heading for Disneyworld, I would recommend this place, and I would also recommend purchasing tickets to Disneyworld, and making dinner reservations in the Parks, well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2006”
Reviews.Author: coldinalaska
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our second visit to this beautiful resort. We exchanged an RCI week (again) to get here. I've read some other reviews posted for March 2006 and am surprised they had problems. We've stayed here twice and have had nothing but an outstanding experience both times. We were unfortunate enough to get a studio in the clubhouse. It just wasn't big enough for a family of four. There was no chance to upgrade as all units were essentially taken. First about the unit. If you are a family of 4 or more, then don't book a studio. Way too small. Some people don't like the West Village 2-bedroom golf villas. But my wife and I prefer them over the new high rise, hotel-style villas. (Granted, the golf villas are older, but they are bigger and no stairs or elevators to deal with. Parking 10 steps from you door is a plus after a full day of activities either at the theme parks or here.) I like the ground floor golf villas. Walk out onto the patio with coffee and paper in hand and watching duffers slice the ball as badly as I do at 7:00 a.m. each morning. It does my heart good. We like the golf villa so much so, we bought a golf villa timehsare here this trip. (Hint: If interested in any type of timeshare here, make sure to ask the sales people about pre-owned timeshares. THEY ARE THOUSANDS AND THOUSANDS CHEAPER!!!!! You can always buy a golf villa and trade to the new style villas if you want.) We toured the new villas, but weren't too interested in them. Sure they look prettier, but really, how much time are you staying in your room?? Is it really worth the extra cost? If you ever get a chance to use them, the on-site amenities are just too numerous to list. (See other reviews.) Our kids just loved all the pools (I lost count at 10!!!! That's all the fingers I have and the wife wasn't too happy about my driving with no hands on the wheel.) We can't wait until the on-site water park opens. They say it will be done by May-June 2006. It looks amazing. They say that it cost $52 million to build! We found that the resort grounds were immaculately kept. Still. They have added a bunch of new units since our stay 3 years ago. (Had the West Village golf villa then.) We had only one minor housekeeping issue (no pillow cover) and it was taken care of in less than 15 minutes. All units, including studios, are fully equipped with plates, glasses, dishes, stove, microwave, etc. and include complimentary coffee (1 package regular and 1 decaf). (CAUTION: BUY MORE COFFEE IMMEDIATELY!!!!!!) Every unit (except studios) have FULL SIZE washer/dryers in the unit. You already know about Disney and Universal being sooooo close, so, no need to go there. The biggest problem we had was traffic coming back from the parks. It was a real hassle when you're beat from all the stuff the parks offer. I have to say that without a doubt the people that work here are OUTSTANDING. Everyone, and I mean everyone, we had to deal with from check in/out to the internet cafe, to the bars and restaurants, to the on-site grocery store (milk is cheaper here than at Publix) to the timeshare people to housekeeping were nothing but professional and very friendly. This may not be a 5-star resort, but it is definitely a 4 1/2.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed by all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family just arrived home from Orange Lake and are planning on going back. We have three children that range in age from 6 to 13, they all had fun! We were not overly impressed with the studio suite we had because it was too small for our family. However we did tour the villas and have decided the next time we come we will stay in one. We loved the pool areas and are looking forward to the new river island on our return. My husband didnt take his golf clubs this time but will definitely not forget them the next time. I believe that Kemmons Wilson had a great vision and Orange Lake is exactly what he wanted it to be; a family destination! Kudos to the Kemmons family!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: canadianredwing
Reviews.Content: Having just returned today from Orange Lake, I am so surprised by the negative reviews I see on this resort. We have been to many all over North America and we were thrilled with our accommodations and the treatment we received there. We were in the Tennis Villas - which are newer and our 2BR 2Bath unit was terrific. Full Washer/Dryer. We played tennis, shot a bucket of balls, played putt-putt all week (get the week's pass for your whole family if you plan on playing more than one game), rented a jetski, mouse boat & a paddle boat. We thoroughly enjoyed the pool and the jogging track around the huge grounds. We were treated with professionalism and great attention for whatever we called the front desk about. The gentlemen at Mulligan's (the pro shop) were extremely friendly and accommodating to my 9 year old and helped him pick out a couple of clubs to hit his golf balls with. Met several long time owners and they were all very friendly and the place definately had a family feel. My kids loved the camp fire sing along with smores on Thursday night. My 15 year old enjoyed the teen meet and greet night. We had a great time. We did go to the sales presentation and were out in an hour and a half, since we already own a timeshare. "Jeff" was not high pressure and was very enjoyable. FYI, I asked him about the infamous "Jim" from another review and he stated that he had left to work for the Mariott. We received $40 U.S. cash and a coupon book for our time. We had a great time and would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Bring the Kids”
Reviews.Author: jhmvis
Reviews.Content: Used an RCI exchange here...was stafisfied, if not totally excited. Great property - 10 mins to all the Disney theme parks and probably another 10-15 to Universal parks. Wanted a location with pool (my wife) and golf (me) onsite...this property hits the mark there. Two 18 hole courses (play the Legends - very nice resort course...the Reserve is OK) and two executive/par 3 courses (one is lit at night). Pools are large and not spectacular, but plenty of lounges/chairs and pool side amenities. If you have kids, this is the place: arcades, pool and ping pong tables, mini-golf, water slides, and lake activities (ski-doos, boats, fishing, etc). It is, as the other reviewers have mentioned, a very large property...with lots to do. It is not a 5 star property, but it is very "solid". Not sure about the "older" units/bad maintenance quality: we stayed in a two bedroom, single stroy condo right on the golf coures...was very nice. We preferred it to the "new" units that are 6-8 stories filled with multiple condos like a mega hotel. I would recommend this property as a destination. It won't be the nicest or most impressive property you've ever stayed at, but it was very nice. We didn't find any "cuisine" at the restaurants onsite, but the food was decent and easy. After a full day at Disney, that may be all you need/want. Take the kids...swim and play golf...and go to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “orange lake not good”
Reviews.Author: jered
Reviews.Content: We just went to orange lake on a guest exchange through RCI. Because we were on a guest exchange, I knew we would probably be placed in an older unit in the west clubhouse, which we were. We just decided to be okay with it since we planned on going to disney everyday and just wanted to sleep at the resort. We have stayed in several places through RCI, and orange lake was definitely the worst. It may be nicer in the newer units on the north side, as this area and the pool looked nicer. The mix of people that stay at this resort is also interesting, being that you have some elderly, young people that seem nice, and others that I notice let their kids swim in their diapers or underwear at the pool? Overall, this resort is not up to my family's usual standard of places to stay and I don't think it should continue to be a gold crown resort for RCI. I would not recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star”
Reviews.Author: Jabberwockyinco
Reviews.Content: We traded our week in Hawai'i for this resort through an RCI excahange. The resort is huge and that may also be it's downfall. With that much acrage in house keeping to cover (3213 units), the overall result is sloppy to say the least. We did our research early before trading into Orange Lake. Our research said that to have a good time to be sure to stay in the New Section. I made several phone calls to try to get this done. When we were put in an old unit that was near the highway I complained. I was moved to a secluded unit (still an old one) and although not what I wanted I accepted it after I was finally informed that no one other than New Owners could stay in the New Section. Then we found all the maintence and house keeping issues that were not taken care, of such as formica hanging off one cabinet door that almost cut my granddaughter's fingers, the kitchen faucet knob broken off so that we had no hot water for the dishes, the dryer vent being broken so that the lint from drying clothes was all over the house, an empty half pint of milk under the bed in the master suite, small dead bugs in the second bath and lost of dirt around the patio door. Each time I complained I was treated with patience and respect and they addressed each issue as I found it but IT'S NOT MY JOB to be the maintenance or housekeeping supervisor. The resort is actually so large that they do not have time for the details that make a resort great. This is not tosay we didn't have a good time there. We did. (Do they train those cranes to come to your patio and beg for food?? LOL)Just not what you would expect from a RCI Gold Crown Resort. It IS Beautiful!! and conveient to Disney and the other vacation parks...but "The Devil is in the Details" and this is not a "Five Star Resort"

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in the world. No Exceptions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I go to Orange Lake every year scince 1998 and loved it. It was so much fun and my 3 kids loved it. The pool is awsome. It has beautiful waterfalls falling down and a water slide. Well, there actually are two pools, but splash lagoon is better because it has waterfalls, slides, jets, basketball, volleyball, and if you want to you can go into the arcade which also has a movie rental area. The other pool is a cooler lap pool buy still is fun. Some other activities you can do are play minigolf, go to dances, watch FREE big screen movies, swim in the man-made (but still awsome) salt lake, arcade, take a beautiful walk on the sidewalk, golf, go to eat, and many more things. The rooms are one of the best things about it. They are nice rooms that are always clean, smell good, and have great appliences. The only complaint which is so small is that there is not that great selections of places to eat. But other than that it is the best place in the whole world.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time share in Florida.”
Reviews.Author: bssd
Reviews.Content: We became owners at Orange lake last year. We bought our 2bed. 2bath timeshare on ---- sight unseen. We bought it by the reviews I read on this site and others. Well let me tell you we were not suprised! We bought a unit on Lake Kem Way, it is fantastic! It is on a side street in the complex. Every mornining I got up at daybreak and enjoyed a cup coffee with the Blue Herron that walked up to me while I was watching the Ducks in the pond. While the unit I bought was in the older section of the complex, it was very clean, and did not look old at all. Our only complaint was the washer -dryer was about as old as the ones we have at home. Abought 10 years old. Well if your not real well to do, you know these appliances start to get a little noisy at this time. Being as they are right in the kitchen-living area, I would like to see them replaced a little more often. Now , about the size of the resort. It is huge. And my advice would be for anyone who is not willing to walk at least 1/2 mile , rent a car. But, over all, with a 9 year old child, I would not choose anywhere else in O rlando to spend with my child. Slash Lagoon, Heee!loved it!. In May if they are still on schedule, they will open River Island. We drove by the construction site, and it was unbelieveble. Huge water slides,14 acres of water fun. I mean 14 acres. Most timeshare complexes aren"t 14 acres. Well, I guess anyone can find fault anywhere, but aside from some what noisy appliances. NO COMPLAINTS AT ALL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've actually been to Orange Lake twice already in 2006 and are very likely to return. If you are a golfer (which we are not) it is hard to beat having four courses right on property. The West Village is oldest, but has its charm. The units are quieter, but do not have jacuzzis. The newer East Village where we stayed both times are 6 story buildings near two golf courses, but only a small pool. The action is in the West Village and the North Village. That is until March, when the action for families with kids will be at the new River Park, the resort's own waterpark! I don't think we'd like to stay in those villas, but the water fun is close enough to the East Village to raise it's attractiveness. We found the service wonderful. On our first stay, we had minor problems with the dryer (it was very loud) and a few missing light bulbs. Hector from maintenance did what he could with the dryer and then went and found the masher/dryer mechanic to get advice. He returned promptly, adn voila, a quiet dryer. It is a big resort, but we found the staff willing to make us happy. Perhaps this is harder in peak seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake - Just an OK experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Orange Lake the week of Feb 12th 2006. The resort is larger than expected. In fact you will need to travel by car or shuttle to hit most of its amenities. We stayed there via RCI exchange, and most of the reviews were correct. They do put exchange in older units - one story units that do not look that nice. I took 30 minutes to request a unit in a high-rise near a pool and ended up with a unit in the north village. The unit itself was not cleaned well. The couch was clearly aged, as well as the towels, kitchen utenciles and mattresses. In fact, the family below us took a trip to the ER for a case of bed bugs!!!!! Had I known that earlier in my trip I would have changed hotels!!!!! Another point, there is some sort of nasty odor that hits the resort early in the morning and late at night. Not sure if this is from the golf course or the mulch. Despite this pools are very nice, but busy and it is close to Disney. I definitely would not recommend purchasing a unit at this resort - but for an exchange it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “I have been every february since 1994 and I love it”
Reviews.Author: StevenBlades
Reviews.Content: If you read the other reports and your wondering weather to stay here then you should, I have never ever been to a resort as good as Orange Lake. I travel from Manchester, England every year and the 9/10 hour flight is worth every minute, orange lake is a vacation in itself you have everything you need, theres a cinema various pools, golf etc. I agree that the sales reps can be a pain but just ignore them, I rate this palce as the best resort I have ever stayed at I fly out in two weeks to go there again : - ) for the 13th time. If you do go I hope you enjoy it as much as me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - but big!”
Reviews.Author: NHtravellers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orange Lake. Our unit was located in the East Village. This was almost 3 miles from the main building. This section is close to the new River Park that is under construction - not sure when that will be completed. There was plenty for my kids to do here - miniature golf, boat rentals, beach, many pools. It was a little cool when we were there but some of the pools were heated. The accomodations were great. We were on the fifth floor in a 2 bedroom unit. It was clean and very spacious. My husband enjoyed the availability of using his wireless connection on his laptop. The resort did call the unit every morning around 9AM but we just didn't answer the phone since we knew it would be a call regarding a time share and we are already RCI members. The golf courses looked great. This resort will be great once they get the River Park operating. I would recommend a car for this resort. There are so many things to see and do outside the resort. Disney is only about 10 minutes away. Every restaurant chain is on Highway 192 outside the resort. My children are 11, 9, and 8 and they said the resort was awesome! I guess it really depends on what section of the resort you are placed in.

Reviews.Title: “Once was enough”
Reviews.Author: mscxd
Reviews.Content: We went to Orange Lake on an RCI exchange. We had a First Class, Gold Crown exchange, but Orange Lake treated us as if we had a steerage exchange. Orange Lake has three tiers of accommodations: Villa, high rises and "Guest". We were assigned to "Guest" accommodations because we were not Orange Lake owners. RCI has a policy that you get equivalent accommodations when you go through their exchange program, so we didn't worry. The "Guest" accommodations we were assigned to were worn and musty, definitely not at our level of exchange. I have seen better two star accommodations. So, we went back to registration to tell them that we wanted better accommodations. Registration told us to go to another desk. Desk #2 told us to go to desk #3. When we got to the desk #3 it was closed. So we went back to Desk #2 and got a phone number. We were told to use a telephone in the middle of a busy lobby. It was very hard to hear since they were holding Bingo in the same area. The customer service representative that answered was polite, accommodating, and understood our reason for wanting a better room. She made the computer changes and told us to go back to Registration and pick up a new key. By the time we were done going back and forth over an hour had past. Not the best of starts. At this point, we were tired and hungry, so we went down to the pizza shop in the Registration building. It took over 20 mins. to get a server to acknowledge us and another 40 mins for the pizza to come. By the way, there were only two other customers in the shop. When we got to the new room, it was much better and appeared to be up to Gold Crown standard. It wasn't until we checked around the next day to find that there was mold, mildew and bugs in both bathrooms; some of the bathroom tiles in the master bath were falling off; and a number of supplies, like soap, were missing. We called Guest Services and got the supplies, but no one in the week we were there addressed the tiles, mold, mildew or bugs. Maintenance was not a forte at Orange Lake. We came back to the suite one night at 11pm to find our fire alarms chirping. Apparently, they hadn't changed the batteries in over a year, so we had to wait until midnight for maintenance to replace the batteries. By the way, they say they have shuttle service between the buildings and functions, but we had to walk a full half a mile to get to a shuttle stop. We then had to bake in the Florida sun for 15 mins. It wasn't worth it. One night, we were called and invited to a one hour breakfast the next day so that they could tell us about the new water park being built on site. We were told that it was not a sales pitch; they understood we were RCI exchangers and wouldn't want to buy anything. They just wanted to advertise the waterpark. Three times I was told that it wouldn't take more than an hour. Silly me, I believed them. After 2.5 hours we were released from timeshare sales hell. We couldn't really leave, because they drove a mile away from our car to go the "breakfast". We had to go all the way through the sales pitch to get out. The double talk and fake professionalism was laughable. Then to end things, we went to check out and they charged us $5 for placing three 800 phone calls. What a rip off. I have done a lot of traveling around the world. I know the difference between a resort and a motel with a pool. This place is a moderate motel with several pools. We stayed once, but not again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
