Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I, Daughter, Son-in-Law and two grandchildren, girl 12, boy 7. We all absolutely fell in love with this place. In fact, we were so impressed that we inquired about learning more about the place and bought a timeshare. We were not pressured in any way, shape ,or form. We found this place to be everything we had hoped for and a whole lot more. The only unfortunate part, was the fact that we had too many things planned outside the place and were unable to participate in as many activities as we would have liked, this time. There is so many activities at the Resort that one doesn't need to leave. My Daughter owns a scrapbook store and has been telling everyone about this place it is awesome!!! It is very hard for us to believe anyone could have a bad experience here. I would encourage anyone looking at staying at Orange Lake, to look at the website and look at what they offer. Thank You, Orange Lake for making great memories for our family. We look forward to our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved it, lots to do for everyone in our family. Also very close to Disney made it great.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our friends set us up with a 2BR villa unit as they could not use their timeshare week. We paid $500 for the week and thought this was a great resort and a great location. After reading some negative reviews I was a little bit leary but for no reason as it turned out. We asked for a North or East village but were flat out refused since we are not RCI owners. Upon getting our room keys in the West village I was very pleasantly surprised with a spotless and spacious unit that looked over a par 3 hole on the golf course and the lake beyond that, it was awesome. This was a family trip so I left the clubs at home but next time will plan on some golf. We did get in 4 rounds of mini golf which was a lot of fun and inexpensive with thier week-long rate of $5 a person ,kids (11,9,6) loved it. Coming from CT the weather was fine for swimming, 50s at night,we used the pools every night after the parks and essentially had them to ourselves. The other bonus of the West units is that those pools are the only heated ones and we were in walking distance to them. Summary: Great pool complex, Florida weather is sooo nice in Dec. when coming from the NE, large, clean units, screened porch's with view, location is convenient to everything, too many things to do in one week, internet access in business center, golf courses looked very nice. Only drawback was 10 am checkout, no late checkout, they were literally waiting for us to leave to make up the room .

Reviews.Title: “West side villas were nice”
Reviews.Author: gsxrrob333
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a West side villa, not the main buildings, just a 2b/2b villa. Nice and quiet. Had a pond in front with golf course. Uh..golf courses all over the place. I don't golf, but if I did, I guess this place would be very convenient. Room 2352, nothing really to complain about except my friend said one of the queen beds had a mattress that needed to be replaced soon. Washer and dryer in the kitchen. Hmmm, not the best location for that. Not enough supplies for a whole week, but we came prepared and packed our own laundry soap to wash towels, clothes. Super market right down the street. If you get a west side unit, ask to be put in a villa, not the main buildings. Much more like a home. Didn't hear a sound from anyone. There is also a smaller pool near the entrance of the resort on the west side where we stayed. Much more relaxed, heated better then the other pools and the spa was nice. Over all a great stay...even in the west side.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in the North building and were very impressed...”
Reviews.Author: Karies
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about this place and was quite concerned that we would have a bad experience. When I got there, I asked if we could have a room in the North or East building. Apparently we were going to be given a room in the West building, but they said they would check. The woman came back and gave us a room in the North building. OUr room overlooked the golf course and we were able to watch the Disney fireworks every night. I was very pleased with the room. It was a 2 bdrm, 2 bath unit that was spacious, pleasant and clean ( the carpet could use a cleaning, though). It was very relaxing to come back to our unit after a day at the parks. I would definitely come here again (as long as I could stay in the NOrth or East units). It seems like a crapshoot as to which room you get into.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !! 2 thumbs UP!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Disney 12/3/05-12/12/05. We stayed at Orange Lake for 7 nights during our vacation. I requested a new unit in the East Village. This unit was Fantastic. Building 87000, right on the Legends fairway. The rooms were clean. We had a 2BR, 2bath unit, full kitchen, washer and dryer. The kids loved having their own TV in the room. We ate breakfast everday in our unit before heading out to Dinsey. This saved us alot of $$. Travel time to any of the Disney parks was only 8 to 12 mins. My boys loved Splash Lagoon. I didn't need any customer service help, so I can't tell you anything about that. But as far as this newer room, it was great. We were on the second floor. Each Bulding has one elevator and two stairwells. They even have a few luggage carts located next to the elevator. I paid $525 for 7 nights,(brother inlaw transfered his timeshare through RCI for us.)

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Orange Lake CC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake Country Club from Nov. 18-25, 2005. We called ahead of our arrival (after reading some poor reviews on TA) and requested a unit in the North Village. We were very pleased with our accommodations. The unit was very clean, spacious, with everything in working order. We had a car, so getting around to the pools or putt-putt course was easy. Orange Lake is about 4 miles from the Disney property. The West Village units looked old from the outside, and many of them are right along Highway 192. I wouldn't want to take a chance on the West Village side, but the East and North Villages are terrific. The golf courses looked great and well maintained. The walking par-3 course is even ligthed until 10:00 PM! The landscaping is also beautiful and well maintained. All in all, we were very pleased with Orange Lake and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: islandrockin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orange Lake and before leaving I was quite concerned after reading many of the reviews on Trip Advisor.We were checked in to one of the older units and I am so glad that I knew from the advice on TA to ask for a newer unit.This in and of itself is not really how I like to book a room,it shouldnt be like rolling the dice.However the room we were assigned to was excellent,it was in the East Village overlooking the golf course,nicely appointed 2 bdrm unit,quite clean except for the cushion in the dining nook it was very dirty needed replacing,everything else was very good,all the amenities,great bathroom with large shower and soaker tub.The pool was spotless and very relaxing.This resort has something for everyone in my opinion.The west village has a lot of activities and is busy,fun vacation stuff like bingo at the pool,arts and crafts etc,etc.Tennis courts,golf courses,basketball,trails to walk,watersports.The grounds are very well maintained.The legends Grille was good although the restaurants in the west clubhouse are dated and not that nice.I would not want an older room by the 192 hwy.The north and east village are the newest,the north seems more geared for kids and the east for adults.Close to everything,grocery store close by.Overall we had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lakie Resort is The Place!”
Reviews.Author: Carlysue
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Orange Lake, came thru our daugh. in-law's RCI. We would stay again at Orange Lake in a heart beat! We had a 2BR suite w/full kitchen, etc. It was simply beautiful, and the resort is right next door to Disney. (We watched the fireworks every night at Disney from our spacious screened-in porch.) We loved everything about the resort. We could spend a week just there and still have plenty to do. The lake area w/beach & boat rentals is so pretty too. Pools & hot tubs all over the place. The prime rib buffet at Kemmon's is delish. The beds were comfy. (We are not smokers, but surprised to notice 2 clean ash trays on the counter. Our suite did not smell of cig. smoke. People who are bothered by smoking places should make sure they go to a place that will assure them a non-smoking accommodation. Some places at Orange Lake are, from what we've heard. Smokers have their rights too.) We hadn't been to Disney in 8 yrs. We had guests (family who live in Fla.) for a few nights and they couldn't believe how impressive it was. Restaurants & shopping are all nearby. The resort is HUGE, it took a couple days to find our unit everytime we went out without using the map they give you. All the staff were friendly and helpful. I could go on & on! Carleen & Ken, Farmington CT.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at Orange Lake and we had a great time at the resort. We were assigned an older 2 bedroom bungalow but due to the reviews on TripAdvisor, we knew to asked for a newer unit. They said they would try but it wouldn't be until the next day. As promised, they called us 8:00 am the next day to let us know that they did have a newer unit available. We had actually considered staying in the bungalow as it was pretty nice but decided to move as the bungalow was too far away from the pools and golf course. We received a newer unit right in front of the tennis courts on the West side. We were really happy that they had newer units there as we were walking distance from the clubhouse, 3 pools, tennis courts and the golf course. (The kids loved the "mushroom" waterfall pool). We stayed at one of the 2 bedroom villas that they show on their website. It is smaller than the bungalow but it was nicer plus close to everything. Our screened in porch looked out to a golf course and lake. The only negative was that the water pressure in the shower was very poor and the washer was extremely noisy. There was only one elevator but we never had to wait very long. Unlike some other places, they do not provide additional ammenities (detergent, soap, etc) other than a starter kit but they do have a general store and Publix market is nearby. Overall, it is an ideal place to stay as there is lots to do at the resort, provided your villa is not too far away, and Disney World plus other attractions are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE just arrived home after a 4 day stay. Driving to the pools was no problem. We enjoyed a two bedroom and 2 bath condo that was 20 years old. We bought into the time share and will be happy to go to the resort once a year if not more. The West End had two pools and a beach area. There are tennis courts and also golf courses. For a veggie vacation it was terrific. Drinks a little pricey. For a vacation with grandkids, Disney is close enough to have a blast. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place..Could Stand Some Improvements”
Reviews.Author: TucsonWildcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orange Lake Country Club from 10/14 - 10/19/05 with an RCI exchange. The grounds were nicely kept and secure. We stayed in the East Village. Check-in was quick and easy. Had to drive a ways to get to our room, however, the room was nicely appointed, clean and bright. My only complaint was that the master bed mattress was low quality (thin ... you could feel and hear the springs). Other than that, for the cost, the room was very nice. Checkout was very quick and easy as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough pools”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at this resort 10/2/05 thru 10/9/05 and would have to say it is ok. We checked in with no problems, I asked the man at the desk if he would please put us as close as possible to a pool or a bar/grill and he assured me that we were really close. Upon arriving at our room in the North Village the closest pool was Splash Lagoon and it was 2.1 mile from our room. I don't know about everyone else but that is Not close in my opinion. The room itself was very nice but I called and spoke with the manager on duty and explained that when I phoned earlier in the week I was assured that if making a request upon arrival I would get near a pool and that 2.1 miles was not acceptable. She searched the facilities and relocated us to the East Village right next to a pool with a hot tub. Even though this was a small pool it was much better. We still had to drive to get to a bar/grill. My overall opinion of Orange Lake is that it is just ok. The grounds are very nice and clean, the room was great, 2 bedroom villa was very roomy. We had a great view of fireworks from Magic Kingdom & Epcot every night. However, this resort is designed for Golfers rather than those who want to be able to walk out of their room and be at a pool and have a drink and relax. My 5 year old loved Splash Lagoon but we did have to get in the car and drive half way through the resort to get there. They advertise 6 pools but they don't tell you that 4 of them are at the same location (Splash Lagoon) and one by the main entrance and one in the East Village. The only other complaint I had is that the elevator in our building smelled really bad.

Reviews.Title: “First time share experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved Orange Lake, we are RCI swappers, got great clean fresh condos, enjoyed the onsite entertainment , pools, games. We were treated like they were trying to sell us and didnt.Close to everything, just watch the crocodiles in the lake we saw them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality towels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at OL the week of Sept. 3rd with my husband's sister and her family in one of the newer large buildings on the 5th floor. Although the rooms are very spacious and the view was great (saw both Magic Kingdom and Epcot fireworks) I was very disappointed in the quality of the towels. I expected to have lush, thick towels, instead of the very thin towels that lower class motels use. We were also expecting to have maid service mid-week and did not. We were coerced into attending the timeshare presentation by my sister-in-law to get the "free" breakfast. Although we did not purchase a timeshare after having approximately 5 different people talk to us after the initial presentation, we did purchase a week vacation for a 2 bdrm 2 bath. After reading some of the comments, I'm very skeptical about takking the vacation, fearing that we will get one of the older units that have not been refurbished. Also, I have seen on a site the sale of some timeshares at a much lower price than we were offered for Gold Crown status.

Reviews.Title: “very upset with Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: shoney
Reviews.Content: We checked into Orange Lake County Club (OLCC) on August 27th. We were told by RCI as well as several OLCC employees that rooms assignments were made right before check-in but request are honored based upon availability. We were lied to!!!!! We were assigned one of the oldest units in the place. When we requested a newer village, we were told that they were reserved for owners only. If you are going there on an exchange beware. After several requests we were moved to a recently refurbished unit in the Tennis villas (still part of the older west village complex). It was simply okay. The bathroom needed much improvement. The new coat of paint did not cover up the mildew and grime in the shower. The West Village Clubhouse was dirty and the bathrooms were gross. At one point I needed to complain about the bathrooms because not a single stall was usable and the response was "not again"! The North Village side was a little nicer. Besides being lied to, our biggest objection to OLCC is the people who stay there. They are rough, rude and ill-mannered. It has the same ambience as a New York subway. If you are getting away for a little quiet relaxation this may not be for you. If you like crowds and a lot going on around you, you may enjoy it. We stayed at Summer Bay the week before and really enjoyed it. I would never stay at OLCC again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time!”
Reviews.Author: DayDreamer89
Reviews.Content: I had a really nice time at Orange Lake. I used my mother in law's timeshare on a transfer through RCI and we had a beautiful room overlooking a medium size pond with a fountain in the middle. There was a small problem checking in but it wasn't that big of a deal. The desk attendant asked the manager for help after she couldn't find my name but the manager quickly rectified the problem and I was off to my room. We had a very clean and spacious room with a very pretty view. I wouldn't consider Orange Lake top of the line but I was very satisfied with the accommodations we had. My wife and I generally do not like to travel during peak season, especially to Disney, so we always have a great time no matter where we are because there are no crowds. We took the kids to the pool and they had a great time, it was semi-crowded but nothing to complain or raise a fuss about. We didn't get a chance to play put-put golf or use some of the other amenities but I'm sure next year we'll do more at the resort itself. I've read a lot of reviews on here where "other guest" have made the reviewer complain about the resort. With all due respect I refuse to allow complete strangers or small typical hotel problems ruin my well deserved vacation. I'll be back next year! Space Moutain and Rockin Roller Coaster here I come!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: mamasai
Reviews.Content: We were at OL last week 8/21-8/28 and absolutely loved it. After reading the reviews I asked for the North Village and received villa # 3633. Great location off the main road and on the ground level. The villa was clean and one could still smell the paint. Splash Lagoon is located in the North Village and has a heated pool with a "mini" slide. The kids (ages 2, 10, 13, 16) loved it. There are lots of activities for all ages. Florida living - small lizards, bugs and a 5 min. rain shower everyday. The East village is for golfers and located in the back of the resort away for everyone. They are building the water park close to the East Village and we discovered another entrance onto 192 from that end of the resort. Publix supermarket in right outside the gate and yes, Disney is within minutes. Universal -approx. 20 off of I-4. I guess I was lucky enough to get a unit in the North Village. I have no complaints. BTW - we bought our Universal tickets from RCI.com. $104.00pp for 7 days TOTAL ( not $104 per day). DEFINITELY THE BEST VALUE AROUND. any questions pl. contact me at maurese123@yahoo.com glad to answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: “It was o.k...wouldn't go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We bought this through an exchange because of hearing wonderful things on the resort. We were put into one of the oldest buildings facing Rt192..the rooms were clean but the outside maitenance and landscaping needs work. We had animal remains on the stairs going up to our room every day and they were never cleaned up. The pool near our room was very, very warm and not refreshing! If you wanted to go to the other pools, you had to drive to get there or take the shuttle! Too much hassle! We want a place where you can walk to a pool and not drive. Go get something to eat without having to get in your car..this was not the place. Sometimes big places aren't the answer!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Orange Lake Resort for 4 nights and we really had a grand time! It was worth every penny I paid even with the 90 minute tour. The saleperson was very polite and easy to talk to. We were not pressured in any way to buy anything. The villa that was given to us (as I learned) was about 10-15 years old but there was no trace of age. Everything seemed like brand new. There are some kinks but are relatively very minor, like a few minutes delay in processing but nothing major. They even had a welcome party for the guests, theater, dive-in (swimming pool) movie, etc. It's a bit of a drive (30 minutes) to Universal, but Disney is just a few minutes away! It's also outside the busy area of I. Bronson (hwy. 192) and there's a couple of ways to get to the resort from the attractions from I-4 depending on the traffic situation. My family really loved staying in this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Orlando Every Year. Hated Orange Lake!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sorcerersteve
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed in the Orlando area at least once a year for the last 14 years. This was our first stay in Orange Lake. We had taken a timeshare tour there a few years ago and loved it, so we were excited about staying there. After reading reviews on Tripadvisor we knew to ask for the newer sections. We checked in and were given the oldest section, we asked for a newer room and were told we would have to go to the registation desk and ask there. We waited on line 2. We asked at the registration desk for a newer room and were told since we were exchangers we had no rights and no reguest for a newer room would be taken. We were placed in one of the oldest units facing route 192. So for our entire vacation our terrace and sliding glass doors faced out on a highway and gave us a spectacular view of a Walgreens drug store and of cars passing by 24 hours a day. Also the grass was cut but the resort should send someone around to pick up the garbage in the bushes in the front and back on the villas. There was garbage in the front and rear of the villas that was rotting so some of it was not new. Needless to say my stay in Orange Lake was not one I care to remember. I would not recommend this resort to anyone and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My entire family had the pleasure of staying in the new East village Condos. We had a wonderful time playing in the pools, on the slides as well as partaking games in the game room such as shuffleboard. We loved the rocking miniature golf with all the lights out and glowing balls. All this enjoyment in the onset of hurricane Ivan barreling in the gulf. Beautiful weather helped make it a beautiful time. The only drawback was the huge roaches that were discovered in our room. The staff explained it was due to all the back to back hurricanes. My family will be returning again next September as well. A new baby prevented this trip for this year.

Reviews.Title: “orange lake is just great”
Reviews.Author: charger12
Reviews.Content: my wife & i had a nice time last august,and are going.back we own a week in the east village.unit#86646 i tell i fished in a small pond on the resort.and i caught fish like crazy.iam a owner of 2 years.and i love it.i have a family member that has been an owner for about the last 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Lot of Hype ... Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family have been RCI members for almost 30 years. We have stayed in many of the RCI resorts in the Orlando area and feel pretty competent to compare resorts. We have tried for years to get a week at Orange Lake and when we finally got it, we were excited. When we arrived, things started out nicely. Probably the smoothest check in of any resort I have ever stayed. From there it went totally down hill. We were placed in one of the older units, which is the luck of the draw, but still very disappointing. It seemed like the grounds crew didn't take as good of care of the older buildings as the new. The same trash layed around the outside of our building the entire week, and to keep it polite, it was trash that I wouldn't touch or I would have cleaned it myself. Also, the day we arrived there was dog excrement all over our stairwell that took 2 days to get cleaned. We were told it was from a racoon, but the racoon never made another mess while we were there?? The resort in my opinion is too large. The slide pool was great but so overcrowded even my children chose the smaller less crowded pool by the end of the week. This is totally not Orange Lake's fault but the large crowds at the pool seemed to breed rudeness. The line for the slide was long and people decided they were not going to wait... a simple lifeguard there to monitor could have solved that. When the activities director tried to conduct a race down the slide, timing kids as they went down, was a practice in futility. The condo was a 2 br 2 ba unit that wasn't the worst in our history of RCI but close to it. Poor televsion choices, for when it rained of kids break time from the sun, turned into an issue because it had never been an issue before. The 1 person jetted tub in the bathroom was quite comical.. no romantic time for Mom and Dad there. I will say this, I wish I would have had my golf clubs. The golf course looked as nice as any I've seen in FL, GA, or AZ. Green fees didn't seem too outrageous. Overall, the hype of Orange Lake got to us, we were expecting too much. We will not be returning to Orange Lake.

Reviews.Title: “We wont be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We vacation every year in Florida and have enjoyed many great vacations through RCI, this was not one of them. Check- in was very smooth, however, we were told that any changes would be done with the RCI representative and he was not available until the next day. We were very unhappy with our accomodations, but no one was able to help us. We checked into a "not too clean" studio in the noisy clubhouse, one window looking out over the children's play area. We were told that a move was impossible so we cut our vacation short, checked out two days early and went to a lovely condo on the beach. We love our timeshares and own three weeks, two in Florida and one in Hawaii, and have exchanged for condos all over the US. What a disappoinment and lose of our valuable vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “Guaranteed to give you cancer”
Reviews.Author: SunMoon53
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at Orange Lake and own one of the original units in the clubhouse. Every year is becoming the same...............an outdateted bathroom with a broken shower head, an outdated microwave and a stench from smoking that makes most people sick. What was promised in the sale, was never delivered and our requests (for a clean air unit) are never met. I have written numerous times and have been ignored. We pay almost $600 a year in Maintenance and taxes for this disaster. Orange Lake..................read this and DARE to contest!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful large unit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Orange Lake was our 2 bedroom 2 bath unit. It was wonderful for the kids to each have their own queen bed in the 2nd bedroom. They loved our large master bath with jacuzzi tub. My mother has exchanged many units over the years in Florida and while she came for a visit, she remarked on how this was the best place she had seen. We were in the North Village which we knew to ask for since we have friends that are owners. I would not suggest going on a school vacation though. The crammed in pool chairs around most pool areas were filled in by late morning and some people were smoking around us. Also, there did not ever seem to be any employees checking what was going on. Our children loved the slide at splash lagoon but the sign says no floating devices there and there always were and sometimes people right at bottom of slide in the way. Also, people with coolers and some with beer around the pool area. THe mini- golf was nice. It would have been convenient to have a grocery at street level instead of having to walk through the main building down the stairs to the back. We did not have any complimentary room cleaning so did our own washing of towels, etc. in the unit. So, even though the unit was wonderful, I would prefer in the future to go back to the Sheraton Vistana resort which we stayed at in April '03.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: genew
Reviews.Content: We exchanged through RCI for a 2 bedroom unit. We were in the North village, which is relatively new, but not the newest. Excellent, large accomodations, really enjoyed it. Friends stayed with us. They had their own bedroom (2 double beds), bathroom w/shower, and a pocket door to close their area off from ours. Large kitchen area, comfortable furniture and beds, extra supplies provided (soap, dw detergent, TP, etc.). We were contacted to be sure everything was OK. We accepted the invitation to a breakfast (timeshare sale pitch), were to receive $30 for attending. Due to scheduling problem, we had to un-accept the invitation. They then offered $40. We still declined, that was the end of it - no pressure, no further contacts. Checkin (9PM) was a breeze, checkout was done the night before we left. $1 per toll-free phone call - ie: phone cards work well for saving cost of LD calls, but $1 per call imposed by the resort. Would I go back to this resort? In a heartbeat. One of the best timeshares I've traded into. Older area not as spacious, lack of sidewalks, hard water were the only negatives I can think of. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Had a ball the whole week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando June 3-10. We stayed in the West Village close to the entry gate and one of the pools. We had a great time all week. When we first arrived we had a problem with our stove burners and it was fixed immediatly. It is a very big resort and we took full advantage of the shuttle bus which delighted us to know end to listen to the driver give us the full tour and all the great things to do around the resort. They even dropped us at our door when we were the only passengers. We were never bothered by salesman. We got one call inviting us to a breakfast which we were unable to attend. Most of the time we had the West Pool and Hot tub all to ourselves. It was easy in and out to get to WDW. Check in and out was smooth and fast. The only real problem we could have had was when we made the reservation we informed them that we needed a ground floor room due to a handicap. But they gave us a third floor room near an elevator and we only had problems with it one day when they were removing all the trash can from the floors. It took it a long time for the the elevator to get to us. The two bedroom villas were great and we loved the screened in porch that looked out over the lake and you could almost see all the fireworks over the trees from WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lakes long walks to the pools”
Reviews.Author: Nails54
Reviews.Content: Driving to get to the pool is not a vacation. The property is way to big they need more swimming pools. No maid service if you are staying one week in the one bedroom villa's. Having to get the sheets changed was extra.. I had already paid enough to get there. We were not impress at all. This couple will not return or recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a 3 bedroom and it was real nice and so large we had plenty of room and had a nice time.The grounds were kept up real nice,and the golf course was nice to look at from our little home. The problem was the pools and the resort. We payed for our stay around $1,600.00 for a week and I thought we would be around a better class of people .Some people looked like they didnt have a dime.And around the pools people were smoking and putting their butts on the ground for everyone to walk on.And the water slide was so small ,I guess for very very small kids.If you are going for the pools I suggest not going to this resort. go th the WI dells.Also the clerk at the disney planning center was not real helpful,I think they should be able to answer our questions better then they did.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the experience”
Reviews.Author: WidleyTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2004 for a week using a friend's timeshare. Having stayed for 2 nights on International Drive we found Orange Lake a totally different experience. Overall, we had no problems (apart from having to stay in our rooms whilst Hurricane Charley was raging!). We checked in ok and went to our accomodation that was clean, modern and spacious. Whilst we were asked to attend the timeshare briefing we declined and were never bothered again. The manager's reception was a bit too 'in your face' for us as first time travellers to the States but there were lots of people enjoying themselves. Although the resort is being extended and I'm sure the newest accommodation will be wonderful there were suggestions that the older accommodation was less of a priority to the management, however, we would not suggest you miss the experience of staying here. Security at the gate was good and we never felt unsafe. The small pool area adjacent to our block was excellent and fresh towels were available daily. At the main pool area we had excellent waitress service for drinks to our loungers. Soon after we arrived we found the sofa bed in the lounge was broken and it was replaced within the hour - I think that shows the serice is great. During our stay we saw two families we knew from the UK who holiday each year at Orange Lake - both are very particular and I have no doubt they would not return if the service was in anyway poor - give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Resort getting big, but still enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only had three days to spend in Orlando. Orange Lake Resort was a relaxing haven to return to each evening after a day at the parks. Although the resort has grown dramatically in the last 6 years since my last stay, Orange Lake is still a good place to vacation. While a bit more expensive than the Hampton Inns we stayed in during our 5 day visit to eastern Florida, the resort was cleaner, quieter, and more accomodating. The two bedroom condo was set up with our comfort and relaxation in mind. Ten hours after we checked out of our room while checking into a Hampton Inn in St. Augustine, Fl. we noted that we had left two hanging bags in our condo at Orange Park. With one phone call that took all of 5 minutes, we were informed that our bags had been found and that they would be ready for our pickup when we returned to Orlando. Within 30 minutes of returning to the resort the next morning, we had our bags and were on our way back home. We would stay at Orange Park again.

Reviews.Title: “not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had our 1st ever family vacation. I had my 27,24,15and 11 year old daughters and my 8 year old granddaughter with me. We were on an RCI exchange. After reading these reviews when we checked in we asked for the new area and was told there was no way to change where we were as the computer picked the room.So we ended up in the older section(2048) When we entered the room the first thing you noticed was it was not very clean. Behind the beds had candy wrappers from the former tenants.there were spiderwebs on the walls. the room was very used looking (cracked tiles,noisy washer and dryers,broken bathroom doorknob,broken outside lights not one but all the outside lights) Just not what you expected from a gold crown resort. When we did call to get the outside light fixed the did come and fix it but only one of them and they broke the light cover and left it. So no patio. the food is overpriced and small portions. We ordered from the pizza place. While we were at splash lagoon someone defecated in the pool. When it was pointed out to a worker he looked at it and left. He returned about 20-25 minutes later and finally closed the pool to clean it-but in the meantime people continued to swim in the pool. When we checked out we were given a list of things to do over the phone by the front desk such as strip the beds and such (why pay a maintainance fee) Oh and some of the silverware was dirty. We did ask to speak to a manager at the end but never got to. all in all while it was passable it was not a quality resort.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Annyka
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Orange Lake after staying there April 30th- May 14th on a RCI exchange. We enjoyed our 2 Bed 2 Bath on the East village that overlooked the fireworks out of our living room every night (# 81645)! Thank you for the suggestions of asking for a newer unit, however that is what they had us planned for anyways, but I'm glad I knew to ask! Yes, the resort is very large and you have to drive to everything, but if it wasn't very big, it would have everything that it has to offer!! Also, they have a shuttle that runs throughout the resort which is a nice option. Our 4 year old loved the beach, slide, and kids pools and the unheated Olympic sized pool is so refreshing when it's in the mid to upper 80's, the music pool side and all of the daily activity options including BINGO are great too! If you didn't want to, you wouldn't even have to leave the resort and many days we didn't!! My only complaints would be: 1. the loung chairs at the pool are way too close together 2. we asked for a later check out of 11 am instead of 10 am and was said yes to that the night before, but the morning we were to check out we had housekeeping knocking loudly on our door at 8 am and woke most of us up! 3. we had 1 complimentary cleaning half way through our trip that didn't appear to be detailed cleaning just beds made and clean towels. 4. you can't understand some of the bingo announcers 5. they have a resort shuttle, but we were told by staff 3 different times that it ran every 10 minutes, every 20 minutes, and every hour. We still didn't know what there schedule was when we left, but it was definately more frequent than every hour (more like every 10-15 minutes). Overall, I would defiantely return to Orange Lake and look forward to the 12 acre lazy river that will open in 2006!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great time at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: JanT
Reviews.Content: We bought two weeks in September 2003 in a three-bed east village room and went back in April this year for our fourth visit and upgraded our second week to a three-bed lock-out in the new River Island complex (can't wait for it to be finished). We have stayed in both the north and east villages and have never had any complaints about Orange Lake. We usually spend a week on the gulf or the Keys before going to OL and always look forward to it. The kids never want to leave, they love all the pools (as do we!). We have always found the staff to be courteous and if we have had any requests they have always been attended to promptly. All in all, a great place to stay (it must be... we are going back AGAIN in September and then June next year!!) We have taken family and friends and they have all said how much they enjoy it at OL. You need never go off the site as everything you need is there. WE LOVE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First I should say that we are owners, but used RCI to exchange for a different week. This is the first and only time we've stayed at OLRCC. We've traveled many other places using our week, but never to our home resort. We were very impressed with the 3 bdr. East Village unit we were assigned. A car is a necessity, but you would need a car if you were staying at any other resort. We didn't mind having to get in/out of the car to drive to the different pool areas. Our 3.5 year old loved Splash Lagoon, the beach, the east village pool and the main clubhouse area pools. Out of the 7 nights we were there, we spent 3 days at disney and the rest of the time, our kid wanted to stay at the resort and swim. We were VERY impressed with the different swimming options and are looking forward to the new 12 acre pool complex with the lazy river. I would not have been happy with a clubhouse room or one of the older units. when checking in we did specifically ask for a newer unit and I think we were lucky to get one. The check in clerk did tell us that from now on, if you own an older unit you will be given an older unit and the same goes for a new unit. I guess to that I would say i'd take my chances and check in way late in hopes that all the older units are assigned and you might get lucky and get a new one. The one HUGE negative we found was that the restrooms at the main clubhouse pool area and east village pool area were absolutely disgusting. There was NO water pressure anywhere so the automatic toilets were not flushing all the way and then one toilet acutally overflowed very slowly. GROSS. We rarely saw housekeeping cleaning around the pool areas. Some people might say the resort is too large, but if that's your only complaint - there's still building so it's only getting bigger. For as big as the resort is, you don't feel like you're always surrounding by large amounts of people. By giving us so many swimming options, it really spreads out the people. Loved the resort, the room was great. We used the internet cafe (Connections) every night to download digital pics to a CD and to check on Fantasy Baseball team. Javier was helpful and very pleasant (clerk at connections).

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orange Lake and stayed from April 23-May 6. The resort is very big. A car is a must for getting around. If you've been looking on their website and you're NOT an owner there, don't expect to get what you see on the site. The new units are for owners only. We were there on a RCI exchange, so we received an older unit on the west side. It was spacious, but out dated. Nothing like I had expected. The tubs are the original 20 yr old ones and there aren't any jet tubs in the west side units. My husband finally got us into the newer units in the east village. Nicer, but nothing to write home about. I found the staff not overly friendly, and really rude and pushy sellers for their resort. They make you feel stupid and are very insulting...at least two out of the three that we had were. Beware of the timeshare speel that you'll be asked to attend, but they won't really tell you that that's what it is. They'll say that you can get so much $$ off certain theme park tickets for attending a "presentation". At night , there were tons of teens taking over the hot tubs, drunk. This place was highly recommended by the RCI agent too. Overall, I would not recommend this place to people who are looking for peace and relaxation; too many people. It's family oriented, which is why I went, but just too big of a resort, and the service and friendliness is lacking and I feel a little on the misleading side. There is such a thing as being too big! I read these reviews long before I went and thought awe, someone just had bad luck, but here I am writing what I've been reading for months!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay in the clubhouse”
Reviews.Author: SpaScout
Reviews.Content: This resort was an absolute dissapointment and and embarrassment as we took freinds with us and payed for their room as a gift to them. We arrived a few hours after our friends who had been forced to check in as us because the non-english speaking desk clerk just couldnt figure out who was who. We then became them and they were hounded every day by the time share people to come to a presentation - did they want us (who already own) or our friends? The phone in our room never worked so we couldnt communicate with our friends. But the worst part was the smoking! We supposedly had a non smoking room which was equipped with ashtrays, but the hallways were so filled with smoke that everytime the a/c came on it sucked in the foul air and we had to block the bottom of the door with a towel to keep some of it out. If you are headed for Disney, definitely stay at a Disney resort. This place is nasty if you are stuck in the clubhouse. I dont know about the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back today!”
Reviews.Author: sjf67
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday, April 23 and stayed through April 29th. We had a two bedroom unit in the East Village (#86425). I was more than a little worried about staying here because of all the negative reviews I had read the past couple of months. We had no problems of any kind. We arrived around 11:30am. The lobby was empty. I asked the gentleman who helped me if we could be in a newer unit. Our rooms were clean and spacious. We did need the patio door handle repaired and it was taken care of right away. We were close enough to walk to the splash lagoon, but I'm glad we had a car to get to the West Village area. We spent our last day at the main pool - the kids loved it!! They had planned activities every hour. I wish we would have joined some of the evening activities, but we were just too tired after being at the parks all day. We ate at the Legacy Grill on the Legends course one night, and ordered Pizza a couple of nights. I thought everything was good and the price was ok too. We were so happy with our room that we cancelled two nights at Disney's Wilderness Lodge because we liked Orange Lake better. We were even lucky enough to see some fireworks from our room.

Reviews.Title: “A Gold Crown Resort for Sure!”
Reviews.Author: nairb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orange Lake Resort and Country Club with our two teenage children and their friends and loved it. We had a two bedroom unit in the east section which is beautiful, modern and quiet. Even with construction going on, we were never inconvenienced or woken up in the morning. The units are nicely laid out and kept immaculately. The washer and drier were full size and located just outside of the hall bathroom--I threw on a load of towels each morning and put them in the drier each evening when we returned to the unit and we had clean towels at all times without using the service they provide for a fee. The kitchen is well equipped. The screened porch is where I had my breakfast every morning, overlooking the golf course. There were many activities available for just about every age group and live music and D.J.'s around the pool and "beach". There are a number of golf courses in the resort to choose from as well as a driving range and miniature golf. The resort is so big that you either have a long walk (which we enjoyed taking) or a short drive to some of the amenities in the resort. There is a shuttle bus that runs all day and there is security present at the gates 24 hours a day. Everyone was pleasant and helpful at Orange Lake. It is located about a 20 minute ride from Universal and less to Disney. We took a ride to the beach one day and were thrilled with the temperature and color of the water. There is a supermarket just outside the resort and a mini market inside the resort (that will deliver to your room). A call was made to our room on the first morning to welcome us and to invite us to a time share sales pitch--and since we did not attend, we received the same call every morning--not a major inconvenience, but the only one we encountered--not bad. We loved our experience at Orange Lake Resort and Country Club and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at Orange Lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: dickandjane71
Reviews.Content: Recently rented 4 Studio Units for our family . Enjoyed a fine stay at this convenient location to area attractions. The pools were a little too busy and crowded for my taste but they were nice. There were convenient services in the lobby for purchasing park tickets. The oversized hotel rooms contained adequate kitchen facilities and cooking utensils to allow us to enjoy breakfast, lunches or late night snack in our room. However do not shop at the Winn Dixie close by unless you enjoy paying outlandish prices for groceries,and don't gas up in this immediate area for the same reason. If you drive a few miles away you will save a lot on both groceries and gas. Many of the area merchants seem to feel they can charge whatever they feel like and the visiting tourist will willingly pay the price...wrong!! This gouging climate that existed in the area was not so at Orange Lake though. Actually we found the value to be quite good,the service good,the facilities very nice(I enjoyed the Tennis Courts during our stay). My understanding is that the golfing avilable is very good,but unfortunate for me I don't golf. Our next visit will probably take us to Celebration World were we do own Time Share.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North Village (2bedroom) thanks to the comments in other reviews. When we first checked in (mass chaos) the front desk clerk was not very friendly she was too busy on the phone (no one else can answer the phone I guess) also was into the other clerks business. Asked for North village and told to go to the reservations desk. After waiting for 20 minutes with no help from other clerks from behind the desk (she had walked away from desk during check in) she did accomadate us. The location was good. The villa was clean and large great for the eight of us. We had lots of room with 3 children and 5 adults. The master bath was huge and great. but you definitely need a car just to get around. One thing we noticed was the buildings were not very well marked especially coming back at night after a long day at the park. The construction was across from us but we didn't hear any of it. We were pinged quite alot by golf balls though. One of the hazards of being right on the golf course. Not good for young child wanting to play outside. The restaurants were good with a variety of foods. It was nice not to have to go outside the resort and fight the crowds. The buffet and pizza place great for the kids. The bedrooms had no ceiling fans for air circulation in Fl. The pool chairs were not sufficient and no cleanup of used or discarded towels that were thrown on the chairs. The activity we did attend the camp song and marshmallow roast was cute and fun for school age children. The day of the luau we ask if reservation were needed and told no. When we got there we could not get in because we had no reservations. I would like to have attended other activities but just not enough time. They do need to work on customer service. Phone calls or answer to questions were put on hold for exteneded period of time. Answers were given not very confidental and most times incorrect. We are hoping to return some day armed with what we know.

Reviews.Title: “where to go for a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: lynn3198
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 29 night stay at Orange lake, staying between 13/03 and 11/04. This was our third stay at the resort, exchanging through RCI. We were a little apprehensive after reading some negative reviews on this site, but we speak as we find. The entire holiday was spent in the same 2 Br Villa looking on to the golf course which was being overhauled, so it was very peaceful. The villa was recently refurbished and very clean. Any requests made of housekeeping etc were dealt with quickly. We had one call only to attend a Timeshare presentation, we politely declined and were not troubled further. The children loved the pools, we had no problem finding loungers by the pool, except over the Easter weekend, but it was no big deal. Watersports on the lake were also good fun. Food was excellent, Kemmons was good value, with all tastes catered for. We could not fault any part of our stay and as usual OrangeLake gets our recommendation. The only bad part was having to leave and come home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but be careful where they put you!”
Reviews.Author: capecodder16
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 1 week, orginally using a bonus week thru RCI. When we booked it we asked for a 2 br like we had seen on their website. When we checked in , we were sent to an efficiency 2 br that was just plain depressing. I went back to the deck and asked "why isnt this like the picture" and they said Ooooh you want one of the newer rooms? they easily accomodated us into a MUCH nicer newer 2br otherwise we wudda stayed in the shack we firt got to. So, please be careful and ask up fron which one you'll be getting. Otherwise, we loved our location, great golf course and close to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “i relaly enjoyed the ornage l;ake”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i went twith my daughtewr who is 14 and we loved it we stayed in a one bedroom and it was soo clean , which thats all i wondered about here.. but the only problem was there was never any lounge chairs available at the pool which is big problem since i want the sun as much as possible,, people take the chairs and put towel on it to reserve it and the staff shoudl doosomewthing about this since the people are at breakfast etccc

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Timeshare Agents lack class”
Reviews.Author: cork_2727
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake from March 12 - 17. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa, as there were six of us in total. Our villa was in the west complex. No complaints about the resort. Plenty to do for the kids and the adults. Our one year old loved the kids pools. There was no pressure to purchase during the timeshare presentation. We were there for 90 minutes, and out. Although I didn't like the second real estate who came in after our initial decline to the first agent. After asking us 5 more questions detailing why we didn't want to purchase, she pulled out a pamphlet regarding terminally ill children, and proceeded to tell us that most people give "a 10 or a 20, so what can I put you down for?" She didn't ask if we would like to contribute, and was rather pushy by asking us what amount we were prepared to donate, as opposed to " would you like to donate?" When we informed her that we donate through our place of employment, she promptly got up from the table, and walked away, without saying a word. This was probably our only negative experience at Orange Lake. The rooms were nice, and spacious. The dryer took about 3 cycles before our clothes were dry. Any phone calls cost us $1.15, which they didn't tell us upon check in. This included local calls, toll free calls, calling card calls, etc...The only calls we didn't get charged for were room to room. I don't mind being charged, but a heads up would have been nice, as opposed to finding out when you pay the bill. Breakfast buffet at Kemmons was good, and food in the pizzeria was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake the week of Feb. 5-13. For 7 wonderful days we enjoyed the peace and quiet of the resort setting. We had a 2 bedroom condo in the North Village. The kid's pool area was great! My husband and I loved the space and cleanliness of the villa. Traveling with 5 kids age 14-7 can be difficult , but not with 3 t.v.s, 2 bathrooms and a full size kitchen. We went to Publix for snacks and some meals. We discovered late in the week, the restaurant in the West Village Clubhouse that had buffets for both breakfast and dinner. The selection was good as was the price! The proximity to both Disney and Universal can't be beat and the price was affordable. The best day we had all week was the one day we stayed at the resort and enjoyed the pools, played putt-putt and ate in. The staff was courteous and accommodated our request to stay in either the North or East Village. Our last night there we stayed at the West Village Clubhouse in a room with 4 double beds and a refrigerator. It was not as new or pleasant as the villa, but for one night, we didn't care. If we are ever lucky enough to go back, I would go during a warmer season and stay on site more (especially with the construction of the new water/play area).

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Drywood6
Reviews.Content: We were at Orange Lake Resort from January 29 to Feb 12. Two Fabulous weeks. We were on an RCI exchange. We had The MOST PERFECT LOCATION!!!! We were in Tennis Villa 5733......... Beautiful view of the Lake, Golf Couse and Beach. Close to the Club House and the Pools. Fantastic sunsets from our screened porch. The interior of the unit was extremely well laid out, clean and well equipped. Any time we wanted anything from the Maintenance staff they were right there. The entire staff were really helpful and courteous. We visited the villas in the much maligned West Village and found them to be really quite nice. I don't know why some folk have been so negative in some of the reviews on TRIPADVISOR. This Resort has a Gold Crown Rating from RCI and in our view certainly deserves it. It is true some of the "Older Units" may need updating but the Management is busy doing so. We were not "Pestered" by the Sales staff. We attended a presentation and said we were not interested and that was the end of that. Before our two weeks were up, we decided we wanted two fixed weeks here where we could always come to and so bought two Spring weeks on the RESALE market. They are both in the "Older" Villas in the West Village Area. One of them we bought through the Orange Lake Resale Dept (Very effecient,honest,courteos, and forthright) and the second week,Privately through the web site "Redweek.com". Again, this was a very Satisfactory transaction. Don't be "Put Off" by any of the negative reviews. ........ I'm afraid some folks will be sending back Negative Reports from HEAVEN !!!! We look forward to going back to OUR Units next Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Great TIme For The Family and Close to All”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from Orange lake it was a great time for all of us. This is the second time we stayed there and we bought this time even though the building is not complete it is in the east villiage. At night time you can see the fireworks from Disney. It is just so relexing there. My family can not wait until next year for the water park to open.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed: January 16-23, 2005: Despite our arrival after 1 a.m., the staff could not have been more helpful. Our flat was a three bedroom in the East Village, with a beautiful view of the golf course, which all of the units in the East Village have. The amenities were great, and the layout was perfect: 3 bathrooms, conveniently-located washer and dryer, good-sized kitchen with all you need to eat in, lots of televisions so the kids didn't take over, and a great screened in porch so we knew that the children were safe while we were out there. The pool was right next door, too, with its own hot tub, and the Legacy Grill restaurant (great place for breakfast, but do not order the orange juice - it costs more than the meal and is from concentrate!) has good food at a good price. The on-site Publix supermarket is large and has all you need, although there's a Super Target west along the 192, between markers 11 and 12. They're doing lots of costruction, which would have affected the North Village, but didn't affect us at all. In the next several months there will also be a big overpass going through the resort to Disney: as it was, though, it never took us more than 10 minutes to get to Disney, and we did not experience any traffic the whole week we were there. Definitely a place we would revisit!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious with lots of activities”
Reviews.Author: lillious
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at Orange Lake Country Club. We were there to attend the International Builders Show in Orlando. Unit was one of the original ones built many years ago. It was a bit dated but everything was clean and attractively decorated. It was very large and had all the comforts of home. Tried requesting east village but they wouldn't take any requests. This is a great place if you have a young family. So many activities to choose from that you wouldn't even need to leave the resort. A car is a must. Everything is very spread out which creates a very tranquil feel. A nice change in the visually stimulating and extrememly noisy Orlando community. Walking paths were very nice and the grounds were beautiful. We usually stay with the Hilton Grand Vacation Club. Although Orange Lake is not as upscale it is a very nice resort. Our only big disappointment. No internet in the units. You have to go to their cyber cafe and pay to go online. Being a frequent Hilton traveller we are spoiled. However, even the Hampton Inn's on the road have free wireless internet. Hopefully Orange Lakes will get into the 21st century soon and upgrade all their units. If you are looking for a fun place to take your family and prefer to have lots of open space then Orange Lake is for you. Not a bad location, it is about 15-20 minutes to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Moonlight Madness Putt-Putt Champs!”
Reviews.Author: chksgolf
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week (Nov 28-Dec 4) at Orange Lake and had a wonderful experience. Our two bedroom condo was older in the West Village but very nicely updated and clean. We had a smaller pool and hot tub directly behind us which we used every night before bed. During the day when we were not at Universal, we spent most of our time at the West Village two pools and putt-putt. We invested in the $25 weekly pass at the putt-putt and our 11 yr old son played about 40 rounds by himself and with other kids he met. We also participated in a few acitivities such as the couples challenge (newlywed game), bingo, beach volleyball, moonlight madness putt-putt and the sing along camp fire, all of which were fun. We did go to the kids pool but found it a bit young for our 8 and 11 yr olds, and definitely more crowded. Check in and check out were fast and painless and we only recieved one presentation invite which we declined. The year before we stayed at the Sheraton Vistana and although we really enjoyed it there the kids preferred Orange Lake by a mile.

Reviews.Title: “loved disney world”
Reviews.Author: texas1225
Reviews.Content: at first we were very concerned. the resort looks really big. you must have a car. the resort is a little older than we like, but it is very clean, and very well kept. the pools are awesome. the water slide was one of the highlights of the trip. do not miss the slide. our two bedroom villa was very large. this was great when bringing all the toys for our four year old home from disney. it was also nice having a two bedroom and not having her to have to use the couch. for this reason we would recommend the resort to other people. the room could have been a little cleaner. i cleaned behind the bathroom door myself. but the rest of the room was very nice. the lobby was way too crowded and loud for our tastes. after spending the week at disney the last thing we wanted was more kids and more loud noise. the resort personnel came into our room and fixed the roof on our patio without any notice to us. this freaked us out because they left a light on that we did not. it took us a few minutes to realize why they had been in our room. on the patio we had an awful view of the trees piled in a huge mess. it would have been nice to have a prettier veiw, but my husband cleaned the patio and chairs and we did sit outside. we did wish we had a little grill. overall it was a nice place to stay, i do not think of it as five star. simply because it was so much older than i realized when booking the trip. next time i book i will remember to ask the age. the people working were all very nice and effecient.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: EnzoX2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11/5 to 11/12 as RCI guests. We were also in the newer East village in a 2 bedroom villa. All living areas are extremely generously sized as well as thoughtfully layed out. The furnishings and beds were all clean, comfortable, and in excellent condition. The pool areas were beautiful and spacious. There were some fun family activities to take part in. The resort is very large, and that was somewhat inconvenient, but we adjusted quickly. Also, if you are a light sleeper, the adjoining golf greens are mowed daily beginning at 5:30. The smell of fertilizer was evident when we had the door to the porch open. All in all, it was a very positive experience and we look forward to returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Request a new unit, and you will be thrilled”
Reviews.Author: havredegrace
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Orange Lake was Nov. 5 - Nov 9. 2004. We went on an RCI exchange. When we checked it, they had us in the Tennis Villas area in the West Village, based on advise from reading trip advisor, I requested a unit closer to Splash Lagoon pool in the North Village, or in the East Village. I had to go to a different desk, but the lady there was very friendly, and found us a unit in the East Village to switch to, she said it was brand new. The place was beautiful! Nicely decorated with a very large galley kitchen with eat at counter. Full size pantry. Very clean and bright. On the other side of the counter was a large tv on a built in shelf facing the living room. There was a built in banquet seating at the dining table , also several chairs. A very comfortable living room with a huge couch, lots of colorful prints on the walls. A totally screened in porch overlooked the Legands golf course. Full size washer and dryer. TV's in master bedroom and in the other bedroom with 2 double sized beds, perfect for our 3 kids!! The master bathroom was fantastic, large shower and jacuzzi tub. The place was just beautiful, spacious, well decorated and painted, and totally clean and new. There is a pool in the East Village, but we went to the Splash Lagoon pool becasue the kids loved the slide, waterfalls, basketball hoop and volleyball net, you get the balls at the pool shop. They have a nice restaurant there also with outdoor seating, a separate kiddy pool, and a splash fountain the kids could run through. The whole Splash Lagoon pool area is beautiful, with lots of pretty trees and plants, a fountain, and lots of lounge chairs and tables. WE LOVED IT!! They are building a new pool area with lazy river, we would love to go back and check it out. The west village clubhouse where you check in looked a little dated, but they had free popcorn for the kids & balloon animals to keep them occupied for a few minutes. They also have a desk where you can buy all your park tickets, and a separate Disney desk where we got our Disney tickets. In addition, they have a small inside play area, arcade, and movie theatre. They have lots of family activities, but we spent our time visiting Magic Kingdom, MGM and Epcot. We had a rental car, and thought it was quite convienent to the parks, especially Magic Kingdom. Last year we stayed at Disney's Wilderness lodge and used Dsiney Trasportation. My husband and I liked having our own car much better. Disney's monorail is nice, but it only connects to 3 resorts, and 2 parks (MK and Epcot) I believe. We had to take their bus a lot, and it definalty slowed us down as it had to make other stops usually before getting us to our destination. Also, if you stay at Wilderness lodge and take the boat launch to get to MK, you usually have to backtrack to the Disney campground area, and also Contemporary to pick up people. Orange lake is defiantly closer to Disney though than Universal. We were very pleasantly surprised by how nice the place is. We are already thinking of going back. If you visit, don't hestiate to ask to be put into a new unit in East Village. It was defianlty worth the few extra minutes at check in.

Reviews.Title: “orange lake resort and country club - just great.”
Reviews.Author: HookedonFlorida
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from orlando and I felt that I had to report on our stay here. I went with very mixed feelings because of the reports that I had already read. I have to say that we were more than happy with the facilities. We stayed in a 2br villa which overlooked one of the little lakes. We could see that our unit was going to be upgraded soon - workers making their way round- but we had no complaints. We found the service excellent, one of the smoke alarms needed a battery and it was replaced the same day, we also needed a light bulb and someone came within the hour. We were contacted to go to a sales demo but when we declined we were not asked again. I read before about the cleanliness of the accomodation and I would say that if you looked close into the cornes they were less than spotless but when you are visiting Orlando who has time to look into the corners! Having stayed at Lake Buena Vista 2 years ago we felt the location to be a little far from the parks we were visiting most, it could take an hour to get to Universal Studios we had a flexi-ticket for Universal etc. The 192 gets quite congested in places, although we did find a short cut to the 535. We only really used the pools in the resort as we were busy outside of the resort but every facility (except internet, which they are working on) was there for you. All in all we were impressed with this resort and would consider returning - especially when the new road is completed. The new "River Island" looks exciting as well.

Reviews.Title: “First Owner Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first return after purchasing condo. Stay was brilliant from start to finish. Even bought second week whilst there. Condo overlooking Golf Course absolutley superb. Only minor point of concern was the Bar Closing Time, for big resort expected bar to stay open longer. Can not wait to go back again next year

Reviews.Title: “Some good points , some bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First the good points. Unit we stayed in was clean spacious and well equipped. Check in staff at front desk were courteous and efficient. Now the bad stuff. On inspection of our unit found closet door in guest bedroom broken. We reported this immediately and several times through our 2 week stay, still not repaired when we left. Resort has great facilities but everthing costs extra and the prices seemed way too high compared to other resorts we have stayed at. For example we own at Vistana Resort at Lake Buena Vista and towel and linen changes were twice weekly at no charge. Orange Lake change once a week and if you want more , again you have to pay. On our last day we had to book an extra night as we were in the middle of Hurricane Jeanne and our flight had been cancelled. Reserved an extra night with reservations and paid $165 for the privilege.We then found our key cards had been de-activated and we could not get back in to our unit.Lots of toing and froing between reservations and front desk got us nowhere until we complained to Guest Relations and the hey presto! things were sorted within 2 minutes. On the whole we feel that Orange Lake should concentrate more on customer services and less on tying to sell you timeshare, as it appeared to us that as soon as you made it clear to them that you were not interested in buying into their resort, they more or less washed their hands of you. How this place got a Gold Crown rating I'll never know. We will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and were in Florida for the first time on our honeymoon September 1st thru September 14th of 2003. While we were there we went on a time share presentation through Orange Lake. We ended up buying and were really excited about it. As the year passed and we were preparing to return we started getting nervous about the decision that we had made in purchasing...Well, I have to tell you that all the anxious feelings went away after our first week there. The staff is so very friendly and helpful. The food was all very good, the service was awesome. My husband and I had a better time on second honeymoon then we did on our first just because of the service at Orange Lake. We both agree that buying part of Orange Lake is one of the best decisions that we could have ever made as a couple! Thank you Orange Lake for all of your service!

Reviews.Title: “It was a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the best time with my family, my 7 year old son christian loved the water slide, he did not want to leave. My 17 year old daughter Jasmine met new friends and had a great time. My family also enjoyed boating, and water skiing, jet skiing, playing tennis, golf, minigolf, evening entertainment, the olympic size pool and water slide pool. The room was spacious and confortable. We were very close to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake CC- Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from OLCC. We were there during the week of Hurricane Ivan, almost did not go. The resort and all the parks were virtually deserted, not because of Ivan but because September is always a very slow month we were told. We thought the resort was fantastic compared to the other timeshare resorts we have been to. The 2 bed/2 bath villa we stayed in was beautiful and in excellent shape. The location is great for the theme parks if that is what you're doing. Lots of golf with more under construction. We are now considering buying a week there.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Spacious, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 4 children) stayed here during the week of June 26. We stayed in the newer development in a 3 bedroom/ 3 bath suite (approx 1700 sq. ft). At night, we could see the fireworks display at Disney right from our balcony (we were on the top floor). The kitchen had a full size fridge, a microwave, a range, a pantry and all the cookware/utensils. The master bath had jets. There was a small pool right next to our building. The area of the resort where we stayed was not chaotic, unlike near the area of the main lobby. It was a great place to stay (clean, spacious, convenient, quiet) for a large family.

Reviews.Title: “Unorganized chaos”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked into Orange Lake on August 29th. This was after hurricane Charlie and in time for Francis. In terms of being prepared for the storm the resort was very lacking. There was no communication between guest services and reservations in the days preceding the storm. Their tv station had no information except the day before. There should have been a uniform consistency in what people had to pay for additional nights. I received 4 different rates from four different people at reservations and at the front desk. The staff even moved people from unit to unit in the middle of the storm because they told them owners and other guest were coming in! Well, hello if guests couldn't leave then how could other get in the airport was closed and the governor had declared a state of emergency. My unit needed to be repaired prior to the storm because of possible leakage. Because the repair was never done I could slosh across the carpet in my living room by mid-hurricane. The most horrendous thiings I saw from my villa window were houskeeping and maintenance staff riding around the resort in golf carts when winds were susutained at 35-45 mph. They just had the barest of covering and clear rain slickers for shelter. This place was absolutley not prepared and I know that I was not the only person who was disgusted and upset by what occured. Considering that this was supposed to be an upscale resort I found it to be to big for its britches and very poorly run.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Orange Lake”
Reviews.Author: Duey11598
Reviews.Content: Got back from a 5 day vacation at the Orange Lake Resort, Aug 27-Sept 2, 2004. The lobby is a little outdated, but very big. Read the reviews here and did request a 2 bdrm condo in the North or East Villages. Received the condo in the East Village. Our unit was on the 1st floor with the back facing the 10th fairway on the golf course. The unit was very spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The kitchin had everything we needed to start in regards to dishwashing liquid, garbage bags, and detergent. The East Village is the farthest from the West Village, which is where you check in. The East Village is where the Pro Shop for the Golf Course is. They are planning to expand the East Village and build "River Island" which is a brand new water park/pool area. The pictures and plans depict a gourgeous complex. This is expected to be done by August of 2005. The North Village is where we spent most of our days when not at Universal. This is where they have "Splash Lagoon", the kids pool. There is a small slide, jacuzzi, water volleyball, and a kiddie pool. There is also a poolside grill and shop. Perfect for both adults and the kids. The West Village had about 4 pools, an olympic size pool and a couple of other smaller pools. From the pool you can walk over to the lake where you can rent jet skiis and jet boats to ride the lake. The pizzeria at the West Village was good. I liked the Hot Wings. It was a ten minute ride to the entrance to Disney and about 25 minutes to Universal. The Publix grocery store is 5 minutes away out of the East Gate. Overall I was impressed with the resort, the only drawback is that there isn't much in regards to organized daily kid's activities, but I guess that is to be expected because during the day I assume everyone would be at the theme parks. I would recommend this resort to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: VinnyNYC
Reviews.Content: Went to Orlando on vacation from Aug. 18th to 29th. Stayed at Sheraton Vistana Villages for the first 5 days (go there for my review) and stayed at OLCC the next 7 on a RCI timeshare exchange. I was with my wife and 2 small children, 3 and 1. Requested the North Village and got it. My first thought on this resort was checking in. The front desk is in the West Village Clubhouse. This building is very outdated. Downstairs are 2 restaurants and a big all purpose room with table and chairs and a small play area for small children. This place had flies everywhere and very over crowed space. Also took a walk by the main pool area in the West Village. It looked like a city pool area, not like a resort area. At this point i was a little worried. But, when our room was finally ready at 4:15, we went to our 2 bed/2ba condo in the North Village, I was very impressed.
