Big spacious kitchen, big master bedroom with nice private bath. 2nd bedroom had 2 full sized bed and a bathroom off the room. We had a nice corner unit. Splash Lagoon (pool area in the North Village) is great for kids of all ages. Played golf 2 days At Legends in the East Village. Very nice course. Very good restaurant in the East Village called Legacy Grill. Had breakfast there 3 times and dinner once, very good prices. They are building a new pool area in the East Village for 2005. If your planning on staying here, request the North Village or the newer East Village. The East Village have 4 or 5 floors and the North is 1 or 2. This resort is sooo big. Our condo from the main gate was about 1.5 miles!!! You need a car in this resort. Disney is pretty close, but it takes a while during peak hours because of the traffic on 192. I would stay here again, ONLY if i could stay in the North or East Villages.

Reviews.Title: “loved the resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my family and i just got back from a 7 night stay at orange lake resort,from 8/8/04-8/15/08. prior to arrival i was a little worried as to what the condo was going to be like, from reading some of the reviews of the resort. our 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo in the west village, was very very nice, clean and well maintained. well stocked for kitchen supplies, garbage bags, coffee filters, etc. the resort is large, but easy to get around. staff was very nice. we even weathered thru hurricane charley in our condo. i would definitaely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orange Lake From July 18th-July 23,2004. We were able to stay in a condo and at the hotel and both were wonderful. The amenities are excellent, the rooms and condos are superb. My husband and I definitely plan on going back and will probably become an owner. I can't wait until we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Spiders and Roaches!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed it unit very close to Route 192 August 14-21. Road noise was load and annoying. The first 2 nights we saw large spiders. Orange Lake sent pest control out to spray. The note left from pest control stated that the spray would take effect in a few days, but the problem maybe worse until then. We saw more large spiders and one huge cockroach. Orange Lake does have many amenties, but can not deliver on a queit, clean place to stay. I do not plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I STAYED AUG 6TH WHAT A NIGHTMARE they extorted nearly $800 out of my account with out telling me For a bill saying I used the phone when in fact I did not .. I will take the to the highest court to get my money back ..they are frauds and watch out cause they left me pennyless with out my permission they took this money ... I reported them to FL attorney general and BBB .THEY ALSO HAVE INCOMPETENT EMPLOYEES AND DID THIS TO ME CAUSE I DID NOT BUY INTO THEIR TIMESHARE. orangelake you will pay me back and I will have you prosecuted for fraud ... mark my words EVERYONE !PLEASE GUARD YOUR WALLET PLEASE..BELIEVE ME I DID NOT INCUR THIS BILL AND I HAVE PROF

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at Orange Lake the week of July 4th. I had a wonderful stay. Everything I needed was right on sight. I'v told all my friends about all the fun we had at Orange Lake . I am looking forward to returning to Orange Lake again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “NicePlace”
Reviews.Author: mommysgetawaypa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort from July 16-23, 2004. The room was great (villa) 2 bedrooms, kitchen, living room and dining room. It was clean and comfortable. When we first arrived-tired and grouchy, our key card would not unlock our door. We called the main desk from our cell phone and they promised to have someone out immediately. It took about 5 minutes. The maintenance team took care of the problem right away. We stayed on Lake Kem Circle. The room was about 8/10 of a mile away from the clubhouse. They offer a shuttle that roams the resort, but we enjoyed the walk. The kids 6&7 loved the pools. The ammenities were a little less than I expected. An example of this is the movie theater. It was a small theater that showed movies that has already been released on VHS. Probably a while ago. The only real complaint I have is that I was literally tricked into the "time share selling spech". We received a call on our second day there asking us if we would like to attend a free lunch and hear about the 12 acre pool that they are building. When we got there, it was all sales. Overall, it was a great place and I would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to get away.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just want to let everyone who gets on Orange Lake's web site to check out the reviews, know that first of all, Orange Lake Country Club is my most favorite place to go in the whole world. I am 21 years old and my parents own timeshare at Orange Lake. They have owned since I was about 5 years old. We go to Orange Lake every other year and some place new on the opposing years. I have been to the Bahamas, Jamaica, and Hilton Head Island, just to name a few. You would think that the resorts there would be even more extravegant than ones in Florida, but Let me tell you how dissapointed I have been at several "top" vacation spots in the world. Every year when we come back to Orange Lake, I feel like I am at a home away from home. I know my way around, the condos are ALWAYS clean, stocked and if something is wrong (which there usually never is) management is there, as soon as you hang up the phone, to fix it. anyone who doubts staying at Orange Lake is only making a huge mistake. I get more excited to go back there every other year than I do to go anywhere else. Thanks Orange Lake, you make our family vacations the best! If anyone has any questions about owning at Orange Lake, please e-mail me and I will be happy to let you know of our great experiences!

Reviews.Title: “Read Me!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited Orange Lake with my fiance and his family for a week, they've owned two weeks there for almost twenty years. I recommended this resort to my two girlfriends so that we could all do a couples get-away one summer. After speaking with them a week later, I was aggravated and appalled when they told me they would not stay at the resort because of bad reviews they read on the internet. I did not believe it was possible that Orange Lake could have negative reviews. Then I came online and read for myself, a bunch of one-timers writing about all sorts of mishaps. I'm not about to say that what they are saying is untrue, I do not know that. What I do know is that I stayed at Orange Lake for one fabulous week and we had no problems at all. We stayed in a two bedroom unit with eleven people. Now I don't know about anyone else, but when I go on vacation and stay at a hotel or resort, I call in advance or do as much research as I can, so I can be prepared as to what I may need to bring. A simple phone call would would tell you if the resort has this, how many of that, etc... Orange Lake has several pools, during the day in mid-summer, of course the pools will be crowded, of course it will be loud. It is Florida and it is the summer. If you plan to go to Disney World, newsflash, that place is loud and crowded, if you're prepared for that, then you have to imagine that any resort in that area will be similar. A bunch of families there to have fun, and doing just that, having fun. You need not stay at a resort near Disney if you want a quiet vacation, or try to get a room on an upper floor. These are things you have to think about before you plan a vacation. Things happen, bad things, they can happen anywhere, maybe you have bad luck or maybe the person who was in the unit before you broke the stove burner and didn't tell anyone. I understand freedom of speech, but I think it is wrong to discredit a resort because you went there once and things went wrong. I went there once, everything went right and my fiance and I plan to buy weeks there when we get married. I am not one to do or not to do judging by what others say, I'm not telling you to go to Orange Lake, I'm not telling you not to go, but what is life if you do things based on other people's opinions? Go see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Tennis Villas were nice”
Reviews.Author: MauiLea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tennis Villas which were located near the clubhouse during the last two weeks of October, 2003. I wanted to submit a review after reading a few on this website. I hope my review is helpful. I exchanged through RCI to get into this resort. Orange Lake is a BIG resort with some very nice accomodations. We requested and stayed at the Tennis Villas. We has a large two bedroom, two bath unit that was very nice. Our unit was clean and spacious. We had a small, screened-in patio that overlooked the lake. The patio was okay; somehow a few insects found their way into the patio. The kitchen included everything we needed. It had a starter supply of coffee filters, one roll of paper towels and dishwasher detergent. There was enough pots, dishes, glasses, mugs and cutlery. The dining table really sat 6 people. There was a counter area that sat 2 more. Don't think that you can comfortably seat 8 at the dinner table. I think this is common with timeshares. (I stayed at another timeshare, Hilton Grand Vacations Club, in a 3 BR that slept 12 and the table sat 6 also). The master bath was HUGE. My daughter loved the jacuzzi bath and I liked the large shower. The second bathroom did not have a bathtub; only a shower. We had enough towels, including facetowels, for eight people. The washer / dryer worked well. The beds were comfortable; pillows were OK. The unit had a thermostat so we were able to adjust to our liking. We did not use the sofa bed so I cannot comment on that. We had a problem with a water leak from somewhere above us. Thankfully, we were still in our unit and put a large pot / towels under the leak. We called the front desk and left for our daily activities. When we returned, the maintenance people had fixed the problem and our carpet dried quickly. No musty odor. We had a midweek cleaning. With a timeshare resort, if you want fresh towels, you have to wash / dry them yourself. We did ALOT of wash during our stay because I like fresh, clean towels and clothers. They only provided a starter supply of laundry detergent so if you are like me, go buy your own. The parking lot fills up in the evening so we had to walk a little further sometimes. It depends on the time of year. Since we were off season, it wasn't bad. I would think there would be a problem in high season. I thought the "ONE" elevator was a bit slow sometimes. Thank goodness we were on the second floor so we just used the stairs when we could. I believe thay have 2 (maybe 3) luggage carts. On check-in day, they are hard to find. I expected the same on check-out day so I moved most of our items into the car the night before we checked out. Our location was great. It was near the central pool complex. They had plenty of pool towels and the pool was pretty busy during the day. They had a variety of pools to choose from. They also had a small playground area for kids. There really is an Orange Lake. You could rent a pedal boat or a jet ski. We rented a petal boat for an hour and had a nice time going around. There are some private homes around the lake. They had a small beach area which is great for the kids. The only thing was that they would not allow swimming in the water. I read that there was runoff that could be harmful and then I also heard from a resort staff person that there was a small alligator living in the lake. I never saw the alligator but did not venture more than ankle-deep in the water. Remember that in Florida, alligators can be found in lake areas. I couldn't criticize the resort for this, but maybe they should post some signs at the beach about NO SWIMMING. Since the resort is large, we had to drive to the North Village to use the pool complex there. It was very nice. This is the newer area and the pool has a water slide. There was also a fountain the kids could play in. The kids LOVED the water slide. The water was very clean and there were enough chaise loungers for everyone who wanted one. I can see availability of these chaise loungers being a problem in high season. We did not eat at the restaurant. We ordered pizza from the pizzeria and it was good. They deliver to your room. They have a small general store but we did not buy anything from there. You get a better selection and price by going outside. You need a car to get around this resort. Though the resort claims it is closest to Disney since one area is adjacent to Animal Kingdon, don't think this means you can get to Disney faster. There are two entrances / exits to the resort. Both go to Route 192 which is always crowded; sometimes more than others. We were there in late OCTOBER and it consistently took us 15-20 minutes to get to Disney. I took the time to attend one of the timeshare presentations to find out more about the resort. They have an internal exchange system and I understand that only Orange Lake owners can exchange into the North and East Village. They are planning on building a water park at this resort; I forgot when they said it would be completed. If you are interested in buying at this resort, do your research and don't buy from the sponsor, as you will always pay a higher price. Look at the resales or purchase from an owner who is looking to sell; you will get a better price. I think the Tennis Villas, North Village and East Village areas are worthy of the RCI Gold Crown Rating. There were other areas (single story units / sections) that were older and not as spacious. This is probably where most of the complaints about accomodations come from. I would have been very disappointed if I got a unit in one of those other areas. My advice is to research this resort before you come and ask for the area you want. Hopefully they can accomodate you. If you won an auction to get into this resort, be aware that you may get an older unit. The studio units are in the clubhouse and they are kind of like a hotel room. If you get a 1 bedroom unit, you cannot stay at the Tennis Villas, as they only have 2 and 3 BR units here. One thing I have learned in my years of exchanges is to stay away from ground floor units. If you are in a multi-story building, the ground floor offers less privacy, a bit more noise, and the probability of more crawling insects making their way in. Feel free to email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Not even a three star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a two bedroom golf condo. I don't think it had been updated in twenty years. If you had the washer and dryer on you could not hear the TV. Electricity went out once. The cable went out once. Burner on the stove was broken, can opener broken. Couch cushions very old and solf. No sheets or blankets available for the person sleeping on the sofa bed. Pools in a cluster and you had to drive to get to them. We had an auto accident on the grounds and even though the staff were very pleasant to us the really didn't seem to care. In speaking with others while we were at the pool everyone seemed to be disappointed. Huge charge to use boats etc on the lake. We were told that they contracted out for these services. Orange Lake should have supplied these for their guests. Pools and area were dirty. This is definately not even a three star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a girlfriend that used her timeshare. We felt that everytime we asked for service or help, we were an inconvience. My daughter got a virus from the pools that lasted 3 weeks. We tried talking to management about many situations from a not working washer, to cable being out, to paying for a buffet that was way overrated,and many more situations. Noone seemed to care or have concern. I have worked in the management restuarant industry for 13 yrs. and will never recommend this time share area. I really hope other people received better service than we did. We will not return. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake, an enigma.”
Reviews.Author: GulfCoastGuy
Reviews.Content: Orange Lake has good points: Friendly people on staff (mostly), decent tennis courts, nice pool areas although a bit crowded week of June 27-July 4, some pretty areas on the resort like the newer north end, Putt Putt with family week passes for 26.00 and a decent breakfast for relatively cheap at Legacy Grill. and it has some bad points: rundown areas (unfortunately where we were located), missing amenities like the screen porch and the jetted hot tub in master bath (this was a real disappointment), malfunctions that were not handled properly on site (washer flooded kitchen floor for four days and the replacement was obviously bought at a fire damage sale and stunk up our room for the final four days, phones were being worked on and called from inside the resort at all hours of the day AND night and ruined two nights sleep for my wife until I took them off the hook, golf pro calling and leaving four messages in ONE NIGHT, all the same message, broken door for first day which would not close), poor handling of problems, they will NOT move you if you have issues. Only two calls from the time share sales dept but too many golf carts running around the grounds slow everything down. Watersports too expensive to consider. I would rate this a B- overall and we will not be back despite the good prices we got for the unit. We were with our two teen children as well. I guess we are spoiled by Marriott World Center Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake is the best place to stay in Central FL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our family to Orange Lake in late April, 2004 and were amazed at how big this resort has gotten. We'd been there before, about 6 years ago was the last time we'd stayed there. There is so much to do there is no reason to leave the resort, unless of course you're visiting the theme parks. Orange Lake has so much to offer and the grounds are immaculate, amenities are abundant, and there are plenty of pools to relax at. I'd tell anyone going to Central FL to stay at Orange Lake because there is no place that has more to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I went to Orlando on May 29th and stayed for the week. Orange Lake is a beautiful resort, that I would definitely recommend. The staff is helpful and nice. The units are absolutely wonderful, we stayed in the 2 bedroom/2 bathroom unit and believe me it was truly home away from home. The location is excellent, you are right of from one of the main Hwys. and Universal Studios and DisneyWorld are about 20 minutes away. Believe me, when I come back to Orlando, I will know exactly where to stay, and that is at Orange Lake Country Club Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Orange Lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Orange Lake is a great resort. We stayed the week of May 24th and had a wonderful time. The 2BR unit was spacious and well-equipped. The various pools and activities were great and the plans for the new waterpark are making me plan to go back in a few years. We stayed in the new section and the unit was perfect. I've heard the older ones could use some refurbishment. Only had 2 issues with the resort. One was the lack of a standard size tub in the unit. Having to bathe 2 toddlers in a whirlpool tub was interesting. The other was the caliber of the food in the various restaurants on-site. It was just OK and had very limited and unimaginative selections.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful resort. Well maintained and staffed by very helpful and pleasant people. We had a 3 bedroom unit in the East Village and it was spectacular. Nicely decorated, very clean and well built...I hardly ever heard anyone else or anyone above me. The golf courses looked well manicured...hope to try them the next time I visit Orange Lake. The main pool is open until 11 PM, allowing us to come home from the theme parks later and still have time for a dip. Security was very visible and most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not Gold Crown”
Reviews.Author: LRice
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 yr. old son and I stayed at OLCC 5/7 - 5/14. I had read all of the previous reviews on this website as well as others, so I knew what to expect. Yes, it is a huge resort that is inconvenient if you like to walk rather than drive. And it does need a facelift, considering the original buildings were built in the 80's - I don't consider it Gold Crown status. However, we had a very pleasant experience and were fortunate enough to stay in the Tennis Villas overlooking the golf course and lake. We were allowed to check-in two hours early, and were actually given a choice of two different units. The first choice was an older unit at the back of the complex - it was ground-level and very spacious but dimly-lit with extremely small bathrooms and sagging mattresses. We chose a 5th floor unit in the Tennis Villas because of the view, the close proximity to the registration area and the updated furnishings. This unit seemed slightly smaller than the first, but was much nicer. This area was also extremely quiet - we had no problems with noise of any kind. We were not hounded by timeshare sales agents, either. The Splash Lagoon pool area is extremely nice - large, beautifully landscaped and lots of fun for the kids. There are some newer villas adjacent to the lagoon, which would be very nice to stay in. Considering I purchased a week at OLCC for $400 off of the Internet, and was given my choice of accommodations once I arrived, I was very satisfied with the results.

Reviews.Title: “Great Nooners”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, pluse 2 more couples stayed at the Orange lake resort for 1 week. We were Very happy with the service and everything worked out perfect. The Ice machine broke and leaked a little water and someone was there to fix it in 10 miniutes then another Employee came by to clean up the mess 5 min later, Service was excellent. Very nice water parks, the shuttle service was a little slow but not bad, only missed one Nooner with the wife due to shuttle service. Highly recomend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Lake was wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just got back from a wonderful holiday at Orange Lake. We had a three bedroom suite overlooking the golf course and we also could see the Disney fireworks display every night over the trees in the distance. The decor was beautiful and the suite was very clean when we arrived. Some wonderful amenities included the master bedroom whirlpool bath, the screened-in patio, and a TV in every room. I do not know what location others were in to complain so much, but this resort was gorgeous. I have travelled to numerous hotels and am quite picky about cleanliness, decor, and space and this resort was incredible in all areas. Take note, if you are travelling with a large group of people twelve would seem quite crowded but around 8 people would fit quite comfortably. If you have a choice request the areas of buildings 88600,88700,88800 - they really are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift......”
Reviews.Author: NickyPeach
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at OL. We went from 5/2-5/09. I stayed on an RCI exchange. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath villa. It was my family of four and another family of four. I called ahead to make sure they had a crib (pack and play) and a highchair. They did, it was in our room when we arrived. The villa we stayed in could really use a major facelift. The carpet was all dirty, the bathrooms were dingy, and the fake plants had dust all over them. I don't know how it achieved gold crown status. A vacation is really what you make it and we made the best out of it. All of us had a fantastic time, we really did, despite the room being the way it was. The pictures on the web site is not what we got when we arrived, so beware. The place is huge. There were many pools, the kids really liked the splash lagoon pool because of the slide. There is plenty to do there. The had a mini movie theater, which the kids enjoyed. It's so close to the theme parks. Our villa was too far from the pools so we drove ourselves, which worked out better for us instead of waiting for their transportation. If you are looking for a first class 5 star resort, don't look here. They do have amenities galore, but they just need a major overhaul and update the older units. Our washing machine broke and flooded out the kitchen , however, maintence came and fixed the problem right away. They were very good in that aspect. I prefer the new Vistana Villages and Oasis Lakes myself. I strongly doubt I would stay there again, but now I know. The front desk did tell me they are refurbishing each year.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get much better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like many people, we had a holiday in Florida and were tempted to get half price park tickets by attending a timeshare presentation at OL. As this was our "holiday of a lifetime" and thought we wouldn't be going back, as we drove there we knew that we would go through the high pressure talking, look around, say no thanks, get our tickets and leave. How wrong we were! What a great place. We bought 1 week there and then and, 2 years later, bought a second week. And, may I add, not once were we pressurised to do either. And we have not regretted it once. We will be going back to OL this year for the 7th time and know that we are going to have a great time there. We don't spend all our time "on site" because we are there so often now we tend to do a "day out" then a day "chilling out" at the resort. We have not had any complaints since we first went there. The staff have all been pleasant and helpful. The facilities are out of this world. The location couldn't be better. We now have a queue of people wanting to come with us, some for their second or third trip. Each time someone new has come with us they have said how wonderful it all is, from the villa (2 BR/ 2 Bath - sleeping up to 8) to the whole of the resort. I could go on for pages writing about how wonderful our stays are but I think by now you get the idea. Cannot be faulted. We love it and can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “lousy golf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: did not stay at the resort but played golf there the conditions were terrible.called to make tee time was not informed of condition of course. there was no greens to shot at they were all dirt,some of the course were closed because of there condition.plus they are only nine hole coures so i do not know were they can say 80 holes of golf.well if that is the way they take care of the golf i would hate to stay at the resort.just returned on 04/30/04 rci user for the last 12 years

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Be..!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the best time when me and family went to Orange lake resort florida!,the sun was nice and it couldn't have been better!,we stayed in one of thehotel rooms ich was looking close to a condo! it had 2 bathrooms and BIG kitchen 2 beds and big nice comfly pullout couch. There is acttually mini put compotitions at night, and a MOVIE THEATER in the hotel! it's great you couldn't ask for more, the big olympic size pool! and all of the games and fun they put together just to please the people staying there! I am happy to say that I am going in a couple of weeks and I am just dying to see the villa that were staying in! we'll I hope that I helped!

Reviews.Title: “aka Lemon Lake Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was given the opportunity to visit Orange Lakes Resort as a referral from a friend at work. When I purchased my time, I was promised a two bedroom condo and a morning presentation since I would only be staying for three days. I paid almost one year ahead of time. My 8 year old son and I traveled sixteen hours in a car to be greeted with a studio with two beds and when I questioned this I was told by reservations that I was lucky to have that. That was after fighting for a place to park and dodging the drunks on golf carts. I was then shuffled off to another desk to set up my "tour" which was moved to a 12:30 p.m. time versus the morning. Check in is at 4:00 p.m., we checked in at 4:00 p.m., the morning was already booked. How is that possible? Maybe it's the same people that take the seats at the pool? So that ate up the middle of one of our only three days of our vacation. The next morning we went to Splash Lagoon. Much to our surprise, we got there 10 minutes after the pool opened and every chair by the pool was "checked" with a towel. There were only four people in the pool, every chair covered with a towel. They must have all been on the morning tour that I was supposed to be on! I drug a chair from another area over to watch my son in the pool. Of course, he got pounced by the teenagers that were unsupervised and left after being choked and dunked. We were then off to our presentation with Mike. I told Mike all the problems that we were having. He offered me the great deal of $21,000 for 20 years at 15.9% interest and one week a year could be mine! He must think I left my common sense in Ohio. Why would I put all that money into one week at a hotel that cannot even give me the room I was promised or at least guarantee me a seat at the pool! Instead of paying all these people to walk around the pool and do nothing, why don't they pay some lifeguards! After I told Mike no, again, we left. The next day I checked my credit card to make sure I was not being over charged, of course I was. Orange Lake has decided to put a $120 hold on my account for incidentals without my knowledge. Nothing was said at check in. Nothing was said with reservations. Nothing. I then called the front desk to ask what this charge was for. I was transferred to reservations to which a woman snipped at me that this was customary and I should have asked. How do you know to ask that you are going to be charged for something you did not know about? By the way, incidentals are if you decide to use their restaurants and charge it to your room, that would be an incidental. I was incidentally paying for everything with cash and not spending my every waking moment at Orange Lake giving them more of my money. That didn't matter because they already had my money! I was also being charged to turn on the phone in my room. What the heck is that?! To add insult to injury the only time I used the phone was the time that I was on the phone to Orange Lake. Maybe next they will put a lock on the toilet and you will have to pay for the use. Taht would be an incidental. She then said that it would take days to release my money. Mind you, it took one day to hold my money, several days to release my money! This is not Orange Lake this is Lemon Lake. At least when you stay at a hotel, you know you will get hotel treatment. When you stay at a resort and get hotel treatment, that's the slap in the face. This is the most unethical place I have ever stayed. Never ever ever again. If I could think of more places to write and complain I would, and I will.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Club Vacations Orlando - Orange Lake Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 8505 W. Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy., Kissimmee, FL 34747
